headlines: China sends back 4 lakh kg of garbage to US
text: Customs officials in China's Zhejiang Province have refused entry to over 4 lakh kg of solid waste from the US and have sent the garbage back to the country. Officials found the shipment consisting of scrap paper mixed with waste metal parts and used drinking bottles. China had banned import of 24 types of solid waste to fight environmental pollution.

headlines: Saudi Aramco to buy 50% of $44-bn Maharashtra oil refinery
text: The world's largest producer of crude oil, Saudi Aramco, will buy 50% stake in the proposed $44-billion refinery project in Maharashtra. The remaining 50% stake will be held by Indian Oil, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum. Saudi Aramco will supply at least 50% of the 60 million tonnes of crude to be processed at the planned refinery, officials said.

headlines: Thought girls would hate me after Pyaar Ka Punchnama: Kartik
text: Kartik Aaryan, while speaking about his five-minute long monologue in 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama', said, "I was afraid this will make me have an [anti-hero] image among girls." "But I got lucky because I portrayed a character who became the voice of youngsters," he added. Kartik further said, "It feels great to have a huge fan following of guys and girls."

headlines: Katrina to write autobiography titled Barbie Dreams: Reports
text: According to reports, Katrina Kaif will be writing her autobiography which has been tentatively titled 'Barbie Dreams', as she is the only Indian actor to have a Barbie doll modelled on her. The autobiography will not reveal details of her personal life and will focus on her childhood. Katrina will also be talking about her Bollywood career in the autobiography.

headlines: Royals beat Daredevils on their return to Jaipur after 5 yrs
text: Rajasthan Royals, who were playing their first Indian Premier League match at Jaipur since May 2013, defeated Delhi Daredevils by 10 runs (DLS method) in a rain-curtailed encounter on Wednesday. The victory was Royals' ninth consecutive at Jaipur and seventh straight against Daredevils in the IPL. Royals will next face Royal Challengers Bangalore on Sunday.

headlines: Kohli named Wisden's leadingÂ cricketer for 2nd straight year
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli has been named Wisden's leading male cricketer for the second year in a row. With this, Kohli has become the third cricketer after Virender Sehwag and Kumar Sangakkara to be honoured with the award multiple times. Meanwhile, Mithali Raj, who recently became the most capped women's ODI player, was named Wisden's leading female cricketer.

headlines: Open racism is not against Reddit rules: CEO Steve Huffman
text: Online discussions platform Reddit's CEO Steve Huffman has revealed that open racism is not against the website's rules. "On Reddit, the way in which we think about speech is to separate behaviour from beliefs," Huffman clarified. It comes after a user questioned the site's policies on whether posts containing racism and racial slurs violate Reddit's terms.

headlines: Iâm proud member of FB: Senator during Zuckerberg's hearing
text: During Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's data scandal testimony, US Senator Thom Tillis said, "I'm a proud member of Facebook, just got a post from my sister on this being National Sibling Day." Senator Roy Blunt told Zuckerberg that his 13-year-old son is dedicated to Instagram, "so he'd want to be sure I mention him while I was here with you".

headlines: PM Modi giving competition to magician PC Sorcar: Owaisi
text: Mocking PM Narendra Modi's claim that over 8.5 lakh toilets were built in one week in Bihar, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said he was "giving stiff competition to legendary magician PC Sorcar". He further said that PM Modi would soon start appearing on magic shows on TV. Earlier, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav had called PM Modi's claim a "big goof-up".

headlines: SC refuses BJP's plea to intervene in WB panchayat polls
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday refused BJP's plea seeking intervention in the West Bengal panchayat polls. BJP claimed that the ruling TMC pressurised the state Election Commission to withdraw its order extending the deadline for filing nominations. Pointing out that the Calcutta High Court ordered a stay on the withdrawal order, the SC directed the BJP to approach the HC.

headlines: Bengaluru logistics startup Mojro raises â¹4.2 crore
text: Bengaluru-based logistics startup Mojro has raised over â¹4.2 crore in pre-Series A funding round led by Mumbai-based 1Crowd. The round also saw participation from Tamil Nadu-based Naga Limited. Founded in 2016, the startup is a smart logistics platform that allows businesses to automate logistics operations using artificial intelligence and also offers freight services.

headlines: 11L ineligible voters in MP to be removed from voters' list
text: Around 11 lakh ineligible voters in Madhya Pradesh will be removed from the voters' list, Chief Election Commissioner OP Rawat said. Rejecting charges that the list contained bogus voters, he added that names of those categorised as absent or dead and double entry cases were being removed. The EC is ensuring that more women are being added, he further said.

headlines: Russian woman dies after being embalmed alive
text: A 27-year-old woman died after she was embalmed while undergoing a surgery to remove ovarian cysts at a Russian hospital. Doctors accidentally gave the woman a dose of formaldehyde, which is used for embalming corpses, instead of saline after the surgery. A criminal case has been filed against medical personnel for causing death by negligence.

headlines: Cops fired after claiming mice ate 500 kg missing marijuana
text: Eight Argentinian police officers were fired after they claimed that over 500 kg of marijuana which was missing from a police warehouse had been eaten by mice. However, forensic experts said they doubted even a large number of rodents could have eaten so much marijuana. The cannabis had been in the warehouse for two years.

headlines: Potential bidders 'arm twisting' govt on Air India: Unions
text: A forum of 10 Air India unions has alleged that potential bidders are using "arm-twisting tactics" to force the government to sell the national carrier for cheap. Stating that "Air India is our national pride and it served the nation many a time in need," the forum said it will take up the issue with the Prime Minister's Office.

headlines: IPL matches to be shifted out of Chennai
text: IPL chairman Rajeev Shukla has confirmed that remaining matches scheduled in Chennai will be shifted due to the Cauvery protests in Tamil Nadu. Shukla said they had initially decided to host matches in Chennai after police assured that adequate security would be provided. The police has now informed CSK that they wouldn't be able to provide security, he added.

headlines: Zuckerberg reveals his personal info was leaked in data scandal
text: Appearing at a US Senate hearing, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg revealed on Wednesday that his personal information was among the data of 87 million Facebook users that was improperly shared with political consultancy Cambridge Analytica. Insisting that Facebook users can impose restrictions on data they share, Zuckerberg said the data may be the only thing of value that Facebook has.

headlines: 8-yr-old J&K girl drugged, raped to punish her community
text: An eight-year-old Muslim girl was drugged before being gangraped repeatedly and then killed by a group of men in J&K's Kathua to "punish" the Bakherwal community she belonged to, police chargesheet revealed. She was kidnapped when she went to graze her horses and was kept at a prayer hall. The accused paid bribes to police to cover up the case.

headlines: CSK's home matches shifted to Pune due to Cauvery protests
text: The BCCI has moved Chennai Super Kings' remaining IPL home matches from Chennai to Pune after police said they cannot provide adequate security amid the ongoing Cauvery protests in Tamil Nadu. Pune was picked ahead of Visakhapatnam, Trivandrum, and Rajkot due to logistical reasons. However, there will be no change in the schedule of CSK's matches.

headlines: Manoj Tiwary slams Aakash Chopra over Vinay Kumar's bowling
text: KXIP's batsman Manoj Tiwary slammed cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra after the latter shared statistics of KKR fast bowler Vinay Kumar, who has conceded 65 runs in 23 balls in the IPL 2018 so far. Tiwary urged Chopra not to highlight Vinay's "bad performances", saying, "Nobody wants to do badly." Chopra told Tiwary that he was just being honest with his job.

headlines: Organised crime group is working against us: CBSE chief
text: CBSE Chairperson Anita Karwal has claimed an organised crime group seemed to be working against the board. She also denied reports that several questions in Joint Entrance Examination (Main) 2018 were from a mock test conducted at a Hyderabad coaching institute. She revealed the CBSE had complained to Delhi Police about 32 websites and YouTube channels that were spreading rumours.

headlines: Student thrashed at Delhi college for being 'UP-Bihar wala'
text: A CCTV footage showing a group of 7-8 students beating up another student at Delhi's Kirori Mal College has surfaced online. The group attacked the student for money, and targeted him by saying "Tum UP-Bihar ke ho yahan tumhari nahi chalti", reports said. The student alleged that police did not take him seriously when he complained about the incident.

headlines: Fake news has become cancer, needs surgery: Swamy
text: Addressing a conference at US' Columbia Business School, BJP MP Subramanian Swamy said fake news has become "a kind of cancer" and needs "some kind of surgery". Talking about Information and Broadcasting Ministry's now withdrawn order on punishing journalists found reporting fake news, Swamy supported PM Narendra Modi's directives that the matter should be addressed by Press Council of India.

headlines: Tamil Nadu priest creates script for oral tribal language
text: A priest in Tamil Nadu, who received formal education till Class 8, has created a script for Kovmozhi, a language of the Kota tribe used only in the spoken form. Claiming that most tribal languages in the area do not have scripts, 73-year-old Poosari AR Kanagarajan said he aimed to preserve the language by recording it in books.

headlines: Man climbs train at rail roko protests, gets electrocuted
text: A 32-year-old PMK party worker in Tamil Nadu was electrocuted after coming in contact with a live wire when he climbed on top of a train during rail roko protests demanding the formation of Cauvery Management Board. He was rushed to a hospital in Puducherry and reportedly suffered 70% burns. The PMK blocked several trains as part of the protests.

headlines: World is becoming more chaotic: Russian President Putin
text: Amid the ongoing tension between Russia and the US over a suspected chemical attack in Syria, Russian President Vladimir Putin said the modern world is becoming "more chaotic". Adding that the current international situation is very troubling, Putin said, "We still hope that common sense will eventually prevail and the entire world system will become more stable."

headlines: Myanmar soldiers jailed for 10 years over Rohingya killings
text: The Myanmar military on Tuesday sentenced seven soldiers to 10 years in prison with hard labour for "contributing and participating in murder" of 10 Rohingya Muslim men last year. Myanmar has been accused of carrying out ethnic cleansing of Rohingyas in Rakhine state. The Myanmar forces' crackdown against Rohingya militants has caused the exodus of nearly 7 lakh Rohingya refugees.

headlines: Chinese doctors remove 3-foot-long cable from man's penis
text: Doctors in China recently used laser technology to remove a 3-foot-long phone charging cable stuck in a 60-year-old man's penis. The man had inserted the phone accessory to relieve itchiness in his urethra reportedly caused by prostate inflammation. However, the charging cable became tangled in his bladder and caused bleeding when he tried to pull it out himself.

headlines: Australian hospital pays donors over â¹8 lakh a year for poop
text: A hospital in Australia pays poop donors up to $13,000 (over â¹8.4 lakh) a year for delivering poop five times a week. Donors, who must be at a healthy weight, need to take a blood test to determine their eligibility. Poop transplants are used to help treat medical conditions like autism and chronic diarrhoea.

headlines: 5 banks account for 55% govt banks' wilful defaulters list
text: Five public sector banks (PSBs) account for nearly 55% of the total wilful defaulters of all the PSBs. India's largest lender SBI has the highest number of wilful defaulters at 1,664 and the amount involved is â¹28,257 crore during April-December 2017. PNB reported the second highest number of wilful defaulters at 1,084 and Union Bank of India had 832 defaulters.

headlines: CBI launches probe into â¹5,280-crore loan to Mehul Choksi
text: The CBI has initiated a probe into a â¹5,280-crore loan given to Mehul Choksi-owned Gitanjali Group by a consortium of 31 banks. ICICI Bank was the lead bank in the consortium and PNB had given the highest loan amount of â¹587 crore. The probe is reportedly a part of existing FIR filed against Choksi and Gitanjali Group.

headlines: Reports on Irrfan's deteriorating health false: Spokesperson
text: Dismissing reports suggesting that Irrfan Khan's health is deteriorating, his spokesperson said, "It is not right to spread rumours through mediums of social media without fact check or any official validation." He also urged people to continue their support and prayers.  Irrfan is currently being treated for Neuroendocrine Tumour in London.

headlines: I'll be known as Ananya's dad after SOTY 2 releases: Chunky
text: Chunky Panday, while talking about his daughter Ananya Panday's upcoming debut film 'Student Of The Year 2', said, "Right now she's known as my daughter but I'm sure by the end of this year I'll be known as her father." "I had tears in my eyes when I saw [her] posters. I'm a little too overwhelmed right now," he added.

headlines: Airbus to add beds in passenger planes' cargo holds
text: Aeronautics company Airbus has collaborated with cabin equipment manufacturer Zodiac Aerospace to design and construct lie-flat beds that would fit in the cargo holds of its passenger airplanes. Passengers will be able to go down into the lower-deck cargo area for a proper nap. The beds will be initially offered on Airbus A330 aircraft by 2020, the companies said.

headlines: Rahul slammed over 'Shirdi miracle' jibe at Piyush Goyal
text: Shri Saibaba Sansthan Trust Shirdi chief Suresh Haware has slammed Congress President Rahul Gandhi for writing "Shirdi's miracle" in his tweet accusing Railway Minister Piyush Goyal of corruption. Haware said involving Shirdi in a political accusation was "very hurtful". The Congress has alleged a firm owned by Goyal's wife saw a â¹30-crore profit on â¹1-lakh investment in ten years.

headlines: Bombay HC allows 3 students with low attendance to give exam
text: The Bombay High Court has allowed three ailing B.Com students to appear for exams despite low attendance on "exceptional" medical grounds. The students had filed petition after the Narsee Monjee College barred them from exams for not maintaining required attendance of 75%. The students reportedly couldn't attend classes regularly as one has cancer and the others had met with accidents.

headlines: HC stays fake news case against 'Postcard News' founder
text: The Karnataka High Court has stayed proceedings against Mahesh Vikram Hegde, the founder of website 'Postcard News', for allegedly spreading fake news to disturb communal harmony. Hegde was arrested last month over a post falsely claiming that a Jain monk had been attacked by Muslim youth. The Jain monk had been hit by a bike while walking on the road.

headlines: Boy playing video game dies as mobile explodes while charging
text: A 12-year-old boy in Chhattisgarh died on Tuesday after a mobile phone he was playing video games on, exploded while charging. The boy's family had to tie a cloth around the boy after his intestines started falling out. Initially taken to a community centre, he was later shifted to a district hospital where he succumbed to injuries.

headlines: Why doesn't PM Modi fast for farmers, Dalits, asks Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday questioned why PM Narendra Modi doesn't sit on fast for "farmers who lost their lives" and for "atrocities on Dalits". Owaisi was reacting to PM Modi's decision to sit on a day-long fast against Parliament disruptions. âWhy doesnât the prime minister sit on a fast to atone for his false promises?" Owaisi added.

headlines: Sai Baba devotees in Mumbai to run 280-km relay marathon
text: To commemorate Sai Baba's 100th death anniversary, 10 athletes from Mumbai left from Jogeshwari for Shirdi on Tuesday evening with a mashaal (torch). They will be covering nearly 280 km as part of the relay marathon. "While returning, we will collect and bring back offerings from Shirdi Sai Baba temple for the devotees," coordinator of the marathon said.

headlines: YSR Cong holds rail roko protest over Andhra special status
text: The YSR Congress Party on Wednesday staged a 'rail roko' protest across Andhra Pradesh over its demand of special status for the state. While the Karnataka Express was forcefully stopped by the protestors, several train tracks were also blocked leading to traffic disruptions in some parts. Earlier, Five YSR MPs resigned from the Lok Sabha over the special status demand.

headlines: Army jawan booked for rape, attempt to murder in Pune
text: An Army jawan has been booked by the police for rape and attempting to murder a woman in Pune's Ahmednagar district. In her complaint, the woman alleged that the accused raped her on the pretext of marriage but later refused to marry her following an argument. Two of his friends have also been booked for trying to poison her.

headlines: Actress claims Rana Daggubati's brother forced her to have sex
text: After claiming that a top Telugu movie producer's son forced her to have sex in a studio, actress Sri Reddy revealed the man's identity as Rana Daggubati's brother and producer Suresh Babu's younger son Abhiram. Referring to photos on social media as "proof", the actress called on rights groups to take out rallies against Abhiram.

headlines: Death toll in Algerian military plane crash crosses 250
text: The death toll from a military plane crash in a field outside Algeria's capital Algiers has risen to 257, according to state media reports. An Ilyushin Il-76 strategic airlifter crashed shortly after taking off from from Boufarik Airport, the base for the Air Transport fleet of the Algerian Air Force. The cause of the crash is not yet clear.

headlines: BCCI picks 4 standby cities for CSK's home IPL matches
text: The BCCI has shortlisted Visakhapatnam, Trivandrum, Pune and Rajkot to host the remaining home matches of CSK amid protests in TN over the Cauvery dispute. Various political groups had called for a boycott of the IPL in Chennai, alleging it would divert attention from the protests. Protestors hurled shoes at boundary during CSK's first IPL 2018 home match on Tuesday.

headlines: Aus pacer Mitchell Starc's brother Brandon wins gold at CWG
text: Australian pacer Mitchell Starc's younger brother Brandon Starc has won the gold medal in the men's high jump event at the Commonwealth Games 2018 in Gold Coast on Wednesday. The 24-year-old high jumper cleared 2.32m in a personal best effort to win the event. Brandon had also won a silver medal at the 2010 Summer Youth Olympics in Singapore.

headlines: AAP removes Kumar Vishwas as party's Rajasthan in-charge
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Wednesday removed rebel party leader Kumar Vishwas from the partyâs Rajasthan in-charge post. The National Treasurer of AAP, Deepak Bajpai, will be replacing Vishwas. Vishwas had recently expressed displeasure after party chief Arvind Kejriwal had snubbed him while deciding three names for the Rajya Sabha from the Delhi quota.

headlines: Goan men get 517 years jail in Dubai for $200 million scam
text: A Dubai court has sentenced two Goans, 37-year-old Sydney Lemos and 25-year-old Ryan de Souza, to 517 years in jail each for cheating thousands in a $200 million Ponzi scheme. Lemos lured investors by promising them 120% returns on a $25,000 minimum investment through his company Exential. Notably, Lemos sponsored Indian Super League franchise FC Goa in 2015.

headlines: Get ready for missile strikes in Syria: Trump warns Russia
text: US President Donald Trump has told Russia to "get ready" for US missile strikes in Syria over the chemical attack that killed at least 70 people. Trump further said Russia shouldn't be partners with a "gas killing animal". This comes after Russia said that US missiles fired at Syria would be shot down and their launch sites will be targeted.

headlines: Five states account for 61% of e-way bill generation: GSTN
text: Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh and Kerala together account for 61% of the inter-state e-way bill generation, GST Network has said. The e-way bill has become mandatory for movement of goods valued over â¹50,000 from one state to another beginning April 1. Incidentally, these five states will start implementing e-way bills for intra-state movement of goods from April 15.

headlines: Aadhaar linking will help prevent PAN fraud: UIDAI to SC
text: Aadhaar-issuing authority UIDAI has told the Supreme Court that Aadhaar-linking would help prevent duplication of PAN cards. It said that shell companies were created abroad using fake PAN card, and by making Aadhaar the "sole criterion" for allotment, one PAN per person can be ensured. "11.35 lakh cases of duplicate PAN/fraudulent PAN have been detected," UIDAI added.

headlines: Sudden stardom made Kapil lose control of himself: Sugandha
text: Comedian Sugandha Mishra who featured on 'The Kapil Sharma Show', while speaking on the ongoing row involving Kapil, said, "Probably the sudden stardom and success that he has got, made him lose control of himself." "This isn't the Kapil I knew. He easily gets carried away and influenced...It's important for him to have the right people around him," she added.

headlines: FIR against 'Kyunki...' actor Akashdeep for beating up man
text: An FIR has been filed against 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' actor and former Bigg Boss contestant Akashdeep Saigal for beating up a rickshaw driver. The driver had confronted Akashdeep for driving on the wrong side of the road. He suffered some injuries and was taken to a nearby hospital. However, his health is stable now.

headlines: Working on the script for a 'lady Singham': Rohit Shetty
text: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty has said he is working on a script for a 'lady Singham' film. "It will take a lot of time, we are planning and working on creating an environment where there is a women character, who is also a cop," he added. Rohit further said, "The germ or thought is there to create this whole cop universe."

headlines: Nawazuddin not part of Rajinikanth's upcoming film: Manager
text: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui's manager denied reports that the actor has been approached to play the antagonist in an upcoming Telugu film starring Rajinikanth in the lead role. "If it was true it would be great, but no, there is nothing like this happening," the manager added. The yet-untitled project will reportedly be directed by Karthik Subbaraj.

headlines: Vinay defends himself after conceding 19 in last over vs CSK
text: After being trolled by fans on social media for conceding 19 runs in the last over against CSK on Tuesday, KKR pacer Vinay Kumar took to Twitter to defend himself. Kumar reminded fans he had once defended 9 and 10 runs against RCB and MI respectively. Vinay has given 65 runs in 23 balls in IPL 2018 so far.

headlines: All 8 Indian male boxers will win at least a bronze at CWG
text: All eight Indian male boxers participating at the CWG 2018 will win at least a bronze each as they have advanced to the semi-finals of their respective categories. The semi-finals of Amit (46-49kg), Gaurav Solanki (52kg), Manish Kaushik (60kg), Naman Tanwar (91kg), Hussamuddin Mohammed (56kg), Manoj Kumar (69kg), Vikas Krishan (75kg) and Satish Kumar (+91kg) will take place on Friday.

headlines: Virat Kohli gifts bat to part-time bowler who dismissed him
text: Team India and RCB captain Virat Kohli gifted a bat to KKR's part-time bowler Nitish Rana, who clean bowled him with a yorker in the IPL on Sunday. Nitish shared a photo of himself with the bat and captioned it, "When you are appreciated by one of the greats of the game, you know you are doing something right."

headlines: 8 Cameroon athletes go missing from CWG village in Australia
text: As many as eight Cameroonian athletes taking part at the CWG 2018 in Gold Coast have been reported missing from the Games village. It is suspected that they fled with the intention not to return to their native country, which faces widespread poverty. Notably, around 40 athletes from various nations sought asylum in Australia after the 2006 CWG in Melbourne.

headlines: Breaking up FB strengthens Chinese firms: Zuckerberg's notes
text: According to the notes Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg prepared for the testimony, he was ready to deny the proposal of breaking up Facebook by saying, "U.S. tech companies key asset for America; break up strengthens Chinese companies". Senator Ron Wyden earlier warned there "had been a number of proposals and ideas" for breaking up Facebook unless Zuckerberg "finds a way".

headlines: Apple ordered to pay $502 million in FaceTime patent dispute
text: Apple has been ordered by a US federal court to pay $502.6 million to security technology company VirnetX for infringing patents for secure communications. First filed in 2010, VirnetX claimed that Apple's FaceTime, VPN on Demand, and iMessage features infringe four of its patents. Earlier, Apple was ordered to pay $440 million to VirnetX for these patented technologies.

headlines: Historic Saudi city to be opened to tourists for first time
text: Saudi Arabia's Al-Ula, a historical region rich in archaeological remnants, will open to tourists as the kingdom prepares to issue tourist visas for the first time. The area, roughly the size of Belgium, is filled with archaeological treasures created by ancient civilizations. Saudi Arabia has signed a deal with France to develop the Al-Ula region into a cultural tourism destination.

headlines: BJP takes in people with criminal backgrounds: Shiv Sena
text: In its editorial mouthpiece 'Saamana', Shiv Sena has alleged that the BJP has been inducting politicians with criminal backgrounds into the party since the 2014 general elections for political gains. People of Maharashtra know who is mentoring goons, Shiv Sena added. This comes after BJP MLA Shivaji Kardile was arrested for allegedly murdering two Sena leaders.

headlines: NDA behind LS logjam to avoid no-trust motion: Andhra CM
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Tuesday said, "Was it not the NDA government which was behind the AIADMK MPs, who stalled the proceeding of Lok Sabha, to avoid facing the no-confidence motion proposed by the Opposition?" He further termed PM Narendra Modi's decision to sit on a day-long fast as "an attempt to run away from the crucial issues."

headlines: Debt-ridden farmer commits suicide, blames PM Modi-led govt
text: A debt-ridden farmer in Maharashtraâs Yavatmal committed suicide on Tuesday and blamed the PM Narendra Modi-led government in a six-page suicide note, reports said. Police officials said they were yet to verify the authenticity of the note and the cause of death. The farmer allegedly consumed pesticide after he failed to hang himself from a tree.

headlines: 90% parents rely on schools for info on sexual abuse: Survey
text: A survey conducted by Mumbai's College of Home Science Nirmala Niketan revealed, â90% parents know about child sexual abuse only because of workshops conducted by schools." While 58% mothers and 46% fathers were aware of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act, only 12% mothers and 28% fathers knew the full form of the Act, the survey added.

headlines: Man gets life term for setting wife on fire in Mumbai
text: A Mumbai court on Monday sentenced a man to life imprisonment for killing his wife by setting her on fire in 2014. The conviction was based on the wife's dying declaration, wherein she stated that her husband committed the crime after an argument. The couple's daughter also said that her parents used to fight frequently over her father's extra-marital affair.

headlines: Air India leaves behind former Aviation Minister's baggage
text: Air India on Tuesday left behind the luggage of former Aviation Minister Ashok Gajapathi Raju at Delhi airport. An airport spokesperson said the baggage was checked in around 12 minutes before scheduled departure of the flight for Visakhapatnam. However, an Air India official said the baggage couldn't reach the plane on time because of the slow movement of baggage belt.

headlines: Man kills neighbour's dog, invites him to share meat
text: A South Korean man killed a neighbour's dog before cooking it and inviting its owner to join him for a dog-meat dinner, police officials said. The 62-year-old confessed to the crime after the pet owner was informed by another neighbour. The accused said he was irritated by the dog's constant barking.

headlines: Over 100 people killed as military plane crashes in Algeria
text: Over one hundred people were killed after an Algerian military transport plane crashed shortly after takeoff on Wednesday, according to Algerian state media. The crash occurred in Boufarik, approximately 30 km from the capital Algiers. Boufarik Airport is the home base for the Air Transport fleet of the Algerian Air Force.

headlines: BJP richest party with â¹1,034cr income in demonetisation yr
text: The BJP is the richest national party with an income of â¹1,034 crore in FY 2016-17 when demonetisation was implemented, an Association for Democratic Reforms report said. It accounted for 66% of the total income of the seven national parties, the report revealed. Congress reported the second highest income at â¹225 crore while CPI reported the lowest at â¹2.08 crore.

headlines: Won't be deterred: Actress who went topless on film body's ban
text: Actress Sri Reddy, who went topless to protest against casting couch in the Telugu film industry, has said she'll not be deterred by the Movie Artistes Association's decision to deny her membership. "Let them bring their lawyers, I'll bring mine," she added. Sri Reddy further said, "As a woman, I have the right to protest and to speak my mind."

headlines: Zuckerberg says FB doesn't use audio obtained from phones
text: During his data scandal testimony, Mark Zuckerberg said Facebook doesn't use audio obtained by tapping users' smartphones to enrich personal information about them. The question was in reference to earlier reports claiming that offline conversations lead to related ads popping up on Facebook. However, Zuckerberg noted that Facebook does allow users to record videos, which have an audio component.

headlines: Facebook gained $21 billion during Zuckerberg's testimony
text: Facebook added nearly $21 billion in market value to $477.2 billion on Tuesday during CEO Mark Zuckerberg's testimony before US Congress. The company's shares posted their biggest daily jump in nearly two years on Tuesday, gaining 4.5%. Zuckerberg was called to testify after it was reported that personal information of 87 million Facebook users was harvested by Cambridge Analytica.

headlines: Will kill ourselves if heâs found guilty of rape: MLAâs wife
text: Rape-accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar's wife on Wednesday said, "My husband is innocent. If he is proven guilty, our entire family will give up their lives." Adding that her husband is being labelled as a rapist without any evidence, she said, "There's political motive behind this. Make my husband and girl (rape victim) undergo narco test."

headlines: WB EC extends nomination deadline, cancels it next day
text: The West Bengal Election Commission on Monday extended the deadline for filing nominations for panchayat polls and withdrew it on Tuesday morning. It said the order was withdrawn after the ruling TMC pointed out legal issues in it. The Opposition claimed the commission is under pressure from TMC which they alleged had tried to prevent their candidates from filing nominations.

headlines: Congress tweets #BhajpaSeBetiBachao amid BJP MLA rape case
text: Hitting out at BJP after an 18-year-old girl accused Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar of rape, Congress on Wednesday tweeted, "#BhajpaSeBetiBachao" (save daughters from BJP). The tweet is an apparent dig at the NDA government's 'Beti Bachao, Betao Padhao' campaign, which is aimed at protection and empowerment of the girl child.

headlines: Amazon offers $2bn to break up Flipkart-Walmart deal: Report
text: Days after reports of Walmart completing due diligence on Flipkart, global rival Amazon has offered around $2 billion as breakup fee for Flipkart's deal with Walmart, according to reports. This could potentially value Flipkart at $18-20 billion. A breakup fee is a penalty set in merger or acquisitions agreements, to be offered by the payer if the deal gets terminated.

headlines: EPFO asks banks not to deny pension over lack of Aadhaar
text: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has asked banks not to deny monthly pension to people over lack of Aadhaar or if their fingerprint or iris scanning is not successful. EPFO said a life certificate could be accepted as an alternative. "Banks should also make special arrangement for...differently-abled, or senior citizens who are unable to visit Aadhaar-enrolment centres," it added.

headlines: Trump, Obama not on list of guests for UK royal wedding
text: US President Donald Trump, his predecessor Barack Obama and British PM Theresa May have not been invited to the royal wedding of UK's Prince Harry and American actress Meghan Markle. âIt has been decided that an official list of political leaders is not required for the wedding," Kensington Palace has announced. A 12-year-old Manchester attack survivor is among those invited.

headlines: Rivers worldwide threatened by pharma waste: Scientists
text: River systems worldwide are flooded with pharmaceutical drugs at levels dangerous for wildlife, researchers said. Hormonal drugs have induced sex changes in fish whereas common anti-inflammation drug diclofenac was driving a vulture species on the Indian subcontinent to extinction. This comes after a UN report in December warned about antibiotics driving the evolution of drug-resistant bacteria.

headlines: Police in NY village announce the arrest of winter
text: The Depew Police Department in New York has jokingly announced on Facebook that they have arrested the winter season for loitering after the state experienced prolonged snowy weather. Police also called for a groundhog to turn itself in after it predicted six more weeks of winter. New York has been experiencing winter with strong winds that caused power outages.

headlines: Manipal Hospitals raises bid for Fortis hospital business
text: Manipal Hospitals has raised its offer to buy rival Fortis Healthcare's hospital business after shareholders expressed dissatisfaction. The revised offer pegs Fortis hospitals' equity valuation about 21% higher at â¹6,061 crore. Manipal said as per the new offer, existing Fortis shareholders will roughly own half of the new company, which would be India's largest hospital chain by revenue.

headlines: I-T Dept attaches first property of Choksi under Benami law
text: The Income Tax department has attached a 4000-square-foot luxury flat of Mehul Choksi worth â¹25 crore under the Benami law for the first time. Located in Mumbai, the flat was purchased by Mehul Choksi in 2009 using the shell company 'Rohan Private Limited', an official said. "Choksi had laundered his own black money to purchase this flat," the official added.

headlines: All 5 Indian shuttlers advance to singles last 16 at CWG
text: All five Indian shuttlers competing in the men's and women's singles events at the Commonwealth Games have advanced to the round of 16. Saina Nehwal defeated South Africa's Elsie De Villiers 21-3, 21-1 while PV Sindhu won 21-6, 21-3 against Fiji's Andra Whiteside. HS Prannoy and Kidambi Srikanth also registered straight-set victories in their respective men's singles matches.

headlines: IPL games to be shifted out of Chennai over protests: Report
text: All IPL matches scheduled to be held in Chennai will be shifted to another venue due to the ongoing protests in Tamil Nadu over the Cauvery dispute, according to reports. The CSK-KKR match on Tuesday was played with over 4,000 policemen deployed around the Chepauk Stadium. Four protestors were also detained during the match for hurling shoes at the boundary.

headlines: India to host Asia Cup in the UAE over Indo-Pak relations
text: India will host the Asia Cup 2018 in the United Arab Emirates after a unanimous decision was taken by the Asian Cricket Council to move the tournament from India on Tuesday. Political relations between India and Pakistan has been cited as the reason behind the change. The BCCI further confirmed that the tournament would revert to the one-day format.

headlines: Hasin Jahan demands â¹10 lakh/month as maintenance from Shami
text: Mohammad Shami's wife Hasin Jahan filed a case against the pacer at Alipore court on Tuesday, seeking â¹10 lakh per month as maintenance from him. "I'm at loss from all ends. I'd been to Delhi to meet him...I can never forget the way he behaved," said Jahan. Her lawyer has claimed sheÂ doesn't have money to pay for monthly expenses.

headlines: Zuckerberg apologises for remark on hate speech in Myanmar
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has apologised for his remark that the company successfully detected messages inciting Muslims in Myanmar to fight Buddhists. In reply, Myanmar civil society groups said that they informed Facebook after identifying the messages. "The messages... were clear examples of your tools being used to incite real harm," the groups said in a letter to Zuckerberg.

headlines: US senators livestreamed Zuckerberg's testimony on Facebook
text: US Senators Richard Blumenthal and Kamala Harris livestreamed Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's testimony over data scandal on their Facebook Pages. During the testimony, Zuckerberg was questioned on Facebook's data sharing policies. It was earlier revealed that 87 million Facebook users' data was shared with Cambridge Analytica, which allegedly exploited it to influence the US elections.

headlines: Zuckerberg apologised in 2007, 2011, 2018 for FB's mistakes
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg apologised again and again for the company's mistakes over the years. In 2007, Zuckerberg said, "We've made a lot of mistakes" after releasing a new feature while in 2011, he said, "We've made a bunch of mistakes" regarding privacy violations. In 2018, he said, "It's my mistake....Give me another chance" referring to the recent data scandal.

headlines: PM's '8.5L toilets in a week' claim a big goof-up: Tejashwi
text: After PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday claimed that 8.5 lakh toilets were constructed in Bihar in the past week, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav called it a "big goof-up". Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam also tweeted, "I don't think its humanly possible to construct toilets at such high speed. But it's very much possible for PM Modi to make such false claims".

headlines: Suspected rape victim's burning body found in J'khand forest
text: The burning body of a woman was found by locals in the Pakur forest in Jharkhand on Tuesday, reports said. Police doused the woman's body after reaching the spot, and suspect she was gangraped and murdered by being set on fire to cover the crime. The upper portion of the victim's body was completely burnt.

headlines: Haryana student form asks if parents have âuncleanâ job
text: The Haryana government has issued a form to school students across the state asking for their Aadhaar, caste, and whether their parents have an "unclean" occupation. Parents received the form through email, which also stated that information was being sought for the state government and not school records. Reacting to the news, Congress said, "Surveillance is the DNA of BJP."

headlines: Protests erupt after 8yr old raped, burnt alive in Pakistan
text: Protests erupted in Pakistanâs Punjab province after an eight-year-old girl was raped and then burnt alive. Local residents held a demonstration blocking the main GT Road for several hours to protest the alleged murder of the victim who later succumbed to her injuries in a hospital. The police claim to have arrested the suspect.

headlines: Air India employees protest against airline's privatisation
text: A group of Air India employees on Tuesday held a lunch-hour meeting at the airline's office in Mumbai to protest against the carrier's privatisation. "The privatisation is in no way going to safeguard the employees interest...we are totally opposed to it," a member said. Notably, the government is seeking to sell 76% stake in the airline.

headlines: US missiles fired at Syria will be shot down: Russia
text: Russia's Ambassador to Lebanon said any US missiles fired at Syria would be shot down and their launch sites will be targeted. US President Donald Trump had vowed to respond to an alleged chemical attack by Syria's government, a Russian ally, within 48 hours. The US had fired 59 missiles at a Syrian airbase after a similar attack last year.

headlines: Explosion forced Apollo 13 to circle Moon, abort landing
text: The third Moon landing mission was aborted after an oxygen tank exploded onboard, two days after launch on April 11, 1970. The crew called NASA's ground control saying "Houston, we've had a problem..." and used their Moon landing module as a "lifeboat". Apollo 13 was classified as a "successful failure" as the three astronauts safely returned after orbiting the Moon.

headlines: We do not sell data to advertisers: FB CEO Mark Zuckerberg
text: During his testimony over data scandal at Facebook, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "There's a very common misconception that we sell data to advertisers. We do not sell data to advertisers." "What we allow is for advertisers to tell us who they want to reach," he added. He highlighted advertisers will never take priority as long as he is running Facebook.

headlines: Snowden takes dig at Zuckerberg after data scandal testimony
text: Whistleblower Edward Snowden tweeted, "And they call me a criminal" while responding to a tweet claiming Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg failed to clarify whether the company tracks browsing activity after users log off, during his testimony. In 2013, Snowden had revealed the US government runs several global surveillance programs and spies on foreign embassies using electronic surveillance.

headlines: Fake Cong K'taka poll candidate list under circulation: CM
text: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Tuesday clarified that the list of Congress candidates under circulation for the upcoming state Assembly polls is fake. Adding that the AICC has not approved the list of candidates yet, the Chief Minister said, "Please donât patronize products of the #FakeNews factory." Meanwhile, the BJP has released its first list of candidates for the polls.

headlines: 420 YSRC members shave head protesting against PM, Andhra CM
text: As many as 420 YSR Congress members have shaved their heads in Andhra Pradesh's Hindupur, protesting against PM Narendra Modi and CM Chandrababu Naidu over their failure to secure special status for the state. Meanwhile, party MPs began an indefinite hunger strike in Delhi on Saturday. Earlier, five YSR Congress MPs resigned over special status to Andhra Pradesh.

headlines: Activist offers VR experience of euthanasia device, slammed
text: Australian activist Philip Nitschke, who created the world's first 3D-printed euthanasia machine, has invited public for a virtual reality experience of his device at the Amsterdam Funeral Fair. Nitschke is being criticised for 'glamorising suicide' using the 'gruesome' machine. He claims it causes painless death by filling nitrogen in the capsule, creating a scarcity of oxygen.

headlines: India to be key driver in energy sector in 25 years: PM Modi
text: Addressing International Energy Forum Ministerial Meeting on Wednesday, PM Narendra Modi said, "India will be a key driver in the energy sector in next 25 years." Asserting that the government is boosting local manufacturing through 'Make in India', PM Modi added, "My vision for India's energy future has four pillars- Energy access, energy efficiency, energy sustainability and energy security."

headlines: SC dismisses PIL seeking framing of rules for case allotment
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday dismissed a PIL seeking framing of rules for setting up of benches and allocation of cases in the apex court and High Courts. The CJI has been trusted by Constitution to be at the helm of affairs, the court said. This comes after four Supreme Court judges had alleged the CJI was allocating cases arbitrarily.

headlines: 19th century reformer Jyotiba Phule coined the term 'Dalit'
text: Jyotiba Phule, the 19th century reformer whose birth anniversary is on April 11, is credited with coining the term 'Dalit'. Phule wrote several books on the atrocities faced by the downtrodden classes and was committed to improving the condition of women in society. In 1848 in Pune, he and his wife Savitribai Phule opened the first-ever school for girls.

headlines: Trump can fire man probing his Russia ties: White House
text: The White House on Tuesday insisted that US President Donald Trump has the power to fire Special Counsel Robert Mueller probing Russian meddling in 2016 presidential election. This comes after the FBI raided Trump's personal lawyer Michael Cohen's offices and seized documents on various issues. "The President thinks this has gone too far," White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders said.

headlines: Kochhars had links with Videocon group since at least 2001
text: ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar and six family members held 2% in Credential Finance in 2001, along with Videocon group that held 17.74%, regulatory filings show. Kochhar, who took over as ICICI's CEO in 2009, had sold or transferred her shares before 2010. Notably, a recent report alleged conflict of interest in a â¹3,250-crore loan that ICICI gave to Videocon.

headlines: Air India asked to release salary of pilot grounded in 2016
text: The Delhi HC has directed Air India to release a pilot's salary, who was grounded in 2016 after being allegedly tested positive for alcohol consumption before and after flights on two occasions. "He has to have something to sustain," the court said. The pilot hasn't been terminated from services yet and was an employee of the airline, his counsel said.

headlines: Didn't know who Varun Dhawan was before 'October': Shoojit
text: Filmmaker Shoojit Sircar has said he had no clue who Varun Dhawan was before they started working on the film 'October'. "I knew that he was jumping around the place, singing, dancing, full of energy," he added. Shoojit further said, "Our planets don't match at all. He is from Mars and I am from Earth."

headlines: Will give an arm, leg to work with Meghna, Zoya, Gauri: Alia
text: Alia Bhatt has said she would give an arm and a leg to work with directors Meghna Gulzar, Zoya Akhtar and Gauri Shinde again. "These are filmmakers I really wanted to work with," she added. While Alia worked with Gauri in 'Dear Zindagi', she will be seen in 'Raazi' and 'Gully Boy', directed by Meghna and Zoya respectively.

headlines: App lets users set reminders to connect with their friends
text: US-based delivery startup Doorman's Founder Zander Adell has created an app called Garden which offers users a personal way to stay in touch with friends. It allows users to set reminder frequencies for wanting to meet different people on the app. Users can also keep track of how often they catch up with friends and leave notes in the app.

headlines: Dubai may begin trials for digital license plates next month
text: Dubai is planning to begin trials for digital license plates in vehicles which will include GPS and transmitters, according to reports. Dubai's transport authority said these devices can alert authorities during an accident or change displays if the car is stolen. It will also allow automatic deduction of fines, parking fees or renewing registration plates from users' accounts.

headlines: Will use bullets to remove BJP in Chhattisgarh: Cong MLA
text: Congress MLA Ram Dayal Uike at a Chhattisgarh's village said sticks and bullets will be used to throw BJP out of power in the state if required. Defending Uike, Chhattisgarh Congress chief PL Punia said Uike had meant that the party will put all its strength to dislodge BJP government and had used the words (sticks and bullets) "only idiomatically".

headlines: Bihar govt conspiring to get me, my family killed: Rabri
text: After Bihar government withdrew 32 Military Police jawans deployed at former Bihar CM Rabri Devi's residence, she alleged that the government is conspiring to get her and her family killed. "The security was revoked at 9 in the night. See what the govt is doing," Rabri added. Slamming the move, her son Tejashwi Yadav gave up his security as well.

headlines: Headphone-like device that can clean ear wax in 35 secs made
text: US-based startup SafKan has developed a headphone-like wearable device which it claims can remove excess earwax in 35 seconds. The automated device called 'OtoSet' uses suction to clean the ears and comes with disposable nozzle tips. The startup further claims that the device is designed to reduce complications such as hearing loss and membrane perforation.

headlines: Ant Financial may raise $8 bn at $150 bn valuation: Reports
text: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's payments affiliate Ant Financial is in talks to raise at least $8 billion from Singapore-based investment company Temasek Holdings, as per reports. The fundraiser might value the Chinese firm at over $150 billion, the reports added. Earlier it was reported that Ant Financial is planning to raise up to $5 billion at $100 billion valuation.

headlines: Human drugs could treat transmissible cancer in Aus animal
text: A Cambridge University study has identified key human cancer medications which could be trialled for treating transmissible cancer that is threatening Tasmanian devils with extinction. Tasmanian devils are marsupial carnivores endemic to the Australian island of Tasmania. The species is considered endangered due to a rare facial tumour that is passed between animals when they bite each other.

headlines: Indian anthropologist goes missing in Bengaluru
text: A 35-year-old anthropologist, Atreyee Majumder, hailing from Bengaluru has gone missing since last week. Majumder, who is currently pursuing a postdoctoral fellowship in Toronto, reached her residence in Bengaluru on April 4 after going out of touch in Toronto the previous day, her parents claimed. After reaching home, she went out and has not been seen since.

headlines: B'luru man poses as girl, cons men through dating websites
text: Bengaluru cyber crime police has arrested a 25-year-old man, who allegedly conned men through dating websites by pretending to be a girl. The accused used girls' names for chatting with men and lured them by saying he would go on a date with them on the condition that they credited money to his bank account.

headlines: Chargesheet against builder for duping buyers of â¹51 crore
text: The Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Mumbai Police on Monday filed a chargesheet against a builder for allegedly duping over 440 home buyers of around â¹51 crore by promising them houses at Mira Road. Dipesh Bhagtani was arrested in January for cheating and criminal conspiracy among other charges and is currently lodged at Arthur Road jail.

headlines: Two arrested for manhandling woman, friend at Mumbai theatre
text: Police have arrested two men for allegedly manhandling a woman and her male friend at a movie theatre in Mumbai on Monday. One of the accused had reportedly passed a vulgar comment on the woman and her clothes. However, when her friend objected to the comment, the accused and his accomplice physically manhandled the duo.

headlines: IAS toppers' wedding inspiring in age of intolerance: Rahul
text: Congratulating IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi and second rank holder Athar Aamir-ul-Shafi Khan on their wedding, Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted that they should become an inspiration to all Indians in this age of intolerance. The couple had fallen in love during their training in Mussoorie and faced criticism for the relationship as they belonged to different religions, reports said.

headlines: Zuckerberg asked about his own personal info during testimony
text: During the data scandal testimony, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg was asked by a senator if he'd be comfortable revealing some of his personal information like the hotel he stayed in or people he texted. For both the questions, Zuckerberg paused and said, "Um, uh, no." The senator then said, "I think that might be what this is all about".

headlines: Ananya, Tara to be lead actresses in Student Of The Year 2
text: Chunky Panday's daughter Ananya Panday and Tara Sutaria have been confirmed as the lead actresses in Karan Johar's upcoming production 'Student Of The Year 2'. The film, which is a sequel to the 2012 movie 'Student Of The Year', will mark Ananya and Tara's debut in Bollywood. Directed by Punit Malhotra, the sequel is scheduled to release on November 23.

headlines: Your user agreement sucks: US Senator to Facebook CEO
text: During Mark Zuckerberg's testimony, US Senator John Neely Kennedy said to Facebook's CEO, "Your user agreement sucks." He also said that the purpose of that user agreement is to cover "Facebook's rear end" and not to inform users about their rights. "I'm going to suggest to you that you go back home and rewrite it", he added.

headlines: Bihar govt withdraws 32 armed cops deputed at Rabri's house
text: Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government has withdrawn 32 Bihar Military Police jawans deputed at former Bihar CM Rabri Devi's residence. The decision was taken hours after the CBI raided the residence in connection with the IRCTC hotel tender case. Slamming the government's move, Rabri's son Tejashwi Yadav said that he and his brother Tej Pratap will also give up their security.

headlines: DM has confined me to a hotel room: Unnao rape victim
text: Appealing Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath for justice, Unnao rape victim on Wednesday said, "The DM has confined me to a hotel room, they are not even serving me water." "I just want the culprit to be punished," she added. The victim has accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar and his associates of abducting and raping her.

headlines: Alzheimer's neutralised in human brain cells for first time
text: A gene associated with Alzheimer's has been neutralised in human brain cells for the first time, California-based researchers have claimed. Scientists "turned off" a protein associated with the apoE4 gene, which damages nerve cells, leading to dementia. Having one copy of the gene doubles the risk of Alzheimer's, whereas two copies increase the risk by 12 times, noted researchers.

headlines: Scientists induce sensation of touch in paralysed man's arm
text: In a first, Caltech scientists have induced natural sensations in a paralysed man's arm by electrically stimulating a certain region of the brain. Electrodes implanted in brain's somatosensory cortex were able to stimulate neurones that produced physical sensations. The work could allow patients using prosthetic limbs to feel physical feedback from sensors on these devices, noted scientists.

headlines: Govt orders enquiry into IndiGo deboarding passenger
text: Civil Aviation Minister Suresh Prabhu has ordered an enquiry into the offloading of a passenger by IndiGo at Lucknow airport. Saurabh Rai, a cardiologist, has accused IndiGo staff of manhandling and de-boarding him from the aircraft after he complained about mosquitoes. IndiGo said that Rai started to use threatening language before the cabin crew could address his concerns.

headlines: Tata Trusts favoured Harvard over Indian universities: Panel
text: A parliamentary panel has accused Tata Trusts of favouring Harvard Business School (HBS) over Indian universities. The panel said that a $50 million contribution to HBS was "for the personal interest" of one or more trustees. It said this comes at a time when students of universities such as Tata Institute of Social Sciences are protesting against lack of funds.

headlines: Trade war is like treating flu with chemotherapy: Jack Ma
text: Alibaba Founder Jack Ma has said it's normal for the world's two biggest economies to have problems with trade, but tackling them with trade war is like treating flu with chemotherapy. Slamming US President Donald Trump's move to slap tariffs on Chinese goods, Jack Ma said, "You're not solving the problem of the cold, you are destroying the whole body."

headlines: China files trade complaint against US at WTO
text: China has filed a trade complaint against the US with the World Trade Organisation over tariffs imposed on imports of steel and aluminium products. China claimed the 25% duty on steel imports and 10% duty on imports of aluminium products violate WTO's fundamental principles. It stated that the US failed to administer its regulations in a uniform and impartial manner.

headlines: Duckworth becomes first US Senator to give birth in office
text: Tammy Duckworth has become the first US Senator to give birth while in office. "[We] couldnât be happier to welcome...newest addition to family", she said on the birth of her second daughter. Duckworth had her first daughter in 2014 while in the White House, making her one of only 10 lawmakers to give birth while serving in Congress.n

headlines: Trump praises Chinese President's 'kind words' on tariffs
text: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday praised China's President Xi Jinping's "kind words on tariffs and automobile barriers". He also thanked him for his "enlightenment on intellectual property and technology transfers". This comes after Jinping promised to "significantly lower" tariffs on vehicle imports and vowed to open up parts of the country's economy amid rising tensions with the US.

headlines: Zuckerberg used extra cushion on his seat while testifying
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg put an extra cushion on his seat, reportedly to boost his height while testifying before the US Congress over the ongoing data scandal around the company. A Facebook spokesperson said the cushion wasn't Zuckerberg's private seat and was provided by the Senate Judiciary Committee. "That's the committee's standard practice," the spokesperson added.

headlines: Kapil Sharma's new show suspended for a month: Reports
text: According to reports, Kapil Sharma's new show 'Family Time With Kapil Sharma' has been suspended for almost a month owing to his health condition. "The show's first episode was nothing like its predecessor...It only did well on TRP charts as Kapil has an ardent fan following," said reports. The show will reportedly be back on air after Kapil's health improves.

headlines: Ankur Mittal gives India 11th shooting medal at CWG 2018
text: Shooter Ankur Mittal won bronze in men's double trap event to give India its 11th medal in shooting and 24th overall at the Commonwealth Games in Gold Coast on Wednesday. Another Indian shooter Mohammad Ashab finished fourth in the same event. Indian shooters Anjum Moudgil and Tejaswini Sawant will compete in the women's 50m rifle prone finals on Thursday.

headlines: 100 life-size cardboard cutouts of Zuckerberg put up in US
text: Advocacy group Avaaz has placed 100 life-sized cardboard cutouts of Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on the lawn outside the US Capitol in Washington DC. The slogan over Zuckerberg's T-shirt read, "fix fakebook'. This came while Zuckerberg testified before the US Congress over the recent data controversy surrounding the social media major, where its users' data was exploited to influence elections.

headlines: Strikes hit German airports, hundreds of flights cancelled
text: Passengers in Germany were left stranded due to hundreds of flight cancellations after airports in Frankfurt, Munich, Cologne and Bremen were hit by public sector strikes. Airport staff including ground crew and firefighters staged walkouts to increase the pressure in a pay dispute. The strike also affected nurseries, rubbish collection services and swimming pools in several German states.

headlines: Gurugram travel planning startup raises â¹78 crore
text: Gurugram-based travel planning startup TravelTriangle has raised â¹78 crore in a Series C funding round led by Fundamentum. Existing investors including SAIF Partners and Bessemer Venture Partners also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2011, TravelTriangle offers travel packages to users and also guides them through bookings and planning for a vacation.

headlines: Distortions in universe's oldest light reveal dark matter
text: US-based scientists have decoded weak gravity-based distortions in the universe's earliest known light to map huge tubelike structures invisible to our eyes. Called filaments, the structures serve as a medium for delivering matter to dense celestial objects like galaxy clusters. Further studies could help understand constituting dark matter, that makes up about 85% of the universe's total mass.

headlines: Device controls reflection, redirection of sound waves
text: US-based researchers have demonstrated a metamaterial that can control the transmission and reflection of incoming sound waves with almost perfect efficiency. As a sound wave travels through the device, each cavity resonates at its prescribed frequency. The vibration affects the speed of the sound wave and also interacts with its neighbouring cavities to control both transmission and reflection.

headlines: PAN forms to now have independent category for transgenders
text: The government has amended Income Tax rules to recognise transgenders as an independent category of applicants for obtaining a Permanent Account Number (PAN). The application forms only had male and female gender categories until now. Transgenders were facing problems linking their PAN and Aadhaar since only Aadhaar had the third gender category, reports said.

headlines: Delhi airport to get bigger T1 and T3, new runway by 2021
text: Delhiâs Indira Gandhi International Airport will launch the first phase of its expansion drive by appointing a design consultant for the expansion of Terminal 1 and Terminal 3 and construction of a new runway and taxiways. Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL) expects the expansion to be completed by 2021, which will be followed by the construction of a new terminal.

headlines: 125 school buses in Ghaziabad fail initial safety checks
text: In a physical inspection of school buses conducted in Ghaziabad on Sunday, it was found that out of 712 buses checked, as many as 125 did not adhere to safety norms, officials said. "The non-compliant buses have been served notice and have to get the issues rectified within seven days," Additional Regional Transport Officer Vishwajeet Singh said.

headlines: 10 tribal students from Maharashtra to scale Mount Everest
text: Ten tribal students, including 3 girls, will attempt to scale world's highest peak Mount Everest under Maharashtra government's Mission Shaurya project. The students, who underwent an eight-month training to learn mountaineering, will leave for the 60-day mission on Thursday. The aim of the project is to tap the potential and promote talent in various fields among tribal youth, officials said.

headlines: Ambedkar said Satyagraha not required in today's India: RSS
text: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Tuesday said that BR Ambedkar felt that non-violent protest such as a Satyagraha is not required in post-Independence India. "In the speech in the Constituent Assembly, Ambedkar had said what we did during the British rule was fine for that time," he added. Bhagwat asserted, "We cannot do what [freedom fighters] did in their time."

headlines: B'luru couple makes eco-friendly alternative to plastic bags
text: A couple in Bengaluru has developed bags made of newspaper and all-purpose flour (maida) as an eco-friendly alternative to plastic garbage bags. The duo has also started a social enterprise called 'greenBUG' and reached out to underprivileged women through an NGO. So far, they have trained around 100 women, and they neither set production targets nor penalise for low production.

headlines: Shooter Shreyasi wins India's 12th gold medal at CWG 2018
text: Indian shooter Shreyasi Singh won the women's double trap gold in a shoot-off after scoring 96 points to take India's gold medal tally at Commonwealth Games 2018 to 12 on Wednesday. This was her second CWG medal after having claimed a silver at the 2014 Glasgow Games. Another Indian shooter Varsha Varman finished fourth in the event, scoring 86 points.

headlines: Facebook does not see messages sent on WhatsApp: Zuckerberg
text: During his testimony before the US Congress on Wednesday, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "Facebook systems do not see the content of messages being transmitted over WhatsApp." He further highlighted that conversations on the messaging platform, which is owned by Facebook, are fully encrypted. Earlier, Facebook had admitted it scans users' chats and photos on Messenger.

headlines: Andhra university site hacked, Pak Zindabad slogan displayed
text: Andhra University's official website was allegedly hacked on Monday to display slogans such as 'Pakistan Zindabad' and 'Free Kashmir' for a few hours. The hackers also left a message slamming the alleged civilian killings by military and police forces in J&K. "All we ask is for freedom, you can kill us but you canât kill us all," it said.

headlines: Denied class promotion, female singer joins all-boys school
text: An 11-year-old female student has been admitted to Dehradun's Col Brown Cambridge School, an all-boys academy, when her own school denied her class promotion due to attendance shortage after her participation in a singing reality show. Being the only girl at the boys academy, Shekinah Mukhiya will wear the same uniform as the boys and use the staff bathroom.

headlines: I lost out on a film because of my skin colour: Priyanka
text: Priyanka Chopra has revealed that she lost out on a film because of her skin colour. "It happened last year...Somebody [from the studio] called one of my agents and said 'She's the wrong physicality'," said Priyanka. "Then my agent broke it down for me like, 'I think they meant they wanted someone who's not brown.' It affected me," she added.

headlines: 5-time world champ Kom assures India of silver on CWG debut
text: Five-time world champion boxer Mary Kom, who is making her Commonwealth Games debut at Gold Coast, has assured India of at least a silver medal after defeating Sri Lanka's Anusha Dilrukshi 5-0 in the 45-48kg category semi-final on Wednesday. The 35-year-old Olympic bronze medalist will face Northern Ireland's Kristina O'Hara in the final on Saturday.

headlines: Will do everything to ensure India's election safety: FB CEO
text: During his testimony before the US Congress on Wednesday, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the company will do everything to ensure the safety of elections in India and Pakistan. This comes after it was revealed that 87 million Facebook users' data was exploited to influence the US elections. Data of over five lakh Facebook users in India was also leaked.

headlines: Facebook to offer $500 each to users who report data abuse
text: Facebook has said it would begin offering a minimum of $500 each as a reward to users who report misuse of private information from the social network. It's part of an effort from the company to step up data protection in light of the data scandal. Facebook said the reward would be applicable to cases affecting 10,000 people or more.

headlines: Show Shah Jahan's sign to prove Taj Mahal's ownership: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Tuesday asked Uttar Pradesh Sunni Waqf Board to submit documents signed by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan to prove the board's claim over Taj Mahal. "Who in India will believe it belongs to Waqf Board," the court questioned. The apex court was hearing Archaeological Survey of India's plea challenging the board's claim over the monument's ownership.

headlines: 3 southern states accuse Centre of bias in fund allocation
text: The Finance ministers of Kerala, Puducherry, and Andhra Pradesh and the Agriculture minister of Karnataka on Tuesday came together to slam the Centre over alleged bias regarding fund allocation to states. They opposed the 15th Finance Commission recommendations, claiming it skewed allocation of central funds in favour of states with large populations like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

headlines: UN should play its part in Kashmir issue: Pakistan PM
text: During his meeting with UN Secretary General AntÃ³nio Guterres on Tuesday, Pakistan Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi urged the world body to play its part in stopping "Indian atrocities" in Kashmir. Accusing India of ceasefire violations along the border, Abbasi said Pakistan seeks a just and peaceful resolution of the dispute, adding that the situation can escalate dangerously.

headlines: MP CM announces â¹4 lakh to family of journos who die on duty
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has announced that the families of journalists who die in the line of duty will receive a compensation of â¹4 lakh. The CM also promised â¹50,000 to camerapersons in case their equipment gets damaged on duty. The announcement comes days after the alleged murder of a journalist reporting on sand mafia in the state.

headlines: Pakistan and China are iron brothers: Pak PM Abbasi
text: Asserting that the friendship between Pakistan and China is the bedrock of strategic stability in the region, Pakistan Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi said that both the countries are "iron brothers". Praising the $50-billion China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), Abbasi said, "In the annals of history, Sino-Pakistan relations find no parallel."

headlines: Global debt rose to record $237 trillion last year
text: Global debt jumped to a record $237 trillion last year, more than $70 trillion higher from a decade earlier, according to the Institute of International Finance. This is also more than three times the size of the global economy. The United Nations calculates the world population at 7.6 billion, suggesting that the world's per capita debt is nearly $31,200.

headlines: I hate both gold and Bitcoin: Billionaire Mark Cuban
text: Calling gold and Bitcoin as "collectibles", American billionaire Mark Cuban has said he hates both as neither are viable alternatives to currency. However, he added, "The good news about Bitcoin is that there's a finite supply, and the bad news about gold is that they'll keep mining more." Cuban said he'd rather have a "pet rock" than gold or Bitcoin.

headlines: GM directed $2.1-billion fraud: Arrested PNB Dy Manager
text: Former PNB Deputy Manager Gokulnath Shetty has reportedly blamed Rajesh Jindal, the General Manager of Brady House branch between August 2009 and May 2011, for directing the $2.1-billion fraud. Shetty alleged that Jindal directed him to issue first Letter of Undertaking (LoU) to Nirav Modi without securities and collaterals in 2010. Rajesh Jindal has already been arrested by the CBI.

headlines: We're on this journey together: Sunny on wedding anniversary
text: Sunny Leone has shared a picture of herself and her husband Daniel Weber from their wedding ceremony on the occasion of their marriage anniversary and wrote, "We're on this crazy journey of life together!" She added, "Seven years ago we vowed in front of God to always love each other! I love you more today then I did that day!"

headlines: Can't play typical hero as I'll do it in my style: Nawazuddin
text: Nawazuddin Siddiqui has said he won't be able to play a typical hero while adding, "I'll play it my way and try to make it realistic.'' "If you've chosen to be an actor, you should only be interested in your growth...Box-office outcome doesn't bother me," he added. Nawazuddin further said people don't understand his kind of films because they're "difficult".

headlines: Misha most beautiful thing to happen to me: Shahid's stepmom
text: Shahid Kapoor's stepmother actress Supriya Pathak has said that his daughter Misha Kapoor is the most beautiful thing to happen to her. She further said spending time with Misha is de-stressing while adding, "Being a grandmother is an out-of-the-world feeling." Talking about Shahid's wife Mira, Supriya said, "My daughter-in-law is like my daughter... Mira and I have a great relationship."

headlines: Kapil my guru, makes me cry to see him in this state: Bharti
text: Speaking about the ongoing row involving Kapil Sharma, Bharti Singh said, "He's my guru...It makes me cry seeing him in this state." "He made us laugh...Now when he needs our support to come out of depression, we're troubling him," she added. Bharti further said, "The health woes happened because of the hard work he put in his dream project 'Firangi'."

headlines: Never seen Apple notify of misused data: Zuckerberg's notes
text: As per Mark Zuckerberg's notes for his testimony, he was prepared to criticise Apple. "Lots of stories about apps misusing Apple data, never seen Apple notify people...Important you hold everyone to the same standard", he wrote. He also directed Jeff Bezos' quote comparing companies that work hard to charge more and companies that work hard to charge less, towards Apple.

headlines: Facebook doesn't feel like a monopoly to me: Mark Zuckerberg
text: On being asked if he thought Facebook was a monopoly during the testimony, the company's CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "It certainly doesn't feel like that to me." Further, when asked about the social media giant's competitors, Zuckerberg mentioned technology companies like Google, Apple, Amazon, Microsoft and Twitter, and said, "We overlap with them in different ways."

headlines: Google may buy Nokia's broadband tech for in-flight WiFi
text: Technology giant Google is in advanced talks to buy Nokia's airborne broadband system to offer in-flight high-speed internet, according to reports. Last year, Nokia announced its air-to-ground connectivity network with internet speeds faster than those of the existing in-flight internet company Gogo. However, the companies could still decide against a deal, reports further claimed.

headlines: Delhi police busts drug racket, recovers â¹125cr-worth heroin
text: The Delhi Police has busted an international drug racket and arrested four people with 29 kilogram heroin worth â¹125-crore after a month-long operation. The drugs were transported from Afghanistan to Kashmir, routed through Pakistan and then distributed in Delhi-NCR region and other parts of the world. Police operated based on a tip-off regarding a person visiting Delhi to supply drugs.

headlines: K'taka temple bans women from leaving hair open on premises
text: Sri Rajarajeshwari Temple in Karnataka's Bengaluru has banned women devotees from leaving their hair open, asking them to tie it with clips or rubber bands before entering the premises. The temple also restricted entry to devotees wearing bermudas, low-waist jeans among other things. It suggested the male devotees should wear dhoti whereas women should don saris or churidars with dupattas.

headlines: Over a dozen injured in clashes during Bharat Bandh in Bihar
text: Over a dozen people were injured in Bihar's Arrah on Tuesday in violent clashes which erupted during a Bharat Bandh protest against caste-based reservations in jobs and education. Meanwhile, Section 144 was imposed in parts of Rajasthan, Uttarakhand and Madhya Pradesh. Hundreds of youth have blocked roads, halted trains, and forcibly closed markets, reports said.

headlines: Issue public notice for auction of Unitech's assets: SC
text: The Supreme Court has asked amicus curiae Pawan Shree Agrawal to issue a public notice inviting objections to the sale of Unitech's assets. The notice is aimed at ensuring that properties are unencumbered before the sale. The court was also informed that Shapoorji Pallonji was interested in buying Unitech's land in Bangalore for â¹110 crore.

headlines: Shoes thrown at boundary during CSK-KKR match, 4 arrested
text: The IPL match between CSK and KKR at the Chepauk Stadium in Chennai was interrupted briefly after Naam Tamilar Katchi workers hurled shoes at the boundary in protest against the Cauvery water-sharing issue. The police have arrested four workers involved in the incident. Earlier, TVK leader Velmurugan had threatened that his party would let loose snakes inside the stadium.

headlines: Cops acting as Cong puppets: BJP to K'taka poll panel chief
text: In its memorandum to Karnataka election panel's chief, the BJP has alleged that police have been functioning as the Congress' puppets ahead of the Assembly elections. The BJP accused police of harassing its workers and filing false cases against them. It also claimed that Election Commission officials unjustly used the model code of conduct to block the party's in-house programmes.

headlines: TN rejects Sterlite copper plant renewal amid protests
text: Metals and mining giant Vedanta on Tuesday said its application for renewal of license to operate its Sterlite copper smelter plant in Tamil Nadu's Thoothukudi has been rejected by the state pollution board. This comes amid protests by locals against the plant's expansion as it was allegedly polluting the groundwater. The plant is closed indefinitely until the renewal is granted.

headlines: Donât delay pension disbursal over Aadhaar linking: CIC
text: The Central Information Commission (CIC) on Tuesday said there should be no delay in the disbursement of pension to senior citizens and retired employees in the name of Aadhaar linking. Delaying pension payments will be "inhumane" and it also amounts to the denial of a pensioner's fundamental right to life, Information Commissioner MS Acharyulu noted.

headlines: Axis Bank adds â¹7,200cr in market cap after CEO's tenure cut
text: Axis Bank on Tuesday added over â¹7,200 crore to its market capitalisation, a day after its CEO and MD Shikha Sharma's tenure was shortened to December 31, 2018. The bank's shares surged over 5.4% and it now has a valuation of about â¹1.41 trillion. The bank's non-performing assets had surged by over 300% in past three years under Sharma's leadership.

headlines: CBI gets nod to attach Nirav Modi's UK account with â¹12 cr
text: A special CBI court on Monday allowed the agency to freeze a bank account of jeweller Nirav Modi in the UK.
