The CBI claimed the account with Barclays bank in the name of Nirav Modi Private Limited had deposits worth nearly â¹12 crore. The agency suspects the amount has been earned through the Letters of Undertaking (LoUs) obtained from PNB.

headlines: I would want my son Taimur to be a cricketer: Kareena
text: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has said that she wants her son Taimur Ali Khan to become a cricketer. However, Kareena added that she would not want to choose a profession for Taimur but wants him to choose what he wants to do. Notably, Taimur's grandfather late Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi was a former captain of the Indian cricket team.

headlines: H'wood elitists look down upon Marvel films: Zoe Saldana
text: Zoe Saldana, who played Gamora in Guardians of the Galaxy, has said she is disappointed with the negative attitude Hollywood 'elitists' have towards films like Marvel films. She added, "Those elitists should be a little more cognizant about what playing a superhero means to a child...You're not just dissing me, you're dissing what that child considers important in their world."

headlines: Katrina Kaif shares her picture from sets of 'Zero'
text: Actress Katrina Kaif took to Instagram to share a picture of herself from the sets of the upcoming film 'Zero'. "Aaj 4 Zero by @aanandlrai," wrote the actress while sharing the picture. Also starring Shah Rukh Khan and Anushka Sharma, the Aanand L Rai directorial is scheduled to release on December 21.

headlines: Shoot location of Salman's Race 3 to shift to India: Report
text: As per reports, the shoot location of the Salman Khan starrer 'Race 3' will be shifted to India from the previous plans of foreign shoot locations. The decision was reportedly made by the makers keeping in view that Salman cannot leave India without the court's permission. This was one of the conditions for his bail in the blackbuck poaching case.

headlines: Russell hits 11 6s, records top IPL score by a no. 7 batsman
text: KKR all-rounder Andre Russell slammed 11 sixes during his knock of 88*(36) against CSK in the IPL on Tuesday. Russell now holds the record for the highest score by a number seven batsman in the IPL, overtaking CSK's Dwayne Bravo's 68-run record. Russell also became the first batsman to slam more than six sixes against CSK in Chennai in IPL.

headlines: Raina overtakes Rohit to hit most sixes by an Indian in IPL
text: CSK batsman Suresh Raina has overtaken MI captain Rohit Sharma to record most sixes by an Indian in the IPL, achieving the feat against KKR on Tuesday. Raina has now hit 174 sixes in 163 IPL matches while Rohit has slammed 173 in 160 matches. KXIP's Chris Gayle holds the record for most sixes (265) in the Indian Premier League.

headlines: CSK chase down KKR's 202 in their 1st IPL home match in 3yrs
text: Chennai Super Kings, who were playing on their home soil for the first time since 2015, chased down Kolkata Knight Riders' 202 in the last over on Tuesday to win their second successive match in the Indian Premier League 2018. With this, Chennai have now won 96 matches in T20 cricket, the second-most by any team.

headlines: BarÃ§a out of CL as Roma pulls off joint 2nd biggest comeback
text: Roma produced the joint-second biggest comeback in Champions League history by overhauling a three-goal quarter-final first-leg deficit to knock Barcelona out on away goals on Tuesday. Roma won 3-0 after losing 1-4 away, joining Deportivo as the second team to overturn a three-goal deficit. Barcelona produced the biggest-ever comeback last year after overturning a four-goal deficit against PSG.

headlines: Player gets injuried due to drug tests, sues tennis bodies
text: American player Madison Brengle has filed a lawsuit against Women's Tennis Association and International Tennis Federation seeking damages for injuries caused by repeated drawing of blood for anti-doping tests. According to the lawsuit, the authorities subjected her to testing despite knowing she had a condition that reacts to needle injections, which caused permanent swelling in her serving arm.

headlines: Liverpool into CL last 4 as Man City lose 3rd match in a row
text: Liverpool scored two second-half goals to register a 2-1 comeback win against Manchester City on Tuesday to advance to the Champions League semi-finals with a 5-1 aggregate victory. The defeat was Manchester City's third in a row across all competitions. Further, Liverpool set the record for most goals scored (33) by an English club in a single Champions League season.

headlines: Shooter Om Mitharval wins India's 22nd medal at CWG 2018
text: India's 22-year-old shooter Om Mitharval won the bronze in the men's 50m pistol event to bag the country's 22nd overall medal at the Commonwealth Games 2018 on Wednesday. This was Mitharval's second medal at the Gold Coast Games after winning a bronze in men's 10m Air Pistol event. Meanwhile, defending champion Jitu Rai finished eighth in the same event.

headlines: Kejriwal meets TDP MPs, backs Andhra's special status demand
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has met 21 TDP MPs who were detained at a police station for trying to stage protests near PM Narendra Modi's residence over their special status demand for Andhra Pradesh. Stating that he supports the party's demand, Kejriwal said, "It is sad that the respectable MPs were sent to jail...this is arrogance."

headlines: BJP came into power in 2014 to fight corruption: Swamy
text: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) came to power in 2014 to fight against corruption, party leader Subramanian Swamy said. Maintaining PM Narendra Modi's reputation as a man of governance, and persuading people to rise above caste loyalties and choose a party which will safeguard their interest were also the reasons why the party came into power, he added.

headlines: Sikhs protest demanding Cong sack 1984 riots accused leaders
text: Sikhs groups on Tuesday protested outside Congress' Delhi headquarters demanding it sack senior leaders Jagdish Tytler and Sajjan Kumar over their alleged involvement in 1984 anti-Sikh riots. The Congress must clear its stand on the accused leaders, they said. Recently, the Congress had allegedly asked Tytler and Kumar to stay away from the stage at a protest fast it organised.

headlines: PM Modi's fast against Parliament disruption a farce: Cong
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala has called PM Narendra Modi's fast against Parliament disruptions on April 12 a "farce". He said the fast should instead be observed to apologise to Dalits and students who were affected by the CBSE and SSC paper leaks. BJP President Amit Shah and all party MPs will observe the day-long fast along with PM Modi.

headlines: Minister seeks transfer of IAS officer who locked his office
text: Karnataka's Hassan District Minister A Manju has written to the Election Commission seeking transfer of IAS and district electoral officer Rohini Sindhuri ahead of the Assembly polls in May. This comes days after Sindhuri locked his government office over reports that it was being used for election work. The minister claimed she was misusing her position to tarnish his image.

headlines: Maha prepares online system for universities to hold exams
text: The Maharashtra government has announced plans to launch a digital automation system to conduct examinations, assess answer sheets online and help with admissions of students across its universities. This comes after Mumbai University had adopted an online marking system last year causing an extended delay in declaring exam results. The system is expected to be implemented from November.

headlines: J'khand to release 221 life-term convicts after 20-year jail
text: The Jharkhand government has decided to release 221 prisoners who were awarded life sentence and have spent over 20 years in jail. Addressing a review committee meeting, CM Raghubar Das said tribals who committed crimes unintentionally and showed good conduct in jails should be released. He also directed the administration to keep a check on offenders after their release.

headlines: CBSE exam postponed in Punjab over bandh to be on April 27
text: The CBSE exams for Class 12 and 10 postponed in Punjab due to Bharat Bandh on April 2 will be held on April 27. Class 12 students were to appear for Hindi while Class 10 students were to appear for French, Sanskrit, and Urdu. The postponement came at the state government's request due to the bandh, wherein 12 were killed.

headlines: Man involved in 400 robbery cases arrested in Delhi
text: A 34-year-old man involved in over 400 robbery cases over a span of nine years in Delhi has been arrested, police said. As many as 12 stolen motorcycles were also recovered from him. The accused, who belongs to Uttar Pradesh, would travel to Delhi by bus and steal motorcycles parked in commercial areas using master keys, police added.

headlines: Kill my son, feed body to animals: Suspected militant's mom
text: After an image circulated online suggested that a missing Assam youth joined Hizbul Mujahideen in Jammu and Kashmir, his mother said the government should shoot him dead as he is "an enemy of the country". "His body should be fed to animals," she added. The Assam Police has launched a probe to ascertain if he has joined the terror outfit.

headlines: OnePlus to launch wireless earphones with OnePlus 6: Report
text: As spotted by Nashville Chatter, a listing on the Bluetooth certification site reveals the listing of a product called the OnePlus Bullets Wireless. The report doesn't clarify whether they'll be fully wireless or still include a wire that wraps around the neck. The report also states that this product will be launch around the same time as the OnePlus 6.

headlines: Indians made 4.5 lakh marriage proposals to Google Assistant
text: Google's virtual assistant has received 4.5 lakh marriage proposals from India, the company's VP of Product Management Rishi Chandra revealed. Google Assistant, which is available in India in both Hindi and English, was launched in the country last year. Users can get real-time answers including news, sports updates, weather reports and know what song is playing via Google Assistant.

headlines: Japanese man aged 112 named world's oldest living man
text: A 112-year-old Japanese man has been recognised as the world's oldest living man by the Guinness World Records. Masazo Nonaka was conferred the title after Francisco Nunez Olivera from Spain died in February aged 113. There are around 68,000 people aged 100 or more in Japan, according to government data released last year.

headlines: What happened in India's 1st civil disobedience movement?
text: On April 10, 1917, Mahatma Gandhi reached Bihar's Champaran to understand the situation of farmers, who were being forced to grow indigo. When Gandhiji was asked by the Britishers to leave the district, he resisted and then got arrested. Upset over the arrest, Champaran residents protested non-violently outside the jail and other government buildings, leading to Mahatma's release.

headlines: Dogs in Gujarat village own land worth millions
text: Around 70 dogs in Gujarat's Panchot village own land worth millions due to a decades-old tradition of donating land to animals in the village. An informal trust controls around 21 bighas of land that has been donated to the dogs. The plots of the land are auctioned for tilling rights for a year and the money is used for sustainability.

headlines: Man steals Maha govt bus, rams it into tree minutes later
text: A man hailing from Uttar Pradesh was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly stealing a state-owned MSRTC bus with passengers on board to drive to his village, police said. However, he lost vehicle's control within minutes and rammed it into a tree. Locals pulled him out and thrashed him, while the bus driver will be suspended for leaving the door unlocked.

headlines: Kapil cried, told us he's trapped: Comedian's former manager
text: In an open letter to comedian Kapil Sharma, his former manager Neeti Simoes wrote, "You...are being misled by 'friends' around you...Like you said to us and cried last month 'you are trapped'." She added that she and her sister Preeti Simoes, Kapil's ex-girlfriend, are ready to clarify matters with Kapil when he is not under the influence of alcohol.

headlines: Class action lawsuit filed against FB, Cambridge Analytica
text: A class action lawsuit has been launched against Facebook, Cambridge Analytica and two other companies by British and US lawyers over alleged misuse of the personal data of over 7 crore people. The lawsuit claims the firms developed "political propaganda campaigns" in the UK and the US by obtaining users' private information from the social media network.

headlines: Congress posts mock video on UP CM Yogi's browser history
text: Mocking Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, Congress has posted a video on what his browser history could be. Using news clips on Kasganj violence and the death of 63 children at a Gorakhpur hospital, the video shows Adityanath searching for "How to ensure social disharmony", "How to bring bad governance" and ends with "How to make Yogi PM in 2019".

headlines: We are being befooled by executive: SC on fund utilisation
text: Slamming states and the Centre for utilising around â¹1 lakh crore meant for protecting the environment and people's welfare for other purposes, the Supreme Court on Tuesday said, "We are being befooled by the executive." Reprimanding the Odisha government for spending "people's funds" on governance issues, the apex court accused the executive of breaching trust and not following instructions.

headlines: Tharoor slams Twitter trolls with new word 'lalochezia'
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday used the word 'lalochezia' to slam trolls on the micro-blogging site. Reacting to the difficult words Tharoor is known for sharing, a user tweeted, "Sir you are helping me a lot in my GRE preparation," while another wrote, "Start 'word of the day' on Twitter, it'll be more popular than 'Good morning' on WhatsApp."

headlines: 10-yr-old raised alarm after escaping Himachal bus accident
text: A 10-year-old boy raised an alarm after falling out of the window of his school bus when it fell into a deep gorge in Himachal Pradesh, killing 29 people. The boy climbed the gorge using sticks and grass and informed people about the accident after reaching the road. Reports said locals saved ten lives after he raised alarm.

headlines: China gained from 'poor' US leadership in past: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Monday said that the "poor" US leadership of the past "allowed" China to take advantage of the country. This comes amid the ongoing tensions between the two countries over trade tariffs. However, Trump said, "I'm very good friends with Chinese President Xi Jinping...I think we will maintain that relationship."

headlines: Homeland Security Advisor latest top US govt aide to resign
text: US President Donald Trump's Homeland Security Adviser Tom Bossert has resigned, White House press Secretary Sarah Sanders said on Tuesday. "The president wishes Tom well and is grateful for his commitment to the safety and security of our great country," she added. Bossert served in the White House since Trump's inauguration.

headlines: Singer Kurt Cobain's handwriting turned into font
text: A project called 'Songwriters Fonts' has created a font based on handwritten letters and notes of late singer-songwriter Kurt Cobain. "Songwriting is about inspiration...The songwriters fonts have been created to give musicians inspiration," the font creators said. They also created handwriting fonts of other singer-songwriters including David Bowie, John Lennon, and Leonard Cohen.

headlines: Wipro's Rishad Premji appointed Nasscom Chairman for 2018-19
text: IT industry body Nasscom on Tuesday said it appointed Wipro's Chief Strategy Officer and board member Rishad Premji as its Chairman for 2018-19. Premji was the Vice Chairman for 2017-18 and has been a member of Nasscom's Executive Council. Notably, Rishad Premji is the son of Wipro's Chairman Azim Premji.

headlines: Russia's richest people lose $16 billion in one day
text: The combined net worth of Russia's 27 wealthiest people plunged by $16 billion on Monday. This comes after the US imposed sanctions against 24 Russian oligarchs and officials, including President Vladimir Putin's former son-in-law Kirill Shamalov. The world's second largest nickel producer Norilsk Nickel's CEO Vladimir Potanin lead the decline as his fortune fell by $2.25 billion.

headlines: Extra 'M' in name didn't change things for me: Rajkummar Rao
text: Actor Rajkummar Rao revealed that his loved ones wanted him to add an extra 'M' in his name, while adding, "But, it's not like just because of that suddenly things changed for me." The actor said that his name was actually Rajkumar Yadav. He further said, "I think eventually it's your hard work and commitment which pays off."

headlines: Sidharth Malhotra to play a thug in 'Shotgun Shaadi': Report
text: As per reports, actor Sidharth Malhotra will be seen playing the role of a thug in Ekta Kapoor's upcoming film 'Shotgun Shaadi'. The film, which reportedly also stars Shraddha Kapoor, is based on groom-kidnapping practice which is said to be prevalent in North India. Sidharth is said to have started taking classes to master the Bihari diction.

headlines: My score was good enough for any Olympic final: Heena Sidhu
text: Indian shooter Heena Sidhu, who set a CWG record to win gold in women's 25m Pistol on Tuesday, has said that her score of 38 was "good enough" for any Olympic final. This was Sidhu's first major gold in 25m Pistol and second medal at the Gold Coast Games, after having won silver in women's 10m Air Pistol.

headlines: Delhi government awards â¹14 lakh to CWG gold medalist Manika
text: Manika Batra, who was a part of women's table tennis team which won gold at the CWG 2018, will be awarded â¹14 lakh by Delhi government. Delhi-born Batra helped India become only the second nation after Singapore to win CWG gold in the women's table tennisÂ team event. The 22-year-old won both her singles' matches in the final against Singapore.

headlines: Nonsense only three knew about ball-tampering: Flintoff
text: Former England captain Andrew Flintoff has said that it is "nonsense" that only three Australian cricketers knew about the ball-tampering plan. "The ball is so important...you talk about how you're going to treat it...To say a bowler has got a ball in his hands (and he) doesn't know that this ball has been tampered with is absolute nonsense," he added.

headlines: Ceiling panel falls on one-year-old boy's head during flight
text: A 33-year-old woman has criticised American Airlines after a ceiling panel allegedly fell onto her son's head as the flight touched down in Texas, US. The woman claimed that her one-year-old son was on her lap when the panel, which included a tank of oxygen, fell down. Meanwhile, the airline said the woman declined medical help at the gate.

headlines: Must purify temples visited by K'taka minister: RSS leader
text: Slamming Karnataka minister UT Khader for consuming beef, RSS leader Kalladka Prabhakar has said that the temples visited by him must be cleaned using holy water. He added that Khader should be prohibited from entering all temples. While the Congress filed an FIR against Prabhakar, Khader said he has forgiven him for his remarks as he follows Islamic teachings.

headlines: RSS man dies after setting self on fire over caste violence
text: Upset over instances of caste violence in the nation, a 45-year-old RSS worker set himself on fire in Jaipur and died a day later. The man, who reportedly ran on streets shouting 'Bharat Mata ki jai' after setting himself ablaze, urged the youth to stand united in a suicide note. He was reportedly distressed over violence during Bharat Bandh protests.

headlines: Goa CM to return from US after treatment in May: BJP leader
text: Goa CM Manohar Parrikar is likely to return from the US in May after receiving treatment for a pancreas-related ailment, state BJP General Secretary Sadanand Tanavade said. The former Defence Minister is responding well to the treatment, he added. Parrikar, who went to the US last month, was earlier admitted to hospitals in Goa and Mumbai.

headlines: ED attaches â¹15-cr worth assets of Chennai businessman
text: The Enforcement Directorate has attached immovable properties worth â¹15 crore of Chennai-based businessman S Rajendran in a case of illegal remittance of about â¹128 crore abroad. Rajendran and two others allegedly remitted the forex through Star Forex India. The accused reportedly obtained a 'Full Fledged Money Changer' license under Star Forex India from the RBI by submitting bogus documents.

headlines: PM Modi to fast in protest against Parliament disruptions
text: PM Narendra Modi and BJP President Amit Shah, along with all BJP MPs, will observe a day-long fast on April 12 in protest against disruptions during the recently-concluded Budget session of the Parliament. The Lok Sabha lost nearly 128 hours due to disruptions and adjournments during the session. Only five bills were passed and another five introduced in the House.

headlines: YouTube's most watched video 'Despacito' deleted by hackers
text: Luis Fonsi's 'Despacito', which was YouTube's most watched video, appears to have been deleted from YouTube in an apparent hack. 'Despacito' had recently become the first YouTube video in history to reach 5 billion views. The hackers reportedly also targeted several videos, including Selena Gomez's 'Wolves', where the title of the videos were renamed to 'Hacked by Prosox'.

headlines: India's 2nd 400m CWG finalist breaks his own national record
text: India's Muhammed Anas Yahiya ran the men's 400m race at CWG 2018 in 45.31 seconds to finish fourth and break his own national record on Tuesday. Yahiya, only the second Indian after Milkha Singh to reach the men's 400m final at CWG, had clocked 45.32 seconds to set the previous record. The 23-year-old missed a medal by just 0.2 seconds.

headlines: Fashion designer arrested for raping teen daughters for 2 yrs
text: Mumbai Police arrested a fashion designer for allegedly raping his daughters, aged 13 and 17, for two years. He has been sent to police custody till April 13. His 17-year-old daughter reportedly confided in her mother after he threatened to not pay for her education and 'throw her out of the house' if she didn't give in to his demands.

headlines: Rajasthan Royals' bowler bowled 7 legal balls in 1 over
text: Rajasthan Royals pacer Ben Laughlin bowled seven legal deliveries in an over during the side's match against Sunrisers Hyderabad in 2018 IPL on Monday. The incident, which went unnoticed during the 12th over of the match, did not seem to have much impact on the match's result as Sunrisers won by 9 wickets with 25 balls remaining.

headlines: Whale found dead in Spain with 29 kg plastic in its stomach
text: A sperm whale found dead on Spain's southern coast was killed due to swallowing 29 kilos of ocean plastic waste, government officials have confirmed. Investigators uncovered plastic bags, net pieces, and a jerrycan in the whale's digestive system during the autopsy. The whale, which was around 10 metres long and weighed more than six tonnes, was found ashore in February.

headlines: Bihar transformed Mahatma Gandhi into 'Bapu': PM Modi
text: Speaking on the 100th anniversary of the Champaran Satyagraha, PM Narendra Modi said Bihar had transformed Mahatma Gandhi into 'Bapu'. Bihar residents have shown leadership skills in the journey from 'satyagraha' to 'swachhagraha', he added. Stating that the state reflected maximum improvement under Swachh Bharat Mission, PM Modi said 8.5 lakh toilets have been constructed in Bihar in a week.

headlines: Raze legal buildings posing safety risk: SC to Delhi body
text: The Supreme Court has directed a Special Task Force appointed to deal with unauthorised constructions in Delhi to demolish any building that poses a safety risk, even if it was built legally. It stated aspects including fire safety, citizens' health, and children's lives must be considered while taking such decisions. It was hearing petitions against illegal constructions in the city.

headlines: Chinese Prez pledges to cut auto tariffs amid US trade clash
text: Amid the rising trade tensions between China and the US, Chinese President Xi Jinping on Tuesday promised to "significantly lower" tariffs on vehicle imports. The statement comes after US President Donald Trump complained about China's 25% tariff on foreign cars, pointing out that it is far higher than the 2.5% imposed by the US.

headlines: Monkeys fight thieves who tried to steal them from zoo in NZ
text: A zoo in New Zealand's Wellington has revealed that a failed attempt to steal squirrel monkeys from one of its enclosures was made on Friday night. The attempt was foiled as the monkeys fought the thieves. The zoo said that some of the monkeys suffered minor injuries, while the thieves would have "some monkey bites".

headlines: Canadian cops search for woman who stole rock worth â¹11 lakh
text: Canadian police are searching for a woman suspected of stealing a rock worth $17,500 (â¹11 lakh) from a museum exhibit. 'Love Yourself' was written on the rock by artist Yoko Ono, the widow of singer-songwriter John Lennon. Social media users tweeted, "Keep the rock, lady. Enjoy it," and "Iâm having a hard time believing that ugly rock is worth 17,000$."

headlines: Nirav, Choksi blackmailed me for issuing LoUs: Ex-PNB DM
text: Former PNB Deputy Manager Gokulnath Shetty has reportedly said that Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi blackmailed him for issuing Letters of Undertaking (LoUs). He confessed to issuing the first LoU to Nirav without any securities and collaterals in 2010. Shetty alleged that they threatened to expose his first misconduct to PNB management, which forced him to keep issuing fraudulent LoUs.

headlines: ITC tweaks juice ad, drops reference to Tropicana
text: ITC has agreed to remove all references to rival PepsiCo's Tropicana from an advertisement campaign with the hashtag "SayNoToConcentrate" for its juice brand B Natural. The Delhi High Court had directed ITC to discontinue the campaign after a complaint by PepsiCo. However, ITC was allowed to hold a promotional event in Mumbai, without being disparaging about PepsiCo or its brands.

headlines: There can only be one hero and that's my dad: Tiger
text: Tiger Shroff, while responding to Subhash Ghai's tweet comparing him to his father Jackie Shroff, wrote, "There can only be one hero and that's dad!" Ghai had written, "A Great tribute to...Jackie Shroff is his own bright son Tiger Shroff as #Hero Vs Hero." While Jackie starred in the 1983 film 'Hero', Tiger made his debut in 2014 with 'Heropanti'.

headlines: Sonam to marry Anand Ahuja in Mumbai on April 29: Reports
text: As per reports, Sonam Kapoor will be marrying businessman Anand Ahuja in Mumbai on April 29. Earlier there were reports of them getting married in Montreux, Switzerland in May. Sonam's family reportedly could not host the wedding at their choice of resort in Montreux as it was pre-booked by a Saudi princess for those dates.

headlines: Change Beti Bachao to Beti Hum hi se Bachao: Richa to govt
text: Richa Chadha, while slamming the Uttar Pradesh government's decision to withdraw a seven-year-old rape and abduction lawsuit against former Union Minister Swami Chinmayanand, tweeted, "Dear government, please change #BetiBachao to #BetiHumHiSeBachao." In her tweet, Richa also made a reference to the Unnao rape case in which a BJP MLA was accused of raping a minor a year ago.

headlines: 4,000 policemen deployed around Chepauk ahead of CSK's match
text: As many as 4,000 police personnel have been deployed around the Chepauk Stadium ahead of CSK's first IPL match in Chennai after around three years amid Cauvery protests. Tamil groups have threatened that they could carry out protests inside the stadium. Earlier, TVK leader Velmurugan threatened his party would let loose snakes inside the stadium if the match goes through.

headlines: Will let loose snakes at stadium during CSK match: TN leader
text: TVK leader Velmurugan has threatened his party would let loose snakes inside the Chepauk Stadium in Chennai if CSK's first home match against KKR goes through on Tuesday. This comes amid protests by state parties urging the Centre to constitute the Cauvery Management Board. Earlier, Velmurugan had said the protestors wouldn't be responsible for any "untoward incident" at the stadium.

headlines: Sachin wins bronze, takes India's medal tally to 21 at CWG
text: Para powerlifter Sachin Chaudhary clinched the bronze medal in the men's heavyweight category on Tuesday to take India's medal tally to 21 at the Commonwealth Games 2018. Sachin successfully lifted 201kg after failing twice to finish with 181 points, 10.9 points behind first-placed Nigeria's Abdulazeez Ibrahim. Sachin had won silver at the 2017 Powerlifting World Cup in Dubai.

headlines: Tiger Woods misses hole-in-one as ball rolls over the hole
text: American golfer Tiger Woods missed scoring a hole-in-one as the ball rolled over the hole at the recently concluded Augusta National Masters in the US. Woods missed being only the second golfer to achieve the feat at the par-3 fourth hole at the Augusta Masters. The 232-yard shot, taken using a 4-iron, took two hops before skipping the hole.

headlines: Player concedes penalty by holding ball with hands near goal
text: Belgium defender Davina Philtjens conceded a penalty against Portugal by holding the ball with hands inches away from goal in injury time during a FIFA Women's World Cup qualifier. Portugal winger Jessica Silva nutmegged her opponent before crossing the ball into the box where Philtjens slipped and held the ball. Philtjens was sent off as Portugal equalised with the penalty.

headlines: 300 flights cancelled at Mumbai airport after runway closure
text: Nearly 300 flights were cancelled on Monday and several others rescheduled after the main runway at the Mumbai airport was closed for six hours for pre-monsoon maintenance work. The Mumbai airport has two intersecting runways, namely the main runway and the secondary runway. On an average, there are 970 flight arrivals and departures at the Mumbai airport every day.

headlines: Flipkart Co-founder-backed meal box startup raises $4 mn
text: Mumbai-based meal box startup Yumlane has raised $4 million in Series A funding round led by Singapore-based RB Investments. Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal and Orios Venture Partners also participated in the funding round. Founded in 2016, Yumlane sells freshly packed food from cuisines including Italian and Chinese and is also present in Bengaluru and Pune.

headlines: New blood test to predict risk of tuberculosis
text: Researchers have developed a simple blood test to estimate the risk of developing active tuberculosis. The test measures the activity of pairs of genes involved in the inflammatory response. Researchers analysed the health status of around 4,500 African people living with a tuberculosis patient. The international team hopes to commercially develop the test to avoid treating people at low risk.

headlines: Rats 68% better at spotting TB than FDA-approved test: Study
text: A Tanzania-based study found that rats can sniff out tuberculosis 68% better than the standard swab test, approved by the US health agency FDA. The researchers trained the rats with odour of tuberculosis-infected mucous, who then identified 57 additional cases of TB among 982 children. On confirming the results by a WHO researcher, the additional patients were treated as well.

headlines: 56 cows die after feeding on pesticides in Andhra village
text: At least 56 cows died on Monday after allegedly feeding on pesticides dumped at a field in Andhra Pradesh's Daida village. The autopsy reports revealed that there was cyanide content in the cows' internal organs. "The poison (cyanide) takes just 15 to 20 minutes to work. It reduces the oxygen-carrying capacity of the animal," a doctor said.

headlines: Britons seeking EU citizenship doubled in Brexit year
text: The number of UK nationals seeking citizenship in another EU member state more than doubled in 2016, according to a European statistical agency. In the Brexit year, 6,555 Britons acquired citizenship in another of the bloc's nations, up 165% from 2,478 in 2015. Around 13 lakh people born in the UK live in other EU countries, according to UN estimates.

headlines: Ex-spy's daughter discharged from hospital after poisoning
text: Daughter of former Russian spy Sergei Skripal, Yulia, has been discharged from a UK hospital more than a month after being poisoned with a nerve agent along with her father. She has been taken to a secure location following her discharge. The UK had accused Russia for the attack which took place in Salisbury, UK.

headlines: Chinese hotel offers 'filtered air', info on PM2.5 levels
text: Chinese luxury hotel 'Cordis' claims the air inside its premises passes through two levels of filtration and is continuously cleaned, while the double-glazed windows remain closed at all times. Further, information about the air quality and PM2.5 levels is displayed on TV screens in the guest rooms. The hotel also has a glass-sided swimming pool, a spa and twin ballrooms.

headlines: Bill Cosby faces topless protester at sexual assault retrial
text: American comedian-actor Bill Cosby on Monday faced a topless protester at his retrial for alleged sexual assault. A former Cosby Show actress, Nicolle Rochelle, confronted him with 'Womenâs Lives Matter' and other phrases written on her body. The retrial is on the accusations by Andrea Constand, a former basketball player, that Cosby had drugged and sexually assaulted her in 2004.

headlines: Salman's co-star files FIR against Bishnois over death threats
text: Salman Khan's 'Hum Saath-Saath Hain' co-star Kunickaa Sadanand has filed a police complaint against the Bishnoi community, alleging that she received death threats for supporting Salman in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case. "I was advocating that instead of punishing Salman...he should be made to do some work for the community...I said even Bishnois are hunters," said Kunickaa.

headlines: Anas 1st Indian to enter CWG 400m final since Milkha Singh
text: Muhammed Anas Yahiya has become the first Indian to qualify for the men's 400m final at the Commonwealth Games since Milkha Singh. Anas was the joint-third fastest runner to qualify for Tuesday's final with a timing of 45.44 seconds. Milkha had won gold in the 400m race (then called 440-yard race) at the British Empire and Commonwealth Games in 1958.

headlines: Shami's wife files domestic abuse case against him, 4 others
text: Indian cricketer Mohammad Shami's wife Hasin Jahan has filed a domestic violence case against the pacer and four other family members in Alipore Court. The 27-year-old cricketer's estranged wife had earlier filed a complaint against him over allegations of domestic violence and adultery. Notably, Shami had taken to Instagram two days back to wish his wife on their marriage anniversary.

headlines: WhatsApp to hire 'Head of India' for the first time
text: Facebook-owned messaging service WhatsApp is looking to hire 'Head of India', reportedly its first full time hire in the country. The executive will directly report to its COO Matthew Idema and represent its product strategy in India. The position requires a person to be a "heavy user of WhatsApps products" and have 15 years of experience in Product driven companies.

headlines: FB leak hit 63,700 NZ people after 10 users download the app
text: About 63,714 people in New Zealand may have been impacted by the Facebook data leak after only 10 users downloaded the personality quiz app which caused the data scandal, the social media giant has revealed. New Zealand's privacy commissioner said he was seeking further information but added that no reports of its impact on 2017 elections have surfaced to date.

headlines: Vote for anyone but BJP: Andhra Dy CM to K'taka Telugu voters
text: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister KE Krishna Murthy on Monday said that Telugu speakers in Karnataka and Tamil Nadu should "vote for anybody but BJP" because PM Narendra Modi denied special status to Andhra Pradesh. Speaking at a press conference in Bengaluru, Murthy also accused PM Narendra Modi of 'cheating' the Telugu people.

headlines: Sulphites in lakes likely helped start life on Earth: Study
text: An MIT study has suggested large concentrations of sulphites and bisulphites in shallow lakes may have set the stage for Earth's first biological molecules. Researchers said the sulphur-based anions released by volcanoes around 3.9 billion years ago would have sped up the chemical reactions required to convert very simple prebiotic molecules into RNA, a genetic building block of life.

headlines: What is the 'Einstein ring', captured by NASA telescope?
text: NASA's Hubble space telescope recently captured a circle of light, called the "Einstein ring", which occurs when light coming from a background galaxy is distorted around a massive cluster making it seem that the galaxy is in multiple places at once. The phenomena of galaxies bending starlight by their strong gravitational force was predicted by Albert Einstein in 1915.

headlines: Don't politicise sealing of illegal structures in Delhi: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Monday asked the Centre and the Delhi government to not make the sealing of illegal structures in the national capital a political issue. Further, asserting that the residents' health was more important than profits, the court asked authorities to proceed holistically and look into fire safety and depletion of groundwater while dealing with unauthorised constructions.

headlines: 'Swachhagrahis' built 8 lakh toilets in Bihar in a week: PM
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday congratulated 'Swachhagrahis' for building 8.5 lakh toilets in Bihar in the last one week. Speaking during the anniversary celebrations of Mahatma Gandhi's Satyagraha in Champaran, PM Narendra Modi added, "With the construction of toilet, women are getting respect, safety and health."

headlines: Police need guidelines to handle rescued pregnant minors: HC
text: Bombay High Court has observed that there must be instructions for police as to what they should do if they rescue pregnant minors. The court was hearing a 14-year-old rape survivor's plea seeking to terminate her 24-week-long pregnancy. The court's observation came after it was revealed that police found out about the girl's pregnancy in March but didn't inform anyone.

headlines: 2 jawans martyred in ceasefire violation by Pak along LoC
text: At least two Indian Army jawans were martyred in ceasefire violation by Pakistan army in Jammu and Kashmir's Sunderbani sector along the Line of Control on Monday. "Pakistan Army initiated unprovoked and indiscriminate firing of small arms, automatics and mortars from 1715 hours," a defence spokesman said. Both the jawans hailed from Jammu and Kashmir.

headlines: Russia's hands covered in blood of Syrian children: US
text: US Ambassador Nikki Haley slammed Russia on Monday in a United Nations Security Council meeting on the alleged Syria chemical attack, saying its hands are "covered in the blood of Syrian children". Urging the UNSC to act, Haley added that "the world must see justice done". This comes after Trump vowed to respond to Syria gas attack within 48 hours.

headlines: Trump slams 'disgraceful' FBI raid on his lawyer's office
text: After the FBI raided the office of Donald Trump's lawyer Michael Cohen, the US President condemned the raid as "disgraceful". Defending Cohen as a "good man", Trump said FBI agents "broke into" the lawyer's office. The FBI seized documents on various issues including a payment to pornstar Stormy Daniels for her silence over an alleged sexual affair with Trump.

headlines: Pakistan starts Polio eradication drive amid Taliban threat
text: Pakistan has launched a nationwide polio eradication drive amid threats from Taliban, which has undermined the efforts to eradicate the disease. The militant group killed 15 people outside a polio vaccination centre in 2016 and a mother-daughter vaccination team in January this year. Notably, Pakistan is one of only three countries in the world that suffers from endemic polio.

headlines: Dinosaur skeletons to be auctioned in Paris
text: The skeletons of two dinosaurs will be auctioned in Paris this week. The smaller skeleton is 3.8 metres long and is expected to fetch up to â¬650,000 (â¹5.2 crore), while the larger one is 12 metres long and has a guide price of up to â¬500,000 (â¹4 crore). "Dinosaurs have become cool, trendy, real objects of decoration," said an expert.

headlines: Still waiting to see if IndiGo bids for Air India: Govt
text: Civil Aviation Secretary RN Choubey has said the government will still want to see if IndiGo bids for Air India. This comes after IndiGo announced its decision not to bid for the carrier as its primary interest in acquiring Air India's international operations wasn't available under the disinvestment plan. Choubey added Air India's operations wouldn't be split in bidding process.

headlines: Jet Airways rules out bid for Air India
text: Jet Airways has opted out of Air India bid less than two weeks after the government asked bidders to send expressions of interest. The carrier's Deputy CEO Amit Agarwal said the decision was taken considering the offer's terms. Notably, the announcement comes days after IndiGo said it did not want to buy Air India's domestic and international networks together.

headlines: Cyclist denied entry to CWG race as team forgets to tick box
text: English cyclist Melissa Lowther was denied participation in the Commonwealth Games' women's individual time trial on Tuesday as the English contingent's officials forgot to tick a box on her entry form. "While Team England have apologised, I'm still gutted not to have the opportunity to represent my country after all the hard miles I have put in", Melissa later said.

headlines: Racer starts race 50 metres ahead after rivals get punished
text: Australian motorcycle racer Jack Miller started the Argentina MotoGP qualifying 50 metres ahead of his rivals. Miller opted for slick tyres on a track which was drying after rain while his rivals had wet weather tyres. The rivals were punished and asked to start the race three rows behind Miller for changing to slick tyres so late.

headlines: Google appeals against India's 'search bias' verdict: Report
text: Technology giant Google has appealed against Indian competition watchdog's judgement that found the company guilty of 'search bias', according to reports. In February, the watchdog imposed a fine of â¹135.86 crore on Google over the same issue. Google was abusing its dominance in online web search and online search advertising markets, the watchdog had earlier said.

headlines: Video: Passengers swat mosquitoes on Jet Airways flight
text: A video shows passengers swatting mosquitoes on a Jet Airways flight at the Lucknow airport. The video, taken on Sunday, shows passengers using newspapers and safety advisory pamphlets to avoid the mosquitoes. Jet Airways took cognisance of the video, and said, "We have taken this up with our cabin appearance team for review. We sincerely regret the inconvenience."

headlines: Protesting lawyers shave their heads in Madhya Pradesh
text: Lawyers in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Monday shaved their heads in protest, demanding the implementation of the Advocates Protection Act. Advocates across the state started the week-long protest despite the High Court Registrar's statement urging them to call it off. In 2012, the state government said the act would be implemented but it hasn't come into effect yet.

headlines: PIL filed in SC for CBI probe into rape case against BJP MLA
text: A PIL has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking a CBI probe into the rape case against BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar. The petitioner has also sought compensation and protection to the family of the victim. This comes after the rape victim's father on Monday died after being allegedly beaten by the MLA's brother in judicial custody.

headlines: WhatsApp shares users' payments information with Facebook
text: Instant messaging service WhatsApp's privacy policy mentions that it shares information collected under its Payments Privacy Policy with third-party service providers including Facebook. The data shared includes users' phone numbers, payment amount, and registration information. Notably, WhatsApp is testing its digital payments service via UPI platform in India since February this year.

headlines: PM Modi launches India's 1st all-electric high-speed train
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday flagged off India's first all-electric high-speed locomotive in Bihar. The first big Make-in-India project completed by France's Alstom, the train has the country's most powerful engine with 12,000 horsepower and a maximum speed of 120 km per hour. The average cost of one high-speed locomotive is around â¹25 crore.

headlines: Firm accused of FB data leak lists 10 'facts' denying claims
text: British data firm Cambridge Analytica, accused of illegally obtaining the personal data of millions of Facebook users, has listed 10 'facts' denying multiple allegations. Claiming that it hasn't broken any laws and didn't "hack" Facebook, the company said it did not use the data to influence the US Presidential Election and added that the claims are "simply untrue".

headlines: We should not kill Facebook over ongoing problems: Jack Ma
text: Talking about Facebook's data scandal and #deletefacebook campaign, Alibaba Founder Jack Ma has said, "We should not kill the company because of these problems." Adding that it is time to fix the problems, Ma said it is also "the time for the CEO to really take it seriously." The most important solution is that Facebook respects privacy, Ma added.

headlines: IndiGo offloads doctor after he complains about mosquitoes
text: A Bengaluru-based cardiologist was offloaded from an IndiGo flight at Lucknow airport after he complained about mosquitoes. Dr Saurabh Rai claimed he was threatened and called a terrorist, while an air hostess said there were mosquitoes all over India. IndiGo said the passenger was unruly and had tried instigating other passengers to damage the aircraft while using words like 'hijack'.

headlines: UP Police announces SIT probe against rape-accused BJP MLA
text: Uttar Pradesh Police announced that a Special Investigation Team has been formed to probe incidents related to a rape case filed against BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar from Unnao. "Investigation is being done and action will definitely be taken," police said. This comes after the rape victim's father died after allegedly being beaten up in police custody by the MLA's brother.

headlines: Antarctica losing ice despite rise in snowfall: Study
text: A study led by British Antarctic Survey has revealed a 10% increase in snowfall over the last 200 years. However, when the ice loss is not replenished by snowfall, the sea level rises, said researchers, who analysed 79 ice cores from across Antarctica to reconstruct the frozen continent's climate history.

headlines: Gujarat cops kidnap builder, extort Bitcoins worth â¹12 crore
text: Gujarat Police's Criminal Investigation Department has filed an FIR against nine policemen in the state for allegedly kidnapping and extorting 200 Bitcoins worth over â¹12 crore from a Surat-based builder. "[They] threatened to kill me in a fake encounter if I didn't hand over my Bitcoins," the builder said. Meanwhile, three cops have been arrested while an inspector is absconding.

headlines: Saffron Ambedkar statue repainted blue by BSP leader
text: A saffron coloured statue of BR Ambedkar in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun was repainted blue by BSP leader Himendra Gautam. The Uttar Pradesh government had installed the saffron statue a few days ago to replace one which was vandalised some time back. "Everyone knows Ambedkar wore a blue suit," BSP leader Sudhindra Bhadoria had said.

headlines: Uttar Pradesh madrasa teaches Sanskrit among other subjects
text: A madrasa in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur is teaching students Sanskrit in addition to languages like Hindi, English, Arabic and Urdu. The principal of the madrasa said, "Sanskrit is now being taught to all students above Class 5. The parents of the students are also very happy and have never raised any objection to this".

headlines: UP government to withdraw rape case against BJP leader
text: The Uttar Pradesh government has decided to withdraw a seven-year-old rape case against BJP leader and former Union Minister Swami Chinmayanand. Chinmayanand had been booked for allegedly abducting and raping a woman in an ashram, and threatening her against complaining. However, no reason has been provided by the state government for withdrawing the complaint.

headlines: FBI raids Trump lawyer's offices, seizes Stormy Daniels docs
text: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) on Monday raided US President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Michael Cohen's offices. The authorities seized documents on various issues including the payment of $130,000 by Cohen to pornstar Stormy Daniels for her silence over her alleged love affair with Trump. Slamming the move as a "disgraceful situation", Trump called it "new level of unfairness".

headlines: China warns against returning to Cold War mentality
text: China's President Xi Jinping has warned against a 'Cold War mentality' and vowed to open up parts of the country's economy amid rising tensions with the US. "The trend of peace is moving forward and a Cold War mentality is outdated," Xi said. This comes a day after US President Donald Trump spoke against Chinese tariffs on car imports.

headlines: Man eats world's hottest chilli pepper, ends up in hospital
text: A competitive eater who participated in a chilli eating contest had to be taken to the hospital after he developed a pain in his neck that turned into a series of thunderclap headaches, it emerged recently. He had eaten a Carolina Reaper pepper, which was the hottest chilli pepper in the world when the incident occurred in 2016.

headlines: Nirav Modi fraud is PNB's issue, won't seek govt support: MD
text: PNB's Managing Director Sunil Mehta has said the bank won't seek government's assistance to tackle the Nirav Modi fraud. "We said this is problem of the bank and we will solve it (ourselves)," he said, adding that the bank has enough resources and capability to do so. PNB has mobilised roughly â¹12,000 crore after September 2017, Mehta further said.

headlines: Kapil's ex Preeti drove him into depression: Firangi maker
text: Rajiev Dhingra, the director of Kapil Sharma starrer 'Firangi' has said that Kapil's ex-girlfriend Preeti Simoes is responsible for driving him into depression. "As soon as she learnt that he was marrying his girlfriend Ginni (Chatrath), she vowed to destroy him," he added. Rajiev further said, "She threatened me saying...she will get [Kapil and me] thrown out of the industry."

headlines: Ranveer Singh to get Dadasaheb Phalke Excellence Award
text: Ranveer Singh will be honoured with the Dadasaheb Phalke Excellence Award in the Best Actor category for his work in 'Padmaavat'. The awards, which were established by the Dadasaheb Phalke Film Foundation, recognise contributions to Indian cinema. Apart from Ranveer, Anushka Sharma will also be awarded the Dadasaheb Phalke Excellence Award for her contribution to films as a producer.

headlines: Drinking is not an excuse for Kapil's behaviour: Upasana
text: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' actress Upasana Singh, while speaking about the row between Kapil and editor Vickey Lalwani, said, "He drinks but that isn't an excuse for such behaviour." "Kapil has been mentally disturbed...In such a condition people make mistakes," she added. Upasana further said she is "shocked" by Kapil's language in the audio tape of his conversation with Lalwani.

headlines: Floyd Mayweather's bodyguard shot outside Atlanta hotel
text: Former boxing world champion Floyd Mayweather's bodyguard was reportedly shot in the leg outside an Atlanta hotel where the boxing champ was staying. The attack, which was conducted by a gunman riding inside a white SUV, is believed to have been directed towards Mayweather. The police said that the bodyguard was undergoing treatment and was in a stable condition.

headlines: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg says he is not resigning
text: Ahead of his testimony regarding the recent data scandal at Facebook, the company's CEO Mark Zuckerberg has said that he would not consider resigning from his position. "I'm very confident that we're gonna be able to work through these issues," Zuckerberg said. Earlier, Zuckerberg had said that he is still the best person to lead Facebook.

headlines: Uber buys bike sharing startup Jump Bikes for $200 million
text: Uber on Monday announced it has acquired US-based dockless bike-sharing startup Jump Bikes for a reported amount of $200 million. As a part of the deal, Jump's team will join the cab-hailing company, however, the startup will carry on as an independent subsidiary. Founded in 2010, Jump Bikes allows users to hire bikes for $2 per 30 minutes.

headlines: Exact energy of neutrino-atom collision found for first time
text: In a first, scientists at US-based Fermilab were able to identify the exact energy of muon neutrinos hitting the atoms at the heart of their particle detector. Such particle interactions reveal information about the subatomic forces that bind the nucleus together. However, neutrino interactions are difficult to detect since they have no electric charge.

headlines: What is the fast-melting 'Dark Zone' in Greenland?
text: Scientists have identified a 'Dark Zone' in the Greenland ice sheet's western part, which is melting up to five times faster than surrounding ice due to contamination with algae, dust and soot from wildfires. The zone measures 400 km in length and spans 100 km at its widest part. Researchers fear the zone is contributing to global sea level rise.

headlines: Stamping of hand baggage to continue at Amritsar airport
text: Passengers at Amritsar airport will continue to have their hand baggage tags stamped due to the sensitive security status of the airport, a CISF official has said. The decision was taken considering the airport's proximity to the Pakistan border and the two hijacking incidents in 1999 and 1982. The practice of stamping hand baggage has been stopped at 31 airports.

headlines: Donât meddle with countryâs security issues: Centre to SC
text: Calling infiltration from borders a major source of terrorism, the Centre told the Supreme Court that the court cannot issue an order directing the government to ensure entry of foreigners in India. It further said that national security is an executive function. The court was hearing a plea against the Centre's decision to deport Rohingya Muslims to Myanmar.

headlines: T'gana junior colleges told not to hold classes in vacations
text: Private junior colleges in Telangana have been told by the Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education that strict action would be taken against them for holding classes during summer vacations. Classes should be held only for students appearing for competitive exams or to clear their doubts, officials said. Last week, 12 junior colleges were sent notices for conducting extra classes.

headlines: Nursery student thrashed by teacher over delay in paying fee
text: A nursery student was allegedly beaten up by a teacher over delay in payment of school fees in Telangana's Ranga Reddy district. The school administration reportedly hasn't issued any statement regarding the incident. The incident comes months after a teacher at another school in the state was caught on camera thrashing students over alleged non-payment of fee.

headlines: Heena Sidhu sets CWG record to win gold in women's 25m pistol
text: Indian shooter Heena Sidhu set Commonwealth Games record to win gold in women's 25m pistol shooting event on Tuesday. This was Sidhu's second medal at CWG 2018, after winning silver in women's 10m air pistol. Another Indian shooter Annu Singh came sixth in the same event. With this result, India have won three golds and overall eight medals in shooting.

headlines: Not responsible for any untoward incident: TN leader to CSK
text: TVK leader Velmurugan warned Chennai Super Kings ahead of their IPL match, saying, "If there's even a small untoward incident...those protesting for Cauvery rights are in no way related." Earlier, Velmurugan threatened that if IPL is conducted in Tamil Nadu, people will protest inside the stadium. State parties are protesting against the Centre's delay in setting up Cauvery Management Board.

headlines: I started Facebook, I run it, Iâm responsible: Zuckerberg
text: Ahead of his testimony over data scandal, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has said, "I started Facebook, I run it, and I'm responsible for what happens here." "We didn't take a broad enough view of our responsibility, and that was a big mistake. It was my mistake, and I'm sorry", he reiterated and added that "it's clear" Facebook didn't do enough.

headlines: FB CEO trained by Bush's ex-assistant for testimony: Report
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is being trained by a former special assistant who served under ex-US President George Bush on how he should answer queries during his testimony on Wednesday, as per reports. The goal is to make Zuckerberg appear as humble as possible and not seem overly defensive. Zuckerberg will testify before the US Congress regarding the data scandal.

headlines: Atlanta airport named world's busiest, Delhi airport 16th
text: US' Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport was ranked the world's busiest airport, with nearly 104 million flyers in 2017, by Airports Council International. The Beijing Capital International Airport and Dubai International Airport were placed second and third respectively. The Delhi airport jumped from 22nd rank in 2016 to 16th rank, as passenger traffic grew by 14.1% to 63.45 million.

headlines: Human eyebrows helped communicate, outlast ancestors: Study
text: A UK-based study has claimed the evolution of eyebrows in modern humans helped them communicate better and outlast their ancestral species. Researchers said mobile eyebrows allowed for expressing a wide number of emotions, thereby aiding in cooperation and survival. Human ancestors had gigantic brow ridges while modern humans evolved flatter foreheads, giving more mobility to eyebrows.

headlines: Right to wed person of choice integral to right to life: SC
text: Setting aside Kerala High Court's order that annulled Hadiya's marriage, the Supreme Court stated, "Right to marry a person of one's choice is integral to Article 21 (right to life and liberty) of the Constitution." Adding that social values are not above constitutionally guaranteed freedom, the court observed, "Society has no role to play in determining our choice of partners."

headlines: SC judges appointed only on impression: Justice Chelameswar
text: Supreme Court judge Justice J Chelameswar on Monday alleged that the appointment of judges to the apex court is done on the basis of impression rather than their performance. He further said that those responsible for the selection process must put assessment on record, as that will lead to a solution for most of the problems.

headlines: Judiciary is watchdog that barks to save democracy: SC judge
text: Senior Supreme Court judge Justice Kurian Joseph on Monday said judiciary and media are watchdogs that have to be vigilant, "barking for saving democracy, barking for when the owner's property is in danger." Adding that the "barking" is to alert the owner, he stated, "[If] the threat continues, barking dogs will be left with no option but to bite."

headlines: Section 144 imposed at various places ahead of Bharat Bandh
text: Section 144 has been imposed in Rajasthan's Jaipur and Bharatpur, Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, and Uttarakhand's Nainital ahead of the Bharat Bandh on Tuesday. The Bharat Bandh has been called by some groups to protest against the caste-based reservation system. The move comes after a Bharat Bandh held by some Dalit outfits last week turned violent, killing at least 10 people.

headlines: Woman assaulted by drunk men for going out with male friend
text: A group of drunk men allegedly assaulted a woman in Assam's Goalpara for going out with a male friend after her marriage was fixed with someone else. A video of the incident shows the accused slapping, kicking, and pulling the woman's hair. "This is a case of moral policing," Goalpara SP Amitava Sinha said.

headlines: CBSE Class 10 student got old maths paper, HC orders retest
text: The Kerala High Court on Monday ordered the CBSE to conduct a re-test for a Class 10 student who claims that she got a two-year-old Mathematics paper in her examination. The girl had alerted the school authorities about the error but attempted the paper after being told to. The school authorities later informed CBSE, which failed to take any action.

headlines: BJP MLA's brother arrested over rape victim's father's death
text: The brother of rape-accused BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar from UP's Unnao has been arrested for allegedly beating the woman's father in jail. The father had passed away after being admitted to a hospital over complaints of abdominal pain. He had been arrested along with his daughter, who tried to kill herself to protest police inaction over the rape complaint.

headlines: Prince Harry asks wedding guests to donate to Mumbai NGO
text: UK's Prince Harry and fiancÃ©e Meghan Markle have asked for donations to charities instead of wedding gifts when they get married next month. Mumbai's Myna Mahila Foundation, a charity for women, is one of the seven charities chosen by the couple. Markle had written about the charity in the TIME magazine after her visit to Mumbai last year.

headlines: Kim Jong-un makes first official mention of US-N Korea talks
text: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has made first official mention of talks with the US at a party meeting while discussing the prospect of the dialogue, North Korea's state media reported. He also discussed strategic and tactical issues to be maintained by the party. Trump and Jong-un are expected to meet for the first time by May this year.

headlines: Nawazuddin approached for Rajinikanth's film: Reports
text: According to reports, actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has been approached to play the antagonist in Rajinikanth's upcoming Tamil film, written and directed by Karthik Subbaraj. The film will be produced by Sun Pictures and Anirudh Ravichander will compose the music. Earlier, Karthik had expressed his wish to work with Nawazuddin after watching his performance in 'Raman Raghav 2.0'.

headlines: Social media trolls are like cockroaches: Twinkle Khanna
text: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna, while speaking about online trolls, said they are like "cockroaches". "Once in a while, you spray hit on them and get them out of the way and you go on," she added. Twinkle further said, "They come along and they [target] everybody and people who take trolls seriously, I'd rather say they are foolish."

headlines: People should forgive Kapil and let him be: Krushna Abhishek
text: Comedian Krushna Abhishek, while speaking on the row between Kapil Sharma and SpotboyE editor Vickey Lalwani, said, "People should forgive Kapil and let him be." Krushna added, "His film 'Firangi' didn't work, he has lost...money plus his [new] show didn't work." Slamming Lalwani, Krushna further said, "It's wrong to harass and write negatively about a guy who's dealing with depression."

headlines: Indian boxer Amit assured of medal after reaching CWG semis
text: India was assured of another boxing medal after boxer Amit Panghal beat Scotland's Aqeel Ahmed to enter the semifinal of the men's 46-49kg boxing event at the Commonwealth Games 2018 in Australia on Tuesday. Apart from Amit, four other Indian boxers are also competing in the quarterfinal stages of various categories at the event.

headlines: Team gold more special than individual gold: Saina Nehwal
text: After India won the badminton mixed team gold for the first time in Commonwealth Games history, Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal said that for her the team gold is more 'cherishable' than an individual gold. "I actually lost focus during the match but thankfully managed to hold it together," Saina said about her match that won India the gold.

headlines: Robots not taking over world: India's disarmament Ambassador
text: Speaking about autonomous weapons, India's disarmament Ambassador Amandeep Gill has said, "Robots aren't taking over the world. Humans are still in charge." He added, "I think we have to be careful in not emotionalising or dramatising this issue." Technology leaders including Elon Musk have raised concerns over autonomous weapons citing that they can be "weapons of terror".

headlines: Ambani may buy majority stake in edtech startup for â¹100 cr
text: Mukesh Ambani is close to acquiring a majority stake in Mumbai-based edtech startup Embibe via his family office for â¹100 crore, according to reports. The potential investment will mark the complete exit for promoters as well as current investors. Founded in 2012, the startup helps students develop their educational standards through personalised feedback.

headlines: Mumbai blockchain startup Elemential raises funds
text: Mumbai-based blockchain startup Elemential has raised an undisclosed amount in a funding round led by Matrix Partners India. The funding round also saw participation from Digital Currency Group, Hinduja Group, and Lightspeed India. Founded in 2015, the startup is building a blockchain development ecosystem and is something like a "Wordpress for companies looking to build blockchain network".

headlines: 205-million-year-old bone of prehistoric reptile discovered
text: A group of international palaeontologists have identified a 205-million-year-old jaw bone of a prehistoric reptile, said to be "one of the largest animals ever". Based on the fossil, researchers estimate the ichthyosaur was at least 20-25 metres long. The discovery also solved a 150-year-old mystery, when ichthyosaur fossils were misinterpreted as dinosaur bones.

headlines: India advises emigrants against fishing jobs in the Gulf
text: The External Affairs Ministry has released a special advisory asking Indian migrants not to take up fishing jobs on trawlers or vessels leaving from Saudi Arabia, UAE and Bahrain and moving towards Iran. This comes after several Indian fishermen were arrested for venturing into Iranian waters. Protector of Emigrants offices have been told not to process any such applications.

headlines: 18 killed as truck hits barricade on highway in Maharashtra
text: At least 18 people have died and 14 injured after a truck they were travelling in hit a barricade on Pune-Satara highway in Maharashtra on Tuesday. Police suspect that the truck driver lost control over the vehicle along a slope, following which it fell around 8-10 feet off the road. The injured have been admitted to a Khandala hospital.

headlines: My father says I make less money than my popularity: Ranveer
text: Ranveer Singh has revealed his father Jagjit Singh Bhavnani keeps complaining that he makes less money as per his popularity. He said he wants to make more money while adding, "more than making money for myself, I want Hindi films to make more money." Ranveer further said, "There's no reason why our films shouldn't be doing as well as China's."

headlines: Saudi Arabia to make Cannes Film Festival debut
text: The Saudi Film Council has announced that it will participate in the 71st annual Cannes Film Festival from May 8 to 19. The council, which was formed last month, said nine short films by young Saudi filmmakers will be screened at Cannes' Short Film Corner. Saudi Arabia recently announced the opening date of its first cinema in 35 years.

headlines: Trailer of Alia Bhatt starrer 'Raazi' released
text: The official trailer of Alia Bhatt and Vicky Kaushal starrer 'Raazi' has been released. Based on the book 'Calling Sehmat: A Novel' by Harinder S Sikka, the film revolves around a Kashmiri girl who marries a Pakistani army officer, portrayed by Vicky. Directed by Meghna Gulzar, 'Raazi' is scheduled to release on May 11.

headlines: India most successful among 35 weightlifting nations at CWG
text: With five golds, India was the most successful among 35 countries and territories which participated in weightlifting at the Commonwealth Games 2018. India bagged a total of nine weightlifting medals including two silver and two bronze medals. This was the second time India finished as the best nation in weightlifting at Commonwealth Games, with the last time being in 1990.

headlines: Apple now globally powered by 100% renewable energy
text: Apple has announced its global facilities are now powered by 100% clean energy, including data centers, offices and retail stores in 43 countries. "After years of hard work we're proud to have reached this significant milestone," the company's CEO Tim Cook said. The firm currently has 25 operational renewable energy projects globally, totaling 626 megawatts of generation capacity, Apple said.

headlines: PM should grant special status to Bihar as promised: JD(U)
text: Janata Dal (United) General Secretary Shyam Rajak on Monday said PM Narendra Modi should grant special status to Bihar as promised when he visits the state on Tuesday. This comes amid Andhra Pradesh's protest demanding special category status. Last month, JD(U) chief and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said he hadn't given up the special status demand for "even one second".

headlines: 'Saffron' statue of BR Ambedkar installed in UP village
text: The district administration in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun village has installed a saffron-coloured statue of BR Ambedkar to replace one that was vandalised earlier. Slamming the new statue, Samajwadi Party spokesperson Sunil Singh Sajan accused the state BJP government of playing "politics of colour". Earlier, the UP government had added 'Ramji' as Ambedkar's middle name in all official documents.

headlines: Rape claims against me a ploy by lower class people: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Kuldeep Sengar has said an 18-year-old woman's rape allegation against him was a "ploy by people of lower classes" to tarnish his image. The woman and her family had attempted suicide outside CM Yogi Adityanath's residence against police inaction, following which her father was arrested. He was allegedly beaten up in custody and later died at a hospital.

headlines: Andhra man grows 18 varieties of mango on a single tree
text: Kuppala Rama Gopala Krishna in Andhra Pradesh has grown 18 varieties of mango on a single tree by joining tissues from different plants. District officials called it a "feat", stating that only two-three varieties are normally grown together. Uttar Pradesh's Haji Kaleem Ullah Khan, dubbed 'Mango Man of India', grew over 300 varieties on one tree.

headlines: 58-yr-old lady uses ladder, saves 20 workers trapped in fire
text: A 58-year-old woman saved the lives of around 20 workers who were trapped inside a burning four-storey footwear factory in Delhi on Monday morning. The woman, Jyoti Verma, used a small bamboo ladder as a makeshift overbridge between the factory and terrace of the building where she lives. However, four people, including two minor boys, were killed in the fire.

headlines: â¹639-cr deal signed for 1.86L bullet proof jackets for Army
text: The Defence Ministry has signed a â¹639-crore contract with Indian defence manufacturer SMPP to procure over 1.86 lakh bullet proof jackets for Army jawans. The lightest material will be used in the jackets to provide ballistic protection, SMPP chief SC Kansal said. The deal will provide confidence that Indian firms can fulfil requirements of the forces, the ministry said.

headlines: Ensure security for Bharat Bandh on Apr 10: Centre to states
text: The Home Ministry has issued an advisory to states to ensure adequate security measures after certain groups gave a call for Bharat Bandh on April 10 to protest caste-based reservation. District magistrates and police superintendents will be personally held responsible for violence in their jurisdiction, the ministry added. Twelve people had died in violence during Bharat Bandh on April 2.

headlines: Will respond to Syria gas attack within 48 hours: Trump
text: Condemning the "heinous" suspected chemical attack in Syria's Douma, US President Donald Trump on Monday said he will make a decision on the US response within 24 to 48 hours. Adding that there was "not much doubt" about who was behind the attack, Trump said, "We cannot allow atrocities like that." Earlier, Trump called Syrian President Bashar al-Assad an "animal".

headlines: Axis Bank CEO Shikha Sharma to step down on December 31
text: Axis Bank CEO and MD Shikha Sharma has sought approval from the bank's board to step down at the end of 2018. In December last year, the bank had decided to reappoint Sharma for a fourth 3-year term starting June 2018. The bank's board has accepted her request, subject to Reserve Bank of India's approval.

headlines: Shilpa Shinde slams journalist who Kapil abused in a call
text: Bigg Boss 11 winner Shilpa Shinde slammed SpotboyE editor Vickey Lalwani, who was abused by Kapil Sharma, while writing, "Every artist knows Vickey... kitne torture karke sawal karte hai. Request to all artists, please share your experience." She added abusing someone is incorrect but for a talented artist like Kapil to hurl abuses, he must be in a bad situation.

headlines: Struggled mid-career, was treated like glamour doll: Shilpa
text: Shilpa Shetty has said she didn't have to struggle to land films but it started mid-way towards her career, adding, "People started typecasting me in just glamorous roles...we were just like glamour dolls." She further said, "I have seen it all...the highs and the lows. But I never gave up." Notably, Shilpa Shetty completed 25 years in Bollywood this year.

headlines: Proud as son wins his first medal for India: R Madhavan
text: Actor R Madhavan has said that he and his wife Sarita Madhavan are proud of their 13-year-old son Vedaant, who won a medal for India at an international swimming competition held in Thailand. He added, "Thank you for all your blessings." He shared a picture of Vedaant, who stood third in the competition, with his bronze medal and certificate.

headlines: Jacqueline not in 'Housefull 4' due to Sajid Khan: Reports
text: As per reports, Jacqueline Fernandez will not star in the upcoming film 'Housefull 4' as its director Sajid Khan said that he is personally and professionally incompatible with the actress. The film's producer Sajid Nadiadwala was reportedly asked to choose between keeping Jacqueline or Sajid in the film. Jacqueline was a part of the previous three films in 'Housefull' franchise.

headlines: RCB fans misinterpret England cricketer's tweet, abuse him
text: RCB fans hit out at England cricketer Ben Duckett on social media after misinterpreting his tweet, wherein he had called the team as a "joke". "You're the joke dude. Grow up and respect the greats, because you'll never be one," wrote a fan. Later, Duckett shared a screenshot of hate messages he received and explained he was praising RCB.

headlines: India beat Malaysia 2-1 to reach Commonwealth semifinals
text: The Indian men's hockey team beat Malaysia 2-1 to reach the semifinal stage at the Commonwealth Games 2018 in Australia on Tuesday. India's Harmanpreet Singh scored both goals, one in the first quarter and then added another in the third quarter. India are set to face England in their final pool match on Wednesday.

headlines: Dhawan hits 77* after getting dropped on 0 as SRH defeat RR
text: SunRisers Hyderabad opener Shikhar Dhawan scored 77*(57) after getting dropped on 0 to help his team chase down Rajasthan Royals' 125 in the IPL on Monday. Dhawan was dropped by Rajasthan Royals captain Ajinkya Rahane at slips in the first over of the chase. Notably, Rajasthan Royals were playing their first IPL match after serving a two-year suspension.

headlines: Irfan asks his brother Yusuf to hit 50 off 13 balls in IPL
text: After KXIP's Lokesh Rahul slammed the fastest-ever IPL 50 off 14 balls on Sunday, Indian all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Twitter and asked his brother SRH's Yusuf Pathan to try hitting a 13-ball fifty. "Tere liye 13-ball me bhi 50 bana neka try karenge Insha Allah bhai," Yusuf tweeted. Rahul had broken Yusuf and Sunil Narine's 15-ball joint-record.

headlines: Dalits most safe, secure under PM Modi's govt: Rajnath Singh
text: Home Minister Rajnath Singh has said the Dalit community is "most safe and secure" under the PM Narendra Modi-led government. "The Opposition has no issue so they are trying to create one", he added. His remarks come after Congress President Rahul Gandhi alleged BJP is against the ideology of tribals and Dalits, adding that it wants to divide the country.

headlines: Over 24 leaders from SP, BSP join BJP in Uttar Pradesh
text: Over 24 leaders from Samajwadi Party and Bahujan Samaj Party in Uttar Pradesh have joined the BJP on Monday. This includes two former MPs, Ashok Rawat from BSP and Jai Prakash Rawat from SP, and a few local body chiefs. The former parliamentarians said they were changing parties as they were impressed by PM Narendra Modi's "development-oriented politics".

headlines: Video: Woman creates ruckus to save drunk driver from cops
text: A woman in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills area was caught on camera arguing with policemen and pelting stones at media personnel after her friend was held for drunk driving. The woman had started arguing when the police asked her friend to undergo a breathalyser test, reports said. No action has been taken against the woman so far.

headlines: Girl who alleged rape had consensual sex with lover: Police
text: Police in Assam's Lakhimpur said a 16-year-old girl who alleged she was gangraped had instead had consensual sex with her boyfriend. It added that she made up the "story of gangrape" when she was questioned by her parents on being out late at night. The minor had named two men in her complaint, following which police booked a 20-year-old man.

headlines: Guilty won't be spared: Yogi on death of rape survivor's dad
text: After the death of a rape survivor's father allegedly after being beaten in police custody, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said the guilty will not be spared. The father and daughter were arrested on Sunday after they attempted suicide outside Adityanath's residence to protest police inaction against a BJP MLA they alleged had raped her in May 2017.

headlines: World's costliest number plate put on sale for â¹132 crore
text: The world's most expensive number plate has been listed for Â£14.4 million (â¹132 crore) by UK-based businessman Afzal Kahn, the owner of Kahn Design. The 'F1' license plate is priced over 10 times the Bugatti Veyron car it is currently linked to. The plate has been owned by Kahn since 2008 when he reportedly purchased it for Â£440,000 (â¹4 crore).

headlines: 20 students killed as school bus falls into gorge in Himachal
