text: At least 20 students have been killed after a school bus fell into a 100-metre deep gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra on Monday. At least 25 others have been injured in the accident and a National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) team has been rushed to the spot. Reports said the 40-seater bus had been carrying 60 school students.

headlines: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak says he is leaving Facebook
text: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak said on Sunday he is leaving Facebook following the recent data scandal. "Users provide every detail of their life to Facebook and... Facebook makes a lot of advertising money off this," he said. "Apple makes money off of good products, not off of you," he added and further emphasised that "with Facebook, you are the product."

headlines: Would like my son AbRam to play field hockey for India: SRK
text: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has said that he would like his youngest child AbRam to play field hockey for India. He added that his four-year-old son has started playing a little bit of football. SRK, who was in Kolkata for his team Kolkata Knight Rider's IPL match against Royal Challengers Bangalore, further said, "He's not yet started playing cricket."

headlines: Producer's son forced me to have sex in studio: Actress
text: Actress Sri Reddy has alleged that a top Telugu film producer's son forced her to have sex in the studio. She further said, "Studios are the safest place to use for sex. Big directors, producers and heroes use studios as brothels. It's like a red-light area." She also claimed directors and heroes forced actresses to sleep with producers and politicians.

headlines: I have stage 1 cancer, will be 100% perfect in 6 months: KRK
text: Kamaal R Khan (KRK) has clarified that he has been diagnosed with stage 1 stomach cancer and doctors have reassured him that he will be "100% perfect" within six months. Earlier, KRK had claimed he had been diagnosed with stage 3 stomach cancer. KRK had added, "I'll be alive for 1-2 years more."

headlines: 4 cops held after rape victim's dad beaten in police custody
text: Four policemen have been arrested and six suspended for allegedly beating up the father of a rape victim in police custody. The victim, who alleged his daughter was raped by a BJP MLA, was admitted to a hospital but passed away later. He had been arrested along with his daughter while protesting outside Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's residence.

headlines: Sexual harassment probe of judge not handled properly: Govt
text: In a letter to Chief Justice Dipak Misra, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said the judiciary did not handle the sexual harassment allegations against a Karnataka district judge properly. A probe conducted by Karnataka High Court had claimed the allegations by a female judicial officer were baseless. The district judge's name was then cleared for elevation to the High Court.

headlines: Bihar university issues admit card with womanâs bikini pic
text: Bihar's Lalit Narayan Mithila University has issued an admit card with a bikini-clad woman's picture to a final-year female student. University officials claimed the mistake was not at their end, adding that they have demanded an explanation from the agency concerned with issuing admit cards. The university had issued an admit card with Hindu deity Ganesha's picture last year.

headlines: Hundreds participate in 'Underpants Run' in Philippines
text: Hundreds of people wore tutus or loincloths, or covered themselves with body paint, to participate in the first-ever 'Underpants Run' in Philippines' capital city Manila. Several local celebrities also participated in the race, wherein participants could choose to run three, five or 10 kilometres. One of the runners said, "People were hyped... All participants were welcome."

headlines: PNB scam is just 3 days of Indian banks' interest: BSE CEO
text: Talking about the â¹13,600-crore PNB scam, BSE CEO Ashishkumar Chauhan compared the amount to the â¹10,000-crore interest India's "solid" banking sector makes in just three days. "Effectively there is nothing there. It's fearmongering," he added. These kinds of scams give banks "enough ammunition" to take more money by charging higher for loans and giving less for deposits, Chauhan further said.

headlines: Hong Kong can take decision on Nirav Modi's arrest: China
text: China on Monday said Hong Kong was free to accept India's request to arrest Nirav Modi based on local laws and judicial agreements. The External Affairs Ministry had sought provisional arrest of the jeweller by Hong Kong, which is a Special Administrative Region of China. While India has an extradition treaty with Hong Kong, there's no such agreement with China.

headlines: Who is Amit Bhardwaj, mastermind of â¹2,000 cr Bitcoin scam?
text: Amit Bhardwaj, who was arrested in Bangkok and brought back to Pune, is the alleged mastermind behind Bitcoin Ponzi schemes worth â¹2,000 crore. Bhardwaj founded crypto companies GB Miners, Amaze Miners, GainBitcoin, and CoinBank Wallet and also launched his own token called MCAP. Besides authoring books on cryptocurrency, he established India's first online retailer which used to accept Bitcoin.

headlines: My sister from another mister: Sonam on Swara's 30th birthday
text: Wishing Swara Bhasker on her 30th birthday, Sonam Kapoor wrote, "Happy happy birthday my Veere. Tere bina life bahut dull hota. My forever entertainment and my sister from another mister love you lots!" Swara and Sonam have worked together in films like 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo', 'Raanjhanaa' and will also be seen together in the upcoming film 'Veere Di Wedding'.

headlines: Solid friend circle very important in my profession: Ranbir
text: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that it is very important to have a solid friend circle especially in his profession. He added, "They keep you grounded, make you humane, and give you a reality check." Ranbir also revealed that filmmaker Ayan Mukerji is one of his closest friends while the rest of his friends date back to his school days.

headlines: Deepika is calm like a Buddhist monk: Ranveer Singh
text: Ranveer Singh has said that Deepika Padukone is calm like a Buddhist monk. Recalling how she was juggling between 'Chennai Express' and 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani' while shooting for 'Goliyon Ki Rasleela Ram-leela', he added, "I can't think of any actor in today's time doing double shifts." Ranveer further said she is  an extremely warm, genuine and kind person.

headlines: Jadhav out of IPL after helping CSK win with injured leg
text: CSK's Kedar Jadhav has been ruled out of Indian Premier League 2018 due to a hamstring injury. Jadhav had sustained the injury during the IPL opener against Mumbai Indians, where he retired hurt in the 13th over during CSK's chase and returned in the last over to score the winning runs. The 33-year-old was bought by CSK for â¹7.8 crore.

headlines: 'Fittest woman on Earth' wins CWG gold after family tragedy
text: Australian weightlifter Tia-Clair Toomey, known as the 'Fittest woman on Earth', bagged CWG gold in the 58kg category and dedicated it to her 17-year-old cousin Jade Dixson who died two weeks ago in a car accident. Toomey lifted a total of 201kg to win by just 1kg. She earned the 'Fittest woman' title after winning CrossFit Games in 2017.

headlines: VVS Laxman began and ended his ODI career with a duck
text: VVS Laxman got out for a duck in both his career's first and last ODI. Playing his third ball on his debut against Zimbabwe on April 9, 1998, Laxman was trapped leg-before-wicket by Pommie Mbangwa. Laxman played his last ODI eight years later, wherein he was caught by Graeme Smith on a Shaun Pollock delivery for a golden duck.

headlines: China firm develops â¹9,700 smart anti-snoring eye mask
text: China-based firm VVFLY Electronics has developed a smart anti-snoring eye mask called Snore Circle, priced at nearly â¹9,700. The mask which features an 80 mAh battery can detect snoring through bone conduction and reduces snoring by giving out vibrations at 36 levels. Users can also monitor and analyse their snoring and sleeping data through its Snore Circle App.

headlines: Complaint filed against YouTube for collecting data on kids
text: A coalition of child advocacy, consumer and privacy groups have filed a complaint against Google-owned YouTube for violating child protection laws by collecting personal data from kids. The group states that Google collects information on children under 13 such as location and phone numbers. "Just like Facebook, Google has focused its huge resources on generating profits," the complainants said.

headlines: Singapore Airlines named best airline in the world
text: Singapore Airlines has been named the best airline in the world in the 2018 Travellers' Choice Awards by TripAdvisor. It was followed by Air New Zealand and Emirates at second and third place respectively, while Japan Airlines and EVA Air completed the top five. Meanwhile, Southwest Airlines, Qatar Airways and Korean Air also featured in the top ten.

headlines: Things rich kids do: BJP mocks Rahul's Namma Metro selfie
text: Mocking Congress President Rahul Gandhi for taking a selfie at the ticket counter at Namma Metro in Bengaluru, the BJP has tweeted, "Things rich kids do in their rare encounter with a commoners life!" Gandhi had taken a ride from Vidhana Soudha station till MG Road station during his campaign for Karnataka Assembly elections scheduled for May 12.

headlines: Not asked to leave Cong protest: 1984 riots accused Tytler
text: Senior Congress leader Jagdish Tytler has denied media reports he was told to leave the party protest at Rajghat against Dalit atrocities over his alleged involvement in 1984 anti-Sikh riots. Tytler, who was initially seen on the stage, later walked away and sat with the party workers. Ajay Maken clarified there was "specific criteria" for those sitting on stage.

headlines: US President Trump slams 'stupid' Chinese trade policies
text: US President Donald Trump on Monday slammed China's trade policies, calling them "stupid". "When a car is sent to the US from China, there is a tariff...of 2 1/2%. When a car is sent to China from the US, there is a tariff...of 25%," he tweeted. Recently, Trump proposed tariffs on Chinese imports worth over $100 billion.

headlines: ED raids Vadodara firm, executives in â¹2,650 cr bank fraud
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Monday conducted multiple searches in connection with a money laundering case against Vadodara-based Diamond Power Infrastructure, which allegedly cheated banks of â¹2,654 crore. The company's corporate office, factories and residential premises of executives were raided. The ED is probing if the defaulted loans were laundered to create black money and illegal assets.

headlines: Swiss Aviation Consulting denies bid for Air India
text: Aviation advisory firm Swiss Aviation Consulting (SAC) on Monday denied it expressed interest in buying the debt-ridden national carrier Air India. A report quoted a senior Aviation Ministry official as saying that SAC has shown interest in buying Air India. SAC said it has not been in contact with Indian government officials or Air India representatives regarding the bidding process.

headlines: India win badminton team gold for 1st time in CWG history
text: India clinched their first-ever badminton mixed team event gold in Commonwealth Games history after defeating defending champions Malaysia 3-1 in the final at Gold Coast on Monday. India's previous best performance in mixed team event at CWG was a silver-medal finish in the 2010 edition. Saina Nehwal and Kidambi Srikanth represented India in singles' matches of the five-member team event.

headlines: India win men's TT team gold medal at CWG after 12 years
text: India defeated Nigeria 3-0 to clinch gold in the men's table tennis team event at the Commonwealth Games for the first time since 2006. With this, India joined England to bag second-most table tennis gold medals (5) at CWG. This is the first time that India have won both men's and women's TT team events at a single CWG edition.

headlines: Hefner started Playboy after being denied a $5-a-week raise
text: Playboy founder Hugh Hefner quit his job at 'Esquire' magazine after he was denied a $5-a-week raise. He then launched the Playboy magazine in December 1953 by mortgaging his furniture for a $600 bank loan. Hefner, who was born on April 9, 1926, holds a Guinness World Record for the longest career as an editor-in-chief for the same magazine.

headlines: Hugh Hefner paid $100 a year to live in Playboy Mansion
text: Playboy founder Hugh Hefner had leased the Playboy Mansion in Los Angeles from Playboy Enterprises and paid $100 a year as rent. The mansion was sold for $100 million to his neighbour Daren Metropoulos in 2016. Hefner, who purchased the mansion in 1971 for a reported $1.1 million, was born on April 9, 1926.

headlines: Instagram only had 13 employees when FB bought it for $1 bn
text: Instagram only had 13 employees when it was bought by Facebook for $1 billion in a combined cash and stock deal on April 9, 2012. Instagram had closed a $50-million round at a valuation of $500 million right before the sale. Founded in 2010 by Mike Krieger and Kevin Systrom, the app had zero revenue at the time of acquisition.

headlines: Tears of gratitude: Salman in 1st public statement post bail
text: Salman Khan, in his first public statement following his bail, wrote on social media, "Tears of gratitude. To all my loved ones who are with me and never lost hope." He further thanked them for "all the love and support". Salman spent two nights in the Jodhpur Central Jail after he was convicted in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case.

headlines: 600 Hamzas meet in Kerala in attempt to set record
text: A gathering was organised exclusively for over 600 people named Hamza in Kerala's Malappuram district on Sunday in an attempt to set a record. The youngest Hamza at the 'Njan Hamza' event was a 41-day-old baby and the oldest Hamza was an 84-year-old man. The event was organised after 78-year-old 'Lovely' Hamza realised there were several Hamzas in their neighbourhood.

headlines: Frame scheme for Cauvery distribution by May 3: SC to Centre
text: Slamming the Centre for not implementing its order regarding distribution of Cauvery water, the Supreme Court on Monday asked it to submit a draft scheme by May 3. Earlier, the Centre had asked for a three-month extension after the court's six-week deadline had expired. The court also asked Karnataka and Tamil Nadu to maintain law and order in the meantime.

headlines: Dad of woman allegedly raped by MLA dies after cops beat him
text: The father of the woman who tried to kill herself outside Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's residence to protest over a rape complaint against a BJP MLA, allegedly died after being beaten up in police custody. He had been admitted to the hospital with complaints of abdominal pain and passed away the next morning, a doctor said.

headlines: China bans exports to N Korea that could be used in weapons
text: China has imposed restrictions on exports to North Korea by banning some items that can be used in both civilian products and weapons of mass destruction. The ban covers items including particle accelerators and centrifuges. Earlier, China banned steel and other metal exports and capped the export of crude oil to North Korea.

headlines: Nuclear deal not shaken by Trump's quakes: Iran Prez Rouhani
text: Stating that US President Donald Trump has been trying to break the 2015 nuclear deal for 15 months, Iran President Hassan Rouhani said the deal is so strong that it has not been shaken by such quakes. Assuring that Iran will not violate the deal, Rouhani said, "If the US withdraws from the deal, they will surely regret it."

headlines: N Korea willing to discuss denuclearisation with US: Reports
text: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is willing to discuss denuclearisation of the Korean Peninsula with the US, according to reports quoting a US official. The North delivered its message in secret talks between its representatives and US officials, reports claimed. US President Donald Trump is expected to meet the North Korean leader for the first time next month.

headlines: UK Queen is direct descendant of Prophet Muhammad: Report
text: British Queen Elizabeth II is a direct descendant of Prophet Muhammad, according to a report published in Moroccan newspaper Al-Ousboue. The newspaper traced back 43 generations of the British Queen's family to assert the claim. "We do not make a comment on these kinds of claims," a Buckingham Palace spokesperson said.

headlines: Churchill 1st foreign national to become honorary US citizen
text: Former British Prime Minister Winston Churchill was the first foreign national to receive honorary US citizenship on April 9, 1963. An ally of US during WWII, Churchill had already been granted honorary citizenship by eight US states. The then US President John F Kennedy praised Churchill as a defender of freedom, wartime leader, orator, historian, and statesman.

headlines: Woman gets late to work, her boss' reply goes viral
text: An Imgur user has shared screenshots of his conversation with his employee after she said she would be late to work because she was taking pictures of her dog. He asked the employee to take her time and even bought her tickets to a baseball game. He later said she had been late for the first time in six years.

headlines: Controlled demolition goes wrong, silo crashes into building
text: The controlled demolition of a 53-metre-high silo in Denmark went wrong when it fell the wrong way, crashing into a building housing a music school and library. Although the building was partially damaged, there were no reports of injuries. Meanwhile, authorities are working to find out why the silo fell in the wrong direction.

headlines: Novartis buys US gene-therapy company for $8.7 billion
text: Swiss drugmaker Novartis has agreed to buy US gene-therapy company AveXis for $8.7 billion, an 88% premium to its Friday closing price. AveXis is developing a product to treat spinal muscular atrophy, an inherited neurodegenerative disease caused by a single defective gene. "We believe the medicine would have a multi-billion dollar peak sales potential," Novartis CEO Vasant Narasimhan said.

headlines: Welcoming of lady on her 70th: Big B on wife Jaya's birthday
text: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, in a blog post on his wife Jaya Bachchan's 70th birthday, wrote, "Welcoming of the lady on her 70th." He further wrote, "She be wife and Mother... and she be with her progress report." Big B also shared a picture of Jaya with their children Abhishek Bachchan and Shweta Bachchan-Nanda as part of the blog post.

headlines: You're the world to me: Abhishek on mother's 70th birthday
text: Abhishek Bachchan, while sharing an old picture of his mother Jaya Bachchan on her 70th birthday, wrote, "Happy Birthday Ma. You are the world to me, love you!" Abhishek has worked with Jaya in films like 'Laaga Chunari Mein Daag' and 'Drona' among others. The actress-turned-politician made her debut in a lead role in Bollywood with the 1971 film 'Guddi'.

headlines: Daughter all want but I already have: Johar on Alia in Raazi
text: Referring to Alia Bhatt in her upcoming film 'Raazi', the film's producer Karan Johar tweeted, "Strong, Emotional, Fiercely Independent. The kind of daughter everyone wants but I already have!" He wrote this while sharing the first poster of the Meghna Gulzar directorial. Also starring Vicky Kaushal, the film is set to release on May 11.

headlines: England women beat India to level ODI series 1-1
text: The English women's cricket team beat India by eight wickets to level the three-match ODI series 1-1 in Nagpur on Monday. India were dismissed for 113, with Danielle Hazell and Sophie Ecclestone picking up four wickets each. In reply, England cruised past the target with eight wickets and 21 overs remaining.

headlines: Cong leaders eat chole bhature before starting hunger strike
text: BJP leader Harish Khurana tweeted a picture showing Congress leaders Ajay Maken, AS Lovely among others eating chole bhature at a Delhi restaurant before their protest fast at Rajghat against alleged Dalit atrocities. Lovely later clarified that the picture was taken before the start of the protest, adding that it was a symbolic fast and not an indefinite hunger strike.

headlines: Video shows sub-inspector thrashing rape accused with belt
text: A video showing a sub-inspector in Uttar Pradesh's Mau beating up a man accused of rape with a belt has surfaced online. The police officer can be seen thrashing the rape accused as the man stood facing a wall. Strict action against the erring officer will be taken, the police department has said.

headlines: 4 booked in UP for derogatory post against Ambedkar on FB
text: The Uttar Pradesh Police has filed an FIR against four people for allegedly writing a derogatory post against Dr BR Ambedkar on Facebook and for assaulting a Dalit youth. The FIR was registered under the SC/STs (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, IT Act, and the IPC on the basis of the complaint filed by the assaulted Dalit youth.

headlines: Union Minister's son gets bail in Bihar communal clash case
text: The son of Union Minister Ashwini Choubey, Arijit Shashwat, was granted bail on Monday after being held over links to communal clashes that took place in Bihar's Bhagalpur. Shashwat had surrendered to the police on April 1. He was accused of illegally taking out a procession, which triggered an alleged communal clash, on the eve of the Hindu New Year.

headlines: Govt plans digital atlas for flood-prone areas
text: The government is preparing a digital atlas for flood-prone areas to give warnings and real-time information about the rise in water levels, reports said. This will help local administrations reduce damage to property and loss of life during floods, reports added. The flood warning system in India is currently based on water-level forecasting.

headlines: CVC warned about jewellery sector an year before PNB scam
text: The Central Vigilance Commission had warned of irregularities in jewellery sector a year before the PNB scam became public. A meeting was reportedly held in January 2017 with chief vigilance officers of 10 banks, including PNB to discuss such irregularities. The meeting particularly focussed on fraud committed by Winsome Diamonds' Jatin Mehta, who fled after defaulting on â¹7,000-crore worth loans.

headlines: Cong leader quits party, joins BJP, rejoins Cong in evening
text: Ahead of the Karnataka Assembly elections, state Congress leader Sundara Devinagara quit the party on Saturday morning and rejoined it hours later in the evening. Devinagara had been welcomed into the BJP at a function in the morning. However, he rejoined Congress at another programme held by party leaders at Mani a few hours later.

headlines: You'll hear me shout from rooftops in case of wedding: Ranveer
text: Addressing reports of him marrying rumoured girlfriend Deepika Padukone by the end of this year, Ranveer Singh said, "If there is any announcement in the future, you will be hearing me shouting from the rooftops." He further said, "Right now we are both extremely busy working. Besides, she is also recuperating from back problems... We are quite occupied and distracted."

headlines: God bless people who canât handle Salman's success: Arpita
text: Arpita Khan Sharma posted a picture of her brother Salman Khan on Instagram with the caption, "God bless all the people that can't handle you or your success." She further called him "God's child" while adding, "I wish only positivity & happiness for you may all the jealousy...fade away." Notably, Salman recently got bail in the blackbuck poaching case.

headlines: Sikh group sets world record by tying 9,000 turbans in US
text: A Sikh organisation has set the Guinness World Record for the "most turbans tied in 8 hours" by tying over 9,000 turbans to celebrate annual Turban Day at Times Square, New York. The event was aimed at spreading awareness among Americans and other nationalities about the Sikh religion and its articles of faith, especially the turban.

headlines: If I fight again, it will be for UFC: Floyd Mayweather
text: Retired undefeated boxer and world champion Floyd Mayweather has said if he ever fights again, it will be for the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC). "If we can get together with Dana White and the UFC to make a megafight happen, one fight, it could be against Conor McGregor", Mayweather said about his potential move to the mixed martial arts event.

headlines: Women bikers complete 17,000-km journey across 6 countries
text: The Telangana Tourism Department on Monday welcomed four women bikers who successfully completed a nearly 17,000-kilometre-long road trip covering six countries. The women, who embarked on their journey from Hyderabad on February 11 to promote Telangana tourism, covered Myanmar, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, and Bangladesh. They were also supported by the Indian government in this initiative.

headlines: Rahul Gandhi observes day-long fast for communal harmony
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi, along with his party, observed a day-long fast between 11 am and 4 pm on Monday for communal harmony in the country. While Rahul observed the fast in front of VIP Gate, Gandhi Samadhi at Raj Ghat in Delhi, other party members held the protest against PM Narendra Modi-led Centre at state and district headquarters.

headlines: IAS 2015 topper Tina Dabi marries 2nd rank holder in J&K
text: Indian Administrative Service (IAS) 2015 topper Tina Dabi married the second rank holder Athar Aamir-ul-Shafi Khan in Jammu and Kashmir on Saturday. The couple had met in 2016 during the felicitation ceremony at the Department of Personnel and Training in Delhi. According to reports, they had faced criticism for their relationship as they came from different religious backgrounds.

headlines: Chhattisgarh village gets electricity after 15 years
text: Chintalnar village in Chhattisgarh's Maoist-affected Sukma district has started getting electricity again after 15 years. The rebels had destroyed the power infrastructure in the village in an attempt to disrupt developmental activities in the area. "Electrification of this area is a major relief for all of us. It will be easier for children to study at night," a villager said.

headlines: Dalit organisation to give UP CM Yogi award, members upset
text: Dalit organisation Ambedkar Mahasabha has decided to felicitate Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath with the 'Dalit Mitra' (Friends of Dalits) award. However, claiming that Mahasabha President Lalji Prasad Nirmal had overstepped his bounds regarding the decision, two of the organisation's founding members called an annual general meeting to initiate disciplinary action against him.

headlines: Had written to CBI about ICICI fraud in 2012: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Udit Raj has revealed that he had written a letter regarding some fraudulent activities taking place in ICICI Bank to Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in 2012. According to Raj, a weather-based crop insurance was launched in 2012 and ICICI Lombard was the middleman between beneficiaries and the government. However, around 13,000 fake beneficiaries were discovered in Rajasthan.

headlines: Govt school in Alwar gets railway station-themed classrooms
text: A government school in Rajasthan's Alwar has been painted to look like a railway station, with classrooms as passenger compartments, principal's office as the engine and the verandah as the platform. The railway station theme is to make the school attractive for the children and to increase student enrolment from the area, the school authorities said.

headlines: 3 infants die, 6 fall sick after vaccination dose in J'khand
text: A total of three infants have died and six others have fallen sick in Jharkhand's Palamu, allegedly after they were administered a vaccination. Assuring that the matter is being probed, MLA Radha Krishna Kishore said, "If wrongdoings are found, action will be taken." Meanwhile, CM Raghubar Das has announced a compensation of â¹1 lakh each for families of the deceased.

headlines: Bus driver braids girl's hair daily after her mother died
text: A US bus driver named Tracy Dean has been braiding the hair of an 11-year-old girl every day before school as her mother passed away two years ago. Isabella Pieri's father did not know how to make her hair, following which she asked Dean for help. Meanwhile, Dean said, "You treat them like your own kids, you know."

headlines: Mumbai Police tweets 'If you don't love me at my' meme
text: Seemingly inspired by the viral 'If you don't love me at my' memes, the Mumbai Police has tweeted an image showing a traffic constable issuing a challan and another showing a constable controlling traffic in the rain. The post was retweeted over 3,000 times, while Twitter users said, "Mumbai Police at its finest" and "Whosoever made this deserves a raise". n

headlines: DJ who headbutted former Australian PM gets 6 months in jail
text: A DJ who headbutted former Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott was sentenced to a maximum six-month jail term today. The assault had occurred in September, when Astro Labe had grabbed Abbott's hand and headbutted him, saying, "you f*cking deserved it." At the time, Abbott had claimed that he was assaulted for opposing same-sex marriage.

headlines: ED traces â¹5,000cr moved through Nirav, Choksi's shell firms
text: The Enforcement Directorate has traced over â¹5,000 crore funnelled through as many as 40 shell companies controlled by jewellers Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi, reports said. About half of â¹5,000 crore has reportedly come back to their India-based firms as foreign investment or through hawala route. The agency is currently probing alleged money laundering in the â¹13,600-crore PNB scam.

headlines: Ferrari F1 car runs over, breaks mechanic's leg at pit stop
text: Ferrari driver Kimi Raikkonen's car ran over his team mechanic's leg during a pit stop at the Bahrain Grand Prix on Monday. The Ferrari pit system had accidentally shown a green light when the mechanic was still changing the left rear wheel. Ferrari have been fined â¬50,000 while the mechanic was taken to a hospital with a double leg fracture.

headlines: Woman athlete runs tea stall in Tamil Nadu to make a living
text: A Kalaimani, a 45-year-old athlete, has been forced to open and run a tea stall in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore to make a living. She has participated in state and national level Masters Athletics events and won four gold medals. "I earn 400-500 from the tea shop, run my family and manage my sports requirements," Kalaimani said.

headlines: Axar Patel signs for English county, will play last 6 games
text: Indian spinner Axar Patel has been signed up by English county cricket side Durham to play in the final six matches of the county cricket season. The 24-year-old Indian spinner is currently playing for the Kings XI Punjab in the Indian Premier League 2018. Notably, India's Cheteshwar Pujara, Ishant Sharma, and Varun Aaron will also play county cricket.

headlines: Canadian firm gets â¹77 lakh to make egg of wood, lava, brass
text: Canada-based Orijin Design Company has raised over â¹77 lakh to make an egg-shaped product called 'The Thinking Egg', priced at $10. The egg, which is 17 mm wide and 23.38 mm tall, is available in brass, pine, lava and howlite elements. The firm claims it is meant to remind people to slow things down and be present in the moment.

headlines: Musk shares pic of main body tool of SpaceX's biggest rocket
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has shared a picture of the main body tool of SpaceX's biggest rocket called BFR designed to take people to Mars. The 157-foot-long rocket will consist of a massive first-stage booster with 31 engines and is capable of carrying 150,000 kg of payload to Earth's orbit. The startup claims the BFR will be ready by 2022.

headlines: Delhi startup which turns pollution into ink raises funds
text: Delhi-based startup Chakr Innovation which turns pollution into processed ink has raised undisclosed amount from IDFC-Parampara Fund and Globevestor funds. The startup has developed a pollution controlling device called 'Chakr Shield' which fits in the exhaust pipe of a diesel generator and captures over 90% particulate matter. The ink processed from the matter is then used in printers and paint.

headlines: Mumbai airport's main runway to be shut for 6 hrs on 2 days
text: Flight operations at the Mumbai airport are likely to be affected for two days as the airport operator on Monday announced the closure of the main runway for six hours today and tomorrow for pre-monsoon maintenance work. It also requested passengers to contact their respective airlines. The Mumbai airport has two intersecting runways, namely the primary and the secondary runway.

headlines: ICICI board split over keeping Chanda Kochhar as CEO: Report
text: The ICICI Bank board has reportedly been divided over whether to ask CEO Chanda Kochhar to resign as CBI probes allegations of impropriety over loans given to Videocon Group. Some outside directors are opposed to Kochhar continuing in her role, reports said. Notably, the board had expressed "full faith and confidence" in Kochhar and refuted reports of any wrongdoing.

headlines: Cello Pens maker moves Bombay HC against former owners
text: Cello Pens maker BIC Group has moved the Bombay High Court against former owners for allegedly violating a non-compete agreement. BIC acquired Cello Pens from Mumbai-based Rathod family and the sale agreement included a clause that prevented them from entering the stationery business for 36 months. BIC said close relatives of the Rathods started the Unimax stationery brand in 2016.

headlines: Firms owned by ICICI CEO Chanda Kochhar's family under probe
text: Investigative agencies are reportedly probing companies owned by ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar's husband Deepak and his brother Rajiv to check tax evasion and money laundering. "The prime focus is on NuPower Renewables" whose "shareholders have changed over the years," an official said. It's alleged that Videocon Chairman Venugopal Dhoot pumped money into NuPower in exchange for loans from ICICI.

headlines: Mercedes-Benz GLS Grand Edition has power to rule every terrain
text: nThe Mercedes-Benz GLS Grand Edition's impressive highlights and unparalleled power give it the authority to rule every terrain. It combines luxury with agile dynamics and extensive safety systems. It also features exclusive interior and exterior elements like the LED Intelligent Light System and the striking "Grand Edition" side badge that makes its authority truly unrivalled.

headlines: Ex-Pak diplomat on NIA wanted list over 26/11-like attacks
text: In a first, the National Investigation Agency (NIA) has put a former Pakistani diplomat, Amir Zubair Siddique, on its wanted list. In 2014, Siddique and three other Pakistani officers allegedly planned 26/11-type strikes on the Israeli and US consulates and Army and Navy commands in south India. The NIA has released a photo of him, seeking information.

headlines: Fresh plea in SC against Priya Varrier's viral song
text: A fresh plea has been filed in the Supreme Court against the viral song featuring actress Priya Prakash Varrier, claiming that the act of winking is forbidden in Islam. The intervention application, filed by two Hyderabad-based parties, said that the sacred lyrics of the song superimposed on objectionable picturisation could be categorised as an act of blasphemy.

headlines: 17yr-old Mehuli sets CWG record, loses shoot-off to come 2nd
text: India's 17-year-old shooter Mehuli Ghosh set a Commonwealth Games joint record to win silver in the women's 10m Air Rifle event on Monday. Ghosh and eventual gold medallist Singapore's Martina Lindsay Veloso both ended with record score following which the winner was decided through a shoot-off. India's 25-year-old shooter Apurvi Chandela won a bronze medal in the same event.

headlines: 23-year-old cyclist suffers cardiac arrest during race, dies
text: Belgium's 23-year-old cyclist Michael Goolaerts passed away in a hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest during the Paris-Roubaix race on Sunday. Goolaerts was rushed to the hospital after he was given CPR treatment on the side of the road following a crash. Notably, Goolaerts is the third Belgian rider to die mid-race in recent years.

headlines: PM Modi may lose his constituency Varanasi in 2019: Rahul
text: Expressing confidence in a united alliance of Congress, BSP and SP in Uttar Pradesh, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said PM Narendra Modi may even lose his parliamentary constituency of Varanasi in 2019 Lok Sabha elections. Earlier in March, a BSP-SP alliance defeated the BJP in the bypolls for Gorakhpur seat, previously held by UP CM Yogi Adityanath for 19 years.

headlines: China's SenseTime becomes worldâs most valuable AI startup
text: China's artificial intelligence (AI) startup SenseTime has become the world's most valuable AI startup after raising $600 million mainly from Alibaba. The round, which valued the startup at over $3 billion, also saw participation from Singapore's Temasek and retailer Suning.com. Founded in 2014, SenseTime develops face recognition technology that can be applied to payments and picture analysis.

headlines: Prez Kovind gets Equatorial Guineaâs highest civilian honour
text: President Ram Nath Kovind was on Sunday conferred with the highest civilian honour given to a non-citizen by Equatorial Guinea. He was bestowed with the honour by Equatorial Guinea's President Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo as a recognition of his contribution to security, development, and world peace. President Kovind is the first head of state from India to visit the nation.

headlines: Doctors confirm Indrani overdosed on medicines in jail
text: Denying reports that Sheena Bora murder accused Indrani Mukerjea was on life support, doctors at Mumbai's JJ Hospital confirmed that Mukerjea had a medicine overdose. Mukerjea, who was reportedly on anti-depressants, was given medication by her jail guards at prescribed intervals. The doctors added that her condition was stable after she was admitted to the hospital in a "delirious" state.

headlines: Trump calls Syrian Prez 'animal' over chemical attack
text: US President Donald Trump has called Syrian President Bashar al-Assad an "animal" over a suspected chemical attack that killed at least 70 people in eastern Ghouta. Trump also slammed Russian President Vladimir Putin and Iran for backing Assad. Trump further claimed that if Barack Obama had acted against Assad, the Syrian President would have been history.

headlines: UK boarding school says it will allow boys to wear skirts
text: A UK boarding school said that it will let boys wear skirts. Its headmaster said, "I would hope that any pupil could come to me and say, 'This is who we are, this is how we wish to express ourselves. We want to wear these clothes', and we would probably allow that." The school also uses gender-neutral terms like "pupils".

headlines: Often told by people there is a director in me: Rajkummar
text: Rajkummar Rao, while talking about how he might direct films, said, "I have often been told by people that there is a director in me and that it will come out one day." Talking further about his acting career, he added, "A boy from Gurgaon who had this dream of becoming an actor is actually living that dream every day."

headlines: I played too many dot balls, concedes Kohli after RCB defeat
text: Reacting to Royal Challengers Bangalore's loss to Kolkata Knight Riders in their IPL 2018 opener, RCB captain Virat Kohli said, "I played too many dot balls and couldn't get any momentum going". The Indian captain also rued the fact that he and South Africa's AB de Villiers got dismissed to a part-time spinner off two consecutive deliveries.

headlines: Vettel wins by 0.699 sec, claims back to back F1 races
text: Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel won his second Grand Prix in as many races, at the Bahrain Grand Prix, while Mercedes' Valtteri Bottas finished second by just 0.699 seconds. The race saw a mechanic suffering an injury after getting hit by Ferrari driver Kimi Raikkonen's car during a pit stop. Meanwhile, reigning world champion Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton finished third.

headlines: Ronaldo scores in 10th straight match in Madrid derby draw
text: Cristiano Ronaldo scored for the 10th game in a row as Real Madrid played out a 1-1 draw against city rivals Atletico Madrid in the La Liga on Sunday. Ronaldo's goal, his 20th in last 10 games, was cancelled out just four minutes later by Antoine Griezmann. With this draw, league leaders Barcelona are 11 points clear at the top.

headlines: Facebook to notify users affected by recent data breach
text: Facebook has announced that it will notify the 87 million users, including 562,455 in India, whose data might have been shared with British firm Cambridge Analytica. Further, users will receive a notice on their Feed, titled 'Protecting Your Information,' with a link to display the apps used. Users will also be able to turn off third-party access to their accounts.

headlines: Apple to unveil red iPhone 8, 8 Plus model this week: Report
text: Technology giant Apple will unveil a red version of the iPhone 8 and iPhone 8 Plus models this week, according to reports. It is part of the company's partnership with (RED), an advocacy group dedicated to combating HIV/AIDS in Africa. Reports claimed the phones will be available for preorder, but doesn't specify if it will include an iPhone X edition.

headlines: WhatsApp allows users to lock voice recording button in beta
text: WhatsApp has released a feature in beta which allows Android users to lock voice recording button while sending long voice clips. To use the feature, users can tap the mic icon at the bottom right of the chat and swipe it upwards to lock it. WhatsApp is reportedly also working on an option to preview the recorded message before sending.

headlines: Jet Airways plane wing hits catering van at Delhi airport
text: The wing of a Jet Airways aircraft hit a parked catering van when the plane was taxiing towards the parking bay at the Delhi airport on Sunday. All the 133 people onboard were safely deplaned after the incident. In another incident, a Jet Airways Delhi-bound flight made an emergency landing in Lucknow as its landing gear was not functioning properly.

headlines: Swiss Aviation Consulting may bid for Air India: Report
text: Switzerland-based aviation advisory firm Swiss Aviation Consulting has shown interest in bidding for debt-ridden national airline Air India, a senior aviation ministry official has been quoted as saying. Earlier, Tata Group and Turkey's Celebi Aviation Holding had expressed interest in buying some of Air India's operations. The government is seeking to sell 76% stake in the airline.

headlines: Convert LoC into Line of Peace and Goodwill: Farooq Abdullah
text: National Conference (NC) President Farooq Abdullah on Saturday said that the Line of Control (LoC) in J&K should be converted into the "Line of Peace and Goodwill". Suggesting that India and Pakistan should initiate dialogue, he warned the Centre against taking the people of the state "for granted" and "ignoring their legitimate aspirations".

headlines: Firm offers tablet-based education for prisoners, gets $9.8M
text: US-based startup Edovo which provides tablet-based education for prisoners has raised $9.8 million in Series A. The round saw participation from Impact Engine, Lumina Foundation, Sustain VC, IDP Foundation, Kapor Capital, and Ekistic Ventures. Founded in 2013, the startup provides certificates and entertainment options and also allows prisoners to stay in touch with their friends and family.

headlines: Man held for fake WhatsApp text that ended woman's wedding
text: A Kerala woman got a man arrested for circulating a fake WhatsApp forward claiming she was planning to elope with her male friend, following which her fiance called off the wedding. In the WhatsApp message, the accused used her picture with the friend and put an audio urging her parents be informed. He was arrested with the cyber cell's help.

headlines: 1 MLA arrested, 2 others booked for murder of Shiv Sena men
text: NCP MLA Sangram Jagtap was among the four arrested for the murder of a Shiv Sena leader and a worker in Maharashtra's Ahmednagar on Saturday after the announcement of civic bypolls results. Another NCP MLA and a BJP MLA were also booked in the incident. The deceased leader's family revealed he was threatened for extending support to Shiv Sena candidate.

headlines: Video: Trump throws away his 'boring' speech notes
text: During a speech at a tax policy discussion in West Virginia last week, US President Donald Trump threw away his prepared remarks and called them "boring". "This was going to be my remarks, they would have taken about two minutes, get the hell away," Trump said while tossing away the paper.

headlines: Israel calls in Air Force to target one Palestinian at border
text: The Israeli Army called in the Air Force to target a Palestinian man, which it called an "armed terrorist", spotted at the border fence with Gaza. The Army said Israel Defence Forces' (IDF) operations against "terrorists" will not allow "any harm to the security of Israeli civilians". Last month, Israeli security forces killed 16 Palestinians protesting along the Israel-Gaza border.

headlines: Noida-based micro-delivery startup MrNeeds shuts down
text: Noida-based micro-delivery startup MrNeeds which used to operate through an app-based subscription service has shut down. The company which was focussed on optimising the supply chain and minimising delivery costs now displays a message on its website, "Our store is closed". The two-year-old startup used to offer delivery service for milk, bread, eggs, groceries and other essentials.

headlines: Thomas Cook presents the Incredible India Week from April 4-11
text: After the success of the 'Grand Indian Holiday Sale', leading travel company Thomas Cook has come up with the 'Incredible India Week' from April 3-11. It facilitates people to explore incredible Indian holiday destinations with discounts, tour packages and also the best price challenge. The tour packages include trips to Andaman, Kerala, Himachal, Uttarakhand among other locations.

headlines: Indian shooter Jitu Rai breaks CWG record to win his 2nd gold
text: Indian shooter Jitu Rai broke the Commonwealth Games record with a score of 235.1 in the men's 10m Air Pistol event to win his career's second Commonwealth Games gold on Monday. In the same event, another Indian shooter Om Mitharval won the bronze medal to take India's medal tally to 15, including eight gold and three silver.

headlines: Actress who staged topless protest denied film body membership
text: The film body Movie Artistes Association (MAA) denied membership to actress Sri Reddy, who went topless in Hyderabad to protest against casting couch in the Telugu film industry. MAA President Sivaji Raja said Sri Reddy going nude in public was for cheap publicity. The film body also stated that members would be suspended if they chose to work with her.

headlines: Hindi Medium earns â¹100 crore in 3 days of its China release
text: The Irrfan Khan and Saba Qamar starrer 'Hindi Medium' earned over â¹100 crore in just three days of its release in China on April 4. The film earned more on its opening day than Aamir Khan's 'Dangal' and Salman Khan's 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan', when they released in China. Directed by Saket Chaudhary, 'Hindi Medium' released in India on May 19, 2017.

headlines: Narine hits 50 off 17 balls hrs after Rahul broke his record
text: KKR opener Sunil Narine slammed 50 off 17 balls against RCB in the evening match on Sunday, becoming the first player to score two 50s off 17 or fewer balls in IPL history. In the afternoon match, KXIP's Lokesh Rahul slammed the fastest-ever IPL fifty off 14 balls against DD, breaking the 15-ball record shared by Narine and Yusuf Pathan.

headlines: Pardeep Singh lifts 352 kg to win India's 13th medal at CWG
text: Weightlifter Pardeep Singh lifted a combined weight of 352 kg in the men's 105 kg category on Monday to bag India's third silver medal and 13th overall medal at the Commonwealth Games 2018. He lifted 152 kg in snatch and 352 kg in clean and jerk. Out of India's 13 medals, nine have been won by weightlifters alone.

headlines: Only 6 of 59 airports equipped to defuse bombs: CISF audit
text: Only six of the 59 airports guarded by CISF are equipped to defuse and dispose of explosives, an audit by the agency has found. Airports require 28 pieces of equipment, like explosive vapour detectors and remote-operated vehicles, for making explosive detection and disposal squads operational. These are only available at Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata, Cochin and Hyderabad airports.

headlines: BSF to build guest houses for jawans' families at border
text: The Border Security Force is reportedly building 190 guest houses for jawans of constable and sub-constable rank to live with their families and spend more time with them. Aiming to reduce stress and fatigue, the facilities will be provided to newly-wed soldiers on priority. Jawans spend an average of five out of 30 years with family during service, reports said.

headlines: Punjab IAF bases put on alert over threat from terror groups
text: Indian Air Force stations and important installations in Punjab have been put on alert after intelligence agencies received inputs that the posts are being targetted by Pakistan-based terrorist organisations Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba. This comes after the Jaish-e-Mohammed issued a statement saying it would avenge the deaths of 13 militants killed in Kashmir this month.

headlines: Marital rape not husband's privilege, must be illegal: HC
text: The Gujarat High Court has remarked "marital rape is not a husband's privilege" and called it an "injustice that must be criminalised". It called for abolishing the exemption under Section 375 of IPC which does not consider sex with wife as rape. The court said this while partly quashing a woman's FIR against her husband for alleged harassment and rape.

headlines: France aids, abets and supports terror: Turkish Prez ErdoÄan
text: Slamming French President for meeting Syrian Kurdish militias last month, Turkish President Recep Tayyip ErdoÄan said that "France aids, abets and supports terror". "You will not be able to rid yourself of this terror burden... you will sink," he added. Turkey had launched an operation against the Kurdish YPG militia, which it considers a terrorist organisation.

headlines: Russia calls Syrian chemical attack 'fake news'
text: The Russian Foreign Ministry has called the suspected chemical attack in Syria "fake news". The ministry said that the incident was being reported as a chemical attack to justify potential strikes against Syria. It further said that those who are not interested in a genuine political settlement of the Syrian crisis are seeking to complicate the situation on the ground.

headlines: China to make it rain over area 3 times the size of Spain
text: China has unveiled a cloud-seeding project intended to force rainfall and snow over an area roughly three times the size of Spain. As part of the plan, China will build combustion chambers to spray silver iodide towards the sky by burning solid fuel. China has been creating 55 billion tons of artificial rain every year since 2013.

headlines: Richest 1% to own two-thirds of all wealth by 2030: Study
text: The richest 1% are on track to own two-thirds of the world's wealth by 2030, as per a study by UK's House of Commons Library. Since 2008, the wealth of the top 1% has been growing twice as fast as the remaining 99%. If the trend continues, the top 1% would own about $305 trillion by 2030, the study said.

headlines: This is not my best, my best is yet to come: Rajkummar Rao
text: Rajkummar Rao has said he wants to go higher in his career while adding, "This is not my best. My best is yet to come." He further said, "My biggest high is just to be in front of the camera and be on a film set." Rajkummar also spoke on success and said that sometimes, it can be a trap.

headlines: Teaches youth it's ok to kill animals: Sofia on Salman's bail
text: Reacting to Salman Khan getting bail, former Bigg Boss contestant Sofia Hayat wrote on Instagram, "Inject yourself with steroids, teach the young it's ok to kill animals and people and abuse women." She added, "Throw a few dance moves in pants that are far too tight...and as long as you have these documents (referring to money)...you are king in India!

headlines: Part-time spinner dismisses ABD, Kohli in successive balls
text: KKR's part-time spinner Nitish Rana dismissed RCB's AB de Villiers and Virat Kohli off successive deliveries to take first two wickets of his IPL career today. Rana achieved the feat in the second over of his IPL career. Jacques Kallis and Thisara Perera are the other bowlers who have dismissed the duo off successive deliveries in same over in IPL.

headlines: Karthik unbeaten for 6th match in a row as KKR beat RCB
text: KKR captain Dinesh Karthik slammed an unbeaten 35 off 29 deliveries to help his team chase down Virat Kohli-led RCB's 176 in the IPL on Sunday. Karthik has remained unbeaten in each of his last six professional cricket matches. The match saw KKR's Sunil Narine become the first batsman to score two IPL fifties in 17 or fewer balls.

headlines: Unlike Mayawati, Kanshi Ram never believed in violence: BJP
text: After BSP supremo Mayawati said the BJP was "scared" following Dalit protests, BJP leader Thaawar Chand Gehlot said she is walking towards the path of violence which her mentor Kanshi Ram never believed in. Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said the BSP, along with SP and Congress, was supporting violence across the country. Twelve people were killed during the protests.

headlines: PM Modi scared of questions on corruption: Rahul Gandhi
text: Addressing a rally in Karnataka, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi was scared of facing questions on corruption and was not letting the Parliament function. "Who stopped Parliament from running? The allies of BJP- the Telugu Desam Party (TDP)," he added. Replying to Gandhi, BJP leader CN Ashwath Narayan said TDP isn't in NDA.

headlines: Angry Dalits important in deciding next PM: Cong leader
text: Congress leader Nitin Raut said "angry" Dalits will play an important role in deciding who the next Prime Minister of the country will be. Adding that they'll choose Congress President Rahul Gandhi for the post, he said, "Dalits...are feeling angry under the NDA's regime. They are being denied educational, employment opportunities which never happened when the Congress was in power."

headlines: BJP releases first list of candidates for Karnataka polls
text: The BJP on Sunday released its first list with 72 candidates for the Karnataka Assembly elections, to be held on May 12. The Chief Ministerial candidate of the party BS Yeddyurappa will be contesting from Shikaripura constituency, which he had won in 2013 on a ticket from Karnataka Jantha Paksha (KJP). The polls are being held for 224 seats.

headlines: 2 men accused of blasphemy thrashed, paraded in Haryana
text: Two Dalit men, accused of blasphemy, were abused, thrashed, and paraded in Haryana's Fatehabad on Friday. A video of the incident went viral and miscreants will be identified based on the video, police have said. Meanwhile, the duo has been booked on the basis of a complaint filed by a man, stating they spoke ill of Bishnoi guru Jambheshwar.

headlines: Delhi CM inaugurates swimming pools at 2 govt schools
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday inaugurated swimming pools at two government schools in Mayur Vihar and Vinod Nagar. Stating that nobody had ever thought government schools could have swimming pools, Kejriwal added his government had shown that these schools could be improved. The pools, fitted with lane ropes, will reportedly help students prepare for national championships.

headlines: Van attacker had mental health problems: German minister
text: The man who ploughed a minivan into a group of people outside a restaurant in the German city of Muenster appears to have had mental health problems, regional interior minister Herbert Reul has said. Confirming that police have ruled out terrorism, Reul said the man acted alone. Two people were killed and around 20 others were injured in the attack.

headlines: Oil spill in Australia would be welcome boost for locals: BP
text: Oil giant BP had claimed that an oil spill off the South Australian coast would be a "welcome boost" to local economies due to the "increased activity associated with cleanup operations". BP made the statements in March 2016 as part of its bid to drill in the region. Notably, BP's 2010 Deepwater Horizon oil spill is the largest in history.

headlines: Delhi High Court stops infringement of Patanjali trademark
text: The Delhi HC has prohibited a trust and four firms from manufacturing, advertising or selling any goods bearing the Patanjali mark following a plea by Ramdev's Patanjali Ayurved. The plea argued that the firms were passing off their products as that of Patanjali's based on the authorisation of the trust, Maharishi Patanjali Vedic Foundation.

headlines: KL Rahul smashes fastest-ever IPL 50 off 14 balls
text: Kings XI Punjab's wicketkeeper-batsman Lokesh Rahul smashed the fastest-ever fifty in IPL history off 14 balls against Delhi Daredevils on Sunday. The previous record was held jointly by Yusuf Pathan and Sunil Narine, who had scored a fifty off 15 balls each. The record for fastest T20 fifty is held jointly by Chris Gayle and Yuvraj Singh (12 balls).

headlines: Journalist shot at his home by unidentified men in Ghaziabad
text: A Sahara Samay journalist, Anuj Chaudhary, was shot at his residence in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad by unidentified men on Sunday and has been rushed to the hospital. Initial probe has revealed that personal enmity was behind the attack, reports quoting police said. Ghaziabad Police tweeted that the force is on the spot and necessary action is being taken.

headlines: Gambhir equals Warner's record for most IPL 50s on DD return
text: Delhi Daredevils captain Gautam Gambhir slammed his 36th IPL fifty against Kings XI Punjab on Sunday to equal David Warner's record for the most number of fifties in the T20 league. The 36-year-old batsman has slammed nine fifties for Delhi Daredevils and 27 for Kolkata Knight Riders. Gambhir is playing for Daredevils for the first time since 2010.

headlines: 1st int'l cricketer born after 2000 youngest to play in IPL
text: Afghanistan's Mujeeb Zadran, the first male cricketer born in the 21st century to play international cricket, has become the youngest to feature in the IPL. KXIP's Mujeeb achieved the feat, aged 17 years and 11 days, after taking the field against DD on Sunday. Sarfaraz Khan was the previous youngest (17 years and 177 days) to feature in the IPL.

headlines: McCullum second player to score 9,000 runs in T20 history
text: RCB opener Brendon McCullum has become the second cricketer to reach 9,000 runs in T20s, achieving the feat against his former team KKR on Sunday. McCullum reached the milestone in his 330th T20, joining Chris Gayle, who has scored 11,068 runs in 323 T20 matches. Suresh Raina, with 7,382 runs, is the highest run-getter in T20s among Indian cricketers.

headlines: Humanity's first mission to Sun set to launch on July 31
text: NASA is set to launch the Parker Solar Probe, also being called as the humanity's first mission to the Sun, on July 31. The spacecraft will orbit directly through the solar atmosphere, closer than any human-made object has ever gone. The spacecraft, which will orbit at 64,37,376 km from the Sun, will have a speed of approximately 6,92,017 kmph.

headlines: How did police trace source of CBSE Economics paper leak?
text: Investigations based on WhatsApp messages led Delhi Police to a woman in Punjab who acquired the leaked CBSE Economics paper for her son. The woman had received the paper from her relative, Rakesh Kumar, a Centre Superintendent at a school in Himachal Pradesh. Kumar stole the Economics paper while collecting the Computer Science and Informatics Practices papers from a bank.

headlines: USâencouraging India's heavy-handed approach: Pakistan
text: Alleging the US was encouraging India's heavy-handed approach, Pakistan's ambassador to the US Aizaz Ahmad Chaudhry said that peace will prevail in south Asia if US assumes the role of a balanced power-player. Last year, Pakistan said the US should treat Pakistan and India equally after it was put on notice by the US for providing safe havens to terrorists.

headlines: Pakistan mulls permanent ban on terrorist outfits: Reports
text: Pakistan is working on a draft bill to permanently ban 26/11 Mumbai attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed-led Jamaat-ud-Dawah as well as other terror groups and individuals, according to reports. This comes after Paris-based money-laundering watchdog, the Financial Action Task Force (FATF), placed Pakistan on its global terrorist-financing watchlist over its alleged support and inaction against terrorism.

headlines: Drunk tourist jumps into pool full of crocodiles, gets saved
text: A 21-year-old drunk tourist in Zimbabwe had his arm ripped off after he jumped into a pool that had three crocodiles, an official said. He was saved by two men who jumped into the pool and pulled him to safety. Although the tourist sustained several fractures, he is said to be in a stable condition.

headlines: Second non-bailable warrant against Nirav Modi, Mehul Choksi
text: A special CBI court on Sunday issued non-bailable warrants against jewellers Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi in connection with cases related to the $2.1-billion PNB fraud. A Mumbai court had first issued non-bailable warrants against the duo on Enforcement Directorate's request in March. While Choksi refused to come back to India citing health reasons, Nirav Modi cited business engagements abroad.

headlines: Dubai cryptocurrency firm denies Alibaba trademark breach
text: Dubai-based cryptocurrency firm Alibabacoin Foundation has denied allegations of trademark infringement by Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group. Alibabacoin said its name is an "inherently generic word" that originates from the very region where it is being asked to stop its use. Notably, Ali Baba is the protagonist's name in the Middle Eastern folk tale 'Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves'.

headlines: Teaser of 'Raazi' featuring Alia Bhatt's character out
text: A teaser of the upcoming film 'Raazi', featuring its lead actress Alia Bhatt, has been released. "Sehmat ho gayi hai #Raazi," wrote the film's official Twitter handle while sharing the clip. Based on the book 'Calling Sehmat: A Novel' by Harinder S Sikka, the film revolves around a Kashmiri girl who marries a Pakistani army officer, portrayed by Vicky Kaushal.

headlines: I don't think I'm more than an average-looking guy: Sidharth
text: Discussing his appearance, actor Sidharth Malhotra said, "I don't consider myself as more than an average-looking guy." He added, "I don't believe there is something exceptional in the way I look." Sidharth had earlier talked about his struggling days in Mumbai and said that for a year, he only did photo shoots as it provided him the money to survive.

headlines: Anushka and I don't pay attention to online trolls: Virat
text: Virat Kohli, while talking about online trolls that he and his wife actress Anushka Sharma face, said, "We don't pay attention to it." Virat added, "People getting nasty towards other people and actually enjoying negativity on social media is something very alarming." After their marriage, Anushka was trolled for Virat's poor performance in the first Test match against South Africa.

headlines: Sonam, Anand's wedding in Switzerland from May 9-12: Report
text: As per reports, Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja's wedding will take place in Montreux, Switzerland from May 9 to May 12. It has been speculated that Switzerland was chosen as the venue after the Swiss government reportedly showed interest in the wedding. It was earlier reported that the wedding would take place in either Jodhpur or Udaipur.

headlines: Basketball player proposes to girlfriend on court after game
text: England men's basketball team player Jamell Anderson proposed to his girlfriend Georgia Jones on court after their victory against Cameroon at the Commonwealth Games on Sunday. England men's team gathered in a post-game huddle as England women's basketball team player Jones watched on. As the huddle broke, Anderson was waiting down on one knee holding an engagement ring.

headlines: Rahulâs record 50 helps Ashwin win 1st match as IPL captain
text: Lokesh Rahul smashed the fastest-ever Indian Premier League fifty off 14 balls as Ravichandran Ashwin-led Kings XI Punjab defeated Delhi Daredevils on Sunday. Rahul, who scored 51 off 16 balls, became the first player to score a fifty inside three overs of an innings in T20 cricket. Notably, the match was Ravichandran Ashwin's first as captain of a T20 side.

headlines: Facebook could find more breaches like recent data leak: COO
text: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg has said the company is doing audits but also warned it could find more data breaches like the recent data leak. Sandberg further stressed that the social media platform "cared about privacy" but "I think we got the balance wrong." Facebook didn't inform users about the leak because "we thought" it was deleted, she added.

headlines: #DeleteFacebook still has 300 participants after 2 weeks
text: The #DeleteFacebook campaign, which emerged in mid-March after the revelation of Facebook's data controversy, still has over 300 participants, as compared to 1,700 two weeks ago, according to Bloomberg. Some of the notable figures who deleted their Facebook accounts include WhatsApp Co-founder Brian Acton, Jim Carrey, and Elon Musk who deleted SpaceX and Tesla's Facebook pages.

headlines: Rahul rides Bengaluru metro during Karnataka poll campaign
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Sunday took a ride in the Namma Metro in Bengaluru during his Karnataka Assembly elections campaign. Gandhi boarded the metro at Vidhana Soudha station and got off at MG Road station where he also visited a bookstore. The Karnataka elections are scheduled for May 12 and counting of votes will be held on May 15.

headlines: Hindu outfit writes in blood to PM against SC/ST act review
text: The Akhil Bharatiya Hindu Mahasabha on Saturday wrote a letter in blood to PM Narendra Modi, demanding the withdrawal of the Centre's review petition against the Supreme Court's order which allegedly dilutes the SC/ST act. The petition was filed following the violent Bharat Bandh protests, which reportedly claimed ten lives.

headlines: T'gana man tied to tree, stoned to death for 7-yr-old's rape
text: A 45-year-old man was tied to a tree and stoned to death for allegedly raping a seven-year-old girl in Telangana's Donkeshwar village. Beaten with stones and sticks, the man fell unconscious and was taken to a hospital but died on the way, police said. The man was drunk when he allegedly lured his neighbour's daughter with chocolates and raped her.

headlines: Top ISIS commander killed in air strike in Afghanistan
text: Qari Hekmat, a top Islamic State commander in Afghanistan was killed in an air strike carried out by Afghan forces on Thursday, the Afghan Defence Ministry said. Hekmat was the founder of Islamic State in northern Afghanistan and had recruited several fighters. Mawlawi Habib-ul-Rahman was appointed as his successor.

headlines: Israeli forces tweet image threatening Palestinian kids
text: An Israel Defence Forces (IDF) spokesperson tweeted an image of a group of Palestinian children seen through a sniper's lens, along with a warning that read, "We see you very well." Adding that Israel will not allow anyone to threaten its security and citizens, the spokesperson wrote, "Whoever thinks he can evade the lens of our forces is wrong."

headlines: Ex-Brazil Prez surrenders to police ending two-day standoff
text: Former Brazilian President Lula da Silva on Saturday surrendered to police to begin a 12-year prison sentence for taking bribes, ending a two-day stand-off after missing a court deadline to hand himself in. He was flown by police helicopter to begin his prison sentence. Lula was convicted of money laundering and passive corruption in July last year.

headlines: Surgery over, recovery in 6 months: PNB MD on Nirav scam
text: Punjab National Bank's Managing Director Sunil Mehta has said the state-run lender will be able to come out of the "entire problem and pain" created by the Nirav Modi scam in the next six months. "So worst is behind us. Everything now seems to be under control as surgery is over, now we are in recovery phase," he said.

headlines: India only the 2nd nation to win women's TT team gold at CWG
text: India has become only the second country to win gold in the women's table tennis event in the history of the Commonwealth Games. The Indian women's team defeated four-time defending champions Singapore 3-1 at Gold Coast on Sunday to achieve the feat. India has bagged seven gold medals at CWG 2018 so far, including three today.

headlines: Businessman posed as slum dweller to get son into school
text: A businessman allegedly posed as a slum dweller to get his son admitted to Delhi's Sanskriti School through its quota for economically weaker sections in 2013. He was caught recently, when he tried to get his second son into the school and mentioned that he was a resident of a posh locality. Following this, school authorities complained to the police.

headlines: Case of criminal intimidation filed against Kapil by journo
text: A case of criminal intimidation has been filed against comedian Kapil Sharma by the entertainment news portal SpotboyE and its editor Vickey Lalwani after the comedian abused and threatened Lalwani. Earlier, Kapil had filed a police complaint against Lalwani accusing him of trying to extort â¹25 lakh and starting a false and malicious propaganda to defame him.

headlines: A cricketer born on 8-4-63 scored 8,463 runs in Test cricket
text: In a unique coincidence, former England captain Alec Stewart, who was born on 8-4-63 (April 8, 1963), smashed 8,463 runs in his Test career. Stewart is the most capped Test wicketkeeper for England, playing 133 matches from 1990 to 2003. Stewart also played 170 ODIs for England, scoring 4,677 runs including four hundreds and 28 fifties.

headlines: Who is Manu Bhaker, the 16-yr-old shooter who won CWG gold?
text: Shooter Manu Bhaker, who won 10m Air Pistol gold at the Commonwealth Games 2018 on Sunday, was born on February 18, 2002 in Goria village near Jhajjar, Haryana. The 11th standard student, who took up the sport in 2016, is the youngest Indian to win a gold medal at the ISSF shooting World Cup, achieving the feat in March 2018.

headlines: Harvested Facebook data might be in Russia: Whistleblower
text: Whistleblower Christopher Wylie who exposed Facebook's data-privacy scandal has said that some of the information improperly harvested from users might be stored in Russia. "The professor who was managing the data harvesting process was going back and forth between the UK and Russia," he said. Earlier, Facebook revealed information of up to 87 million users may have been exploited.

headlines: BJP scared of Dalits after Bharat Bandh's success: Mayawati
text: BSP supremo Mayawati on Sunday claimed the success of the Bharat Bandh protest against the alleged dilution of the SC/ST Act by the Supreme Court has left the BJP scared of Dalits. "Authorities in the BJP-ruled states have started atrocities towards Dalits. Many Dalits and...their families are being arrested," she added. At least 10 people were killed in the protests.

headlines: Thousands of black holes at Milky Way's centre: Study
text: Researchers studying data from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory have estimated that up to 10,000 black holes are present within 3 light-years of Sagittarius A*, a supermassive black hole at the centre of Milky Way galaxy. Sagittarius A* is 4 million times as heavy as the Sun and is located 26,000 light-years from the Earth.

headlines: Will never let our land be used against India: Nepal PM
text: During his three-day visit to India, Nepal Prime Minister KP Oli said that his country will never let its land to be used against sovereign India. He further said that Nepal needs the same kind of assurance from India. Adding that Nepal's friendship with India is most important, Oli said that Nepal is not a competitor to India.

headlines: Artifacts pointing to Mahabharata link found in UP village
text: Archaeologists excavating a site in a UP village have found artifacts which reportedly bear a strong cultural resemblance to those found in places mentioned in the epic Mahabharata. The excavation began in January after locals claimed that the site had the debris of the 'Lakshagriha' built by the Kauravas to burn the Pandavas and the tunnel through which Pandavas escaped.

headlines: Video shows policeman throwing money at dancers in UP
text: A video showing a policeman dancing to Bollywood songs and throwing money at dancers in Uttar Pradesh recently went viral on social media. Two policemen, a constable and an officer, were deployed to ensure the security of visitors at a local fair. They were suspended, while the police began a probe into the incident.

headlines: Kapil's abusive language sad reflection of state of mind: Mehta
text: Discussing Kapil Sharma's abusive tweets and telephonic conversation with SpotboyE editor Vickey Lalwani, director Hansal Mehta tweeted, "Kapil's language with the journalist was despicable but also a sad reflection of his possible state of mind." Mehta added, "The journalist in question is no ethical saint either. He has harassed many people, spun many malicious stories."

headlines: Time not ripe for IPL in Chennai: Rajini on Cauvery dispute
text: Taking part in protests against the Centre over the delay in setting up of Cauvery Management Board, actor Rajinikanth said time is not ripe for IPL in Chennai. If the scheduled IPL matches cannot be cancelled, the Chennai Super Kings' players should wear black bands to highlight the plight of farmers facing water shortage in Tamil Nadu, Rajinikanth added.

headlines: Katrina, Jacqueline, Varun visit Salman in Mumbai after bail
text: Katrina Kaif, Jacqueline Fernandez, Varun Dhawan and Bobby Deol were among the celebrities who were spotted visiting Salman Khan's house in Mumbai following the actor's return after spending two nights in Jodhpur Central Jail. The 52-year-old actor was granted bail on Saturday. Daisy Shah, Malaika Arora Khan, Amrita Arora, Huma Qureshi and her brother Saqib Saleem also visited Salman.

headlines: Chinese man caught smuggling 5 rhino horns jailed for 1 year
text: A court in the Netherlands has awarded a one-year prison sentence to a Chinese man who was caught smuggling five rhino horns and four other horn objects worth around â¬500,000 (â¹4 crore) in his baggage. The man was caught at the Schiphol airport in December, when he was travelling from South Africa to China via Amsterdam.

headlines: Pollard, Bravo sport no. 400 in IPL opener to mark records
text: Windies' Kieron Pollard and Dwayne Bravo wore jerseys number 400 for their respective teams in the IPL opener on Saturday. CSK's Bravo revealed they donned the special jerseys just for the opener to celebrate their personal landmarks. In January, MI's Pollard became the first player to play 400 T20s while Bravo is the first bowler to take 400 T20 wickets.

headlines: Facebook reported in 7 countries for breaking privacy law
text: Facebook has been reported to the data protection authorities for breaking European privacy law in the Netherlands, Norway, Belgium, Spain, Portugal, Italy, and Greece. This comes after the company admitted that around 87 million users' data was affected by the recent data scandal. The reports accused Facebook of failing to protect its users' data and not taking adequate measures.

headlines: Ship rams into historic mansion on coast of Istanbul
text: A tanker crashed into a historic mansion on the coast of Turkish city Istanbul on Saturday after its steering equipment became locked. Although there were no reports of casualties, footage from the crash showed extensive damage to the historic seaside mansion. The Hekimbasi Salih Efendi Mansion has stood on the shores of the Bosphorus Strait since the 18th century.

headlines: Brothers held with 1.3 kg heroin in stomachs in Dubai
text: Two brothers were arrested at the Dubai airport after they allegedly tried to smuggle over 1.3 kg of heroin by hiding it in their stomachs. As many as 108 capsules were recovered from their stomachs, and they were charged with possession and smuggling of drugs. The two are suspected to have been involved in smuggling in the past as well.

headlines: SpaceX, Tesla investor Steve Jurvetson to launch new fund
text: SpaceX and Tesla investor Steve Jurvetson is set to launch his own fund called Future Ventures, according to his Facebook post. "I strongly believe that mission-driven founders forge the future. At Future Ventures, we will support those passionate founders," Jurvetson said. The move comes six months after Jurvetson left the Silicon Valley firm DFJ, amid allegations of sexual misconduct.

headlines: Employees launch website to offer Musk's full-sized masks
text: Two Tesla and SpaceX employees have launched a website called 'elonmask.co' which offers users to download full-sized masks of the startups' CEO Elon Musk. Users can download four printable cutouts of Musk's face with expressions ranging from 'neutral' to 'badass'. The developers explained that they created the project so people can "choose the path of being extraordinary."

headlines: Woman claims she was raped by BJP MLA, tries to kill self
text: A woman tried to commit suicide outside Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's residence on Sunday, alleging that no action was taken despite complaining about being raped by a BJP MLA and his associates. She further claimed she and her family were threatened when they lodged an FIR. "I want all of them arrested. Otherwise, I will kill myself," she said.

headlines: Former Mexico Prez trolls Trump with 'small hands' t-shirt
text: Former President of Mexico Vicente Fox trolled US President Donald Trump by wearing a t-shirt that read, "Can't build a wall if your hands are too small." Fox said the clothing not only represented his opposition to the border wall, but was also about "inclusion, equality and acceptance of all people." Earlier, he had compared Trump to Adolf Hitler.

headlines: CBI questions not related to PNB scam: Ex-RBI Deputy Guv
text: After being questioned by the CBI, former RBI Deputy Governor Harun Rashid Khan clarified that the questions were not related to the PNB scam and Nirav Modi. He said the agency questioned him about the UPA government's 80:20 gold import scheme. He further said he wasn't sure if Nirav Modi was among the beneficiaries of the scheme.
