headlines: 40 CAs under RBI scanner over loan defaults by companies
text: Around 40 Chartered Accountants are under the Reserve Bank of India scanner for suspected illegal activities with defaulting companies, officials said. The RBI is looking to determine whether these CAs helped the entities cause deliberate defaults and later assisted them in restructuring the stressed assets. It is also looking at the role of various key personnel associated with such entities.

headlines: Centre's director on ICICI board changed amid Videocon row
text: The government has changed its nominee on private sector lender ICICI Bank's board amid the ongoing Videocon loan row. It has nominated another Joint Secretary-rank official from the Finance Ministry, Lok Ranjan. It is alleged that Videocon Chairman Venugopal Dhoot gave â¹64 crore to the firm of ICICI CEO Chanda Kochhar's husband after Videocon got a â¹3,250-crore loan from ICICI.

headlines: 70 civilians killed in suspected chemical attack in Syria
text: At least 70 civilians were killed on Saturday after government troops allegedly dropped a barrel bomb containing poisonous chemicals in Syria's Eastern Ghouta. The Syrian government has denied the allegations and called reports of a chemical attack a "fabrication". Meanwhile, the US has said it would demand an immediate response by the international community if the reports are confirmed.

headlines: Space hotel guests will witness 16 sunrises, sunsets in 1 day
text: Guests at Aurora Station, the proposed world's first luxury space hotel, will witness 16 sunrises and 16 sunsets in 24 hours as the hotel will orbit the earth every 90 minutes. The hotel, expected to launch in 2021, will cost $9.5 million (â¹61.6 crore) for a 12-day stay. Guests can also participate in research experiments like growing food in orbit.

headlines: Which Bollywood actors have spent time in jail besides Salman?
text: Besides Salman Khan's recent arrest, Sanjay Dutt was in prison for almost four years after being convicted for illegal possession of weapons in the 1993 Mumbai serial blasts case. In 2009, Shiney Ahuja was arrested for raping his maid. Saif Ali Khan faced arrest when he got into a fistfight with a businessman at a five-star hotel in 2012.

headlines: Saudi Crown Prince meets Google, Apple CEOs in US
text: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman recently met the CEOs of technology giants Google and Apple in the US to discuss digital development in Saudi Arabia. The executives also included Google Co-founder Sergey Brin, Magic Leap CEO Rony Abovitz, and Virgin Founder Richard Branson. It was the Prince's first trip to the US after becoming the heir to the throne.

headlines: Wife not an object, man can't force her to live with him: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Saturday said wife is not a 'chattel' (a personal possession), or object, and a man cannot force her to live with him. It said this while hearing a criminal case filed by a woman against her husband alleging cruelty. The court asked the man to reconsider his desire to reside with his wife against her wish.

headlines: Kerala 1st state to issue norms to declare brain dead cases
text: Kerala has become the first state in the country to issue guidelines for declaring a patient as brain dead. All hospitals in the state will be required to follow the guidelines in order to obtain organs for transplant from the patient. This comes amid growing concerns among the public about possibilities of manipulation to make organs available for transplant.

headlines: Woman with scissors embedded in head takes bus to hospital
text: A 57-year-old Chinese woman survived after a pair of scissors pierced through her skull while she was working on a farm. Following this, she made the one-hour journey to the hospital by herself on a public bus. She later said that she felt numb and did not experience any pain after the mishap occurred.

headlines: Boy tries recreating pic from 5 yrs ago, gets stuck in hole
text: A seven-year-old boy found himself stuck in a three-foot-deep hole at a tourist attraction in England after he tried to recreate a picture taken when he was two years old. Max Morgan was stuck for nearly three hours before firefighters arrived to rescue him. He had bruises on his legs but was not seriously injured.

headlines: Billionaire George Soros' $26 billion fund to trade crypto
text: Billionaire investor George Soros has allowed his $26 billion family office to trade in cryptocurrencies, according to reports. Earlier in January, Soros had said cryptocurrencies are a bubble and cannot function as actual currencies because of their volatility. Notably, Soros has invested in e-commerce company Overstock, which recently launched a crypto trading platform.

headlines: Anushka to get Dadasaheb Phalke Excellence Award as producer
text: Anushka Sharma will reportedly be honoured with the Dadasaheb Phalke Excellence Award for her contribution to films as a producer. The awards, which were established by the Dadasaheb Phalke Film Foundation, recognise contributions to Indian cinema. Anushka has already produced three films 'NH10', 'Phillauri' and 'Pari' under her own production house Clean Slate Films, which she started in 2014.

headlines: Gayle was not picked as RCB considered its future: Kohli
text: Revealing the reason behind Chris Gayle's snub for IPL 2018, RCB captain Virat Kohli said, "He did a great job...but the team dynamic for next three years was taken into consideration." "Infusing new people in the team would give us the balance we require," he added, further claiming that they're looking to being a unit and not rely on individuals.

headlines: Bravo survives as ball hits stumps, gets out 2 balls later
text: Chennai Super Kings batsman Dwayne Bravo got a reprieve in the 19th over as he jabbed down Jasprit Bumrah's slow yorker which rolled back onto the stumps but failed to dislodge the bails. Bravo hit the next ball for a six before being caught out by Mumbai Indians' captain Rohit Sharma on the last ball of the over.

headlines: Clarke denies reports of making comeback to Australian team
text: Former Australian captain Michael Clarke has denied news reports claiming that he is willing to make a comeback to international cricket after Steve Smith and David Warner were banned over ball-tampering. Clarke said he had just made an offer to help Cricket Australia in "any way" including "mentoring the under 14s". Clarke is currently commentating in the IPL.

headlines: Won't give extra water to Wankhede for next 5 yrs: BMC to HC
text: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has informed the Bombay High Court that it won't provide any additional water to Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium for preparing cricket pitches for the next five years. The civic body's response was in reference to a petition which said that water had been "wasted" for cricket matches when Maharashtra was witnessing an acute water shortage in 2016.

headlines: WhatsApp denies reports of keeping track of users' messages
text: Facebook-owned WhatsApp has denied reports that it is keeping track of users' messages saying that it collects very little data and every message is end-to-end encrypted. However, an American tech entrepreneur claimed that WhatsApp was likely mining the information collected by calls made through its platform. Earlier, WhatsApp had admitted to sharing users' information with Facebook.

headlines: Online campaign urges users to boycott Facebook for a day
text: An online campaign called Faceblock is urging Facebook users to boycott the social media platform for a day to protest against the data privacy issues. The campaign has been planned to coincide with Mark Zuckerberg's appearance before the US Congress on April 11. The virtual demonstration aims to "send a powerful message that we demand better," the campaign's spokesperson said.

headlines: Global cyber attack displays image of US flag on screens
text: Several countries, including India, were hacked to display an image of the US flag on screens, the Iranian IT ministry said on Saturday. The image was displayed along with a warning, "Don't mess with our elections". The attack apparently affected 200,000 router switches globally, including 3,500 switches in Iran, the ministry said in a statement.

headlines: TDP MPs detained for trying to protest near PMâs residence
text: Delhi Police and CRPF on Sunday detained Telugu Desam Party (TDP) MPs while they were on their way to protest near PM Modi's residence to demand special status for Andhra Pradesh. "The PM is the person to take decisions...He has to fulfil his promises and that is why we want to raise our demands with him," MP Jayadev Galla said.

headlines: MakeMyTrip may buy stake in Oyo, to delist Treebo, FabHotels
text: Online travel portal MakeMyTrip is reportedly planning to acquire an equity stake in hotel aggregator Oyo following the announcement of a partnership in February. MakeMyTrip is also expected to delist properties of Oyo rivals including Treebo and FabHotels, as part of the deal. This comes more than two years after MakeMyTrip removed Oyo's inventory from its platform citing strategic overlaps.

headlines: 60 prisoners committed suicide in Karnataka jails in 10 yrs
text: Around 60 prisoners committed suicide in various jails across Karnataka in the last ten years, reports said. Some major reasons why inmates killed themselves included depression, guilt, loneliness, and fear of being ostracised. Officials said that counselling is also insufficient as there is only one psychiatrist for 4,000-plus inmates as against a recommendation of one counsellor per 500 inmates.

headlines: False cases being filed against Dalits who protested: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Udit Raj has alleged that the Dalits who had taken part in the Bharat Bandh protests are being targeted and false cases are being filed against them. Appealing to the party to look into the matter immediately, the MP said that not telling the party at the right time would have been a selfish act.

headlines: Air India flight to Delhi diverted due to landing gear snag
text: A Jodhpur-Delhi Air India flight with 142 passengers onboard was diverted to Jaipur on Saturday evening as the landing gear failed to retract after takeoff, officials said. Later, some passengers travelled to their destination by road while others were flown to Delhi on another flight. Meanwhile, the Air India aircraft was flown to Delhi without any passengers for repairs. n

headlines: Ludhiana ACP accused of molesting, attacking woman
text: The Ludhiana Assistant Police Commissioner has been accused of molesting and attacking a woman. The woman claimed that her brother was threatening her with some personal photos and had shown them to the ACP. The accused then took her to another room, molested her, and thrashed and abused her when she protested.

headlines: Russian cyclist thrashed after being mistaken for thief
text: Russian cyclist V Oleg, who was touring the country, was beaten up by a farmer and his neighbours in Telangana's Bhiknoor after being mistaken for a thief. The Russian national suffered injuries on his jaw, head, and right arm and is undergoing treatment at a hospital in Hyderabad. He had been forced to stop at Bhiknoor due to a thunderstorm.

headlines: Fire at Trump Tower in New York kills 1, injures 6
text: At least one person was killed and six others were injured after a fire broke out at the Trump Tower in New York, US, on Saturday. President Donald Trump, who has a private residence and an office in the tower, was not in the building at the time of the incident. The cause of the blaze is still unknown.

headlines: ED seizes â¹3.7 cr in bank fraud done during demonetisation
text: The Enforcement Directorate has attached â¹3.71 crore of two firms for alleged misuse of third-party bank accounts for cash deposits after demonetisation. Officials of Bank of India, Gaya, allegedly in connivance with four individuals deposited demonetised currency in the bank accounts of various persons without their knowledge. The money was then transferred to the accounts of the two companies.

headlines: Cash vans should have CCTV, GPS, wireless sets: RBI
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has said that cash vans of banks should have CCTV, wireless communication, GPS connectivity and tubeless tyres. The service provider must have a net worth of â¹100 crore and a minimum fleet of 300 specifically fabricated cash vans. As per the guidelines, no cash van should move without armed guards.

headlines: Lifter Punam clinches gold, takes India's medal tally to 7
text: Weightlifter Punam Yadav bagged the gold medal in the women's 69 kg category on Sunday to take India's overall medal tally to seven at the Commonwealth Games 2018. The 22-year-old athlete lifted a total of 222 kg to finish first. It was her career's second Commonwealth Games medal, having bagged a bronze in the 2014 edition in Glasgow.

headlines: 16-year-old shooter Manu Bhaker sets CWG record to bag gold
text: India's 16-year-old shooter Manu Bhaker shot a total of 240.9 to set Commonwealth Games record and bag gold in the women's 10m Air Pistol at the Gold Coast Games on Sunday. Another Indian shooter Heena Sidhu finished second in the event, scoring 234. India have won one bronze, two silver and six gold medals so far at the CWG 2018.

headlines: Dhoni-led CSK defeat MI in last over on return to IPL
text: Two-time champions CSK, who returned to the IPL after serving a two-year suspension period, defeated defending champions Mumbai Indians in the season opener on Saturday. CSK, who had slumped to 118-8 at one stage while chasing, were driven by all-rounder Dwayne Bravo, who slammed 68 runs in 30 balls including seven sixes. CSK will next face KKR on April 10.

headlines: Passenger train travels for 10 km without engine in Odisha
text: The Ahmedabad-Puri Express with passengers on board travelled without an engine for 10 kilometres in Odisha on Saturday night. The incident occurred as the engine shunting procedure was not applied properly, following which the concerned persons-in-charge were suspended. The train was stopped by placing stones on the track, while all the passengers were reported to be safe.

headlines: Who are the college dropouts who went on to become billionaires?
text: Some of the world's richest people are college dropouts, including Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates who had dropped out of Harvard University and is now worth $90.3 billion. Late Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs dropped out of Reed College after attending just one semester. Wipro Chairman Azim Premji dropped out of Stanford University in 1966 following his father's sudden death.

headlines: Gymnasts penalised for not having Emblem of India on attire
text: The Indian women's gymnastics trio of Aruna Budda Reddy, Pranati Nayak and Pranati Das were penalised 0.3 points each and India additionally received a penalty of 1.0 point in the team final at the 2018 Commonwealth Games. The penalties came after it was found that the National Emblem was missing from their attire and they were not wearing identical attire.

headlines: Shooter Ravi Kumar wins bronze, 10th medal for India at CWG
text: Shooter Ravi Kumar clinched a bronze medal on Sunday, taking India's medal tally at the 2018 Commonwealth Games to 10, which includes six golds and two silvers. He scored 224.1 in the men's 10m Air Rifle to finish third while another Indian shooter Deepak Kumar, who had set the qualification record earlier in the day, finished sixth.

headlines: Woman forgets passport at hotel, stranger helps get it back
text: A woman who forgot her passport at a hotel in Japanese city Kyoto and was supposed to catch a flight from Tokyo airport asked for help on Reddit. She asked if anyone was travelling to Tokyo and would be willing to bring the passport to her. Following this, a stranger took a train from Kyoto to Tokyo to return it.

headlines: Hotel slippers help police nab thief in US
text: A man who allegedly committed several robberies was nabbed by US police after a woman said she had video surveillance of the suspect. The video showed the man attempting to steal items from unlocked cars while wearing hotel slippers. The police arrested the suspect after checking a local hotel near the crime scene to see if he was staying there.

headlines: India's Vikas Thakur lifts total 351 kg, wins bronze at CWG
text: Indian weightlifter Vikas Thakur lifted a total of 351 kg to win bronze in men's 94 kg event at the Commonwealth Games on Sunday. This was India's fifth medal of the day including two golds and one silver. India are currently on the fourth spot in the medal tally with 11 medals including eight in weightlifting and three in shooting.

headlines: Mary Kom assured of medal on Commonwealth Games debut
text: Mary Kom assured India of another medal on her debut at the Commonwealth Games after advancing to the semifinals of the women's 48 kg boxing event on Sunday. Her win also assured the Indian boxing contingent of its first CWG medal. The five-time world champion will face Sri Lanka's Anusha Dilrukshi in the semifinal on April 11.

headlines: Messi's hat-trick helps BarÃ§a equal La Liga unbeaten record
text: Lionel Messi scored a hat-trick as La Liga leaders Barcelona equalled the league record of 38 games unbeaten with 3-1 win over Leganes on Saturday. Barcelona are now 12 points clear at the top, with second-placed AtlÃ©tico Madrid set to face Real Madrid today. Messi's goals included a 30-yard free-kick, which curled into the top-right corner.

headlines: Man Utd post comeback win to deny City record title victory
text: Manchester United scored three second-half goals to register a 3-2 comeback win on Saturday to deny Manchester City from winning Premier League title in record time. City were looking to become the first team to win the Premier League with six matches to spare. City have recorded 84 points from 32 matches this season, 13 points more than second-placed United.

headlines: Would not do business with those not using encryption: Cook
text: Talking about how encryption is important to protecting user data, Apple CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview said, "I would do business with no one that wasn't doing that." He also said that no one should be able to eavesdrop on users' messages and phone calls. "The only way to protect your data is to encrypt it," he added.

headlines: US Senator warns to break up Facebook over privacy issues
text: US Senator Ron Wyden has warned that Facebook could be broken up if the company doesn't take steps to protect users' privacy. "There have been a number of proposals and ideas for doing it... unless [Zuckerberg] finds a way... he's gonna have a law on his hands," he said. The Senator also said that he would support such a law.

headlines: PM Modi had asked TDP to join NDA alliance: Andhra CM
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu has claimed that PM Narendra Modi had urged the TDP to join the NDA alliance during the 2014 elections. Stating that PM Modi had expressed sympathy towards the state, CM Naidu said he allied with BJP for Andhra Pradesh's sake. Recently, TDP exited the alliance over the state's demand for special status.

headlines: Ink thrown at Hardik Patel outside Madhya Pradesh restaurant
text: A man allegedly threw ink at Patidar leader Hardik Patel while he was being welcomed to a restaurant in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Saturday. The accused, who was protesting against Patel's visit to the state, was beaten up by people present at the spot and was later apprehended by the police. Patel is currently on a three-day visit to MP.

headlines: 3 mobile apps launched for Karnataka Assembly elections
text: The Election Commission has launched three mobile apps for voters ahead of Karnataka Assembly polls on May 12. The apps titled Model Code of Conduct Reporting, Election Officers' Directory, and Election Quiz aim to encourage citizens for better participation in the electoral process. They would reportedly help voters get poll-related information and report violations of the code of conduct.

headlines: Have to work to liberate Kashmir, destroy India: JuD
text: At a rally in Pakistan's Gujranwala, 26/11 Mumbai attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed's terror group Jamaat-ud-Daawa (JuD) said it has to work for the liberation of Kashmir and destruction of India. "Kashmir is likely to be liberated soon and India will be wiped out from the map of the world," JuD leader Ahsanullah Muntazir said.

headlines: Don't know why India obsessed with impeachment: SC judge
text: Justice Chelameswar, one of the Supreme Court judges who had spoken against CJI Dipak Misra, on Saturday said, "I do not know why the nation is obsessed with impeachment." He added that there have to be other mechanisms to deal with such problems. This comes amid reports that Congress may move an impeachment motion against the CJI.

headlines: Can't call India intolerant based on few stray incidents: VP
text: Speaking at the 60th anniversary of The Foreign Correspondentsâ Club of South Asia, Vice President Venkaiah Naidu said that the entire country cannot be described as intolerant based on some stray incidents of communal violence. "India is a flourishing and vibrant parliamentary democracy with a free press and complete religious freedom to its people," the Vice President added.

headlines: Kin of Iraq victims from WB receive â¹5 lakh compensation
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has awarded â¹5 lakh compensation to the families of the two West Bengal-based workers who were abducted and killed by the ISIS in Iraq in 2014. The bodies of the 38 Indian victims were handed over to their families after MoS for External Affairs VK Singh brought the mortal remains to India earlier this week.

headlines: Is word 'chinki' notified as casteist remark, HC asks CBI
text: The Delhi HC asked the CBI to check if 'chinki', a word used to refer to people from northeast India, has been notified as casteist remark under SC/ST laws. The court sought clarification after it was informed there was no such government notification. It was hearing pleas against a lower court's decision acquitting people accused of beating a northeast student.

headlines: 7,000 buses booked for violating pollution norms in Delhi
text: Addressing the state Assembly, Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said over 7,000 buses were booked for violating pollution norms in the last six years in the national capital. While 3,328 buses booked for not having valid Pollution Under Control (PUC) certificates were registered in Uttar Pradesh, 643 buses were registered in Delhi. The fine for not having PUC is â¹1,000.

headlines: IITs to add 779 seats exclusively for women this year
text: Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) will be offering 779 additional seats exclusively for women this year, in a bid to improve the gender ratio in the B.Tech programme. Of the 779 seats, the largest portion of 113 will go to IIT Kharagpur. This year onwards, the quota will be increased every year till the number of women students reaches 20%.

headlines: Funds given to spread violence in SC/ST protest: MP Police
text: The Madhya Pradesh Police has said that several organisations and individuals were provided funds to spread violence during the protests against the alleged dilution of the SC/ST act. Adding that money was provided for banners, posters, and lathis, police officials said, "It was but natural that youngsters armed with lathis would indulge in violence."

headlines: 6L names removed from MP voter list: Chief Electoral Officer
text: Talking about the Madhya Pradesh voter list, Chief Electoral Officer Saleena Singh said so far the names of 6.7 lakh voters, who shifted or died, have been removed. The Election Commission is getting the information from district collectors to update the list, she added. In February, the Congress had filed a complaint with the EC alleging discrepancies in the list.

headlines: Meghalaya Minister's son driving Mercedes hits bike, 1 dead
text: A Meghalaya police constable was killed on Friday night after a Mercedes car driven by state Health Minister Alexander Hek's son Aibansharai Nongsiej rammed into a bike. A jail official driving the bike was grievously injured and constable Probat R Marak, who was riding pillion, was declared brought dead by a hospital.

headlines: 4 killed, 20 injured as van rams into crowd in Germany
text: As many as four people were killed and 20 others were injured after a van rammed into a crowd in the German city of MÃ¼nster on Saturday. Police had cordoned off the site of the incident and urged people to avoid visiting the area. Police officials said that the driver of the car had killed himself.

headlines: No new episode of Kapil Sharmaâs show to air this weekend
text: 'Family Time With Kapil Sharma' will not air any new episodes this weekend, as per a representative from the channel which owns the show. Reruns of the comedy show will be telecast instead. On Friday, Kapil posted a series of abusive tweets against the media, which a journalist alleged was due to the negative reviews that his show received.

headlines: Shekhar Suman's Facebook account hacked, vulgar content shared
text: TV actor and producer Shekhar Suman has confirmed his Facebook account was hacked on Friday. "I am highly disappointed...I started getting calls that someone...hacked my account and posted some nude pictures and objectionable material on my wall," said Suman. He added that he will report the matter to the cyber crime cell and may go offline from social media.

headlines: Go home and sleep: Salman to fans at Mumbai house after bail
text: Actor Salman Khan reached Mumbai after he was granted bail and gestured towards his fans gathered outside his house to go home and sleep. Salman was seen with his father Salim Khan and nephew Ahil Sharma waving at his fans from his balcony. The actor was released from the Jodhpur Central Jail earlier on Saturday after spending two nights there.

headlines: MS Dhoni captaining a side for first time in 13 months
text: MS Dhoni, who is leading CSK in the IPL opener against MI today, is captaining a side for the first time since March last year. Dhoni had stepped down as Team India captain in January last year and was removed as RPS captain for IPL 2017. He last led Jharkhand against Bengal in Vijay Hazare Trophy on March 18, 2017.

headlines: 14 killed as Canadian ice hockey team bus crashes into truck
text: Fourteen people were killed after a bus carrying a group of Canadian junior ice hockey players collided with a truck on a highway in Saskatchewan on Friday. Fourteen more were injured, including three critically, in the accident involving a team playing at Canada's junior hockey level. The team comprised 24 players with the youngest aged 16 and the oldest 21.

headlines: Cong MP calls for special session after Parliament washout
text: In a letter to Rajya Sabha Chairman Venkaiah Naidu, Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has requested the government to organise a special parliamentary session in May or June. Stating that the "complete washout" at the recently-concluded budget session inflicted "great damage" to the institution, Ramesh added that a two-week session should be organised to facilitate debate and pass important bills.

headlines: Form Cauvery board or TN will seek separate state: A Raja
text: Former Telecom Minister A Raja has said the Tamil community will agitate and demand for "a separate state of Tamil Nadu" if the Centre does not form the Cauvery Management Board. This comes after the Centre failed to form the board despite the Supreme Court deadline of March 29. Earlier, the SC reduced Tamil Nadu's quota of water.

headlines: Some PSBs can be privatised but not right now: SBI Chairman
text: SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said this is not the right time for privatisation of public sector banks (PSBs), though some of them could be divested after being strengthened. "Before privatisation, banks need to be made stronger so that they fetch the right price," he added. He said it would take at least two years for banks to be strengthened.

headlines: How did govt agencies crack Vadodara firm's â¹2,650 cr fraud?
text: After receiving a letter on the â¹2,654-crore fraud by Diamond Power Infrastructure, the PMO directed the Finance Ministry, CBI, and ED to ascertain facts. The Finance Ministry directed banks to submit full details and Bank of India filed a complaint to CBI within a week of PMO receiving the letter. The agency then raided the company and booked its directors.

headlines: Assam hikes MLAs' salary by 33%, CM to get â¹1.6L per month
text: The Assam Assembly has passed three bills for increasing the monthly salary of the Chief Minister, Assembly Speaker, Deputy Speaker, ministers, and MLAs by 33-50%. While the Chief Minister's salary and allowance will be hiked to â¹1.64 lakh from â¹1.07 lakh, salaries of MLAs will be increased by 33.3% to â¹80,000. The decision will be applicable from this month.

headlines: China's influence in Maldives cause of concern: US
text: Amid reports of China's land grabbing in Maldives, the US has said that China's influence in the island nation was a cause of concern for all nations, including India. US' Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for South and Southeast Asia, Joseph Felter, also cited China's growing influence in Pakistan and Sri Lanka as a strategic threat in the Indo-Pacific region.

headlines: Afghanistan accepts Pak offer to resume talks with Taliban
text: Afghanistan has accepted Pakistan's offer to resume direct talks with the Taliban, Pakistan PM Shahid Abbasi said on Saturday. In a joint statement, Pakistan and Afghanistan called on the Taliban to join the talks without delay. Pakistan had offered to mediate in Afghanistan-Taliban talks after President Ashraf Ghani said he was ready to recognise the Taliban as a political group.

headlines: 800 flee Venezuela to Brazil daily amid economic crisis: UN
text: As many as 800 Venezuelans flee daily to neighbouring Brazil to escape the violence, hunger and lack of shelter in the country, the UN High Commissioner for Refugees said. The global refugee agency added that Venezuelans also fled to Colombia and Panama, among other countries. This comes as Venezuela faces its worst economic crisis amid hyperinflation and shortage of cash.

headlines: ITC restrained from using juice ads targeting rivals
text: The Delhi High Court has asked ITC not to continue its advertising campaign for juice brand 'B Natural' with hashtag "SayNoToConcentrate" which allegedly targeted rival juice brands. This comes after a suit was filed by PepsiCo India that sells juice under Tropicana brand. ITC published advertisements saying: "Dear Tropicana and Real, come join us in making Indian juices concentrate-free".

headlines: Loss of â¹800 cr in business avoided by Salman's bail: Report
text: As per reports, a loss of â¹800 crore of business in film projects has been avoided following actor Salman Khan's bail in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case. The 52-year-old actor was either acting in or producing, through his production houses, several upcoming films, projected to be reportedly worth around â¹800 crore.

headlines: Armour worn by Russell Crowe in Gladiator sells for â¹62 lakh
text: The torso armour that actor Russell Crowe wore in the 2000 film 'Gladiator' has been sold 125,000 Australian dollars (over â¹62 lakh) at an auction in Sydney. The sale was part of an auction titled 'Russell Crowe: The Art of Divorce', where the actor sold items he shared with his former wife Danielle Spencer.

headlines: Sanjay, Ranbir, Vaani to star in upcoming YRF film: Report
text: As per reports, Sanjay Dutt, Ranbir Kapoor and Vaani Kapoor will star in an upcoming Yash Raj Films (YRF) production. The film will reportedly be directed by Karan Malhotra, whose last directorial was the Akshay Kumar and Sidharth Malhotra starrer 'Brothers'. The untitled project is said to be part of a three film deal that Karan has signed with YRF.

headlines: Why is CSK's Dwayne Bravo wearing jersey number 400 vs MI?
text: Chennai Super Kings all-rounder Dwayne Bravo is wearing the jersey number 400 instead of his usual number 47 in the IPL opener against Mumbai Indians today. Bravo had become the first bowler in T20 cricket history to take 400 wickets in December last year. The 34-year-old had revealed he would wear the jersey number 400 just for the opening game.

headlines: Pak-born SA cricketer Tahir tweets in Tamil ahead of IPL
text: Pakistan-born South African spinner Imran Tahir posted a tweet in Tamil ahead of the Indian Premier League 2018 opener on Saturday. The 39-year-old spinner, who represents Chennai Super Kings in the T20 league, shared a picture of his jersey and wrote, "Itâs time to start the vehicle and finish the job quick. Whistle podu!"

headlines: Nadal records longest winning streak in World Cup of Tennis
text: World number one Rafael Nadal set a new Davis Cup record for the longest winning streak in the competition after winning his overall 23rd straight Davis Cup match while facing Germany's Philip Kohlschreiber. The world number one and 16-time Grand Slam champion's win helped Spain draw level with Germany in the quarterfinals of the event.

headlines: Akhtar mentions Kashmir in tweet on Salman, deletes it later
text: Ex-Pakistani pacer Shoaib Akhtar took to Twitter to hail the Jodhpur court's decision of granting bail to Salman Khan and said he wants "all the troubled area of the world" including Kashmir to be free. However, he deleted the tweet later. Earlier this week, Shahid Afridi tweeted about the "appalling and worrisome situation" in Kashmir, urging UN to take action.

headlines: Indrani Mukerjea admitted to hospital in delirious state
text: The prime accused in the Sheena Bora murder case, Indrani Mukerjea, was rushed to a Mumbai hospital's emergency ward in a delirious condition on Friday. Mukerjea, who has been lodged in Byculla jail since 2015, was later shifted to the critical care unit and is still under observation, reports said. She had complained of uneasiness and breathing difficulties, police said.

headlines: Talks with northeast insurgent groups in final stage: Rijiju
text: Union Minister for Home Kiren Rijiju on Saturday said the government's peace talks with northeast insurgent groups have reached their final stage. The government has agreed to several genuine demands of the militant group ULFA (P), he added. The Centre is conducting talks with the NSCN (IM) and northeast sovereignty will not be compromised, he further said.

headlines: Russia-bound plane makes emergency landing at Delhi airport
text: A Russia-bound aircraft with 345 passengers onboard made an emergency landing at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Saturday after suffering an engine failure, an airport spokesperson said. The passengers onboard the non-scheduled flight, which had taken off from Vietnam's PhÃº Quá»c, were safely evacuated. At least eight fire tenders were rushed to the spot.

headlines: Bayern seal 6th straight Bundesliga title with 5 games to go
text: Bayern Munich registered a 4-1 comeback victory against Augsburg on Saturday to win their record-extending sixth consecutive Bundesliga title with five matches to spare. Bayern have now won 28 German first division titles including 27 in the Bundesliga era. Bayern top the table with 72 points, having won 23 out of 29 matches this season.

headlines: Actress goes topless slamming casting couch in Telugu films
text: Actress Sri Reddy went topless outside the Telugu Film Chamber of Commerce at Jubilee Hills in Hyderabad to protest against casting couch in the Telugu film industry. Sri Reddy said that her protest was over the film chamber's silence over incidents of casting couch. The police later took her away from the Chamber's premises.

headlines: Henry Ford's first vehicle didn't have a steering wheel
text: The first vehicle made by Henry Ford, the Founder of Ford Motor Company, had a tiller instead of a steering wheel. The 'Quadricycle', which was made in 1896, had two forward gears, no reverse gear, no brakes and a doorbell button as a horn. Ford sold his Quadricycle for $200 and used the money to build his second car.

headlines: Hum really saath saath hai: Sonakshi on Salman's bail
text: After Salman Khan was granted bail in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case, Sonakshi Sinha shared a picture with the actor using the hashtag 'Hum really saath saath hai'. Singer Adnan Sami tweeted, "So happy for the bail of my dear brother Salman Khan. Come home...Jai Ho!" Meanwhile, Salman's 'Dabangg' co-star Sonu Sood wrote, "A Good deed is the best Prayer."

headlines: On what conditions has Salman Khan been granted bail?
text: Salman Khan, who was granted bail on Saturday in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case, cannot leave the country without the Jodhpur Sessions Court's permission. The other terms on the basis of which he was given bail included submission of two bonds of â¹25,000 each. The actor has to appear in the Jodhpur court on May 7 for the next hearing.

headlines: Salman Khan released after 2 nights in Jodhpur Central Jail
text: Salman Khan has been released from Jodhpur Central Jail after spending two nights at the jail following his bail on Saturday. Amandeep Singh Kapoor, DCP (East) Jodhpur, earlier stated security was being arranged in transit and at the airport for the actor, who is expected to fly back to Mumbai. Salman was convicted in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case.

headlines: Kapil's girlfriend Ginni posted abusive tweets: Ex-Girlfriend
text: Kapil Sharma's ex-girlfriend Preeti Simoes said that she is certain his girlfriend Ginni Chatrath must have used his phone to post abusive tweets from his official account. "If this is what Ginni and her one year with Kapil has brought him to, I feel sorry for...them," added Preeti. She further said that the Kapil she knew was intelligent and dynamic.

headlines: Which players have played both for CSK and Mumbai Indians?
text: Former pacer Ashish Nehra represented Mumbai Indians in the inaugural edition of the IPL and played for Chennai Super Kings in the 2014 and 2015 editions. Wicketkeeper-batsman Parthiv Patel has played three seasons each for both the teams. Harbhajan Singh and Ambati Rayudu were bought by CSK in January after having played for only Mumbai Indians in the IPL.

headlines: Chennai Super Kings have the best winning percentage in IPL
text: CSK, who are returning to the IPL after two years, have the best winning %age in the league's history. The Chennai-based franchise is followed by three-time champions Mumbai Indians, who have won record 91 matches with a winning %age of 58.28. Delhi Daredevils, the only team among the eight to never reach the final, have the worst winning %age.

headlines: Will walk shirtless in London if we win World Cup: Kohli
text: India captain Virat Kohli has reiterated former skipper Sourav Ganguly's statement that the former will walk shirtless on London's Oxford Street if India win the 2019 World Cup. "I don't think it will only be me. For sure, Hardik will be following me...Bumrah is there as well because he has six packs too. There'll be a few candidates," Kohli said.

headlines: BJP MP writes to PM Modi accusing govt of ignoring Dalits
text: Dalit BJP MP Yashwant Singh from Uttar Pradesh has written to PM Narendra Modi, accusing the Centre of ignoring the Dalits in the country. "Being a Dalit, my capabilities haven't been put to use, I only became an MP because of reservation," Singh wrote. Earlier, Dalit MP Chhote Lal Kharwar wrote to PM Modi, alleging mistreatment by CM Yogi Adityanath.

headlines: Delay in reporting rape doesn't mean victim is lying: HC
text: The Bombay High Court has said that delay in reporting a rape case to the police does not mean that the victim is lying and added that victims fear being shamed by the society. The court upheld the 10-year jail term awarded to four men, who highlighted that the victim lodged a gangrape complaint two days after the incident occurred.

headlines: 'HornVrat' aims to curb constant honking in Mumbai
text: In an attempt to curb constant honking in Mumbai, an NGO named 'Awaaz Foundation' has launched a campaign called 'HornVrat' in cooperation with the state's transport department and Mumbai Police. As part of the campaign, an auto rickshaw decorated with blow horns is being taken out on the streets of Mumbai urging people to refrain from honking.

headlines: Japan activates 1st marine unit since WW2 to boost defence
text: Japan has activated its first marine unit since World War II to counter invaders occupying the country's islands along the East China Sea. This comes after China, which also claims the group of islands, announced $175 billion for defence in its budget for 2018. "Given the situation, defence of our islands is critical," Japan's Defence Ministry said.

headlines: Britain's sugar tax on soft drinks comes into effect
text: Britain's sugar tax on soft drinks came into effect on Friday, a move aimed at reversing the trend of obesity among children. The tax will be levied on drinks with sugar content exceeding 5 grams per 100 ml. The tax revenue would be used to fund sports programmes and nutritious breakfast clubs for children, the Public Health Ministry said.

headlines: Pak's largest TV network goes off air on 'military orders'
text: Pakistan's Geo News channel has claimed it has been taken off air in over 80% of the country on the orders of the military. Geo News, Pakistan's largest television network, said its broadcast was shut down last month in residential areas administered by the military. Geo has been critical of the military and Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa's leadership.

headlines: US airport security check increased my respect: Pakistan PM
text: Pakistan's PM Shahid Khaqan Abbasi, who underwent a security check at a US airport last month, said that the check did not reduce his respect as the Prime Minister but instead increased it. Adding that the law is same for everyone, Abbasi said that he had even seen former US President Bill Clinton go through such security checks.

headlines: Russia will never be our friend: US
text: US Ambassador to the UN Nikki Haley has said that the US will never be friends with Russia. Adding that their bilateral ties solely depended on Russia's actions, Haley said the US will "slap" Russia if needed. She further claimed that President Donald Trump's administration has done more against Russia than any other administration since former President Ronald Reagan's tenure.

headlines: PNB's FY18 domestic business crosses â¹10 tn despite fraud
text: State-owned PNB has reported a 7.9% increase in its domestic business, crossing â¹10 trillion turnover for the first time ever in FY18. The increase in its domestic business was despite the â¹13,900-crore fraud linked to jewellers Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi. The domestic deposits of the bank grew 6.2% to â¹6 trillion in 2017-18.

headlines: I have a life beyond cinema, need frequent breaks: Tabu
text: Tabu said she has a life beyond cinema while adding, "If I don't get frequent breaks from acting, then I...get a bit restless." She added, "There are these phases I have, where I (don't) want to work and do a variety of things." She further said she loves signing films, where the shoot can wrap up as soon as possible.

headlines: Salman has done a cameo in jail, tweets user on actor's bail
text: Reacting to Salman Khan being granted bail on Saturday two days after being convicted, a user tweeted, "Salman has done cameos in Judwaa 2 and jail." "Salman's journey from Jail to Bail lasted longer than relationships these days," wrote another user. However, another tweet read, "Serving 5 years in jail was too harsh a punishment after 20 years of trial."

headlines: Shahid shares video of himself dancing to 'Dame Tu Cosita'
text: Shahid Kapoor has shared a video of himself on Instagram, where he is seen dancing to the song 'Dame Tu Cosita', while copying an animated green alien's steps that have gone viral on social media. Other celebrities including Jacqueline Fernandez, Mallika Dua and Divyanka Tripathi have also shared videos dancing to the song, which is by DJ El Chombo.

headlines: Weightlifter does backflip after lifting 136kg at CWG 2018
text: Australian weightlifter Francois Etoundi did a backflip to celebrate after lifting 136kg in the snatch category of the men's 77kg event at the Commonwealth Games 2018 on Saturday. Etoundi, who later tore his bicep at the event, went on to win bronze by lifting a combined total of 305kg. It was the 33-year-old weightlifter's second successive Commonwealth Games bronze medal.

headlines: Pujara nicknamed 'Steve' as teammates fail to pronounce name
text: Indian batsman Cheteshwar Pujara has been nicknamed 'Steve' by his Yorkshire teammates as they find it difficult to pronounce his name. "Initially, they started calling me 'Puj', but they have started calling me Steve again. It's a good nickname, but I prefer Cheteshwar," said the 30-year-old batsman. Pujara's county deal was finalised after he failed to bag an IPL contract.

headlines: The first-ever ODI hundred was scored in the second ODI
text: ODI cricket's first-ever hundred was scored by England's Dennis Amiss in the second ODI against Australia in August 1972, a year after the first-ever ODI. Amiss, born on April 7, 1943, scored the hundred off 130 balls in what was his debut match. He also shared the first-ever ODI hundred partnership, adding 125 runs with Keith Fletcher in the match.

headlines: SpaceX didn't show Earth during launch over lack of license
text: SpaceX didn't show images of Earth captured by cameras on the Falcon 9 rocket which was launched recently as it didn't have a license. SpaceX reportedly received a warning from a US government agency after the live stream of Tesla Roadster car launched into space showed the Earth. SpaceX had been unaware of the license requirement, an official said.

headlines: Delhi man kills, chops friend's body over affair with wife
text: A Delhi man allegedly killed his friend and later chopped up his body into seven pieces as he suspected him of having an affair with his wife. The accused reportedly sent his wife to her maternal home and invited his friend to his home, where he carried out the crime. The accused stuffed the chopped body pieces in the refrigerator.

headlines: UK opens 1st permanent military base in Middle East in 50yrs
text: The UK has opened a naval base in Bahrain, its first permanent military base in the Middle East in nearly 50 years. The base will host around 300 British troops and support personnel. As part of the US-led coalition fighting the Islamic State in Syria, the base is aimed at helping the UK tackle security threats in the Gulf region.

headlines: Salman Khan granted bail in 1998 blackbuck poaching case
text: Actor Salman Khan will be released from Jodhpur Central Jail on Saturday after he was granted bail by a Jodhpur court in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case on a surety of â¹50,000. The court earlier sentenced him to five years in prison and also imposed a fine of â¹10,000. Following the sentence, Salman had spent two nights in jail.

headlines: Venkat lifts 338kg to give India 2nd gold of the day at CWG
text: Weightlifter Ragala Venkat Rahul lifted 338kg in the men's 85kg event on Saturday to give India their second gold medal of the day at the Commonwealth Games 2018. The 21-year-old lifter, making his debut at the Games, lifted 151kg and 187kg in snatch and clean and jerk categories respectively. Earlier today, Sathish Sivalingam won gold in the men's 77kg event.

headlines: 3 arrested over CBSE Class 12 Economics paper leak
text: Police on Saturday arrested a school teacher, a clerk, and a support staffer from Himachal Pradesh's Una district over the CBSE Class 12 Economics paper leak. Earlier this month, Delhi Police arrested three people from Bawana over their involvement in the leak, which occurred around 40 minutes before the exam began. The paper was leaked in handwritten form on WhatsApp.

headlines: Data on most of 2 billion users was vulnerable: Facebook
text: Facebook has admitted that data on most of its 2 billion users' was vulnerable and users' public profiles could have been scraped by malicious entities. A feature that allowed users to enter a person's phone number or email address into Facebook Search to help find them was abused, Facebook said. It added that the feature has been disabled now.

headlines: Kapil is suicidal, I'm scared for him: Ex-girlfriend Preeti
text: Comedian Kapil Sharma's ex-manager and ex-girlfriend Preeti Simoes, while reacting to his abusive tweets that have now been deleted, said, "I think he is suicidal and I am scared for him." She added, "I think he needs his family to take care of him and put him in the hands of experts...because clearly he is not in his right senses."

headlines: Paes most successful doubles player in 'World Cup of Tennis'
text: Indian tennis player Leander Paes set the record for the most number of doubles wins in Davis Cup, also known as the 'World Cup of Tennis', registering his 43rd win in the doubles rubber of the Asia/Oceania Group I tie. Paes teamed with Rohan Bopanna to beat China's doubles pair. India won 3-2 to advance to the World Group Play-offs.

headlines: Device that reads words user doesn't speak aloud developed
text: Researchers have developed a device to transcribe words that a user verbalises internally but doesn't speak out aloud. The device picks and feeds neuromuscular signals, in the jaw and face that are triggered by internal verbalizations invisible to the human eye, to a system trained to correlate particular signals with particular words. It conveys information to users via bone-conduction.

headlines: Facebook suspends Canadian firm amid data scandal probe
text: Facebook has suspended Canadian firm AggregateIQ claiming it may be affiliated with Cambridge Analytica and improperly received its users' data. In response to Facebook's action, AggregateIQ said that it has never been and is not a part of Cambridge Analytica. Earlier, it was revealed that Cambridge Analytica exploited the data of Facebook users to meddle in the US elections.

headlines: Could've addressed user data leak 2.5 yrs ago: Facebook COO
text: Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg has admitted the company could've addressed the Cambridge Analytica data leak "two and a half years ago". "We thought the data had been deleted and we should have checked," Sandberg said, adding that Cambridge Analytica had assured Facebook it was deleted. Facebook didn't inform users about the leak because "we thought" it was deleted, she added.

headlines: Firm accused of FB leak denies using data of users in India
text: The firm accused of exploiting Facebook users' data to influence the US Presidential elections has denied using data of users in India. Cambridge Analytica said that it has done surveys in India and followed proper guidelines, a government official said. Facebook had earlier revealed that data on up to 5,62,455 users in India may have been shared with Cambridge Analytica.

headlines: Modi Scam Alert: Rahul on $15bn plan to buy fighter jets
text: After Defence Ministry began the process for procuring around 110 fighter jets for the Indian Air Force at a cost of $15 billion, Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Modi Scam Alert!" Rahul alleged that PM Narendra Modi "re-tendered" the Rafale deal to "favour friends". He further claimed that PM Modi's friends were racing to tie up with "strategic partners".

headlines: Vegetables harvested in Antarctica without daylight and soil
text: Scientists have harvested 3.6 kilograms of lab-grown salad greens, 18 cucumbers, and 70 radishes in Antarctica, without dirt, daylight, or pesticides, in two months, as per the team. They employed a water and nutrient system while optimising LED lighting and monitoring carbon dioxide in the room. They hope to harvest 4-5 kilograms of fruits and vegetables a week by May.

headlines: Agreed on new rail line to connect Nepal with India: PM Modi
text: During a joint press conference with Nepalese PM KP Oli on Saturday, PM Narendra Modi said, "We have agreed to work towards a new railway line to connect Kathmandu with India." "We aim at improving waterways and railways with Nepal. Today, we reviewed the progress in various such connectivity projects," PM Modi added.

headlines: Goa issues alert on terrorists entering India via sea route
text: Goa on Friday issued an alert to all vessels and agencies operating off the state's coast after an intelligence input warned of a possible terrorist attack on the Indian western coast, state Ports Minister Jayesh Salgaonkar said. The Indian Coast Guard input suggested that an Indian fishing vessel seized by Pakistan may carry terrorists on its way back to India.

headlines: Pak woman facing death row released after 20yrs in prison
text: A Pakistani woman, Asma Nawab, facing a death sentence for killing her family in 1998, has been acquitted after 20 years in prison. Nawab and her then-fiance Farhan were convicted of the alleged crime on the basis that the family had not given the couple permission to marry. Nawab has now been released as there wasn't sufficient evidence against her.

headlines: WTO favours China, unfair to US: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Friday slammed the World Trade Organisation (WTO) saying the international trade body was âunfairâ to the US. He added, "[China] gets tremendous perks and advantages, especially over the US." This comes after China launched a WTO challenge against the US' proposal to impose tariffs on Chinese imports over alleged theft of intellectual property.

headlines: 3 quit Nobel literature academy in protest over sex scandal
text: Three judges of the Nobel literature prize-awarding academy have resigned in protest over close ties between the institution and an artistic director accused of sexually assaulting several members and their wives and daughters. The decision to quit came after a vote that concluded a member with close ties to the accused will not be excluded from the academy.

headlines: This is all imagination: Videocon chief on lookout notice
text: Denying the news of a look out circular against him, Videocon Group Chairman Venugopal Dhoot has said, "This is all your imagination." He said that his passport expired two months back and he hasn't gone out of the country for last five years. "God is watching from above and he will punish all those who are spreading rumours," Dhoot added.

headlines: Levi's sues Louis Vuitton-maker's unit on trademark breach
text: Levi Strauss & Co has sued Louis Vuitton maker LVMH's unit Kenzo over trademark infringement. Kenzo allegedly used Levi's federally-protected tab on an array of garments, including those in a new clothing line featuring singer Britney Spears. Levi's said it has put distinctive tabs bearing its name attached to its garments' pockets since 1936 for "sight identification" for its products.

headlines: Cryptocurrencies not legal tender: Pakistan's central bank
text: Pakistan's central bank on Friday declared that cryptocurrencies were not legal tender in the country. The State Bank of Pakistan told banks and other financial services providers to refuse customers seeking crypto-currency transactions. Earlier, the RBI on Thursday barred all entities it regulates from providing services to any individual or business dealing in cryptocurrencies.

headlines: 'Raid' becomes 4th film in 2018 to enter â¹100 crore club
text: With earnings of â¹100.14 crore, Ajay Devgn starrer 'Raid' has become the fourth film in 2018 to enter the â¹100 crore club. The film crossed the â¹100 crore mark within twenty-two days of its release. The other three films of 2018 which earned over â¹100 crore are 'Padmaavat', 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety' and 'Baaghi 2'.

headlines: CWG's oldest athlete once foiled an airplane hijack attempt
text: Canada's 79-year-old shooter Robert Pitcairn, who is the oldest athlete to take part in the Commonwealth Games, once foiled a hijack attempt aboard an airplane carrying 120 passengers in 1974. Pitcairn, who was a commercial pilot, was introduced to the sport of shooting as a cadet in the Air Force. Notably, Pitcairn narrowly failed to qualify for Manchester 2002.

headlines: Will invite chacha Nitish, uncle Modi to wedding: Lalu's son
text: Confirming the reports of his marriage getting fixed with RJD leader Chandrika Rai's daughter Aishwarya Rai, Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tej Pratap said, "I will invite both chacha Nitish and uncle Sushil Modi." Talking about the verbal exchange between him and Bihar Deputy CM Modi last year, Tej said, "All is past now."

headlines: IIT alumni's ed-tech startup Smartivity raises â¹35 lakh
text: S Chand & Company will invest â¹35 lakh in Delhi-based ed-tech startup Smartivity, filings have revealed. In 2016, Smartivity had raised $1 million (around â¹6 crore) in pre-Series A funding. Founded in 2015 by IIT alumni Ashwini Kumar, Apoorv Gupta, Rajat Jain, and Pune University graduate Tushar Amin, Smartivity makes engagement-driven smarter learning experiences and toys for children.

headlines: Mumbai to get children's traffic park to teach traffic rules
text: Mumbai's Thane will get a children's traffic park which will educate children on traffic rules, emergency services and road safety through lane markings, zebra crossings and road signages. The park will have displays, demonstrations, slide shows, workshops, exhibition and street plays to explain the rules. "The park also has cycle training tracks for people to learn bike riding,â officials said.

headlines: Muslims weave garlands for Hindu temples in J'khand village
text: Around 40 Muslim families in Vikhrajpur village in Jharkhand have been growing flowers and weaving garlands for Hindu temples for the past four decades. The families also decorate temples with flowers free of cost on occasions like Ram Navami and Durga Puja. The flower cultivators had never failed to deliver wreaths during festivities, a local temple priest said.

headlines: Mumbai firm's director arrested for evading service tax, GST
text: Mumbai-based e-commerce website Gadgets Guru's director Rajpal Singh has been arrested on charges of non-payment of service tax and GST. He allegedly defaulted on payment of service tax of â¹3.06 crore and GST of â¹5.78 crore. The firm reportedly failed to pay the requisite amount to authorities despite repeated follow-ups and notices.

headlines: Salman Khan getting VVIP treatment in Jodhpur jail: Reports
text: According to reports, actor Salman Khan is receiving VVIP treatment in Jodhpur Central Jail, where he is currently lodged. He reportedly sleeps in his barrack with a "special air cooler" and also gets the cigarettes he smokes. Families of Deputy Inspector General of the jail and the jailor met Salman with their children and also clicked selfies, reports added.

headlines: AI will destroy humanity without thinking about it: Musk
text: Elon Musk has said, "If AI (artificial intelligence) has a goal and humanity just happens to be in the way, it will destroy humanity as a matter of course without even thinking about it." Musk added AI will never die and "you'd have an immortal dictator". If one company develops "godlike" AI, it'll take over the world, he added.

headlines: Kapil Sharma files complaint against journalist, ex-managers
text: Kapil Sharma has filed a complaint against his ex-manager and rumoured ex-girlfriend Preeti Simoes and her sister Neeti Simoes, accusing them of mental harassment. He also accused journalist Vickey Lalwani of trying to extort him of â¹25 lakh. "Some people just want to defame you...but it'll take ages to stand against the wrong," tweeted Kapil.

headlines: Mandhana's 86 helps India beat Eng by 1 wicket in 1st ODI
text: India's Smriti Mandhana struck a 109-ball 86 to help India chase England's 207 and win by a wicket and five balls to spare in the first ODI on Friday. India's Poonam Yadav and Ekta Bisht took four and three wickets respectively, while during the chase, the duo put up a match-winning 18-run tenth-wicket stand.

headlines: Facebook to label political ads, display who paid for them
text: Facebook has announced it'll label all political advertisements and the label will include information on who has paid for them. Advertisers who want to run political or "issue ads" (political topics that are being debated across the country) will need to be verified, Facebook said. Earlier, it was found that Facebook users' data was exploited to influence the US elections.

headlines: Indian startup to continue in ex-Google funded race to Moon
text: Bengaluru-based startup TeamIndus has decided to continue in Lunar XPrize's race to the Moon, which was previously funded by Google. The competition has been relaunched without a monetary prize after it was cancelled in January. The competition is for privately-funded teams to land a robotic spacecraft on the Moon, travel 500 metres, and transmit data back to Earth.

headlines: Will consider legal action against Apple over DND app: TRAI
text: TRAI Chairman RS Sharma has said, "We will consider taking legal action" against Apple over the delay in taking steps to support the authority's Do-Not-Disturb app on App Store. Apple had earlier said that the app which requires access to user data violates its privacy policy. TRAI had launched the DND app in 2016 to block unsolicited calls and messages.

headlines: Won't delete CEO's texts until 'unsend' feature for all: FB
text: Facebook has said it will introduce an 'unsend' feature for everyone which will let users delete sent messages from a receiver's inbox. "Until this feature is ready, we will no longer be deleting any executives' messages," Facebook said. This comes after Facebook admitted that it withdraws messages sent by CEO Mark Zuckerberg from the recipients' inboxes to protect communications.

headlines: Guj MLA booked for inciting youth to disrupt PM Modi's rally
text: BJP leader KS Naveen has lodged an FIR against Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani for allegedly inciting youth to disrupt PM Narendra Modi's rally in Karnataka. This comes after Mevani said, "Karnataka youth's biggest role...can be when PM Modi steps foot...for campaign on April 15...throw chairs in the air, disrupt his function and ask him what happened to two crore jobs?"

headlines: Alert at airports against ICICI CEO Chanda Kochhar's husband
text: Indian authorities have issued a look out circular to all airports against ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar's husband Deepak Kochhar and Videocon Group Chairman Venugopal Dhoot. This comes after the CBI filed a preliminary enquiry case against Deepak Kochhar and Dhoot. It is alleged that Dhoot gave â¹64 crore to Deepak's firm after Videocon got a â¹3,250-crore loan from ICICI.

headlines: Friendship more important than treaties: Nepal PM in India
text: During his meeting with President Ram Nath Kovind, Nepalese PM KP Oli said, "Any treaty, any agreement, everything starts from friendship. With our neighbours, particularly from India, we first expect friendship." On being asked why he chose India over China for his first foreign visit after assuming post in February, Oli said, "India invited me and so I visited India."

headlines: Hyderabad University professor discovers two new languages
text: Professor Panchanan Mohanty of the University of Hyderabad has discovered two new languages, namely 'Walmiki' and 'Malhar', spoken in Andhra Pradesh and Odisha. The professor has presented his research at a Foundation for Endangered Languages' conference in UK. The university said the name Walmiki is indicative because "the speech community claims descent from the great Indian saint-poet Valmiki."

headlines: Trump ends 'catch and release' immigration policy
text: US President Donald Trump has signed a memorandum ordering the end of 'catch and release' policy in which illegal immigrants are released from detention while awaiting a court hearing on their status. The memo also asks officials to procure measures to crack down on illegal immigration. "Safety and security of Americans is the President's highest priority," the White House said.

headlines: We've already lost the trade war: US Prez Donald Trump
text: Defending his proposed $100bn tariffs against Chinese goods, US President Donald Trump on Friday said in an interview, "Weâve already lost the trade war. We donât have a trade war." Trump added that there might be little pain but ultimately the country will be much stronger. This comes after China put additional 25% tariff on US imports worth $50 billion.

headlines: My daughter Ananya is a born actor: Chunky Panday
text: Actor Chunky Panday, while talking about his daughter Ananya Panday, said, "She is a born actor." "She wouldn't have been born if she wasn't an actor," he jokingly added. Ananya will reportedly make her Bollywood debut with Karan Johar's 'Student Of The Year 2', which will also star actor Tiger Shroff.

headlines: Watched hate speeches to cultivate anger: Rao on 'Omerta'
text: Rajkummar Rao, while speaking about the film 'Omerta' in which he'll be portraying a terrorist, said, "I watched a lot of documentaries and hate speeches to cultivate anger in me." "Apart from [that], I was also in London, to get used to the accent and learn about the culture there," he added while talking about his preparation for the film.

headlines: Chennai Super Kings nervous on IPL return: CSK coach Fleming
text: Chennai Super Kings' former player and current coach Stephen Fleming has said that the squad is nervous as they are set to return to the Indian Premier League after a two-year gap. Fleming added that the players will not be carrying any scars of the betting scandal that resulted in CSK being suspended from the IPL for two years.

headlines: India throw away lead vs Pak to draw 2-2 at CWG 2018
text: India gave away a 2-0 lead to manage a 2-2 draw against Pakistan in their opening match of the men's hockey event at the Commonwealth Games 2018 in Australia on Saturday. Following goals from Dilpreet Singh and Harmanpreet Singh, India conceded with the final play of the match, an 8th penalty corner for Pakistan.

headlines: Bumrah world's number one limited-overs bowler: Ex NZ-pacer
text: Former New Zealand pacer and current Mumbai Indians' bowling coach Shane Bond has said that Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah is the world's number one bowler in limited-overs cricket. "Every team is looking for someone who can do a job at the end of the innings in particular and there is no better bowler than Jasprit," Bond said.

headlines: Tool to opt-out of data being used for ads will be paid: FB
text: On being asked if Facebook can have a tool to let users restrict the company from using their data to target advertisements, COO Sheryl Sandberg said, "That would be a paid product." Sandberg added, "we have different forms of opt-out, we don't have an opt-out at the highest level." She highlighted that Facebook doesn't provide users' personal information to advertisers.

headlines: Foodborne disease-detecting patch developed
text: A team of engineers and biochemists has developed a transparent test patch, printed with harmless molecules, that can signal contamination as it happens. It can be incorporated directly into food packaging, to monitor contents and detect harmful pathogens like E coli and Salmonella. According to WHO, foodborne pathogens result in nearly 600 million illnesses and 420,000 deaths per year globally.

headlines: Stay 1 night in villages with SC/ST majority: PM to BJP MPs
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has asked BJP MPs and leaders to spend a night in villages where Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes are in majority. Union Minister Ananth Kumar said this would be done during the party's Gram Swaraj Abhiyan programme beginning April 10. PM said MPs should work to implement schemes like Jan Dhan in those villages, Kumar added.

headlines: TISS ST students to get fee exemption: Maharashtra govt
text: Maharashtra government on Friday guaranteed the Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS) of fee exemption and financial support to Scheduled Tribe students. This comes after a bandh was organised by the Students' Union against the withdrawal of financial aid to the Government of India-Post Matric Scholarship (GoI-PMS) students from SC/ST category across all the campuses of the institute.nnn

headlines: Girl returning from karate class slaps cop for harassing her
text: A traffic policeman in Haryana's Rohtak was slapped by a girl for allegedly harassing her while the two were riding in a shared auto. The girl was returning from her karate class when the cop allegedly started pestering her for her phone number. The police said that the accused has been suspended while probe has been launched.

headlines: PM Modi receives Nepalese PM KP Oli at Rashtrapati Bhavan
text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday received his Nepal counterpart KP Oli and his wife Radhika Shakya at Rashtrapati Bhavan. The Nepalese PM, who arrived on Friday with a 54-member delegation for a 3-day visit, also received a ceremonial welcome. Both the Prime Ministers will hold a delegation-level meeting later in the day at New Delhi.

headlines: Man carries oxygen cylinder for mother waiting for ambulance
text: A man in Uttar Pradesh was forced to carry his mother's oxygen cylinder on shoulders outside a hospital while waiting for an ambulance. A picture of the duo surfaced online, wherein the mother could be seen with the oxygen mask on and her son holding the cylinder. Reportedly, they waited for a long time but the ambulance didn't turn up.

headlines: Bihar reduces competitive exams fee for women by 75%
text: Bihar government has reduced the fee for women candidates appearing for the examinations conducted by Bihar Public Service Commission and Bihar Staff Selection Commission by nearly 75%. The examination fee for preliminary test has been reduced from â¹600 to â¹150, while the fee for mains examination has be reduced to â¹200 from â¹750.

headlines: Vodafone introduces the FANtastic Breaks Contest
text: Being the Unofficial Sponsor of Fansâ¢, Vodafone brings you the FANtastic Breaks Contest for all the fans whoâve stood by their teams through thick and thin. They will be required to answer a simple question to stand a chance to win many exciting prizes and an iPhone, every match.

headlines: India win 3rd gold in as many days in weightlifting at CWG
text: India won their third gold medal in as many days in weightlifting at the Commonwealth Games 2018 after Sathish Sivalingam came first in the men's 77kg category on Saturday. The 25-year-old lifted a total of 317kg to win his second successive gold medal at Commonwealth Games. All of India's five medals at CWG 2018 till now have come in weightlifting.

headlines: Only 1 player has stuck to same team in all 11 IPL seasons
text: Royal Challengers Bangalore captain Virat Kohli is the only player to be a part of the same franchise since the inaugural IPL. Kohli was picked as a catchment player by the Bengaluru-based club in 2008 and has always been retained since then. He became the most expensive player in IPL history after RCB retained him for â¹17 crore in January.

headlines: World's first hotel in space to open in 2021
text: US company Orion Span will open the world's first luxury hotel in space in 2021. Named 'Aurora Station', the hotel will cost $9.5 million (over â¹61 crore) for a 12-day stay, inclusive of  launching shuttle price. Facilities include growing food, and high-speed internet access, with guests required to complete a mandatory three-month training prior to their stay.

headlines: Over 8 lakh people were killed in Rwanda's civil war
text: The civil war in Rwanda, during which an estimated eight lakh Rwandans were killed, erupted on April 7, 1994. The war, fought between the Hutu and Tutsi tribes, was triggered by the death of Rwandan President JuvÃ©nal Habyarimana, a Hutu, after his plane was shot down. The genocide is considered one of the worst since World War II.

headlines: Sonali, Tabu told Salman to shoot blackbuck, says eyewitness
text: Actresses Sonali Bendre and Tabu told Salman to shoot the blackbuck, alleged an eyewitness in the poaching case. He added, "How can any blackbuck die after falling into a pit. It was Salman who shot the deer." While Salman was sentenced to five years in prison, Sonali and Tabu, who were among the co-accused, were acquitted by the Jodhpur court.

headlines: My Twitter wasn't hacked: Kapil on abusive tweets on media
text: Comedian Kapil Sharma posted a series of tweets abusing the media and his latest tweet read, "My Twitter wasn't hacked," which was later deleted. Earlier in a tweet, Kapil had claimed that his account had been hacked. Kapil alleged the media of creating fake news while adding, "You f**cking paid media." All these tweets, including the abusive ones, were deleted.

headlines: Your daughter wants to sleep with me: Kapil abuses journo
text: Vickey Lalwani, the editor of entertainment website SpotboyE, has shared an audio tape of a conversation that he has claimed took place between him and Kapil Sharma. In the audio, Kapil can be heard abusing Vickey and saying, "Your daughter wants to sleep with me." Kapil had alleged that Lalwani started a false propaganda to defame him.

headlines: Which players have hit fastest tons in past IPL seasons?
text: Ex-Australian wicketkeeper-batsman Adam Gilchrist slammed the fastest hundred of the inaugural IPL season off 42 balls. Kings XI Punjab's Chris Gayle, who holds the record for smashing most IPL tons (5), hit the fastest centuries of the 2011, 2013 and 2015 seasons while playing for Royal Challengers Bangalore. Banned Australian cricketer David Warner slammed the fastest hundred of last season.

headlines: Lok Sabha wasted 127 hrs, functioned for 34 in Budget session
text: The Lok Sabha lost 127 hours and 45 minutes during the budget session due to frequent disruptions and forced interruptions, while the House functioned for around 34 hours during 29 sessions. An average of 0.5% starred questions were answered per session, with only 17 of the 580 starred questions being answered. Written replies were tabled for remaining questions.

headlines: IAF seeks to buy 110 jets in largest fighter aircraft deal
text: The Defence Ministry has begun the process for procuring around 110 fighter jets for the Indian Air Force at an approximate cost of â¹97,000 crore, dubbed as the world's largest fighter aircraft deal. While 15% aircraft will be procured in a flyaway state, 85% aircraft will be made in India. 75% of the procured jets will have single seats.

headlines: 5-year jail for taking over 1 liquor bottle inside UP
text: Carrying more than one liquor bottle to Uttar Pradesh from other states has been made a non-bailable offence attracting a five-year jail term. Offenders will be charged a minimum fine of â¹5,000, with open bottles being exempted from the ruling. The amendment, which was passed in 2017 and became operational this month, is aimed at reducing liquor imports.

headlines: China sperm bank asks donors for loyalty to Communist Party
text: A sperm donation bank in China has asked potential donors to swear loyalty to the Communist Party. The bank demanded that applicants must "support the leadership of the party, be loyal to its cause and be law-abiding citizens, free of political problems." China has witnessed an increase in demand for sperm donation after it abolished its one-child policy in 2015.

headlines: US imposes sanctions against Russian oligarchs, officials
text: The US on Friday imposed sanctions against 24 Russian oligarchs and officials, including President Vladimir Putin's former son-in-law Kirill Shamalov. The sanctions were also imposed against 14 Russian entities. Those included on the list engaged in malign activities, including inciting violence in eastern Ukraine and supplying Syria's Assad regime with weapons, the US Treasury Department said.

headlines: Poisoned former Russian spy no longer in critical condition
text: Former Russian spy Sergei Skripal, who was poisoned with a nerve agent in the UK, is no longer in critical condition and is responding well to the treatment, the hospital treating him in UK's Salisbury has said. Skripal and his daughter, whose condition had improved to stable, were poisoned last month by a type of nerve agent known as Novichok.

headlines: Relations with Russia at 'best level in history': China
text: During his visit to Russia, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said that current relations between the two countries were at the "best level in history". Noting that the current international situation was full of uncertainties, Wang added that as strategic partners, China and Russia needed to strengthen their cooperation. This comes amid China and Russia's recent tensions with the US.

headlines: Crypto exchange sold for $34 mn after suffering $530 mn hack
text: Japanese crypto exchange Coincheck, which lost about $530 million after suffering the world's largest cryptocurrency hack ever, was acquired by online brokerage firm Monex Group for about $34 million. Coincheck's management, including current CEO Koichiro Wada and COO Yusuke Otsuka, will step down as part of the deal. Monex shares jumped 20% after the announcement.

headlines: 'Sholay' actor Raj Kishore passes away at the age of 85
text: Actor Raj Kishore, who played the role of a prisoner in 'Sholay', passed away on Friday at the age of 85. He reportedly passed away due to a heart attack. Kishore also acted in films like Padosan (1968), Deewar (1975), Ram Aur Shyam (1967), Hare Rama Hare Krishna (1971), Bombay To Goa (1972) and Karan Arjun (1995), among others.

headlines: Anne slams trolls who will fat shame her over weight gain
text: Anne Hathaway shared an Instagram video where she claims she is gaining weight for a film, while adding, "To all the people who are going to fat shame me in the upcoming months, it's not me, it's you." Reacting to the post, a user tweeted, "I'm glad I'm not famous, don't have to put up with this stuff."

headlines: Preity Zinta first celebrity to visit Salman in Jodhpur jail
text: Actress Preity Zinta was the first celebrity to visit actor Salman Khan in the jail in Jodhpur after his conviction in the blackbuck poaching case. Following that, Salman's sisters Alvira and Arpita visited him. Salman was sentenced to five years in prison in the case, which was filed by the Bishnoi community in 1998.

headlines: Chadwick should win an Oscar for Black Panther: Chris Evans
text: 'Captain America' actor Chris Evans has said that Chadwick Boseman should win a Best Actor Oscar for his portrayal as the titular character in 'Black Panther'. Talking about working with Chadwick in 'Avengers: Infinity War', Chris added, "It was great working with Chadwick. He is just a powerhouse. He really is so talented."

headlines: I am proud of my middle class background: Ishaan Khatter
text: Actor Ishaan Khatter, while speaking about nepotism in the film industry, said his history is different from the general perception while adding, "I'm proud of my middle-class background." "My house is rich in culture, cinema, and the performing arts. So, I've cultivated the same interests and it was only a natural progression for me to pursue that," he added.

headlines: Bowler should become Team India captain after Kohli: Sehwag
