text: Kings XI Punjab's mentor-cum-director of cricket Virender Sehwag has said he hopes that a bowler will become the captain of Team India after Virat Kohli. Sehwag, who played an instrumental role in appointing Ravichandran Ashwin as Kings XI Punjab captain, added he is "great fan" of a "bowling captain". Ashwin is the only bowler captain in the IPL 2018.

headlines: 20-year-old Indian wrestler dies after breaking neck in bout
text: Nilesh Kandurkar, a 20-year-old Kolhapur wrestler, died on Friday after breaking his neck in a bout. Kandurkar was taking part in a mud wrestling tournament on Monday when he landed on his neck while trying to free himself from the opponent. He was admitted to a Kolhapur hospital and later shifted to Karad, where he succumbed to his injuries.

headlines: Walmart finishes due diligence to buy Flipkart stake: Report
text: US-based retail giant Walmart has completed due diligence process on Indian e-commerce startup Flipkart as it looks to buy a controlling stake in it, as per reports. Walmart has already offered a proposal to buy the stake for $10-12 billion, reports added. The deal might value Flipkart at about $20 billion.

headlines: BJP workers protest as leaders' posters not shown in rally
text: BJP workers attending a Mumbai rally on the party's foundation day on Friday staged a protest after noticing that posters of party's late leaders Pramod Mahajan and Gopinath Munde were not displayed at the venue. Claiming that the two leaders increased the party's presence in rural areas, workers said they were upset over the party's treatment towards grassroots leaders.

headlines: 5% GST on railway catering services in trains, stations
text: The Finance Ministry on Friday clarified that a 5% GST will be levied on food and drinks supplied by the Indian Railways or IRCTC in trains, platforms or stations. Earlier in March, IRCTC introduced the use of Point of Sale (PoS) machines in trains after many passengers filed complaints of train vendors overcharging passengers.

headlines: Number of vehicles in Pune overtakes city's human population
text: With 36.2 lakh registered vehicles, the number of vehicles in Pune has surpassed the estimated 35 lakh population of the city, the city's RTO chief has said. The number of vehicles in the city increased by 8.6% in 2017-18, with 74.6% registered vehicles being two-wheelers. The RTO registered â¹1,021 crore revenue in 2017-18, overshooting the target by 118%.

headlines: Defence Ministry site not hacked: National Informatics Centre
text: National Informatics Centre, which hosts several government websites including Defence and Home, on Friday said the Defence Ministry website was not hacked. It further said there was some technical issue since 2:30 pm today due to which the website was not working. This comes after Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman acknowledged the hack, adding that appropriate action has been initiated.

headlines: Home Ministry website taken down after Defence site hacked
text: The website of Ministry of Home Affairs was taken down on Friday as a precautionary measure, minutes after the Defence Ministry website was hacked. The National Informatics Centre, which hosts the website, temporarily suspended it citing upgrading of the security system. Further, the website of Ministry of Labour and Employment was also unavailable shortly after the hacking incident.

headlines: I was chilling in jail: Salman Khan in 2008 interview
text: While describing his previous jail terms in a 2008 interview, Salman Khan had said, "I was chilling. The only tension was the bathroom." "There were nine or 12 rooms...each room had 9-10 people in one room," he had added. Salman had further said, "You get this one mug [to eat food from]. You [also] use it to take a shower."

headlines: Who is the highest run-scorer of all time in the IPL?
text: Indian Premier League's most capped player, Suresh Raina, is the highest run-getter in the league, with 4,540 runs in 161 matches. The Chennai Super Kings batsman has hit 173 sixes, the most by an Indian batsman in the league. Further, Raina also holds the record for taking the most number of catches (86) across the ten editions of the tournament.

headlines: When there's a flood, snakes, mongooses unite: Shah on Opp'n
text: Speaking about the Opposition's efforts to create a united front against BJP, party chief Amit Shah said, "Whenever there is a massive flood, all snakes, mongooses, cats... lions climb up a huge tree fearing rising water levels". Last month, several Opposition leaders attended a dinner organised by Congress leader Sonia Gandhi at her 10 Janpath residence in Delhi.

headlines: 180-million-year-old pregnant reptile fossil discovered
text: Palaeontologists have discovered part of the skeleton of a 180 million-year-old pregnant ichthyosaur with the remains of 6-8 tiny embryos between its ribs. Only five ichthyosaur specimens from Britain have ever been found with embryos, and none with this many, as per researchers. Ichthyosaurs were marine carnivore reptiles that fed on other reptiles, fish, and marine invertebrates.

headlines: Ex-Prez Mukherjee served notice over Babri reference in book
text: The Delhi High Court has sought a response from former President Pranab Mukherjee over a petition, which claims that references to the Babri Masjid demolition in his book 'The Turbulent Years: 1980-1996', hurt Hindu sentiments. A trial court had earlier dismissed the petition submitted by a group of lawyers on the basis that Indian Presidents had immunity from legal proceedings.

headlines: Arun Jaitley admitted to AIIMS for kidney transplant: Report
text: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley has been admitted to AIIMS Delhi and will undergo a kidney transplant surgery on Saturday, reports said. Earlier, Jaitley said he was receiving treatment for "kidney related problems" and working from a "controlled environment" at his residence. He had skipped the oath-taking ceremony after being elected as a Rajya Sabha MP.

headlines: Ex-RBI Deputy Governor questioned over $2.1-bn PNB fraud
text: The CBI is questioning former RBI Deputy Governor Harun Rashid Khan in connection with $2.1-billion PNB fraud linked to jewellers Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi. Khan was the Deputy Governor for a five-year term between 2011 and 2016. He is reportedly being questioned over the alleged benefits to Choksi's Gitanjali Group due to 80:20 gold import scheme.

headlines: US approves $1.3-billion artillery sale to Saudi Arabia
text: The US has approved a $1.3-billion artillery sale to Saudi Arabia, including 180 Paladin howitzer systems and artillery-firing vehicles. Earlier, US President Donald Trump's administration approved an arms sale of $1 billion to the kingdom. The deals come as Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman made his first official visit to the US.

headlines: Ready to pay any cost: China on possible trade war with US
text: Amid the ongoing tensions between the US and China over the imposition of tariffs on each other's imports, the Chinese Commerce Ministry has said that it is ready to pay any cost in a possible trade war with the US. This comes after US President Donald Trump proposed $100 billion in additional tariffs on China.

headlines: Afghanistan accuses Pakistan of cross-border air strikes
text: Afghanistan on Thursday accused Pakistan of carrying out cross-border air strikes that caused damage in its Kunar province. Calling the air strikes a violation of international norms, the Afghan Foreign Ministry warned Pakistan that such acts would have consequences on their bilateral ties. This came ahead of Pakistan PM Shahid Khaqan Abbasi's visit to Afghanistan.

headlines: Eagle lands on player's shoulder before baseball match in US
text: During the national anthem before a Major League Baseball match, a bald eagle landed on the right shoulder of Seattle Mariners' pitcher James Paxton. The pitcher, who barely moved when it landed, later said, "I was just standing there trying not to panic...I figured I'm not going to outrun an eagle, so we might as well just see what happens."

headlines: What are the features in the new Income Tax Return forms?
text: In the new Income Tax Return forms, the salaried taxpayers have to provide more details about their salary break-up and income from property. It has been made mandatory for small businesses to report their GST Identification Number and turnover reported under GST. Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) can provide details of any one foreign bank account to claim credit or refunds.

headlines: Hope I get to work with Kareena in future: Kartik Aaryan
text: Kartik Aaryan, who recently walked the ramp with Kareena Kapoor Khan at Manish Malhotra's show in Singapore, said that hopefully in future, he will get to work with Kareena. He said, "Of course (I'll work with her)...Our show became a big hit, which is good thing to have." Earlier, Kartik said he always had a crush on the actress.

headlines: Cried, was happy when mother told me she is a lesbian: Jay Z
text: Rapper-music producer Jay Z has revealed that he cried with relief when his mother Gloria Carter told him she is a lesbian. "I was so happy for her that she was free," said Jay Z. He further said that he had known his mother was a lesbian, but they discussed it for the first time eight months ago. n

headlines: Tamannaah replaces Parineeti for IPL performance: Report
text: As per reports, Tamannaah Bhatia will perform at the opening ceremony of the upcoming edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL). This comes after Parineeti Chopra reportedly opted out from the performance for the Twenty20 cricket league's opening ceremony due to her ongoing hectic schedule. The 11th season of the IPL is set to begin on April 7.

headlines: My brother Shahid is the wise old man in our family: Ishaan
text: Ishaan Khattar has revealed that his half-brother Shahid Kapoor is the wise old man in their family. "Once in a while, he expresses his philosophy. I'm philosophical, too, but I prefer to listen," said Ishaan. He further said, "I felt great satisfaction...as it's my brother from whom I've learnt so much, and (doing good films) is like giving back."

headlines: Trailer of Rowan Atkinson's Johnny English Strikes Again out
text: The trailer of the Rowan Atkinson starrer 'Johnny English Strikes Again' has been released. The film is the third installment of the 'Johnny English' comedy series with Atkinson in the titular role of an "accidental secret agent". The second film in the franchise 'Johnny English Reborn' had released in 2011.

headlines: Russell Crowe to sell 227 items in The Art of Divorce auction
text: Actor Russell Crowe is set to sell 227 items that he owns as part of an auction 'Russell Crowe: The Art of Divorce'. The auction will take place on April 7, "a date of particular significance as both the actor's birthday and wedding anniversary". The auction will include items he shared with his former wife Danielle Spencer.

headlines: Three weeks not even looking at my kit bag was weird: Kohli
text: Speaking about his break from cricket, Indian captain Virat Kohli said that it felt weird not looking at his kit bag and cricket equipment during his three-week break. "I was keeping a check on all the scores happening around the world, especially with India playing as well", Kohli added about being connected to the sport in his break.

headlines: Women try to save man's life in sumo ring, told to get out
text: Female medics who rushed to perform first aid to a man who suffered brain hemorrhage in a sumo ring in Japan were told by the referee to "get out" of the ring. The ring is considered a "sacred space" and women are forbidden from entering it. Salt was reportedly thrown into the ring to purify it after the women left.

headlines: Boycott IPL matches in Chennai, demand TN's political groups
text: Several political parties in Tamil Nadu have urged people to boycott IPL matches in Chennai in protest against the Centre failing to meet deadline for creating the Cauvery Management Board. TVK leader Panruti Velmurugan threatened that if IPL is conducted in Chennai, farmers will go inside the stadium and protest. CSK play their first match at home on April 10.

headlines: Russia to block Telegram app over refusal to allow spying
text: Russia has filed a lawsuit to block the Telegram messaging app in the country as the platform refused to give access to its users' encrypted messages. Russia's FSB Federal Security Service claims it demanded access to the messages primarily to prevent terror attacks in the country. Telegram had refused to comply with Russia's demands, citing respect for user privacy.

headlines: Indian politicians facing credibility crisis: Rajnath Singh
text: Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said politicians in the country are facing a credibility crisis, adding that people believe that there is a vast difference between the "words and deeds" of politicians. Speaking about his Lok Sabha campaign, Singh said he had assured voters that he will "try to do the work" instead of lying.

headlines: Delhi schools to be graded on infrastructure, academics
text: The Delhi government has announced plans to grade around 5,600 government and private schools in an initiative to help parents choose the school for their kids based on reliable information. The schools will be graded on infrastructure, teaching-learning facilities and safety among others. The evaluation process will begin in August and the grades awarded will be announced on Children's Day.

headlines: Defence Ministry website hacked, shows Chinese characters
text: The Ministry of Defence website was hacked on Friday, displaying an error message along with Chinese characters which reportedly read 'home'. Acknowledging the issue with the website, the Defence Ministry tweeted that "appropriate action" has been initiated. Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman added that steps will be taken to prevent such incidents in the future.

headlines: Bag with 'BOMB to Brisbane' causes panic; woman meant Bombay
text: A part of Brisbane airport was cordoned off on Wednesday after a bag with the label "BOMB to BRISBANE" was spotted on the baggage belt. The owner of the bag, a 65-year-old Indian woman travelling from Bombay, was questioned by the police, when she revealed that it meant "Bombay to Brisbane". The woman was let off without any sanctions.

headlines: Trailer of Priyanka Chopra starrer 'Quantico' Season 3 out
text: The first trailer of the third season of American television series 'Quantico', starring actress Priyanka Chopra, has been released. Priyanka will reprise the character of 'Alex Parrish' on the show. The new season, which will premiere on April 26, will have 13 episodes, unlike the first two seasons which had 22 episodes.

headlines: Mithali Raj becomes most capped player in women's ODIs
text: Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj has become the most capped player in women's ODI cricket after turning out for the 192nd time against England on Friday. Raj, who is also the highest run-getter in WODIs, overtook former England captain Charlotte Edwards, who had appeared in 191 WODIs. Indian fast bowler Jhulan Goswami is the third-most capped WODI player.

headlines: Should try pink ball in IPL matches next year: Kapil Dev
text: Former Indian captain Kapil Dev said, "If the Indian team is wanting to play day-night Test at home with pink ball, they could use next year's IPL as testing ground". India have not played a single day-night Test match yet. India's current coach Ravi Shastri had previously stated that day-night Tests neutralise the effects of the spinners.

headlines: FB shares rise as Zuckerberg dismissed affect of data row
text: Facebook shares rose 4.2% on Thursday after the company's CEO Mark Zuckerberg said that the recent data scandal did not have a "meaningful" impact on the company. Facebook's share had sunk 16%, wiping over $80 billion from its market value since the data scandal was reported. Data of 87 million Facebook users was exploited to influence the US elections.

headlines: Still discussing motion for removal of Chief Justice: Cong
text: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Friday said that the motion for the impeachment of Chief Justice Dipak Misra is still being discussed by the Opposition and that his previous statement was misinterpreted. This comes after reports claiming that Kharge said the removal notice against the CJI won't be introduced and the issue was "closed" surfaced on Thursday.

headlines: Chinese workers attack Pak cops over visit to red light area
text: Chinese workers in Pakistan's Khanewal attacked policemen deployed for their security, as they were denied permission to visit a red light area without being accompanied by them, police said. The workers were reportedly engaged in the construction of a motorway. The workers later cut power supply to a police camp at the construction facility and stopped work on the project.

headlines: You'll be sorry: Russia to UK on spy poisoning row
text: "Youâre playing with fire and youâll be sorry," the Russian Ambassador warned the UK in a United Nations Security Council meeting on Russia's alleged involvement in the poisoning of former spy Sergei Skripal. This comes after the UK's key allies rejected Russia's call for a joint investigation into the case. Russia-UK ties have deteriorated over the issue.

headlines: Should I sit at home as my wife is ICICI CEO: Deepak Kochhar
text: Denying allegations that his wife's bank giving â¹3,250-crore loan to Videocon benefitted him, Chanda Kochhar's husband Deepak Kochhar has said, "Should I sit at home just because my wife is the CEO of ICICI?" He said, "I am a Bajaj MBA and a Harvard alumni." He added the allegations were ruining Chanda's 30 years of career and their family reputation.

headlines: Video shows making of Banita's character Shiuli from October
text: The makers of the upcoming film 'October' released the making video of Banita Sandhu's character Shiuli. The video introduces Banita as Shiuli, who the makers described as a girl loved by one and all, on the screen and on the sets. Directed by Shoojit Sircar and starring Varun Dhawan as the lead actor, the film will release on April 13.

headlines: Ranbir to have a cameo in Madhuri's Marathi debut: Reports
text: According to reports, actor Ranbir Kapoor will be having a cameo in Madhuri Dixit's upcoming Marathi debut film 'Bucket List'. This will be Ranbir and Madhuri's second outing after the song 'Ghagra' from the film 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani'. Presented by Karan Johar and directed by Tejas Prabha Vijay Deoskar, 'Bucket List' is scheduled to release on May 25.

headlines: 'Ek Do Teen Char' remake wasn't required: Alka Yagnik
text: Singer Alka Yagnik, who sung the original version of 'Ek Do Teen Char', has said the remake version starring Jacqueline Fernandez "wasn't required". "Even though [the original] song was an item number, there was a certain innocence and vulnerability present in the song and on Madhuri Dixit's face," she added. Alka further said, "It was not at all seductive either!"

headlines: McGregor smashes rival's bus with trolley, turns himself in
text: MMA fighter Conor McGregor smashed his UFC rival's bus with a metal trolley before voluntarily walking into a police station. Two people were reportedly injured in the attack, including a UFC fighter who was hit by shattered glass. McGregor, who's plane was grounded in New York, has been charged with three counts of assault and one of criminal mischief.

headlines: Sad I couldn't break CWG record: India's gold medalist
text: Weightlifter Sanjita Chanu, who won India's second gold medal at the Commonwealth Games 2018 on Friday, said that she is sad for not breaking the CWG record after failing to lift 112kg in her last attempt. "Probably god was not with me today...I probably didn't push too well in jerk," she added. Chanu won gold medal in women's 53kg category.

headlines: Bumrah doesn't understand what pressure is: MI coach
text: Speaking about pacer Jasprit Bumrah, Mumbai Indians' coach Mahela Jayawardene said that the Indian pacer does not understand what pressure is and is happy to have him in the team. "Bumrah just comes in and does what he likes to do irrespective of the situation," Mumbai Indians' captain Rohit Sharma added about the 24-year-old.

headlines: Samsung raided in S Korea over alleged union sabotage
text: Samsung offices have been raided by South Korean prosecutors as part of an investigation into allegations that the company had sabotaged workers' efforts to strengthen labour unions. A Samsung spokesperson said that the company was aware that the prosecutors had secured labour-related documents. The company's repair service unit outside Seoul was raided, prosecutors said.

headlines: Twitter suspended 12L accounts for terror content since 2015
text: Microblogging site Twitter has revealed that it has suspended over 12 lakh accounts over terrorist content since August 2015. Between July 1, 2017 and December 31, 2017, over 2.74 lakh accounts were permanently suspended for violations related to the promotion of terrorism. Twitter highlighted that it has seen a decline in the suspensions across three reporting periods.

headlines: Cong gives breach of privilege notice against Union Minister
text: The Congress on Friday submitted a breach of privilege motion against Union Minister for Parliamentary Affairs Ananth Kumar for misleading the Lower House over the disruptions by naming leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi. The notice also accused the government of not being interested in running the House. This comes after the Opposition's no-trust motion wasn't discussed due to disruptions.

headlines: 59 BJP MPs sign letter to shift Children's Day to Dec 26
text: As many as 59 BJP MPs have signed MP Parvesh Verma's letter to PM Narendra Modi, seeking to change Children's Day from November 14. The letter stated that December 26, the day of martyrdom of Sikh Guru Gobind Singh's sons, should be designated for the occasion. The letter suggested, "14 November can be attributed as "UNCLE DAY" or "CHACHA DIWAS".

headlines: BJP MPs to launch fast against parliamentary disruptions
text: PM Narendra Modi has announced all BJP MPs will observe a fast on April 12 to protest against the frequent disruptions in the Parliament. Blaming Congress for the parliamentary logjam, PM Modi said the opposition was doing divisive politics. Meanwhile, the Congress has announced it will observe a day-long fast to promote communal harmony following violent protests over SC/ST act.

headlines: TDP MPs stage dharna in LS Speaker's chambers in her absence
text: TDP MPs on Friday staged a 'dharna' inside Lok Sabha Speaker Sumitra Mahajan's chambers when she wasn't present there to press for special category status to Andhra Pradesh. An MP was also seen sleeping on the chambers' floor. Earlier, five YSR Congress MPs submitted their resignation to the Speaker over the special status issue.

headlines: Giant 'sunshade' in sky to solve global warming: Scientists
text: Scientists have suggested mimicking big volcanic eruptions that could mask the sun with a veil of ash, cooling the Earth. âThe technique...could be very helpful or very harmful,â they said. Twelve scholars from countries including India and China believe, since developing countries are most vulnerable to global warming, they should be more involved in âsolar geoengineeringâ.

headlines: 7-year-old boy killed for resisting sexual assault in Delhi
text: A 21-year-old man in Delhi has been arrested for allegedly abducting and killing a 7-year-old boy for resisting sexual assault. The boy had been missing since April 2 and was last spotted with the accused. The police found the man hiding at his brother-in-law's house and he took them to the spot where he dumped the boy's body.

headlines: China's double amputee to climb Everest after ban revoked
text: Xia Boyu, a Chinese climber, will become the first double amputee to be given a permit to climb Mt Everest after Nepal's top court overruled a government ban on blind and double amputee climbers. Xia, who had lost both legs to frostbite on Everest four decades ago, will make a fifth attempt to summit the world's highest mountain peak.

headlines: Blocking crypto in India 'stupid': Billionaire investor
text: Talking about the Indian government deeming cryptocurrencies as not legal tender, American billionaire investor Tim Draper said, "This is the stupidest thing". He added, "It's as if America says the internet is illegal." He further said that if he had a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, then he would let him know that he "is making a huge mistake".

headlines: Failed Bitcoin exchange CEO lost 35 kgs in prison
text: Mark Karpeles, former CEO of failed Japan-based Bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox, has said he lost 35 kg in four months in jail as "lunch was actually two breads with jam". Karpeles was arrested and jailed in 2015 by police investigating the collapse of Mt. Gox. He said he doesn't want $1-billion that he may receive once bankruptcy proceedings were over.

headlines: 'Sarbjit' producer accused of sexually assaulting minor boy
text: Sandeep Singh, the producer of Randeep Hooda and Aishwarya Rai starrer 'Sarbjit', has been accused of sexually assaulting a minor boy from Switzerland in Mauritius last month. Singh reportedly befriended the boy at the hotel's beach and forced the boy into a sexual act. However, the boy managed to escape, after which his father approached the hotel staff.

headlines: Mark Zuckerberg became billionaire from millionaire in 1 yr
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg took just one year to turn from a millionaire to a billionaire, according to a study by Betway based on Forbes' data. Zuckerberg was the youngest self-made billionaire on Forbes Billionaires list when he debuted in 2008 at the age of 23. Zuckerberg is currently world's 7th richest person with a fortune of $63.8 billion.

headlines: How long the richest took to turn billionaire from millionaire?
text: World's richest person and Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos took two years to become a billionaire from a millionaire, according to a study by betting site Betway. World's second richest person Bill Gates took five years to gain billionaire status after becoming millionaire. Warren Buffett became a billionaire at the age of 56, about 26 years after he became a millionaire.

headlines: Got threat calls to not come for bail plea: Salman's lawyer
text: Actor Salman Khan's lawyer Mahesh Bora on Friday said, "Yesterday I got threatening SMSes and internet calls warning me not to appear for Salman Khan in bail hearing today." This comes after the actor's lawyers filed a bail plea in Jodhpur Sessions Court after he was sentenced to a 5-year imprisonment in Blackbuck Poaching case on Thursday.

headlines: Manoj Bajpayee, Tabu starrer 'Missing' hits the theatres
text: The Manoj Bajpayee, Tabu and Annu Kapoor starrer 'Missing' "isn't a spellbinding thriller, but it has its moments," wrote Hindustan Times. The New Indian Express called it "a thriller with plot-holes galore" while Firstpost wrote that the film is "missing a semblance of logic". The film has been rated 2/5 (Hindustan Times, Firstpost) and 1/5 (The New Indian Express).

headlines: Hollywood abandoned me after my Donald Trump prank: Comedian
text: American comedian Kathy Griffin, who landed in a controversy for sharing a photo of herself holding a fake decapitated head resembling US President Donald Trump, said people had started disliking her. "Nobody wanted to hear a word from me," the comedian added. The controversy had led to an investigation and cancellation of various gigs and hosting jobs for Griffin.

headlines: Salman's punishment too harsh: Ex-Pak pacer Shoaib Akhtar
text: Weighing in on Bollywood actor Salman Khan's five-year jail sentence in the blackbuck poaching case, former Pakistani pacer Shoaib Akhtar sympathised with the actor and said that the punishment handed out to him is too harsh. "Really Sad to see my friend Salman khan sentenced for 5 year But the Law must take its course," read part of Akhtar's tweet.

headlines: FB withdraws Zuckerbergâs messages from receiversâ inboxes
text: Facebook messages sent by CEO Mark Zuckerberg are withdrawn from the recipients' inboxes to protect executives' communications, the company confirmed. While users can delete messages from their own inboxes and they remain visible in the recipient's thread, Facebook limited the retention period for Zuckerberg's messages. However, messages from before 2014 still appear to some users, reports said.

headlines: Facebook confirms it scans users' chats, photos on Messenger
text: Social media major Facebook has confirmed that it scans users' messages, photos and the links they send on Messenger in order to regulate the content which violates its standards. The company explained its automated systems scan the content and take it down in case a violation is detected. Facebook clarified that it doesn't listen to users' voice and video calls.

headlines: 5 YSR Congress MPs resign over Andhra special status issue
text: To protest against the Centre's refusal to assign special category status to Andhra Pradesh, five Lok Sabha MPs of YSR Congress submitted their resignation to Speaker Sumitra Mahajan on Friday. All the resignation letters had only one line, which read, "I hereby tender my resignation of my Lok Sabha seat in the House with immediate effect."

headlines: Freecharge Founder to raise $30 mn for new startup: Reports
text: Freecharge Founder Kunal Shah is looking to raise $30 million (around â¹200 crore) in funding for his new startup, as per reports. The funding might be raised from venture capital firm Sequoia Capital and Russian fund Ru-Net, among others, reports added. Earlier in January, Shah took to Twitter to announce that he is âexcited to startup again in 2018.â

headlines: Oldest magnetic record discovered in meteorite
text: Researchers have found an iron-containing mineral, present in meteorites, retaining a record of a magnetic field from around 4.6 billion years ago. The discovery contradicts the theory that considers non-uniform magnetic materials poor recorders, since the magnetism in the mineral is non-uniform. The discovery may lead to new insight into solar system formation with the help of magnetic fields.

headlines: Video: Woman molested on local train as bystanders watch
text: A woman was molested by a man onboard a local train in Mumbai on Thursday night. The video of the incident shows the man brutally thrashing and attempting to throttle the woman, while none of the bystanders come to her rescue. The accused was arrested by Dadar Government Railway Police and a case has been registered against him.

headlines: Na biwi na bacche phir bhi dekho kitne acche: Ramdev
text: Yoga guru-turned-businessman Ramdev has said, "People work for their family. Na biwi na bacche phir bhi dekho kitne acche (No wife, no children, still see how comfortable I am)." He added he doesn't go around with the baggage of having family. He said, "If you have a child, then you will have to bear with them for the entire life."

headlines: Bihar govt allots fund for restoration of riot-hit mosques
text: The Bihar government has allocated over â¹2 lakh for the repair and restoration of the Gudri mosque and the Jiaul-Ulum Madrassa that were damaged in the recent communal riots. The government has also reportedly released â¹25 lakh as compensation for people whose shops were burnt during the Aurangabad Ram Navami clashes and â¹8.5 lakh for six people affected in Nawada.

headlines: India to buy missile system from Russia despite US sanctions
text: India will continue negotiations with Russia to acquire a missile defence system at a cost of over â¹30,000 crore despite the sanctions imposed by the US on defence trade with Russia. "The issue of the sanctions has already been discussed between the US and India, but India will go ahead with its decision and continue negotiations," a source said.

headlines: Ambala launches 'OYE! Ambala' campaign to make city cleaner
text: Ambala Municipal Commissioner Satyender Duhan in July 2017 launched 'OYE! Ambala' project in a bid to clean the city, after it ranked 308 out of 500 in the Swachh Survekshan 2017 survey. Under the project, a contractor was fined with â¹1,000 for not collecting waste and residents failing to provide segregated waste for three consecutive days had to pay â¹100.

headlines: Trump proposes $100bn more in tariffs on China in trade war
text: US President Donald Trump on Thursday proposed $100 billion in additional tariffs on China in light of the countryâs "unfair retaliationâ against earlier US tariffs. This comes after China announced an additional 25% tariff on US imports worth $50 billion in a tit-for-tat move. "Rather than remedy its misconduct, China has chosen to harm our farmers and manufacturers," Trump said.

headlines: SC allows RCom to sell assets, will reduce debt by â¹25000 cr
text: Billionaire Anil Ambani-led Reliance Communications (RCom) on Thursday said that Supreme Court lifted a Bombay High Court stay on sale of some of its assets. The company said it now expects to reduce debt by around â¹25,000 crore within the next few weeks. However, the court refused to lift a separate order of a tribunal barring sale of RCom's towers.

headlines: RBI delays year-end bonuses of Chanda Kochhar, Shikha Sharma
text: The RBI is delaying year-end bonuses to the heads of top private sector banks, which includes ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar, Axis Bank's Shikha Sharma and HDFC Bank's Aditya Puri, according to reports. Notably, ICICI's board had approved a bonus of â¹2.2 crore for Kochhar, while Shikha Sharma was set to receive â¹1.35 crore and Aditya Puri about â¹2.9 crore.

headlines: Louis Vuitton maker LVMH CEO becomes world's 4th richest man
text: Louis Vuitton maker LVMH's Chairman and CEO Bernard Arnault has overtaken Zara Founder Amancio Ortega to become the world's fourth richest person, according to Bloomberg. Arnault has a net worth of $70.7 billion and has also become the richest person in Europe. This comes after shares of his company Christian Dior rose to a record high on Thursday.

headlines: German actress Suzanne to play Sonia Gandhi in upcoming film
text: German actress Suzanne Bernert will be seen portraying former Congress president Sonia Gandhi in the upcoming film 'The Accidental Prime Minister'. The film will also feature actor Anupam Kher as former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh. Directed by debutant Vijay Ratnakar Gutte, the film is scheduled to release on December 21.

headlines: Indian women's hockey team thrashes Malaysia 4-1 at CWG 2018
text: The Indian women's hockey team beat their Malaysian counterparts 4-1 in their second match at the Commonwealth Games 2018 in Australia on Friday. The team, returning after a defeat to Wales in the opening match, saw two goals from defender Gurjit Kaur and a goal apiece from Rani Rampal and Lalremsiami. India will next face England on Sunday.

headlines: TDP MP dresses as Sage Vishvamitra to demand special status
text: TDP MP Naramalli Sivaprasad on Friday dressed up as Sage Vishvamitra and went to the Parliament to press for the party's demand for special category status for Andhra Pradesh. Sivaprasad had earlier shown up at the Parliament during the Budget Session dressed up as various characters like washerman, Narad Muni, and a 'possessed' tantrik, to mark his protest.

headlines: Faridabad-based laundry startup UClean raises â¹4 crore
text: Faridabad-based laundry startup UClean has raised â¹4 crore in pre-Series A round from investor Anubhav Chopra. This comes a month after the startup raised $1 million (over â¹6.5 crore) from franchise and retail services provider Franchise India Holding. Founded in 2016, UClean offers its customers an option to wash their clothes at an UClean outlet and also provides pick-and-drop service.

headlines: Andhra CM takes out cycle rally to demand for special status
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Friday led a bicycle rally in the state's capital Amravati to press for special category status for the state. The rally started after the CM honoured TDP Founder NT Rama Rao's statue with a garland. The rally was joined by several TDP MLAs, MLCs, leaders and workers.

headlines: Headless body of abducted Kashmiri youth recovered
text: The police on Friday recovered the headless body of a youth who was allegedly abducted by militants earlier this week in Jammu and Kashmir. The youth was abducted along with his father on Wednesday. "The father had managed to escape from the clutches of his abductors although he sustained a bullet injury. He is now being treated," police reportedly said.

headlines: Salman to spend another night in jail as bail order reserved
text: Actor Salman Khan will be spending another night in Jodhpur Central Jail, as the court has reserved the order on his bail plea in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case till tomorrow. The order will be pronounced at 10:30 am tomorrow, said reports. Salman is being lodged in the same jail as rape-accused self-styled godman Asaram Bapu.

headlines: Indiaâs youngest weightlifter at CWG 2018 wins bronze
text: India's youngest weightlifter at the 2018 Commonwealth Games, 18-year-old Deepak Lather won India a bronze medal in the 69-kg men's category at Gold Coast on Friday. Lather, who is making his Commonwealth Games debut, lifted a total weight of 295 kg. Earlier in 2017, at the Commonwealth Championships, Lather won three medals for India.

headlines: Former South Korean President sentenced to 24 yrs in prison
text: Former South Korean President Park Geun-hye was sentenced to 24 years in prison and slapped with a $17 million fine after being convicted of corruption in a trial broadcast live on Friday. Park was involved in a bribery scandal that has seen the chiefs of giants like Samsung and Lotte being jailed.

headlines: No special treatment for Salman, will get dal-roti: Police
text: After actor Salman Khan's conviction in Blackbuck Poaching case, Jodhpur DIG (Jail) Vikram Singh said that no special treatment is being given to him and he will be served dal-roti like others. Singh also stated that the actor was given four blankets to sleep on the floor as there is no provision of beds in Indian jails.

headlines: Irrfan Khan starrer 'Blackmail' hits the theatres
text: Irrfan Khan and Kirti Kulhari starrer 'Blackmail', which released today, is "an unconventional entertainer and a good black comedy," wrote Bollywood Hungama. "The fun-filled and realistic story-telling keep [one] engaged," said Hindustan Times (HT). The Times of India (TOI) wrote that the plot of the film is its hero. It has been rated 4/5 (Bollywood Hungama, TOI) and 3/5 (HT).

headlines: Pak no. 1 T20I team as they don't play IPL: Younis
text: Former Pakistani cricketer and coach Waqar Younis has stated that the Pakistani cricket team is the number one ranked T20I side as the Pakistani players do not play in the Indian Premier League. "Because of not playing IPL, our boys are down to earth and they want to play international cricket," the former Pakistani captain added.

headlines: Virgin Galactic finishes 1st powered flight since 2014 crash
text: Richard Branson-led commercial spaceflight Virgin Galactic's SpaceShipTwo VSS Unity has successfully completed its first supersonic, rocket-powered flight since 2014 crash. The plane had crashed during a test flight, killing one of its pilots. Notably, Unity was launched mid-flight by a larger plane called White Knight Two at an altitude of around 46,500 ft.

headlines: FB asked for patients' medical data to match with its users'
text: Reports have revealed that Facebook asked several US hospitals to share anonymised data about their patients including their illnesses and prescription information for a proposed research project. Facebook intended to match the patients' data with its users' information to develop insights into how it could help better patient care. Facebook said that the project has been paused.

headlines: Congress won't move impeachment motion against CJI: Reports
text: The Congress-led Opposition won't move an impeachment motion against Chief Justice of India Dipak Misra, as per reports. "That issue is closed now," Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge reportedly said in an interview. "We never initiated (it) in the Lower House. There was a talk in the Upper House...as far as Lok Sabha is concerned, we never initiated anything," he added.

headlines: RBI asks all payment system operators to store data in India
text: The RBI has directed all payment system operators in India to store data within the country to ensure the security of users' information. "Ensuring the safety and security of payment systems data... is essential to reduce the risks from data breaches," RBI said. The operators have been given six months' time to comply with the directive of the central bank.

headlines: India sends request to Hong Kong for Nirav Modi's arrest
text: The External Affairs Ministry on Thursday informed the Rajya Sabha that a request has been submitted to Hong Kong authorities for provisional arrest of PNB scam-accused Nirav Modi. The ministry was responding to a query seeking to know if the Centre has any clue about the whereabouts of Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi.

headlines: Haryana cops took bribe to move Dera cash, weapons: Reports
text: A letter sent to Punjab and Haryana High Court claims that Haryana CID Chief Anil Rao and DSP Ajit Singh took bribes to help mobilise Dera assets and weapons to a safe place. The letter further alleged that the police did not arrest two key accused in the Panchkula violence case on the orders of the CID chief and DSP.

headlines: 56 new airports to function in coming years: Union Minister
text: As many as 56 new airports will start functioning in the next few years to improve the connectivity in India, Union Minister Suresh Prabhu said on Thursday. "Efficient logistics is critical for countries like India to harness trade and facilitate greater and faster integration with both the domestic as well as the world economy," he added.

headlines: Patanjali to launch garments line in 2019
text: Stating that consumers want him to launch Patanjali jeans, yoga guru Baba Ramdev has announced that the brand will launch its own garments line next year. The collection, which will also feature ethnic clothes, will cater to men, women and children. He added that Patanjali will bring "windfall profits" to India from the countries which "looted" the nation.

headlines: IIMs free to choose if they want to grant degree or diploma
text: The Human Resource Development Ministry has clarified that IIMs are free to choose if they want to grant a diploma or degree to their students. The Parliament had passed the IIM Act in December 2017 granting greater autonomy to their executive bodies in the functioning of the institutes. The postgraduate diplomas given by IIMs are not universally accepted.

headlines: Man held after he tries to loot bank with fake bomb
text: A man was arrested on Thursday after he entered an HDFC Bank branch in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor district with a fake bomb strapped to his waist in an attempt to loot it. The man had entered the bank and threatened to blow it up if he wasn't given â¹5 lakh. The police deem the man to be mentally unstable.

headlines: US making a mistake by imposing tariffs on imports: China
text: Calling on the international community to oppose the US' recent trade moves, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said, "If the US believes it could benefit from protectionism it is making a mistake." China also launched a World Trade Organisation challenge against the US proposal to impose tariffs on Chinese imports over alleged theft of intellectual property and technology.

headlines: Qatar introduces national service for women for first time
text: Qatar will introduce national service for women for the first time under a law issued by the country's Emir Tamim bin Hamad al-Thani. Women aged over 18 will be able to volunteer for national service under the law. Every Qatari male aged 18-35 is required to perform a compulsory military service, now extended to a year instead of three months.

headlines: Didn't know about money paid to pornstar: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump gave his statement over his alleged affair with pornstar Stormy Daniels saying that he didn't pay her $130,000 for her silence. He insisted that he didn't know why his lawyer Michael Cohen had made the payment and where the money came from. Cohen had admitted to making payment to the pornstar from his own pocket.

headlines: Will Salman's dad say sorry on his behalf: Sona Mohapatra
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra, while seemingly taking a dig at Salman Khan's supporters following his conviction in the 1998 blackbuck poaching case, tweeted, "Will daddy say sorry on his behalf?" Sona's statement referred to Salman's father Salim Khan, who had earlier apologised over Salman's remark that he felt like a "raped woman" during the shooting of 'Sultan'.

headlines: Teaser of John Abraham starrer 'Parmanu' released
text: The official teaser of John Abraham starrer 'Parmanu: The Story of Pokhran' has been released. The film is based on the series of nuclear bomb test explosions conducted in Pokhran, Rajasthan in 1998. Directed by Abhishek Sharma and also starring Diana Penty, 'Parmanu: The Story of Pokhran' is scheduled to release on May 4.

headlines: Won't play in the IPL even if invited: Shahid Afridi
text: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has claimed he would never join IPL even if he's invited to play, saying he was never interested in the league. This comes after he tweeted on Kashmir, claiming "innocents are being shot down by oppressive regime" there. "My PSL is the biggest and there will be a time that it leaves IPL behind," he added.

headlines: Australia team culture criticism exaggerated, says Ponting
text: Reacting to the criticism faced by the Australian cricket team over the recent ball-tampering scandal, former Australian captain Ricky Ponting said that the criticism of Australia's team culture "has probably been blown out of proportion". "As Australians, we like to play the game hard, we like to play the game fair," Ponting said about the nation's sporting culture.

headlines: FB fined $33.4 mn in Brazil for not helping corruption probe
text: A Brazilian judge has ordered Facebook to pay $33.4 million for failing to cooperate with a corruption investigation. Facebook was fined for failing to give access in 2016 to WhatsApp messages exchanged by individuals under investigation for defrauding the health care system of a Brazilian state. In this case we have disclosed the data required by applicable law, Facebook said.

headlines: Opp'n responsible for Dalit protests violence: UP Deputy CM
text: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Keshav Maurya has claimed Samajwadi Party, BSP and Congress were responsible for the violence during protests by Dalit oraganisations against the Supreme Court's ruling on the SC/ST Act. Maurya alleged anti-social elements joined the stir and turned the protest violent. At least two were killed in the state and several were injured in the violence.

headlines: BJP moves SC seeking safety of WB panchayat poll candidates
text: The BJP on Thursday moved the Supreme Court seeking protection of its workers for filing their candidature for the West Bengal panchayat elections. The party alleged that TMC workers were assaulting BJP candidates to prevent them from filing their nominations. Chief Justice Dipak Misra said the case will get an early hearing due to the upcoming deadline for filing nominations.

headlines: US grocery startup closes $350mn funding at $4.3bn valuation
text: US-based grocery delivery startup Instacart has added $150 million funding to the $200 million it raised in February, bringing the total amount raised in its Series E round to $350 million. Instacart said the startup is now valued at $4.35 billion. Founded in 2012, Instacart is an app-based startup that allows customers to order groceries and get them delivered.

headlines: Pakistan captain once called bird instead of head or tail in toss
text: The coin toss in the Pakistan-Zimbabwe Test at Harare on January 31, 1995, was done twice as Pakistan captain Saleem Malik called 'bird' instead of heads or tails. The coin had an eagle, the national bird of Zimbabwe, inscribed on one side. Malik won as the 'bird' turned up but referee ordered a re-toss which came out in Zimbabwe's favour.

headlines: Shahid Afridi once bit ball during ODI, claimed he was smelling it
text: During an ODI against Australia on January 31, 2010, Pakistan's stand-in captain Shahid Afridi was caught by cameras biting the ball which led to umpires changing the ball. Afridi, after the match, claimed that he was just trying to smell the ball. However, Afridi later pleaded guilty to ball tampering and was banned for two T20Is.

headlines: Went to Rao's daughter's wedding: Judge exits interim CBI head case
text: Justice NV Ramana on Thursday recused himself from hearing a petition challenging the appointment of IPS officer M Nageshwar Rao as CBI interim director, saying, "Rao is from my home state and I have attended his daughter's wedding." After CJI Ranjan Gogoi and Justice AK Sikri, Justice Ramana is the third judge to withdraw from hearing the case.

headlines: Rahul is now into hallucinating conversations: Smriti Irani
text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi claimed Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar told him he had nothing to do with the new Rafale deal, Union Textiles Minister Smriti Irani posted on Facebook, "He is now into hallucinating conversations." Calling Rahul a "congenital liar," Irani added, "It is dangerous to even maintain social contact with him in terms of basic political courtesies."

headlines: Last we saw fast extradition it was Batman, now it's PM Modi: BJP
text: BJP has compared PM Narendra Modi to Batman after extradition of AgustaWestland scam accused Deepak Talwar and Rajeev Saxena from Dubai. "Last time we saw such swift extradition, it was Batman extraditing Lau from Hong Kong and delivering him to Jim Gordon. 'Everything's impossible until somebody does it'. This time it's PM Narendra Modi," the party tweeted.

headlines: Deepak Ahuja to retire as Tesla CFO after 11 years at the company
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced that CFO Deepak Ahuja would be retiring but would stay as a senior advisor for "probably years to come". "There is no good time to make this change," said Ahuja, noting Tesla achieved two back-to-back profitable quarters. "Super appreciate Deepak's 11 year history building Tesla & wish him greatest of happiness in retirement!" Musk tweeted.

headlines: Man fakes own kidnapping, cheats boss of â¹50L to buy house in Delhi
text: Delhi businessman Neeraj Goel was cheated by his employee Harender of â¹50 lakh given to him to be kept in a godown by faking his kidnapping with a colleague's help. Harender lied to Goel he was kidnapped, robbed and dumped on road by four men. Police arrested Harender when they found no injury on his forehead where he'd put band-aid.

headlines: Chanda Kochhar to lose â¹9.8 crore bonus, â¹221 crore in stock options
text: After ICICI Bank sacked former CEO Chanda Kochhar, she'll have to pay back â¹9.82 crore she earned as bonuses from April 2009. Further, 57 lakh unvested and unexercised shares (stock options), whose current value is â¹221 crore, granted to her in the last 9 years stand revoked. Kochhar exercised shares worth â¹134 crore (as of Wednesday's closing) since April 2009.

headlines: Yami Gautam trips during her ramp walk at LakmÃ© Fashion Week
text: Actress Yami Gautam nearly tripped during her ramp walk at the LakmÃ© Fashion Week Summer/ Resort 2019. The actress, who was the showstopper for designers Gauri and Nainika, was wearing a tulle gown. When asked about how she managed, the actress said after the show, "It just comesnfrom the fact that you can know it can happen with anyone."

headlines: Sultan Abdullah crowned Malaysia's 16th King
text: Sultan Abdullah Sultan Ahmad Shah was on Thursday crowned Malaysia's 16th King, nearly a month after Sultan Muhammad V's abdication. The 59-year-old took the oath of office in a nationally televised ceremony at the national palace in Kuala Lumpur. The Malaysian King is elected on a rotational basis from the sultans of the country's nine states for a five-year term.

headlines: Bohra gets new passport on being detained in Russia, thanks Swaraj
text: Actor and Bigg Boss contestant Karanvir Bohra took to Twitter to thank External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj for helping him get a temporary passport to gain entry into Russia, after he was detained in Moscow due to passport damage. Earlier, he tweeted the authorities were contemplating deporting him back to India. Karanvir is in Moscow to attend a film festival.

headlines: 8 held for helping foreigners stay illegally in US as students
text: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement has arrested eight persons, all of whom are either Indian nationals or Indian-Americans, on charges of fraudulently facilitating hundreds of immigrants to illegally remain in the US as students. The accused, in exchange of cash, helped the foreigners in illegally obtaining immigration documents from a university and creation of false student records.

headlines: No one should test the patience of Hindus: Giriraj Singh
text: Claiming people who talk about intolerance in India are actually part of an "intolerance gang", Union Minister Giriraj Singh said, "No one should test the patience of Hindus." He also asked people who are opposed to the construction of Ram Mandir and claim there is intolerance in India to go to Pakistan and "see what kind of democracy they have."

headlines: What is polar vortex, setting temperatures in US below Antarctica?
text: The polar vortex is a large area of low pressure and cold air surrounding both of the Earthâs poles. The current of the northern polar vortex has been disrupted and is now pushing south, bringing temperatures in the US Midwest colder than parts of Antarctica. Over 200 million Americans are expected to be affected by the cold weather phenomenon.

headlines: Naxals set ablaze six vehicles in Maharashtra
text: Naxals on Thursday allegedly torched six vehicles in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district, a police official said. A group of around 12 Maoists set four tractors and two JCB machines on fire which were brought for construction work in Korchi tehsil, the official added. They also blocked a road by cutting trees and placing branches on the way, the official further said.

headlines: India's unemployment rate hit 45-year high in 2017-18: Report
text: India's unemployment rate rose to a 45-year high of 6.1% during 2017-2018, the Business Standard reported quoting an unreleased government survey. It reportedly showed that joblessness stood at 7.8% in urban areas compared with 5.3% in rural areas. Notably, two remaining independent members of the National Statistical Commission quit Wednesday allegedly due to the non-publication of jobs data.

headlines: Man hurls slippers at judge after he convicts him for theft
text: After being convicted in a theft case, a 22-year-old man hurled a pair of slippers at a magistrate in a court in Maharashtra's Thane in a fit of rage, a police official said Wednesday. The magistrate ducked in time and escaped getting hit by the slippers, he added. The accused was later booked for the incident as well.

headlines: Hindu temple vandalised in US in hate crime
text: A Hindu temple has been vandalised in Kentucky, US, in what authorities called a hate crime. Vandals sprayed black paint on the deity, wrote hateful messages on temple walls and broke windows at the temple. A knife was also left stabbed into one of the chairs in the main room of worship at the temple.

headlines: Apple to use laser-based 3D cameras in 2020 iPhones: Report
text: According to a Bloomberg report, Apple plans to introduce laser-powered cameras, designed to scan and create three-dimensional reconstructions of objects, within its new iPhones, expected to launch in 2020. The rear-facing camera will reportedly work up to 15 feet away from the device. The report added the camera will be used to enhance AR on the iPhone.nnn

headlines: Google Chrome testing feature to warn of 'lookalike URLs'
text: Google Chrome is testing a feature to warn users of "lookalike URLs" that may look similar to existing ones and help redirect users to the site they were trying to visit. The feature has been in testing phase since the release of 'Chrome Canary 70' browser. It can be enabled in the stable version of Chrome as an experimental feature.

headlines: Triple Talaq bill gives our Muslim daughters equality: Prez
text: Highlighting steps taken for women during a joint session of Parliament on Thursday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "Our Muslim daughters were living under constant fear. The Triple Talaq bill gives them equality, lets them live without fear." He claimed the government had generated jobs for women and increased maternity leave, making it easier for young mothers to keep working.

headlines: All Muslims should've been sent to Pak during Partition: BJP MP
text: Claiming our ancestors "made a mistake" during Partition, BJP MP Giriraj Singh said, "Each and every Hindu should have been brought back to India and each and every Muslim should have been sent back to Pakistan." He claimed the Ram Mandir issue would've been resolved earlier if India's first Home Minister Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel was the country's first PM instead.

headlines: SC dismisses PIL against Asthana's appointment to aviation body
text: The Supreme Court has dismissed a petition against the appointment of former CBI Special Director Rakesh Asthana as Director General of Bureau of Civil Aviation Security when an FIR is still pending against him. The apex court told the petitioner, lawyer Manohar Lal Sharma, "Your PIL... made little sense. Everything cannot be rolled in under one sky into a petition."

headlines: CM Manohar Parrikar skips morning session of Goa Assembly
text: Goa CM Manohar Parrikar on Thursday skipped the morning proceedings of the ongoing budget session of the state Assembly. While presenting the state budget in the House on Wednesday, Parrikar said, "I'm presenting the budget in josh. The josh that is too high, very high, and fully in hosh". The three-day-long budget session of the state Assembly will end today.

headlines: Ekta Kapoor confirms birth of baby boy Ravie via surrogacy
text: Producer Ekta Kapoor has confirmed she has become a mother to a baby boy via surrogacy. "Everything in life doesn't go the way you want it to but there are always solutions to those hiccups. I found mine and today I feel immensely blessed to become a parent," she wrote. The 43-year-old revealed that the baby has been named Ravie.

headlines: Nadal to marry girlfriend this year after 14 years of dating: Report
text: Seventeen-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal will tie the knot with his longtime girlfriend Xisca PerellÃ³ this autumn in a ceremony in his hometown Mallorca, according to Spanish magazine 'Hola'. Nadal and Xisca, who have been dating since 2005, reportedly got engaged during a trip to Rome in May last year. The couple had kept their engagement private until recently.

headlines: OnePlus India poses question for Siri on social media
text: OnePlus India on Wednesday took to social media platforms to pose a question to Apple's voice-controlled personal assistant Siri after OnePlus emerged as the No.1 premium smartphone brand in India for Q4 2018 in research by Counterpoint. The post read, "Hey Siri, which is India's No.1 Premium Smartphone?", carrying the caption "iDare you".

headlines: Two pieces of world's smelliest fruit sold for â¹70,000 each
text: Two durian fruits have sold for over â¹70,000 each at a supermarket in Indonesia. "The buyer did not want to be named, but he was a durian lover," the supermarket manager said. Known as the world's smelliest fruit, a normal durian sells for a few dollars, but the 'J-Queen' variety durians are extremely rare and possess a very pungent aroma.

headlines: Sensex rises 665 points a day before Interim Budget
text: Indian equity benchmark Sensex recorded its best single-day gains of 2019 a day ahead of Interim Budget, rising 1.87% or 665 points to 36,257 on Thursday. Reliance Industries, HDFC Bank and Infosys were among the top gainers. This will be the last Budget presented by the Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led government before the general elections.

headlines: Army Chief Rawat meets Parrikar to enquire about his health
text: Indian Army Chief General Bipin Rawat on Thursday met Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar at the state Assembly complex in Panaji. After the meeting, Rawat said, "I had come here to enquire about the health of Parrikar. It was just a courtesy visit." Parrikar has been suffering from a pancreatic ailment.

headlines: Haryana CM delivers speech in Tamil amid Pongal celebrations
text: A video showing Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar delivering a speech in Tamil during Pongal celebration in the state has gone viral on social media. BJP Tamil Nadu youth wing vice-president SG Suryah, who shared the video, mentioned Tamil was Haryana's second official language for 40 years but in 2010 Congress CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda replaced the language with Punjabi.

headlines: Hindu Mahasabha's site hacked for firing at Gandhi ji's effigy
text: The website of Akhil Bharatiya Hindu Mahasabha has purportedly been hacked by 'Kerala Cyber Warriors' after the outfit's members fired at Mahatma Gandhi's effigy. The hackers wrote "Hindu Mahasabha Murdabad" on the site. While the text below the image of the incident on the site read, "Arrest this hippopotamus and her goons under sedition charge as soon as possible."

headlines: Feels like I'm back home: Sonakshi on working in 'Dabangg 3'
text: Speaking about teaming up with Salman Khan to work in the third instalment of the 'Dabangg' film franchise, Sonakshi Sinha said, "It feels like I'm back home because that's where I started my career." "My life changed completely after that film, it's how I found my calling," she added. Sonakshi made her acting debut opposite Salman in 'Dabangg' in 2010.

headlines: 2nd Apple worker arrested over self-driving car secret theft
text: The FBI has arrested Apple employee Jizhong Chen for allegedly stealing secrets from its self-driving car unit and trying to sell it to a Chinese competitor. An employee reportedly saw Chen taking photos in a sensitive work area, after which an investigation was conducted. Former Apple employee Xiaolang Zhang was arrested in July 2018 for the same.

headlines: NoMo jobs: Rahul on report claiming unemployment at 45-yr high
text: Referring to a report claiming an unreleased government survey found India's unemployment reached a 45-year high of 6.1% in 2017-2018, Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "NoMo Jobs...Time for NoMo2Go." Rahul added, "The Fuhrer (a term associated with dictator Adolf Hitler) promised us 2 Cr jobs a year. 5 years later, his leaked job creation report card reveals a National Disaster."

headlines: Zomato may sell UAE biz to Delivery Hero at â¹1,780cr: Report
text: Gurugram-based foodtech startup Zomato is reportedly in talks with German foodtech major Delivery Hero to sell its UAE business for $200-250 million (nearly â¹1,780 crore). The report said Zomato and Delivery Hero account for 35-40% of UAE's market share and the deal would give Delivery Hero "significant market leadership" on completion. Zomato's average UAE orders are reportedly higher than India.

headlines: â¹100 crore allotted to TDB for Sabarimala temple
text: The Kerala government on Thursday allotted â¹100 crore for the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB), which manages the Sabarimala temple, in the 2019-20 budget. Some false propaganda by certain politicians affected TDB's income, Kerala Finance Minister Thomas Isaac said. The government aims to provide maximum facilities at Sabarimala on the lines of the Tirupati model, he added.

headlines: Pakistan lifts travel ban on Asia Bibi
text: Pakistan has said that Asia Bibi, the Christian woman acquitted of blasphemy, has the right to travel anywhere inside the country or abroad. This came after Pakistan's Supreme Court upheld her acquittal, rejecting a petition by hardline Islamists. Pakistan had barred Bibi from travelling abroad following a deal with the Islamists who had opposed her acquittal and demanded her execution.

headlines: Saudi ends crackdown on corruption that saw princes being detained
text: Saudi Arabia has announced an end to its crackdown on corruption, launched in 2017, that saw more than 200 princes, ministers and businessmen being detained. The kingdom said it recovered over $100 billion in cash, property and other assets. Among the prominent detainees were Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's cousins, including billionaire investor Prince Alwaleed bin Talal.

headlines: Sri Lanka halts imports of J&J baby powder pending tests
text: Sri Lankan officials said the country has halted imports of Johnson & Johnson's baby powder until the company proves the product is free from cancer-causing asbestos. Stocks of the talc already in the country can still be sold. This comes after reports suggested J&J knew that asbestos was present in its product, leading to tests in several countries including India.

headlines: DHFL shares plunge 16% following reports of govt probe
text: Dewan Housing Finance (DHFL) shares on Thursday fell 16% after reports said the government has launched a probe into the company's alleged fund diversion. A media report accused DHFL's controlling shareholders, the Wadhawans, of diverting funds worth â¹31,000 crore, including loans from state-run banks, to shell firms. The company, however, said it hasn't received any communication from government.

headlines: What is polar vortex, setting temperatures in US below Antarctica?
text: The polar vortex is a large area of low pressure and cold air surrounding both of the Earthâs poles. The current of the northern polar vortex has been disrupted and is now pushing south, bringing temperatures in the US Midwest lower than parts of Antarctica. Over 200 million Americans are expected to be affected by the cold weather phenomenon.

headlines: Your lies making things worse: Krish to Kangana on Manikarnika row
text: Criticising Kangana Ranaut for taking first credit for 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi', co-director Krish said, "Please realise your lies are making things worse." He posted screenshots of WhatsApp chats with technicians and other members stating that 85% of the film was shot by him. This comes nafter Kangana's sister shared screenshots of messages reportedly sent by Kangana to Krish.

headlines: God wanted Trump to become President: White House
text: White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders has said God "wanted Donald Trump to become (US) President", adding that "God calls all of us to fill different roles at different times". "That's why he's there and I think he has done a tremendous job in supporting a lot of the things that people of faith really care about," she added.

headlines: MIT researchers train robot arm to play 'Jenga' game
text: MIT researchers have developed a robot arm that can play the 'Jenga' game by combining the abilities of both sight and touch. The robot, equipped with a force sensor on its wrist and an external camera, probed the blocks to understand which are harder or easier to move. It grouped outcomes of about 300 attempts to learn to play 'Jenga'.

headlines: I want Tesla cars to call tow truck if issues detected: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said he wants to add a feature that enables Tesla cars to automatically call a tow truck as soon as they detect issues like a flat tire. Users will be able to cancel the call through the in-dash display. However, Musk has not provided with a timeline as to when the feature might get launched.

headlines: ED gets 4-day custody of AgustaWestland scam accused Saxena
text: Dubai-based businessman Rajiv Saxena, a key accused in the â¹3,600 crore AgustaWestland VVIP chopper scam, on Thursday has been remanded to four-day Enforcement Directorate (ED) custody. The ED had asked for an eight-day remand of Saxena. "We are aware of his (Rajiv Saxena) health and medical issues, every possible need will be taken care of,"  ED counsel DP Singh said.

headlines: Founders tell me 'Madam, please don't send us to court': SBI MD
text: India's largest lender SBI's Managing Director (MD) Anshula Kant has said the first thing company founders tell when they come to the bank is, "Madam, please don't send us to NCLT". If the founder is "genuine we don't want him to lose the company", Kant added. She also said that one-time settlements are a "preferred choice" if founders have funding.

headlines: DMRC reserves 1st coach in all lines, except Red, for women
text: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has announced that the first coach in the moving direction of all trains, except in Red Line, will be reserved for women from January 1. The move aims to bring in uniformity across the network. Earlier, the first and last coach in trains were alternately reserved for women depending on the up and down line.

headlines: DMK proposal for Rahul as PM not alliance opinion: Akhilesh
text: After DMK chief MK Stalin proposed that Congress chief Rahul Gandhi be projected as 2019 PM candidate, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said it is not necessarily the opinion of all alliance partners. "The people of the country are unhappy with the BJP and that is why the Congress got success in three states," the former Uttar Pradesh CM added.

headlines: Umpire didn't need to get involved in Kohli-Paine spat: Ponting
text: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said umpire Chris Gaffaney didn't need to involve in the banter between India captain Virat Kohli and Australia captain Tim Paine in the second Test at Perth. "It was a conversation, a bit of banter between the two captains and whatever we heard today has been pretty lighthearted and quite funny at times," Ponting added.

headlines: â¹106.8 crore spent for 60 players in IPL 2019 auction
text: The eight IPL franchises spent â¹106.8 crore to buy 60 players in the 2019 IPL auction in Jaipur on Tuesday. Kings XI Punjab spent â¹32.5 crore and bought the most number of players (13) in the auction, while Chennai Super Kings spent â¹5.2 crore to fill their two available slots. As many as 351 players were selected for the auction.

headlines: I thought someone will buy me for â¹20 lakh: â¹8.4-crore buy Varun
text: Tamil Nadu spinner Varun Chakravarthy, who was bought for â¹8.4 crore by Kings XI Punjab in the IPL 2019 auction, said that he thought someone would buy him for just his base price of â¹20 lakh. "After the last Tamil Nadu Premier League...I was confident...I will be bought...I never dreamed of going for such a huge amount," the 27-year-old said.

headlines: At â¹1 crore, player like Yuvraj is a steal for MI: Akash Ambani
text: After buying Yuvraj Singh for his base price of â¹1 crore at the IPL 2019 auction, Mumbai Indians owner Akash Ambani said, "To be honest...we had budgeted a lot more for Yuvraj and Malinga." He added, "At â¹1 crore, a player like Yuvraj is probably the (biggest) steal of 12...years. He has won every trophy there is to be won."

headlines: Wondering what went wrong: Tiwary after going unsold in IPL auction
text: Bengal captain Manoj Tiwary, who went unsold at the IPL 2019 auction, took to Twitter to share a graphic of his statistics from IPL 2017 and picture of his trophies. "Looking at the awards which I received during 2017 IPL season, wondering what went wrong???" he wrote. Tiwary had a base price of â¹50 lakh at the auction.

headlines: CARS24 enables car owners to sell their cars in less than 2 hours
text: CARS24 has enabled car owners to sell their cars in less than 2 hours with instant payment in their account. The company also handles all paperwork including RC transfer. CARS24 has over 70 branches across 13 cities PAN India and having bought over 1 lakh cars in 3 years, it has become the market leader in used car transaction space.

headlines: Gautam Gambhir once gave his Man of the Match award to Virat Kohli
text: Indian cricketer Gautam Gambhir gave his Man of the Match award to Virat Kohli in an ODI against Sri Lanka in 2009, when Kohli scored his maiden ODI hundred. The duo had registered a third-wicket partnership of 224 runs to help India chase down a target of 316, with Gambhir scoring an unbeaten 150. Gautam Gambhir turned 37 on Sunday.

headlines: Pacer once took 7 wickets for just 1 run in 32 balls in a Test
text: Former Windies' fast bowler Curtly Ambrose, who turned 55 on Friday, dismissed seven Australian batsmen within a span of 32 balls, giving away just one run in a Test match in 1993. Ambrose's spell helped his team bowl out Australia for 119 in first innings, after being 85 for 2 at one stage. Ambrose ended with first-innings figures of 18-9-25-7.

headlines: Suzuki Connect helps you connect to your car seamlessly
text: Suzuki Connect helps you connect to your car by providing a wealth of features and information that enhance your on-road experience. From your vehicle's maintenance to helping you drive better and even save fuel, Suzuki Connect will ensure that you and your car become a part of a better-connected world.

headlines: Don Bradman once scored 100 runs in 3 overs
text: Legendary batsman Don Bradman, while playing in a domestic match in 1931, scored a total of 100 runs in a span of three overs. At the time, an over constituted of eight balls and Bradman hit 33, 40, and 27 runs respectively in three consecutive overs. Bradman began the onslaught after completing his century and carried on to make 256.

headlines: Illegal to give lift to unknown people: Mumbai cop fines man
text: A man from Mumbai has claimed that he was issued a challan for offering a lift to three people on his way to office recently. Nitin Nair wrote in a Facebook post that after he offered the lift, he was made to stop by a traffic policeman, who told him it was "illegal to give a lift to unknown people".

headlines: Paw prints of pet dog help trace missing US toddler
text: The paw prints of a pet dog helped a US family find their 2-year-old son who went missing for several hours earlier this week. The toddler, who was discovered without his diaper, suffered scratches and bug bites. "I owe it to my dog, because if my son was alone who knows what could have happened," his father said.

headlines: Musk's language on earnings call equals 12-yr-old: Algorithm
text: The language used by Tesla CEO Elon Musk while speaking on earnings calls is at the level of a 12-year-old or a 7th grader, according to a report by CB Insights. The research firm carried out an algorithmic analysis of text from 28 quarters' worth of earnings calls dating back to 2011. Musk scored the highest on the "Vagueness Algorithm".

headlines: How does the world's smallest computer work?
text: The world's smallest computer created by the University of Michigan researchers has been designed as a temperature sensor that can measure changes in extremely small regions and even body cells. It has a full-fledged processor but it loses all its data when it loses power. The computer, which measures just 0.3 mm, is smaller than a grain of rice.

headlines: Kerala CM slams report Railways Minister refused to meet him
text: After reports emerged that Railways Minister Piyush Goyal refused to meet him, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan wrote on Facebook, "I had not even thought of meeting the minister during my Delhi visit." This comes after Vijayan alleged that PM Narendra Modi's office repeatedly turned down his request for a meeting to discuss the alleged disparities in ration allocation to Kerala.

headlines: July 27 total lunar eclipse to be the longest of 21st century
text: The lunar eclipse which will take place on the night of July 27 and 28 will be the longest one to occur this century. The event, expected to last nearly four hours, will also feature a visible 'Blood Moon', where the Moon appears red because of sunlight scattering through Earth's atmosphere. It will be visible across several countries including India.

headlines: Army Major gets arrested for murder of another Major's wife
text: The Delhi Police on Sunday arrested an Indian Army Major for the alleged murder of another Major's wife. Shailja Dwivedi was found with her throat slit and her body run over by a vehicle near Delhi's cantonment area. Police have reportedly found evidence in the victim's phone which pointed at "some kind of estrangement" between her and the accused Major.

headlines: Man declared dead by hospital, found alive before last rites
text: Doctors at Delhi's Ganga Ram Hospital wrongly declared a 60-year-old man dead, who was later found alive by the family members while being taken for his last rites in an ambulance. The relatives said they found him sweating and informed the doctors, who then declared him alive. The man's family has accused the hospital of negligence.

headlines: Chinese woman crashes Ferrari minutes after renting it
text: A video of a Chinese woman losing control of a Ferrari 458 and crashing it minutes after renting the sports car has gone viral. The video shows the Ferrari's bonnet damaged severely, and one of its front wheels dislodged. "First time driving a Ferrari. This truly is the most amazing feeling," the woman can be heard saying before the crash.

headlines: Walmart customer says he steals from them, company responds
text: A Walmart customer's tweet admitting that his "favorite thing to do" in their stores was to steal has gone viral. The retail giant later responded to the customer saying, "After further review of our store's video feed we've decided to let you keep the rash cream." Reacting to this, a user wrote, "Give him the burn ointment too".

headlines: Will work as long as necessary without pay: Infosys' Nilekani
text: Speaking at Infosys' 37th Annual General Meeting, Chairman Nandan Nilekani said that he will work as long as necessary at Infosys without compensation. "I have already benefited enough from this company so I am not taking compensation," Nilekani added. He further said the company will look into the suggestion of having Co-founder Narayana Murthy on its board.

headlines: Wipro CEO earns â¹18 cr, more than India's largest firm's CEO
text: Wipro CEO Abidali Neemuchwala's compensation increased about 34% to â¹18.2 crore in the last fiscal while Rajesh Gopinath, the CEO of India's largest company TCS, earned â¹12 crore. Further, Wipro's Chief Strategy Officer Rishad Premji's compensation rose 250% to â¹5.9 crore. Wipro, India's third largest IT firm, posted a 6% decline in profit for the year at â¹8,003 crore.

headlines: Enjoy playing underdog, not superhero or tough guy: Ranbir
text: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that he enjoys playing the "underdog" and not the "superhero or the tough guy". He added, "It doesn't come naturally to me. I enjoy a Barfi! or a Rockstar." He further said, "My character in Besharam was an alpha male and I don't have the confidence as an actor to play that."
