headlines: Never planned singing, have offers for films: Iulia Vantur
text: Iulia Vantur, who sang 'Selfish' and 'Party Chale On' songs from 'Race 3', has said that she never planned singing and has received offers to star in films. She added, "Initially I said no, now I am thinking. Honestly, right now...I don't know." "I want to focus on this, and become better and do it right," she further said.

headlines: Watch the 95th-min goal that helped Germany stay alive in WC
text: Midfielder Toni Kroos scored with a curling free-kick in the 95th minute to help Germany defeat Sweden 2-1 to stay alive in the 2018 FIFA World Cup. The defending champions needed a win to not be dependent on other teams to progress to the second round. As many as 18 players were inside the box when Kroos took the shot.

headlines: Brazil coach tumbles to ground while celebrating late goal
text: Brazilian football team head coach Tite tumbled to the ground while celebrating midfielder Coutinho's 91st-minute goal against Costa Rica in the 2018 FIFA World Cup on Friday. The 57-year-old fell over after being unintentionally pushed to the ground by a player. Tite revealed that he picked up a thigh injury due to the fall.

headlines: 60-kg life-size chocolate sculpture made for Messi's b'day
text: A Moscow confectionery built a life-size chocolate sculpture of Argentina football team captain Lionel Messi to mark his 31st birthday. A team of five workers took almost a week to carve the 60-kg sculpture. The sculpture will be put on display in the town of Bronnitsy, which is Argentina's base for the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

headlines: After thrashing Pak 4-0, India beat Olympic champs Argentina
text: After thrashing Pakistan 4-0 in the Champions Trophy opener on Saturday, the Indian men's hockey team registered a 2-1 victory over defending Olympic champions Argentina on Sunday. India are currently on top of the points table of the six-team tournament, with six points from two matches. India will next face 14-time champions Australia on Wednesday.

headlines: Facebook working on tool to track users' time spent on app
text: Facebook is working on a feature called 'Your Time on Facebook' which will track how much time users spend on an average on the app. It will also offer users an option to set a daily time limit to reduce app usage. A company spokesperson confirmed the same but did not reveal when or if the feature would be launched.

headlines: Can't fix office toilet due to US export ban, claims ZTE
text: Chinese technology giant ZTE has claimed it cannot fix an office toilet as it was made by the US-based manufacturer, American Standard. ZTE couldn't buy spare parts for repair due to the US export ban, according to a notice by the company's administration department. The notice further said the toilet would be fixed as soon as the ban is lifted.

headlines: NoBroker records 465% rise in revenue at â¹6.28 crore in FY17
text: Bengaluru-based real-estate startup NoBroker has recorded a 465.7% rise in revenue at â¹6.28 crore for the financial year 2017, compared to â¹1.11 crore in the previous fiscal, according to filings. The startup has raised $20 million so far and counts SAIF Partners and BEENEXT as investors. Founded in 2014, NoBroker lets customers buy, sell or rent houses without paying brokerage.

headlines: Collector met PM in black as locals stripped of black cloth
text: District Collector Karamveer Sharma received PM Narendra Modi in Madhya Pradesh wearing a black suit while people attending the latter's rally were made to remove black clothing. Although the police denied that there was any protocol against black clothing, reports said the decision was taken in consideration of recent farmers' agitation wherein black was used as a sign of protest.

headlines: IAS officers to be assessed on attitude about weaker section
text: IAS officers holding the posts of Secretary and Additional Secretary will be appraised on the basis of their attitude towards the economically weaker sections among other criteria, draft forms released by the Centre have revealed. The Personnel Ministry has sought the state governments' inputs on the revised forms, which will assess officers on qualities such as effective decision making.

headlines: Man killed by neighbours over brother's inter-caste marriage
text: A 23-year-old man was killed in Haryana's Jind by his neighbours who were upset about his elder brother's inter-caste marriage, the police said on Saturday. The victim's brother had married a Dalit girl against her family's wishes. The accused, who were reportedly drunk, had reached the victim's house with lathis and attacked him when he came out.

headlines: Bodies of 4 engineering students recovered from Andhra river
text: The bodies of four students enrolled at a private engineering college in Andhra Pradesh's Kanchikacharla were recovered from the Krishna river on Sunday. Around 100 personnel from the national and state disaster response forces participated in the rescue operations after the students, who had gone to Ibrahimpatnam for a picnic, drowned in the river on Saturday.

headlines: NSG introduces psychology test to select future commandos
text: The National Security Guard has introduced a new and comprehensive psychology test for entry-level soldiers aspiring to be inducted and trained as 'Black Cat' commandos. A threshold mark has to be obtained by a soldier in the psychology test in order to join, officials said. The move will ensure that physically and mentally fit personnel are inducted, officials added.

headlines: Got complaint on 31 loan accounts, no irregularities: ICICI
text: ICICI Bank has said that it has investigated 31 loan accounts involving â¹6,082 crore following a whistleblower complaint and found no irregularities. The anonymous complaint alleged "irregularities in the conduct of some borrower accounts" and "incorrect accounting". This marks the third whistleblower complaint since 2016, with previous ones leading to controversies including Videocon loan row.

headlines: Pak candidate declares â¹22,500 crore in assets before elections
text: Independent candidate Mohammad Hussain Shaikh contesting the National Assembly and Punjab province elections in Pakistan has declared around â¹22,500 crore in assets, Pakistani media reported. Shaikh claims that he owns land comprising almost 40% of Muzaffargarh city, which had previously been disputed and was stuck in a case for 88 years before the Supreme Court recently ruled in his favour.

headlines: Ali Zafar seeks â¹55 cr from actress over her harassment claim
text: Pakistani actor-singer Ali Zafar filed a defamation case claiming damages of over â¹55 crore against singer-actress Meesha Shafi, who accused him of sexual harassment on social media. Zafar claimed Shafi caused "tremendous injury" to his "reputation... livelihood". His claims included â¹1.11 crore for mental torture and over â¹22 crore for loss of business opportunities.

headlines: Fan found dead 2 days after leaving home over Argentina loss
text: The body of Dinu Alex, a 30-year-old football fan, was retrieved from a river in Kerala, two days after he left his house over Argentina's defeat to Croatia in World Cup. He had left behind a suicide note, saying his favourite team had let him down. The authorities had been searching for him for the last two days.

headlines: Punjab-born player in Ireland squad for T20Is against India
text: Punjab-born off-spinner Simranjit 'Simi' Singh is in Ireland's 14-member squad for two T20Is against India on June 27 and 29. The 31-year-old has picked eight wickets from seven ODIs and six from four T20Is. India will be led by Virat Kohli, who was earlier scheduled to play county cricket on June 29 but was ruled out due to neck injury.

headlines: Humans only advanced civilisation in universe: Oxford study
text: A new study by Future of Humanity Institute's scholars at the Oxford University claims that humanity is the only advanced civilisation in the observable universe. For the study, titled 'Dissolving the Fermi Paradox', the scholars reevaluated the Drake Equation which calculates the number of civilisations in our galaxy that we might be able to communicate with, using seven factors.

headlines: Man lures girl at wedding with ice cream, rapes & kills her
text: A man in Gwalior has been arrested for allegedly luring a girl with an ice cream and then raping and killing her. The accused had gatecrashed a wedding in a drunken state to eat free food when he kidnapped the girl. The CCTV footage from the area shows the accused taking the girl away to a secluded location.

headlines: Haryana village 1st to pass 'No Toilet, No Bride' resolution
text: Haryana's Godikan village panchayat has passed a 'No Toilet, No Bride' resolution, becoming the first panchayat in the country to do so. According to the resolution, girls from Godikan will not be married off in houses without a toilet. "If girls have to go out of their homes to relieve themselves, they will not be safe," the village sarpanch said.

headlines: Pakistani Taliban confirms chief's death, appoints successor
text: Confirming the death of its leader Mullah Fazlullah in a US air strike, the Pakistani Taliban named Mufti Noor Wali Mehsud as the new chief on Saturday. Mehsud was appointed deputy leader by Fazlullah in February this year. Pakistani Taliban spokesman Muhammed Khorasani said it was a matter of pride that all the previous leaders had been martyred.

headlines: Messi signed 1st BarÃ§a contract on a napkin as a 13-year-old
text: Argentina captain and five-time Ballon d'Or-winner Lionel Messi signed his first informal contract for Barcelona on a table napkin as a 13-year-old in 2000. Messi, who was suffering from growth hormone deficiency at the time, was signed by Barcelona's Technical Secretary Carles Rexach despite opposition from some officials. Messi, who is the highest goalscorer in Barcelona history, turns 31 today.

headlines: DMK protests against TN Guv for holding meetings like a CM
text: DMK workers in Tamil Nadu have been holding black flag protests against Governor Banwarilal Purohit for "holding review meetings in every district like a Chief Minister". Accusing Purohit of interfering in state administration, DMK working President MK Stalin said he was "eyeing the chief minister's chair". Purohit said "review" was a media-coined term and his meetings are general in nature.

headlines: Cong should let other parties be in driving seat: Tejashwi
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that Congress should let other parties be in the "driving seat" in states where it is not the largest opposition party, such as Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. "[T]he talk about a prime ministerial candidate should be secondary because there is danger facing the country. The Constitution, democracy, and reservation are in danger," he added.

headlines: BJP leader shot dead in Tripura by unknown assailants
text: BJP leader Biswajit Pal was shot dead by unknown men around midnight on Saturday, 200 metres from his home in Tripura's Agartala. The 35-year-old had been returning home from work when the accused shot him in his chest. His family claimed he had complained of stalkers a few days ago and police suspect a land dispute led to the murder.

headlines: JNU drops plan to offer 'Islamic terrorism' course
text: The Jawaharlal Nehru University has dropped its plan to start a course on 'Islamic terrorism' following objections raised by some professors and the Delhi Minorities Commission. The Commission had issued a notice to JNU, stating the course would "create wrong notions about Muslims" and "deteriorate" the communal atmosphere. Instead, it suggested a course on how religions are being misused.

headlines: PM Modi opens metro linking Delhi to 'Gateway to Haryana'
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated an 11-km-long elevated section of Delhi Metro's Green Line that will link the capital to Bahadurgarh, which is also known as 'Gateway to Haryana'. This is the third place in Haryana to be brought under Delhi Metro's network, after Gurugram and Faridabad. With 20 trains in service, the section will have seven stations.

headlines: Odisha worker finds house filled with over 100 baby cobras
text: A daily worker who recently built his thatched house with his savings in an Odisha village found it infested with over 100 baby cobras on Friday. The Snake Helpline NGO was called, which said, "We are still looking for the mother cobra." Notably, snakebite deaths account for about 37% of the total number of disaster deaths in Odisha.

headlines: IndiGo flight forced to land due to cracks in windshield
text: An IndiGo flight headed towards Bengaluru made an emergency landing at the Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport in Kolkata on Sunday after the pilot discovered cracks in the windshield. The flight had departed at 10:15 am, and landed by 10:34 am. All the passengers were safe and the aircraft is being repaired.

headlines: 12-yr-old takes grandma to hospital in cart over no ambulance
text: A 12-year-old boy had to ferry his grandmother to a community health centre in a cart in UP's Basti district as no ambulance was available. He said, "Daadi was crying in pain and her condition was deteriorating with every passing minute." While his 85-year-old grandmother is undergoing treatment in a hospital, officials said they have taken note of the incident.

headlines: 17-year-old Muslim girl refuses to marry, seeks police help
text: A 17-year-old Muslim girl named Ravanna sought the help of the police as her parents were forcing her to get married even though she wanted to pursue her studies. A police team managed to convince her family to call off the wedding. However, Ravanna refused to stay with her family and has now been sent to a women's hostel.

headlines: Jharkhand farmer ends life as water supply to field blocked
text: A 50-year-old farmer allegedly hanged himself inside his house in a Jharkhand village after forest officials blocked water supply to his field. "Water not reaching the fields might be one of the reasons behind the suicide," authorities said. However, the police said there may be another reason as the economic condition of the family didn't seem to be "very bad."

headlines: Violence, cruelty cannot solve any problem: PM Modi
text: Talking about the Jallianwala Bagh massacre, Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said, "Violence and cruelty can never solve any problem." He added, "It is peace and non-violence, renunciation and martyrdom that are triumphant in the end." He also said Guru Nanak Dev Ji and Kabir Das worked towards social harmony and fought against casteism.

headlines: Woman kills, buries newborn in cow dung pit in Odisha
text: A woman in Odisha's Mayurbhanj allegedly killed and buried her newborn son in a cow dung pit last week. While the woman claimed the child was stillborn, locals allege she was trying to hide him because he was born out of wedlock. They claimed she killed the child, hid him in a container, and later buried him in the pit.

headlines: GST is a celebration of honesty: PM Modi in Mann ki Baat
text: During the 45th edition of his programme 'Mann ki Baat', PM Narendra Modi called GST a "celebration of honesty". Adding that "inspector raj has been taken over by information technology" under GST, the PM said, "One nation, one tax reform is now a reality...GST has set a fine example of cooperative federalism and states unitedly contributed towards it."

headlines: Kerala's 4th international airport to open in September
text: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Saturday announced the state's fourth international airport in Kannur will begin operations in September this year. Following a meeting with Union Civil Aviation Minister Suresh Prabhu, the CM added that development plans for Thiruvananthapuram and Kozhikode airports were also discussed. He also said that a feasibility study for an airport at Aranmula is underway.

headlines: Saffron-coloured 'Yogi mango' displayed at festival in UP
text: During the sixth mango festival in Lucknow, a cultivator displayed the 'Yogi mango', named after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath. "The mango is small and round shaped. The speciality of this mango is the colour. It is saffron in colour," an official said. He added that the mango will come in the market in the next three to four years.

headlines: Minister repairs road for son's wedding as govt ignores plea
text: Uttar Pradesh minister OP Rajbhar has repaired a 500-metre long road outside his residence ahead of his son's wedding reception after the authorities ignored his pleas. Rajbhar said he requested the government to mend the road two months ago but to no avail. He added he had no option but to repair it himself ahead of the function on Sunday.

headlines: 'Arrogant' France may become no. 1 enemy on migration: Italy
text: Italy's Deputy Prime Minister Luigi Di Maio on Saturday said "arrogant" France risked becoming its no. 1 enemy on migration issues. "Italy indeed faces a migration emergency and it's partly because France keeps pushing back people at the border," he added. He further said that French President Emmanuel Macron should open the country's ports to let migrants in.

headlines: Airborne car crashes into US gas station, driver unharmed
text: A video of an airborne car crashing into a gas station in the US state of Mississippi has surfaced online. Following the crash, the female driver can be seen stepping out of the car unharmed and walking away. She was later arrested by the police and charged with driving under the influence.

headlines: Saudi Arabia becomes last country to allow women to drive
text: Saudi Arabia became the last country in the world to allow women to drive after it lifted the ban on female motorists on Sunday. "Now every woman has the right to drive a car anywhere in the kingdom," the country's traffic authorities spokesman said. The Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman had announced the lifting of the ban last year.

headlines: Swaraj's husband replies to user calling them marriage goals
text: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj's husband Swaraj Kaushal responded to a woman who tweeted to him saying, "as a single woman by choice - you and ma'am Sushma Swaraj are marriage goals". Kaushal replied saying, "Pls don't mention goals. I am missing them like Messi." He earlier replied to a user who asked about Sushma Swaraj's salary.

headlines: Too early to form opinion: Priyanka's mom on meeting Nick
text: Talking about meeting Priyanka Chopra's rumoured boyfriend Nick Jonas, her mother Madhu Chopra said, "I've met him for the first time, it's too early to form an opinion." "We...went out for dinner...But it was a large group...So I didn't get the time to know him that well," she added. Nick, an American singer, arrived in India with Priyanka on Thursday.

headlines: 12-year-old Indian 2nd youngest Grandmaster in chess history
text: Chennai's R Praggnanandhaa has become the second youngest Grandmaster in chess history at the age of 12 years, 10 months, 13 days. The youngest Grandmaster ever is Russia's Sergey Karjakin, who achieved the feat aged 12 years, 7 months and has held the record since 2002. Apart from World Champion, Grandmaster is the highest title a chess player can attain.

headlines: I third-wheeled with Virat, Anushka on their dates: Rahul
text: Team India player KL Rahul has revealed he "third-wheeled" with Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma on some of their dates while he was going through a low phase in 2014. "Anushka was there in Melbourne...She told me she isn't going to let me sit alone and said she and Virat would take me out for dinner," said Rahul.

headlines: Class 10 boy stabbed junior 31 times in 90 sec in Vadodara
text: The Class 10 boy arrested for the murder of his junior in Vadodara had stabbed him with a knife 31 times in 90 seconds, the investigation has revealed. The accused committed the murder because he wanted to shut down the school after being scolded for not doing his homework, police said. "The victim could have been any student," police added.

headlines: 'Handpump wali chachis' repair pumps for free in MP
text: A group of 15 tribal women from Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur, popularly called 'Handpump wali chachis', have been repairing handpumps for free for the last 8-9 years. The group, which has also worked in Bhopal, Delhi and Rajasthan, travel around villages on foot to offer their services. They said that they have not received any help from the authorities.

headlines: 19 of India's 25 dirtiest cities are in West Bengal
text: Nineteen of the 25 dirtiest cities in India are in West Bengal, according to a survey by the union housing and urban affairs ministry. The 19 cities include Darjeeling, Siliguri, North Barrackpore and Bankura. Notably, West Bengal had not participated in the cleanliness surveys conducted by the ministry in 2016 and 2017.

headlines: Farmers protest as banker seeks sexual favour to grant loan
text: Farmers in Maharashtra on Saturday staged a protest outside Central Bank of India's Datala branch after a bank manager was booked for asking sexual favours from a farmer's wife in exchange for a crop loan. As the branch was closed, the protestors vandalised the bank's board and painted its wall black. The police later arrested a few agitating farmers.

headlines: Man arrested for sharing morphed picture of Baba Ramdev
text: A 40-year-old man from Noida has been arrested for sharing a morphed picture of Baba Ramdev on a WhatsApp group. In the image, Ramdev was seen lifting his leg while a group of men stands around him. Patanjali Ayurved's CEO Acharya Balkrishna later tweeted, "Thank you... for taking action against the man who defamed Baba Ramdev through the objectionable photo".

headlines: Doctor accused of removing patient's kidney without consent
text: The family of a 60-year-old man in Uttar Pradesh has filed a complaint against a doctor alleging he removed his kidney without permission during a surgery for kidney stone removal. The family claims when they asked him about the organ removal, he couldn't give a satisfactory reply. The doctor said he discussed all possibilities with the family before the surgery.

headlines: US reunites 522 children separated under immigration policy
text: The US government has reunited 522 children separated from adults as part of the country's immigration policy. However, the US Homeland Security Department said children detained for other reasons would continue to be separated. This comes after President Donald Trump signed an executive order to end the policy of separating immigrant children from their families on the US-Mexico border.

headlines: WH Press Secy 'kicked' out of eatery for working for Trump
text: White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders was "kicked" out of a restaurant in Virginia on Friday because she works for President Donald Trump. Sanders confirmed the incident on Twitter and wrote, "I was told...to leave...and I politely left." Earlier this week, US Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen was heckled by protestors while she was dining at a restaurant.

headlines: Iran will face wrath of entire world if it pursues nukes: US
text: Warning Iran against pursuing its nuclear programme, US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has said, "The wrath of the entire world will fall upon them." "We would end up down a path that I don't think is in the best interests of Iran," he added. However, Pompeo clarified he was not talking about a military option.

headlines: It's nice being Ranbir's wife in 'Sanju': Dia Mirza
text: Actress Dia Mirza, who will be portraying Sanjay Dutt's wife Maanayata Dutt in Ranbir Kapoor's 'Sanju', said, "It's so nice being Ranbir's wife." She added that given a chance, she wouldn't choose any other role in the film. Talking about her reaction when she saw Ranbir's look as Sanjay in the biopic, she said, "Has Sanjay gotten inside Ranbir's body?"

headlines: First look of Sanya Malhotra from 'Pataakha' unveiled
text: The first look of Sanya Malhotra from her upcoming film 'Pataakha' has been unveiled. Sanya made her Bollywood debut with Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'. The Vishal Bhardwaj directorial, which was earlier titled 'Chhuriyaan', will be releasing on September 28. Also starring Sunil Grover in the lead role, 'Pataakha' will reportedly mark the Bollywood debut of TV actress Radhika Madan.

headlines: How did govt let UN report on Kashmir see light of day: Cong
text: Slamming the government over the UN report alleging human rights violation in Kashmir, Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera said, "We are very agitated...how did the UN report on human rights see the light of the day?" Calling the report the "biggest question mark on our foreign policy", Khera said that Congress had criticised the report in stronger words than the government.

headlines: Andhra will be torn apart if monkey gangs come to power: CM
text: Referring to his political opponents, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Saturday said the state will be torn apart if "monkey gangs" come to power in the assembly elections next year. These people promise a lot of things which cannot be fulfilled, he added. The state will develop only if one party is elected in successive elections, he asserted.

headlines: Government body to protest animal sacrifice ahead of Bakrid
text: Ahead of the festival of Bakrid, or Eid al-Adha, the Animal Welfare Board of India (AWBI) is launching a campaign against the slaughter of animals for sacrifice. "People are not aware, they link it to religion, but this is not a religion thing. In no religion can you kill animals," the board's Chairman SP Gupta said.

headlines: Secular forces except Cong must unite against BJP: Kerala CM
text: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan has said, "The main task is to defeat the BJP by rallying all secular and democratic forces. But this has to be done without having a political alliance with the Congress." Claiming the NDA had failed on all fronts, he added, "All are upset with the present regime. It has to go, sooner the better."

headlines: Haryana makes LED lights mandatory in government offices
text: Haryana has made use of LED bulbs and tubelights mandatory in all government offices by August 15. All halogen, sodium bulbs, and tubelights will be replaced with energy-efficient LED bulbs and tubelights, as per CM Manohar Lal Khattar's directions. The use of incandescent lamps and purchase of sodium vapour lamps by government sector is already banned, officials said.

headlines: Man thrashed on rumour of being child lifter dies in Bengal
text: A 36-year-old man who was attacked in East Midnapore, West Bengal a week ago on suspicions of being a child lifter succumbed to his injuries on Saturday. The police said, "We have already arrested four people and are searching for other suspects." Meanwhile, a youngster was stripped and assaulted in Malda district on suspicions of being a child lifter.

headlines: MLA sleeps in crematorium to reassure construction workers
text: TDP MLA Nimmala Rama Naidu slept in a crematorium on Friday night in Andhra Pradesh's Palakol to drive away fear among the construction workers engaged in its modernisation. The workers were scared after noticing a partially burnt corpse and had refused to work, the MLA said. "On Saturday, about 50 workers returned to work to resume the construction," he added.

headlines: 100 Naxals appear for IGNOU test in Odisha
text: Over 100 Naxals, who surrendered before the Odisha Police, have appeared for Indira Gandhi National Open University's (IGNOU) Bachelor Preparatory Programme exam. After clearing the test, candidates can seek admission to various Bachelors degrees offered by the university. District authorities are providing free education to Naxals to ensure that they get a chance to enter the mainstream society.

headlines: Congress should apologise, act against Azad, Soz: Amit Shah
text: BJP President Amit Shah has asked Congress to apologise for the statements of its senior leaders Ghulam Nabi Azad and Saifuddin Soz and take action against them. This came after Azad said the Indian Army was killing more civilians than terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, while Soz supported a statement by former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf about Kashmiris preferring independence.

headlines: Twitter users mock UK PM May's curtsey to Prince William
text: Reacting to a video of UK Prime Minister Theresa May's curtsey to Prince William, a Twitter user wrote, "Could someone please take Theresa May to a ballet class and show her how to curtsey." While other users tweeted, "Looks like she's about to sit on the floor," and "Theresa May how's your back?"

headlines: Narayana Murthy misses Infosys AGM for second straight year
text: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy didn't attend the firm's Annual General Meeting (AGM) for second straight year. Murthy and other co-founders including Nandan Nilekani and S Gopalakrishnan had skipped the AGM for the first time in June 2017. They remained absent amidst serious differences over governance issues with some of the board's previous members and first non-founder CEO Vishal Sikka.

headlines: Messi lasted less than 50 secs on field on international debut
text: Argentina captain Lionel Messi lasted just around 43 seconds on the field on his international debut, before getting a red card. Messi, who turns 31 today, debuted for Argentina on August 17, 2005, in a friendly against Hungary by coming on as a substitute in the second half. The forward elbowed a player in the neck and was sent off.

headlines: Jon Snow actor Kit marries his Game of Thrones co-star Rose
text: 'Game of Thrones' actors Kit Harington, who portrayed Jon Snow, and his girlfriend Rose Leslie, who used to play the character Ygritte in the show, got married today. Their reception is being held at Wardhill Castle in Aberdeenshire, Scotland, which belongs to Rose's family. Guests at the wedding included their co-stars Peter Dinklage, Maisie Williams, Sophie Turner and Emilia Clarke.

headlines: Shut up or I'll go naked: Sona to trolls on Odia bhajan row
text: Singer Sona Mohapatra, in tweets against those slamming her for her rendition of an Odia bhajan, wrote, "I'll go full naked with higher 'hills' and show you Chandi's true colours if you don't shut up." She tweeted in response to a user who had accused her of tarnishing Odia culture by wearing half-naked clothing and heels while performing the bhajan.

headlines: Shah Rukh gave ailing Irrfan keys to his London house: Report
text: Shah Rukh Khan handed actor Irrfan Khan the keys to his house in London before the actor left for UK for the treatment of neuroendocrine tumour, as per reports. Shah Rukh wanted Irrfan to feel at home in London while battling his health crisis, reports added. He reportedly visited Irrfan's Mumbai residence and they spent nearly two hours together.

headlines: BJP-PDP split due to partiality towards Jammu, Ladakh: Shah
text: Speaking about BJP pulling out of its alliance with PDP in Jammu and Kashmir, BJP President Amit Shah said that the Modi government made several efforts but partiality towards Jammu and Ladakh continued. He added, "There was no point of BJP staying in power if the goal of equal development in Jammu and Kashmir wasn't achieved."nn

headlines: Won't allow Kashmir to get disintegrated from India: Shah
text: Asserting that Jammu and Kashmir is an integral part of India, BJP President Amit Shah on Saturday said that his party will never allow Kashmir to get disintegrated from the country. Speaking at a rally to mark the martyrdom anniversary of Jana Sangh founder Syama Prasad Mookerjee, he added, "If J&K is today part of India, it's because of Mookerjee."

headlines: Army Major's wife found with throat slit, body run over by car
text: The wife of an Indian Army Major was found dead with her throat slit and body run over by a car, presumed to belong to the murderer, on a street close to Delhi's cantonment area on Saturday. She had left for a physiotherapy session and was last seen taking a lift in another car from outside the hospital, police said.

headlines: â¹3.6 lakh fine collected in Nashik on 1st day of plastic ban
text: At least 72 people were penalised and â¹3.6 lakh fine collected in Nashik on the first day of the plastic ban that came into effect across Maharashtra today. Plastic items of over 350 kilograms were also seized, as per a Nashik Municipal Corporation release. The fine for the first-time and second-time offenders is â¹5,000 and â¹10,000 respectively.

headlines: Heart transported 323 km in 94 minutes for 4-year-old girl
text: A live heart covered a total distance of 323 kilometres from an Aurangabad hospital to Mumbai within 94 minutes. It was flown to Mumbai and then taken to the hospital via a green corridor in an ambulance for a four-year-old girl's transplant surgery. The heart was retrieved from a 13-year-old boy who passed away in a road accident.

headlines: Govt built 8cr toilets in urban, rural areas in 4 years: PM
text: Addressing a gathering in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Saturday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi claimed in the last four years, the government constructed over 8 crore 30 thousand toilets in urban and rural areas combined. Further asserting that over 65 lakh toilets had been constructed in Madhya Pradesh itself, he said 'Swachh Bharat' is now on the verge of reality.

headlines: Clip shows mob forcing 65-yr-old to confess to cow slaughter
text: A video purportedly showing a mob beating a 65-year-old Muslim man and forcing him to confess to cow slaughter in UP's Hapur has surfaced. The man can be seen bleeding from his head while pleading to his attackers. He was one of the two victims of a mob lynching which left him seriously injured and led to the other's demise.

headlines: Zimbabwe President Mnangagwa survives assassination attempt
text: Zimbabwe President Emmerson Mnangagwa on Saturday survived an assassination attempt during an election campaign rally in the Bulawayo city. Vice Presidents Constantino Chiwenga and Kembo Mohadi sustained minor injuries after an explosion rocked the venue of the rally. The assassination attempt comes ahead of the presidential elections in Zimbabwe which are scheduled to be held in July.

headlines: Plastic frogs 'married' in UP to seek rain from Lord Indra
text: Locals in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi organised a wedding ceremony for two plastic frogs to please Lord Indra (God of rain) and pray for the arrival of monsoon. Two people, who were dressed as bride and groom, carried the frogs on decorated plates during the ritual. "It's an old belief that wedding of frogs makes Indra Dev happy," a local said.

headlines: Manveer is a dear friend: Kamya Punjabi on dating rumours
text: Denying dating rumours with Bigg Boss 10 winner Manveer Gurjar, TV actress and Bigg Boss 7 contestant Kamya Punjabi said, "Manveer is a dear friend." She added that if she falls in love with anyone she would be happy to let everyone know. The rumours started after Kamya and Manveer met at a party last year.

headlines: Arijit, Meghna win best playback singers at IIFA 2018
text: Arijit Singh won the Best Playback Singer (Male) award for 'Hawaayein' from 'Jab Harry Met Sejal' and Meghna Mishra won Best Playback Singer (Female) award for 'Main Kaun Hoon' from 'Secret Superstar' at the 2018 IIFA Awards. Pritam won Best Background Score award for 'Jagga Jasoos'. Meanwhile, Nitesh Tiwari and Shreyas Jain won Best Screenplay award for 'Bareilly ki Barfi'.

headlines: Ranbir, I wanted lead roles so never worked together: Sonam
text: Sonam Kapoor, while talking about working with Ranbir Kapoor after the gap of 11 years, said, "He always does lead roles, I also want to do only leading parts. So, it never worked out." Sonam, who starred opposite Ranbir in their debut film 'Saawariya' in 2007, added, "It's just that we just didn't get a film to do in between."

headlines: HernÃ¡ndez nets 50th int'l goal as Mexico post 2nd win in WC
text: Forward Javier HernÃ¡ndez became the first Mexican to reach 50 international goals as the North American team defeated South Korea 2-1 in a Group F fixture at the 2018 FIFA World Cup on Saturday. Further, the former Manchester United striker became only the third Mexican to score in three different World Cup editions. Mexico currently lead the Group F table.

headlines: 95th-minute goal helps Germany stay alive in 2018 FIFA WC
text: Defending champions Germany scored in the 95th minute to register a 2-1 comeback victory against Sweden to register their first win in the 2018 FIFA World Cup. The four-time champions needed a win or a draw against Sweden to stay alive in the tournament, after having lost their opening match to Mexico. Germany will next face South Korea on Wednesday.

headlines: Argentina gang smuggles cocaine in World Cup trophy replicas
text: Police in the Argentine capital of Buenos Aires busted a drug smuggling gang that used replicas of the FIFA World Cup trophy to smuggle cocaine and marijuana. Police found eight World Cup trophy replicas with 1.5kg of drugs inside each of them. At least six people were arrested in the raid conducted by the police.

headlines: Can't select players based on one test: Yo-Yo Test creator
text: Dr Jens Bangsbo, a Danish soccer physiologist who developed the Yo-Yo Test which is compulsory for Team India selection, has said players cannot be selected based on a single test. This comes after two Indian cricketers, Mohammad Shami and Ambati Rayudu were dropped after failing the test. The test, which was developed in 1991 for football, has been criticised.

headlines: Once teased Hayden, he threatened to punch me: Parthiv Patel
text: Wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel, in an episode of Breakfast with Champions, revealed ex-Australian batsman Matthew Hayden once threatened to punch him during an ODI. "I was carrying drinks after Hayden's dismissal...and...I said, 'Woohoo' to tease him," Parthiv said. "While going back...Hayden was standing on the way and said, 'If you ever do this again...I'll punch you on your face'," Parthiv added.

headlines: Rebel BJP MLA's son floats new party to contest Raj polls
text: Rebel BJP MLA Ghanshyam Tiwari's son Akhilesh has founded a new political party named 'Bharat Vahini Party' to contest the Rajasthan polls, scheduled for later this year. The party will field candidates from all constituencies under the leadership of Ghanshyam. Around 2,000 party leaders and workers will attend the first party meeting, which will be organised in July.

headlines: Important leaders belittled to glorify one family: PM Modi
text: In an apparent jibe at the Congress, PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said deliberate efforts were made to belittle "towering personalities" in order "to glorify one family". Paying his tributes to Bharatiya Jana Sangh founder Syama Prasad Mookerjee on his death anniversary, he added, "Programmes such as Startup India and Make in India are a reflection of his ideas."

headlines: Delhi govt depts carry out construction despite ban by L-G
text: Various government departments like Public Works Department (PWD), Central Public Works Department (CPWD), and NBCC India carried out construction work in Delhi despite the ban imposed by Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal. The construction of the ITO skywalk, authorised by the PWD, was ongoing for the entire duration of the ban on the grounds that it is majorly steelwork.

headlines: 33 Cambodian pregnant women found in raid on surrogacy ring
text: Thirty-three pregnant women were found during a raid on an illegal commercial surrogacy operation in Cambodia, police officials said. The women were carrying babies on behalf of Chinese clients, police added. One Chinese man and four Cambodian women were arrested and charged with human trafficking and being intermediaries in surrogacy.

headlines: Mexican airline offers to reunite migrant families for free
text: Mexico-based Volaris Airlines has offered free flights to reunite migrant children who were separated from their families. "It hurts to see these children without their parents and it is our vocation to reunite them," the airline said. Earlier this week, four US airlines had asked the government not to use their flights to transport the children away from their parents.

headlines: Ratan Tata-backed firm under ED lens for foreign investments
text: Ratan Tata's investment arm RNT Associates is under the Enforcement Directorate's lens over its offshore investment portfolio. The agency has sought details such as nature of activities of RNT Associates, bank account details and copies of audited balance sheets. This comes after a whistleblower sent a letter to RBI explaining financials and transactions of RNT Associates and its Singapore unit.

headlines: Gang-raped women were forced by accused to drink urine: Cops
text: Five NGO workers, who were abducted and raped while performing a street play in Jharkand, were forced by the accused to drink their urine, police has revealed. Six men had abducted an 11-member group about 100 km from Ranchi, and driven them into a forest to rape them. Two of the six have been arrested and confessed to the crime.

headlines: Thrown napkin helps solve 32-year-old rape-murder case in US
text: A discarded napkin at a restaurant has helped investigators crack the murder case of a 12-year-old girl in the US in 1986. The napkin was used to match DNA of the 66-year-old man who had raped and murdered the girl in a park. Investigators had collected DNA from the crime scene, which helped locate the accused's kin and the accused.

headlines: Will honour him: Sena on officer who shamed interfaith couple
text: After a passport officer was transferred for shaming an interfaith couple in Lucknow earlier this week, a Shiv Sena delegation said they'll honour him. Slamming the government's decision to transfer him, the delegation added that the officer was doing his work diligently. "Government was trying to appease Muslims. It was a matter of national security," added the delegation. n

headlines: Biometric attendance made compulsory in J&K govt offices
text: Jammu and Kashmir Governor NN Vohra on Friday made biometric attendance compulsory in all state government offices with immediate effect. The move is aimed at ensuring punctuality in all the offices. All employees, including contractual, consolidated, and casual employees, have been directed to enrol themselves and no salary would be disbursed to those who are not enrolled.

headlines: 42,000 lost answer sheets of Bihar board exams sold for â¹8,000
text: Over 42,000 evaluated answer sheets of Class 10 of Bihar School Examination Board, which went missing a week ago, were found with a scrap dealer. Following his arrest, he confessed to the police that the peon of SS Balika High School sold it to him for â¹8,000. The peon had been selling answer sheets to the scrap dealer since 2014.

headlines: Which Indian states have banned plastic?
text: Maharashtra has become the 18th state to enforce a complete ban on the sale, use and manufacture of plastic bags. Other states which have imposed a complete ban include Rajasthan, Jammu & Kashmir, Uttar Pradesh, among others. Goa, Gujarat, Kerala, Odisha and West Bengal have partial bans on plastic use, typically around sites of religious importance or during pilgrimage season.

headlines: Wanted to teach women a lesson: Accused in J'khand gangrape
text: The accused in the Jharkhand gangrape case have revealed in their statement that they wanted to teach the five NGO activists a lesson, said the police. The women were abducted and gangraped when they were performing a street play in a village school and the incident was filmed to threaten them. Out of the six accused, two have been arrested.

headlines: Infosys is ready and relevant, everyone is united: Nilekani
text: The brand Infosys is ready and relevant and "everyone is united" to take the company higher, Non-Executive Chairman Nandan Nilekani said on Saturday. He further said that several steps have been taken to bring back stability in the company. "Our priority is to get our strategy right under the leadership of Salil Parekh," Nilekani added.

headlines: Criminal case on bankers for sanctioning loans is silly: IBA
text: The Indian Banks' Association (IBA) CEO VG Kannan has said that slapping "a criminal case against bankers for sanctioning loans is silly". This comes after Bank of Maharashtra CEO Ravindra Marathe was arrested in â¹3,000-crore DSK Group loan fraud case. "Bankers are not concerned if a company takes deposits from the public, and therefore their arrest is unwarranted," Kannan added.

headlines: Saqib Saleem to play villain in Salman's 'Dabangg 3': Report
text: Actor Saqib Saleem, who recently starred in Salman Khan's 'Race 3', will be reportedly playing the role of the villain in Salman's 'Dabangg 3'. While actor Sonu Sood played the antagonist in 'Dabangg', Prakash Raj was the villain in 'Dabangg 2'. The Prabhudheva directorial, which also stars Sonakshi Sinha, will be produced by Arbaaz Khan.

headlines: Belgium beat Tunisia in 2018 FIFA WC's highest scoring game
text: Forwards Romelu Lukaku and Eden Hazard each scored twice as Belgium thrashed Tunisia 5-2 in the highest scoring game of the 2018 FIFA World Cup so far. With the win, Belgium extended their unbeaten streak to 21 matches, the second-longest active streak. Further, the African nation is now 13 matches without a win at the FIFA World Cup.

headlines: Parrots can talk: Costliest footballer Neymar slams critics
text: World's most expensive footballer, Neymar took to social media to take a dig at critics after scoring against Costa Rica in World Cup on Friday. "Not everybody knows what I've been through to get here. To talk, even parrots can talk...but to do...few people do," the 26-year-old Brazilian wrote. "I cried out of happiness...determination and desire to win," he added.

headlines: Whenever I play vs Messi, I score twice: Nigerian striker
text: Ahead of Nigeria's match against Argentina at 2018 FIFA World Cup, the African nation's record World Cup goalscorer Ahmed Musa said whenever he plays against five-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi, he scores. "Possibly, I'm going to score another two goals," he added. "We know the importance of the last game, it's do-or-die...we can't afford to lose," Musa further said.

headlines: India score last 3 goals in 6 minutes, thrash Pakistan 4-0
text: The Indian men's hockey team scored their last three goals within a span of six minutes to thrash Pakistan 4-0 in the opening match of the Champions Trophy's final edition on Saturday. India have now won eight of their last 10 hockey matches against Pakistan. The Indian team will next face Argentina on Sunday.

headlines: Rahul Dravid chose coaching India U-19 over IPL: BCCI head
text: Vinod Rai, Chief of BCCI's Committee of Administrators, has said Rahul Dravid chose to coach the India 'A' and U-19 teams over IPL franchise Delhi Daredevils when the conflict of interest issue arose. "We gave Rahul two options...IPL or a 12-month BCCI contract. Rahul said I'll give my time to the Under-19 team," revealed Rai.

headlines: Sarah Taylor best wicketkeeper in the world: Adam Gilchrist
text: Former Australian wicketkeeper-batsman Adam Gilchrist has said that England Women wicketkeeper Sarah Taylor is the "best wicketkeeper in the world at the moment" across men's and women's cricket. "It's a pretty bold statement, because there are a lot of fine wicketkeepers around," he added. Gilchrist had hailed Taylor on social media days ago for a stumping against South Africa Women.

headlines: Female bodybuilder claims pics being misused on social media
text: Indian female bodybuilder Shweta Rathore has registered a case with police alleging that her pictures were being misused on social media platforms. Shweta has claimed that an unidentified Instagram account posted pictures of her taken at various events to attract followers. "No one deserves to be bullied or have fake information that could jeopardise their lives," Shweta wrote on Instagram.

headlines: 1st Tesla race car that can go 0-100kmph in 2.1s hits tracks
text: Tesla's first race-ready car, capable of going from 0 to 100 kmph in 2.1 seconds, was taken to the tracks for the first time in Barcelona on Thursday, ahead of the Electric GT racing championship planned in November. Being lighter by 500 kg than the production car, Tesla Model S P100DL is 30% faster, with speeds reaching 250 kmph.

headlines: Tamil Nadu becoming breeding ground for extremists: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Pon Radhakrishnan has claimed that Tamil Nadu is becoming the "breeding ground" for activities by extremists, adding that Naxal training camps are being organised in the state's hilly areas. Slamming the AIADMK-led state government for not taking action against extremist elements, Radhakrishnan added, "Naxals, Maoists and Muslim extremists have intruded into some of the media houses too."

headlines: Centre approves tourism projects worth â¹1,800cr for Himachal
text: The Centre has approved projects worth â¹1,800 crore for the development of tourism in Himachal Pradesh, CM Jai Ram Thakur said on Saturday. He added that the government will make efforts to develop lesser known areas in the state as tourism sites. This comes after tourism was affected in Shimla over severe water scarcity in May.

headlines: 1,300-tonne sulphuric acid removed from TN Sterlite plant
text: Days after a sulphuric acid leak was reported at Vedanta's Sterlite copper plant in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin, District Collector Sandeep Nanduri said 1,300 tonnes of the acid have been removed from the site. While authorities had dismissed the incident as a minor leak, Vedanta had moved the Madras High Court claiming that government's inaction could lead to severe environmental consequences.

headlines: Southern Railways to fine â¹2000 for selfie in front of train
text: Southern Railways will impose a fine of â¹2,000 on passengers who take a selfie in front of trains at railway stations or while standing on the footboard. The initiative aims to cut down on selfie-related train mishaps which have grown recently, said the manager of Coimbatore Railway junction. People found repeating the offence will be imprisoned for six months.

headlines: Collector eats mid-day meal with kids during surprise visit
text: S Suhas, the District Collector of Kerala's Alappuzha, recently shared a mid-day meal with students of a government school where he had gone for a surprise visit. "I'd been getting complaints about the quality of food at Government Sree Devi Vilasam...So I decided to conduct a surprise visit to the school...I didn't find any issues with the meal," he said.

headlines: ABVP vandalises private school in Telangana over fee hike
text: Members of the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) allegedly vandalised several school buses parked outside a private school in Telangana's Rangareddy after it saw the school functioning despite ABVP's call for a state-wide bandh. The ABVP had called for the bandh to demand a cap on the fees charged by private schools. It also filmed the incident to instil fear.

headlines: Police detains Stalin amid DMK's protest against TN Governor
text: Police on Saturday detained DMK Working President MK Stalin along with around 400 party workers during their protest against Tamil Nadu Governor Banwarilal Purohit over his alleged "interference in the state's affairs". The protest comes a day after police detained 192 DMK workers for showing black flags to the Governor during his visit to Chennai.

headlines: Priest who slapped crying baby suspended from church duties
text: The French priest who was caught on video slapping a crying toddler has been suspended from leading baptisms and weddings. The Meaux Dioceses found Father Jacques Lacroix guilty of a "loss of coolness...that cannot be excused". "I apologised for my clumsiness to the family...it was my last baptism", the 89-year-old priest said.

headlines: Nepal to have foreign policy independent of India, China: PM
text: Nepal will share close relations with both India and China but maintain an independent foreign policy, Nepalese PM KP Sharma Oli said. Adding that as neighbours both India and China would get top priority, Oli claimed Nepal's relations with both the countries were broad, comprehensive and multi-faceted. Nepal can serve as a bridge between India and China, he further said.

headlines: Man scolded by Anushka sends legal notice to her and Virat
text: Days after Team India captain Virat Kohli shared a video of his wife Anushka Sharma scolding Arhhan Singh for littering, the man has sent a legal notice to the couple, demanding an apology from them. "The ball's in their court...I should await their response," said Arhhan. He earlier slammed Anushka for "yelling" at him and Virat for sharing his video.

headlines: Bank manager asks farmer's wife for sex to grant farm loan
text: The manager of a Central Bank of India branch in Maharashtra has been booked for asking sexual favours from the wife of a farmer seeking farm loan. The manager, Rajesh Hivase, asked for the wife's number in order to process the loan and later called her demanding the favours. The woman recorded the conversation and filed a complaint against Hivase.

headlines: Want to thank complainant: Model on magazine cover verdict
text: Talking about the Kerala High Court's verdict on 'Grihalakshmi' magazine cover which showed her breastfeeding a baby, model Gilu Joseph said, "We're thankful to the person who filed the case." "Because of that the High Court got an opportunity to appreciate us," she added. The court, while dismissing the complainant's petition, had refused to categorise the magazine cover as obscene.

headlines: Sex and the City actress Cynthia reveals her kid is transgender
text: Cynthia Nixon, who starred in the show 'Sex and the City', has revealed her oldest child is a transgender. "I'm so proud of my son...who graduated college this month. I salute him and everyone else marking today's #TransDayofAction," she wrote in a post on Friday. Cynthia has two children with ex-partner Daniel Mozes and a daughter with wife Christine Marinoni.

headlines: PM Modi inaugurates MP's â¹3866 cr Mohanpura irrigation project
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today inaugurated the Mohanpura irrigation project in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh district. The â¹3,866 crore project includes a dam and a canal system which will provide drinking water to over 400 villages. "It is a great service to women and sisters who face lots of difficulties in fetching water from long distances,â said PM Modi.nn

headlines: Ex-CEO of Yamuna Expressway firm arrested in â¹126-cr scam
text: The Uttar Pradesh Police on Friday arrested a former CEO of Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) for his alleged involvement in a â¹126-crore land scam. He has been charged with causing YEIDA a loss of â¹126 crore by unnecessarily purchasing 57 acres of land through several shell companies whose Boards of Directors included his family members and relatives.

headlines: Rape-accused Daati Maharaj may face potency test: Report
text: As per reports, rape-accused godman Daati Maharaj will be asked to perform a potency test after he denied rape allegations against him during CBI interrogation. Further, he claimed he wasn't present in his ashram on the day of the incident. The godman has been accused of raping a female follower two years ago inside a Chhattarpur ashram run by him.n

headlines: Customer finds dead lizard in biryani, eatery served notice
text: A restaurant in Vijayawada has been served a notice by food regulator FSSAI after a customer found a dead lizard in his biryani. "We...sent the biryani samples with the lizard to the lab for testing," FSSAI official N Purnachandra Rao said. A case was registered against the restaurant for not keeping kitchen premises hygienic and flouting FSSAI norms, he added.

headlines: Bajaj Finance overtakes Axis Bank in market capitalisation
text: Bajaj Finance on Friday overtook private sector lender Axis Bank in terms of market capitalisation after its shares surged 3.45%. Bajaj Finance's market capitalisation stood at â¹1,34,952 crore, which was â¹227 crore more than that of Axis Bank's â¹1,34,725 crore valuation. So far this year, shares of Bajaj Finance have gained nearly 33%, while Axis Bank has lost nearly 7%.

headlines: McDonald's stops use of plastic cutlery in west, south India
text: McDonald's south and west India operator, Hardcastle Restaurants, said it has stopped use of plastic cutlery at its outlets and switched to wooden cutlery and paper straws. "With...move to biodegradable and non-plastic alternatives, we'll be able to reduce about 200 tonnes of plastic per year," a company spokesperson said. There are 277 McDonald's restaurants across west and south India.

headlines: Villains now treated with dignity in Hindi films: Gulshan
text: Actor Gulshan Grover, who is known for portraying negative roles, said, "The villain part has now got dignity in Hindi films." He added that the "writing part of the negative characters has become far better, more research has been done in depth". He further said, "The iconic villain from Indian films has disappeared."n

headlines: Janhvi is unintentionally funny: Ishaan Khatter
text: Ishaan Khatter, who will be seen opposite Janhvi Kapoor in 'Dhadak', has said, "She (Janhvi) is a bit clumsy and unintentionally funny, which brings a smile on everyone's face." He added, "It's been delightful working with her...Janhvi and I were like Tom and Jerry on the set." He further said that Janhvi is very dedicated, involved and sincere.

headlines: There's no need to be ashamed of seeking pleasure: Anurag
text: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, while talking about his web series 'Lust Stories', said, "We don't need to be ashamed of... what we seek, wanting pleasure and self-gratification." "The biggest disease we all suffer from is unnecessary shame that is thrust upon us," he added. Anurag further said, "It's good to talk about things people don't want you to speak about."

headlines: Stop paying attention to beauty standards: Kajol
text: While talking about women being objectified and speaking against body shaming, actress Kajol said, "We just need to stop fixating on it so much and we need to stop paying so much attention to it." She added, "I think everybody is made beautifully and individually...The day we start seeing our beauty is when others will start seeing it as well."

headlines: Watch 97th-min goal that made Neymar Brazil's 3rd top scorer
text: Neymar scored in the 97th minute in Brazil's 2-0 victory against Costa Rica at 2018 FIFA World Cup on Friday to become his nation's outright third highest goalscorer. Neymar has now scored 56 goals for Brazil and is only behind Ronaldo (62) and PelÃ© (77). Further, the 26-year-old's goal was the latest scored in normal time of a WC match.

headlines: Hardik Pandya receives autographed Manchester United jersey
text: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya took to social media to share a picture of himself receiving a jersey of Premier League side Manchester United. The jersey has been autographed by all the players of the English football club and has been enclosed in a frame. "This is going straight up on my wall!" he captioned the picture.

headlines: Goa CM Parrikar playing with health in suicidal manner: Cong
text: The Congress has claimed that Goa CM Manohar Parrikar was "playing with his health" with a "suicidal tendency" by not resigning from the post over his health issues. It slammed BJP for being "irresponsible" and asking an ailing person "to go through so much stress". This comes after Parrikar returned from the US after receiving treatment for a pancreas-related ailment.

headlines: More militants killed as NDA let militancy re-emerge: Omar
text: After Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said the number of terrorists killed in Jammu and Kashmir increased during the NDA regime, former CM Omar Abdullah said the increased killings indicate that government allowed militancy to re-emerge. "You should be embarrassed by these statistics, not be claiming them as some achievement," Abdullah added.

headlines: Einstein's relativity theory valid in other galaxies: Study
text: After conducting the "most precise" test of gravity outside the Milky Way, another team of astronomers has confirmed that Albert Einstein's general theory of relativity is valid on galactic scales. "General relativity predicts that massive objects deform space-time, meaning when light passes near another galaxy the light's path is deflected," said researchers as depicted in the Einstein's ring.

headlines: Depressed retired judge shoots himself in the mouth at home
text: A 76-year-old retired district judge allegedly committed suicide on Friday by shooting himself in the mouth using his licensed gun at his residence in Ghaziabad. Stating that he was diagnosed with depression after his wife died last year, Devdutt Sharma's family said he was "otherwise quite fit". No suicide note was recovered from the deceased's room.

headlines: Suspended cop held for murdering elderly couple in Mumbai
text: A 28-year-old Odisha constable, who was suspended over his alleged involvement in his live-in partner's murder, has been arrested for allegedly robbing and murdering an elderly Mumbai couple with the assistance of their domestic help. Gold items including 28 bangles, 9 rings and 44 earrings were recovered from the two accused, who were nabbed at a railway station.

headlines: 23 Air India flights delayed due to software malfunction
text: As many as 23 Air India flights were delayed across its network today after a technical glitch in the check-in software hampered operations. âThe software-related glitch affected operations from 1 pm to 2.30 pm...during the period, check-in and other services were handled manually,â said the airline's spokesperson. New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport was among the worst affected.n

headlines: Largest Swedish music fest scrapped over sex assault claims
text: The organisers of Sweden's largest music festival have ended the event permanently following reports of sexual assault and rape. The four-day Bravalla Music Festival was cancelled this year after over 20 cases of sexual assault were reported in 2017. "(We) cannot develop the festival the way we want (it) to be relevant to visitors in the future," the organisers said.

headlines: North Korea still an 'extraordinary threat': Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said that North Korea still poses an "extraordinary threat" and renewed the "national emergency order" with respect to the regime. Sanctions against North Korea were extended for one year following the order's renewal. This comes days after Trump declared that North Korea no longer posed a nuclear threat, following his summit with leader Kim Jong-un.

headlines: 15 'fake' transgenders disqualified from Mexico elections
text: A Mexican court has disqualified the candidacy of 15 men who posed as transgenders to misuse a gender quota in local elections. The men pretended to be transgenders in the Oaxaca state as it allows them to occupy seats designated for women. The court ordered that the candidacies vacated by the disqualified men be filled by women.

headlines: US' separation of migrant kids may amount to torture: UN
text: The US government's policy of separating migrant children from their families and detaining them "may amount to torture", the UN Human Rights Council said. It added that ending the policy does not address the situation of children who have already been separated from their parents. Over 2,300 migrant children have been detained since the government implemented its policy in April.

headlines: Govt appoints Arijit Basu as new Managing Director of SBI
text: The government on Saturday appointed Arijit Basu as Managing Director of India's largest lender State Bank of India. He will fill the spot left vacant following the elevation of Rajnish Kumar as the Chairman. Basu, who has a bachelor's in Economics and master's in History, started his career with the bank almost 35 years ago as a probationary officer.

headlines: Woman taunted over dark skin poisons food; 5 dead, 88 hospitalised
text: A 23-year-old woman from Maharashtra poisoned the food served at a relative's party, which killed five people and hospitalised 88. Pradnya Survase, who was arrested after interrogation, confessed that she poisoned the food to kill her husband and in-laws, who had repeatedly taunted her over her dark complexion and cooking skills. The deceased included four children and a 53-year-old man.

headlines: Failed drug test in IPL because of Delhi pollution: McCullum
text: Former New Zealand captain Brendon McCullum has blamed his failed dope test during IPL 2016 on Delhi's pollution. McCullum, who was playing for Gujarat Lions in that edition, said since he suffers from asthma, he had increased his usual medicine dose to cope with the pollution. The increased dose then showed high levels of salbutamol, a drug which treats asthma.

headlines: My enemies tried to kill me: Anti-virus pioneer McAfee
text: John McAfee, Founder of anti-virus software company McAfee, has claimed that he was left unconscious for two days after he ate something his "enemies" had "spiked". "I am more difficult to kill than anyone can possibly imagine. And for those who did this- You will soon understand the true meaning of wrath... You had better be gone," the 72-year-old tweeted.

headlines: Poster refers to MP CM Shivraj Chouhan as Prime Minister
text: A poster showing Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan referred to as the Prime Minister was put up in Madhya Pradesh's Hoshangabad district. It also displays the photograph and designation of PM Narendra Modi. The poster gives information about PM Modi's visit to Madhya Pradesh and the projects he will inaugurate.nn

headlines: BJP IT cell is like Frankenstein's monster now: Founder
text: Founder of BJP IT Cell Prodyut Bora has said that the cell has become like 'Frankenstein's monster' now. He added, "During the 2014 campaign, the IT cell was being controlled...from Gandhinagar. It was being run by the Modi team and...the rot started there." He further said, âYou cannot fix the IT cell until you fix the partyâs President."nn

headlines: 1st human infection of new mosquito-borne virus found in US
text: A virus found in Florida's mosquitoes that can cause a rash and mild fever has been identified in humans for the first time, University of Florida researchers have reported. The virus, called "Keystone virus" after a location in the Tampa Bay area, was initially identified in 1964, while its first known human infection was observed in a teenager in 2016.

headlines: Indian envoy to Pak barred from visiting gurudwara on b'day
text: India's High Commissioner to Pakistan, Ajay Bisaria, was reportedly barred from visiting Gurdwara Panja Sahib near Rawalpindi despite having the required permissions. Bisaria, who was accompanied by his wife, wanted to pray at the gurudwara on the occasion of his birthday, reports said. This was the second time in three months that Bisaria was denied entry to the gurudwara.

headlines: PIL filed in Delhi HC against felling of over 2,500 trees
text: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in the Delhi High Court against the felling of over 2,500 trees for development projects in the national capital. Claiming the permission to cut trees "was granted incorrectly", the petition said the felling of trees in at least six locations started on Friday. HC asked petitioners to submit photographs of the trees.

headlines: 2 held for cheating 2,000 people of â¹9 crore in Hyderabad
text: The Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested two men for allegedly duping 2,000 people of â¹9 crore on the pretext of holiday packages, club memberships, and plots of land. The two were the managing directors of a company. The police also seized the company's register books, plot allotment documents, rubber stamps, silver coin gift packs, and cash worth â¹8.15 lakh.

headlines: Woman accidentally crosses into US from Canada while jogging
text: A French woman visiting her mother in Canada accidentally crossed across the US border while jogging along the beach. The 19-year-old ran across the border in Canada's British Columbia into the US state of Washington. She was held at a detention centre in the US for two weeks before immigration officials in Canada and the US could verify her documents.

headlines: IndiGo hikes excess baggage fee by 33% on domestic flights
text: IndiGo, SpiceJet and GoAir have hiked excess baggage charges by 33% to â¹400 for each kilogram beyond the allowed 15 kg for domestic passengers who haven't pre-booked excess baggage. IndiGo's charges for pre-booking excess baggage of 5kg and 10kg on its domestic routes will now be â¹1,900 and â¹3,800 respectively. Earlier, Air India increased its excess baggage charges by 25%.

headlines: Bourbon warehouse collapses, spilling 9,000 barrels whiskey
text: About 9,000 stacked bourbon whiskey barrels plummeted to the ground on Friday when a large section of a decades-old storage warehouse collapsed at a distillery in Kentucky. The damaged warehouse at the Barton 1792 Distillery held about 18,000 barrels. No cause had been determined for the collapse, but no one was injured, a spokesperson for US-based spirits company Sazerac said.

headlines: Nidhhi and I are friends, dating rumours are false: KL Rahul
text: Cricketer KL Rahul, while denying rumours that he is dating actress Nidhhi Agerwal, said, "We are just good friends and all the rumours are false." He added that they have known each other since their college days. Rumours of the two dating each other began after they were spotted going out for dinner together.

headlines: Mouni Roy to star in Rajkummar Rao's 'Made In China': Report
text: Mouni Roy will reportedly star opposite Rajkummar Rao in 'Made In China'. While Rao is said to play a struggling Gujarati businessman in the film, Mouni's role is yet to be confirmed. The film will be directed by Mikhil Musale, whose directorial debut 'Wrong Side Raju' won National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Gujarati.

headlines: Acting is like a game of badminton: Pankaj Tripathi
text: Pankaj Tripathi has said that acting is like a game of badminton while adding, "When there are actors on either side of the court and both players are good at the game, it automatically becomes interesting." Talking about working with actress Richa Chadha, Pankaj further said, "She makes it a good interesting match, not a boring one."

headlines: Dhoni in team as we didn't perform to our potential: Parthiv
text: Indian wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel, in a recent episode of Breakfast With Champions, said MS Dhoni cemented his place in Team India because other wicketkeepers including him didn't perform to their potential. Parthiv had made his international debut in 2002 as a 17-year-old, two years before Dhoni. He further suggested he "wasn't born in the wrong era" and Dhoni outperformed him.

headlines: If men can remarry, why cannot women: Vice President Naidu
text: Speaking at a programme to celebrate International Widows' Day in Delhi, Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday asked, "If a man can remarry, why cannot a woman?" Calling for a change in the mindset of people, Naidu said that widowhood is sad for both men and women but the latter suffer more.

headlines: CM Chouhan's govt restored MP's lost glory: PM Modi
text: Addressing people after inaugurating a â¹3,866-crore irrigation project in Rajgarh, PM Narendra Modi said, "Shivraj Singh Chouhan's government has worked to restore the lost glory of Madhya Pradesh." "â¹70,000 crore will be spent on micro-irrigation scheme by the government and I assure you that the Madhya Pradesh government will get all help from the Centre," PM Modi added.

headlines: Biker nabbed for having 'Chal Bhen***d' number plate
text: A biker in Mumbai was apprehended by traffic police for sporting a registration plate on his motorcycle that had 'Chal Bhen***d' written on it instead of the registration number. The biker reportedly also failed to produce the registration papers, following which his bike was seized by the policemen. The defaulter was riding the bike without wearing a helmet.

headlines: Son of Punjab AAP leader dies of suspected drug overdose
text: The son of Moti Lal Pasi, a local AAP leader in Punjab, was among the two people found dead purportedly after a drug overdose. Police revealed that they found syringes next to the bodies, adding they cannot confirm the cause of death until an autopsy. The bodies were recovered after the neighbours informed the police about a foul smell.

headlines: CBI will probe murders of two journalists in Tripura: CM Deb
text: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb has announced that the CBI will probe the murders of two journalists who were killed in the state last year. A local television journalist was hacked to death while he was reporting about an agitation organised by a regional party in September. A crime reporter was killed at a battalion headquarters of Tripura State Rifles.

headlines: Hyd files 643 cases against vehicles ferrying school kids
text: Hyderabad Police registered 643 cases in two days during its special drive against vehicles carrying school kids. The drive, which aims to prevent accidents by such vehicles, is conducted every year. While 130 cases against such auto drivers were registered on Thursday, 513 cases were registered on Friday, out of which 456 were against autos and 55 against school vans.

headlines: J&K police to crack down on gathering at militants' funerals
text: Jammu and Kashmir Police chief SP Vaid said they have devised a strategy to deal with gatherings at militants' funerals. Officers have been instructed to act against people making provocative speeches at the funerals to glorify the sacrifice of dead militants, reports said. It's a crucial issue which needs to be dealt with to bring Kashmir to normalcy, officials said.

headlines: Syrian government uses banned barrel bombs
text: Syria has resumed the use of barrel bombs in an offensive in the southwest after a year, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said. The UN had banned barrel bombs as it poses a threat to civilians due to its lack of precision. Over 12 barrel bombs targeted rebel-held towns in the area bordering Jordan and the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.

headlines: Vatican diplomat admits to possessing child pornography
text: A Catholic priest who worked as a diplomat at the Vatican's US embassy has admitted to the possession and distribution of child pornography while serving in the country. Monsignor Carlo Alberto Capella said his crimes were the result of a "personal crisis" arising from his transfer to the US. He's been held in custody at a jail in the Vatican.

headlines: Surat court issues arrest warrant against Nirav Modi
text: A Surat court has issued an arrest warrant against 'fugitive' Nirav Modi after he failed to appear during court hearings in an alleged customs duty evasion case. The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence booked Nirav for diverting diamonds and pearls worth â¹890 crore by his Special Economic Zone units in Surat. The agency alleged evasion of customs duty of â¹52 crore.

headlines: Adani Wilmar not eligible to bid for Ruchi Soya: Patanjali
text: Baba Ramdev-led Patanjali Ayurved has raised concerns about Adani Wilmar's eligibility to bid for acquiring bankrupt Ruchi Soya. It has alleged that Pranav Adani, MD of Adani Wilmar, is married into â¹3,700-crore loan fraud-accused Vikram Kothari's family. Notably, bidders for an insolvent firm can't be allowed to offer a resolution plan if bidding firm is "connected" to a stressed-loan corporate.

headlines: World's smallest computer smaller than a grain of rice made
text: University of Michigan has regained the title of making the world's smallest 'computer' from IBM by making a device measuring 0.3mm x 0.3mm, one-tenth of IBM's version. Smaller than a grain of rice, the device loses all prior data when unplugged, unlike desktop computers. The device is a precision temperature sensor, which can report temperatures with an error of 0.1ÂºC.

headlines: Aadhaar data can't be used for criminal investigation: UIDAI
text: Aadhaar's governing body UIDAI on Friday said that use of biometric data for criminal investigation is not allowed under the Aadhaar Act. This comes after the National Crime Records Bureau said police should be provided with limited access to Aadhaar data, as it would aide in catching first-time offenders, besides identification of unidentified bodies.

headlines: Chhattisgarh cop wants to beat wife, asks SP for permission
text: A police constable in Chattisgarh wrote to the Superintendent of Police (SP) seeking permission to beat his wife. He claimed that it is necessary to beat her to stop her from participating in a protest by police officers' family members. He further wrote he is scared of harassing her as she is from the upper caste and has political affiliations.

headlines: Despite not being on social media, I am all over it: Kareena
text: Kareena Kapoor, while talking about not being on social media, said, "Despite not being active or even present on social media, I am still all over it." "I don't need to put out anything more about my life. On the other hand, some people are active on social media, yet no one is interested in them," she added.

headlines: Nick shares rumoured girlfriend Priyanka's clip from India visit
text: American singer Nick Jonas, in an Instagram story, shared a video of his rumoured girlfriend Priyanka Chopra during his visit to India. The video has been captioned 'Her' followed by a heart-eye emoji and shows Priyanka walking towards the camera. Nick, who arrived in India with Priyanka on Thursday, also met her mother Madhu Chopra.

headlines: Tamil director booked for calling Lord Ganesha 'imported God'
text: Tamil filmmaker P Bharathiraja has been booked by the Chennai Police for hurting religious sentiments, after he allegedly called Lord Ganesha an "imported God" while addressing a public gathering in January. Hindu Makkal Munnani, a religious and cultural organisation, had filed a complaint against the filmmaker. The Madras High Court had earlier granted him anticipatory bail in a similar case.

headlines: Dutt took girlfriends to his mom's 'fake' grave, reveals Hirani
text: Filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani has revealed Sanjay Dutt used to take his girlfriends to a graveyard, saying he brought them there 'to meet his mother' Nargis Dutt, who passed away in 1981. "After this...the girl would feel emotionally attached to Sanju. The reality was that the grave was not his mother's," added Hirani. Earlier, it was revealed Dutt had 308 girlfriends.

headlines: India thrash Pakistan 36-20 at Kabaddi Masters Dubai
text: India defeated Pakistan 36-20 in their first match of the inaugural six-nation Kabaddi Masters at the Al-Wasl Sports Complex in Dubai on Friday. Pakistan was all-out twice during the match, with Indian captain Ajay Thakur scoring the most raid points. India is scheduled to play Kenya next on Saturday.

headlines: Facebook accidentally leaks sensitive data to third parties
