Shivpal's brother Surendra said that cash worth â¹60,000 and jewellery worth â¹1.5-2 lakh was stolen. The incident happened at the judge's native village Jalaun in Uttar Pradesh.

headlines: Govt bans new al Qaeda, ISIS branches under anti-terror law
text: The Union Home Ministry has banned the new branches of militant organisations al Qaeda and ISIS under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. The al Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) and the Islamic State of Iraq and the Sham-Khorasan (ISKP) had been radicalising Indian youths and encouraging terror attacks on Indian interests, an official release of the ministry said.

headlines: Mizoram does not participate in International Yoga Day event
text: The Mizoram government did not participate in the International Yoga Day event on Thursday. "I do not know about any such event. I am currently in my constituency, carrying out rescue and relief works in the wake of the floods," state Sports and Youth Services Minister Zodintluanga said. The Yoga Day event has been dubbed 'anti-Christian' by Mizoram religious groups.

headlines: Don't say I never give anything: Trump gives candy to Merkel
text: US President Donald Trump reportedly threw candies towards German Chancellor Angela Merkel, saying "Here, Angela. Don't say I never give you anything." The incident happened during a discussion between world leaders at the G7 summit. Merkel and other leaders urged Trump to sign the G7 joint communique and criticised him for imposing import tariffs.

headlines: TIME cover slams Trump's family separation policy
text: The TIME magazine in its latest edition slammed US President Donald Trump over his administration's recently-reversed policy of separating families of illegal migrants. The cover combined the photo of the US President with the viral image of a migrant girl crying. The US government's policy was criticised globally after over 2,000 migrant children were separated from their families.

headlines: UPI transactions hit record 10 million on a single day
text: Transactions through the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) reached a new high with over 10 million transactions being conducted through the platform on Wednesday. This compares to around 189.5 million transactions conducted through the platform in May. The UPI platform, which facilitates e-payments directly through banks, is developed by the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI).

headlines: Taj wins bid for 33-yr lease of premium Lutyens' Delhi hotel
text: The Indian Hotel Company, which runs the Taj hotel chain, has won the bid for a 33-year lease of The Connaught Hotel in Lutyens' Delhi. The 85-room hotel was closed in 2013 after the previous operator ran it for 18 years without a licence. Taj will pay 31.8% of the gross turnover or â¹5.8 crore per annum, whichever is higher.

headlines: Trader makes â¹79 cr profit thinking he was on demo account
text: A French trader who made $11.6 million (â¹79 crore) using a brokerage's platform he initially thought was a demo system is suing the company after it seized his earnings. The trader placed $1.16 billion worth orders and suffered $1.16 million loss before realising the trades were live. He continued trading and eventually made the profit on a $5 billion position.

headlines: I admire Alia for taking up challenging roles: Rishi Kapoor
text: Praising his son Ranbir Kapoor's girlfriend Alia Bhatt, Rishi Kapoor said, "I admire [her for taking] up challenging roles like in 'Highway' and 'Raazi'. "It's...difficult at this tender age to carry a film on your shoulders and only an actor can do that," he added. Rishi further said, "Alia has been lucky and of course, she has the talent too."

headlines: 19-year-old MbappÃ© scores as France advance in World Cup
text: Forward Kylian MbappÃ©, aged 19 years and 183 days, became the youngest goalscorer for France in a major tournament as the European team defeated Peru 1-0 at 2018 FIFA World Cup on Thursday. With the win, France advanced to the second round of the World Cup and eliminated the South American side. France will next face Denmark on June 26.

headlines: England register their 2nd highest ODI chase, take 4-0 lead
text: England chased down Australia's 310 in the fourth ODI in Chester-le-Street on Thursday to register their second highest successful run chase in ODI cricket. With the victory, England also took a 4-0 lead in the five-match ODI series. Notably, England have now won eight of the nine ODIs they have played against Australia in  2018.

headlines: Kohli, Anushka have had a powerful influence on me: KL Rahul
text: Indian cricketer KL Rahul said Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma are an "amazing couple" and they have "really had a powerful influence" on him. The 26-year-old batsman revealed that the couple took "immense care" of him when he felt "miserable and depressed" after a "terrible performance". "They even made sure I spent the new year night with them," he added.

headlines: India to play 200 int'l cricket matches from 2018 to 2023
text: Indian men's cricket team will play over 200 international matches from 2018 to 2023, the most by an international side over the next five-year cycle. India will play as many as 102 international matches at home in the next cycle. Further, India will make their debut in the ICC World Test Championship in July 2019 against Windies.

headlines: Google engineers refused to make tool for military contracts
text: A group of nine Google engineers refused to work on a security feature called "air gap" to help win military contracts, earlier this year. The engineers reportedly weren't convinced that Google should use its technology to help the US government wage war. Also, in June, around 4,000 employees urged Google to abandon an AI drone program for the US military.

headlines: Startup unveils world's 1st burger restaurant run by robots
text: US-based startup Creator has unveiled a robot-run restaurant which makes burgers, priced at $6 each. The machine which makes the burgers contains 350 sensors and 50 actuator mechanisms to prepare the bun, add toppings and cook the patties in under 5 minutes without any human intervention. Formerly known as Momentum Machines, Creator was founded by Alex Vardakostas in 2009.

headlines: 20-year-old woman gangraped by 4 men for 12 days in Odisha
text: A 20-year-old Odisha woman was allegedly held captive and raped by four men for 12 days before she managed to escape on Tuesday. She was in a relationship with a man who called her to a temple for their wedding. However, she was raped by him and three others after he took her to a house instead.

headlines: Centre, H'yana, Raj get notices over Aravalli deforestation
text: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Wednesday issued notices to the Centre, the Haryana government, and the Rajasthan government over the deforestation in the Aravalli hills. The notices have been issued after media reports claimed that "massive deforestation" in the mountain range had led to "increasing dust storms and air pollution in the Delhi-NCR region".

headlines: Navy personnel perform Yoga on ship decks and in submarines
text: Indian Naval Chief Admiral Sunil Lanba among other Navy personnel on Thursday performed Yoga to commemorate International Yoga Day. While some Navy personnel performed exercises on the deck of the decommissioned vessel "INS Viraat" in Mumbai, some conducted Yoga activities inside submarines. A total of 15,000 Navy personnel participated in the event along with their families.

headlines: Odisha school gets notice for not extending summer holidays
text: The Odisha government has issued a show cause notice to a school for allegedly flouting its order to extend summer vacations due to the heat wave. The notice said, "young children have been compelled to travel in severe hot and humid condition and attend the classes." It asked the principal not to open the school before June 26. n

headlines: 3 elephants rescued from 17-foot-deep well in 6 hrs in TN
text: Three elephants were rescued from a 17-foot-deep well within six hours in Tamil Nadu on Wednesday. The rescue operations were carried out after residents heard the trumpeting of the elephants and informed the forest personnel. The rescue team dug up the land around the well and built a slope, enabling the elephants to climb out.

headlines: BJP, PDP took cue from Bollywood films for divorce: Omar
text: Days after BJP ended its alliance with PDP in the Jammu and Kashmir government, former Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said, "The PDP and BJP have been watching Bollywood movies for political strategy. This is how they have crafted their divorce." Abdullah added, "Brilliant fixed match, scripted to perfection except the audience aren't fools and neither are the rest of us."

headlines: Chanda Kochhar's Mumbai house under I-T Dept's scanner
text: The Income Tax department has reportedly launched a probe into the acquisition of ICICI Bank CEO Chanda Kochhar's family residence in Mumbai. Her husband Deepak Kochhar had purchased the flat in a "complex transaction" involving firms linked to Videocon Group, reports said. Chanda Kochhar is currently on leave until an internal probe into allegations of impropriety against her is completed.

headlines: Telangana man does 'aarti' to photo of Trump everyday
text: A 31-year-old farmer in Telangana's Jangaon district has installed a photograph of Trump in his puja room and performs "aarti" to the photograph everyday. Bussa Krishna said this was his way of making the US President and people understand the greatness of Indians. He started worshipping Trump after an Indian software engineer was killed in a hate crime.

headlines: TN students form barrier, refuse to accept teacher's transfer
text: Students at the Government High School in Tamil Nadu's Veliagaram created a barrier and refused to let their 28-year-old English teacher leave after they found out about his transfer. "They were hugging and crying and clutching my foot refusing to let me go," G Bhagawan said. "More than a teacher, I'm a friend, a brother to them", he added.

headlines: Man arrested in connection to rapper XXXTentacion's death
text: A man named Dedrick D Williams was arrested on Wednesday in connection to the death of 20-year-old rapper Jahseh Onfroy, also known as XXXTentacion. He has been booked for first-degree murder in the shooting of the rapper. XXXTentacion was shot dead on Monday while he was at a motorcycle dealership.

headlines: What superstitions are players following in FIFA World Cup?
text: At the FIFA World Cup, Germany's Mario Gomez uses only the far-left urinal before a match, as a superstition. His teammate Julian Draxler holds his bag in the locker and sprays perfume on it as it gives him a "feeling of happiness". England's Dele Alli is using the same shin guards he has worn since he was 11.

headlines: AAP MLA injured in attack by sand mafia in Punjab
text: AAP MLA Amarjit Singh Sandoa was injured after he was allegedly attacked by sand mafia "goons" in Punjab's Ropar when he and his security personnel were visiting an illegal sand mining site on Thursday. In the attack, which was video recorded by mediapersons accompanying the MLA, Sandoa was hit by a stone on his chest.

headlines: Who is Atul Gawande, CEO of Jeff Bezos & Buffett's new firm?
text: Indian-American surgeon Atul Gawande was on Wednesday appointed the CEO of Amazon's Jeff Bezos, Berkshire Hathaway's Warren Buffett and JPMorgan Chase's new healthcare firm. The 52-year-old practices endocrine surgery at Brigham and Women's Hospital and teaches at the Harvard TH Chan School of Public Health and Harvard Medical School. He is also the founding executive director of Ariadne Labs.

headlines: Shimla civic body proposes water fee hike after water crisis
text: Weeks after the city faced a severe water crisis, the Shimla Municipal Corporation on Wednesday proposed an annual hike of 10% in water charges in accordance with a government notification of 2015. However, criticising the move, BJP councillors said, "It's strange that after town faced water crisis, [Municipal Corporation] has proposed hike in water charges."

headlines: Minister wants Fortuner not Innova, says 'used to big cars'
text: Karnataka Food and Civil Supplies Minister BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan has sought a Toyota Fortuner for official use instead of the Innova he has been allotted, since the latter is "low level". Khan, who comes from a business family owning over 100 luxury buses, said he has been "travelling in big cars since my childhood" and finds the Innova uncomfortable.

headlines: Hospital hands over stranger's body to kin of living patient
text: A government hospital in Maharashtra handed over a dead body to the family of a 50-year-old patient, claiming their relative had passed away. After bringing the body home for the last rites, the family realised the deceased wasn't their relative, who was revealed to be alive and still receiving treatment. The hospital has ordered a probe into the matter.

headlines: Chinese investment in US down 92% amid trade war
text: Chinese investments in the US in the first five months of 2018 totalled $1.8 billion, representing a 92% drop from investments in the same period last year. A study on Chinese investments found that it was the lowest in seven years. This comes amid the trade war between the countries after US President Donald Trump imposed tariffs on Chinese imports.

headlines: 9-yr-old Syrian girl to be honoured for 'defending freedom'
text: Syrian child activist Bana Alabed who live-tweeted her experiences in war-torn Syria will be honoured for "defending freedom". US-based think tank Atlantic Council said that the nine-year-old used "social media to bring attention to the plight of children in Syria". Alabed also featured on the TIME magazine's list of 25 Most Influential People on the Internet in 2017.

headlines: No action taken by Pakistan to get Taliban to negotiate: US
text: Pakistan has not taken any "sustained" or "decisive" action to get Taliban to the negotiating table with the Afghan government, US Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary for South and Central Asia, Alice Wells has said. Pakistan had offered to mediate in the peace process after Afghanistan's President Ashraf Ghani offered to recognise the Taliban as a political group earlier this year.

headlines: Say hello to your mommy: Trump mocks protestor
text: US President Donald Trump mocked a protestor at his rally in Minnesota, saying, "So we have a single protestor, he is going home to his mom," and added, "Say hello to mommy." Trump further claimed that 'the fake news' will claim the next day that there were massive protests at the rally.

headlines: Vatican uses term 'LGBT' in official document for 1st time
text: The Vatican has used the abbreviation 'LGBT', which is used to denote the terms lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender, in its official document reportedly for the first time. The term was used in a planning document for an upcoming bishops meeting. The Vatican has in the past formally referred to gay people as 'persons with homosexual tendencies'.

headlines: Ex-Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka was aware of data theft: US firm
text: US firm Teradata has alleged that ex-Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka was aware of stealing trade secrets when he was German technology firm SAP's CTO. Teradata claimed that SAP entered into a joint venture in 2008 to gain access to its intellectual property and later developed a product, HANA. Sikka is considered the architect of HANA, an analytics platform of SAP.

headlines: Fan designs German flag with women's underwear for World Cup
text: A German football fan created a flag using women's undergarments in black, red and yellow, to show his support to the German World Cup team. Michael Poppe installed the flag on his bicycle and was initially concerned that people would find it "indecent". "I've caused a sensation with it â everything is perfect," Poppe said.

headlines: What was France's sex tape scandal for which Benzema was axed?
text: France forward Karim Benzema was axed from the national team in 2015 over an alleged attempt to blackmail national teammate Mathieu Valbuena over a sex tape. Benzema had discussed the tape with Valbuena when both were on national duty in October 2015. Benzema had reportedly told Valbuena to pay ransom to get back a tape of him with his girlfriend.

headlines: 'Goal of the Century' came 4 mins after 'Hand of God' goal
text: Argentine legend Diego Maradona scored 'Goal of the Century' four minutes after netting the 'Hand of God' goal against England in 1986 FIFA World Cup quarter-final. Maradona ran 60 yards in 10 seconds from his own half and dribbled through multiple defenders before applying the finish in the 55th minute. It was voted as 'Goal of the Century' in 2002.

headlines: FB to redirect users searching for opioid to crisis helpline
text: Social media major Facebook will redirect users searching for opioids or addiction treatment to a federal crisis helpline, the company has announced. Users will be shown a message at the top of the search results page asking if they want help finding free and confidential treatment referrals. A similar feature will arrive on Instagram in the next few weeks.

headlines: Uber drivers earned over $600 million in tips in one year
text: Uber drivers have earned over $600 million in tips in one year in the US and Canada. The company's product manager Dhruv Tyagi said the tipping increased by 30% since the company launched the in-app tipping feature for drivers. In the first six months, drivers earned $200 million and in the last six months, they earned $400 million in tips.

headlines: Actions of a few bad apples won't stop Tesla: Elon Musk
text: Talking about Tesla's former employee who hacked the company's system, CEO Elon Musk said, "The actions of a few bad apples will not stop Tesla from reaching its goals." He also said, "With 40,000 people, the worst 1 in 1000 will have issues." Tesla on Wednesday sued the former employee for stealing confidential data and making false statements to media.

headlines: BJP spreads communal poison against minorities: Owaisi
text: After a Hindu-Muslim couple was allegedly harassed at the Lucknow passport office, All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen President Asaduddin Owaisi said, "Since BJP came to power they have spread hatred and communal poison against minorities, Muslims in particular, and Dalits." He added, "Things have come to such a stage that government officer has the audacity to question an adult's marriage."

headlines: Kerala woman, lover get over 20 yrs jail for killing husband
text: An Australian court has sentenced a Kerala woman and her lover to over 20 years in prison for murdering her husband. They poisoned the victim with cyanide-laced juice, following which the woman claimed he died from a cardiac arrest and performed his last rites. His friends became suspicious and notified authorities as she started living with her lover soon after.

headlines: Cong leader booked for celebrating Rahul's b'day in school
text: Congress leader Ramesh Rajora has been booked by police for celebrating Congress President Rahul Gandhi's 48th birthday allegedly in government school premises in Madhya Pradesh without prior permission. The complainant has claimed celebrations were held inside the school. However, Rajora said he had only distributed biscuits outside the school and the case was filed under pressure of BJP leaders.

headlines: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar skips International Yoga Day event
text: After Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar skipped the International Yoga Day celebrations in Patna today, Deputy Chief Minister Sushil Modi said, "It is not necessary that everyone comes out to participate." Modi also said he knew many JD(U) leaders who attended the event, and added, "It is not a question about JD(U)."

headlines: We don't need UN's advice on how to govern ourselves: US
text: US National Security Advisor John Bolton has said that his country doesn't need any "advice by the UN or other international bodies" on how to govern itself. Defending itself against the decision to withdraw from the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC), Bolton added that the US had opposed the creation of the global body in the first place.

headlines: Mukesh Ambani's daughter Isha gets an MBA from Stanford
text: India's richest person Mukesh Ambani's daughter Isha Ambani has completed her MBA from the US' Stanford University and received her degree at its 127th Commencement ceremony. Isha, who is engaged to Anand Piramal, has a bachelor's degree in Psychology and South Asian Studies from Yale University. The 26-year-old is on the boards of Reliance Jio and Reliance Retail.

headlines: Intel CEO resigns for having relationship with an employee
text: Chipmaking major Intel's 58-year-old CEO Brian Krzanich on Thursday resigned after the company was recently informed that he had a past consensual relationship with an Intel employee. An internal investigation confirmed the violation of Intelâs non-fraternization policy, which applies to all managers. The board has named Chief Financial Officer Robert Swan as interim CEO, effective immediately.

headlines: I'm wearing coats of makeup more than medical coats: Manushi
text: Miss World 2017 Manushi Chhillar, while speaking about her life after winning the beauty pageant, said, "Life has changed all over. More than medical coats, I'm wearing coats of makeup on me." "But I'm getting to travel so much, learn so much, getting to experience so many things," she added. Manushi, who is 21 years old, is a medical student.

headlines: FreeCharge losses near sum paid by Axis Bank for acquisition
text: Axis Bank-owned payments and e-commerce startup FreeCharge's losses mounted to â¹356 crore in FY17, according to Registrar of Companies (RoC) filings. This is almost equal to about â¹385 crore Axis Bank had paid in July 2017 to acquire the startup. Founded in 2010, the startup was acquired by Snapdeal before it was bought by Axis Bank.

headlines: Koko, the gorilla who knew sign language, dies at 46
text: Koko, a 46-year-old gorilla who mastered sign language has died in its sleep at a California preserve on Tuesday, the Gorilla Foundation announced. Koko appeared in several documentaries while a 1978 National Geographic cover featured a selfie the animal took in front of a mirror. "Koko's capacity for language and empathy opened minds and hearts of millions," the foundation said.

headlines: Woman shoots at auto driver for not giving way, arrested
text: A woman in her thirties was arrested for shooting at an auto-rickshaw driver after a fight over not giving way in Gurugram on Wednesday. The two got into an argument after the driver parked his auto in a lane and the woman wanted to pass. The fight reportedly ended but she returned with a country-made pistol and shot at him.

headlines: Minor jailed for refusing to give free vegetables to Bihar cops
text: A 14-year-old boy was beaten up and jailed after he refused to give vegetables for free to police in Bihar's Patna, the boy's father claimed in a letter to CM Nitish Kumar. The boy was forced to sign a blank sheet, he added. Police claimed the boy was 18 years old and was arrested as part of a bike-lifter gang.

headlines: Israel PM's wife charged with fraud over misuse of funds
text: Sara Netanyahu, the wife of Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu, was charged with aggravated fraud and breach of trust on Thursday over alleged misuse of state funds. Sara had allegedly misused state funds worth $100,000 for personal dining and catering services at the Prime Minister's residence in Jerusalem. PM Netanyahu has denied the allegations against his wife.

headlines: Unaware of North Korea taking any steps to denuclearise: US
text: US Defence Secretary James Mattis has said he's not aware of any steps taken by North Korea to dismantle its nuclear weapons following the summit between the two countries. The US and North Korea had signed an agreement to completely denuclearise the Korean Peninsula. After the summit, US President Donald Trump declared North Korea was no longer a nuclear threat.

headlines: Panama Papers firm did not know who 75% of its clients were
text: Mossack Fonseca, the offshore law firm at the centre of the Panama Papers leak, had no records of the real owners of 75% of its clients, according to an internal investigation. One client also complained that his customers would have to pay taxes because of the leak. A fresh Panama Papers leak also revealed 12,000 documents linked to Indians.

headlines: Mallika to star in Indian remake of TV series The Good Wife
text: Actress Mallika Sherawat will star in the Indian adaptation of American television series 'The Good Wife'. Mallika, who will also produce the show, will be seen playing the lead role in the Indian version. "The show's brilliant storyline and pioneering female role made me want to do it in India," the actress said in a statement.

headlines: Not showing abla nari: Sonam on 'Veere...' masturbation scene
text: Speaking about Swara Bhasker's masturbation scene in 'Veere Di Wedding' being trolled, Sonam Kapoor said, "We're not showcasing what [trolls] think is the abla naari...the one who needs to be rescued." "Anything that's uninhibited is a show of strength. And certain people don't like that show of strength because you're standing up to the bully in a way," she added.

headlines: If I've kids, they'll have Sonam Ahuja in their name: Sonam
text: Actress Sonam Kapoor has said if and when she has children with her husband Anand Ahuja, they'll have 'Sonam Ahuja' in their name. "I want... my child to have my name as well," she added. While Sonam changed her name to Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, Anand changed his to Anand Sonam Ahuja after they got married.

headlines: VAR penalty helps Australia hold Denmark to 1-1 draw in WC
text: Australia held Denmark to a 1-1 draw in a Group C fixture at the 2018 FIFA World Cup on Thursday, claiming their first point in the tournament. Midfielder Mile Jedinak equalised for Australia after converting a penalty awarded by the video assistant referee (VAR). Interestingly, all three of Jedinak's goals in World Cup history have come through penalties.

headlines: Swiss fans confuse World Cup venue, book hotel 1,281 km away
text: A group of Switzerland fans visiting Russia for the 2018 FIFA World Cup mistakenly booked a hotel in the wrong city, which was 1,281 km away from the venue where Switzerland played Brazil. The fans confused the venue city of Rostov-on-Don with Rostov Veliky. They reportedly called the police when they could not find their hotel in Rostov-on-Don.

headlines: Ronaldo is like port wine: Coach after forward's 4th WC goal
text: After Cristiano Ronaldo scored his fourth goal at the ongoing FIFA World Cup, Portugal coach Fernando Santos said that the five-time Ballon d'Or winner is like "port wine" and gets better with age. "His physical prowess, his technique, he's constantly evolving, he doesnât want to do today what he did three or four years ago," Santos added.

headlines: Watch World Cup history's first disallowed goal through VAR
text: Iranian midfielder Saeid Ezatolahi's 62nd-minute goal against Spain was disallowed by video assistant referee (VAR) after being deemed offside, becoming the first goal to be denied by VAR in World Cup history. The linesman spotted Ezatolahi straying in an offside position but the Iranians kept on celebrating the equaliser. VAR confirmed the player was offside and the goal was disallowed.

headlines: Rashid shares video of place where he began playing cricket
text: Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan took to Twitter to share a video of the place where he started playing cricket. "This is how from where I start my ckt playing with brothers at home...big bro (Amir Khan) has some skills to turn the ball #familylegspinners," he captioned. In the video, Rashid Khan's brother can be seen bowling leg-spin.

headlines: Has the trainer become selector: Ex-selector slams Yo-Yo test
text: Former Team India chief selector Sandeep Patil has slammed BCCI's new fitness criteria, saying, "I find it very absurd that a player is dropped for failing the Yo-Yo test after being picked in the squad." "What I also find absurd and wrong is that the trainer will decide on these matters. Has the trainer become a selector?" the 61-year-old added.

headlines: Twitter suspends users for sharing Trump advisor's number
text: Twitter has suspended the accounts of users who tweeted a link to a story containing the phone number of US President Donald Trump's advisor Stephen Miller. The story allegedly credited Miller for drafting the policy which separated children from parents at the US-Mexico border. In a statement, Twitter said its rules don't allow publishing other people's personal information without consent.

headlines: Firm develops AI to detect heart attacks with 93% accuracy
text: Danish software company Corti has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that can detect heart attacks during emergency calls with 93% accuracy rate. The AI analyses the caller's words, voice tone, and background noise while describing an incident. According to a study, the system gave results in an average of 48 seconds, over 30 seconds faster than humans.

headlines: Woman falls 500 ft while taking selfie at hill station, dies
text: A 33-year-old Delhi woman died after falling into a 500-foot-deep valley while taking a selfie at Matheran, a popular hill station near Mumbai, said the police today. Sarita Rammahesh Chouhan was visiting the hill station with her husband and three children when she fell into the valley. Following this, a rescue operation was launched and her body was recovered.

headlines: Officials 'soft' on power theft by Muslims: UP BJP MLA
text: Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Sanjay Kumar has accused power department officials of taking "selective action" and being "soft" on power theft by Muslims. In a viral video on social media, Kumar was seen telling a power official on phone to "provide me the data pertaining to the raids conducted...in Muslim houses from April 1 till date".

headlines: J&K BJP chief claims to get death threats from Pakistan
text: Jammu and Kashmir BJP president Ravinder Raina on Thursday claimed he had been getting death threats from Pakistan for the last two days. He said, "I will not be cowed down by such calls... I am a soldier of Bharat Mata and the BJP." He added, "They are desperate and frustrated... We will never spare Pakistani 'wallas'."

headlines: 60-year-old dies after being trapped in cupboard for days
text: A 60-year-old British woman has died after being trapped naked for several days inside a cupboard while on a holiday last year, a judicial probe has found. A water pipe broke and cold water flowing into the confined space contributed to her death, the coroner reported. She also tried to smash through part of the wall, reports said.

headlines: Actor slammed for 'cage Trump's son with paedophiles' remark
text: Hollywood actor Peter Fonda has been slammed after he called for US President Donald Trump's son Barron to be separated from his parents and caged with paedophiles. Fonda's tweet came in criticism of the US government's policy of separating the families of immigrants crossing into the country illegally. First Lady Melania Trump alerted the US Secret Service following Fonda's tweet.

headlines: Germany foils biological attack after Tunisian man's arrest
text: The German police on Wednesday said it foiled a biological attack following the arrest of a Tunisian suspect last week. The 29-year-old suspect was found in possession of the lethal poison ricin and bomb-making material. The police added the suspect may have links to ISIS and followed instructions shared by the militant group on how to make the bomb.

headlines: Don't want to profit from separating families: Airline to US
text: American Airlines asked the US government not to use its planes to transport the migrant children separated from their families. "We have no desire to be associated with separating families, or worse, profit from it," the airline said in a statement. US President Donald Trump on Wednesday ended the policy of separating the children from their families following widespread criticism.

headlines: Aegon Life iTerm Insurance Plan covers you for 100 years
text: A term insurance plan is one of the safest and cost-effective ways of getting insured. It ensures that your loved ones are safeguarded against any unforeseen circumstances. Aegon life's iTerm plan covers you for 100 years and guarantees 25% payout of the death benefit on diagnosis of any terminal illness. Also, you get a waiver from future premium payments.

headlines: 15 of same family on way to funeral die as tractor hits car
text: Fifteen members of the same family were killed on their way to a funeral after their SUV was hit by a tractor allegedly carrying illegally mined sand in Madhya Pradesh's Morena. While 12 died on the spot, 3 passed away while receiving treatment. The victims, all from Gwalior district, were going to a nearby village for a funeral.

headlines: Who are the Indians named in new Panama Papers leak?
text: The new Panama Papers leak includes names of Hike CEO Kavin Bharti Mittal, actor Amitabh Bachchan, PVR Cinemas owner Ajay Bijli and Asian Paints promoter Ashwin Dani's son Jalaj Ashwin Dani. The leak shows that Mittal, Bachchan and Dani were clients of controversial law firm Mossack Fonseca. The Panama-based firm provided tax-related services for offshore companies related to those named.

headlines: UP officer who asked Hindu-Muslim couple to convert transferred
text: A passport officer in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow was transferred and a probe was ordered after a Hindu-Muslim couple claimed that he humiliated them and asked the man to convert to Hinduism. However, the officer claimed that he only asked the woman to get her name endorsed as a different name was mentioned on her Nikahnama (Muslim marriage contract).

headlines: Maybe he'll come running and hug me: Son of murdered J&K editor
text: In an obituary for 'Rising Kashmir' editor Shujaat Bukhari, his son Tamheed, who is in Class 10, wrote, "May be, he will come running towards me and hug me?" "Papa would never tell us about the help he extended to scores of families...He believed that one day Kashmir would become free from innocent killings," he added.

headlines: JCB operator takes wife home in JCB machine after wedding
text: A man who has been operating a JCB machine for a decade, Karnataka's Chethan Kallakatta took his newlywed bride home in a JCB machine decorated with balloons. "She was scared and refused to sit on it," said Kallakatta. His wife agreed to sit on the machine when Kallakatta assured he has been working with the machine every day for years.

headlines: Even water tastes like sherbet: Ranbir on being in love with Alia
text: Talking about being in love with Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor said, "When you fall in love, everything's great. [Even] water tastes like sherbet." He added, "Falling in love is the greatest thing in the world...Who doesn't want to be in love?" Ranbir earlier said the best thing about being newly in love is it comes with a "lot of excitement".

headlines: Sexual harassment at workplace not managed well: Huma
text: Speaking about sexual harassment at workplaces, Huma Qureshi said, "To be honest, sexual harassment at workplace isn't being managed well." "We often have a tendency to...talk against a woman when she speaks out on sexual harassment as if she's the offender, not the man," she added. Huma further said, "We need to change the environment where more women feel safer."

headlines: What are the dressing room rituals of FIFA World Cup teams?
text: At the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia, Argentina set up an altar in the dressing room, ahead of their first game against Iceland. Peru players also set up a shrine with images of Jesus Christ inside their dressing room, before their game against Denmark. England players  Jordan Henderson, Harry Kane and Raheem Sterling placed their shirts alongside each other's.

headlines: TMC not militant organisation like BJP: WB CM Mamata
text: After BJP accused TMC of killing party workers in West Bengal, CM Mamata Banerjee said, "We are not a militant organisation like the BJP." "They are creating fights not only among Christians, Muslims but also among Hindus," the CM added. She further accused the party of lynching people and EVM tampering and asked people to be careful.

headlines: Cocaine in rivers affecting eels' mating ability: Study
text: Italian researchers have found that mild cocaine concentrations in rivers worldwide hinder eels' ability to migrate and reproduce. The team found the drug builds up in body parts, impacts their muscles and hormones. Scientists placed European eels in cocaine-polluted waters for 50 days and found the effects persisted in the "critically endangered" fish for 10 days even in clean water.

headlines: Told woman to use name stated in Nikahnama: Passport officer
text: The Lucknow passport officer, who has been transferred for allegedly humiliating an interfaith couple, has said he asked the woman to get the name 'Shadia Anas' endorsed as it was mentioned on her Nikahnama. "We have to do thorough checks to ensure no person is changing their name to obtain a passport," he added.

headlines: India raises import duties on many items against US tariff hike
text: India on Thursday raised import duties on almost 30 items including agricultural and steel products in protest against the US imposing higher levies on products shipped from the country. Earlier, US hiked tariffs on certain steel and aluminium products which had tariff implication of $241 million on India. China, EU and other trading partners have also hiked tariffs in protest.

headlines: Amit Jain to be first Indian MD of L'OrÃ©al India
text: French beauty giant L'OrÃ©al has appointed Amit Jain as its new India Managing Director, making him the first Indian to lead its operations in the country. He succeeds Jean-Christophe Letellier who, after five years in the role, will take up a new position within L'OrÃ©al Group. Jain has 30 years of experience with companies such as Coca-Cola, Viacom and AkzoNobel.

headlines: Spanish player saves bird that invaded pitch during WC game
text: Spanish midfielder Isco rescued a bird that had invaded the pitch during Spain's match against Iran at FIFA World Cup on Wednesday. The 26-year-old picked the bird and escorted it safely out of the playing ground after defender Gerard Pique had lost hold of it. "Isco saving this bird's life was the highlight to my first half," a user tweeted.

headlines: Danish WC players pay for jet so teammate can see newborn
text: Denmark players paid for a private jet so defender Jonas Knudsen could fly home and see his newborn daughter after the team's win over Peru in 2018 FIFA World Cup on Saturday. Knudsen's wife gave birth several weeks earlier than expected after the defender had arrived in Russia. "We wanted to do anything for him," Danish goalkeeper Kasper Schmeichel said.

headlines: Mohammad Shami sees daughter after 3 months, shares picture
text: Indian fast bowler Mohammad Shami took to Instagram to share a screenshot of himself video chatting with his daughter. "I'm very happy to see you my heartbeat babo I love you...after 3 months...long time," he captioned the picture. Shami was recently dropped from the Indian team after failing to clear the Yo-Yo fitness test.

headlines: Yoga se hi hoga, tweets Sehwag on Yoga Day
text: On the occasion of fourth International Yoga Day, former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag tweeted, "Yoga Se Hi Hoga! Catch on to Yoga". Meanwhile, Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said "Yoga is the single path to attain multiple objectives of physical, mental & spiritual well being." Olympic medallists shuttler Saina Nehwal and wrestler Sakshi Malik also extended Yoga Day greetings.

headlines: Tinder's parent company Match acquires dating app Hinge
text: Tinder's parent company Match Group has acquired a 51% stake in the dating app Hinge, the company announced on Wednesday. Hinge, which was initially launched in 2011 on a Tinder-based model, redesigned its app from 'swiping' to letting users build out full profile pages. Apart from Hinge, Match owns other dating apps including OkCupid, Match and Plenty of Fish.

headlines: Instagram launches standalone app for hour-long videos
text: Facebook-owned Instagram has launched a standalone video app called IGTV which will allow users to upload videos up to one hour in length. Users will be able to swipe through videos or visit a Browse tab of recommended videos, and creators they're following. IGTV will also allow creators to upload videos directly to the Instagram app, a product manager said.

headlines: Facebook to let Group admins charge for exclusive content
text: Facebook on Wednesday introduced the Subscription Groups which will allow admins to charge for exclusive content in Groups. Parenting, cooking, and home cleaning private groups on the platform will be the first ones to access the feature which is in pilot mode. Group admins will reportedly be able to charge up to $29.99 (â¹2,000) per month during the testing phase.

headlines: Mumbai man drives around for 8 hours with wife's body in car
text: A man drove across Mumbai for eight hours with the dead body of his wife in his car after she committed suicide, the police said. He took the body to the three different hospitals before authorities informed the police. Following this, the police filed a case of abetment of suicide against him as they learnt the couple would fight often.

headlines: Yoga has nothing to do with religion: Vice President Naidu
text: At an International Yoga Day event in Mumbai on Thursday, Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu said, "Yoga has nothing to do with religion." He further said, "Yoga adopts a holistic approach towards health and well-being... It is unfortunate that some people attribute religious overtones to this ancient scientific system."

headlines: 800 differently abled attempt Guinness Record on Yoga Day
text: As many as 800 differently abled people from across India attempted to set a Guinness World Record for 'Largest Silent Yoga Class' on the occasion of International Yoga Day on Thursday in Ahmedabad. The participants had been undergoing training for this since May. Chosen from 10 city-based organisations, the participants were instructed using Bluetooth headphones.

headlines: Billboard in US' Texas urges liberals to leave
text: A billboard urging liberals to leave has come up in the US state of Texas. "Liberals please continue on I-40 (interstate highway) until you have left our great state of Texas," the billboard read. However, the company that owns the billboard has said it would be immediately removed, adding that the ad space was bought by an individual.

headlines: UK university sends Nazi General's quote as career advice
text: A university in the UK's Exeter sent students a quote by Nazi General Erwin Rommel as part of a career advice email. The quote, which appeared at the bottom of the internal email, read, "One cannot permit unique opportunities to slip by for the sake of trifles." The university apologised later, saying it would make sure this doesn't happen again.

headlines: Russia's Sistema exits Anil Ambani's RCom, sells its 10% stake
text: Russian conglomerate Sistema has fully sold its 10% stake over the past few months in Anil Ambani-led Reliance Communications (RCom). Sistema had sold its Indian mobile telephony business, Sistema Shyam Teleservices, to RCom in return for a 10% stake in October 2017. RCom has since shut its consumer wireless business amid intense competition, and currently operates only an enterprise business.

headlines: Northern Hemisphere witnesses longest day of the year today
text: June 21 marks the beginning of summer in Earth's Northern Hemisphere, referred to as the 'summer solstice', the year's longest day and shortest night. A solstice is an astronomical event when the tilt of Earth's axis with respect to the Sun is maximum. After summer solstice, days start getting shorter till winter solstice on December 21, Northern Hemisphere's shortest day.

headlines: Japan worker's pay cut for taking lunch break 3 minutes early
text: A 64-year-old Japanese official working at the waterworks bureau has suffered half a day's pay cut for taking his lunch break around 3 minutes early 26 times in seven months. The worker violated the public service law by not concentrating on his work, the waterworks bureau said. His bosses even called a press conference and apologised for the worker's misconduct.

headlines: Obscenity lies in beholder's eyes: Kerala HC on 'breastfeeding' cover
text: The Kerala High Court, while dismissing a petition, refused to categorise the cover of Malayalam magazine 'Grihalakshmi' which showed a woman breastfeeding a baby as obscene. "We don't see, despite our best efforts, obscenity in the picture...As beauty lies in the beholder's eye, so does obscenity perhaps," it observed. "One man's vulgarity is another man's lyric," the court further noted.nn

headlines: VC fund CEO dies after phone explodes, catches fire in bedroom
text: Nazrin Hassan, the CEO of Malaysia-based venture capital firm Cradle Fund, died after one of his two smartphones exploded and caught fire while charging in his bedroom. As per reports, the phone caused a blunt trauma to the back of Hassan's head when it exploded, while the smoke from the explosion caused his death.

headlines: China social media platform blocks UK comedian over Xi skit
text: Chinese social media platform Weibo has blocked all mentions of British comedian John Oliver's name after he ran a 20-minute segment satirising President Xi Jinping on his show 'Last Week Tonight'. Attempts to post Oliver's name receive an error message which says the content "violates relevant regulations or Weibo community rules". However, searches for his name were not blocked.

headlines: SRK used to tell me he always thought DDLJ is silly: Ranbir
text: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has revealed Shah Rukh Khan used to tell him that he always thought the film 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' is "silly". "[He thought] it's a silly love story. But see what that film did," added Ranbir while referring to its box-office performance. The 1995 film, directed by Aditya Chopra, starred Shah Rukh and Kajol in lead roles.

headlines: Burger King slammed for 'Get Pregnant by Football Stars' ad
text: Fast-food giant Burger King has taken down an advertisement offering a lifetime supply of Whoppers to Russian women who get pregnant by FIFA World Cup players, following criticism. The ad, which also promised a reward of $47,000, asked women to get "the best football genes" and "ensure the success of the Russian team for generations to come".

headlines: Swiggy raises $210 million, becomes billion-dollar startup
text: Bengaluru-based food delivery startup Swiggy has raised $210 million in Series G round of funding from Naspers, DST Global, Coatue Management and Meituan-Dianping. With this funding, Swiggy's valuation has reportedly touched $1.3 billion, making it India's 12th unicorn startup after Flipkart, Paytm, Ola Cabs and others. Founded in 2014, Swiggy has now raised over $460 million in total funding.

headlines: ITBP personnel perform Yoga at 18,000 feet in Ladakh
text: Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) personnel performed 'Surya Namaskar' in a cold desert of Ladakh at an altitude of 18,000 feet on the fourth International Yoga Day. In Arunachal Pradesh, ITBP jawans performed 'River Yoga' in Digaru river. Meanwhile, Indian Navy personnel in several parts of the country performed various asanas onboard the INS Viraat, INS Jyoti and INS Jamuna.

headlines: CM Naiduâordered treasure hunt in Tirumala temple: Ex-priest
text: A former head priest of the Lord Venkateswara temple in Tirumala has alleged that Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu had ordered excavation in the temple's kitchen last year to search for ancient treasure. The former priest's allegation comes after the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams sent him a notice for levelling "false allegations" against the temple administration and the state government.

headlines: Sanskrit to be used for future supercomputer: Union Minister
text: Union Minister of State Anantkumar Hegde has said, "While we're becoming too dependent on English in our country...eminent scientists of the world are coming to the view that Sanskrit is the language for future supercomputers." The minister further added that many European universities have also started teaching Sanskrit to students again.

headlines: AirAsia pilot puts ACâon full to make passengers leave plane
text: The AirAsia pilot of a delayed Kolkata-Bagdogra flight allegedly put the air-conditioning blower on full to vacate the plane after passengers refused to deboard as it was raining outside. A passenger said they were sitting inside the flight for one-and-a-half hours without food or water. "It created a scary scene as heavy fog was created inside the plane", he added.

headlines: US blames rights groups for its withdrawal from UN body
text: US Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley on Wednesday blamed human rights groups for the country's withdrawal from the UN Human Rights Council. Haley said at least 17 rights and aid groups urged countries not to support the US' efforts to reform the Geneva-based UN body. Haley had called the council "hypocritical and self-serving".

headlines: Video: Priest slaps crying toddler during baptism ceremony
text: A video of a priest slapping a crying toddler during a baptism ceremony has surfaced online. "It's a tantrum, this is called a tantrum...I will scream louder than you. So, calm down. Calm down," the priest can be heard saying in French. The toddler's father can then be seen pulling the child out of the priest's arms.

headlines: No magic wand to solve India's jobs crisis: CEA Subramanian
text: Outgoing Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) Arvind Subramanian has said there is no "magic wand" to solve India's jobs crisis and the country needs to focus on growth, investment and exports. "We have a window for this before technology squeezes the space for it," Subramanian added. He further said that he regretted not being able to replicate CEA role in states.

headlines: Rao to reunite with Kangana for Anurag Basu's Imli: Reports
text: Actor Rajkummar Rao will star with Kangana Ranaut in filmmaker Anurag Basu's upcoming project titled 'Imli', as per reports. Rao and Kangana were previously seen together in 'Queen' and are currently shooting for 'Mental Hai Kya'. While Kangana earlier worked with Basu in 'Kites', 'Imli' could be Rao's first film with the director.

headlines: Anupam shares pic with onscreen wife in Manmohan Singh's biopic
text: Anupam Kher took to Twitter to reveal that actress Divya Seth Shah will be playing ex-Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's wife Gursharan Kaur in the biopic on Singh titled 'The Accidental Prime Minister'. The biopic is based on a book written by Singh's former media advisor and journalist Sanjaya Baru. Directed by Vijay Gutte, it will release on December 21.

headlines: England fans give Nazi salutes in WC city invaded during WWII
text: A video showing a group of England fans giving Nazi salutes and singing Hitler songs in the World Cup host city of Volgograd, where nearly 2 million people died during World War II, has surfaced online. The song was seemingly aimed at English club Tottenham Hotspur with lines "Spurs are on their way to Auschwitz, Hitler's gonna gas them again".

headlines: SuÃ¡rez announces wife's pregnancy post scoring in 100th game
text: Uruguay striker Luis SuÃ¡rez announced his wife's pregnancy after scoring his 52nd goal in his 100th international appearance against Saudi Arabia on Wednesday. "Happy to achieve the final 16 stage again... and even more happy to share that we'll have our third child," the 31-year-old tweeted as Uruguay reached the World Cup's knockout stage for the third straight time.

headlines: Lionel Messi suffers and cries for Argentina: Mother
text: Argentina football team captain Lionel Messi's mother, Celia Cuccittini, has said that her son has been deeply affected by criticism of his performances with the national team and he "suffers and cries at times". "He more than anyone would give everything for this to be his World Cup," Cuccittini added. Notably, Argentina have lost three consecutive major finals.

headlines: Asylum seekers use World Cup IDs to enter Europe from Russia
text: Asylum seekers from Morocco, Nigeria, China and elsewhere have illegally tried to enter Europe using World Cup fan identity documents, which gives visa-free access to Russia, according to the border police. The accused were intercepted at Russia's border with Finland and Norway or the Belarusian border with Poland. Notably, the border between Belarus and Russia can be crossed without checks.

headlines: Player tries somersault throw in final secs of game, fails
text: Iran's Milad Mohammadi has been trolled by football fans after he failed to throw in the ball after attempting a somersault during the dying seconds of the World Cup group match, which saw Spain win 1-0 on Wednesday. The substitute kissed the ball before failing to generate enough momentum for a long-distance throw-in and then passed the ball backwards.

headlines: Microsoft acquires AI startup Bonsai
text: Microsoft on Wednesday announced that the company has signed an agreement to acquire the US-based artificial intelligence (AI) startup Bonsai for an undisclosed amount. Microsoft said the deal will help the company in its work with autonomous systems. Founded in 2014, Bonsai follows a reinforcement learning approach which involves training AI systems for better outcomes through trial and error.

headlines: History won't forgive BJP for its greed in J&K: Shiv Sena
text: Days after BJP broke its alliance with PDP in the Jammu and Kashmir government, Shiv Sena claimed history will never forgive the party for its "greed." It said, "BJP opted out of power in Kashmir after spreading anarchy in the valley." It added, "The situation had never deteriorated to this extent there...never had so many jawans lost their lives before."

headlines: Bank of Maharashtra shares hit record low after CEO's arrest
text: Bank of Maharashtra shares slumped as much as 7% to hit a fresh record low on Thursday, following the arrest of CEO Ravindra Marathe in a cheating case. The Pune police also arrested an executive director, and former CMD of the bank. The case relates to alleged â¹2,043 crore fraud by Pune-based developer DS Kulkarni alias DSK and his companies.

headlines: 1 lakh people perform Yoga in Rajasthan, create world record
text: More than 1 lakh people together performed Yoga in Rajasthan's Kota on Thursday to create Guinness World Record on the occasion of International Yoga Day. CM Vasundhara Raje Scindia was present at the venue along with Yoga guru Ramdev, who conducted the yoga session. Earlier, 55,000 people of Mysore held the record of the largest crowd performing yoga.

headlines: Trump ends policy of separating families of immigrants
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday ended the policy of separating immigrant families at the US-Mexico border after public uproar over it. âI didnât like the sight or the feeling of families being separated,â Trump said. More than 2,000 children have been separated from their family at the border between April 19 and May 31.

headlines: Algeria shuts internet nationwide to prevent cheating during exams
text: Algeria shut down all internet connections nationwide for two hours on Wednesday in order to prevent students from cheating during two high school diploma exams. Further, phone jammers were installed where the exam papers were printed to prevent any leak. This comes after widespread cheating in 2016, where questions were leaked on social media before the start of the exam.

headlines: Did over 100 takes for 2 shots in Saawariya's towel song: Ranbir
text: Ranbir Kapoor said he did over 100 takes for two shots in his debut film Saawariya's song 'Jab Se Tere Naina', which he called the 'towel song'. Discussing how director Sanjay Leela Bhansali doesn't do anything less than 45 takes, Ranbir said he did 45-50 takes in a day for the shots and another 70 takes the next day.

headlines: Jagga Jasoos failure broke my heart and bank account: Ranbir
text: Speaking about the box-office performance of his 2017 film 'Jagga Jasoos', Ranbir Kapoor said, "The film's failure broke my heart and my bank [account]. "We had too much on our plate. Firstly, it was a detective film, the character stammers, it's a musical...there's a love story...so it was very hard," he added. Ranbir was a co-producer of 'Jagga Jasoos'.

headlines: Kangana shares video of her performing yoga on Int'l Yoga Day
text: The Instagram account of Kangana Ranaut, run by her team, has shared videos of her performing yoga on the occasion of International Yoga Day today. "Kangana shows her dedication towards #Yoga...and encourages everyone to adopt Yoga as a lifestyle and a way to spiritual awakening," the caption read. Kangana is currently in London for the shoot of 'Mental Hai Kya'.

headlines: George Clooney, wife Amal donate $100,000 to migrant kids
text: Hollywood actor George Clooney and his wife, Amal Clooney, have donated $100,000 (â¹68 lakh) to help migrant children who were separated from their families at the US-Mexico border. "We can't change this administration's policy but we can help defend the victims of it," they said in a statement. The couple added their twin toddlers inspired them to make the donation.nn

headlines: Women's T20I highest total world record broken twice in 1 day
text: England Women registered the highest-ever total in women's T20I cricket history by scoring 250/3 against South Africa  Women in a T20I tri-series match on Wednesday. England Women surpassed the previous highest total of 216/1 scored by New Zealand Women against South Africa Women earlier in the day. New Zealand Women had overtaken Australia Women, who had recorded 209/4 in March.

headlines: Captain DeMo is fast asleep; it's crazy: Rahul on CEA's exit
text: After Union Minister Arun Jaitley announced that Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian will be stepping down, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "Captain DeMo is fast asleep. It's crazy out there." Meanwhile, the brightest are fleeing the "sinking ship" that RSS is steering onto rocks, he added. He further questioned if Jaitley was still the Finance Minister after returning from surgery.

headlines: BJP leader held with drugs worth â¹27 crore in Manipur
text: The Narcotics and Affairs of Border (NAB) on Wednesday arrested BJP leader Lutkhosei Zou and six others in Manipur over possession of drugs worth â¹27 crore. Apart from 4.5 kg heroin and 2.8 lakh World is Yours (WY) tablets, guns, â¹57 lakh cash and demonetised currency notes worth â¹95,000 were also seized from them.

headlines: Mars dust storm goes planet wide, Curiosity rover takes pics
text: The dust storm that shut down NASA's contact with Mars' oldest active rover Opportunity has spread throughout the Red Planet, the US space agency said. However, NASA's Curiosity rover has remained largely unaffected and has shared images from the other side of Mars. The sunlight blocking haze was above level 8, whereas it was last measured at 11 over Opportunity.

headlines: T-rex couldn't stick its tongue out, models incorrect: Study
text: A study by American and Chinese researchers has revealed that Tyrannosaurus rex couldn't stick out its tongue like lizards, claiming it is incorrectly shown at theme parks and museums. Most dinosaurs' tongues were rooted to the bottom of their mouths like in alligators, said researchers, after comparing tongue-supporting bones in modern birds, crocodiles, and their extinct dinosaur relatives.

headlines: Passport officer shames interfaith couple, asks to convert
text: An interfaith couple, who applied for their passports in Lucknow, was allegedly humiliated and shamed by a passport officer before he had put their applications on hold. Tweeting about their ordeal to External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj, the couple said that the officer even told the man to convert to Hinduism and take 'pheras' for their wedding to be valid.

headlines: Kerala man forges Qatar royals' email ID, dupes museum of â¹5cr
text: A man in Kerala was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly forging email IDs of members of Qatar royal family and duping Qatar Museums of â¹5.6 crore. Using a forged ID, the accused mailed the museum authority to deposit the amount in his account as an advance for painting a gold-framed portrait of the King. Police have frozen his bank account.

headlines: Ex-US Prez Nixon opposed India in 1971 war against Pak: Docs
text: Former US President Richard Nixon opposed India in the 1971 war with Pakistan which led to the creation of Bangladesh, according to recently declassified documents. Nixon believed India's military action would set a "bad precedent" and endanger the future of any small country. Pointing at then Indian PM Indira Gandhi, Nixon had said that lady chiefs of state are "dangerous".

headlines: US dismisses third-party role in resolving Kashmir dispute
text: The US administration has dismissed a third-party role in resolving the Kashmir dispute between India and Pakistan. "We believe the pace, scope and character of any discussion on Kashmir are for the two sides to determine," it said. This comes after Chinese Ambassador to India Luo Zhaohui said trilateral cooperation between India, China and Pakistan could help resolve the issue.

headlines: 60-yr-old held for raping, killing 4-yr-old granddaughter
text: A 60-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping and murdering his 4-year-old granddaughter in Chhattisgarh. After killing the child, the accused hid her under dry grass pretending that she was missing and later threw her body in muddy water near his house. A dog squad dug out a blood-stained 'lungi' from the crime spot, helping in identifying the accused.

headlines: Dehradun se Dublin tak Yoga hi Yoga hai: PM on Int'l Yoga Day
text: Addressing 50,000 Yoga enthusiasts in Uttarakhand on International Yoga Day, PM Narendra Modi said, "Dehradun se Dublin tak, Shanghai se Chicago tak, Jakarta se Johannesburg tak, Yoga hi Yoga hai." "Yoga is India's gift to the world. It's a passport for wellness...Yoga Day has become one of the biggest mass movements in the quest for good health," PM Modi added.

headlines: Ivanka urged Donald Trump to end family separations: Reports
text: US President Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump urged him to end family separations on the US-Mexico border, according to reports. Ivanka had reportedly seen the images of the separations and said the US administration should deal with the crisis "for a lot of reasons". Trump on Wednesday signed an executive order to end the separations.

headlines: Video of Ukraine border guards dancing semi-naked goes viral
text: A video of Ukrainian female border guards dancing semi-naked on Korean singer Psy's song 'Gentleman' has gone viral. The footage was captured during a party, which the off-duty border guards hosted at their dormitory. Several people condemned the video, saying that the guards had "disgraced" the Ukrainian military uniform and called for them to be sacked.

headlines: N Korea has returned remains of 200 US war dead: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said that North Korea has returned the remains of 200 US troops missing from the Korean War, although there was no official confirmation from military authorities. North Korean leader Kim Jong-un had agreed to return the remains during his summit with Trump. About 7,700 US troops remain unaccounted from the 1950-1953 Korean War.

headlines: NZ PM Ardern 2nd world leader to give birth while in office
text: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern on Thursday gave birth to a baby girl, becoming the second democratically elected world leader after Pakistan's Benazir Bhutto to give birth while in office. Ardern shared the news by posting a picture of the newborn on her Instagram account. "Welcome to our village wee one," Ardern captioned the picture.

headlines: Made small empire out of $25 machine bought in 1946: Buffett
text: In a video showing Warren Buffett visiting a candy store with 'best friend' Bill Gates, Buffett says, "I bought a [pinball] machine for $25 in 1946 and built a small empire out of it." Calling it the best business he was ever in, Buffett added, "I peaked very early in my business career. It's been all downhill ever since."

headlines: Singer Akon to launch cryptocurrency called AKoin
text: Senegal-born singer Akon has announced the launch of his cryptocurrency called AKoin, that will be available for sale in two weeks. As part of the AKoin venture, the singer plans to complete a '100% crypto-based futuristic city' on 2,000 acres of land located near Dakar, the capital city of Senegal. The land was gifted to Akon by the Senegalese President.

headlines: SBI MD B Sriram named CEO of IDBI Bank for three months
text: SBI Managing Director B Sriram has been given additional charge as the CEO and MD of IDBI Bank for a "temporary" period of 3 months. He has been appointed in place of MK Jain who was recently made the Deputy Governor of RBI. Sriram currently manages SBI's corporate banking division, which has a loan book exceeding â¹10 lakh crore.

headlines: 'Kyunki Saas Bhi...' actor Hiten to star in Johar's Kalank
text: Hiten Tejwani, known for starring in the television show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', will star with Alia Bhatt, Sanjay Dutt and Aditya Roy Kapur in Karan Johar's production 'Kalank'. "I'll act with them and share screen space with them for the first time...I'm looking forward to it," said Hiten. 'Kalank' is scheduled to release on April 19, 2019.

headlines: Sikkim government appoints AR Rahman as its Brand Ambassador
text: Music composer AR Rahman has been appointed as the Brand Ambassador of the Sikkim government, an official notification issued by Chief Secretary AK Srivastava stated. Rahman will promote and project Sikkim's achievements nationally and globally. Earlier this year, he was made the state's Brand Ambassador of tourism and business.

headlines: I definitely want to make a sequel to 3 Idiots: Hirani
text: Filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani has said that he definitely wants to make a sequel to his 2009 directorial '3 Idiots'. Hirani added, "In fact, (screenwriter) Abhijat (Joshi) and I started writing something a few days ago." He further said that it is still in the initial stage and they will take a fair amount of time to develop the script.

headlines: I'm looking to keep Miss World crown in India: Miss India 2018
text: Miss India 2018 Anukreethy Vas, who will represent the country at Miss World, said, "After 17 years, Manushi (Chhillar) has brought the crown to India...I am looking forward to keeping it in India." Talking about her win, she added, "It's a proud moment for me because it's the first time Tamil Nadu has won Miss India (world title)."

headlines: Trailer of Stallone, Michael B Jordan's 'Creed II' released
text: The trailer of Sylvester Stallone and Michael B Jordan starrer 'Creed II' has been released. The film is a sequel to 2015 film 'Creed' and the eighth installment in the 'Rocky' film series. Directed by Steven Caple Jr and also starring Tessa Thompson, the film is scheduled to release on November 21.

headlines: Sacrificed government but did not abandon Kashmir, says BJP
text: After BJP ended its alliance with PDP in Jammu and Kashmir, BJP General Secretary Ram Madhav said the BJP sacrificed its government for "larger national interest." He also added that the BJP is not "abandoning" Kashmir. "We tried for two years but it was no longer tenable. Every alliance has uncertainty built into it," he further said.

headlines: Sack Digvijay Singh: BJP to Cong after 'hindu terror' remark
text: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Wednesday demanded that Congress leader Digvijay Singh be "sacked" from the party. Singh had said that all the Hindus arrested for terrorism have been part of the RSS in some way or the other. Following this, Patra said, "You (Digvijay Singh) pointed a finger at millions of Hindus, denigrated them and called them terrorists."

headlines: Meditation app Calm raises $27 mn at $250 mn valuation
text: US-based meditation startup Calm, which offers mental wellness apps, has raised $27 million in a Series A funding round at a $250 million pre-money valuation. The funding round was led by Insight Venture Partners with participation from Ashton Kutcher's Sound Ventures and singer Harry Styles. Founded in 2012, Calm had raised $1.5 million in seed funding prior to this round.

headlines: Virgin Hyperloop One to make â¹3,000 crore test track in Pune
text: Richard Branson-led Virgin Hyperloop One will invest â¹3,000 crore to build a 15-km-long Hyperloop demonstration track in Pune for the Mumbai-Pune Hyperloop project. Pune's development commissioner Kiran Gitte said the project will come up between Wakad and the Gahunje Stadium. The Hyperloop route is expected to reduce the commute time between Mumbai and Pune to 25 minutes.

headlines: Rajasthan ranked No. 1 in water conservation: NITI Aayog
text: Rajasthan has been ranked first by the NITI Aayog among all states after it registered a significant increase in groundwater level due to the water conversation structures built under Chief Minister's Jal Swavlamban Abhiyan. The state also witnessed an increase of 81% in irrigation capacity. As many as 4 lakh structures were built in Rajasthan in the last three years.

headlines: J&K newspapers publish blank editorials over journo's murder
text: All major newspapers in Jammu and Kashmir left their editorial spaces blank on Tuesday in protest against the killing of 'Rising Kashmir' Editor Shujaat Bukhari in Srinagar. "The editorial is the heart of a newspaper. Since our voices have been silent since the murder, we decided to show our protest," Kashmir Editors Guild Spokesperson Shafat Kira said.

headlines: Only 25% Indian adults used internet in 2017: Survey
text: Despite the government's Digital India initiative, only 25% of the adults in India used internet in 2017, which is among the lowest in the world, a Pew Research Center survey found. It also revealed smartphone ownership in the country increased from 12% in 2013 to 22% in 2017. Social media use increased from 8% in 2013 to 20% in 2017.

headlines: Man pours petrol on wife in Pune court over Triple Talaq case
text: A man allegedly poured petrol on his 22-year-old wife inside the premises of a Pune family court after she refused to withdraw a case of Triple Talaq against him. Sohail Khan then tried to escape the court premises but was detained by police. His wife also accused him of mental harassment and forcing her into unnatural sex during their marriage.

headlines: US has rebuilt China: Donald Trump
text: Amid the ongoing 'trade war' between the two countries, US President Donald Trump has said that his country has rebuilt China. "China has been taking out $500 billion a year out of our country and rebuilding (itself)," the US President added. Trump further threatened to impose import tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese goods.

headlines: North Korea removes anti-US souvenirs from shops: Report
text: North Korea has removed anti-US souvenirs sold at gift shops after the improvement in relations between the two countries, according to reports. The souvenirs, which included stamps, postcards and posters among others, were "replaced by items more focused on positive themes such as reunification", reports added. North Korea had been selling the souvenirs to spread propaganda against the US.

headlines: US is world's first country to quit UN Human Rights Council
text: The US is the world's first country to withdraw from the UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC). The US joined the UNHRC in 2009 during the tenure of then-President Barack Obama. The US slammed the "biased" UNHRC for its criticism of the alleged violations committed by the Israeli forces on Palestinians and called for reforms in the global human rights body.

headlines: Just did a minute countdown: Singer on WC middle finger act
text: British singer-songwriter Robbie Williams has revealed he flipped his middle finger to the camera at the 2018 FIFA World Cup opening ceremony to signal that there was one minute to go until kick-off. "I can't trust me. I don't know what I'm going to do at any time," Williams added. The 44-year-old further said he had not planned it before.

headlines: Spain win 1st match of WC, go level with Portugal in Group B
text: Spain defeated Iran 1-0 on Wednesday to register their first win at the 2018 FIFA World Cup. With the victory, the 2010 champions are now level with Portugal with four points in Group B. Notably, there has not been a single 0-0 draw in the opening 20 matches of a World Cup for the first time since 1954.

headlines: SuÃ¡rez's goal in 100th game knocks Saudi, Egypt out of WC
text: Forward Luis SuÃ¡rez scored in his 100th international appearance as Uruguay defeated Saudi Arabia in a Group A fixture at the 2018 FIFA World Cup on Wednesday. Russia and Uruguay became the first two teams to advance to Round of 16 while Saudi Arabia and Egypt were eliminated. Further, SuÃ¡rez became the first Uruguayan to score in three World Cups.

headlines: Twitter users turn Senegal coach's celebration into meme
text: Reacting to Senegal coach Aliou CissÃ©'s celebration during the team's victory against Poland at the 2018 FIFA World Cup, a user tweeted, "CissÃ© is me when there's free food at work." Other users wrote, "Me when I wake up early but realise I've 10 more minutes of sleep before the alarm rings," and "CissÃ©'s like: 'Celebrate. But make it fashion'."

headlines: Watch diving header that made Ronaldo Europe's top scorer
text: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo scored a diving header in the fourth minute against Morocco in 2018 FIFA World Cup to become the highest international goal-scorer among European players. The 33-year-old guided a Joao Moutinho cross from a short corner into the net to take his tally to 85 goals. His goal helped Portugal register their first victory in the tournament.

headlines: Yo-Yo test standard unattainable for some players: Ex-physio
text: Former Team India physio John Gloster has said the 16.1 benchmark for the Yo-Yo fitness test would've been "physically unattainable" for some cricketers, which doesn't mean they would be exempted from selection. "Yo-Yo test could be of help in the T20s, but is it a definitive test for all formats of the game? I am not too sure," added Gloster.

headlines: Facebook to include autoplay video ads in Messenger app
text: Facebook is planning to include autoplay video ads in its Messenger app which will automatically start playing while users scroll through messages, the company has confirmed. The ads will start rolling out from June 25 to select users, a company spokesperson said. Earlier, Facebook had admitted that it was running out of places to run ads in the News Feed.

headlines: Kamal Haasan meets EC for registration of political party
text: Actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan on Wednesday met Election Commission officials to formally register his party Makkal Needhi Maiam. He said, "They asked certain questions. They are not having any major objections." Launched on February 21, the party reportedly has a flag featuring six interlocking hands that symbolises co-operation between the five Southern States and 1 Union Territory.

headlines: Next Maharashtra CM will be from Shiv Sena: Uddhav Thackeray
text: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray has said the next Maharashtra Chief Minister will be from Shiv Sena, adding, "I am determined and moving ahead with this resolve." He said Sena would not join the third front and also criticised the BJP. The BJP is reportedly attempting to enter a pre-poll alliance with Shiv Sena ahead of the 2019 elections.

headlines: VC firm gives 2 youngest employees $20mn to make investments
text: US-based venture capital (VC) firm Canaan Partners has assigned $20 million of its $800-million fund to two of its youngest employees, Adina Tecklu and Hootan Rashidifard to make startup investments. The move is part of the company's Canaan Beta program which will invest $250,000-500,000 checks in consumer tech startups focussing in areas such as social media and gaming.

headlines: Muslim man lynched over cow slaughter rumour in UP
text: A 38-year-old Muslim cattle trader was lynched and a 65-year-old was seriously injured allegedly after a mob attacked them on the suspicion of cow slaughter in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur. The injured man's brother said the 65-year-old was buying fodder for cattle when he met the deceased and said it's possible he was attacked because he was spotted with the trader.

headlines: BJP leader who shared 'sexist' post on women journos gets bail
text: BJP leader S Ve Shekher was granted bail two months after he shared a Facebook post claiming women journalists compromise themselves. The post was uploaded by his Facebook friend, in context of Tamil Nadu Governor Banwarilal Purohit patting a female journalist on her cheek. It had claimed, "women cannot become reporters or anchors unless they sleep with top bosses."

headlines: MP man jailed for life for raping 62-year-old woman
text: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Ambah has been sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a 62-year-old woman in 2016. The court also imposed a fine of â¹2,000 on him. The convict had beaten up the woman, threatened to kill her when she tried to resist his attempts, and raped her at her house in August 2016.

headlines: PM Narendra Modi married me, he is Ram for me: Jashodaben
text: Expressing shock over Madhya Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel's remark of PM Modi being unmarried, his estranged wife Jashodaben on Wednesday said, "He is married...He is Ram for me." She added that while filing papers for Lok Sabha elections in 2014, PM Modi himself declared his marital status and mentioned her name. "Patel's conduct has tarnished Indian PM's image," said Jashodaben.

headlines: Railway cop suspended after video of him molesting woman goes viral
text: A constable employed with the Railway Police Force was on Wednesday suspended after a video of him touching a woman inappropriately went viral on social media. The constable was posted at Kalyan police station in Mumbai. The constable started caressing the back of the woman while he was sitting on a bench at the station.

headlines: Poster of John Abraham starrer 'Satyamev Jayate' unveiled
text: The poster of the John Abraham starrer 'Satyamev Jayate' has been unveiled. Sharing the poster of the film, which is scheduled to release on August 15, John tweeted, "This Independence Day, justice will roar!" The film, which has been directed by Milap Milan Zaveri, comes with the tag line, "Beimaan pitega, corruption mitega (Corrupt will be beaten, corruption will end)."

headlines: 1st Japanese royal visits Russia in 100 years for FIFA WC
text: Japan's Princess Hisako has become the first member of the Imperial family to visit Russia since 1916.
