The two also danced together on the show. Talking about Sanjeev's video, Govinda earlier said, "More than half a dozen heroes...copied my steps, and nobody has done it so well!"

headlines: I'm in 'Zero' as I'm a zero: Salman on cameo in SRK's 'Zero'
text: Salman Khan, while speaking about his cameo in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'Zero', jokingly said, "I'm in 'Zero' because I'm a zero." Salman has also featured in the new teaser of the film. Shah Rukh will be seen playing a dwarf in the Aanand L Rai directorial, which also stars Anushka Sharma and Katrina Kaif.

headlines: English fans bring sandpaper cards to mock Australia in ODI
text: England cricket team supporters brought sandpaper 'six' and 'four' cards at the Oval to mock the Australian team for the ball-tampering scandal. The security had confiscated over 5,000 sandpaper cards ahead of the ODI, which saw Australia lose by three wickets on Wednesday. Chants of "Aussie! Aussie! Aussie! Cheat! Cheat! Cheat!" were also heard from the crowd but later subsided.

headlines: Tortured, abused in custody: 2008 Malegaon blast accused
text: 2008 Malegaon blast case accused Lieutenant Colonel Shrikant Prasad Purohit has alleged he was tortured in the custody of the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad. In a 24-page letter to the National Human Rights Commission, which came to light recently, he named six officers for the torture and claimed he was beaten and threatened to confess to a crime he never committed.

headlines: Stone quarry worker blows up his home to teach wife a lesson
text: A stone quarry worker in West Bengal's Birbhum allegedly blew up his house with dynamite on Wednesday "to teach his wife a lesson". The man, whose wife and son were not at home at the time of the blast, said that his wife used to quarrel with him frequently. The man suffered critical injuries in the blast and was hospitalised.

headlines: That girl was my daughter: 'Godman' on rape charge
text: Self-styled godman Daati Maharaj has said that the 25-year-old woman follower who has accused him of rape was his 'daughter' and he won't put any allegations on her. "Even if I am hanged, I won't put allegations on her. If I have done anything wrong, then the legal authorities will look into that," he added.

headlines: Girl given electric shocks, held captive for dating a Muslim
text: A girl in Kerala has filed a complaint against her mother and VHP and RSS workers for allegedly holding her captive for 1.5 years and even giving her electric shocks for dating a Muslim man. Reportedly, the girl has claimed that she was given 10 tablets a day and injections to keep her unconscious during captivity.

headlines: Bellandur lake largest septic tank of Bengaluru: NGT panel
text: A committee appointed by the National Green Tribunal (NGT) has said that the Bellandur lake in Bengaluru has become the "largest septic tank of the city". Slamming the Karnataka government and various state agencies for failing "miserably" in their duties, the panel stated that not even one millilitre of clean water is available in the lake.

headlines: World has escaped threat of war post S'pore summit: S Korea
text: South Korean President Moon Jae-in on Thursday said the world has escaped the threat of war, nuclear weapons and missiles after the Singapore summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. Both the US and North Korea signed an agreement to work towards achieving complete denuclearisation of the Korean Peninsula.n

headlines: Aus soldiers slammed for flying Nazi flag in Afghanistan
text: A leaked photo of Australian soldiers flying a Nazi swastika flag over their vehicle while on operations in Afghanistan in 2007 has been criticised by Australian PM Malcolm Turnbull as "completely and utterly unacceptable". The Australian Defence Ministry confirmed the picture was authentic and said that the Nazi 'parade' was just a "twisted joke" rather than an expression of neo-Nazism.

headlines: Kim Jong-un is a tough guy: Trump on his human rights record
text: US President Donald Trump praised North Korean leader Kim Jong-un as a "tough guy" and a "great negotiator" in response to a question on his human rights record. Trump also said a lot of other people have done bad things. Trump has in the past called Kim "a madman who doesn't mind starving or killing his people".

headlines: Dust storm on Mars shuts down NASA rover 'Opportunity'
text: A massive dust storm on Mars, which was first detected by Opportunity rover on May 30, has blocked out the Sun over one quarter of the Red Planet, shutting down all science operations except its master clock, said NASA. The solar-powered vehicle last communicated with Earth on June 10 and would wake up automatically when it's charged sufficiently, added NASA.

headlines: Sylvester Stallone under probe over alleged sexual assault
text: US prosecutors have launched a probe to determine whether actor Sylvester Stallone should be charged in connection with a sexual assault reported last year. The case involves a woman who alleged he assaulted her in 1980s when she was a teenager. Stallone had a sexual encounter with her while shooting a film in Israel in 1987 while he was single.

headlines: Teaser of 'The Conjuring' spin-off 'The Nun' released
text: The official teaser of horror film 'The Nun', the spin-off to 'The Conjuring' has been released. The film focuses on the character 'Valak', introduced in 'The Conjuring 2'. It stars Oscar-nominated Demian Bichir, Taissa Farmiga and Jonas Bloquet, among others. Directed by Corin Hardy, 'The Nun' is scheduled to released on September 7.

headlines: How many matches did each team take to win their first Test?
text: Australia won the first-ever Test in 1877, becoming the only team to win their debut Test. England and Pakistan registered their first Test victories in their respective second matches while India posted their first Test victory in their 25th match, 20 years after debut. New Zealand took 45 Tests for their first win, the most by a side.

headlines: 17-yr-old hits 232*(145) in an ODI to break 21-yr-old record
text: New Zealand Women's 17-year-old spinner Amelia Kerr smashed an unbeaten 232 off 145 balls against Ireland Women on Wednesday to register the highest-ever score by a woman in an ODI. Kerr surpassed former Australia Women captain Belinda Clark, who had slammed 229*(155) against Denmark Women in 1997. Only Kerr and Clark have scored double centuries in women's ODIs.

headlines: Apple CEO reveals why he accepted Steve Jobs' interview call
text: On being asked why he accepted Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs' interview call, CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview said, "I thought, you know this is an opportunity to talk to a guy that started the whole industry." On his meeting with Jobs, Cook said, "There was a sparkle in his eye that I'd never seen in a CEO before."

headlines: We have given all of our employees 100% standing desks: Cook
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview revealed that the company has given all of its employees 100% standing desks to work on. When asked if he thought that standing up working is better than sitting down, Cook said, "If you can stand for a while and then sit, and so on... it is much better for your lifestyle."

headlines: I'm not political: Apple CEO on running for US President
text: On being asked if he would consider running for the US President, Apple CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview said that he is not political. Adding that he loves "focusing on the policy stuff," Cook said, "I can make a bigger difference...doing what I'm doing." "You know, you'd love to be president, but not ever run," he added.

headlines: Virtual ID can be used in place of Aadhaar for new SIM: DoT
text: Consumers can either give their Virtual IDs or Aadhaar card number to get new SIMs or verify existing ones, as per a notice by the telecom department. The Virtual ID system provides users with a 16-digit randomly generated number which can be used instead of the Aadhaar number. The service will be enabled on the UIDAI website from July 1.

headlines: Man decides to sue Google after searching himself online
text: Australian man Milorad Trkulja has been granted permission by the country's high court to sue Google, alleging the search engine showed his name and picture while searching for criminals. Trkulja also sued Google in 2012, receiving roughly $150,000 in damages, after discovering that searching his name showed images of mob figures. "I will sue them 'til they stop," Trkulja said.

headlines: Give birth to 'sanskari' kids or be infertile: BJP MLA to women
text: Slamming Congress leaders in Madhya Pradesh, BJP MLA Panna Lal Shakya said, "There are women who give birth to such leaders. Women should rather remain infertile than produce kids who are not 'sanskari' and defile the society." "The Congress came up with the slogan of 'Gharibi Hatao' but wiped out the poor instead," the MLA added.

headlines: Not afraid to get fired: Whole Foods CEO on tiff with Amazon
text: In a leaked audio clip, John Mackey the CEO of Whole Foods, acquired by Amazon in 2017, is heard saying, "I'm sure that Amazon has probably gotten more disagreement from me than any other...person." Adding he has the least amount to lose, Mackey said, "I ultimately am not afraid to get fired," However, he didn't disclose what caused the disagreement.

headlines: GM names India's Dhivya Suryadevara as its 1st woman CFO
text: US' largest automaker General Motors (GM) on Wednesday named Indian Dhivya Suryadevara as its first female Chief Financial Officer (CFO). She will succeed Chuck Stevens, who is retiring after 40 years of service, on September 1. Suryadevara, currently Vice President of Corporate Finance, has an MBA from Harvard Business School and is a Chartered Financial Analyst and a Chartered Accountant.

headlines: Retired Lieutenant Colonel arrested for molesting 8-year-old
text: A 70-year-old retired Lieutenant Colonel has been arrested for allegedly molesting an 8-year-old girl, who lived in the same building in Delhi, while they were in an elevator together. The incident came to light after she told her parents, who approached the police. The Resident Welfare Association had received similar complaints about the accused in the past, police said.

headlines: Macedonian Prez refuses to sign name change deal with Greece
text: After Macedonian PM Zoran Zaev signed an agreement with Greek PM Alexis Tsipras to rename the country as 'Republic of North Macedonia', Macedonian President Gjorge Ivanov has refused to sign the "damaging treaty". Greece objected to the name, saying it implies a claim to the whole geographic region of Macedonia, of which more than half is part of Greek territory.

headlines: Pak bans 26/11 Mumbai attack mastermind's party from polls
text: The Pakistan Election Commission has dismissed an application seeking registration of 26/11 Mumbai terror attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed's political party, the Milli Muslim League (MML). The decision follows a report by the Interior Ministry that said the party followed the ideology of the Lashkar-e-Taiba founder. Earlier, the US included the MML in its list of Foreign Terrorist Organisations.

headlines: Priyanka Chopra to be paid â¹12 crore for 'Bharat': Reports
text: Actress Priyanka Chopra will be paid a remuneration of â¹12 crore for her upcoming film 'Bharat', as per reports. Her team had reportedly quoted â¹14 crore as her remuneration for the Salman Khan starrer, but the figure came down to â¹12 crore. 'Bharat' will mark Priyanka's comeback in Bollywood after three years.

headlines: Hosts Russia lowest-ranked among 32 teams at 2018 World Cup
text: Russia, who are hosting FIFA World Cup for the first time, are the lowest-ranked team among the 32 nations participating in the 2018 edition. Russia are currently ranked 70th and they will face the second-lowest ranked team, Saudi Arabia (67th), in the opener of the 32-day tournament. Defending champions Germany will start the quadrennial tournament as the top-ranked team.

headlines: Don't have sex with World Cup guests, MP warns Russian women
text: Russian women should not have sex with visiting World Cup fans to avoid becoming single mothers with mixed-race children, Russian lawmaker Tamara Pletneva has said. The 70-year-old cited 1980 Moscow Olympics, which led to some women getting pregnant with foreigners. When asked if World Cup could boost Russia's birthrate, she said, "We should be giving birth to our own children."

headlines: Australia lose to England in 1st game under new coach Langer
text: New Australian coach Justin Langer's reign began with a defeat as Australia suffered a three-wicket loss against England in the first ODI on Wednesday. The ODI series began with a handshake between players of both the sides after Australian captain Tim Paine requested England captain Eoin Morgan. The five-match series is Australia's first full ODI series since the ball-tampering scandal.

headlines: 17-yr-old 1st cricketer to hit 200, take 5 wickets in an ODI
text: New Zealand Women's 17-year-old spinner Amelia Kerr on Wednesday became the first-ever cricketer in history to slam a double hundred and take a five-wicket haul in a single ODI. Playing against Ireland Women, Kerr recorded the highest-ever ODI score by a woman by smashing 232*(145) and registered bowling figures of 7-1-17-5 to help her team win by 305 runs.

headlines: Footballer pushes own teammate to steal ball, gets trolled
text: Belgium forward Eden Hazard was trolled by his national team members on Twitter after he pushed his own teammate to steal the ball from him during a friendly. "When there's only one slice of pizza left," midfielder Axel Witsel wrote. Further, goalkeeper Simon Mignolet tweeted, "When your girl wants to watch Netflix when the World Cup is on #ATouchofEden."

headlines: Political positions heritable, not wisdom: Jaitley on Rahul
text: Taking a dig at Congress President Rahul Gandhi, Union Minister Arun Jaitley said that in dynastic parties, political positions are heritable but wisdom is not. Attacking the Congress in a Facebook post titled 'Is Congress Becoming Ideologyless? Is Anti-Modism its only ideology?', Jaitley added that dynastic political parties are family and personality dominated and ideology takes a back seat.

headlines: Karni Sena threatens to cut Raj Min's nose over rat remark
text: Rajput group Karni Sena has threatened to cut Rajasthan minister Kiran Maheshwariâs nose and ears for allegedly equating Rajputs with rats. "She has probably forgotten Deepika Padukone 'Padmaavat' incident," said the group. When asked about a Rajput committee's campaign against BJP ahead of upcoming assembly polls, Kiran had said, "People are like rainy season rats who come out during elections."

headlines: Man thrashed by govt official for misbehaving over village road
text: A 32-year-old man was allegedly thrashed by a government official after the man complained about roads in his village in Rajasthan's Karauli on Tuesday. He reportedly got into an argument with the official and was arrested by police. A probe has been ordered into the incident, and primary investigation revealed the man had misbehaved with the officer, an official said.

headlines: Brothel owner to run for state assembly in US
text: A brothel owner and reality TV star has secured the Republican Party nomination to contest an assembly seat in the US state of Nevada. Dennis Hof owns seven legal brothels in Nevada and stars in the adult reality series 'Cathouse'. The 71-year-old calls himself 'the Trump of Pahrump', the name of the town he lives in.

headlines: TCS adds â¹16,500 crore to market value on share buyback plan
text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) added â¹16,539 crore to its market value on Wednesday after the company said it will consider a share buyback proposal at its next board meeting. The company's shares surged 2.43%, taking its market capitalisation to â¹6.98 lakh crore ($103.5 billion). TCS had undertaken a â¹16,000-crore buyback offer last year.

headlines: If head of poor family dies before 60, we'll give â¹2L: MP CM
text: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday announced that the state will give â¹2 lakh to poor families whose heads die before the age of 60. He further said that in case the head of the family dies in an accident, the state will give â¹4 lakh to the families.

headlines: Footballs made in Pakistan being used in 2018 FIFA World Cup
text: The Telstar 18 footballs, which will be used in the upcoming FIFA World Cup in Russia, have been manufactured in a company in Pakistan's Sialkot. The company also manufactures footballs for Germany's Bundesliga, France's Ligue 1 and the Champions League. The company had also provided footballs for the 2014 FIFA World Cup in Brazil.

headlines: NZ Women 1st team to hit 400-plus totals in 3 straight ODIs
text: New Zealand Women became the first team across men's and women's cricket to register 400-plus totals in three consecutive ODIs, achieving the feat by scoring 440/3 against Ireland Women in the third ODI on Wednesday. New Zealand Women had posted a total of 490/4 in the first ODI on Friday before scoring 418/10 in the second ODI on Sunday.

headlines: I did it for greater purpose: Apple CEO on coming out as gay
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview said that he decided to come out as gay "for a greater purpose". Adding that there were a lot of gay kids not being treated well by families, Cook said, "It would tug at my heart to the point where I thought, I'm making the wrong call... which is to stay private."

headlines: Is 'anti-Modism' Congress' only ideology: Jaitley in FB note
text: Claiming that Congress leaders' statements show lack of ideology, Union Minister Arun Jaitley on Wednesday wrote a Facebook note titled, "Is Congress Becoming Ideologyless? Is Anti-Modism its only ideology?" "P. Chidambaram believes that frying 'pakodas' does not create jobs. Rahul Gandhi says that running Dhabas can be a launch pad for start ups," he wrote.

headlines: Grofers would never get into micro-delivery business: CEO
text: When asked if Grofers will follow the micro-delivery model, the online grocer's CEO Albinder Dhindsa said, "We would never do that." Further talking about ending its daily essentials subscription service in 2016, he also said, "We didn't see merit in doing it and realised that the model was unviable." Grofers would continue to lay "emphasis on core business," he added.

headlines: Chennai Police detains around 3,000 people in one night
text: The Chennai Police on Monday night detained around 3,000 people, including over 1,300 criminals and over 1,100 history-sheeters, on various charges. In order to arrest the history-sheeters, the police conducted raids at around 740 hotels and lodges. The operation came a day after the city recorded 14 incidents of chain snatching and four robberies.

headlines: Mumbai witnessed 12 major fires, 22 deaths in last 6 months
text: Mumbai has witnessed 12 major fires which resulted in 22 deaths in the last six months, including the Kamala Mills fire which killed 14 in December last year. A fire in Saki Naka led to deaths of 12 people in December, while a Marol fire in January killed four people. In May, a fire in Goregaon left five dead.

headlines: Karnataka to have first father-daughter duo in Assembly
text: For the first time in Karnataka, a father-daughter duo will be legislators in the state Assembly at the same time. While Sowmya Reddy won the polls from Bengaluru's Jayanagar for the Congress, her father Ramalinga Reddy is Congress MLA from neighbouring BTM Layout. Speaking about his daughter, Ramalinga said, "She had a desire to help people." n

headlines: Prayers outside the temple may not reach God: K'taka temple
text: Karnataka's Kukke Shree Subrahmanya Temple has issued a notice stating that prayers or rituals conducted outside the temple are private in nature and 'may not reach God'. The temple issued the notice owing to middlemen who were luring devotees in the name of "private pujas". The temple reportedly has an annual income of â¹95 crore.

headlines: Trump explains viral G7 summit photo with world leaders
text: Commenting on the viral G7 summit photo of world leaders, US President Donald Trump said that the conversation captured in the picture was "very friendly" although it didn't look that way. Trump added he was waiting for a document after requesting final changes in it. The photograph was shared across several social media platforms and was turned into memes.

headlines: Trump showed video to convince Kim to give up nukes
text: US President Donald Trump showed a video to Kim Jong-un in a bid to show the North Korean leader the benefits of denuclearisation. The four-minute video portrayed Kim and Trump as 'men of destiny' with the world's future in their hands. The video showed a bright future for North Korea if it chooses to give up nuclear weapons.

headlines: Georgia PM Kvirikashvili resigns amid rift with ruling party
text: Georgia's Prime Minister Giorgi Kvirikashvili resigned on Wednesday citing differences with the ruling party's leader and former Prime Minister Bidzina Ivanishvili. The 50-year-old became Prime Minister in 2015. Kvirikashvili's resignation coincided with anti-government protests in the country over the government's alleged interference in the murder trial of two teenagers killed last year.

headlines: Saudi-led coalition launches biggest attack of Yemen war
text: The Saudi Arabia-led coalition launched its biggest attack of Yemen's civil war to regain control of the port city of Hodeidah. Most of the food, fuel and medicines imports reach Yemen through Hodeidah, which is currently under the control of Iran-backed Houthi rebels. As many as 30 air strikes reportedly hit the city within half an hour.

headlines: Alligator on US airport runway delays flight landing
text: The landing of a flight at the Orlando International Airport, US, was delayed as an alligator strolled across the runway. Authorities had to deploy an airport truck to escort the alligator to a nearby pond. Despite the temporary delay, the flight landed in Orlando 17 minutes ahead of its scheduled time of arrival.

headlines: Family helped Nirav Modi launder money, destroy evidence: ED
text: Jeweller Nirav Modi's brother Nehal Modi intentionally helped in concealing money laundering and destroying the evidence, the Enforcement Directorate's chargesheet said. The agency also said his father was a beneficiary of two companies in which around $50-55 million was transferred from Nirav's dummy companies. The agency also alleged that Nirav's sister Purvi Mehta helped him in fund diversion.

headlines: India's per capita income grows 8.6%, slowest in 6 years
text: India's per capita income or the average income earned per person grew 8.6% in last fiscal, its slowest pace in six years in nominal terms. The per capita income during 2017-18 stood at â¹1,12,835 as compared to â¹1,03,870 in 2016-17, government data showed. The per capita income in real terms during the fiscal grew 5.4% to â¹86,668.

headlines: RCom reduces employee base by 94% from 52,000 to 3,400
text: Anil Ambani-led Reliance Communications has said its employee base now stands at 3,400, a reduction of 94% from the peak of around 52,000 employees. RCom said it is "fully insulated from the hyper-competition and financial stress" after it exited the consumer-facing wireless business in January. RCom is now a pure B2B player with only 35,300 customers worldwide, the company added.

headlines: I am also Kaala: MLA Jignesh Mevani on new Rajinikanth film
text: Speaking of Rajinikanth-starrer Kaala, Dalit activist and Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani tweeted, "Watched Kala yesterday and felt that I am also a Kala. Very good film." The film, which is about the oppression faced by the Dalit community, was termed "a brilliant cultural response to the Brahminical ideology" by Mevani. He also shared a photo with Kaala filmmaker Pa Ranjith.

headlines: TV-less Argentine prisoners on hunger strike over World Cup
text: As many as nine prisoners in an Argentine jail have gone on a hunger strike to urge authorities to repair the cable TV so they can watch the World Cup. The inmates wrote a letter to a judge, claiming the audiovisual cable is their "indispensable right". The cable TV, located in a common area, hasn't been working since three days.

headlines: Spain appoint ex-Madrid player as new boss a day before WC
text: Spain have appointed former Real Madrid defender Fernando Hierro as their new manager, a day before the 2018 FIFA World Cup begins in Russia. This comes after the Spanish federation fired Julen Lopetegui for not informing them about his appointment as Real Madrid coach. Spain will begin their World Cup campaign against Portugal on June 15.

headlines: Once delayed Iftar to watch Dhoni bat: Afghan keeper
text: Afghanistan wicketkeeper-batsman Mohammad Shahzad has said he can even sacrifice food and sleep to watch MS Dhoni bat. He revealed that once during Iftar when he was watching India's match, he delayed having food and prayed to God that Dhoni "finishes the match". "I don't know what's there in (Dhoni) that I like him so much," Shahzad further said.

headlines: What was hidden behind walls: BJP to Akhilesh on bungalow
text: Referring to the damaged walls of the government bungalow vacated by Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, Uttar Pradesh minister Sidharth Singh asked, "What was hidden behind the wall that you had to break it down?" This comes after Yadav slammed BJP for accusing him of damaging the bungalow and called it a "conspiracy". Singh added, "Ulta chor kotwal ko daante".

headlines: Chhattisgarh villagers travel via boat during monsoon rains
text: Residents of Chhattisgarh's Timed village have to cross Indravati river using small boats during monsoon due to lack of connectivity. The rains caused the water level in the river to increase, making it dangerous for the locals to cross it. The villagers said the situation would have been better if the bridge in the area was constructed on time.

headlines: Vast improvement in countering J&K insurgency: NSC official
text: There has been a vast improvement in India's way of dealing with insurgency in Jammu and Kashmir as compared to the situation in the 1990s, the senior joint secretary of National Security Council said. Speaking at an international conference, he asserted that statistically, there has been a decline in insurgency. He further said radicalisation is not just a "Muslim problem".

headlines: Teachers launch bikini flashmob for sacked colleague in Russia
text: Teachers across Russia have launched a flashmob on social media by sharing pictures of themselves in bikinis to support a colleague who was fired for modelling in a swimsuit. Viktoria Popova was told she had violated the school's code of conduct. After the campaign gained strength, Viktoria was offered her job back at the same school or a different one.

headlines: Govt may list Air India after failed divestment: Reports
text: The government is open to listing Air India after it failed to attract buyers for 76% stake in the company, according to reports. While several proposals are being considered to revive the divestment process, the government will not give control to a foreign entity, reports added. The government may reportedly consider reducing the debt that the buyer would take over.

headlines: 17-yr-old hits 174 runs in 19 ODIs, slams 232* in 20th ODI
text: New Zealand Women spinner Amelia Kerr, who hit 174 runs in her first 19 ODIs, smashed 232*(145) in her 20th ODI against Ireland Women on Wednesday. Kerr became the second woman to score an ODI double ton after Australia's Belinda Clark (229 in 1997). Aged 17 years and 243 days, Kerr is the youngest to score an international double century.

headlines: Car hangs from parking's 4th floor after driver hits accelerator
text: A woman driver was rescued unhurt in California after she accidentally hit her car's accelerator instead of the brake, and it went hanging from the fourth floor of a multi-level parking. After removing her from the car, firefighters secured it with cables to keep it from falling off. A tow truck then pulled the car back to the parking.

headlines: Kim Kardashian asks for 'edit' button, Twitter CEO responds
text: Reality television personality Kim Kardashian on Wednesday tweeted that she asked Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey to introduce an edit button for tweets. She also said that she made the pitch during her husband Kanye West's birthday party. Responding to her tweet, Jack Dorsey said, "Now I see why I was invited!"

headlines: Watch FIFA WC's song video featuring Will Smith, Ronaldinho
text: The official video of the 2018 FIFA World Cup song 'Live It Up', sung by American actor-rapper Will Smith, singer Nicky Jam and Albanian pop star Era Istrefi, also features Brazil legend Ronaldinho. Brazilian winger Willian can also be seen in the video. Smith, Jam and Istrefi will perform the song live during the World Cup final on July 15.

headlines: What are the most controversial moments in World Cup history?
text: During the 2006 FIFA World Cup final, France captain Zinedine Zidane headbutted Italy's Marco Materazzi in his farewell match. Uruguay's Luis SuÃ¡rez bit Italian Giorgio Chiellini in a 2014 World Cup match and was banned for nine international matches. Maradona scored a goal using his hand against England in the 1986 World Cup quarter-final, which was called 'Hand of God'.

headlines: Player named Flying Dutchman scored flying header in 2014 WC
text: Netherlands' Robin van Persie, nicknamed 'Flying Dutchman' by Arsenal supporters, scored a diving header against Spain in the World Cup on June 13, 2014. Netherlands, who went on to win the match 5-1, were trailing 0-1, when Van Persie guided a Daley Blind cross into the net in the 44th minute. The goal was nominated for the 2014 PuskÃ¡s Award.

headlines: Anushka's presence made BCCI award more special: Virat Kohli
text: India captain Virat Kohli, who received Polly Umrigar Award for BCCI's best international cricketer for the last two seasons on Tuesday, said his wife Anushka Sharma's presence made the occasion "more special". "The awards didn't happen last year but I'm glad they didn't because she's here now," Kohli added. The 29-year-old was presented with the award by coach Ravi Shastri.

headlines: 48-team 2026 FIFA World Cup to be held in US, Mexico, Canada
text: The 2026 FIFA World Cup will be held in the US, Mexico and Canada after their 'united' bid received 134 votes, 69 more than what Morocco's bid received. This is the fifth time Morocco lost their bid campaign to host FIFA World Cup. Mexico has hosted the World Cup twice (1970 and 1986) and the US hosted it in 1994.

headlines: Yashwant Sinha joins AAP protest march to L-G's office
text: Former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha, who resigned from BJP recently, joined thousands of AAP leaders and workers as they marched towards Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal's office on Wednesday. Expressing solidarity with AAP leaders in their "struggle", Sinha urged that a solution is found at the earliest. AAP's demands to Baijal include a direction asking IAS officers to end their "strike".

headlines: Karnad on hit list of Gauri Lankesh murder suspects: Reports
text: Theatre personality Girish Karnad was on the hit list of those suspected of killing journalist Gauri Lankesh, SIT officials have said. Politician BT Lalitha Naik and rationalist CS Dwarakanath reportedly also featured on the list. The SIT has recovered a diary, which has entries in Devanagari script and features the names of personalities known for their views against hardline Hindutva.

headlines: 2 Muslims lynched in Jharkhand on suspicion of cattle theft
text: Two Muslim men were allegedly lynched by a mob on Wednesday morning after locals accused them of stealing 13 buffaloes from a resident in Jharkhand's Godda. "Villagers claim that they found the missing buffaloes in the possession of the two people in Bankatti area. They were beaten to death," Godda Superintendent of Police Rajiv Kumar Singh said.

headlines: Consider giving job to kin of man jailed in Pak: HC to govt
text: The Gujarat High Court asked the Centre to consider giving a job to the sister of an Indian man who has been lodged in a Pakistani jail since 1994 over suspicions of being a spy. The HC directed the Union Ministry of Home Affairs to consider giving her a job within one month on compassionate grounds as an exceptional case.

headlines: Homeless man lynched on suspicion of child-lifting in W Bengal
text: An unidentified man suspected of being a child-lifter was allegedly tied to an electricity post and beaten to death by a mob in West Bengal on Wednesday. The victim, who appeared to be homeless, was rescued by police but succumbed to injuries in the hospital. The police have arrested three people on the basis of a video of the incident.

headlines: Lights, solar panels stolen from newly-inaugurated UP expressway
text: Solar panels, batteries, iron and under-lights amounting to millions of rupees have been reported stolen from Eastern Peripheral Expressway in Uttar Pradesh days after its inauguration by PM Narendra Modi. Inaugurated on May 27, the 135-km expressway was built at a cost of â¹11,000 crore. Touted as India's first smart and green highway, it was built in record 17 months.

headlines: Karti-controlled firm got â¹26 lakh bribe in Maxis deal: ED
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has alleged that former Finance Minister P Chidambaram's son Karti Chidambaram controlled a firm which received â¹26 lakh as alleged bribe in the Aircel-Maxis deal. This payment was received from Aircel immediately after FDI approval, the agency said. It added that another Karti-promoted firm received â¹90 lakh from Malaysia's Maxis allegedly for software services.

headlines: Pak SC upholds death sentence for man who raped 7-yr-old
text: The Pakistan Supreme Court has upheld a death sentence for a man who raped and murdered a seven-year-old girl in January. The convict, Imran Ali, had appealed the death penalty handed over to him by an anti-terrorism court claiming his trial was not fair. The incident had sparked outrage and protests across Pakistan.

headlines: Would like to give him an award: Mahindra on 'one-man band'
text: Impressed by a man who he dubbed as a "one-man-band", Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to ask if anyone knew his whereabouts. "I'd like to give him an award for innovation or musical talent âhaven't quite decided which one yet!," the billionaire's tweet read. The man in the video can be seen playing three instruments at once.

headlines: Armaan sent to judicial custody for assaulting girlfriend
text: A Bandra court rejected actor Armaan Kohli's bail application and sent him to judicial custody till June 26 for assaulting his live-in partner Neeru Randhawa. The actor, who had reportedly been hiding at a friend's farmhouse in Lonavala, was arrested on Tuesday evening. Neeru had earlier claimed that she had to undergo a surgery due to the assault.

headlines: No fear as I'm in safe hands: Taapsee on working with Big B
text: Taapsee Pannu, who will work with Amitabh Bachchan for the second time in Sujoy Ghosh directorial 'Badla', said, "When you're in safe hands of a brilliant filmmaker and an ace co-actor there's nothing to fear." Talking about the film, Taapsee added, "This is going to be a riveting thriller. I'm...out of my comfort zone which I actually enjoy the most."

headlines: Barber makes Messi, Ronaldo's portraits on fans' heads
text: A hairdresser in Serbia is offering 'portraits' of five-time Ballon d'Or winners Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo onto the back of heads of fans. It takes barber Mario Hvala five to seven hours to complete a portrait, which costs â¬150 (nearly â¹12,000). The 35-year-old said the idea of "doing something different" came to him nine years ago.

headlines: National wrestling champ arrested for murder in Rohtak
text: Rakesh Mokhriya, a national level wrestling gold medallist, has been arrested on charges of murdering a man last year in Rohtak. Mokhriya had turned gangster and murdered the man following a dispute over contract of liquor vend. He had earlier spent six years in jail for murdering a Jhajjar resident over a rivalry in 2005.

headlines: PayPal rival Adyen's value more than doubles at $17bn post IPO
text: PayPal rival Adyen on Wednesday saw its valuation hit $17 billion in one of Europe's biggest technology initial public offerings (IPO) of 2018. The company's revenue exceeded $1.1 billion in 2017 for the first time and recorded a net profit of $83.9 million for the same period. Founded in 2006, Adyen processes payments for companies including Facebook, Netflix, and eBay.

headlines: 2 malware copying banking apps to steal data found in India
text: Quick Heal Security Labs has spotted two banking Android malware in India that imitate social and banking apps to steal the user's banking credentials. The malware are able to do this by displaying a fake window that asks for a debit/credit card number. Until the user provides the number, the malware doesn't allow access to Google Play or other apps.

headlines: 2 Telangana Congress MLAs move court over House membership
text: Two Telangana Congress MLAs on Tuesday moved the Hyderabad High Court, filing a contempt petition against the Assembly Speaker and the Secretary for not restoring their membership to the assembly. The ruling Telangana Rahstra Samithi had last month filed a plea seeking the two leaders' expulsion. Dismissing the plea, the HC last week directed the Speaker to restore their memberships.

headlines: UK to retain startups with free dinners, trips to America
text: In order to ensure that financial technology startups don't leave London after Brexit, the UK government will offer incentives including free networking dinners and trips to potential partners in the United States to the firms. The British government on Wednesday also announced it will launch 'Tech Nation', a programme open to founders of early-stage fintech firms.

headlines: 2 men posing as cops rob Mumbai woman of gold chain
text: Two men posing as policemen allegedly robbed a 68-year-old woman of her gold chain worth â¹60,000 in Mumbai. The woman claimed that the men wearing safari suits approached her saying there were robbers in the area and asked her to give them her jewellery for safekeeping. She said she was probably hypnotised, due to which she gave them her chain.

headlines: Trump aide apologises for 'Trudeau has place in hell' remark
text: US President Donald Trump's trade adviser Peter Navarro has apologised for saying Canada PM Justin Trudeau "deserves a special place in hell". Navarro had slammed Trudeau over his criticism of the US' trade policies, referring to the tariffs imposed on aluminium and steel imports. "The problem was that in conveying that message I used inappropriate language," Navarro said.

headlines: Facebook questioned by US over lyrics of Taylor Swift's song
text: A US Senator had asked Facebook if Taylor Swift's cover of a song named 'September' qualified as "hate speech", a document has revealed. The Senator also asked if a statement reading "Taylor Swift needs her *** whooped" falls in the category. Facebook replied it defines hate speech as an attack on people based on characteristics including race and national origin.

headlines: Chinese vase found in shoebox auctioned for over â¹128 crore
text: An 18th century Chinese vase found in a shoebox in an attic in France has been auctioned for â¬16.2 million (over â¹128 crore) by Sotheby's. The bulb-shaped vase, which was expected to fetch between â¬500,000 and â¬700,000, was made for an emperor of the Qing dynasty. Earlier this year, a Qing dynasty bowl was auctioned for â¹198 crore.

headlines: Truecaller makes 1st Indian acquisition, buys payments firm Chillr
text: Swedish caller ID service Truecaller has acquired Kerala-based payments startup Chillr, marking its first acquisition in India. As part of the deal, Chillr Co-founder Sony Joy will join as the Vice President of Truecaller Pay, and the entire team will be retained by the company. Founded in 2014, Chillr lets users send money directly between bank accounts using mobile numbers.

headlines: Jeff Bezos, Bill Gates-led $1-bn fund makes 1st investment
text: Breakthrough Energy Ventures, a $1-billion fund led by investors including world's richest man Jeff Bezos and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates, has made its first investment in two energy storage startups. Form Energy received $9 million with Prelude Ventures, and Quidnet Energy got $6.4 million alongside Evok Innovations. Launched in 2016, the fund invests in technologies to fight climate change.

headlines: Akhilesh Yadav brings taps to press meet to defend himself
text: After being accused of damaging his government bungalow and removing air conditioners and taps, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav walked into a press conference on Wednesday holding taps. Claiming the bungalow was maintained well, he said it had been renovated with his money. If "even a single item in the inventory is missing", I'm ready to return it, he added.

headlines: Rahul's first press conference in Mumbai lasts 2 min 45 sec
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi's first ever press conference in Mumbai on Wednesday lasted only for 2 minutes and 45 seconds. Rahul reportedly arrived an hour after the scheduled time and didn't answer any questions. He criticised PM Narendra Modi-led NDA government, BJP, and the RSS before ending the press briefing, which was attended by over 100 media persons.

headlines: Woman, husband try to set themselves on fire at UP Assembly
text: A woman and her husband on Wednesday attempted to set themselves on fire near Uttar Pradesh Vidhan Sabha in Lucknow, citing police inaction over their rape complaint against a Samajwadi Party worker. "She was raped in 2015, no action has been taken. He is threatening us to withdraw the case. I request his immediate arrest," the woman's husband said.

headlines: US approves $930-mn deal to sell attack helicopters to India
text: The US government has approved a  deal to sell six AH-64E Apache attack helicopters to India for $930 million. The US will also provide night vision sensors, control radars,  Hellfire Longbow missiles and Stinger air-to-air missiles to India under the deal. "(The helicopters) will increase India's capability to counter ground-armoured threats and modernise its armed forces," the US said.

headlines: 3 arrested for eve-teasing Union Minister Anupriya Patel
text: The police have arrested three people for allegedly eve-teasing and making indecent remarks at Union Minister Anupriya Patel when she was returning from her Parliamentary constituency Mirzapur. The accused were travelling in a car that didn't have a number plate and tried to overtake the minister's cavalcade on Sunday night. They also allegedly misbehaved with the minister's security personnel.

headlines: 90-yr-old finds family after viral video of cop feeding him
text: A missing man in his 90s has been reunited with his family after a video of him being fed by a cop in Solapur went viral. His family had launched a search for him but failed. However, the viral video reached Mumbai, where it was seen by a head constable who recognised his missing neighbour in the video.

headlines: Vajpayee's health has improved in the last two days: AIIMS
text: After former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee was admitted to AIIMS, the hospital on Wednesday issued a statement saying he has shown significant improvement in last 48 hours. "His kidney function...heart rate, respiratory rate and BP also normal, they're being maintained without support. Hopefully he'll make full recovery in next few days," the hospital added.

headlines: There is no longer a nuclear threat from North Korea: Trump
text: A day after concluding the summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, US President Donald Trump said that there was no longer a nuclear threat from the reclusive regime. Trump termed his meeting with Kim "an interesting and very positive experience". Both the US and North Korea signed an agreement to work towards achieving complete denuclearisation of the Korean Peninsula.

headlines: Macedonia changes name, ends 27-year dispute with Greece
text: Greece has agreed to recognise Macedonia under the name 'Republic of North Macedonia', ending a 27-year deadlock between the two nations. Greece objected that the 'Republic of Macedonia' implies a claim to the whole geographic region of Macedonia, of which more than half is part of Greek territory. Greece vetoed Macedonia's bid to join NATO and EU over the dispute.

headlines: Astronauts gift Pope spacesuit customised with a cape
text: Astronauts from the International Space Station gifted Pope Francis a spacesuit customised with a cape. The suit, presented to the Pope by Italian astronaut Paolo Nespoli, bore the Pope's birthname, Jorge Bergoglio, and his native country Argentina's flag. The white cape displayed the Vatican's flag, the official NASA wings logo and the name "Pope Francis" embroidered on it.

headlines: Guess Co-founder Paul Marciano quits after kissing claims
text: US fashion brand Guess on Tuesday said that Co-founder Paul Marciano has resigned as Executive Chairman after allegations of improper conduct, including kissing and groping. A special committee found that Marciano "exercised poor judgement in his communications with models and photographers". Guess and Marciano also reached settlements with five individuals amounting to $500,000.

headlines: Nirav Modi shifted dummy directors in Hong Kong to Cairo: ED
text: The Enforcement Directorate has alleged that Nirav Modi shifted all dummy directors of his six Hong Kong-based shell companies to Cairo after CBI registered a case. Nirav Modi's US-based brother Nehal Modi allegedly destroyed all the cell phones of the dummy directors and arranged for their tickets. These directors earned salaries of â¹8,000 to â¹30,000 per month, according to ED.

headlines: I'm safe: Deepika after fire breaks out at her building
text: Deepika Padukone has tweeted that she is safe, after a Level III fire broke out on the 33rd floor of the building where she resides. "Thank You everyone. Let's pray for our firefighters who are at site risking their lives," she added. Deepika was reportedly not in the building and had gone for a shoot when the fire broke out.

headlines: Will take case against Armaan back if he apologises: Girlfriend
text: Model Neeru Randhawa, whose boyfriend Armaan Kohli was arrested for allegedly assaulting her, has said she'll take the case back if he apologises and "says to the law he won't harass her again". "He's capable of harassing people...so I dread that side of his," she added. Neeru had claimed she underwent surgery due to an injury resulting from the assault.

headlines: Work can't be bartered for favours: Aditi on casting couch
text: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari, while speaking about casting couch in Bollywood, said, "Work can't be bartered for favours; either you have talent or you don't." "If at all there is any kind of closeness between two people, then it should be consensual," she added. Aditi further said, "I also believe somewhere that we girls need to say 'no'."

headlines: Which are the most talked about hairstyles in WC history?
text: Brazilian football legend Ronaldo shaved most of his hair off, leaving a semi-circular tuft of hair at the front, for the 2002 FIFA World Cup. Nigeria's Taribo West painted his dreadlocks in the green and white colours of the country's flag in the 1998 edition. The entire Romanian squad dyed their hair blond at the 1998 World Cup.

headlines: 1st bowler to 400 Test wickets Hadlee diagnosed with cancer
text: New Zealand legend Sir Richard Hadlee, the first-ever bowler to take 400 Test wickets, has been diagnosed with bowel cancer. The 66-year-old underwent a successful operation to remove the tumour, which was found during a routine three-year colonoscopy last month. "(F)urther treatment in the form of chemotherapy will commence...and last for a few months," an official statement read.

headlines: Researchers develop humanoid robot to hug humans
text: Researchers from the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems, Germany, have developed a humanoid robot called "HuggieBot" that gives hugs to humans. The humanoid robot, which weighs about 204 kg, is almost as tall as a person and gives hugs varying in duration and firmness. Researchers claim that their goal is to demonstrate the ability of robots to comfort people.

headlines: FB denies building eye-tracking tech despite holding patents
text: Facebook has denied building an eye-tracking software, according to the company's response to questions from the data scandal testimony. However, the company holds at least two patents for the technology, claiming they are "to protect (their) intellectual property". The company also added that if it ever did build the technology, it would take privacy into account.

headlines: Sharad Pawar is playing dangerous politics: Shiv Sena
text: After Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar claimed people arrested for inciting the Bhima-Koregaon violence were innocent, the Shiv Sena accused him of destabilising social harmony and playing "dangerous" politics. "Instead of coming in front of cameras and asking people to maintain peace, Pawar created an impression that Hindutva organisations were behind it," the Shiv Sena added.

headlines: Cong tried bullying Pranab Mukherjee over RSS event: Goyal
text: Congress tried bullying former President Pranab Mukherjee into not attending the RSS event, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said on Tuesday. Calling "Pranab da" practical, Goyal said, "When they realised he is a man of his own convictions, they tried to make a virtue out of their opposition." "Pranab da will be Pranab da and RSS will be RSS," he added.

headlines: Taliban assures Afghans of bright future once US leaves
text: The Taliban militant group has assured Afghans of a bright future once the US "invaders" leave the country. It also denounced the US relocation of its Israeli embassy to Jerusalem, saying the move exposes US hatred towards Islam. The militant group has been fighting US-led NATO forces to restore Islamic law since their ouster in 2001.

headlines: Infosys manufacturing head Nitesh Banga quits
text: IT giant Infosys' Global Head of Manufacturing, Nitesh Banga, has left the company to take over as the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of privately held software firm GlobalLogic. Infosys appointed Banga to the position in July last year after the earlier head Sandeep Dadlani quit. Banga was also on the board of Infosys' product and platforms subsidiary EdgeVerve.

headlines: Fire at Mumbai high-rise where Deepika Padukone resides
text: A Level III fire broke out on the 33rd floor of a Mumbai high-rise building, where actress Deepika Padukone resides on the 26th floor. While no casualties have been reported yet, 10 fire tenders, 5 jumbo tankers, 2 hydraulic platforms have been pressed into service. Reports said the fire at Beaumonde Towers in Worli has been brought under control.

headlines: Indian-origin chef fired over "anti-Islam" tweet to Priyanka
text: Dubai's JW Marriott Marquis has fired Michelin-starred Indian-origin chef Atul Kochhar over his tweet slamming Priyanka Chopraâs apology for a Quantico episode that portrayed Indians as terrorist. "We donât share the same views," read Marriottâs statement. In the tweet for which he apologised, Kochhar wrote, âYou haven't respected sentiments of Hindus...terrorised by Islam."n

headlines: Spain fire head coach a day before World Cup over 'betrayal'
text: A day before the World Cup commences, Spain have fired their manager Julen Lopetegui after he agreed to take over as Real Madrid manager after the tournament. Spanish FA President Luis Rubiales revealed Lopetegui didn't inform them before making his decision. "The Spanish national team is...team of all the Spaniards...There is a way that you must act," Rubiales added.

headlines: Tesla has never made an annual profit in 15 years: Elon Musk
text: Tesla has never made an annual profit in almost 15 years since the company was launched, CEO Elon Musk said in an email to employees. Adding that profit "is not what motivates us", Musk also said that to achieve the company's mission of transitioning to sustainable energy, Tesla has to demonstrate that it can become sustainably profitable.

headlines: Maha couple requests books as wedding gifts, sets up library
text: A couple in Maharashtra requested their wedding guests that instead of gifting them bouquets, they should bring them books for competitive exams, which they used to set up a library for needy students. The couple said that they wanted to help students who want to appear for competitive exams, but do not have the means to prepare for them.

headlines: Officials destroy 7,800 kg of ganja in Andhra Pradesh
text: Andhra Pradesh Prohibition and Excise Department officials on Tuesday destroyed 7,814 kg of ganja, seized from 62 raids conducted in East and West Godavari districts. The officials burnt a large amount of crop in front of state Excise Minister KS Jawahar, who warned people against cultivating the crop and said the government was determined to make the state 'ganja free'.

headlines: Woman on ventilator after hospital allegedly gives blood of wrong group
text: A 31-year-old woman's husband has sued Kolkata's Columbia Asia hospital after its staff allegedly infused the blood of a wrong group while performing surgery, causing her to take ventilator's support. A case of ectopic pregnancy, she was reportedly infused with blood of group of AB+ instead of A+. Her lungs and kidneys were damaged after the wrong blood infusion.

headlines: I do not get chicken in jail: Gangster Abu Salem
text: The 1993 Mumbai blasts convict Abu Salem on Tuesday complained to Portuguese Embassy officials that Maharashtra's Taloja jail authorities do not give him chicken and he has been forced to become a vegetarian. The authorities were in jail to check on him after he complained of a threat to his life. "His toilet is small and dirty," Salem's lawyer said.

headlines: 5 arrested for stripping Kolkata student and recording it
text: Police have arrested five people, including two students, for allegedly stripping a second-year student in a Kolkata college and recording it. The victim said he was targeted after he asked accused student Arnab Ghosh to submit an expenditure statement of the money they collected from students. Ghosh claimed to head the college's TMC unit, but the party denied the claims.

headlines: MP cow protection board chief gets cabinet minister rank
text: The Madhya Pradesh government has elevated state cow protection board Chairperson Swami Akhileshwaranand to the rank of cabinet minister. In April, Akhileshwaranand was given the minister of state rank along with four other religious leaders. He reportedly wrote to CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, objecting to being "put at par with those controversial figures".

headlines: Bhaiyyuji Maharaj leaves all property to his sevadar after suicide
text: The police have recovered the second page of spiritual leader Bhaiyyuji Maharaj's suicide note which states he has given the power of attorney to his trusted sevadar Vinayak. "My all powers of finance, properties, bank accounts will be Vinayak...I'm writing this thing without pressure," it reads. The 50-year-old, who retired from public life in 2016, shot himself dead on Tuesday.

headlines: Nine-year-old girl in rehab for addiction to video game
text: A nine-year-old British girl has gone into rehab after becoming addicted to survival video game Fortnite. She would secretly play Fortnite at night, and would not even get up to use the toilet when playing the game. Her parents took action after she started falling asleep at school and making in-app purchases without their knowledge.

headlines: AT&T wins court approval to buy Time Warner for $85 billion
text: A US federal judge has approved telecommunications and cable giant AT&T's $85.4 billion acquisition of media conglomerate Time Warner without imposing any conditions. The judge rejected the government's argument that the combination would hurt competition and harm consumers. The deal gives AT&T ownership of cable channels such as HBO and CNN as well as film studio Warner Bros.

headlines: It isn't the 1st time: Salim on death threats to son Salman
text: Talking about the death threats received by his son Salman Khan from gangster Sampat Nehra, Salim Khan said this isn't the first time he has received such threats. "Everyone is concerned...but work can't stop," he added. Salim further said, "There's added security for Salman, who has, in any case, always had a good team of security personnel deployed for him."

headlines: Dad never got best actor award but got love from fans: Bobby
text: Speaking about actors receiving awards, Bobby Deol said, "I consider my father (Dharmendra) as one of the most iconic and talented actors of our country, who has been never given a best actor award." "[But] he received lot of love and appreciation from his fans," Bobby added. He further said, "So [awards] don't matter. I'm here because people love me."

headlines: Kapil to collaborate with Salman for next project: Reports
text: Comedian Kapil Sharma is planning to collaborate with Salman Khan for his upcoming project, as per reports. The project, which is said to be a film, will reportedly be directed by Salman's brother Sohail Khan. Kapil recently posted on Twitter after a gap of two months and said he will start working on "something new" soon.

headlines: Apple limits how apps can share, handle users' contact lists
text: Technology giant Apple has changed its App Store rules to limit how developers and apps use information about iPhone owners' friends and contacts, according to Bloomberg. The move curbs developers' practice of asking users for access to their phone contacts and using it for marketing purposes. Sharing and selling that database with third parties has also been banned.

headlines: Cong candidate wins K'taka's Jayanagar seat by 4,000 votes
text: Congress candidate Sowmya Reddy has won Karnataka's Jayanagar Assembly constituency, defeating BJP candidate BN Prahlad by nearly 4,000 votes. Although polls were held across the state on May 12, voting for the Jayanagar seat was deferred to June 11 because of the death of BJP candidate BN Vijayakumar. She is Bengaluru's 7th woman MLA in the last 66 years.

headlines: UK to launch âStart-Up Visasâ for encouraging entrepreneurs
text: UK Prime Minister Theresa May has said that 'Start-Up Visas' will be launched in 2019 to invite talented founders of business ventures. The government revealed that the visa will be open to people who do not have a university degree. The current Tier 1 (Graduate Entrepreneur) visa is only granted to graduates with 'credible business ideas'.

headlines: Food chain Wow! Momo raises â¹3 crore from Fabindia MD
text: Kolkata-based food chain Wow! Momo has raised â¹3-4 crore from Fabindia's Managing Director William Bissell, as per reports. The funding round has raised the chain's value to around â¹300 crore. Founded in 2008, Wow! Momo, which started with a â¹30,000 investment, offers around 12 different flavours of momos and has over 130 outlets across the country.

headlines: Toyota invests $1 bn in Uber rival Grab at $10 bn valuation
text: Toyota has agreed to invest $1 billion in Uber's Southeast Asian rival Grab. As a part of the deal, Toyota, which will become a lead investor in the startup's ongoing financing round, will work with Grab to strengthen their collaboration in connected cars area. The deal values Grab at over $10 billion, according to reports.

headlines: Police arrest prime accused in Assam lynching case
text: Assam Police on Tuesday arrested the prime accused in connection with the lynching of two men by a mob over rumours in Karbi Anglong over a week ago. The accused called up locals accusing the victims of being child lifters and asked them to stop their car, police said. Around 64 people have been arrested in the case so far.

headlines: College student caught supplying heroin to boyfriend in jail
text: A second-year college student named Susmita Malakar was caught trying to supply 200 grams of heroin to her boyfriend at a jail in Kolkata. Malakar had claimed the heroin was talcum powder when jail officers intercepted her and called the police. Notably, her boyfriend Bhagirath Sarkar is an under-trial prisoner who has been accused of murder and supplying narcotics.

headlines: E-billing at Mumbai's Kurla station to curb overpricing
text: The Central Railway has introduced electronic billing at Mumbai's Kurla railway station in order to curb overpricing. Commuters can also use debit or credit cards to make payments at the point of sale machines that have been installed in food stalls. The step was taken after many people complained that they were being charged extra by the stall owners.

headlines: Delhi air quality beyond 'severe' level due to dust storms
text: The air quality in Delhi deteriorated beyond the 'severe' level on Wednesday due to dust storms in western India which increased coarser particles in the air, according to Central Pollution Control Board data. The PM10 level was at 778 in the Delhi-NCR area and 824 in Delhi particularly, which led to hazy conditions and limited visibility.

headlines: Cops book data analytics firm after trainee commits suicide
text: Police have booked a data analytics firm in Bengaluru for abetment to suicide, a day after firm's 23-year-old trainee decision scientist allegedly jumped from the 12th floor of the office building. The victim's father, in his complaint, claimed that his son was facing workplace harassment and was apprehensive of getting sacked. No suicide note was recovered from the deceased.

headlines: Construction workers build road over dog's body in Agra
text: Construction workers working for a private firm constructed part of a road over a dead dog's body in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The body was removed after people filed a police complaint on seeing the half-buried body of the dog on Wednesday. Meanwhile, Public Works Department (PWD) has issued a notice to the construction company.

headlines: Facebook confirms it tracks users' mouse movements on screen
text: Facebook has revealed it tracks users' mouse movements on screen, claiming that the information is used to distinguish between humans and bots. It also collects information about operations and behaviours performed on the device, such as whether a window is foregrounded or backgrounded. The social media major emphasised that the data is collected to personalise its services and content.

headlines: PM Modi responds to Kohli's challenge, shares his fitness video
text: PM Narendra Modi has shared a video of him doing a series of morning exercises, days after he accepted Indian captain Virat Kohli's fitness challenge. In the video, PM Modi can be seen performing various yoga asanas, walking on tracks "inspired by 5 elements of nature" and doing breathing exercises. He further nominated Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy for the challenge.

headlines: More concerned about my stateâs fitness: Kâtaka CM on PMâs challenge
text: Responding to PM Narendra Modi's fitness challenge, Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy tweeted, "I am more concerned about development fitness of my state and seek your support for it." Adding that yoga and treadmill are part of his daily workout regime, he said, "I am honoured and thank you very much for the concern about my health."

headlines: Trump calls De Niro 'low IQ individual' over his remark
text: Slamming Robert De Niro for saying "F**k Trump" during the live TV broadcast of Tony Awards 2018, US President Donald Trump called the Oscar-winning Hollywood actor a "low IQ individual". "Robert De Niro has received [too] many shots to the head...I watched him last night and truly believe he may be punch-drunk. Wake up Punchy!" Trump tweeted.

headlines: Indian chess player pulls out of Iran event over headscarf rule
text: Indian chess player Soumya Swaminathan has asked to be withdrawn from the Asian Team Chess Championship being held in Iran over the compulsory headscarf rule in the country. Stating that the rule is in direct violation of her basic human rights, she said, "[S]urely there is no place for an enforceable religious dress code in Sports."

headlines: Woman gets â¹4L power bill, corrected to â¹134 post complaint
text: A woman in Hyderabad recently received an electricity bill of â¹3.81 lakh for the May-June period, stating that user consumed 40,059 units of power. However, a new bill was generated after the woman's complaint that amounted to â¹134 for consuming 63 units. Officials suspect the number of units might have been entered with an extra digit, which inflated the bill.

headlines: Bored reading newspaper in jail, need someone to chat: Abu Salem
text: Convicted gangster Abu Salem, who is lodged in a Mumbai jail, has complained to Portuguese embassy officials that he was bored of reading newspaper throughout the day and needed someone to chat with. Complaining about the food quality and sanitary conditions, Salem requested the authorities to shift him to some jail in Uttar Pradesh as his family is based there.

headlines: Press Council to decide if media can use the word 'Dalit'
text: The Information and Broadcasting Ministry officials on Tuesday said the Press Council of India will decide whether media can use the term 'Dalit' or not. This comes after the Bombay High Court had asked the ministry to consider the same. Earlier, the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment had advised ministries and states to use 'Scheduled Caste' instead of 'Dalit'.

headlines: Kerala government withdraws travel advisory over Nipah virus
text: The Kerala government has withdrawn the travel advisory issued after the outbreak of Nipah virus in the state. The advisory had asked people to avoid the districts of Kozhikode, Malappuram, Wayanad, and Kannur. "It is now safe to travel to any part of Kerala," a statement by Additional Chief Secretary of State Health and Family Welfare Department Rajeev Sadanandan said.

headlines: MP govt transfers money to students scoring 75% in Class 12
text: The Madhya Pradesh government has started transferring money online to students, who scored 75% and above in Class 12 exams organised by the state board this year, to purchase laptops. Around 88,000 students in the state are eligible to receive â¹25,000 each, under the scheme. The money has been transferred to over 22,000 eligible students till now.

headlines: George HW Bush becomes USA's longest living Prez at 94
text: George HW Bush turned 94 on Tuesday, officially becoming the longest living President in US history. The 41st President of the US celebrated his birthday at his home, eight days after being released from the hospital where he was treated for low blood pressure and fatigue. "My heart is full on the first day of my 95th year," Bush said.

headlines: Trump agreed to lift sanctions on North Korea: State media
text: Hailing the summit between leader Kim Jong-un and Donald Trump as the "meeting of the century", the North Korean state media has said that the US President agreed to lift sanctions imposed on the country. It further said that Trump and Kim invited each other to visit the US and North Korea, respectively, and both accepted the invitation.

headlines: Death penalty overturned for pregnant cow that crossed border
text: The Bulgarian government overturned the death sentence awarded to a pregnant cow that had crossed European Union borders without adequate paperwork. Penka the cow wandered away from her herd in Bulgaria and crossed into neighbouring Serbia last month. Bulgaria repealed the death penalty after receiving backlash from animal rights campaigners.

headlines: Was scared during scene where I had to yell at Rajini Sir: Huma
text: Huma Qureshi, who starred opposite Rajinikanth in 'Kaala', has said she was scared while shooting for a scene in which she had to yell at him. "That was the hardest [scene]...It was my sixth day at...shoot...I was trying to get my groove of things," she added. Huma further called the scene "powerful" and said she's glad it turned out well.

headlines: My biggest challenge was when I had my 1st panic attack: Zoya
text: Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar has said her biggest challenge was when she had her first panic attack at 27. "It's not something you can ignore. You can't sit around and get sucked into a rabbit hole," she added. Zoya further said, "I chose to get help immediately. It took a while to work things out but I'm fine now."

headlines: Janhvi, Kartik Aaryan to star in Bhansali's next: Report
text: Janhvi Kapoor and Kartik Aaryan will star opposite each other in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's next film, as per reports. Janhvi is set to make her Bollywood debut with Karan Johar's co-production 'Dhadak', which is an adaptation of Marathi film 'Sairat'. Kartik made his debut with 2011 film 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama' and was recently seen in 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety'.

headlines: Official poster of Akshay Kumar starrer 'Gold' released
text: The official poster of Akshay Kumar starrer 'Gold', a film on India's first Olympic medal as a free nation, was shared by the film's producer Farhan Akhtar on social media. The film will also mark the Bollywood debut of television actress Mouni Roy. Directed by Reema Kagti, 'Gold' is scheduled to release on August 15.

headlines: John Cena replaces Sylvester Stallone in Project X: Reports
text: WWE wrestler John Cena has replaced Hollywood actor Sylvester Stallone in Jackie Chan starrer 'Project X', as per reports. The action-thriller film, previously titled 'Ex-Baghdad', will be directed by 'Need for Speed' director Scott Waugh. 'Project X' will focus on a Chinese-operated oil refinery that is attacked by terrorists in the Middle East.

headlines: Nike drops Iran boot deal ahead of World Cup over US sanctions
text: Nike has halted the supply of boots to Iranian footballers ahead of the FIFA World Cup in Russia due to the sanctions imposed by the US following its withdrawal from the nuclear deal. Iranian football team coach Carlos Queiroz slammed the move saying, "We are only managers and footballers, and should not get involved in such matters."

headlines: Kohli receives BCCI's Best International Cricketer award
text: Indian men's cricket team captain Virat Kohli received the Polly Umrigar Award (Best International Cricketer) by the BCCI for his performances in the 2016-17 and 2017-18 seasons. In the women's category, Harmanpreet Kaur and Smriti Mandhana received the Best International Cricketer Award (Women) for the 2016-17 and 2017-2018 seasons respectively.

headlines: Grand Alliance sentiment in people, not just politics: Rahul
text: Addressing the media in Mumbai, Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said, "Mahagathbandhan (Grand Alliance) is a sentiment in people and not just politics." "Whole nation is united against RSS and BJP," he added. The Congress President further slammed the central government for "burdening" the common man by not bringing fuel under GST.

headlines: Elon Musk's Tesla cuts 9% of workforce to become profitable
text: Elon Musk-led Tesla has let go of approximately 9% of its workforce in an effort to reduce costs and become profitable, the billionaire said in an email to employees. "These cuts were almost entirely made from our salaried population and no production associates were included," he said. Earlier, Musk told employees that Tesla has been undertaking a thorough reorganisation.

headlines: Hindu group members held for trying to cleanse ghats after Iftar
text: Police have detained members of Vishwa Hindu Dal on Tuesday for trying to perform 'shuddhi-karan' (cleansing) of a Lucknow temple's ghats following an Iftar party organised on Sunday. "Our Sanatan Dharm says that our places of worship become impure with such non-Hindu activities and have to be purified," a member said. They later protested at the police station.

headlines: Railways to cut 11,000 redundant posts in FY19
text: The Railway Board has set a target of shedding 11,040 redundant posts in different railway zones in 2018-2019. The posts have been identified to be included in the "pool of surrendered posts", which have either been vacant for long or rendered redundant due to technological advancement. Last year, the number of such surrendered posts was around 10,000.

headlines: 17 killed, 35 injured after bus hits road divider in UP
text: Around 17 people were killed and 35 injured on Wednesday after the private bus they were travelling in rammed into a divider and overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri. The injured were rushed to a nearby hospital for immediate medical relief. Officials rushed to the spot after learning about the incident and cranes have reportedly been deployed to clear the road.

headlines: Great meaning in North Korea's denuclearisation: Japan PM
text: Praising North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has said, "There is great meaning in Chairman Kim's clearly confirming to US President Donald Trump the complete denuclearisation of the Korean Peninsula." He further said that resolving the issue of Japanese citizens abducted by North Korea would require the strong support of the US.

headlines: US reopens de facto Taiwan embassy amid tensions with China
text: The US on Tuesday reopened its de facto embassy in Taiwan, unveiling the structure after it underwent a $256-million renovation. This comes amid China's objections to the US' ties with Taiwan, which it considers as part of its territory. The US had cut diplomatic ties with Taiwan in 1979 to uphold the 'One China' policy.

headlines: Celebrate with Hyatt and save up to 30%*
text: Discover an inspiring stay at a Hyatt hotel as you explore the historic temples, beautiful beaches, and breath-taking architecture located across India. With world-class dining experiences, impeccable service and unique spa treatments, your stay will be nothing short of memorable.

headlines: 4 BSF personnel martyred in ceasefire violation by Pakistan
text: As many as four BSF personnel were martyred and three were injured in a ceasefire violation by Pakistan in J&K's Samba on Wednesday. Among the deceased were one Assistant Commandant, one Sub-Inspector and two jawans. Pakistani Rangers and BSF had recently agreed to ensure ceasefire along the International Border but Pakistan violated it by opening fire at the BSF party.

headlines: Eklavya cut thumb for guru, BJP cuts gurus: Rahul on PM Modi
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday tweeted, "Ekalavya cut off his right thumb because his Guru demanded it. In the BJP, they cut down their own Gurus." Addressing Congress workers in Mumbai, Rahul said that senior BJP leader LK Advani is PM Narendra Modi's "guru and mentor", adding that PM Modi does not treat Advani respectfully during official events.

headlines: Rahul put politics over ailing ex-PM Vajpayee: Cong rebel
text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi went to meet former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee at AIIMS, rebel Congress leader Shehzad Poonawalla said Rahul put politics over the ailing former PM. Shehzad tweeted, "Till 7:30pm or so AIIMS didn't want anybody to visit Vajpayee ji due to tests...Rahul Gandhi knew this but went anyway as political points needed to be scored!"

headlines: Independent candidates' seats declining in every poll: Study
text: The seat and vote share of independent candidates are declining with every election, an analysis of the EC data has revealed. Presently, 11 state assemblies have the lowest-ever seat-share of the independent candidates, while 22 state assemblies have the lowest vote-share of the independent candidates ever recorded. The current Lok Sabha has the second-lowest number of independent candidates.

headlines: Peon's art selected as cover of Railways' achievement book
text: The Railways Ministry has selected an artwork created by a 35-year-old peon for the cover of a booklet listing the ministry's achievements in the past four years. The artwork, which depicts Mahatma Gandhi stepping down from a train, was the third entry sent by Shyam Sundar. "The Railway Minister shook my hand and said the painting was beautiful," Shyam said.

headlines: 47% Indian Muslims fear false terrorism accusations: Study
text: Over 47% Muslims in India fear that they will be falsely accused in terrorism cases, a survey carried out by NGO Common Cause has revealed. Out of the 15,563 respondents across 22 states, 26% Muslims believe that police discriminate on the basis of religion. The survey also found that 44% of Indians feared being beaten up by the police.

headlines: 10 people killed due to lightning strikes in West Bengal
text: At least 10 people died and several others were injured on Tuesday due to lightning strikes in several districts of West Bengal. While four people died in Bankura district, three died in Hooghly district, the police said. A woman and her daughter were killed by lightning when they were working in a field in a village.

headlines: Nothing wrong in naming hotel after caste, rules Madras HC
text: There is nothing wrong in naming a hotel after a caste and the owner's right to do so is guaranteed under the Constitution, a Madras High Court bench held on Tuesday. Quashing criminal proceedings against members of fringe outfit Periyar Dravida Kazhagam, the court said that it was not as if untouchability was being practised at the hotel.

headlines: Trump could cancel N Korea deal before getting home: Iran
text: Warning North Korea against trusting the US, Iran on Tuesday said that US President Donald Trump could cancel the deal before returning home. The US has undermined agreements and has unilaterally withdrawn from them, Iran said referring to US withdrawal from the 2015 nuclear deal. The US and North Korea had signed an agreement to denuclearise the Korean Peninsula.

headlines: India, Pakistan should emulate US, N Korea: Shehbaz Sharif
text: Following the summit between US and North Korea, former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's brother Shehbaz Sharif has said India and Pakistan could take steps similar to those taken by the US and North Korea. "There is no reason why Pakistan and India cannot do the same," he added. Shehbaz further said the countries should begin with the issue of Kashmir.

headlines: Real Madrid's new coach once called Messi best player ever
text: Newly appointed Real Madrid manager Julen Lopetegui earlier rated Barcelona's Lionel Messi better than Cristiano Ronaldo, saying, "He's the best player ever, I agree." His comment came in reference to Spain and Argentina's chances at 2018 FIFA World Cup. The 51-year-old coach, who previously played for both Real Madrid and Barcelona, will manage the Spanish team at the world tournament.

headlines: 'Our business is our business' dialogue seeped into my home: Daisy
text: Daisy Shah has said that her dialogue "Our business is our business, none of your business" from 'Race 3' has seeped into her house as her sister uses the dialogue while having a normal conversation.
