"It's really fun when people give their own version to my dialogue," she added. Daisy's dialogue had gone viral after the release of the trailer.

headlines: Video shows Neymar throwing eggs at teammate on his birthday
text: Brazilian forward Neymar and teammates pelted eggs and flour at Philippe Coutinho, who celebrated his 26th birthday on Tuesday. Brazilian World Cup squad members mobbed Coutinho, who was sitting down on the training ground, and later threw water on him as well. Left-back Marcelo was also seen smashing an egg on the world's most expensive player Neymar.

headlines: 6 players leave Ronaldo's ex-club after fans attacked team
text: As many as six players of Cristiano Ronaldo's ex-club Sporting CP have terminated their contracts a month after a group of fans attacked the team for failing to qualify for next season's Champions League. They claimed 'just cause' in dissociating themselves from the club. Around 50 fans had attacked the team, injuring a player and destroying the club's changing room.

headlines: Visited ailing ex-PM Vajpayee as I'm Congress soldier: Rahul
text: Addressing Congress workers in Maharashtra, party chief Rahul Gandhi said that he visited former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee, who has been admitted to AIIMS, as he was a "soldier of the Congress". He added that PM Narendra Modi does not respect his 'guru' LK Advani, adding that Congress has given more respect to Advani than PM Modi.

headlines: Masjids, Madrasas not teaching real Islam in J&K: BJP leader
text: After two policemen were killed and six personnel were injured in attacks by militants in Jammu and Kashmir, Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha Vice President Aijaz Hussain said that Masjids and Madrasas are not teaching real Islam. "If killing innocent people is jihad, better change maulvis of masjids and teachers in madrasas. We need introspection," he wrote in a Facebook post.

headlines: Lowest form of politics: BJP as Rahul says PM insults Advani
text: After Congress president Rahul Gandhi accused PM Narendra Modi of insulting his "guru" LK Advani, BJP spokesperson Anil Baluni said, "The Congress president is practising the lowest form of politics." Stating that the country saw how Congress treated former President Pranab Mukherjee, Baluni added, "The country is watching how the president of the oldest political party is behaving."

headlines: Railways builds engine that can work in 12 inches water
text: The Central Railway has built a waterproof engine that will work even in 12 inches of water, as opposed to the current engine that cannot work in over four inches of water. While the current engine can't function if water enters its motor traction at four inches, the new engine has sealed motors, preventing water from entering the traction.

headlines: 60 families homeless as fire breaks out in Chennai
text: As many as 60 families were left homeless after a fire broke out in Chennai's Ennore on Monday. Police suspect that the fire was started in the kitchen of one of the thatched huts. The fire was controlled within two hours after four fire tenders were rushed to the site. No casualties were reported in the incident.

headlines: Centre mulls linking driving licences with Aadhaar
text: The Centre is in talks over linking driving licences with Aadhaar numbers, Union Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said on Tuesday, adding that this will help in identifying a drunk driver in case he/she escapes. "I am in conversation with Union Minister Nitin Gadkari to link Aadhaar card with (driving) licence...A person can change name not his/her fingerprints," he said.

headlines: Assamese students body holds prayer meet for lynched youth
text: The All Assamese Students Association held a prayer meeting in New Delhi for the two youth who were lynched in Assam's Karbi Anglong last week. The two were lynched after locals thought they were child traffickers due to a message that had been circulating over WhatsApp. "We...insist for immediate punishment of the perpetrators," a member of the association said.

headlines: Police arrest 6th suspect in journo Gauri's murder case
text: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the murder of journalist Gauri Lankesh on Tuesday arrested a 26-year-old suspect. A total of six suspects have been arrested over the murder, which occurred outside Lankesh's Bengaluru residence in September 2017. Earlier, an accused in the case claimed that he was asked to arrange bullets by another accused as Lankesh was "anti-Hindu".

headlines: Haryana raises age limit for entry in govt service to 42 yrs
text: The Haryana government has raised the upper age limit of entry into government service from 40 to 42 years, an official spokesperson said on Tuesday. The spokesperson said a circular to this effect was addressed to all administrative secretaries, heads of departments, chief administrators and managing directors of all boards, among others.

headlines: Secular writer dragged out of shop, shot dead in Bangladesh
text: A 60-year-old writer and publisher was dragged out of a shop and shot dead by unidentified assailants in Bangladesh's Munshiganj district on Monday. Shahzahan Bachchu had received death threats from extremist groups for promoting secularism in the Muslim-majority nation. Several writers and activists have been murdered in Bangladesh in last three years in attacks by suspected Islamist militants.

headlines: Rana Kapoor reappointed as Yes Bank CEO for another 3 years
text: Yes Bank shareholders on Tuesday approved the reappointment of Rana Kapoor as the Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) for another three-year term starting September 1. His new tenure now has to be approved by the Reserve Bank of India. Notably, Rana Kapoor has been at the helm of the private sector lender since 2004.

headlines: No RBI nominee should be on bank boards: Governor Urjit Patel
text: No RBI nominee should be on the boards of public sector banks to avoid "any conflict of interest", Governor Urjit Patel said while briefing a parliamentary panel on Tuesday. He also said the primary responsibility to contain bank frauds rests with the boards. Patel further told that the RBI has "inadequate" control over state-run banks and asked for more powers.

headlines: Who is ex-Barcelona player named new boss of Real Madrid?
text: Current Spain manager Julen Lopetegui, who has represented both Barcelona and Real Madrid as a player, will join Real Madrid as head coach on a three-year deal after the World Cup. The 51-year-old former goalkeeper managed Spain at Under-19, Under-20 and Under-21 levels before moving to Porto and Spain. The Spanish senior team hasn't lost a single match under Lopetegui.

headlines: FB says it logs IP addresses where users logged into account
text: In its follow up answers for the questions asked during data scandal testimony, Facebook has said, it "automatically logs IP addresses where a user has logged into their Facebook account." The social media major further said it collects posts, photos, or other content a user has liked. Information regarding dates, times, and titles of advertisements clicked is also collected.

headlines: Samsung challenges $539 million verdict in Apple patent case
text: Samsung has filed a motion with a US court challenging a verdict which asked the company to pay Apple $539 million for copying patented iPhone designs. The company asked the court to either dismiss the judgment or retry the case in which the damages were decided. In the case, first filed in 2011, Samsung previously paid $399 million to Apple.

headlines: He will also run away: Rahul Gandhi takes a dig at PM Modi
text: In an apparent reference to PM Narendra Modi, Congress President Rahul Gandhi today said, "Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi ran away with â¹35,000 crore... and even Lalit Modi decamped... But he (PM Modi) says nothing... He will also run away." He added, "There is fear in his voice... But I am not scared as I am a soldier of truth."

headlines: Assam's lone Muslim BJPâMLAâgets threat letter with bullets
text: Assam's lone Muslim BJP MLA Aminul Haque Laskar has allegedly received a letter threatening him with dire consequences unless he resigns from the party in 15 days. Two bullets were taped to the letter written in red ink. The 52-year-old said, "It accused me of siding with the BJP despite being a Muslim" and "not opposing the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill-2016".

headlines: 40 arrested for spreading rumours that led to Assam lynching
text: As many as 40 people have been arrested for spreading social media rumours on child-lifting gangs that had led to a mob lynching two people in Assam's Karbi Anglong. Further, the police released over 70 people after counselling and making them delete their "objectionable" posts. Around 25 were arrested for the lynching while many others are on the run.

headlines: 1,000 evacuated as heavy rains trigger flood in Mizoram
text: Around 1,000 people were evacuated from Mizoram's Lunglei and Aizawl districts on Tuesday after monsoon rains triggered a flood in the state. All schools in the state will remain closed on Wednesday as over 180 houses were submerged during the flood. Landslides triggered by the flood blocked several roads and left the affected areas inaccessible.

headlines: Tharoor shares fake letter on university rejecting Einstein
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has tweeted a fake rejection letter from the University of Bern to Albert Einstein. The letter rejected Einstein's application for a doctorate, claiming that his space-time theory was "more artistic than actual physics". Tharoor later said, "It might still help people by recalling Einstein's early rejection for a doctorate, even if this letter itself is fake".

headlines: Trump suggests US may end military exercises with S Korea
text: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday suggested stopping the US-South Korea joint military exercises and announced the end of "provocative and inappropriate" war games on the Korean Peninsula. "The war games are expensive, we pay for majority of them," Trump added. The US and South Korea have been conducting the exercises in an apparent show of strength against North Korea.

headlines: Anyone can make war, only courageous can make peace: Trump
text: Hailing North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's commitment to denuclearise the Korean Peninsula, US President Donald Trump said, "Anyone can make war, but only the most courageous can make peace." Calling the summit "one of the greatest moments," Trump added, "We are prepared for the new history. We are ready to write new chapters."

headlines: Man kills 4 kids after holding them hostage for 20 hrs in US
text: Four children held hostage by a 35-year-old in an apartment in Florida, US, have been found dead along with the suspect. The standoff between the suspect and police, which lasted for over 20 hours, began when police responded to a domestic violence call. Police said two children are believed to be that of the suspect and two are his girlfriend's.

headlines: My character in 'Sui Dhaaga' is inspired by Suppandi: Varun
text: Actor Varun Dhawan, who will be playing the role of 'Mauji' in the film 'Sui Dhaaga', has said that his character in the film is inspired by the comic character 'Suppandi'. Varun will portray a tailor and an office peon in the film which reportedly centres around the 'Make in India' campaign. The film also stars actress Anushka Sharma.

headlines: Great, we're talking about masturbation: Karan on 'Veere...'
text: Karan Johar, while talking about the masturbation scene in 'Veere Di Wedding', has said that it's a great thing that people have started talking about masturbation. "We are talking about this in an open forum suddenly," he added. He further said, "More power to those girls who accepted these roles and more power to the filmmaker who made this film."

headlines: Horrible but personal choice: Rose on chef Anthony's suicide
text: Addressing celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain's choice to commit suicide, actress-activist Rose McGowan wrote a letter saying, "Suicide is a horrible choice, but it is that person's choice." "Many of these people who lost their friend are wanting to lash out and blame. You must not sink to that level," she added. She further wrote that Anthony's depression won.

headlines: Demo for 'Spiderman' with Rhino, Electro as rivals unveiled
text: The gameplay demo of 'Spiderman' was unveiled by Sony PlayStation at the E3 2018. The clip shows five of the Marvel character's main enemies including Electro, Rhino and Scorpion, confronting him during a prison break. The PS4 game, which is scheduled to release on September 7, showcases a mix of hand-to-hand brawling, acrobatics, and web slinging among other 'Spiderman' skills.

headlines: Elephants play football to raise awareness against gambling
text: Elephants played a football match to raise awareness against illegal gambling in Thailand's Ayutthaya on Tuesday. As many as nine elephants, painted with the flags of nations competing in the upcoming FIFA World Cup, played against school students in a 15-minute match. Organisers said they wanted to show students that World Cup was more about enjoying the game than betting.

headlines: Russian artists make stone mosaics of Messi and Salah for WC
text: Russian artists have created stone mosaics of Argentina captain Lionel Messi and Egypt's Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah. The mosaics will be up for display in Kazan, Russia where six World Cup games will be played. Messi piled up 34 goals for Barcelona in La Liga, while Salah ended his Premier League campaign for Liverpool with 32 goals this season.

headlines: Bugs, bones in hockey players' food, complains chief coach
text: Indian hockey team's chief coach Harendra Singh has drawn attention to the quality of food being provided to the Indian team's players at the SAI centre, with bones and insects being found in their food. In his letter to the Hockey India, Singh wrote about the excessive oil and fat, and the kitchen utensils used to prepare food being "unhealthy".

headlines: Brock Lesnar modern era's longest reigning WWE Champion
text: WWE Universal Champion Brock Lesnar has officially become the longest reigning champion in modern era, surpassing CM Punk's record of 434 days. Lesnar had won the belt at Wrestlemania 33 on April 3, 2017. The reign is considered to be the sixth-longest of all time in WWE, with all the longer terms coming before 2000.

headlines: Inzi telling me his son was my fan a big deal: Sachin
text: Sachin Tendulkar has revealed ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq once introduced his son to him saying, "He's my son but he is your fan." "The kind of rivalry we have...Inzi was captaining Pakistan then...to say something like this to a player from the other team...it takes a lot," Sachin added. "He was very calm...he never got angry," Sachin further said about Inzamam.

headlines: PM using L-G as pawn to stop us from working for poor: AAP
text: Addressing a press conference on Tuesday, AAP leader Sanjay Singh claimed Prime Minister Narendra Modi was using Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal as a pawn to stop the government from working for the poor. Further alleging the PM is trying to hinder Delhi's progress, Singh added, "The installation of CCTV cameras is not yet fulfilled because it hasn't been sanctioned."

headlines: Odisha MP Jay Panda who quit BJD resigns from Lok Sabha
text: Two weeks after he resigned from the Biju Janata Dal, Lok Sabha MP from Kendrapara, Baijayant Jay Panda on Tuesday tendered his resignation as a member of the Lok Sabha. Panda, who was suspended from BJD for 'anti-party activities' in January, had quit the party in May saying he was unhappy as BJD members did not attend his father's funeral.

headlines: BJP body files complaint on Shehla Rashid for Gadkari tweet
text: BJP's youth wing has filed a complaint with the police against JNU student leader Shehla Rashid for her tweet saying that RSS and Union Minister Nitin Gadkari were planning to assassinate PM Narendra Modi. The "unfounded allegations" promotes insecurity and uncertainty, the complaint said. Rashid had earlier clarified that the tweet was sarcastic after Gadkari threatened to sue her.

headlines: Music platform Saavn's profit rose 3 times to â¹3.2cr in FY17
text: Music streaming platform Saavn's profit rose 3 times to â¹3.22 crore in the fiscal year ending December 2017, compared to â¹1.08 crore the previous year. It posted a 16.2% rise in revenue at â¹45.9 crore for the same period in comparison to â¹39.6 crore in FY16, according to filings. Also, Saavn recorded â¹41.15 crore expenses in FY17.

headlines: Former Apple executive hired as Uber's brand officer quits
text: Uber's Chief Brand Officer Bozoma Saint John, who previously worked as Apple's marketing head, is leaving the company after one year. Uber said she will be joining the entertainment company Endeavor as Chief Marketing Officer. Thanking Bozoma for her contribution, Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshashi said, "Endeavor is lucky to have her... excited to watch her work in her new role."

headlines: Kerala to launch program for detecting defects in newborns
text: The Kerala government has announced plans to launch the Comprehensive Newborn Screening programme to detect birth defects in babies born in government health facilities within 48 hours of birth. Stating that the infant mortality rates in the state are low, officials said the scheme aims at improving the quality of life for the surviving children.

headlines: Malaysia to reopen embassy in North Korea
text: Malaysian PM Mahathir Mohamad has announced that Malaysia will reopen its embassy in North Korea a year after closing it amid diplomatic tensions with the reclusive regime. Relations between the two nations deteriorated after North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's half-brother, Kim Jong-nam, was assassinated in Malaysia last year. Malaysia had also banned its citizens from traveling to North Korea.

headlines: Deepika posts message on depression after Bourdain's suicide
text: Deepika Padukone shared a message on Instagram about depression by her organisation, The Live Love Laugh Foundation, citing recent suicides of celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain and designer Kate Spade. "Kate...Anthony...to the outside world...'had it all'...But would we ask someone who 'had it all' how they met with an accident," read the message. It added, "Like..other illnesses, depression does not discriminate."

headlines: Bigg Boss contestant Armaan arrested for assaulting girlfriend
text: Actor and ex-Bigg Boss contestant Armaan Kohli has been arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly assaulting his live-in partner Neeru Randhawa. He had reportedly been hiding at a friend's farmhouse in Lonavla. Neeru had earlier alleged, "He...banged my head against the floor...The wound was so deep that I had to undergo a surgery."

headlines: Our team meeting before IPL final lasted 5 seconds: Dhoni
text: CSK captain MS Dhoni has revealed that the team meeting before the final of the IPL 2018 lasted about five seconds. Dhoni said, "Fleming was like, 'Go, get it boys', and it got over." "Everybody's role and responsibilities were very clear. You need to address something if it really needs to be addressed. You know, there's no point," said Dhoni.

headlines: Spiritual leader who shot himself pressurised by govt: Cong
text: Congress leader Manak Agarwal has claimed that self-styled spiritual leader Bhaiyyuji Maharaj, who shot himself dead on Tuesday, was under "mental pressure" as BJP-led Madhya Pradesh government forced him to "accept privileges". Bhaiyyu Maharaj refused to support the government, he added. Earlier this year, Bhaiyyu Maharaj had refused the government's offer of ministerial level rank.

headlines: Uber driver asks lesbian couple to get out of car over kiss
text: A video shows an Uber driver asking a lesbian couple to get out of the car for kissing in the US. In the video, filmed by the couple, the driver is seen shouting, "It's illegal... You can't do this in the car". Further, one of the girls claimed the driver "grabbed" her arm trying to prevent her from filming him.

headlines: I am leaving, too much stressed out: Bhaiyyuji Maharaj in suicide note
text: The police on Tuesday recovered a suicide note from Madhya Pradesh's spiritual leader Bhaiyyuji Maharaj's residence, which reads, "I am leaving too much stressed out, fed up." The 50-year-old, who was recently offered a ministerial post in the state government, shot himself dead in Indore. The police are investigating the reason behind his mental tension mentioned in the suicide note.

headlines: Bad hair summit, tweets user on Trump-Kim meet
text: Reacting to the meeting between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, a Twitter user wrote, "Tiny little dictator with a funny haircut meets Kim Jong-un." While one user tweeted, "The two worst haircuts in history are about to trade hair care tips," another wrote, "From Little Rocket Man to 'Very Talented Man'...the arc of Trump-Kim relationship."

headlines: US govt website wrongly shows Singapore as part of Malaysia
text: The US State Department website mistakenly showed Singapore as part of Malaysia. A transcript of a press briefing given by US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo described the briefing's venue as "JW Marriott, Singapore, Malaysia". Singapore was previously a part of Malaysia and had separated from the east Asian country in 1965.

headlines: N Korea sanctions to remain in place: Trump after summit
text: After concluding the historic summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, US President Donald Trump said that the sanctions against North Korea will remain in place. Trump added that the sanctions would stay until nuclear weapons were no longer a factor influencing their bilateral relations. Both the nations signed an agreement on Tuesday to denuclearise North Korea completely.

headlines: Govt mulls selling 100% stake in Air India after zero bids
text: After the government received zero bids for its 76% stake sale in Air India, it is now considering selling 100% of the company. "There's no fixed objective that government should have 24%. It can be re-examined," Economic Affairs Secretary SC Garg has said. The national carrier was offered along with nearly â¹33,400 crore of its debt.

headlines: Retail Inflation rises to 4-month high of 4.87% in May
text: India's retail inflation accelerated to a four-month high of 4.87% in May driven by higher fuel prices, government data showed on Tuesday. May was the seventh straight month in which inflation was higher than RBI's medium-term target of 4%. The RBI last week raised repo rate for the first time since 2014, by 25 bps to 6.25%, citing inflation concerns.

headlines: Shoemaker Christian Louboutin wins EU battle over red soles
text: French luxury shoemaker Christian Louboutin has won a European Union court battle over trademarking his signature red-soled shoes. In 2010, Louboutin sued rival Dutch shoemaker Van Haren in the Netherlands after it sold similar shoes. The legal dispute centred on whether Louboutin's trademark involved a shape or a colour as companies cannot trademark common shapes of products under EU law.

headlines: Religare sues Lakshmi Vilas Bank to recover â¹800 cr deposits
text: A Religare Enterprises' arm has sued a Delhi branch of Lakshmi Vikas Bank to recover fixed deposits worth nearly â¹800 crore. The lender had invoked the deposits to recover loans to Religare founders Malvinder Singh and Shivinder Singh, who are facing allegations of financial irregularities. "As per legal opinion received...the adjustment of deposits against loans are lawful," the bank said.

headlines: Mouni to star opposite John in 'Romeo Akbar Walter': Report
text: Actress Mouni Roy, who is set to make her Bollywood debut opposite Akshay Kumar in 'Gold', will star opposite John Abraham in his upcoming film 'Romeo, Akbar Walter', as per reports. The film is a spy thriller. John will reportedly be seen in around eight looks and will play characters ranging from a 26-year-old to an 85-year-old.

headlines: I would love to do a Hollywood film: Kajol
text: Actress Kajol has said that she would love to do a Hollywood film. "There's no particular genre in mind, and it depends whether the script appeals to me or not," the actress added. She further said that she would ask the same questions that she would for a Hindi film before choosing a project.

headlines: Everything is still not fair for outsiders: Taapsee Pannu
text: Actress Taapsee Pannu has said that "outsiders" are getting a decent amount of opportunities in the film industry, but she added, "We're still not at the level where we can say everything is fair and square." She further said, "We're at least working towards it and things have improved from what they were."

headlines: I froze, couldn't react: Nushrat on being molested by fan
text: 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety' actress Nushrat Bharucha was recently posing with fans when one of them allegedly molested her as he wrapped his arms around her waist, which made her freeze and she couldn't react. She said she happily obliges when people approach her for selfies. However, she added, "I don't want people to misunderstand my friendly nature."

headlines: Didn't lose place to a normal player, it was Dhoni: Karthik
text: Indian wicketkeeper-batsman Dinesh Karthik, who last played a Test match in 2010, has said that he was not good enough in presence of a special player like MS Dhoni. "(I) didn't lose my place to some normal cricketer...(Dhoni) was special...I respect him for that," he added. Karthik is a part of India's 15-member squad for the Test against Afghanistan.

headlines: This happens when food isn't on time: Chhetri on viral video
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri jokingly said he got the idea of the video, wherein he urged fans to support them, one morning when "he didn't receive breakfast on time". "Actually I am ageing. That's why you get...weird...thoughts," he added. "Had my PR team got a whiff of it, they wouldn't have allowed me to post," he further said.

headlines: Banks plan to send banking communications on WhatsApp
text: At least five major banks including ICICI Bank and Axis Bank are either reportedly testing or are in a pilot stage of sending banking communications through WhatsApp. These communications will include notifications on ATM cash withdrawal details and point of sales (PoS) transactions. Banks will have to integrate with WhatsApp and appear as a verified account for these communications.

headlines: China's Xiaomi could be twice as expensive as Apple: Report
text: China's Xiaomi could be twice as expensive as Apple in terms of market value, according to Morgan Stanley. Due to Xiaomi's faster growth trajectory, it is expected to trade at around 27 times to 34 times the forecasts for 2019 adjusted earnings. That's roughly the double of Apple's valuation of 14.5 times the estimated 2019 adjusted earnings, according to Bloomberg.

headlines: Twitter Founder's payments firm to pay $2.2mn to settle suit
text: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey-led payments company Square has agreed to pay $2.2 million to settle a class-action lawsuit involving its on-demand food delivery service, Caviar. The lawsuit claimed the company collected gratuities from customers but didn't pass them on to the delivery drivers. The court will make its decision to approve or deny the settlement in late September this year.

headlines: No Congress MLA will go to BJP: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
text: Former Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah on Tuesday maintained there was no discontent within Congress now over the denial of ministerial berths and added, "how much ever BJP tries to entice our MLAs, no one will go." This comes after reports indicated growing discontent among newly elected Congress lawmakers who were left out during the June 6 cabinet expansion.

headlines: Railway employee arrested for molesting French woman in WB
text: Railway employee Arshad Hussain has been arrested from West Bengal for allegedly sexually molesting a French national. Hussain had offered his train seat to a French lady who was standing at the door. He showed her the empty seat and allegedly molested her, following which fellow passengers caught him and handed him over to the Railway Police Force.

headlines: Kiran Bedi to host vegetarian iftar party for 100 people
text: Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Kiran Bedi has tweeted that she will host an iftar party at her official residence Raj Nivas on Tuesday, adding that only vegetarian food will be served owing to the house's policy. She further said 100 people have been invited to the party, including "Muslim Public Officials, women and few others seniors of the community."

headlines: Every rape alarming; death penalty is appropriate: Govt
text: Union Women and Child Development Minister Maneka Gandhi has said that every rape is alarming and death penalty is an appropriate punishment. "There is an argument that provision for the death penalty will lead to more killings after rapes and that could be valid. But there is no study one way or the other," she added.

headlines: No communication from US regulator on Chanda Kochhar: ICICI
text: The ICICI Bank on Monday clarified that it has not received any communication from the US markets regulator in relation to the allegations against CEO Chanda Kochhar. The regulator reportedly received complaints from institutional investors in the US to probe into the matter related to disclosure issues. Kochhar is facing conflict of interest allegations in the â¹3,250-crore Videocon loan case.

headlines: Nigerian man buries father in new â¹60-lakh BMW to honour him
text: A Nigerian man honoured his father by burying him in a brand-new BMW car worth over â¹60 lakh, reports said. A picture showing the man's father being purportedly buried in the car in Nigeria's Anambra state went viral on social media. Reacting to it, a social media user wrote, "Insanity and selfishness regardless of that fact that is your cash."

headlines: Salman, rumoured girlfriend Iulia to sing for film: Reports
text: Salman Khan and his rumoured girlfriend Iulia Vantur will sing a romantic track for the upcoming film 'Yamla Pagla Deewana Phir Se', the third instalment in the 'Yamla Pagla Deewana' franchise, as per reports. The song will reportedly be picturised on Bobby Deol and Kriti Kharbanda. 'Yamla Pagla Deewana Phir Se' will also star Sunny Deol and Dharmendra.

headlines: IPL-like Kerala Boat Race League to be held in August
text: Kerala's tourism department has given its clearance to hold IPL-style boat races, including the Nehru Trophy boat race and the President's Trophy Boat Race in Kollam. The two month-long boat-racing league will make 75% local participation mandatory, and limit the participation of oarsmen from other states and abroad to 25%. The races will be held in five districts.

headlines: Mark didn't know British firm retained data until 2018: FB
text: In its follow up answers for the questions asked during data scandal testimony, Facebook has claimed CEO Mark Zuckerberg wasn't aware that British firm Cambridge Analytica may not have deleted users' data until March 2018. Facebook earlier claimed Analytica assured it that its users' data was deleted in 2015. Analytica was accused of illegally harvesting data of 87 million users.

headlines: China job site 51job's Co-founder becomes a billionaire
text: Rick Yan, the Co-founder and CEO of China's top job site 51job, has become a billionaire after amassing a $1.5 billion fortune, according to Bloomberg. Yan, who has never appeared on an international wealth ranking before, owns 20.8% of the Shanghai-based company. Yan, 55, was an initial investor in 51job and became the company's CEO in 2000.

headlines: Uber launches 5MB low-data Lite app, to pilot first in India
text: Uber has launched a low-data Lite app which is less than 5MB in size, compared to 39MB for its regular app on Android devices. Uber Lite app has a minimal design with a 300-millisecond response time and will function even with poor internet speeds. The app is piloting first in India and will come to other countries later this year.

headlines: K'taka HC scraps panel comprising Sachin Bansal, Azim Premji
text: The Karnataka High Court has scrapped the Bengaluru Vision Group comprising corporate heads including Wipro Chairman Azim Premji, and Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal. The order noted the Group was only an advisory committee and that they already had a recognised body responsible for the city's development. The Bengaluru Vision Group, set up in April 2016, had 23 members.

headlines: Who was spiritual leader Bhaiyyuji Maharaj, who shot himself dead?
text: Self-styled spiritual leader Bhaiyyuji Maharaj, whose real name was Uday Singh Deshmukh, was a former model and was offered a Madhya Pradesh ministerial post this year. He mediated between Anna Hazare and the UPA government during Lokpal bill agitation in 2011. The 50-year-old, who shot himself dead today, travelled in a Mercedes and was rarely seen without his Rolex watch.

headlines: Telangana man steals police vehicle to meet sick wife
text: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Telangana for allegedly stealing a police vehicle to meet his sick wife. Tirupathi Lingaraju told the driver and gunner present in the car that he had been asked to bring it down to the police station. They realised their mistake only after Inspector Praveen Kumar returned to the parking area.

headlines: Make me and Kim look handsome, thin: Trump to photographers
text: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday joked that the photographers should make him and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un look "handsome and thin". Trump made the comment during a working lunch with Kim Jong-un in Singapore. At the conclusion of the historic summit, Trump said he and the North Korean leader will meet again "many times".

headlines: Will invite Kim to White House at appropriate time: Trump
text: In a press conference after meeting Kim Jong-un, US President Donald Trump said he will invite the North Korean leader to the White House at the appropriate time. Trump further said that he would also like to travel to North Korea. The US leader also told the media that "he trusts Kim and Kim trusts him".

headlines: Government puts IRCTC disinvestment plan on hold
text: The disinvestment of Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has been deferred as the government wants a better valuation. "There is huge data...and that's not getting captured in the valuation. We are trying to see how we can utilise that," Railway Minister Piyush Goyal said. IRCTC, which offers railway ticketing and e-catering services, has over 3 crore registered users.

headlines: Govt forms panel to look into jobs data calculation
text: The government has set up a committee headed by former Chief Statistician of India TCA Anant to bring in transparency in the jobs data calculation. The panel will look into the limitations of the Quarterly Employment Survey (QES) and submit its report. The government said the survey effectively captures the employment size of only about 5% of the total workforce.

headlines: Actor takes legal action against Sri Reddy over false claims
text: Telugu actor and Bigg Boss Telugu host Nani has initiated legal action against Sri Reddy after she claimed he sexually exploited her and made sure she couldn't be part of Bigg Boss 2 Telugu. The actor wrote in a statement, "The fact that someone can randomly pick up names who are soft targets and spread such absolute baseless nonsense...disturbs me!"

headlines: Wonder Woman actress Gal Gadot to star with Dwayne in film
text: Gal Gadot, known for portraying the superhero character 'Wonder Woman', will star with Dwayne Johnson in the upcoming action-comedy film 'Red Notice'. The film, which will reportedly star another lead male actor, is scheduled to release on June 12, 2020. Gadot had earlier worked with Dwayne in 'Fast Five', 'Fast & Furious 6' and 'Furious 7'.

headlines: Salman's 'Race 3' satellite rights sold for â¹130cr: Reports
text: The satellite rights of Salman Khan starrer 'Race 3' have been sold for an amount of â¹130 crore, as per reports. It is reportedly the highest ever price at which a Bollywood film's satellite rights have been sold. Reports added that the earlier record was held by Aamir Khan starrer 'Dangal', whose satellite rights were sold for â¹75 crore.

headlines: Would love to go back to playing Doctor Strange: Cumberbatch
text: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch, who played lead role in 2016 superhero film 'Doctor Strange', has said that he would love to go back into that role. He added, "I am bits of dust at the moment as far as I understand (referring to the ending of 'Avengers: Infinity War'). So you really have to ask Kevin Feige (President of Marvel Studios)."

headlines: CBFC receives complaint against Sanju on toilet leakage scene
text: A complaint has been filed with the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) against 'Sanju' by an activist over a scene which shows the toilet overflowing in a jail's barrack. The activist said, "This...scene will leave a bad impression about the jails and jails authorities of India." He threatened to approach the court if CBFC doesn't take any action.

headlines: Nobody wanted Rashid in IPL team in 2016: Ex-Afghan coach
text: Former Afghanistan cricket team coach Lalchand Rajput has revealed he had asked IPL franchises to pick Rashid Khan in 2016 but they refused. Rajput added that he had told Gambhir and Sehwag that "talented" Rashid would be a good choice for their respective franchises but they refused citing enough spinners. Notably, 19-year-old Rashid is currently the top-ranked T20I bowler.

headlines: Flipkart's Myntra opens data centre in Silicon Valley
text: Flipkart-owned fashion retailer Myntra has opened a data centre in the Silicon Valley, CTO Jeyandran Venugopal has confirmed. Adding that Myntra has found "some right talent in the valley", Venugopal said that the Head of Data Labs and a senior researcher have already been hired. Myntra is also hiring deep domain experts from India for the project.

headlines: Worker testifies Tesla stopped him from organising unions
text: A Tesla employee organising a union was asked by a company supervisor to leave the factory after handing out pro-union pamphlets, the worker has claimed at the US National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) hearing. An NLRB attorney claimed Tesla asked workers to sign confidentiality agreements, preventing them from publicly discussing work conditions. However, the company has denied the allegations.

headlines: Shop owner stabs man for paying â¹15-bill with â¹500 note
text: A shop owner in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur allegedly stabbed a customer for trying to pay for a â¹15-chocolate bar with a â¹500 note. The victim only had a â¹10 and a â¹500 note and offered to pay â¹5 later or return the chocolate. However, the shop owner stabbed him after abusing him for disturbing work at an auspicious time, reports said.

headlines: Woman delivers baby on road as ambulance arrives late
text: An Udaipur woman was forced to deliver a baby on a road with the help of some women living nearby as the ambulance failed to reach on time, her husband alleged. However, Udaipur Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr Sanjiv Tak refuted the allegation, saying it reached quickly while the couple had ignored their advice to visit the hospital earlier.

headlines: Mother, daughter thrashed with hockey sticks by 6 men in UP
text: A woman and her daughter were beaten up with hockey sticks by six men in Lucknow on Monday night, the police said. The woman, who runs a parlour, was on her way home with her daughter when they were attacked by men on two motorcycles. The attackers ran away when passersby saw them thrashing the two women.

headlines: 1st bullet train may be delayed over fruit growers protests
text: India's first bullet train project between Ahmedabad-Mumbai may be delayed due to protests by fruit growers against government efforts to acquire their land. A 108-km stretch of their land forms one-fifth of the corridor. The protestors argued that the $17-billion bullet train, partially funded by Japan, is "wasteful" and the money could instead be utilised to improve existing rail infrastructure.

headlines: Kejriwal's sit-in is a mockery of democracy: Delhi BJP Prez
text: Delhi BJP President Manoj Tiwari today called the sit-in by CM Arvind Kejriwal at the Lieutenant Governor's office a "mockery of democracy." While Tiwari tweeted, "No Work only Drama", Opposition Leader Vijender Gupta called Kejriwal's sit-in a way to "shirk work." Among other demands, the AAP leaders are pressing for a direction to IAS officers to end their "strike".

headlines: First case of polio reported in Venezuela in 30 years
text: A case of polio has been reported in Venezuela for the first time in nearly 30 years, the Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO) has claimed. A 2-year-old child in the Delta Amacuro state was diagnosed with polio due to lack of vaccination, it added. Venezuela has witnessed a decline in healthcare services amid the economic crisis in the country.

headlines: No evidence found against Kundra in Bitcoin scam yet: Police
text: The Maharashtra Police has said that no concrete evidence has been found so far against Shilpa Shetty's husband and businessman Raj Kundra in the â¹2,000 crore Bitcoin scam case. The prime accused in the case, Amit Bhardwaj, had been arrested in April for allegedly duping over 8,000 people. The police also said the Enforcement Directorate was investigating the case separately.

headlines: Video of an old woman working as a typist in MP goes viral
text: A video of an elderly woman working as a Hindi typist in front of the collector office in Madhya Pradesh is going viral. In the video, the woman can be seen typing documents and drafts for people on a typewriter with an impressive speed. Her video has garnered over 5,600 likes and over 3,500 retweets on micro-blogging site Twitter.

headlines: CM Manohar Parrikar to return to Goa this week: Reports
text: Goa Chief Minister Manohar Parrikar, who is currently receiving treatment for a pancreatic ailment in the US, will return to the state this week, reports said. An official said the CMO was making arrangements for his return. However, the BJP has denied the reports saying, "As far as we know...some tests are expected to be conducted later this month."

headlines: Kejriwal's claim of officers on strike is baseless: IAS body
text: The IAS Association has said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's allegations that the officers are on strike is "unwarranted and baseless" and added that the Budget would not have been passed otherwise. However, the association admitted the officers are boycotting meetings called by ministers because they have not been assured of their safety after the attack on Chief Secretary Anshu Prakash.

headlines: Leading newspaper publishes ad for 'homosexuality healing'
text: One of the leading Indian newspapers has been slammed for publishing an ad in its classifieds section, that claimed cosmic healing of homosexuality among men and women. Responding to the ad, the newspaper's Executive Editor tweeted, "We will find out how this slipped in...there should be zero discrimination." The controversial ad was also shared by equal rights activist Harish Iyer.

headlines: Settle rape case with 5 shoe strikes: Panchayat to victim
text: A panchayat in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura asked a rape-attempt victim to settle the case by slapping the accused five times with her slipper. Dissatisfied with the punishment, the victim's son lodged a police complaint against the accused, their neighbour, on Sunday. A hunt is on to nab the accused, who is absconding, the police said.

headlines: Who are the running bodyguards protecting Kim Jong-un?
text: The bodyguards protecting North Korean leader Kim Jong-un are all handpicked from Korean People's Army on the basis of their looks, fitness and martial art skills. The height of these guards must be equivalent to Kim Jong-un as per rules. They are among the only people allowed to carry loaded guns near the Supreme Leader.

headlines: Woman sues NASA to keep Moon dust 'gifted by Neil Armstrong'
text: A US-based woman has pre-emptively sued NASA for legal ownership of a Moon dust sample, which she claims was given to her father by his close friend Neil Armstrong. The lawsuit was filed in advance as the space agency states all lunar material belong to the US government. The lady also holds a note apparently addressed to her by Armstrong.

headlines: India's petrol, diesel demand rise to record highs in May
text: India's domestic sales for petrol and diesel rose to record highs in May, data from the Oil Ministry showed. Petrol consumption for the month climbed to 2.46 million tonnes while diesel sales soared to 7.55 million tonnes. The overall fuel consumption in May totalled 18.72 million tonnes compared to 18.1 million tonnes in the same month last year.

headlines: Kabaddi champions to train Kangana for film: Reports
text: Actress Kangana Ranaut, who will be a part of Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari's directorial, will be trained by Kabaddi champions for the film, as per reports. The actress is said to have allotted fifteen days in the month of August to prepare and understand the sport. Kangana will reportedly undergo a physical transformation for the role.

headlines: Fun video went wrong: Sara on nude video shared accidentally
text: Television actress Sara Khan, whose sister Arya mistakenly posted a video showing Sara in a bathtub, has said the video was made in fun when both of them were in the tub, while adding, "Everything just went wrong." "She was [a bit] drunk and then we were just having fun. She deleted it in no time," Sara further said.

headlines: Wasn't selected for Tamil Nadu because of long hair: Vijay
text: Cricketer Murali Vijay has revealed he wasn't selected for Tamil Nadu when he was 21 because of long hair. "Some selectors thought it was too much of style for a cricketer to have," he said. He added that he told his club teammates that MS Dhoni is playing for India with long hair and he can't even play for TN.

headlines: 'Condolences' to Bedi, Chauhan: Gambhir on Saini's selection
text: Former Delhi captain Gautam Gambhir took a dig at former Indian cricketers Bishan Singh Bedi and Chetan Chauhan after Delhi fast bowler Navdeep Saini received his maiden Test call-up. "My 'condolences' to DDCA members Bedi...Chauhan...black armbands are available in Bangalore too," Gambhir wrote. Bedi and Chauhan had objected to Saini's selection in Delhi's Ranji team, terming him an 'outsider'.

headlines: 2013 Game of Year 'Last of Us' sequel's gameplay revealed
text: Sony released a new gameplay trailer to the action-adventure game, 'Last of Us Part II' at the E3 2018 on Monday. The game, a sequel to the multiple 2013 Game of the Year awards winner 'Last of Us', features cannibalistic creatures infected by a mutated strain of fungus. Last of Us Part II will be available on PlayStation 4 platform.

headlines: Was nicknamed 'Monk' after I drank Old Monk: Murali Vijay
text: Indian cricketer Murali Vijay has revealed that his friends gave him the nickname 'Monk' after he drank Old Monk rum for the first time during an Under-16 tour. Vijay revealed he could not stop himself from drinking it despite being 16 years old as the weather in Delhi was "too cold". "No one should drink at that age," he added.

headlines: WhatsApp says it shares limited payments data with Facebook
text: Highlighting that its parent company Facebook does not use its users' payment information for commercial purposes, WhatsApp admitted it shares limited data with the social media major. Facebook "simply helps pass the necessary payment information to the bank partner and NPCI," WhatsApp said on its website. The data shared includes users' phone numbers, payment amount, and registration information.

headlines: Paytm Founder complains of his iPhone X not restarting
text: Paytm Founder Vijay Shekar Sharma on Monday took to Twitter to complain about his iPhone X, which he claimed did not restart despite multiple attempts. "All, multiple combos of hold key press, haven't worked to restart it !" Sharma tweeted. He also posted a video of the phone, the screen of which was blank with just the 'loading' symbol.

headlines: Fight is over ideology; will win: Rahul on RSS defamation case
text: After a court framed charges against Congress President Rahul Gandhi in a defamation case filed by an RSS activist, Rahul said, "They have been putting different cases on me, but my fight is based on ideology." "I will fight against them and we will win," he added. The case was filed over his statement blaming RSS for Mahatma Gandhi's assassination.

headlines: PrÃ¸hbtd gets $8mn in largest funding for cannabis media firm
text: US-based cannabis marketing platform PrÃ¸hbtd Media has raised $8 million in the single largest funding round for a media-related company in the cannabis industry. It was led by Serruya Private Equity, The Delavaco Group, and Cresco Capital. PrÃ¸hbtd helps cannabis companies connect with consumers through branding, marketing, product development, and video production.

headlines: 7.74 lakh Mercedes cars have unauthorised software: Germany
text: Germany's Transport Ministry on Monday said that 7.74 lakh Mercedes-Benz vehicles were found to contain unauthorized software defeat devices in Europe. Germany also ordered Mercedes-Benz' parent Daimler to recall 2,38,000 cars in the country. Daimler has said it will work on removing the software and cooperate with authorities, the authorities said.

headlines: TV host Rannvijay Singh invests in Gurugram's Whatâs Up Life
text: Gurugram-based online local lifestyle startup What's Up Life has raised an undisclosed amount of funding from television host Rannvijay Singh Singha. Commenting on it, Rannvijay, who also became its brand ambassador, said he likes the way it is reaching out to people. Founded in 2015, the startup is an editorially curated discovery app for dining out, party, leisure and events.

headlines: New sperm structure found maybe linked to infertility: Study
text: A US-based study found a new centriole, a sperm structure which may contribute to research on infertility, miscarriages and birth defects. The centriole is the only essential cellular structure contributed solely by the father for building the cell's skeleton and antennae known as cilia. Researchers found that a father donates not one, but two centrioles through the sperm during fertilisation.

headlines: Villagers set forest on fire after leopard kills 7-year-old
text: Villagers in Uttarakhand's Bageshwar set a forest on fire on Monday after a leopard killed a seven-year-old boy. A crowd of over a thousand people gathered to demand the leopard be shot. The half-eaten body of the child, who was attacked when he went out to urinate, was found nearly 250 metres from his house in the forest, officials said.

headlines: Lifeguard molests 8-yr-old girl at Chandigarh swimming pool
text: A 26-year-old lifeguard has been arrested for allegedly molesting an eight-year-old girl at a swimming-cum-gym academy in Chandigarh. The victim was training inside the pool at 8:30 pm on Sunday when the accused touched her inappropriately, according to police. People near the pool saw the act and raised an alarm, following which the victim's family called the police.

headlines: B'luru woman updates FB status on holiday, finds home robbed
text: The house of a woman in Bengaluru's RT Nagar was robbed allegedly after she posted the details of her trip to Tamil Nadu on her Facebook status. The woman returned from her trip to find jewellery worth â¹5 lakh, â¹57,000 in cash and a two-wheeler missing. Police said she suspects the burglars committed the robbery after noticing her Facebook status.

headlines: BJP worker arrested for criticising CPI(M) MLA on Facebook
text: BJP worker S Sooraj has been arrested for allegedly posting a derogatory comment against CPI(M) MLA Veena George. Sooraj stated in a Facebook post, "Dear MLA madam it would be helpful if you can address the issue (of waterlogging at a bus stand) after beauty parlours." George claimed Sooraj tried to incite communal hatred and insult her as a woman.

headlines: Taliban kills Afghan governor ignoring ceasefire
text: The Taliban militant group killed Abdurrahman Panah, the Governor of Afghanistan's Kohistanat district, ignoring the eight-day ceasefire announced by the Afghan government from Tuesday. Accepting the government's ceasefire offer, the militant group had said it would defend itself against any attacks. Taliban's three-day ceasefire will begin on Friday.

headlines: MP spiritual leader Bhaiyyuji Maharaj shoots himself dead
text: Madhya Pradesh spiritual leader Bhaiyyuji Maharaj was admitted to an Indore hospital after shooting himself on Tuesday. The 50-year-old, who had been awarded the rank of minister by the MP government, passed away while being treated. He retired from public life in 2016, opposing the "commercialisation of the spiritual environment" and reportedly rejected the offer of the ministerial post.

headlines: Trump, Kim sign agreement to completely denuclearise N Korea
text: US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un have signed an agreement to completely denuclearise the east Asian nation in exchange for security guarantees from the US. "We are both very honoured to sign the document," Trump said. The two leaders began the Singapore summit with a 40-minute one-on-one talk followed by bilateral discussions with their top aides.

headlines: Choose long term care with Aegon Life's iTerm insurance plan
text: With lowest premiums and high coverage, Aegon Life Insurance provides the best option for you with the Aegon Life iTerm Insurance plan. With additional benefits against accidents and illnesses and life cover for 100 years, this plan guarantees your family's financial protection at the lowest charges. Changes can be made in alignment with the changing needs of your family.

headlines: Why did India not play 1950 FIFA World Cup despite qualification?
text: Indian football team had qualified for 1950 FIFA World Cup in Brazil but didn't participate because the All India Football Federation considered Olympics to be more prestigious. Brazil also offered to sponsor their travel but the AIFF didn't see it fit to send the team halfway around the world via ship, citing "disagreements over team selection and insufficient practice time".

headlines: Cong denies it didn't invite ex-Prez Pranab to Iftar party
text: The Congress has denied reports that it did not invite senior party leader and former President Pranab Mukherjee to its Iftar party scheduled for Wednesday at Delhi's Taj Mahal Hotel. "Congress President (Rahul Gandhi) has extended an invite to Sh Pranab Mukherjee and he has graciously accepted," party spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said.

headlines: What is the history behind Coca-Cola and McDonald's?
text: Coca-Cola was invented in 1886 by an American pharmacist John S Pemberton, who took a sample of his drink to Jacobs' Pharmacy that placed it on sale as a soda fountain drink. While McDonald's was founded by Dick and Mac McDonald, who in 1948 introduced a 'Speedee Service' concept featuring 15-cent hamburgers and started franchising their concept after its success.

headlines: 'Baby Miracle' born with eyes shut, missing brain dies aged 10
text: A 10-year-old who was born with part of her brain missing, her eyes sealed shut and severe disabilities has died. Known as Baby Miracle, Miracletina Julie Nanai was born in island nation of Samoa. Her father Mikaele said she was so severely disabled that doctors predicted she would only live for a few hours and wanted to let her die.

headlines: Petition against HC judge over foul remarks against lawyers
text: A case of criminal contempt was filed in Uttarakhand High Court on Tuesday against Justice Lokpal Singh over allegedly making derogatory remarks against other lawyers and a former judge. The petition has bee filed by lawyer CK Sharma who, along with his colleague, was reportedly humiliated by Justice Singh in an open court and threatened with a jail sentence.

headlines: Girl live-streams her suicide on FB over tiff with boyfriend
text: An 18-year-old girl in West Bengal committed suicide by hanging herself and streamed it live on Facebook allegedly after she had a fight with her boyfriend. The girl's family claimed that she had a fight with her boyfriend over chat, wherein she had threatened to kill herself. Police have taken the boy into custody for allegedly abetting suicide.

headlines: 'Satsangs' made mandatory in Rajasthan schools
text: Rajasthan education department has directed all schools in the state to hold 'satsangs' or sermons by saints on third Saturday of every month as part of co-curricular activities for students. It also stated that on first Saturday, biographies of well-renowned personalities should be read out to the students while moral value stories should be narrated to them on second Saturday.

headlines: Video: Dennis Rodman cries while discussing Trump-Kim summit
text: Former US basketball player Dennis Rodman cried as he spoke about the summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. "I said to everybody, the door will open...I knew things were going to change," he stated. Rodman, who once called Kim his "friend for life", has met the North Korean leader three times since 2013.

headlines: Pak SC orders to unblock Pervez Musharraf's ID, passport
text: Pakistan's Supreme Court has ordered authorities to unblock the national identity card and passport of former President Pervez Musharraf to pave way for his return to the country. Musharraf, who currently resides in Dubai, has been summoned by the apex court. He is facing charges of treason for subverting the Constitution after he imposed an emergency in Pakistan in 2007.

headlines: Kim, you have b*lls: Rishi on North Korean leader meeting Trump
text: Rishi Kapoor, while tweeting about North Korean leader Kim Jong-un meeting US President Donald Trump in Singapore, wrote, "Salute to a 33-year-old Korean getting an American President (71 years) meeting. Kim, you have b*lls!" He also referred to Trump's alleged affair with pornstar Stormy Daniels in the tweet. "USA, when you elect a Clown, expect a Circus," he further wrote.

headlines: Does feminism mean women masturbating onscreen: CBFC member
text: Vani Tripathi Tikoo, a member of the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC), while slamming 'Veere Di Wedding', said, "Is this what feminism and female empowerment mean to some filmmakers? To show women...swearing and masturbating?" "It's nothing but a perverse view of gender equality," she added. Vani further denied reports that the board made cuts and modifications to the film.

headlines: Priyanka attends rumoured boyfriend Nick's cousin's wedding
text: Priyanka Chopra accompanied her rumoured boyfriend, American singer Nick Jonas to his cousin's wedding in Atlantic City, New Jersey. The two were seen arriving arm-in-arm for the wedding on Saturday. The actress reportedly also met Nick's family following the wedding. Priyanka and Nick were first linked up when they attended the Met Gala together last year.

headlines: Spanish goalkeeper demands public apology from Spain PM
text: Spanish national team goalkeeper David de Gea has demanded a public apology from Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez for commenting on the 27-year-old's alleged involvement in a sexual assault case two years ago. An investigation, that was launched into the sexual assault case, found the allegations leveled against the Manchester United goalkeeper to be false.

headlines: Asthma drug reverses memory loss in mice: Study
text: American researchers have discovered that an asthma drug can remove toxic build-ups of a protein in mice brain and reverse dementia, which affects over 50 million people worldwide. Trials on mice engineered to have the disease revealed that the drug 'zileuton' helped them improve in memory tests and reverse the accumulation of tau proteins, related to Alzheimer's disease.

headlines: NASA rover trapped in dust storm on Mars, losing power
text: NASA's Opportunity rover, which landed on Mars in 2004, has been weathering a dust storm since June 3. The storm is blocking sunlight from reaching its solar panels, which charge its battery needed to power the rover's signal transmitters and heaters, NASA officials said. Opportunity was originally planned for a three-month mission but has survived for over 14 years.

headlines: Shashi Tharoor mocks Trump-Kim summit with a cartoon
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday mocked the summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un by sharing a cartoon of the two leaders. In the cartoon, Kim is seen saying, "I will destroy America," to which Trump responds, "No way, that is my job. I don't want another Asian stealing an American job."

headlines: Robbers open fire, loot â¹5 lakh from Amritsar power station
text: Two armed robbers on Monday opened fire at a state-owned power station in Punjab's Amritsar and stole nearly â¹5 lakh. Punjab State Power officials said policemen standing at the spot were "mute spectators" because of which the robbers escaped easily. However, the police said they had tried to chase the robbers but they ran away on their motorbike.

headlines: Official interference in spiritual matters on rise: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA H Raja on Monday said that the interference by officials in spiritual matters in temples was on the rise. Stressing the need to retrieve temples from the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department, he alleged that the officials were not doing enough to enhance the revenue of the temples under their purview.

headlines: Not guilty: Rahul Gandhi in defamation case by RSS worker
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday pleaded not guilty as a magistrate court in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi framed charges against him in a criminal defamation case filed by Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker Rajesh Kunte. Gandhi allegedly said at a public rally in 2014 that "RSS people had killed Mahatma Gandhi". Kunte said the remark was aimed at slandering RSS' reputation.

headlines: BMC to fine up to â¹10,000 for using plastic bag from June 23
text: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation can fine people up to â¹10,000 if they are seen carrying a plastic bag or taking one from a vendor from June 23. The civic body will deploy inspectors for markets, malls and supervise street hawkers who will levy a fine on shopkeepers if they are seen handing out plastic bags or other one-time use plastic materials.

headlines: Man threatens to infect businessman with HIV to extort â¹3 cr
text: After the arrest of a businessman in an alleged gangrape case, a Delhi lounge owner also arrested in the case reportedly threatened to infect him with HIV to extort â¹3 crore from his brother. The businessman was arrested along with the world's cheapest smartphone 'Freedom 251' maker Ringing Bells' Founder Mohit Goel on Sunday in connection with the gangrape case.

headlines: Vegetable seller wins â¹1cr lottery, finds out ticket is fake
text: A vegetable seller in Maharashtra's Nalasopara has filed a police complaint after he won â¹1.1 crore in state lottery but later found out that his ticket was fake. When he went to the State Lottery Department, Suhas Kadam was told that there were three claimants for the same. Kadam said he feels embarrassed whenever people congratulate him for the lottery.

headlines: Video: Trump shows his 'Beast' limousine to Kim after summit
text: US President Donald Trump showed the interior of his limousine, nicknamed 'The Beast', to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un during the summit between the two leaders. As Trump and Kim walked towards the car, a secret service agent opened the door while the North Korean leader peeked inside to look at the interior. Kim also brought his limousine to Singapore.

headlines: Ivanka Trump tweets a 'Chinese proverb' that doesn't exist
text: US President Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump posted a proverb ahead of the summit between her father and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, wrongly claiming it to be a Chinese proverb. She posted, "Those who say it cannot be done, should not interrupt those doing it -Chinese proverb." Several users pointed out the mistake on Twitter and Chinese social media.

headlines: Kim very talented man, loves his country very much: Trump
text: After signing an unspecified agreement with the North Korean leader, US President Donald Trump said, "Kim Jong-un is a very talented man and he loves his country very much." Adding that he has formed a special bond with Kim, Trump said, "We will meet again, we will meet many times." The two leaders vowed to leave behind the past.

headlines: Kim meet went better than anybody could have expected: Trump
text: Describing his meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, US President Donald Trump said, "It went better than anybody could have expected." Trump further said that "a lot of progress" has been made, adding that the two sides are expected to sign an agreement. However, it is unclear what document the two leaders would be signing.

headlines: 2 Indian kids to be official ball carriers at FIFA World Cup
text: Two Indian kids will be the official ball carriers at the upcoming FIFA World Cup 2018 in Russia. One of them will carry the ball in Belgium vs Panama on June 18, while the other will be performing the duty in the Brazil vs Costa Rica match on June 22. The two kids have been selected out of 1,600 children.

headlines: New rules go into effect in US, end Obama-era net neutrality
text: The US on Monday enforced 'Restoring Internet Freedom Order', replacing Obama-era 'net neutrality' rules, which had barred internet service providers from charging more for certain content to grant equal access to the internet. "The order replaces unnecessary, heavy-handed regulations dating back to 1934," the US said. The critics of the move have claimed it will make the internet less accessible.

headlines: Delhi CM Kejriwal sleeps on sofa at L-G house in protest
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday held a sit-in protest for over 12 hours at Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal's residence and slept on a sofa in the waiting room. Kejriwal and his colleagues refused to leave demanding Baijal take action against IAS officers boycotting government meetings. Kejriwal also demanded that the L-G approve the scheme for doorstep delivery of ration.

headlines: Chinese electric car startup Byton raises $500 million
text: Chinese electric car startup Byton has raised $500 million in a Series B funding round to develop smart, connected cars. Investors including FAW Group, Tus-Holdings, and CATL also participated in the funding round. The startup aims to begin delivering cars to Chinese customers by the end of next year and in the US by 2020.

headlines: Railways launches 'Menu on Rails' app to check food rates
text: Railway Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday launched 'Menu on Rails' application for passengers that displays various food items served on different trains and stations and their rates. The menu has been divided into beverages, breakfast, meals, and Ã  la carte categories and also caters to diabetic patients. The app will also display pre-booked meals for some trains.

headlines: UK assures cooperation on Mallya, Nirav Modi's extradition
text: The United Kingdom has assured India full cooperation in the extradition process of fraud-accused Nirav Modi and liquor baron Vijay Mallya, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said after meeting with British Minister for Countering Extremism Baroness Williams. "UK should not be a country where anti-India activities can be conducted without any kind of restriction or check," Rijiju added.

headlines: 27 B'luru joints shut for playing live music without licence
text: Police have ordered the shutdown of 27 establishments in Bengaluru for allowing live music on their premises without a licence. While these establishments have been booked, notices have been served to several others. This comes after the Supreme Court in January this year upheld a 2005 Karnataka High Court order regarding licences for live performances.

headlines: Women who ate my garden's mangoes bore sons: Hindu activist
text: Addressing people in Nashik, Bhima Koregaon riots accused Sambhaji Bhide said, "Mangoes are powerful and nutritious. Some women who ate mangoes of my garden have given birth to sons." "Till now, 180 childless couples took the fruit from me and 150 of them have had children," he added. Meanwhile, activists are demanding action against Bhide for spreading superstitions.

headlines: Ex-PM Vajpayee suffering from urinary tract infection: AIIMS
text: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Delhi has said that former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee is suffering from a urinary tract infection and is being closely monitored. The hospital said the condition of the 93-year-old former PM is stable, adding that he has undergone several tests. PM Narendra Modi spent around an hour with Vajpayee at the hospital.

headlines: We should let her enjoy: Pooja on sister Alia dating Ranbir
text: Pooja Bhatt, on being asked about her half-sister Alia Bhatt's relationship with Ranbir Kapoor, said, "We should just let that young girl be and enjoy her life." "Because I think she is doing her job of entertaining India and the world really well," she added. Pooja further said, "What Alia does or doesn't do in her personal life is...her problem."

headlines: Ronaldo steps out of national team bus to meet young fan
text: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo stepped out of the national team bus to meet a crying boy, who thought his chance to meet Ronaldo before he departed for World Cup was lost. Ronaldo posed for photographs with him and signed his Portugal shirt. The 33-year-old Real Madrid star also embraced and kissed the boy before rejoining his teammates in the bus.

headlines: AAP MP to file PIL over PM Modi's attendance in Parliament
text: After rebel AAP leader Kapil Mishra was allowed to file a petition over Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's attendance in the Assembly, party MP Sanjay Singh said he will file a PIL seeking details of PM Narendra Modi's attendance in the Parliament. "Despite appeal by the entire opposition, (PM) Narendra Modi does not come to Parliament," Singh said.

headlines: Google funding proves we're in right direction: Fynd Founder
text: Mumbai-based online fashion startup Fynd's Co-founder Harsh Shah has said that Google's investment has reaffirmed the fact that they "are going in the right direction". It definitely "provides a big boost in confidence", he added. Earlier in March, Fynd had raised an undisclosed amount of funding in a Series C round which was led by Google.

headlines: Tiny diamonds behind mysterious glow in Milky Way: Study
text: Astronomers have suggested nano-diamonds around new stars as a possible source of microwave radiation across the Milky Way. Astronomers estimate around 1-2% of the total carbon in these proto-planetary disks goes into forming nanodiamonds. It could help make better models of microwave radiation from the galaxy, which needs to be removed to study afterglow of the Big Bang, they said.

headlines: Love my profession more now: Nurse who survived Nipah virus
text: 19-year-old student nurse M Ajanya, who is the first victim to come out of the hospital after the outbreak of Nipah virus in Kerala, said that she loves her profession more now. "I would like to devote my life nursing back many lives," she added. Ajanya had contracted the virus after being posted at the medical college hospital's casualty wing.

headlines: Rahul gets trolled for saying Coca-Cola owner sold shikanji
text: Reacting to Congress President Rahul Gandhi's statement that the man who started the Coca-Cola company used to sell shikanji in the US, users on Twitter mocked him with #AccordingtoRahulGandhi. While one user said that according to Rahul, Steve Jobs sold apples during his childhood, another wrote that Elon Musk used to make Diwali rockets before launching SpaceX rockets to Jupiter.

headlines: Hospital to pay â¹15 lakh to woman 20 yrs after son's death
text: A Chennai consumer forum has directed a hospital to pay â¹15 lakh to a woman, whose son died almost 20 years ago due to negligence by the hospital. A 28-year-old patient, who suffered from an ear ailment, was taken for operation without the consent of his family. He died around a month later due to complications caused by the surgery.

headlines: 245 couples tie knot in govt-organised mass marriage
text: Around 245 couples from the Hindu and Christian communities tied the knot at a mass marriage ceremony organised by the Ministry of Women and Child Development in Chhattisgarh on Monday. The ceremony was organised under CM Raman Singh's Samuhik Kanya Vivah scheme. In March, over 1,100 couples got married in Jagdalpur under the scheme.

headlines: 2 fixed parking slots per home to be allotted in Delhi
text: Residents in south Delhi will soon be allotted two fixed parking spots per house and issued permit stickers as part of a project to decongest Delhi. Houses with more than two cars will have to park their extra vehicles at paid parking spots or make their own arrangement. Vehicles will be towed if they aren't parked in the designated spaces.

headlines: People know why trains delayed, what we inherited: Goyal
text: Railway Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday said that passengers know that trains are getting delayed because of maintenance of tracks, which was "due for decades". Slamming the previous UPA government for not considering the Rail Safety Fund announced by former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee for ten years, Goyal said, "Everyone knows what we have received in inheritance."

headlines: Chapter dedicated to a woman railway cop in Maharashtra book
text: A chapter on Sub-Inspector Rekha Mishra attached to Railway Protection Force in Mumbai has been added in a Maharashtra State Board's Class 10 textbook for rescuing hundreds of destitute, missing, kidnapped or runaway children. "Her being part of the chapter in the textbook will definitely inspire the new generations," a senior railway official said after felicitating Mishra for her achievements.

headlines: BJP workers conduct havan after Vajpayee admitted to AIIMS
text: BJP workers in Kanpur conducted a havan for former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee, who was admitted to AIIMS Delhi on Monday. "He has been diagnosed with a urinary tract infection for which appropriate treatment has been closely monitored and treated by a team of doctors," the hospital said. The treatment is being monitored by AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria.

headlines: US woman arrested for driving children in dog kennels
text: A Tennessee woman has been arrested after a video showing her releasing her two granddaughters from dog kennels in the back of her car went viral. The 62-year-old has been charged with two counts of child endangerment. The children alleged that they were told to sit in the kennels because there was no room in the back of the car.

headlines: Trump becomes 1st sitting US Prez to meet a N Korean leader
text: Donald Trump on Tuesday became the first sitting US President to meet a North Korean leader after he shook hands with Kim Jong-un at the Capella Hotel on Singapore's Sentosa island. "We will have a great relationship, I have no doubt," Trump said. Meanwhile, Kim said it "wasn't easy to get here", adding that the two leaders overcame many obstacles.

headlines: There will be challenges ahead but will work with Trump: Kim
text: During his meeting with Donald Trump, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un said, "There will be challenges ahead but will work with the US President." Adding that the meeting is good for peace, Kim said, "We overcame all kinds of skepticism and speculations about this summit." Meanwhile, the US President said, "Working together, we will get it taken care of."

headlines: People will think of this as a form of fantasy: Kim on Trump meet
text: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, during his historic summit with US President Donald Trump, said, "Many people in the world will think of this as a form of fantasy from a science fiction movie." "I think the entire world is watching this moment," Kim was heard telling Trump. The two leaders were joined by their advisers following a one-on-one meeting.

headlines: Goldman predicts Brazil World Cup win after 10L simulations
text: After running 10 lakh simulations of the tournament, US bank Goldman Sachs has predicted that Brazil will lift the 2018 FIFA World Cup. It used machine learning to run 2 lakh models, using data on individual players and team performance. Goldman had also predicted Brazil's win in 2014 but the country lost 1-7 to eventual champions Germany in the semi-final.

headlines: Gave identical support to both Trump, Clinton campaigns: FB
text: In its follow up answers for the questions asked during data scandal testimony, Facebook has claimed it offered "identical support" to both Trump and Clinton campaigns. "Everyone had access to the same tools," Facebook added. Earlier it was revealed that its users' data was used to influence last US Presidential elections where current President Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton contested.

headlines: Willing to sacrifice seats for BSP in 2019 polls: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav has announced that they are willing to sacrifice some seats for Bahujan Samaj Party to defeat BJP in the 2019 general elections. BSP chief Mayawati said they will enter a pre-election alliance only if they are offered a respectable number of seats. The two parties defeated BJP in four Uttar Pradesh bypolls this year.

headlines: Farmers' protest a political stunt by Opposition: Gujarat CM
text: Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani has alleged that the farmers' protest in the state was a "political stunt" by opposition parties ahead of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. Warning farmers against being misled, Rupani added, "The Opposition remembers farmers' problems only when elections are near." This comes after several Congress leaders were detained for spilling milk on roads during farmer protests.

headlines: Lake evaporates in 2 hours as Hawaii volcano lava hits it
text: Lava from Hawaii's Kilauea volcano, which is erupting for over 40 days, vaporised the largest freshwater lake on Big Island on June 2, the US Geological Survey has revealed. Within just two hours, the molten rock had boiled away the 400-year-old lake and filled the entire area, which was 200 feet deep at some places, USGS added.

headlines: India tells UK not to provide safe haven to wanted criminals
text: After the UK government confirmed PNB fraud accused Nirav Modi's presence in the country, MoS for Home Affairs Kiren Rijiju said the UK should not be viewed as a safe haven for wanted criminals from other countries. Raising the issue of fugitives like Nirav and liquor baron Vijay Mallya, Rijiju said India expects UK's cooperation in bringing back wanted men.

headlines: Chinese man climbs 5 floors to rescue child hanging from balcony
