text: A video of a Chinese man climbing five floors of a building to save a two-year-old hanging from from a window has gone viral. The man, identified as Zhang Xin, had climbed the building without any protective gear. The boy's head was reportedly stuck in the grill after his grandmother left him alone to go shopping.

headlines: S'pore summit beginning of 'long process' for peace: S Korea
text: While watching the meeting between North Korean leader Kim Jong-un and US President Donald Trump, South Korean President Moon Jae-in said the summit is only the beginning of a "long process" of re-establishing peace on the Korean Peninsula. He further said the North Korean nuclear issue cannot be resolved in one meeting, adding he hopes the summit will be successful.

headlines: People will remember me even if I've 5 scenes in film: Taapsee
text: Taapsee Pannu, while talking about the length of her roles in films, said, "Even if I have five scenes in the film, I know the audience will remember me after coming out from the theatre." "That much confidence I need to have in myself as an actor. It is not necessary to be hero all the time," she added.

headlines: Whenever I am offered a biopic, I get scared: Varun Dhawan
text: Actor Varun Dhawan has said whenever he is offered a biopic, he gets scared. "Most of the times, I don't want to do one. I approach even my fictional characters as biopic characters," he added. Varun further said if he has to do a biography on someone, it would be one on his father, filmmaker David Dhawan.

headlines: Pooja Bhatt slams threats to Priyanka over 'Quantico' row
text: Pooja Bhatt has slammed people threatening to ban Priyanka Chopra's films over a 'Quantico' episode which portrayed Indians as "terrorists" who were trying to frame Pakistan for trying to bomb Manhattan in New York. Pooja tweeted that Indians claim Priyanka's achievements as their own when she makes a mark for herself internationally but make her apologise for someone else's show.

headlines: Trailer of 'Shadow of The Tomb Raider' released
text: The first trailer for the new sequel to the Tomb Raider franchise, Shadow of The Tomb Raider, was released at the E3 Expo. The game, which is scheduled to be released on September 14, 2018, continues the story of Lara Croft, who must "master a deadly jungle, overcome terrifying tombs" to save the world from a Mayan apocalypse.

headlines: Polish defender's reflex kick saves reporter from injury
text: Polish defender Michal Pazdan saved a television reporter from injury by a falling lamp with his reflex kick during an interview. The reporter was unaware of the falling lamp that came crashing down due to the windy conditions. The reporter later shared a clip of the incident on Twitter and called Pazdan her "hero" in the caption.

headlines: Messi fan tea stall owner paints house in Argentina colours
text: Shib Shankar Patra, a 53-year-old tea stall owner in Kolkata, painted his entire building in Argentina's national team's colours after he was told by a travel agent that his savings are not enough to watch Argentina at World Cup. "I don't smoke or drink. I have only one addiction and that is Lionel Messi and Argentina," Patra said.

headlines: There's something about 'Ducks' & Gambhirs: Gautam Gambhir
text: Ex-DD captain Gautam Gambhir trolled himself by drawing a comparison between 'Ducks' and 'Gambhirs'. The 36-year-old shared a picture of his daughter hugging a person dressed as Donald Duck and placed a picture with the caption "IPL 2014: 3 consecutive Ducks and then the title!!!!" alongside it. "(T)here's something about 'Ducks' & Gambhirs, they seem inseparable," he jokingly wrote.

headlines: Ronda Rousey to be the first female Hall of Famer in UFC
text: American fighter Ronda Rousey will become the first female MMA fighter to be inducted into the Ultimate Fighting Championship Hall of Fame, the UFC announced on Sunday. "There would be no women in UFC without Ronda Rousey," UFC President said in the statement. Rousey had a 12-2 win-loss record, winning 11 of them within the first round of the fight.

headlines: India can't be run by only 3 men; Opp'n will unite: Rahul
text: PM Narendra Modi, BJP President Amit Shah, and RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat will soon understand that India cannot be run by only three people, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said on Monday. Adding that the Opposition will unite within a year to demonstrate the strength of India to the three leaders, he said India will be run by its people.

headlines: Rename Taj Mahal as Ram or Krishna Mahal: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Surendra Singh has said that the Taj Mahal should be renamed 'Ram Mahal' or 'Krishna Mahal', adding, "If I am to be heard it should be called 'Rashtrabhakt Mahal'." He said that monuments built by Muslim rulers should not be destroyed, adding, "Someone has erected buildings, using our land's resources, that belongs to India."

headlines: MLA mocks Digvijaya's tweet, inspects bridge with binoculars
text: Madhya Pradesh MLA Vishwas Sarang on Monday inspected an under-construction railway overbridge with binoculars after Congress leader Digvijaya Singh posted an image of a damaged metro pillar from Pakistan and claimed it to be from Bhopal. Digvijaya later apologised for the tweet, adding that he did not verify the image after receiving it from a friend.

headlines: Info Edge writes off â¹186 cr in startup investments for FY18
text: Online classifieds company Info Edge has categorised â¹186 crore as written off in its startup investment portfolio for the financial year 2017-18. The number stood at â¹83 crore as of January 30, 2017, taking total written off amount to over â¹100 crore last year. Info Edge includes Zomato, PolicyBazaar, and Happily Unmarried among its portfolio of active investee companies.

headlines: PM Modi, Rahul visit ex-PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee in hospital
text: PM Narendra Modi on Monday evening visited former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee, who has been admitted to the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi with a urinary tract infection. Vajpayee was also visited by Union Minister JP Nadda and Congress President Rahul Gandhi, while BJPâparty president Amit Shah is likely to visit him.n

headlines: 2 Muslim clerics assaulted for not chanting 'Jai Shri Ram'
text: While returning from their evening prayer on Sunday, two Muslim clerics were allegedly beaten up by 20 bike-borne men in Jharkhand's Ranchi for not chanting 'Jai Shri Ram'. The men were armed with sticks and rods. One of the clerics was rushed to a hospital after suffering severe injuries and is now said to be in a stable condition.

headlines: Family keeps woman's dead body hoping God will revive her
text: The mother and brother of a woman who died kept her dead body in their apartment in Andhra Pradesh for three days, hoping God would bring her back to life, reports said. The incident came to light after their neighbours complained to the police about a foul smell. Police then forcibly shifted her body to a hospital for an autopsy.

headlines: Govt mulls blocking WhatsApp calls in insurgency-hit areas
text: The Centre has decided to examine the feasibility of blocking WhatsApp calls in insurgency-hit areas such as Jammu and Kashmir. Security agencies face problems in tracking WhatsApp calls between militants as the service provider offers end-to-end encryption. This comes after militants accused in a 2016 attack, which killed seven jawans, claimed that they received orders through WhatsApp calls.

headlines: Kim Jong-un brings own toilet to not let enemies analyse his poop
text: Ahead of his meeting with US President Donald Trump in Singapore, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un brought his own portable toilet to "deny determined sewer-divers insights into the supreme leader's stools", according to reports. "The leader's excretions contain information about his health status, so they can't be left behind," a North Korean defector had said earlier.

headlines: UK minister confirms Nirav Modi's presence in the country
text: UK Home Office Minister Baroness Williams on Monday confirmed PNB fraud accused Nirav Modi's presence in the country. In a meeting with Minister of State for Home Affairs Kiren Rijiju, Williams assured full cooperation for the extradition of the fugitive diamond merchant. Earlier, reports said that Nirav Modi had applied for political asylum in the UK.

headlines: Kamal makes Instagram debut on day of film's trailer launch
text: Kamal Haasan has made his Instagram debut on the day of the trailer launch of his upcoming film 'Vishwaroopam 2'. His account named 'ikamalhaasan' shared a poster of his upcoming film. The Tamil trailer of 'Vishwaroopam 2' was launched by his daughter Shruti Haasan while Aamir Khan launched the trailer for the film's Hindi version 'Vishwaroop 2'.

headlines: How do Chhetri's career stats compare to ex-captain Bhutia?
text: Football team captain Sunil Chhetri and ex-captain Bhaichung Bhutia are India's highest goalscorers and the only two players to play over 100 matches for India. While Chhetri has 64 goals in 102 matches, same as Lionel Messi's tally of international goals, Bhutia had 43 goals in 107 appearances. Further, Chhetri has won seven trophies with India, one more than Bhutia.

headlines: No plans to privatise railways, either now or ever: Govt
text: Union Railway Minister Piyush Goyal has said there are no plans to privatise Railways, either now or ever. Goyal's clarification came in response to concerns raised by employee unions on the national transporter being privatised. The Railways has been inviting private participation in areas such as station development, rail infrastructure and technological upgradation.

headlines: UP doctor rapes woman for year, uses video to blackmail her
text: A doctor named Sajid Hasan has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman repeatedly for a year in Miranpur, the Uttar Pradesh police said today. The accused had molested the woman last year and recorded the act. He allegedly used the video to blackmail the victim and threatened to upload it on social media.

headlines: Journo murder accused names Hindu body leader in confession
text: In his confession, journalist Gauri Lankesh murder accused claimed Hindu Janajagruti Samiti leader Mohan Gowda had put him in touch with an extremist unit of Hindu outfit Sanatan Sanstha, which was planning the murder. He came in contact with a Hindutva activist, another accused, who was arrested earlier in May. Lankesh was shot dead in Bengaluru in September last year.

headlines: Nipah virus contained, last patients recovered: Kerala
text: Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja on Sunday announced that the Nipah virus outbreak in the state has been contained, adding that the last two patients who tested positive for the virus have recovered. As many as 17 people, including a nurse who treated patients infected with the virus, died during the outbreak. Over 2,000 people were kept under observation.

headlines: VHP protest at Taj Mahal over gate blocking temple path
text: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) workers on Sunday staged a protest at the entrance of the Taj Mahal against the installation of a gate at the monument. The protestors alleged that the gate blocked the way to a 400-year-old temple located 350 metres away from the Taj Mahal. Around 30 people have been booked for removing a part of the gate.

headlines: ISIS attack targeting Afghan ministry kills 13, injures 25
text: At least 13 people have been killed and over 25 others have been injured in a suicide explosion at the entrance to Afghanistan's Rural Rehabilitation and Development Ministry in Kabul, government officials said. The explosion happened when employees of the ministry were leaving office. The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack.

headlines: Permanent peace to be discussed at Trump-Kim summit: N Korea
text: Establishing a permanent peace-keeping mechanism will be discussed during the summit between Supreme Leader Kim Jong-un and US President Donald Trump in Singapore, North Korean state media has said. Meanwhile, US State Secretary Mike Pompeo said the country is willing to offer North Korea "unique" security guarantees if it embarks on "complete, verifiable and irreversible denuclearisation."

headlines: Chip-based ATM card hacked in rare case, woman loses â¹40,700
text: The Mumbai Police is investigating a cyberfraud where a woman lost â¹40,700 after her ATM chip-card was cloned and money was withdrawn. The police said that chip-card fraud is a rare occurrence as most of the debit card cloning cases are of magnetic stripe cards. However, the private bank refunded her money as the woman was not at fault.

headlines: Deepika demands fees equal to male co-star in films: Reports
text: Actress Deepika Padukone has demanded fees equivalent to her leading male co-star in films, which is three times more than what Bollywood's A-list actresses earn, as per reports. Reports added that Deepika has not announced any film post 'Padmaavat' as she wants to do only author-backed title roles and wants creative control over the scripts.

headlines: We should look at Leone the way we look at Madhuri: Hardik
text: Patidar leader Hardik Patel, while expressing his views on Sunny Leone, asked, "What's the problem if we look at her the way we look at actresses Nargis, Sridevi, or Madhuri Dixit?" He added, "Why can't we view Sunny Leone as an actress on screen independent of her old image (as an adult film star)?"

headlines: With God best to be at his feet: Sehwag on pic with Sachin
text: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to share a picture of himself with cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, writing, "When with God ji @sachin_rt ,best to be at His feet." In the picture, Sehwag can be seen sitting with a hammer in his hand, with Sachin standing alongside him. Sehwag termed himself as 'Hanumanji' and Sachin 'Ramji'.

headlines: Today I'm here because of Gambhir: Saini on Test call-up
text: Delhi pacer Navdeep Saini, who received his maiden India Test team call-up on Monday, said he owes his achievement to Gautam Gambhir. "I did what he told me and today I'm here because of him. I donât know whenever I speak about Gambhir, I get emotional," he added. The 25-year-old has replaced Mohammad Shami in the squad for Afghanistan Test.

headlines: Shane Warne shares pic with Ed Sheeran having beer at Lord's
text: Australian spin legend Shane Warne on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture of himself having beer with British singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran at Lord's Cricket Ground. "Fun day in the nets at Lords with my good friend Ed Sheeran & yes he smashed me everywhere ! Time for a beer," Warne captioned the picture.

headlines: Cannot believe what one video did for us: Sunil Chhetri
text: Referring to the video he shared urging the fans to watch Indian football team's matches from the stadiums, captain Sunil Chhetri said, "I cannot believe what one video did for us." "Itâs been wonderful what has happened for Indian football in the last 20 days," he added. Notably, India's last three matches in the Intercontinental Cup were sold out.

headlines: Only those 'begging for votes' host iftar parties: BJPâMLA
text: Only those "begging for votes" host iftar parties, Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh said on Monday. He added, "These days many Telangana legislators are busy hosting iftar parties, wearing skull caps and taking selfies...My thinking is different." Notably, Rahul Gandhi is set to host his first iftar party as Congress president.

headlines: Lalu's sons cut cake on his birthday amid reports of rift
text: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's sons Tej and Tejashwi cut a 32-kg cake on Lalu's 71st birthday on Monday, while their mother Rabri stood by their side. Lalu, who is out on bail on health grounds, reportedly watched the celebrations on television from his residence. This comes amid reports claiming that Tej was upset on being sidelined in Lalu's absence.

headlines: Will replace items missing from bungalow: Akhilesh to Yogi
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has asked Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath to send him a list of items that were "missing" from his official bungalow after he vacated it. Stating that he will purchase the items and send them to Yogi, Akhilesh added that the government should return the personal items he left behind at the bungalow.

headlines: Digvijaya apologises for posting pic from Pak as MP bridge
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Sunday apologised for tweeting a picture of a damaged metro pillar in Pakistan's Rawalpindi as that of a railway overbridge in Bhopal. "One of my friend sent it to me. My fault I didn't check up," he wrote. The same picture was circulated on social media earlier as that of Delhi Metro and Hyderabad Metro.

headlines: Weighed 70 kg as cricketer, 90 kg as politician: Sidhu
text: Punjab minister Navjot Singh Sidhu has revealed he weighed 70 kg when he used to play cricket but now weighs 90 kg after joining politics. Adding that he doesn't exercise and keeps sitting for long hours, he said he plans to lose 8 kg in 3 months. This comes after Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh  launched the 'Tandarust Punjab' mission.

headlines: Lesbian couple seeks Mathura Police's help to get married
text: A lesbian couple in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura on Sunday sought the police's help for getting married, claiming that their families opposed their relationship. The women, who work at a beauty parlour, have known each other for the past four years. "Both the girls were counselled to change their decision by police," Deputy Superintendent of Police Rakesh Kumar said.

headlines: Lesbian couple commits suicide after throwing child in river
text: Two women in a relationship committed suicide after throwing a three-year-old child in the Sabarmati river, Ahmedabad police said. The child was the daughter of one of the women. The police said the couple scribbled a note on a walkway stating they had "distanced themselves from the world so they could unite, but the world did not let them live."

headlines: Gujarat NRI shot dead by ex-employee in US
text: A man from Gujarat settled in the US was shot dead allegedly by a former employee of his gas station-cum-store in Atlanta, Georgia. The man is survived by his wife and two children. Family members of the deceased said his last rites would take place in the US once the postmortem and other formalities are completed.

headlines: Airtel accuses Reliance Jio of making false claims in ad
text: Bharti Airtel has moved the Advertising Standards Council of India, alleging that Reliance Jio made false and misleading claims in its latest advertisement. Airtel argued that the claims were made without any disclaimers or independent third-party data to back them. The watchdog has upheld Airtel's complaint saying Jio's claims were misleading by "ambiguity".

headlines: Spain won 2010 FIFA World Cup despite scoring just 8 goals
text: Spain won the 2010 FIFA World Cup despite scoring just eight goals in the 31-day tournament, becoming the lowest-scoring side to win the quadrennial tournament. Spain scored four goals in three group matches and won their four knockout games including the final with a 1-0 scoreline. Spain also became the first team to win WC after losing their opening match.

headlines: Aamir launches Hindi trailer of Kamal Haasan's Vishwaroopam 2
text: Actor Aamir Khan on Monday took to Twitter to digitally launch the Hindi trailer of Kamal Haasan's Tamil film 'Vishwaroopam 2'. The film, whose Hindi version is titled 'Vishwaroop 2', also stars Rahul Bose and Shekhar Kapur. Written and directed by Haasan, the film is scheduled to release on August 10.

headlines: Word of season, being used since 2 years: Johar on nepotism
text: Karan Johar, in a veiled reference to nepotism at Dhadak's trailer launch, said, "We always put a tag, we use some word, like the word of the season, the word which is being used since the past two years." He added, "People aren't here because of their name but because of...effort they've put to make a name for themselves."

headlines: IITian's startup accuses Facebook of copying its feature
text: IIT Kanpur alumnus Yash Mishra-founded social network VoxWeb has accused Facebook of copying its audio-only posts feature. VoxWeb claims Facebook's feature is similar to its 'speaking-pic' feature which allows users to choose a photo from their phone and record an audio along with it. Facebook's audio-only Stories also allows users to add a background colour, image, and sticker.

headlines: Xiaomi posts $1 billion loss in first-quarter ahead of IPO
text: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi has revealed it lost $1.1 billion in the first three months, as it prepares for the biggest Initial Public Offering (IPO) since 2014. The company also said its revenue for the quarter came in at $5.37 billion. Xiaomi is expected to raise $10 billion at a valuation of $60-70 billion, according to reports.

headlines: PM Modi should protect people, not create trouble: Kejriwal
text: Accusing BJP and Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal of using the CBI and Anti-Corruption Branch against AAP, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal today said, "The Prime Minister is like a father figure to the nation. He should protect the people, not create troubles." Kejriwal added that the agencies' main intention is to "defame" AAP and stop its work.

headlines: Audi CEO Rupert Stadler's home raided in German diesel probe
text: An apartment belonging to Audi CEO Rupert Stadler was raided by German prosecutors on Monday after he was named a suspect in Volkswagen's emissions-cheating probe. He is being investigated for fraud and falsifying public documents relating to sales of diesel cars in Europe. This comes almost three years after Volkswagen admitted to falsifying US diesel emissions tests.

headlines: Japanese startup Mercari's IPO to make Founder a billionaire
text: Japanese e-commerce startup Mercari's Initial Public Offering (IPO) priced at $1.2 billion will make its 40-year-old Founder Shintaro Yamada a billionaire with about $1.04 billion fortune. Further, the indicated IPO price will give Mercari a market value of $3.6 billion. Founded in 2013, Mercari became Japan's first startup to become a unicorn at $1 billion or more valuation.

headlines: SoftBank Vision Fund leads $250mn funding in US data startup
text: SoftBank Vision Fund has led a $250-million funding in Cohesity at around $1-billion valuation, the US-based data storage startup announced today. The Series D round also saw participation from Cisco Investments, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Morgan Stanley Expansion Capital and Sequoia Capital. Founded in 2013, Cohesity offers secondary storage for backup, file services, and analytic datasets.

headlines: FIR filed against ex-AMU students seen at bar during Ramadan
text: An FIR has been filed against five people, including three ex-Aligarh Muslim University students, for allegedly hurting religious sentiments after a photograph on Facebook showed them drinking at a Delhi bar during the month of Ramadan. They received death threats, and posts circulating on AMU groups called for them to be lynched. The three ex-AMU students have gone into hiding.

headlines: Mallya's seized plane's parking costs Mumbai Airport â¹15,000/hour
text: The parking of beleaguered liquor baron Vijay Mallya's luxury airplane Airbus A319, which was seized by service tax department, is costing the Mumbai Airport nearly â¹15,000 per hour. The airport officials say the plane is not fit to fly and its scrap weighs almost 10 tonnes. The plane has been parked for free since a government agency has seized it.

headlines: Cop takes bullet for colleague who recently became a father
text: Sub-inspector Bijender Singh Deshwal took a bullet to save a younger 25-year-old colleague who had become a father three months ago during a gunfight between Delhi Police and gangsters on Sunday, Deshwal's son revealed. Following this, the policemen rushed to the hospital, where they were tended to by a medical team that included the daughter of one of the officers.

headlines: Trump accuses India of charging 100% tariff on imports
text: Speaking after leaving the G7 summit in Canada, US President Donald Trump accused India of charging 100% tariff on some imports. "I mean, we have India, where some of the tariffs are 100%. A hundred percent. And we charge nothing. We can't do that," Trump said. He threatened to cut trade ties with countries which are "robbing" America.

headlines: Founder of largest EV battery maker becomes a billionaire
text: The Chinese founder of world's largest electric vehicle battery maker CATL, Zeng Yuqun, has become a billionaire with a net worth of $3.4 billion, according to Bloomberg. The company achieved a valuation of $12.3 billion on the first day of trading on Monday after its shares soared 44%. The 50-year-old engineer, who started CATL seven years ago, owns 26% stake.

headlines: Life doesn't come with a manual, it comes with a mother: SRK
text: Shah Rukh Khan shared a picture of his wife Gauri Khan and their daughter Suhana Khan on social media with the caption, "Life doesn't come with a manual, it comes with a mother." Shah Rukh wrote the line, which he came across while reading, seemed appropriate for the picture. The picture shows Gauri and Suhana at a party in London.

headlines: Maybe man-woman love is not destined for me: Manisha Koirala
text: Actress Manisha Koirala feels that the man-woman love is not destined to happen for her. "I'd rather accept this sad truth of my life rather than fall into the wrong relationship again," added Manisha. She further said that she will not allow any man to bring her down while adding, "Can't afford to make wrong moves...God has given me...second chance."

headlines: Shahid Kapoor shares pic from sets of Batti Gul Meter Chalu
text: Actor Shahid Kapoor has shared a picture from the sets of 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu'. The film stars Shraddha Kapoor opposite Shahid while Yami Gautam will reportedly be seen playing a lawyer in the Shree Narayan Singh directorial. Shahid earlier said, "The story is based in Uttarakhand so I will be using a certain accent and dialect for the film."

headlines: Ronaldo's bicycle kick features in FIFA 19's reveal trailer
text: Real Madrid forward Cristiano Ronaldo's bicycle kick in the Champions League quarterfinal against Juventus features in the official reveal trailer of the EA Sports FIFA 19 video game. The game, which will release on September 28th, will also feature PSG's Neymar Jr on its cover this year. The game will officially feature UEFA Champions League for the first time.

headlines: Cricket has all ingredients to become a global game: Sachin
text: After Scotland became the first-ever Associate nation to defeat a top-ranked ODI side, Sachin Tendulkar called for more opportunities for "teams with massive potential" to play against "more experienced" teams. "Cricket has all the ingredients to become a global game," he added. Scotland scored 371/5 against England, becoming the first Associate nation to post an ODI total of 350-plus.

headlines: Shami dropped from Indian Test team after failing Yo-Yo test
text: Pacer Mohammad Shami has been dropped from the Indian squad for the Afghanistan Test after failing to clear the Yo-Yo fitness Test at National Cricket Academy in Bengaluru. Delhi pacer Navdeep Saini, who took 34 wickets in eight matches in Ranji Trophy last season, has been named as Shami's replacement. The Test against Afghanistan will start on June 14.

headlines: Match halted as air ambulance lands on ground to help fan
text: County Championship match between Lancashire and Essex was halted for around 35 minutes after an air ambulance landed on the outfield to attend to an ill spectator. A male supporter had collapsed in the pavilion and was taken to hospital in one of three ambulances that had arrived at the scene. The play restarted after the air ambulance took off.

headlines: To win WC, masturbate before matches: Portugal keeper's wife
text: Portugal football team goalkeeper Rui Patricio's wife Vera Ribeiro, who is a sex therapist, has said that players should practice masturbation before the matches to improve their performance at the upcoming World Cup. She said that players who masturbate will be more relaxed and less stressed than those who abstain. The World Cup is scheduled to start on June 14.

headlines: England 1st world no. 1 team to lose to an associate nation
text: England on Sunday became the first team in cricket's history to be a number one ranked side losing an ODI to an associate nation after their six-run loss against Scotland. Scotland's 371 was the highest ODI total ever by an associate nation, while Jonny Bairstow became the only England batsman to hit a third consecutive ODI ton.

headlines: BJP worker, 4 family members found murdered in Nagpur
text: A BJP worker and his four family members were found murdered at their residence in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Sunday. The incident came to light when Kamlakar Pohankar failed to respond to several calls, following which locals barged into his home. Police suspect that the murders could have been committed due to personal enmity.

headlines: Centre very confused about Air India, claims P Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram has claimed that lack of clarity in the policy objective suggests that the government is "very confused" regarding what to do with Air India. "It is neither privatisation nor a joint venture arrangement...you cannot succeed in selling 70% or any stake in Air India," he added. Notably, the government received zero bids for the loss-making airline.

headlines: Delhi man kills self after throwing acid on wife, daughters
text: A man allegedly threw acid on his wife and daughters and drank it to kill himself in Delhi on Saturday. The police reached the spot, where the man was declared dead while the mother and daughters were rushed to the hospital where they are undergoing treatment. During investigations, the police found the couple had fought before the man bought acid.

headlines: Video: Chicks hatch from eggs thrown at dump site in Georgia
text: A video of hundreds of chicks running around after hatching from eggs thrown at a dump site in Georgia's Marneuli has gone viral. The eggs were reportedly thrown away by a local poultry farm. Local officials said the warm temperature at the site and its rocky landscape had created conditions favourable for the eggs to hatch.

headlines: We'll support BJP if Delhi made state before 2019 polls: Kejriwal
text: After the Delhi Assembly accepted a resolution on full statehood to Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal said the AAP will campaign for BJP if Delhi gets statehood before the 2019 general elections. "We'll make sure that each and every vote from Delhi goes in your favour," he said. Otherwise, "Delhi residents will put up boards saying 'BJP leave Delhi'", he added.

headlines: Imran Khan homosexual, had relationships with men: Ex-wife
text: Imran Khan's ex-wife Reham Khan has claimed in a book that the Pakistani cricketer-turned-politician is homosexual and had relationships with Pakistani actor Hamza Ali Abbasi and member of his political party, Murad Saeed. Reham, whose marriage with Imran lasted 10 months, had earlier accused him of having an illicit affair with a female employee of his political party.

headlines: Trailer of Diljit Dosanjh, Taapsee starrer 'Soorma' released
text: The trailer of Diljit Dosanjh and Taapsee Pannu starrer 'Soorma' has been released. 'Soorma' is based on the life of former Indian hockey team captain Sandeep Singh, whose role will be portrayed by Diljit. Directed by Shaad Ali, the film also stars Angad Bedi and is scheduled to release on July 13.

headlines: Rebel AAP leader sues Kejriwal for low Assembly attendance
text: Rebel AAP leader Kapil Mishra on Monday moved the Delhi High Court against CM Arvind Kejriwal for his low attendance in the Delhi Assembly. Mishra's petition alleged the CM was present only seven times in 2017 although the Assembly had 27 sessions. He also claimed CM Kejriwal wasn't present in the Assembly in the last 40 months during Question Hour.

headlines: Shiv Sena calls plot to kill PM a 'thrilling horror story'
text: In its mouthpiece Saamana, Shiv Sena on Monday said that the recent assassination threats to PM Narendra Modi and Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis is "nothing less than a thrilling plot of a horror story". Condemning the politicisation of the matter, it added, "It is okay if lakhs are killed, but the saviour of lakhs has to live."

headlines: CapitalG leads $21.5 mn funding in India's Aye Finance
text: Google's parent company Alphabet's venture arm CapitalG has led a $21.5 million funding round in Gurugram-based startup Aye Finance. The Series C funding round also saw participation from existing investors SAIF Partners and LGT Group. Founded in 2014, the startup provides business loans to small and micro enterprises across the country.

headlines: Amazon admits to violating labour laws at China factory
text: Amazon has admitted to violating labour laws at the China factory which manufactures Echo speakers and Kindle e-readers. A March audit revealed that over 40% of staff were low-cost agency workers who didn't get holiday or sick pay. It was also revealed that workers were not paid properly for overtime and had to ask for permission to use the washroom.

headlines: Fear for my life: Officer post accusing senior of harassment
text: The woman IAS officer who has accused Haryana Additional Chief Secretary Sunil Gulati of sexual harassment has now said that she fears for her life. She added that such incidents happened to her before and no action was taken against the officers she complained about. Meanwhile, Gulati has denied the allegations and said he is ready to face a probe.

headlines: Coca-Cola was started by a man who sold shikanji: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi while speaking at an event in Delhi on Monday said that Coca-Cola company was started by a man who used to sell 'shikanji' in America. The man's talent was recognised and he was given money to start the Coca-Cola company, Gandhi added. He further claimed that McDonald's was started by a man who ran a 'dhaba'.

headlines: 5-yr-old stepchild testifies, man gets life term for murder
text: The Delhi High Court upheld a man's life sentence for murdering his wife after his 5-year-old stepdaughter testified against him. The child said the man would often beat her mother and that she saw him injure her with a sharp object, as well as shove a gas pipe in her mouth. Her testimony was substantiated by the forensic report.

headlines: Video: Kim Jong-un's bodyguards jog by his limo in Singapore
text: A video of Kim Jong-un's bodyguards running alongside his limousine shortly after the North Korean leader arrived in Singapore has surfaced online. The bodyguards were earlier spotted during Kim's summit with South Korean President Moon Jae-in. Singapore is the farthest the North Korean leader has traveled from his home country since assuming power in 2011.

headlines: Nearly 44% of world's population watched FIFA World Cup 2014
text: According to FIFA, the 2014 edition of the FIFA World Cup was watched by 3.2 billion people (approximately 44% of world's population) on their in-home televisions for at least a minute or more. Meanwhile, the total audience for the final between Argentina and Germany, including in-home and out-of-home figures for viewers watching for at least one minute, hit 1.013 billion.

headlines: D-Mart operator Avenue Supermarts m-cap crosses â¹1 trillion
text: D-Mart parent Avenue Supermarts on Monday joined the â¹1 trillion ($14.8 billion) market capitalisation club after the company's stock price hit a new record high. Avenue Supermarts stands at the 29th position in the overall market-cap ranking. This comes after promoter Radhakishan Damani sold 1% stake last week to ensure that the firm meets minimum public shareholding norms.

headlines: I'm by your side: Arjun to half-sister Janhvi on her debut
text: Actor Arjun Kapoor, in a social-media post addressed to his half-sister Janhvi Kapoor, wrote, "Sorry I'm not there in Mumbai but I'm by your side, don't worry." He wrote this ahead of the release of the trailer of Janhvi's debut movie 'Dhadak'. "I just wanted you to know this profession is amazing if you work hard, be honest," added Arjun.

headlines: I once told mom, I wish to debut in film like Sairat: Janhvi
text: Janhvi Kapoor revealed that once while watching the Marathi film 'Sairat' with her late mother Sridevi, she told her how she wished to debut in such a film. She added, "Me and mom had this big discussion (about) how even she wanted a role like this for me." Janhvi will debut in 'Dhadak', which is an adaptation of 'Sairat'.

headlines: Nadal may lose world rank 1 to Federer despite French Open win
text: Rafael Nadal, who won his record eleventh French Open title, might lose his world number one ranking to Roger Federer if the Swiss reaches the third round of the upcoming grass court tournament, Stuttgart Open. Federer, who will reach the tournament's final if he registers three wins there, lost in the opening round to Tommy Haas last year.

headlines: This win is for fans who filled the stands: Sunil Chhetri
text: After leading Indian football team to Intercontinental Cup victory with a brace in the final, captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to thank fans for backing the team. "What a feeling! Thank you, India! This win is for the fans who filled the stands, cheered from home...and believed in us," he wrote. Chhetri scored 8 goals in the tournament

headlines: Samson fails Yo-Yo test, left out of India A team: Reports
text: Rajasthan Royals' wicketkeeper-batsman Sanju Samson has been left out of India A squad to tour England after failing the mandatory Yo-Yo test, according to reports. The 23-year-old was the only player who fell below the required 16.1 mark, reports added. Samson was the second-highest run-scorer for Rajasthan Royals in the IPL 2018, hitting 441 runs in 15 matches.

headlines: Korean crypto exchange Coinrail hacked, loses over $40 mn
text: South Korea-based cryptocurrency exchange Coinrail on Sunday announced that its platform has been hacked resulting in the loss of a reported amount of $40 million. According to its website, the exchange has already suspended services and managed to freeze two-thirds of stolen tokens. Coinrail also said 70% of its reserves have been moved to a cold wallet without internet access.

headlines: SpaceX may build new facility to launch 64 rockets per year
text: Elon Musk-led SpaceX is reportedly planning to build a new facility in Florida, US to launch 64 rockets per year. Reports suggest most of the launches will be using Falcon 9 rockets which Musk believes can be launched up to 100 times before retirement. SpaceX has also asked NASA for a 67-acre patch of land for this purpose, reports added.

headlines: Democracy is not possible without the Opposition: Amit Shah
text: When asked if he wished to wipe out the Opposition from the country, BJP chief Amit Shah replied, "Democracy is not possible without the Opposition...But it is the responsibility of Rahul Gandhi to keep the Congress alive, not mine." Discussing his party slogan of 'Congress-mukt Bharat', he added, "Congress-mukt Bharat means getting rid of the 'Congress culture'."

headlines: Govt openings for joint secy-level posts to induct RSS: Cong
text: After the Centre listed openings for joint secretary-level posts for private sector employees, Congress said the government wanted to recruit people from RSS and "industrial houses". The Congress also called it an attempt to sabotage the current system of recruiting experienced civil servants to the posts. It questioned why these posts were opened to "Indian nationals" and not "Indian citizens".

headlines: Self-styled godman Daati Maharaj booked for raping follower
text: The Delhi Police has filed a case against self-styled godman Daati Maharaj for allegedly raping a female follower two years ago inside a temple run by him in Chhattarpur. The victim reportedly said she did not file a complaint earlier as she was intimidated by him. She added that there are several other women whom he has physically assaulted.

headlines: Three tourists, including Maha cop, drown off Goan beach
text: Three tourists from Maharashtra, including a police constable and his brother, drowned off Goa's Calangute beach on Monday morning. Two others who had been pulled into the sea because of the strong undercurrents were able to swim back to the shore. The victims were declared brought dead at a health centre after being pulled out by locals.

headlines: Brother shot 500 mt from where UP CM stayed: Gorakhpur doc
text: Dr Kafeel Khan, accused in the death of over 60 children in Gorakhpur, said his brother was shot at by bike-borne assailants 500 metres away from Gorakhnath temple where Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath was staying. Adding that his brother was operated on successfully, he posted a video on social media, saying, "Allah rahem kare. M not going to bend."

headlines: Drunk man kills wife for refusing to cook mutton for him
text: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad allegedly beat up his wife with an iron rod after she refused to cook mutton for him. The accused, who was drunk at the time, his father and brother then threw her off the third floor to make it look like an accident, reports said. She succumbed to her injuries before reaching the hospital.

headlines: Trump renouncing G7 statement is 'depressing': Merkel
text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel has said US President Donald Trump's decision to not endorse the G7 statement is "a bit depressing". "Sometimes it seems Trump thinks that only one side wins and everyone else loses," she added. Calling the US a less reliable partner, Merkel said the EU needs to stand together to increase its influence on the world stage.

headlines: Nirav Modi seeking political asylum in UK: Reports
text: Fraud-accused jeweller Nirav Modi has fled to the UK, where he is seeking political asylum, according to reports. Nirav Modi, who is being investigated in the over â¹13,000-crore PNB scam, is in London trying to claim asylum alleging "political persecution". India's External Affairs Ministry is reportedly waiting for UK's law enforcement agencies to approach them before pushing for an extradition.

headlines: Trailer of Srideviâs daughter Janhviâs debut film 'Dhadak' out
text: The trailer of 'Dhadak', the debut film of late actress Sridevi and producer Boney Kapoor's daughter Janhvi Kapoor, was released on Monday. Janhvi will feature opposite actor Shahid Kapoor's half-brother Ishaan Khatter in the film. Directed by Shashank Khaitan and co-produced by Karan Johar, the film is scheduled to release on July 20.

headlines: What are JEE Advanced toppers from last few years doing now?
text: JEE Advanced topper from 2009 is working with Google in San Francisco, while the 2010 topper is pursuing a PhD at Switzerland's Institute of Neuroinformatics. The 2011 topper is now an IAS officer after securing an AIR 24 in his first attempt in the UPSC exams. The 2012 and 2013 toppers are employed with Tower Research Capital and Microsoft respectively.

headlines: Defecated in open while shooting Suraj Hua Maddham song: Johar
text: Karan Johar has revealed he defecated in open as he got a "bad loose motions attack" while shooting for the song 'Suraj Hua Maddham' in Egypt for 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham'. "There were...limestone structures...I had to go behind one of them (to defecate)," Johar added. He further said he couldn't help it as the vanity van was two kilometres away.

headlines: F**k Trump: Oscar-winning actor Robert De Niro at Tony Awards
text: Oscar-winning actor Robert de Niro swore at US President Donald Trump twice saying, "F**k Trump" during the live TV broadcast of Tony Awards 2018 on Sunday. De Niro, who appeared on stage to introduce performer Bruce Springsteen, at first said, "I'm gonna say one thing. F**k Trump," and later stated, "It's no longer down with Trump. It's f**k Trump."

headlines: What happens when chequered flag in F1 is waved too early?
text: The Formula One chequered flag, which signifies the end of the race, if waved prematurely results in the final positions being determined by the rankings at the end of the previous lap. During the Canadian GP on Sunday, model Winnie Harlow waved the flag at the end of the 69th lap, resulting in disqualification of the 69th and 70th laps.

headlines: Power bank explodes in a man's bag in China, video goes viral
text: A power bank kept inside the bag of a man who was travelling in a bus in China suddenly exploded on May 30, the video of which has gone viral. The man, who was talking to another man when the power bank exploded, threw the bag out of the bus. None of the passengers or the man were injured.

headlines: India refuses to endorse China's Belt and Road Initiative
text: Refusing to endorse China's Belt and Road Initiative at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that India would welcome only those connectivity projects which respect its sovereignty and regional integrity. Notably, India oppose the Belt and Road Initiative as it includes the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor which passes through Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

headlines: Class 10 girl sedated with alcohol, sexually assaulted in TN
text: Police have detained seven people, including minors, for allegedly sexually assaulting a Class 10 girl after sedating her with alcohol and drugs in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur. The incident came to light when police found her stranded at a bus stop after she failed to return home from school. The girl admitted her friend had got her to take drugs regularly.

headlines: Dreamt for 19 yrs: Son of Kargil martyr joins same battalion
text: Indian Military Academy cadet Hitesh Kumar has been commissioned as Lieutenant and has joined the 2nd Battalion of Rajputana Rifles, the same battalion as his father who was martyred in 1999 Kargil War. Kumar said he dreamt for 19 years to join the Army and now wants to serve with pride. His younger brother is also preparing for the Army.

headlines: Farmer's 15-yr-old son clears JEE, elder son cleared at 13
text: The 15-year-old son of a farmer in Bihar has cleared JEE Advanced 2018 securing All India Rank 383 with 241 marks out of 360. His elder brother Satyam, currently pursuing MTech from IIT-Kanpur, cleared the exam at age 13 in 2012. Their father said he is proud of both his sons for clearing the exam at such a tender age.

headlines: US news channel host calls Trump a 'dictator'
text: A Fox News show host called the upcoming summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un as a "meeting between two dictators" on air. However, the host later apologised, saying, "I did not mean that." Reacting to the gaffe, a twitter user wrote, "Fox News just called Trump a dictator. Finally, intellectual reporting."

headlines: Trump, Kim to begin summit with one-on-one meeting: Reports
text: US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un will begin their historic summit in Singapore on Tuesday with a one-on-one session, according to reports. The two leaders will be joined only by translators, reports added. The meeting will be the first ever between a sitting US President and a North Korean leader.

headlines: US President Trump calls Kim Jong-un 'unknown personality'
text: US President Donald Trump has said his summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un would be about building a relationship and setting up a dialogue with a leader having an "unknown personality". "People don't know much about him...Many leaders next to him have never met him," he added. Both the leaders have arrived in Singapore for the June 12 talks.

headlines: Karti Chidambaram gets anticipatory bail in black money case
text: In a late night hearing on Saturday, the Madras High Court granted anticipatory bail to former Finance Minister P Chidambaram's son Karti Chidambaram in a black money case. An arrest warrant was issued shortly before Karti was due to leave for London on Sunday morning. Karti gave a written undertaking to appear before the concerned official on June 28.

headlines: Abhi mehengai bahut badh gayi: Rao on his â¹11k pay 8 yrs ago
text: Talking about how he wouldn't accept being paid â¹11,000 for doing films now, Rajkummar Rao said, "In my defence, I'd argue, 'Abhi mehengai bahut badh gayi hai!'" Rajkummar had featured in 'LSD: Love Sex Aur Dhokha' eight years ago, for which he was paid â¹11,000. Rao added that it's scary if he chooses certain films only because they sell.

headlines: Nawazuddin's brother booked for posting derogatory pic on FB
text: Nawazuddin Siddiqui's brother Ayazuddin was booked for posting Lord Shiva's 'derogatory picture' on Facebook after a complaint was lodged by Hindu Yuva Vahini. Denying the charges, Ayazuddin said a man had posted the picture and he shared it to confront him that one shouldn't share posts that hurt someone's religious sentiments. The police added Ayazuddin had not written anything offensive.

headlines: Canada GP ends 2 laps early as model waves flag before finish
text: The Canadian Grand Prix was officially counted till the 68th lap after VIP guest and model Winnie Harlow waved the chequered flag too early in Montreal on Sunday. German Formula One driver Sebastian Vettel handed Ferrari its first Formula One win in Canada in 14 years after registering his career's 50th Grand Prix win.

headlines: Will continue alliance with BSP to defeat BJP: SP chief
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday said the party's alliance with BSP will continue. Addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri, Yadav said, "In 2019, even if we have to give up a few seats we will do it. We have to ensure BJP is defeated." The parties had entered into an alliance for the recent Lok Sabha bypolls.

headlines: BJP playing 'threat letter' card for sympathy: Sharad Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar has accused BJP of playing the "threat letter" card to gain sympathy. He added that some retired CID officers informed him that when such letters come, they go to security agencies and not the media. Pawar was referring to letters seized by the police talking of an alleged plot to assassinate PM Narendra Modi.

headlines: Nearly 400 Kerala police personnel accused in criminal cases
text: As many as 387 police personnel in Kerala are accused in criminal cases, according to a report submitted to the state Human Rights Commission by DGP Loknath Behera. Among them, some have returned to the police department after serving their punishment. Under the Kerala Police Act, the accused should be suspended from service if found guilty.

headlines: Delhi 'Lady Don', her family have 100 cases against them
text: The Delhi Police has seized the residence of 62-year-old Bashreen, popularly known as 'Lady Don', in Delhi's Sangam Vihar due to her criminal background. Bashreen and her family of eight sons have over 100 criminal cases lodged against them, reports said. Bashreen, who is accused in a murder case, has been absconding since September 2017.

headlines: Shoot stone-pelters dead: BJP MP on J&K withdrawing FIRs
text: Talking about the decision of the PDP-BJP government in J&K to withdraw FIRs against 10,000 youths for stone-pelting, BJP MP DP Vats on Sunday said they should instead be shot dead. His remark comes days after Home Minister Rajnath Singh said cases against first-time stone-pelters would be withdrawn "for the sake of their future", adding that "children make mistakes".

headlines: 6 students on college trip die after being run over by bus
text: Six students and a teacher on their way to Haridwar for a college trip died on Monday after being run over by a state-run bus on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway in Uttar Pradesh. The accident occurred when the students were filling diesel from one bus to another, police said. CM Yogi Adityanath announced â¹2-lakh compensation to families of the deceased.

headlines: Singapore to spend â¹100 crore for Trump-Kim summit: PM Lee
text: Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on Sunday said that the country will spend around â¹100 crore to host the historic summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. Adding that the summit gives Singapore publicity, Lee said, "It's our contribution to an international endeavour which is in our profound interest."

headlines: RBI seeks update on payments data storage every fortnight
text: The RBI has reportedly asked payment services firms to provide fortnightly updates on action taken by them to store transaction data in the country. RBI on April 6 mandated all payment companies to store user data only in India and ensure compliance within 6 months. It said "only certain" operators currently store the data either partly or completely in India.

headlines: This new film captures the feeling of safety at home
text: From wars and corruption to riots and terrorist attacks, many things create a sense of insecurity today. But the greatest sense of insecurity comes from the feeling that your own home is not safe, that it can be broken into and robbed. A new film evocatively captures the feeling of safety that Godrej Locks brings to the lives of Indians.

headlines: World's cheapest phone 'Freedom 251' maker's founder arrested
text: The maker of world's cheapest smartphone 'Freedom 251' priced at â¹251, Ringing Bells' founder Mohit Goel was arrested along with two more people by the Delhi Police on Sunday. The three were allegedly trying to extort money in lieu of settling a rape case. Last year, Goel was arrested over allegations of fraud and an alleged non-payment of â¹16 lakh.

headlines: Launch Code Expansia - Kalpataru's Ultra-premium homes in Thane
text: Kalpataru launches yet another landmark Project in Thane West â Launch Code Expansia beside the Grand Central Park. Created by the best of minds in the industry, it is equipped with best in class club house facilities and offers a host of amenities for all ages. Limited period pre-launch prices for 1BHK, 2BHK and 3BHK starting from â¹69 lacs.

headlines: Railways to monitor train cleanliness using WhatsApp groups
text: The Northern Railways is planning to use WhatsApp groups, supervised by senior officials, to monitor the cleanliness of trains. All departments will post their status report on a daily basis on their separate WhatsApp groups. The Northern Railways will also get a â¹1.6-crore automatic coach washing plant, which is capable of washing a 24-coach train within eight minutes.

headlines: 9 bars at prominent Delhi spots caught serving expired beer
text: During surprise inspections between August 2017 to April 2018, the Excise Department found nine prominent venues at popular Delhi spots such as Hauz Khas and Connaught Place serving expired beer. The department also revealed that of the 214 establishments inspected, 94 were found violating norms. Many bars and clubs were found violating the seat-capacity condition as well.

headlines: India to get its 1st police museum in Delhi
text: India will get its first national police museum in Lutyens Delhi, a senior official said on Sunday. The museum, which will depict the history of central and state police forces, will come up as an underground facility in the premises of the National Police Memorial. It will be inaugurated on Police Commemoration Day, which is held on October 21.

headlines: Govt's 10 joint secretary-level posts open to private sector employees
text: The government has opened 10 joint secretary-level posts for private sector employees, who neither require to be an IAS officer nor UPSC qualified to be eligible for the job. The openings spread through major ministries including Finance and Agriculture. The period of contract will be for three years, extendable up to five years.

headlines: $3 billion pledged for girl education at G7 summit
text: Pledges worth nearly $3 billion to help vulnerable women and girls, including refugees, get an education were announced at the G7 summit in Canada. The Canadian government said the amount could help educate over 80 lakh children and teenagers. Canadian PM Justin Trudeau called it "the single largest investment in education for women and girls in crisis and conflict situations".

headlines: Trudeau deserves special place in hell: Trump's adviser
text: Slamming Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's comments on US tariffs during the G7 summit, US President Donald Trump's trade adviser Peter Navarro said, "Trudeau deserves a special place in hell." Navarro also accused Trudeau of backstabbing Trump. The Canadian PM had called US tariffs "insulting", saying the country won't be pushed around and plans to apply retaliatory tariffs.

headlines: No reference to Saif in Race 3: Director Remo D'souza
text: 'Race 3' director Remo D'souza has said that there is no reference to actor Saif Ali Khan in the film. He added, "It wasn't that we didn't want him. The script is written with different characters... All the other characters were done so there was no need." Notably, Saif had starred in both 'Race' and 'Race 2'.

headlines: Chhetri names shin pads after his 'strengths' wife and sister
text: After scoring India's match-winning brace in the Intercontinental Cup final, captain Sunil Chhetri shared an Instagram post in which he presents his shin pads to his wife and sister after naming the equipment after them. Chhetri's post was captioned, "Named my shin pads and handed them to the people who give me strength. I love them so much!".

headlines: Nadal has defeated 7 different men in 11 French Open finals
text: Rafael Nadal, who on Sunday defeated Dominic Thiem toÂ win French Open for a record-extending 11th time, has defeated seven different opponents in his 11 French Open finals. The world number one defeated Mariano Puerta to win his maiden French Open title in 2005 as a 19-year-old. Nadal clinched the 2006, 2007, 2008 and 2011 titles by defeating Roger Federer.

headlines: Nadal 3rd tennis player to earn $100 million in prize money
text: Following his 11th French Open title, world number one Rafael Nadal became the third player after Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic to earn $100 million in prize money. The 32-year-old, who had won $98,001,598 before the tournament, was awarded $2.6 million for his title win. Notably, Djokovic had become the first tennis player to earn $100 million in June 2016.

headlines: Do you think I'm mad that I will marry another girl: Shami
text: Reacting to his wife Hasin Jahan's allegations that he wants to marry his elder brother's sister-in-law after Eid, Indian cricketer Mohammad Shami said he is not mad that he will marry another girl. "I am (already) in much trouble due to my first marriage," he added. Hasin had also alleged that Shami offered her money and asked for divorce.

headlines: 13th-ranked Scotland score 371, beat no. 1 England by 6 runs
text: Scotland, who are placed 13th in ODI rankings, defeated top-ranked England by six runs in the one-off ODI on Sunday. Scotland registered their highest-ever ODI total of 371/5, breaking the 21-year-old record for the highest ODI total (347/3, Kenya) by an Associate side. Further, the match witnessed Jonny Bairstow become the first England player to hit three straight ODI hundreds.

headlines: Digvijaya posted pic of Pak metro as Bhopal rail: MP CM
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has claimed that Congress leader Digvijaya Singh posted a picture of a damaged metro pillar from Pakistan's Rawalpindi as that from Bhopal. "These are those who cannot make a bridge properly on their Twitter handle, let alone on the ground," Chouhan tweeted. The CM shared a report which claimed the picture was from Pakistan.

headlines: CAIT threatens nationwide agitation on Flipkart-Walmart deal
text: Traders' body Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has threatened to launch a nationwide agitation if the government clears $16-billion Flipkart-Walmart deal. CAIT claims that ignoring to bring reforms in the e-commerce sector has encouraged Walmart to buy Flipkart and enter the trade indirectly. The deal will increase malpractices manifold in the e-commerce spectrum, the trader body said.

headlines: Russian space agency plans to use laser to shoot space junk
text: Russian space agency Roscosmos is planning to evaporate space debris and junk floating around the Earth using high beam lasers with a three-metre laser 'cannon'. NASA estimates that there are more than 500,000 pieces of space junk, orbiting the Earth at speeds of up to 28,160 kmph. Scientists claim the clearing out of space debris will help ease space exploration.

headlines: Bihar minister denies reports of ban on chewing tobacco
text: Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey on Sunday denied media reports of planning a ban on khaini, or chewing tobacco. Pandey clarified that while the state is against the consumption of gutkha and khaini, it has not asked the Centre for its prohibition. Earlier, reports had claimed Bihar requested khaini be notified as a food product so it could be banned.

headlines: Brother of doctor accused in Gorakhpur children's death shot
text: The brother of Dr Kafeel Khan, accused in the death of over 60 children at a Gorakhpur hospital, was allegedly shot at by bike-borne assailants on Sunday. After the incident, Khan said, "I have always said that they would try to kill us." He was released on bail in April after seven months in jail in connection with the deaths.

headlines: 15 arrested for lynching 2 men in Assam over false rumours
text: Assam Police has arrested 15 people for being allegedly involved in the lynching of two men in Assam's Karbi Anglong district on Friday. "The situation at the site is under control and efforts are on to nab the others," police officials said. The victims had been attacked by a mob over false rumours about them being child lifters.

headlines: Ex-BJP minister's brother arrested for abusing Mufti
text: Police have arrested former BJP minister Lal Singh's brother Rajinder Singh for abusing Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti during a rally aimed at demanding a CBI probe into the Kathua rape and murder case. Rajinder had been absconding since a case was registered against him in May.  He was arrested from his hideout spot in Udaipur.

headlines: Ram Temple construction will begin before 2019 polls: BJP MP
text: BJP MP Sakshi Maharaj has claimed that the construction of Ram Temple at the disputed site in Ayodhya will begin before the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. Stating that PM Narendra Modi is the "biggest brand" in India, he asserted that PM Modi will be re-elected next year. He also sought a high-level probe into the assassination threats to PM Modi.

headlines: UP girl shot dead 4 days after alleging sexual harassment
text: A 17-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh was shot dead on Friday, four days after she submitted a police complaint alleging sexual harassment by four people. The body of the victim, who was studying to be a nurse, was discovered the next day by her neighbour who alerted the police. Three accused are in custody while one is on the run.

headlines: Czech woman drowns while playing GPS-based treasure hunt
text: A Czech woman drowned after being trapped inside Prague's underground drainage system while participating in a global GPS-based treasure hunt, police officials said. The woman was geocaching when heavy downpours led to rapidly rising water. The body of the 27-year-old victim, who has not been identified, was found in the Vltava river.

headlines: Brazilian newborn thought to be dead buried for 7 hours
text: A newborn baby in Brazil's Canarana was buried for seven hours after her family apparently thought she was dead. Her mother, a 15-year-old who gave birth in the bathroom, said the baby fell on the bathroom floor and hit her head. The newborn, who was rescued by police, suffered two fractures to her skull and had her umbilical cord attached.

headlines: Praying that US-N Korea summit leads to peace: Pope Francis
text: Pope Francis on Sunday said he is praying that the upcoming summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un succeeds in laying the groundwork for peace. Urging people around the world to pray for the summit, the pontiff said, "I want to offer the beloved people of Korea an especial thought of friendship."

headlines: Chhetri equals Messi, becomes joint 2nd best active scorer
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri scored both the goals in India's 2-0 Intercontinental Cup final win against Kenya on Sunday to equal Argentina captain Lionel Messi's tally of 64 international goals. With this, Chhetri became the joint-second best active international goal-scorer and is only behind Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo (81). Chhetri has scored 10 goals in his last six matches.

headlines: World no. 1 Nadal wins his 11th French Open title in 14 yrs
text: World number one Rafael Nadal on Sunday defeated world number eight Dominic Thiem in the men's singles final to clinch his record-extending 11th French Open title in 14 years. With this, Nadal equalled former world number one female player Margaret Court's record of winning a single Grand Slam singles title 11 times. Overall, it was Nadal's 17th Grand Slam title.

headlines: SC/ST Act, reservation to stay till BJP in power: Amit Shah
text: BJP chief Amit Shah today said the SC/ST Act and reservation system in jobs will be enforced till the BJP-led government is in power. He added, "In the coming days, Congress will spread different types of lies to mislead people. Sometimes they will say the SC/ST Act is being abolished, on other occasions they will say reservation is being scrapped."n

headlines: No rift with Tejashwi, hope he becomes future PM: Tej Pratap
text: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's elder son Tej Pratap Yadav has dismissed reports of a rift with his younger brother Tejashwi Yadav over a struggle for power in the party. He added, "I want that Tejashwi becomes the PM one day." Referring to the Mahabharata, Tej also said he wished to make his brother sit on the throne like Arjun.

headlines: Passed Class 10 when I was 10: T'gana youngest girl engineer
text: A 16-year-old girl named Kasibhatta Samhitha, who has become the youngest engineer in Telangana, said she cleared Class 10 with 8.8 GPA when she was 10 years old. Samhitha added, "I opted for electrical and electronics engineering which I cleared with 8.85 GPA." She further said that she aims to join the power sector after finishing masters in engineering.

headlines: Want to get into startup biz after studying from IIT: JEE topper
text: The all-India topper of JEE Advanced 2018 exam, Haryana's Pranav Goyal on Sunday said that he wants to get into the startup business after studying computer science engineering from IIT Bombay. Goyal topped the exam by scoring 337 marks out of 360. "I knew Iâd be among the top 10, but rank 1 came as a surprise," he added.

headlines: 13 people killed due to heavy rainfall in Kerala
text: At least 13 people have been killed across Kerala amid heavy rainfall this monsoon, with most deaths caused due to drowning. The Meteorological Department has warned of strong winds with a speed of 40-50 kmph in the state in the next 24 hours. Further, fishermen have been advised to not venture into the sea.

headlines: He asked me to come closer to his chair: IAS alleges harassment
text: A 28-year-old Haryana woman IAS officer in a Facebook post has accused a senior officer of sexually harassing her, saying, "He asked me to get up and come closer to his chair." She claimed she was being harassed for "adverse comments on official files." She added her superiors threatened to file complaint against her to spoil her Annual Confidential Report.

headlines: FIR against 46 people for posting emojis in serious chat dismissed
text: The Madras HC on Friday dismissed an FIR against 46 BSNL employees, which stated they posted an emoji of 'crying with laughter' in response to a serious WhatsApp message. Filed by a BSNL divisional engineer from Tamil Nadu, the FIR said that the WhatsApp message pertained to customer complaints. The complainant said she felt "offended" and "humiliated" by the response.

headlines: 45-yr-old widow booked for raping 15-yr-old boy in Andhra
text: The Andhra Pradesh Police has booked a 45-year-old woman for allegedly raping a 15-year-old boy in Vijayawada. Police said the woman, whose husband passed away seven years ago, seemingly sexually abused the victim for over a month. The incident came to light when the victim's mother spotted the accused in their house after she tried to rape the boy again.

headlines: Female Army officers perform yoga at 19,022 feet, set record
text: An all-woman team of Indian Army officers, led by Colonel Omender K Pawar, have scaled Mount Bhagirathi II and set a world record for performing yoga at an altitude of 19,022 feet. The team of nine officers broke the previous record held by the Indian Army for performing yoga at about an altitude of 18,800 feet on the Siachen Glacier.

headlines: Staff overworked, underpaid at Amazon China factory: Report
text: New York-based organisation China Labor Watch has released a report claiming the workers at Amazon's China factory are required to work over 100 hours of monthly overtime, violating Chinese labour laws. The workers are also required to arrive at work 10 minutes before their shift begins, without compensation. Further, the staff dormitories lack adequate fire-safety precautions, the report added.

headlines: Shraddha's 'Batti Gul...' to clash with her 'Stree': Report
text: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's upcoming films 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu' and 'Stree' will release on the same day as both the films are scheduled to release on August 31, as per reports. She will star alongside Shahid Kapoor in 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu' while her co-star in 'Stree' is Rajkummar Rao. Yami Gautam will also feature in 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu'.

headlines: There is no 'Wanted' or 'No Entry' sequel happening: Salman
text: Actor Salman Khan has said that there is no 'Wanted' or 'No Entry' sequel happening. He further named 'Bharat', 'Dabangg 3' and 'Sher Khan' as some of his upcoming films. Salman added, "Then there is a dance film with Remo (D'souza) and one (Sanjay Leela) Bhansali film when he comes and narrates it. We recently discussed it."

headlines: What is this starry thing? Just be yourself: Rajkummar Rao
text: Actor Rajkummar Rao, while talking about how some actors have a 'starry' attitude, said, "What is this starry thing? Why do you have to do it? Just be yourself, man." He added that a 'starry' attitude happens when people take themselves too seriously. "I take my work very seriously but I don't take myself seriously," the actor further said.

headlines: Salma didn't speak of Harvey to protect us: 'Zorro' actor
text: 'The Mask of Zorro' actor Antonio Banderas said Salma Hayek didn't disclose she was sexually harassed by Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein as she "was trying to protect her friends and herself". Salma told Antonio that Harvey was "very powerful and could make or break careers" and she thought if her friends confronted Harvey, they "would pay a very high price".

headlines: Deepika rejects xXx 4 offer because of her marriage: Reports
text: As per reports, Deepika Padukone has rejected the offer to star in 'xXx 4' as she is avoiding taking projects around November owing to her marriage to Ranveer Singh during that time. Reports added that the actress would not be seen in 'xXx 4' unless there is a change in their wedding date.

headlines: Sanjay and Sidharth to star in Prakash Jha's film: Reports
text: Actors Sanjay Dutt and Sidharth Malhotra will star in Prakash Jha's next directorial, as per reports. Reports added that Sanjay has liked the script and will start working on the film by the end of this year. Prakash also reportedly met Sidharth after which the actor agreed to be part of the film.

headlines: B'desh men's team celebrates women's last-ball Asia Cup win
text: Bangladesh men's cricket team opener Tamim Iqbal took to Instagram to share a video of the team celebrating the women's team's Asia Cup final victory against India. In the video, Iqbal can be seen jumping in joy in a dressing room, along with Mashrafe Mortaza, Mustafizur Rahman and others, after watching the women's team clinch victory on the last ball.

headlines: Lightning kills 21-year-old aspiring cricketer in Kolkata
text: A 21-year-old aspiring cricketer died after being struck by lightning during practice at the Calcutta Cricket Academy in Kolkata on Sunday. Debabrata Pal, who was an all-rounder, had joined the academy last month. Club Secretary Abdul Masood revealed that they performed cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) on Pal after he collapsed but he did not respond to it.

headlines: L-G, Delhi Chodo: AAP's campaign for full statehood to Delhi
text: Addressing AAP workers, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said the party will launch a city-wide phased campaign to demand complete statehood for the national capital. Dubbing it the 'L-G, Delhi Chodo' campaign, Kejriwal accused L-G Anil Baijal of creating hurdles for the party's development projects. Party leaders will hold 300 public meetings to ensure that the campaign reaches every house.

headlines: Won't sacrifice state leaders' interests for alliances: Cong
text: Congress MLA Randeep Surjewala has said that while the party has a time-tested policy of working with ideologically compatible parties, it will not abandon its state leaders' interests during the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. He added, "The Indian National Congress will never sacrifice the... aspirations of its workers. An ideal balance will be struck on a state to state basis."

headlines: Musk's Boring Company distributes first 1,000 flamethrowers
text: Elon Musk-led tunnelling startup The Boring Company has distributed the first batch of its 20,000 commercial flamethrowers called 'Not a Flamethrower' to customers at the company's headquarters. Priced at $500 each, the remaining 19,000 flamethrowers will be shipped out in the coming weeks. Earlier in January, Musk sold $3.5 million worth of flamethrowers in less than 24 hours.

headlines: Won't make value judgements on Flipkart-Walmart deal: Prabhu
text: Responding to complaints against the $16-billion Flipkart-Walmart deal, the Minister of Commerce and Industry Suresh Prabhu has said, "We are not making any value judgement on it." Adding that violations are looked into by agencies mandated for them, he said it was the job of Enforcement Directorate (ED) and the RBI to look into the complaints against the deal.

headlines: Day curfew relaxed in Shillong after communal clashes
text: Day curfew in Meghalaya's capital Shillong was relaxed for 11 hours on Sunday to allow people to attend church service, the police said. This comes after no incident of violence was reported in the past 24 hours. Shillong had witnessed communal violence during the past week following an altercation between a Punjabi woman and a Khasi bus conductor.

headlines: 1,000 autos will welcome Rahul Gandhi in Mumbai: Congress
text: Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam has said around 1,000 auto-rickshaw drivers will welcome Congress President Rahul Gandhi in their vehicles during his trip to Mumbai. He added that the drivers' decision depicts the common man's love for Rahul. Nirupam further said, "Rahul ji ensures that the common man's opinions, grievances and inputs not only reach him but also are responded to."

headlines: Amit Shah slams Rahul Gandhi, calls him 'Rahul baba'
text: Slamming Congress President Rahul Gandhi for seeking an account of work done by the BJP-led Central government, BJP chief Amit Shah today said, "Rahul baba, why are you asking for our account of four years? We do not need to give you any account." He asked, "Your family governed the country for...55 years. Why has there not been any development?"

headlines: Which has been the highest scoring match in FIFA WC history?
text: The quarter-final match between Austria and Switzerland in 1954, which produced 12 goals, is the highest scoring match in FIFA World Cup history. Austria defeated the hosts 7-5, with nine of 12 goals coming within the first 40 minutes. The match came to be known as 'Heat battle of Lausanne' due to the high temperature (40Â°C)  it was played under.

headlines: 'Kar Har Maidaan Fateh' song from Ranbir starrer 'Sanju' out
text: A new song titled 'Kar Har Maidaan Fateh' from Ranbir Kapoor starrer 'Sanju' has been released. It has been composed by Vikram Montrose, with vocals by Sukhwinder Singh and Shreya Ghoshal. Shekhar Astitwa has penned the song's lyrics. Written and directed by Rajkumar Hirani, the film also stars Sonam Kapoor, Paresh Rawal, Manisha Koirala, Vicky Kaushal and Dia Mirza.

headlines: Dockless bikes shout warnings when touched without unlocking
text: US-based bicycle-sharing company LimeBike has equipped its dockless electric scooters with built-in alarms that issue verbal warnings when touched without unlocking via its app or paying. The scooters shout 'Unlock me to ride me or I'll call the police!' as a warning to users. However, a LimeBike spokesperson said that the feature did not ever actually call the police.

headlines: Who is Pranav Goyal, the JEE Advanced 2018 topper?
text: Haryana's 17-year-old Pranav Goyal on Sunday topped the JEE Advanced 2018 exam by scoring 337 marks out of 360. An alumnus of Bhavan Vidyalaya in Panchkula, Goyal scored 97.2% in CBSE Class 12 exams and had secured All India Rank 4 in JEE Mains. He scored 350 marks out of 360 in JEE Mains.

headlines: Baby escapes without injuries as cradle blows away with roof
text: A two-month-old baby in Kerala escaped without any injuries on Saturday when the makeshift cradle he was sleeping in, along with the roof of the house, was blown away due to strong winds. The cradle carrying him wedged itself onto a coconut tree adjacent to the house. Following this, the baby was rescued by villagers who heard his mother's cries.

headlines: Father won't rejoin politics: Ex-Prez Mukherjee's daughter
text: Former President Pranab Mukherjee's daughter Sharmistha Mukherjee on Sunday asserted that her father will not enter active politics again. This comes after Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut claimed that RSS might pitch Mukherjee as the prime ministerial candidate in 2019 if the BJP fails to attain majority. Mukherjee had addressed a gathering at the RSS headquarters earlier this week.

headlines: 624/625 marks were insufficient for me: Karnataka Class 10 topper
text: Karnataka Board's Class 10 topper Mohammad Kaif Mulla who scored 625 marks out of 625 after rechecking, on Sunday said, "624 marks were insufficient for me because I expected more". Earlier a joint topper, Mulla scored full marks in Science after rechecking and became the topper with 100%. He is the topper among 13 lakh students of the state board.

headlines: Prince George's cousin shuts him up during UK national anthem
text: A video showing Queen Elizabeth II's great-granddaughter Savannah Phillips covering her cousin Prince George's mouth with her hand to shut him up has gone viral online.
