The incident occurred at the balcony of Buckingham Palace during the Trooping the Colour celebration,  when the British national anthem 'God Save the Queen' was being played.

headlines: Total loss of state-run banks crossed â¹87,000 crore in FY18
text: Public sector banks collectively suffered a net loss of â¹87,357 crore in 2017-18, with PNB posting the highest loss of nearly â¹12,283 crore. Of the 21 state-owned banks, only Indian Bank and Vijaya Bank reported profits during the financial year. All the 21 banks had together reported a net profit of â¹473.72 crore in 2016-17.

headlines: Violence cost India's GDP over $806 bn last year: Report
text: Violence cost the Indian economy $806 billion last year in purchasing power parity terms, which amounts to around $595.4 (â¹40,200) per person, according to the Global Peace Index.nThe economic impact of violence to the global economy was $14.76 trillion in 2017. Notably, India jumped one spot to the 136th rank among 163 countries on the 2018 Global Peace Index.

headlines: Confidence in state-run banks at historic low: Ex-RBI Guv
text: Former RBI Governor YV Reddy has said confidence in the working of state-run lenders is at a historically low level. The doubts about trust in banks can be attributed to rising bad loans due to defaults by the "very rich and very powerful," he added. Referring to the PNB scam, Reddy said it's the taxpayers who pay for the losses.

headlines: Cash with public doubles since note ban to record â¹18.5 tn
text: The currency with the public has reached a record high of over â¹18.5 trillion, more than double from a low of â¹7.8 trillion post demonetisation, RBI data showed. The total currency in circulation has also more than doubled to over â¹19.3 trillion from post-demonetisation low. Notably, the currency with the public stood at about â¹17 trillion before demonetisation.

headlines: Ajay is better than me at pampering Nysa and Yug: Kajol
text: Actress Kajol has said that her husband Ajay Devgn is better than her when it comes to pampering their children Nysa and Yug. "I pamper my kids but there are always limits to it," she added. She further said, "I am very conscious of the rules and their daily routine of sleep and food timing."

headlines: Some B'wood people will never be welcomed in my home: Salman
text: Salman Khan has said that some people from the film industry will never be welcomed in his home. "There are one or two families from whom I have not got that respect and love. That's where it ends," he added. He further said he doesn't have enemies in the industry but it's just that he doesn't like a few people.

headlines: Rashid will create headaches for Indian players: SRH coach
text: SunRisers Hyderabad head coach Tom Moody has said that Afghanistan's 19-year-old leg-spinner Rashid Khan will create "enough headaches" for the Indian batsmen in the upcoming Bengaluru Test. "I am yet to see someone successfully read him...his deception is still a big weapon," he added. Notably, Rashid has taken 35 wickets in just four first-class matches he has played.

headlines: Work timings relaxed in Brazil for people to watch World Cup
text: The Brazilian government will relax the work timings so that the citizens can watch Brazil's FIFA World Cup matches. People will be allowed to report to work by 2 pm on the days when Brazil play in the morning (according to Brazil time). Further, they can leave from work by 1 pm when Brazil have matches in the afternoon.

headlines: Rashid calls Bhogle 'SIR' after earlier terming him as 'bro'
text: Afghanistan's 19-year-old spinner Rashid Khan termed 56-year-old commentator Harsha Bhogle as 'SIR' after having earlier referred to him as 'bro' in one of his tweets. Bhogle on Saturday tweeted that he had no problem in being called 'bro' by the 19-year-old despite the age difference. Reacting to his tweet, Rashid wrote, "Thank you (Harsha Bhogle) SIR.

headlines: Apple may introduce touch-sensitive side buttons for Watch
text: Apple is reportedly replacing the physical buttons in Apple Watch with solid-state side buttons which are touch-sensitive. The new buttons will not physically click but instead, reacts to a user's touch through a haptic feedback similar to iPhone 7 home button. The new buttons are expected to be announced later this year or in the 2019 Apple Watch, reports added.

headlines: BJP suffering because of PM Modi's ego: Andhra CM Naidu
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu has said that the BJP is suffering because of PM Narendra Modi's ego, adding that the party is "running from pillar to post to keep the NDA flock together." Stating that he respected PM Modi despite being senior to him in politics, Naidu said PM Modi wanted to keep all alliance partners under his control.

headlines: Conflict with L-G no excuse to not work: Dikshit to AAP govt
text: Congress leader and former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit has slammed the Delhi government, stating that a conflict with the Centre or Lieutenant Governor cannot be an excuse to not work. "Public wants governance not complaints," she added. In his reply, incumbent CM Arvind Kejriwal challenged the former three-time CM to run the Delhi government under PM Narendra Modi-led Centre's regime.

headlines: RSS may name ex-Prez Pranab as PM candidate in 2019: Sena MP
text: Slamming RSS for inviting ex-President Pranab Mukherjee to its event, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said the organisation could be preparing to put him forward as PM candidate in 2019 if BJP fails to get majority. Meanwhile, an editorial in Shiv Sena's newspaper 'Saamana' claimed that RSS never invited late Bal Thackeray because he believed in "expansive Hinduism".

headlines: Sasikala's estranged brother launches new political party
text: V Dhivakaran, the estranged brother of deposed AIADMK leader VK Sasikala, launched a political party named 'Anna Dravidar Kazhagam' in Tamil Nadu today. The party, named after Dravidian veteran CN Annadurai, has a party flag featuring a green star and red and black stripes. Notably, Dhivakaran fell out of favour with Sasikala following a spat with their nephew TTV Dhinakaran.

headlines: Chose race car over big house after 1st company sale: Musk
text: While talking about his first company being sold 19 years ago, billionaire Elon Musk on Saturday said, "I had to decide between buying a house in Palo Alto or a McLaren F1." Adding that there was no contest about it, Musk said that he bought the F1 and a small condo that was much cheaper than the car.

headlines: Hyd woman dies in Saudi, family asks Swaraj for probe
text: The family of a woman from Hyderabad has asked External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj for a probe after the woman died under allegedly suspicious circumstances in Saudi Arabia's Dammam. The woman's sister has claimed that her husband would torture her mentally and physically and used to beat her up. She added that she suspected he had murdered her.

headlines: Only PM Modi, CM Yogi are incorruptible in BJP: Party leader
text: BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan on Saturday said that only Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath are incorruptible. Adding that he cannot say the same about other leaders in the party, Sharan said, "Our Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath do not indulge in any kind of corruption."

headlines: Delhi CM Kejriwal accuses CBI, ACB of trying to frame him
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has accused the CBI and Anti-Corruption Branch of randomly picking files from the Delhi Jal Board, of which he is the minister-in-charge, to "somehow frame" him "in something". Asking the agencies to explain the reason or "apologise to Delhiites for this witch-hunting exercise", Kejriwal further said he will release the list of files sought by them.

headlines: 'Doors open' for alliance in MP, says Congress' Scindia
text: Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia has said Congress' "doors are open" for an alliance in Madhya Pradesh and that seat sharing won't be a "speed breaker" for like-minded parties to come together. Scindia, whose remarks come amid reports of a Congress-BSP tie-up, added, "(CM) Shivraj Singh Chouhan should worry about his own party rather than being so concerned about the Congress."

headlines: Kim Jong-un arrives in Singapore for summit with Trump
text: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un arrived in Singapore on Sunday for his historic summit with US President Donald Trump on June 12. The trip to Singapore represents the farthest Kim has traveled from North Korea since taking power after his father's death in 2011. He will meet Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong later in the day.

headlines: Jacqueline suffers permanent eye injury during Race 3 shoot
text: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez suffered a permanent eye injury while playing squash during the shooting schedule of her upcoming film 'Race 3'. She shared a picture of her eye with the caption, "So it's a permanent injury...My iris will never be a perfect round again but so... grateful I can see." Some users commented it was her pupil that looked damaged.

headlines: Virgin Hyperloop One may allow riders to see through tubes
text: Richard Branson-led Virgin Hyperloop One has shared a video demonstrating a concept to allow riders to see through Hyperloop tubes. In the video, the tube through which the 'pod' moves, is shown to have windows placed at every 10 metres. As the pod will gain speed, the windows will pass quicker and smoothen out while reaching 1,200 kmph target speed.

headlines: I came to North America at 17 with $2,000: Billionaire Elon Musk
text: The South African-born billionaire CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, Elon Musk on Sunday said that he arrived in North America when he was 17 years old, with $2,000 cash, a backpack and a suitcase full of books. Adding that he paid his way through college, he revealed he dropped out of Stanford University with $1,10,000 in college debt.

headlines: Railways installs first-ever food vending machine in train
text: The Indian Railways has installed a tablet-operated automatic food vending machine in the newly-launched double-decker Coimbatore-Bengaluru UDAY Express. The machine offers snacks and beverages like biscuits, chips, aerated drinks and tea/coffee. The train is also equipped with an infotainment system with Wi-Fi, GPS-based passenger information system and an exclusive dining area for passengers.

headlines: 26 students from Anand Kumar's Super 30 clear JEE Advanced
text: As many as 26 out of 30 students from the 'Super 30' coaching institute run by mathematician Anand Kumar in Bihar's Patna have cleared 2018 JEE (Advanced). Of the 480 students from the institute, 422 have cleared the exam since 2002. Kumar provides free coaching, along with accommodation and food, to 30 underprivileged students every year.

headlines: Congress HQ in Kerala put for sale on OLX for â¹10,000
text: The Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee headquarters in Thiruvananthapuram was listed for 'sale' on OLX for â¹10,000 by a user named Aniesh on Saturday. The post requested interested buyers to contact Indian Union Muslim League or Kerala Congress (Mani). This comes after several Congress leaders opposed the party's decision to back Kerala Congress (Mani) for elections to a Rajya Sabha seat.

headlines: Violence led to loss of â¹40,000 per person in India: Report
text: The impact of violence in 2017 led to a loss of over â¹80 lakh crore to India's GDP, or â¹40,000 per person, according to a Institute of Economics and Peace report. In contrast, the impact was over 12 times more on the global economy. The report, which analysed 163 countries, listed Syria as most affected with 68% loss to GDP.

headlines: Valedictorian's mic cut while talking about sexual assault
text: A high school in California, US, cut its valedictorian's microphone after she began talking about the alleged mishandling of cases of sexual misconduct by members of the school community. A video of the incident showed the audience applauding her and chanting "let her speak". The student later posted an "uncensored" version of her speech.

headlines: Pic of Merkel staring at Trump during G7 summit goes viral
text: A picture of German Chancellor Angela Merkel staring directly at US President Donald Trump during the G7 summit has gone viral. The picture was shared on Merkel's Instagram account. Reacting to the picture, a Twitter user wrote, "She knows how to send a message," while another tweeted, "The woman leader of the free world telling Trump how it is."

headlines: Nothing Trump is doing will make the world better: Germany
text: Commenting on US President Donald Trump's trade policies and his Iran nuclear deal withdrawal, German Foreign Minister Heiko Maas has said nothing Trump is doing will "make the world better, safer or more peaceful". Adding that the only answer to 'America First' is 'Europe United', Maas said, "Trump knows that what he is doing is of direct detriment to Europe."

headlines: Ambani family earned â¹14,500 cr in dividend income in 10 yrs
text: Mukesh Ambani's family, being the promoter and single-largest shareholder of Reliance Industries, earned a cumulative â¹14,553 crore as dividend income in 10 years, according to BloombergQuint. The dividend income nearly doubled from â¹927 crore in 2008 to â¹1,804 crore in 2018. Notably, Mukesh Ambani has capped his annual salary from the company at â¹15 crore for the tenth consecutive year.

headlines: 5 yrs today, miss you dad: Priyanka on dad's death anniversary
text: Remembering her father Dr Ashok Chopra on his death anniversary, Priyanka Chopra shared a video on Instagram with the caption, "5 years today. Miss you dad." The video starts with the text, "(My dad) was the man of my life." It ends with Ashok's picture followed by the text, "He made his little girl believe that she could be anything."

headlines: New poster of Janhvi and Ishaan starrer 'Dhadak' unveiled
text: A new poster of Janhvi Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter starrer 'Dhadak' has been unveiled. Directed by Shashank Khaitan and co-produced by Karan Johar, the film is reportedly remake of the 2016 Marathi film 'Sairat'. 'Dhadak' will be Janhvi's debut film while Ishaan's second as he earlier starred in Majid Majidi's 'Beyond The Clouds'. 'Dhadak' will release on July 20.

headlines: Indians 3rd highest WC ticket buyers in non-playing nations
text: Indian fans have bought the third-highest number of tickets, behind USA and China, for the upcoming FIFA World Cup 2018 among the nations which are not participating in the tournament. While USA is topping the chart with 86,710 tickets, China comes in second place with 39,884 tickets and Indian football fans are at the third spot with 17,962 tickets bought.

headlines: Inzamam once changed field to let me hit a six: Sehwag
text: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag has revealed that Pakistan's then captain Inzamam-ul-Haq once changed a fielder's position from long on for one ball on his request so that he could hit a six. Sehwag, who hit a six after the field change, said when bowler Danish Kaneria questioned Inzamam about the change, Inzamam told Kaneria to go back and bowl.

headlines: 6-time reigning champs India fail to defend Women's Asia Cup
text: Six-time reigning champions India failed to defend the Women's Asia Cup after suffering a three-wicket defeat on the last ball against Bangladesh in the final at Kuala Lumpur on Sunday. This was the second time Bangladesh defeated India in this edition of Asia Cup. Both of Indian women's team's defeats in the 14-year history of Asia Cup occurred this year.

headlines: Afridi posts pic of daughter with chained lion in background
text: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi shared a couple of photos on his official social media accounts, one being of his daughter copying his wicket-taking celebration with a chained lion lying in the background. Afridi posted another photo of him feeding a baby deer, captioned, "And yes don't forget to take care of animals, they too deserve our love and care".

headlines: Delhi Speaker hosts Iftar party, doesn't invite L-G Baijal
text: Amid an ongoing tussle between legislators and Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal, Delhi Assembly Speaker Ram Niwas Goel didn't invite Baijal to the Iftar party he hosted on Saturday. The Speaker said he had invited the Lieutenant Governor last year but he had not attended it. Saturday's event was attended by CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, among others.

headlines: New Roadsters to have SpaceX-inspired rocket thrusters: Musk
text: Electric carmaker Tesla's CEO Elon Musk has said that the next-generation Tesla Roadster will have an optional 'SpaceX package' that will include around '10 small rocket thrusters'. He also said these "rocket engines" which would be "arranged seamlessly around car", will improve acceleration, top speed, braking, and cornering. "Maybe they will even allow a Tesla to fly," he added.

headlines: Bihar govt plans ban on chewing tobacco on health grounds
text: The Bihar government is planning to ban khaini, or chewing tobacco, on health grounds. "We need to crack down on khaini as every fifth person in the state is said to be addicted to it," Principal Secretary (Health) Sanjay Kumar said. The state has written to the Centre to notify khaini as a food product in order to ban it.

headlines: Environment Ministry approves Delhi airport expansion plan
text: The Union Environment Ministry has approved the proposal for the expansion of Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport. The expansion will increase the overall capacity of the airport to 85 million per annum as against the current 70 million per annum. Further, phase two of the expansion will include the construction of a new terminal.

headlines: Bihar to get specially-trained dogs to sniff out alcohol
text: To help enforce the liquor ban in the state, Bihar Police has requisitioned 20 specially-trained puppies from Telangana to sniff out alcohol. The puppies would be trained for 8-9 months in Telangana and then be drafted to sharpen campaign against illegal stocking of alcohol in Bihar, officials said. The dogs would be distributed in all four police zones of Bihar.

headlines: Maharashtra most vulnerable state in disaster risk index
text: Maharashtra has been ranked the most vulnerable state in the draft National Disaster Risk Index, followed by West Bengal and Uttar Pradesh. States like Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh that are prone to natural calamities have been ranked relatively lower. Few factors taken into consideration were exposure of population, agriculture and livestock, environmental risk and economic vulnerabilities.

headlines: PM Modi shakes hands with Pak Prez at SCO summit in China
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday shook hands with Pakistan President Mamnoon Hussain after signing of agreements at Shanghai Cooperation Organisation in China. Earlier, PM Modi met Chinese President Xi Jinping and signed an agreement allowing India to export non-Basmati rice to China. Another agreement was signed under which China will share hydrological data on Brahmaputra river with India.

headlines: Trump and Kim lookalikes hold summit in Singapore
text: Ahead of the talks between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un on June 12, lookalikes of the two world leaders held a summit of their own at a mall in Singapore. The event was dubbed the 'real' Trump-Kim summit. The duo had earlier appeared at the PyeongChang Winter Olympics in South Korea.

headlines: Army foils infiltration bid, kills 6 terrorists in J&K
text: The Army on Sunday killed six terrorists while foiling an infiltration bid along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district. The operation is still in progress, a spokesman said. Notably, this is the third infiltration foiled by security forces in the Keran sector of Kupwara district after the Ramadan unilateral ceasefire.

headlines: Pranav Goyal tops JEE Advanced exam 2018
text: Pranav Goyal from Roorkee zone has secured the All India Rank 1 in the JEE Advanced examination 2018, while Meenal Parakh from Delhi, who secured the 6th rank, is the topper among girls. Over 1.6 lakh students appeared for the exam conducted on May 20. Over 10.74 lakh aspirants had appeared for the JEE Main examination.

headlines: Priyanka apologises as Quantico shows Indians as terrorists
text: Responding to criticism over an episode in her American TV show 'Quantico' which showed 'Indian terrorists' framing Pakistan for trying to blow up Manhattan in New York, Priyanka Chopra tweeted, "I'm a proud Indian and that will never change." "I'm extremely saddened and sorry that some sentiments have been hurt...That was not and would never be my intention," she added.

headlines: 26 people killed by dust storms, lightning strikes in UP
text: As many as 26 people were killed by dust storms and lightning strikes in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday. CM Yogi Adityanath has directed the district magistrates of the affected areas to immediately provide compensation to the families of those killed. He added that the state government will extend all possible help to those hit by dust storms and related incidents.

headlines: Paresh to play National Security Advisor Ajit Doval in 'Uri'
text: Actor Paresh Rawal will be seen portraying the role of National Security Advisor Ajit Doval in the upcoming film 'Uri'. The actor took to Twitter and shared his look from the film with the caption, "Proud to be playing our hero." Written and directed by Aditya Dhar, the film also stars Yami Gautam and Vicky Kaushal.

headlines: Mahatma Gandhi's son stayed in jail to watch Don Bradman bat
text: The youngest son of Mahatma Gandhi, Devdas, was in England when Australian legend Don Bradman toured the country for the last time. After failing to find accommodation in Nottingham, Devdas convinced the warden of a local prison to let him spend the night there on June 10, 1948. He finally managed to watch Bradman bat at Nottingham's Trent Bridge stadium.

headlines: Nipah virus contained, no need to run from anywhere: MoS
text: Union Minister of State for Health Ashwini Choubey on Saturday said that the Nipah virus has been contained in Kerala and there is no need to "run from anywhere". Adding that the virus is not an epidemic, Choubey said, "There is no need for the general public to be apprehensive about the safety of individuals and their family members."

headlines: Man dies in Delhi hospital after treatment by fake doctor
text: A 45-year-old man died at a hospital in Delhi after he was treated by a fake doctor, who gave him wrong medication and injections, reports said. The hospital, which was not registered with the Delhi government, has now been shut down. The accused has been booked for murder and admitted that he got fake medical degrees through a friend.

headlines: Will know in first minute if Kim summit will succeed: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said he will know "in the first minute" whether his summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un will be successful. He further said that Kim is "going to surprise on the upside". "And if I think it won't happen, I'm not going to waste my time. I don't want to waste his time," he added.

headlines: US President Trump arrives late at G7 summit, leaves early
text: US President Donald Trump arrived several minutes after the start of the G7 meeting on women's empowerment. He missed Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's introductory statement at the meeting and entered the room while Canada's ambassador to France Isabelle Hudon was speaking. Trump then left the meeting early to head to Singapore for his summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un.

headlines: Trump calls Trudeau weak, refuses to endorse G7 statement
text: Following the G7 summit in Canada, US President Donald Trump called Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau "dishonest" and "weak" for his remarks on tariffs imposed by the US on metal imports from Canada. "Trudeau acted so meek and mild," he said. Trump also said that the US will not sign a previously agreed summit communique.

headlines: Man jumps to death at Mecca's Grand Mosque
text: A man jumped off the roof of the Grand Mosque in the Muslim holy city of Mecca on Friday. His body was sent to a local hospital and an investigation into the incident and the man's motives has been launched. Last year, a Saudi man was held by police as he was trying to set himself ablaze at the mosque.

headlines: We are not selling, we will never sell Prada: CEO
text: Denying reports that he intends to sell the company, Italy's biggest luxury goods group Prada's CEO Patrizio Bertelli has said, "We are not selling, we will never sell." Bertelli's family owns majority 80% stake in Prada. He added that his 30-year-old son Lorenzo is getting ready to become the head of Prada one day if he wants to.

headlines: Pic of Chinese woman cooking fish on car bonnet goes viral
text: A picture of a Chinese woman cooking fish on a car bonnet amid rising temperatures has gone viral. The woman can be seen frying fish and vegetables, while sheltering herself from the heat with an umbrella. She was photographed in the country's Shandong province, where temperatures hit close to 40 degrees Celsius.

headlines: Disha Patani to play Salman's sister in 'Bharat': Reports
text: Disha Patani is set to play the role of the sister of Salman Khan's character in 'Bharat', as per reports. She will reportedly be playing the role of a trapeze artiste in a 1960s circus in the film, which is an adaptation of 2014 South Korean movie 'Ode to My Father'. The film will release on Eid next year.

headlines: Warner to commentate during Eng-Aus ODI post ball-tampering
text: Former Australian vice-captain David Warner, who was handed a ban for being involved in the ball-tampering scandal in South Africa, is set to commentate during an Australia-England ODI this month. "He just wants to atone for his mistakes and move on, I hope Australia gives all of them that chance," the broadcaster's director of sports said.

headlines: If female models earn more then so should male players: Nadal
text: Rafael Nadal has said that if female supermodels earn more than their male counterparts then in the same way male tennis players should earn more than female players as they gather more audience. "It's a comparison we shouldn't even make. Female models earn more than male models and nobody says anything. Why? Because they have a larger following," Nadal added.

headlines: Karthik was red with anger before his 8-ball 29 in final: Rohit
text: India's then stand-in captain Rohit Sharma revealed that during Nidahas Trophy final, he calmed Dinesh Karthik down, who was "red with anger" before his 8-ball 29 including match-winning last-ball six. Rohit said Karthik told him he should have batted up the order, following which Rohit told him he is an experienced batsman and should face experienced bowlers towards the finish.

headlines: Comparisons with Messi, Ronaldo unfair: Sunil Chhetri
text: Indian football captain Sunil Chhetri has said that comparisons with Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, who are above him on the list of highest active goalscorers, are unfair. "The two players who are above me are completely world stars... There is a massive difference between them and us. There is no comparison at all," Chhetri said.

headlines: UP CM grants â¹4.5 lakh to 19-yr-old shooter for Jr World Cup
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath granted â¹4.5 lakh to 19-year-old shooter Priya Singh to help her participate in the International Shooting Sports Federation (ISSF) Junior World Cup in Germany. The 19-year-old, who is a daughter of a Dalit labourer from Meerut, was one of the six candidates selected for the 50-metre rifle prone ISSF Junior World Cup event.

headlines: CM Yogi ordered damage to ex-CM's govt bungalow: SP leader
text: Samajwadi Party leader Sunil Yadav has alleged that the damages inside the government bungalow recently vacated by former CM Akhilesh Yadav were ordered by CM Yogi Adityanath himself. "This was done just to malign Akhilesh Yadav's image in public because CM is frustrated after losing a series of bypolls," the Samajwadi Party leader said.

headlines: Want Arjun to rule Hastinapur, leave for Dwarka: Tej Pratap
text: RJD patriarch Lalu Prasad Yadav's elder son Tej Pratap tweeted that he wanted to make Arjun, purportedly a reference to his younger brother Tejashwi, takeover the reins of Hastinapur and himself leave for Dwarka. The tweet led to reports that Tej was upset at being "sidelined" as the top party leadership shifted loyalty towards Tejashwi in Lalu's absence.

headlines: Delhi gangster killed in encounter had murdered father at age 11
text: One of the most wanted criminals, Rajesh Bharti, who was killed in a shootout by the Delhi Police on Saturday, had murdered his father when he was 11 years old. A resident of Haryana's Jind, Bharti then spent a few months at a juvenile detention centre. Police suspect he stabbed his father after the latter thrashed him for gambling.

headlines: Man slits 4-yr-old daughter's throat as sacrifice for God
text: A 26-year-old man in Rajasthan's Pipar City has been arrested after he confessed to slitting his four-year-old daughter's throat as sacrifice to please God during Ramadan. The man made her sit on his lap in their verandah and then recited verses from the Quran before slitting her throat. He later said that he felt like he was overtaken by Satan.

headlines: RSS, Gadkari planning PM Modi's murder: JNU student leader
text: JNU student leader Shehla Rashid has tweeted that RSS and Union Minister Nitin Gadkari are plotting a "Rajiv Gandhi style" assassination of PM Narendra Modi. The tweet was purportedly in reference to recent claims that Maoists were planning a "Rajiv Gandhi-type incident" to assassinate PM Modi. Gadkari later threatened legal action "against anti-social elements" making "bizarre comments".

headlines: Elephant named 'Laden' maybe declared rogue for killing 37
text: A forest officer has asked the Assam forest department to declare an elephant named 'Laden' in Goalpara forest as rogue on suspicion that he has killed 37 people since 2016. Locals said the name 'Laden' comes from the elephant's "unusually big size". He mostly attacks at the end of the month and then goes untraceable for 15-20 days, officials said.

headlines: Cong leader likens ex-Prez's fake photo to Nazi propaganda
text: Referring to former President Pranab Mukherjee's morphed photo at an RSS event, Congress leader Manish Tewari said, "[A]s the Nazi Propaganda Minister Joseph Goebbels famously quipped you speak a lie a thousand times it will become the truth." He added that the morphed picture of the former President was for posterity and not for today.

headlines: Video of couple having sex on Mumbai road divider goes viral
text: A video showing a couple seemingly having sex on a road divider in Mumbai has gone viral. The couple disentangled themselves, adjusted their clothes and crossed the road to the other side after the police arrived at the scene. While the man, a foreign national, escaped, the woman was caught by the police and is suspected to be mentally unstable.

headlines: Gangster assigned to kill Salman monitored him for 2 days: Police
text: Actor Salman Khan was among the targets of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang and gangster Sampat Nehra had been assigned to kill him, as per Haryana Police. Sampat went to Mumbai for two days and clicked photographs, took note of the actor's movement around the balcony and house in Galaxy Apartment, possibly to assess the distance and weapon required, added the police.

headlines: Celeb chef Anthony hung himself with bathrobe belt, no foul play in suicide
text: Celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain hung himself in his hotel room in France using a bathrobe belt and no foul play has been suspected in his suicide, as per French prosecutors. Prosecutor Christian de Rocquigny stated there was no element that made them suspect that someone came into Anthony's room. Rocquigny added there were no signs of violence on Anthony's body.

headlines: Meghan Markle wears â¹3-lakh dress to Queen's birthday
text: Newlywed Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle wore a â¹3.08-lakh dress by Carolina Herrera for Queen Elizabeth II's 92nd official birthday on Saturday. Markle, who was making her first public appearance after her honeymoon with Prince Harry, paired the dress with a Philip Treacy hat. While June 9 marks the Queen's official birthday, her actual birthday is on April 21.

headlines: Rejected â¹50L offer from Bigg Boss: J&K man used as human shield
text: The 29-year-old Jammu and Kashmir man, who was tied to an Army Major's jeep as a 'human shield' during a stone pelting incident, claimed he rejected a â¹50 lakh offer by the producers of Bigg Boss. While TV channel Colors termed Farooq Ahmad Dar's claim "speculation", the International Forum for Justice confirmed he was offered the reality show last year.

headlines: Release of Rajinikanth starrer '2.0' postponed to 2019: Report
text: The release date of Rajinikanth and Akshay Kumar starrer '2.0' has been postponed to 2019, as per reports. Reports added that the visual effects work on the film which is still pending has caused the delay in the film's release and has also affected the budget of the film. The new release date will reportedly be announced later this year.

headlines: Upset Congress, JD(S) leaders eager to join BJP: Yeddyurappa
text: Addressing BJP workers in Karnataka, party leader BS Yeddyurappa claimed that several "disgruntled" leaders from Congress and JD(S) are eager to join the BJP. He added that it was BJP's responsibility to induct the disgruntled leaders and strengthen the party in every constituency. This comes amid reports of Congress and JD(S) MLAs being unhappy with portfolio allocation.

headlines: Trinamool Congress worker hacked to death in West Bengal
text: A Trinamool Congress worker was allegedly hacked to death in West Bengal's Howrah district on Saturday. While the TMC blamed the BJP for the murder, the BJP said, "The TMC has turned West Bengal into Afghanistan (by) murdering people throughout the state." The murder comes amid the death of several BJP and TMC workers in the state under mysterious circumstances.

headlines: Jack Ma's Ant Financial's valuation now twice more than Uber
text: Jack Ma-led Alibaba's affiliate Ant Financial now has a valuation of $150 billion, which is more than double the valuation of Uber ($62 billion), according to reports. This comes after Ant Financial raised around $14 billion from investors including US-based private equity firm Warburg Pincus. The funding has made Ant Financial the world's largest fintech company, according to Bloomberg.

headlines: What's the SCO summit which India is attending for 1st time?
text: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) is an intergovernmental international organisation which came into force in 2003. It consists of eight member statesâIndia, Kazakhstan, China, Kyrgyzstan, Pakistan, Russia, Tajikistan, and Uzbekistanâand is seen as a counter to the NATO. PM Narendra Modi is the first Indian PM to attend the summit after India became a full member in 2017.

headlines: 27 flights diverted as dust storm hits Delhi
text: As many as 27 incoming flights were diverted from Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after a dust storm hit the national capital on Saturday. An airport official added that normalcy in operations was restored after the flights were diverted. A wind speed of up to 70-80 kmph was recorded in the city along with moderate to heavy rainfall.

headlines: 13-yr-old kills 3-yr-old after failing to rape her in UP
text: Police on Friday arrested a 13-year-old boy for murdering his three-year-old female neighbour after failing to rape her in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida. Police said the accused tried to rape the victim after watching a porn video on his uncle's mobile phone. CCTV footage confirms that the boy lured the victim to a secluded spot.

headlines: Got 1 mark in Bihar board exam despite passing JEE: Students
text: Students have alleged discrepancies in evaluation in Bihar state board's Class 12 exams, claiming that they received 1 or 2 marks out of 100 marks in subjects such as Physics and Chemistry despite clearing JEE (Main) examinations. "I was given 68 on 50 marks in English theory and 38 marks on 35 in Physics theory," a student claimed.

headlines: China Prez Xi accepts PM Modi's invite for informal summit
text: Chinese President Xi Jinping has accepted PM Narendra Modi's invitation for an informal summit in India next year, the Ministry of External Affairs said. The two leaders had met for their first informal summit in the Chinese city of Wuhan in April. PM Modi met President Xi on Saturday along the sidelines of the two-day Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit.

headlines: Singapore summit is a 'one-time shot' for Kim Jong-un: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Saturday said that the upcoming Singapore summit will be a "one-time shot" for North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. Calling the summit a "mission of peace", Trump added it was an opportunity for Kim to do something for his people. He further said North Korea had been working "very well" in the build-up to the summit.

headlines: Won't allow our soil's use against India: Nepal Army Chief
text: Nepal's Army Chief General Rajendra Chhetri has said his country would never let its soil to be used against India. He added that as a neighbour, India's interests was Nepal's top priority. Chhetri was the chief guest at the Indian Military Academy (IMA) passing-out parade in Dehradun on Saturday.

headlines: US is like a piggy bank that everyone is robbing: Trump
text: Slamming nations against their "brutal" approach in conducting trade with his country, President Donald Trump on Saturday said that the US is like a "piggy bank that everyone is robbing". Trump further criticised former US Presidents for their foreign trade policies and called for "fair and reciprocal" trade practices.

headlines: I was told I won't get films after marriage: Kareena Kapoor
text: Kareena Kapoor said she was told she would not get films after marriage, while adding that she changed the norm. Talking about being a working mother, Kareena added, "I want to ace that balancing act." She further said she and husband Saif Ali Khan agreed to do one film each in a year to balance time for their son Taimur.

headlines: Good script should be like book that is unputdownable: Kajol
text: Actress Kajol said a good script should be like a book that is unputdownable. "I believe a good script should be like one of those books that you read till 4 AM and you know you have to get up at 7 AM and go to work," added Kajol. She further said she wants roles that leave a strong impact.

headlines: Sunil Chhetri gets upset as fan throws Indian flag at him
text: A video of a fan throwing the Indian flag at Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri after an Intercontinental Cup match has surfaced online. In the video, Chhetri appears to be upset with the fan's action and asks the crowd to not do such things. The 33-year-old also appeared to be angry at an official who stepped on the flag.

headlines: We have better spinners than India: Afghanistan captain
text: Asghar Stanikzai, who will lead Afghanistan in their maiden Test against India next week, has said they have better spinners than India. "We'll have a tough time, for us and for them too. It won't be easy for either team," he added. "(Test cricket) is a new frontier for (Rashid Khan). I'm sure he will conquer it," he further said.

headlines: I am depressed: Uncapped cricketer who won 4 awards in 4 yrs
text: Kerala all-rounder Jalaj Saxena, who has won four BCCI awards in last four years, has said he is depressed as he has not even received an India A call. "You are giving an award but there is no reward...This only seems more like an insult to me," added the 31-year-old, who was the highest wicket-taker in Ranji Trophy last year.

headlines: Sachin just shook my hand, moved on when we 1st met: Sehwag
text: Ex-Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag has revealed when he first met Sachin Tendulkar, the latter just shook his hand and went ahead. "(I thought) I worship him and he just said 'hi' and went his way," Sehwag said. "When I met him for the first time, my perception was that he likes me as much as I like him," he added.

headlines: 78-year-old Polish fan to attend his 11th FIFA World Cup
text: Andrzej Bobowski, a 78-year-old Polish fan, is set to attend his 11th FIFA World Cup at the upcoming edition in Russia. Bobowski has watched 135 World Cup matches in the stadiums since his visit to Argentina in 1978 with a ticket bought by his then wife. Indian couple Pannalal and Chaitali Chatterjee will attend their 10th World Cup in Russia.

headlines: Listened to Sehwag, then got stumped for first time: Sachin
text: Sachin Tendulkar recalled that following Virender Sehwag's advice to attack England's bowling, he stepped out to hit a shot and missed a turning ball to be stumped for the first time in Tests. The former Mumbai cricketer added that although listening to Sehwag's advice led to the dismissal, he does not blame his former opening partner for it.

headlines: Ukrainian model arrested in India over no visa released
text: A 20-year-old Ukrainian model, who was arrested from an Uttar Pradesh hotel in April for not possessing a valid visa and other documents, was released from a Gorakhpur jail on Friday. Daria Molcha said she entered India through Nepal after she was blacklisted and deported by India in December 2017. She has been sent to the Ukrainian embassy.

headlines: Important for India to address banking sector crisis: IMF
text: It is important for India to address the ongoing crisis in the banking sector to support investment and inclusive growth agenda, International Monetary Fund spokesperson Gerry Rice has said. "Steps include the recognition of these non-performing assets, the resolution framework under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code," he added. Notably, the non-performing assets touched â¹8.41 trillion at December 2017 end.

headlines: World no. 1 Halep wins French Open, clinches 1st Grand Slam
text: World number one Romania's Simona Halep won her maiden Grand Slam title after defeating world number 10 USA's Sloane Stephens in the French Open women's singles final on Saturday. The 26-year-old was playing her third Roland Garros final, after having finished as runner-up in 2014 and 2017. Halep had also ended as runner-up at Australian Open in January.

headlines: First 'Bond girl' Eunice Gayson from Dr. No passes away at 90
text: Actress Eunice Gayson, the first to be officially considered a 'Bond girl', has passed away aged 90. Eunice portrayed the character Sylvia Trench in the 1962 film 'Dr. No', the maiden film for the spy character James Bond, and the second film 'From Russia with Love'. The iconic phrase, "Bond, James Bond" was enacted during a scene with Eunice.

headlines: Sachin behind Dhoni coming before Yuvraj in WC final: Sehwag
text: Virender Sehwag has revealed that Sachin Tendulkar suggested MS Dhoni's promotion in the 2011 World Cup final despite Yuvraj Singh being in good form. Sehwag added when Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir were batting, Sachin directly passed a message to Dhoni for the first time. "Sachin told MS...if righty gets out...go for righty and if lefty...go for lefty," he added.

headlines: 22-year-old Indian boxer defeats 2016 Olympic champion
text: Indian boxer NT Lalbiakkima defeated the 2016 Olympic champion Hasanboy Dusmatov in the 49-kg category quarter-final of the Kazakhstan President's Cup on Friday. The 22-year-old secured a 4-1 victory to assure himself of a medal at the tournament. Notably, the Mizoram-born boxer has never even won a national title at any age category.

headlines: KFC to test vegetarian 'fried chicken' in UK
text: KFC has said it is testing vegetarian 'fried chicken' in the UK with signature blend of herbs and spices. "Development of the recipe is still in its very early stages, and so the options we're exploring in our kitchen are still top secret," a KFC spokesperson said. The fast food chain plans to launch the chicken-like "vegetarian options" in 2019.

headlines: Class 8 pass made Karnataka's higher education minister
text: The qualification of JD(S) minister GT Devegowda, who has been given the higher education portfolio in Karnataka's newly-formed cabinet's expansion, is Class 8 pass. On the portfolio allotment to him, Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said, "What have I studied? I'm working as the chief minister!" Reports claim Devegowda, who was eyeing key portfolios, is unhappy with his portfolio.

headlines: ACs, bathroom fittings missing from Akhilesh Yadav's vacated bungalow
text: Former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav has been accused of destroying government property after ACs, imported bathroom fittings and other costly items went missing from the Lucknow bungalow he vacated recently. He was asked to vacate the bungalow by Supreme Court. Admitting the damage caused to the bungalow, Yadav promised to return the missing items if the government provides a list.

headlines: Tesla shareholder files case against Musk on $2.6 bn package
text: A Tesla shareholder has filed a lawsuit in the US against the company's CEO Elon Musk, seeking to overhaul his $2.6 billion compensation package, which was approved in March. The "compensation plan is so large it dwarfs the pay package of every other public company CEO," the lawsuit said. Notably, Musk's package is tied to Tesla's market cap goals.

headlines: Accounts named 'Paytm Girl' offering sex chat surface online
text: Several accounts with variants of the name 'Paytm Girl' have surfaced on different social media platforms including Instagram, primarily focused to offer sex services. These accounts reportedly provide a variety of remote sexual services in exchange for payments through digital wallet Paytm. Some of these accounts are even accepting payments through Flipkart's PhonePe app.

headlines: Amazon delivery boy starts own venture, earns â¹1L per month
text: Raghuvir Chaudhary, who formerly worked as a delivery boy at Amazon and received a monthly salary of â¹9,000, started his own venture and now earns â¹1 lakh per month, according to YourStory. Chaudhary's startup delivers snacks and tea through four centres in Jaipur. He conceived the idea when he used to deliver packages and couldn't find tea spots during breaks.

headlines: Indian minor married to 77-yr-old Omani man happy: Oman
text: Responding to the Indian embassy in Oman's request to aid the return of a minor Hyderabad girl who was married to a 77-year-old Omani national, Omani authorities said the girl was happy with her husband. Authorities added she didn't wish to return to India. Her family members were arrested last year for selling her to the 77-year-old for â¹5 lakh.

headlines: Consider asking media to not use word 'Dalit': HC to Govt
text: The Bombay High Court has asked the Information and Broadcasting Ministry to consider asking the media to not use the word 'Dalit' within the next six weeks. This comes after the Social Justice and Empowerment Ministry advised central and state governments to avoid using the word 'Dalit' in all communications and instead use the phrase 'person belonging to Scheduled Caste'.

headlines: Cheque given by UP CM to rank holder bounces, student pays fine
text: A â¹1-lakh cheque given to a class 10 student by Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath for achieving seventh position in the state board examinations has bounced. The student was charged a penalty for the cheque, which was reportedly dishonoured due to mismatched signatures. The cheque bore the signature of Barabanki District Inspector of Schools, Raj Kumar Yadav.

headlines: Heavy rainfall predicted in Mumbai over next 2 days: IMD
text: India Meteorological Department officials on Saturday warned of heavy rainfall in Mumbai and Konkan regions over the next two days. Over 32 flights have been delayed and three were cancelled due to adverse weather conditions. Regional Meteorological Centre of Mumbai has urged people to stay indoors and Navy officers have been stationed across the city as a precautionary measure.

headlines: IBC amendments to eliminate 'fly by night' realtors: FM
text: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley has said the amendments to the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) will help eliminate "fly by night" realtors and ensure timely completion of projects. "Sound and structured real estate developers would remain," he added. Earlier, President Ram Nath Kovind promulgated an ordinance empowering homebuyers to initiate insolvency proceedings against defaulting builders.

headlines: Sikh soldier first to wear turban in UK Queen's b'day parade
text: A 22-year-old Sikh Coldstream Guards soldier has become the first person to wear a turban during the Trooping the Colour parade which was held to mark UK Queen Elizabeth II's official birthday. Charanpreet Singh Lall said he hoped his participation would be seen as a "new change in history" and would encourage people from different religions to join the Army.

headlines: Tibetans should choose the next Dalai Lama, not China: US
text: In a report presented to the Congress, the US has said that Tibetans should choose the reincarnation of spiritual leader the Dalai Lama as per their beliefs. The report further expressed concern over the Chinese government's interference in the religious matters of Tibetans. China has said the Dalai Lama must be chosen only after the approval of the Communist Party.

headlines: Five new countries elected to UN Security Council
text: The UN General Assembly on Friday elected South Africa, Indonesia, Dominican Republic, Germany and Belgium as non-permanent members of the Security Council. Their terms will begin on January 1 next year, with the non-permanent members being elected for a two-year term. The Security Council is composed of 15 members, five permanent and 10 non-permanent.

headlines: What film is this: Rishi on Jab Tak Hai Jaan scene with SRK
text: Rishi Kapoor, who was part of the film 'Jab Tak Hai Jaan', tweeted, "What film is this from?," while sharing a clip of a scene where he featured with Shah Rukh Khan. "Cannot remember or is it from a film?," he further tweeted. Rishi had a cameo appearance in the film as the step-father of Katrina Kaif's character Meera.

headlines: You always got my back, I got yours: Arjun on Sonam's b'day
text: Sonam Kapoor's cousin Arjun Kapoor shared a photograph from their childhood and wished Sonam on her 33rd birthday while captioning it, "You always got my back and I always got yours." "You're married now but it feels like we are still kids in school together," he added. He also called her the most fiercely loyal and selfless soul he knows.

headlines: Ticket rates for Hindi films should be brought down: Salman
text: Salman Khan has said that ticket rates for Hindi films should be brought down to â¹200-250 for weekends and â¹120-150 for weekdays, the way it is for regional films. "With Hindi films, the numbers (ticket rates) are higher but we need the footfalls too," added the actor, who is planning to launch his own theatre chain 'Salman Talkies'.

headlines: He was my protector: Celeb chef Anthony's girlfriend after his death
text: Celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain's girlfriend, Italian actress Asia Argento, in a statement issued after his alleged suicide, said, "He was my love, my rock, my protector." "His brilliant, fearless spirit touched and inspired so many, and his generosity knew no bounds," the statement further read. Bourdain was reportedly found hanging in his hotel room on Friday.

headlines: Villains are disappearing from modern cinema: Shakti Kapoor
text: Actor Shakti Kapoor has said villains are disappearing from modern cinema. "As the trend is changing...an actor has to be very versatile and good with every role," added Shakti. He further said that Bollywood has always been adamant on creating a unique experience for a villain's character but a romantic sequence by a villain can only happen in modern times.

headlines: Started single wicket bowling on Nehra's advice: Umesh Yadav
text: Team India pacer Umesh Yadav has said he has started practising single wicket bowling on RCB coach Ashish Nehra's advice. "Nehra told me...the key to consistency is uncluttered mind. The moment you try too many things, you can mess up," he added. "Even during IPL, I would pick his brains about the red ball season ahead," he further said.

headlines: It's popcorn time, tweets Kohli on 'beard insurance' rumours
text: Reacting to his teammates tweeting about him reportedly getting his beard insured, Team India captain Virat Kohli on Saturday tweeted, "The talk around my beard is quite entertaining...it's popcorn time boys #ViratBeardInsurance." KL Rahul on Friday shared a leaked video of Kohli, wherein the latter was seen getting his beard measured and signing papers afterwards.

headlines: Babua, tell me what Cong has done in 70 yrs: Shah to Rahul
text: Speaking about Congress President Rahul Gandhi, BJP chief Amit Shah said, "Arre babua, tell me brother, what you have done in 70 years? Your three generations were in power for 70 years." He added that the BJP was lucky to have an Opposition which was satisfied with winning a few bypolls despite failing to form the government in several states.

headlines: India is an inspiration for the world: UN chief
text: UN Secretary-General AntÃ³nio Guterres has said that India is a "very important inspiration" for the world, lauding its efforts in achieving the 2030 Sustainable Development Goals. Guterres was speaking on the first anniversary of the India-UN Development Partnership Fund which was set up to help implement the goals. India has announced an assistance of $100 million over ten years.

headlines: Top criminal Rajesh Bharti killed in encounter by Delhi Police
text: Rajesh Bharti, one of Delhi's 10 most wanted criminals, was killed in a shootout with police in south Delhi on Saturday morning, along with three members of his gang. At least 35 rounds of gunfire were exchanged, with six police officers also receiving bullet injuries. Bharti had at least 25 cases against him and carried a reward of â¹1 lakh.

headlines: Contest for 1st couple to marry in self-driving car launched
text: The American Automobile Association has launched a contest to find the first couple to get married in one of its self-driving shuttles in Las Vegas. The contestants will have to write a 400-word essay describing how an autonomous vehicle would have changed their road trip experience with their partner. The winning couple will be married on June 30.

headlines: I wanted to get married only after I met Anand: Sonam Kapoor
text: Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, who turned 33 today, revealed she wanted to get married only after meeting Anand Ahuja, who she married recently. "Before that, I didn't believe in the institution of marriage," she added. Talking about the fondest memory of her birthday, Sonam recalled a surprise that Anand had planned when they had been dating just for two months.

headlines: Zoya Zinda Hai to be Tiger Zinda Hai's sequel, jokes Salman
text: Salman Khan has jokingly said that the film 'Tiger Zinda Hai' will get a sequel titled 'Zoya Zinda Hai'. The character of Zoya was played by Katrina Kaif in 'Tiger Zinda Hai'. "The sequel to 'Tiger Zinda Hai' is absolutely happening. I have even heard the plot of it," added Salman.

headlines: Bachchan doesn't have good formal education degrees: MP CM
text: In his speech aimed at inspiring students who did not score well in Class 12 exams, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "He (Amitabh Bachchan) did not have any good formal education degrees." Congress termed Chouhan's remark "an insult to Bhopal's jamai". Bachchan has done a double major in Science and Arts from Delhi University's Kirori Mal College.

headlines: Saif gets notice from Interpol for hunting wild boar in Bulgaria
text: Saif Ali Khan has been served a legal notice from Interpol with regards to the wild boar hunting case in Bulgaria. The Bulgarian police had recently booked an agent who allegedly organised the hunt for him without permits and licences. As per reports, Saif's statement was recorded by the police a month ago.

headlines: 296 kg Goan fish patty sets Guinness world record
text: A 295.6-kilogram fish patty, whose preparation was led by a Mumbai-based food and beverage company has been adjudged the world's largest by the Guinness World Records. The cutlet, which was prepared in Goa, is a popular seafood snack in the state. The patty, which had a height of 29 centimetres and diameter of 122 centimetres, was prepared in August 2017.

headlines: 14 of 15 votes wanted Sachin, me to open in WC 2003: Sehwag
text: Virender Sehwag has revealed that ahead of the World Cup 2003, coach John Wright's vote for the team's opening pair resulted in 14 out of 15 chits calling for a Sachin Tendulkar-Sehwag opening pair. Sehwag jokingly said that he knows that the one chit that called for Sourav Ganguly to open was from the then captain Ganguly himself.

headlines: I had a boss who belittled me publicly: Facebook's Sandberg
text: Addressing the students of MIT on Friday, Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg said that in one of her early jobs, she had a boss who "belittled" her publicly. He "treated me quite differently from the two men on my team and not in a good way," Sandberg added. She urged students to build workplaces where everyone is treated with respect.

headlines: Yahoo redirecting users to new app before shutting Messenger
text: After announcing that it is discontinuing its Messenger service after 20 years, Yahoo is recommending its users to use its group messaging app called Squirrel. Yahoo launched the invite-only app in May on iOS and Android, with a focus on friends, family and work groups. Squirrel is currently available in beta version, Yahoo said.n

headlines: High uranium levels in water of 16 Indian states: US study
text: A Duke University-led study has claimed to find "widespread uranium contamination in groundwater from aquifers in 16 Indian states". "Nearly a third of all water wells we tested in Rajasthan contained uranium levels that exceed WHO's safe drinking water standards," said researchers, who took samples from 324 wells in Rajasthan and Gujarat and analysed previous studies for 14 other states.

headlines: Doctor caught sneaking marijuana, mobiles in Kolkata Central Jail
text: A doctor was arrested for allegedly trying to smuggle 35 mobile phones, 4 kg marijuana and alcohol into Kolkataâs Alipore Central Jail on Friday. Cash amounting to â¹1.46 lakh was also recovered from the doctor who has been working at the prison for 10 years. Police believe he used to make money by selling these items to jail inmates.

headlines: Bengaluru couple suffocates to death inside their parked car
text: A 29-year-old businessman and his 28-year-old girlfriend suffocated to death on Wednesday after they were trapped inside their parked car as its air-conditioning stopped working. Their bodies were found when the businessmanâs family members opened the garage on Thursday morning. There was not much air inside the garage and the vehicle ran out of diesel, shutting down the car's air-conditioning.

headlines: Police assaulted me for hugging trans friend: Gay stylist
text: A Delhi-based gay stylist has alleged that the Delhi Police assaulted him for hugging his friend, who was a transwoman, on the street. Alleging that police assumed the transwoman was a sex worker, he added he was detained at a police station for two hours. The man was released after he signed an undertaking promising to not complain against police.

headlines: Had no idea he went to IIT to commit suicide: Gupta's family
text: The family members of 31-year-old IIT-Delhi graduate Anshum Gupta, who committed suicide after jumping off the institute's building on Friday, said they had no idea he went there to commit suicide. A relative said Gupta quit his job around 5-6 months ago because he was unhappy with his professional growth. After graduation, Gupta worked for two years in the US.

headlines: 2 men lynched after being mistaken as kidnappers in Assam
text: Two men were lynched in Assam's Karbi Anglong on Friday after they were mistaken to be kidnappers by locals. The victims, who were reportedly travelling to see a waterfall, died on the spot after their SUV was attacked. A video of the incident shows one of the victims saying, "Don't kill me...please don't beat me. I am an Assamese."

headlines: Taliban announces ceasefire during Eid for the first time
text: The Taliban militant group in Afghanistan has for the first time announced a three-day ceasefire during the Eid holiday. Taliban said that the ceasefire would exclude foreign forces and that it would defend itself against any attack. This comes days after Afghanistan's President Ashraf Ghani declared a ceasefire with the militant group until June 20.

headlines: China awards its first-ever 'Friendship Medal' to Putin
text: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday awarded his country's first Friendship Medal to his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin and called him his best friend. Xi said that the medal is China's highest state honour for foreigners and is presented to those who made outstanding contributions to China's modernisation drive, promoted cooperation between China and the world, and safeguarded world peace.

headlines: Entertainment is a brutal business: Jacqueline Fernandez
text: Actress Jacqueline has said entertainment is a brutal business where things change every Friday. "At times we get demotivated at so many different levels because everything changes on Friday- fans, idea and loyalty," she added. Jacqueline further said, "There is no foolproof formula of success or failure here, but the result gives you the reality check every week."

headlines: One G good enough: Preity on adding husband's initial to name
text: Actress Preity Zinta, who recently added her husband Gene Goodenough's initial to her name, tweeted, "After marriage I decided to take the G from my husband's name. One G is Goodenough for me." The actress got married to Gene in February 2016. The couple got married after dating for five years.

headlines: Players not wrong in partying with prostitutes: Mexico coach
text: Mexican football team's coach Juan Carlos Osorio defended his side's players who were reportedly having a party with prostitutes after their friendly match against Scotland last Saturday. Osorio said that the players did nothing wrong and deserved "some time for themselves". "As people, we can do what we want in our private lives," midfielder Andres Guardado said about the incident.

headlines: Used to talk to Ganguly in Bengali to relax him: Sachin
text: Former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar recalled that he used to talk to his former opening partner Sourav Ganguly in Bengali to relax him to play his natural game while batting together. Sachin said that while Rahul Dravid and Gautam Gambhir were "very serious" and did not talk much, he used to talk a lot to Virender Sehwag while batting alongside him.

headlines: Used to give Sehwag bananas to keep his mouth shut: Sachin
text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said that he used to offer his opening partner Virender Sehwag bananas from across the dressing room to make him "shut his mouth". Sachin also revealed that when he asked Sehwag to stop singing songs while batting against South Africa in World Cup 2011, Sehwag replied that singing the songs kept his mind busy.

headlines: Team finds 2 solar systems, one with 3 Earth-sized planets
text: Using data from NASA's Kepler Space Telescope, Spain-based astronomers have announced the discovery of two new planetary systems, with one of them hosting three Earth-sized planets. The first discovery involved a red dwarf star 160 light-years from Earth while other red dwarf had two 'super-Earths' about twice the size of the Earth, having surface temperatures over 3,000 ÂºC, said researchers.

headlines: Crater in Rajasthan made by meteorite impact, claim experts
text: The crater in Rajasthan's Ramgarh village, long debated to have evolved from "tectonic activity" or "magmatism", was caused by "meteorite impact", a team including scientists from Geological Survey of India (GSI) has claimed. A 3-km-diameter meteorite is likely to have fallen at the location several crore years ago creating a trench of about 4 km diameter, said a team member.

headlines: Woman declared widow brings husband 'dead' for 20yrs to court
text: A woman who was declared a widow after the death of her husband 20 years ago, recently moved an application that he was alive in the Revenue Public Court in Rajasthan's Nimbara village. The woman brought him to the court on Thursday, saying, "Give me the status to be happy..." The authorities then registered him to be alive in records.

headlines: Chargesheet against ex-BCCI chief over â¹102 cr bank scam
text: The CBI has filed a chargesheet against former BCCI chief AC Muthiah and 23 others for allegedly causing a loss of â¹102.87 crore to Syndicate Bank. Muthiah, a former chairman of First Leasing company, cheated the bank by submitting forged financial statements to obtain "undue credit limits". The bank also alleged the company showed inflated income and assets since 1998.

headlines: US warned Pakistan against going to war with India in 1999
text: Srinath Raghavan's book 'The Most Dangerous Place' has claimed ex-US President Bill Clinton warned ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif in 1999 against going to war with India. India-Pakistan relations were tense following Pakistan Army's occupation of key areas in Kargil. The US feared an India-Pakistan war would lead to an all-out confrontation with nations like Russia and China joining the war.

headlines: I-T dept raids Noida engineer with 2 wives, 25 properties
text: An Income Tax raid against a Noida engineer on Friday revealed he has 5 cars, 25 properties and two families. Noida Authority's Chaudhary Brijpal Singh has two wives with two sons and a daughter, one set of each in Noida and Faridabad. He kept same names for his children from both wives to ease the property buying and selling procedure.

headlines: Trailer of 'First Man' starring Ryan as Neil Armstrong out
text: The trailer of 'First Man', starring actor Ryan Gosling as astronaut Neil Armstrong, who became the first man to walk on the moon during the Apollo 11 mission, has been released. The film depicts the years leading up to the mission in 1969. Directed by 'La La Land' director Damien Chazelle, 'First Man' is scheduled to release on October 12.

headlines: Newborn baby's burnt leg amputated after hair dryer left on
text: A four-day-old baby's leg was amputated after a nurse allegedly forgot a hair dryer on for 1.5 hours next to the child at a hospital in China. The newborn suffered serious burns and doctors had to amputate the leg to save his life. Two other babies, who were also in the room, sustained minor burns in the December 2017 incident.

headlines: French Open finalist was ranked 957 in world 11 months ago
text: American tennis player Sloane Stephens, who is set to face world number one Simona Halep in the final of the French Open 2018, was ranked 957 around 11 months ago. The 25-year-old, who won her maiden Grand Slam at the US Open 2017, has a 6-0 win-loss record in tournament finals. Meanwhile, Halep is a two-time runner-up at French Open.

headlines: Jack Ma's Ant Financial now worth more than Goldman Sachs
text: Jack Ma-led Alibaba's affiliate Ant Financial's valuation now stands at $150 billion, more than investment bank Goldman Sachs' $88 billion, according to reports. This comes after Ant Financial raised $14 billion from investors including Warburg Pincus and Temasek on Friday. The funding round made Ant Financial the world's largest fintech firm, according to Bloomberg.

headlines: FB denies sharing users' friends' data with firms after 2015
text: After Facebook claimed it cut off developer access to user data in 2015, a report claiming the company struck data-sharing deals with select companies and shared details of users' friends has surfaced. Denying the reports, Facebook said after 2015, it gave a short extension to a few developers, adding it did not share any users' friends' private data.

headlines: Startup sues Apple for copying logo for its 'Shortcut' app
text: A startup named Shift has sued Apple for $200,000 over copying its logo for the company's Shortcut app. "It's mind-blowing that Apple, the firm with the biggest cash pile in history...had to copy our logo," Shift said. Apple introduced the app for Siri on iOS 12, which allows users to create their own commands for the digital assistant, this week.

headlines: Man posts video of him controlling an iPhone with his eyes
text: A developer named Matt Moss has posted a video on Twitter which shows him controlling an iPhone with his eyes, using Apple's augmented reality framework called ARKit. It shows Moss looking at the button to click it and then blinking to press the button. Commenting on the technology, Moss said it can "improve the lives of people with disabilities."

headlines: Bihar student scores 38 out of 35 marks in Class 12 boards
text: A student in Bihar's Arwal has scored 38 out of 35 marks in Class 12 state board exam for theory in Maths and 37 out of 35 marks in objective questions. "Such things have been happening in the state board exams for long," he said. Another girl in Vaishali scored 18 marks in Biology, an exam she didn't appear for.

headlines: Paan chain owner held for raping woman using drug-laced paan
text: The owner of a paan chain in Hyderabad has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman after drugging her using a paan. The woman claimed she became friends with the accused through Facebook four years ago after which they started an affair. He blackmailed her using their intimate pictures and videos when she suggested they get married, she added.

headlines: Forced, unnatural sex are grounds for divorce: High Court
text: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has said that forced and unnatural sex amount to cruelty and can be grounds for divorce on "the basis of evidence". The court observed this while granting divorce to a woman from Bathinda who alleged her husband forced her for unnatural sex after consuming liquor and beat her when she refused.

headlines: UP cop unable to cope with 20-hr shift, shoots self to death
text: A constable in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow has shot himself to death at his government quarters reportedly because he was unable to cope with his 20-hour shift. The constable often complained about his long working hours since he could not find the time to spend with his family, his friends said. No suicide note was recovered from the scene.

headlines: Hafiz Saeed won't contest Pak poll, JuD to run for 200 seats
text: Mumbai terror attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed will not be a candidate in Pakistan's upcoming general elections but his terror organisation Jamaat-ud-Dawah (JuD) will contest for over 200 seats. JuD will contest the elections on the platform of Allaha-u-Akbar Tehreek because the group's own political front Milli Muslim League (MML) has not yet been registered with the Pakistan Election Commission.

headlines: Best way to deal with stereotypes is by taking risks: Swara
text: Swara Bhasker has said that the best way to deal with stereotypes is by taking risks. "When I came to...film industry...I was told not to play any character of a sister or best friend of the protagonist," added Swara. "I thought if those are the rules to get the lead role, why not break them," she further said.

headlines: I was Nolan's 1st choice for The Joker, jokes Janhvi Kapoor
text: Janhvi Kapoor, in an Instagram story, shared a childhood picture of herself in which she can be seen dressed as a clown. "Lesser known fact: I was Nolan's first choice for The Joker, had to decline for Dhadak," she jokingly wrote. The Joker is a fictional character who appears in Hollywood director Christopher Nolan's 2008 superhero film 'The Dark Knight'.

headlines: 61-year-old Disney executive quits over 'unwanted hugs' row
text: Pixar Chief John Lasseter on Friday said he is stepping down, months after allegations of making staff feel uncomfortable with "unwanted hugs". He will stay in a consulting role until he steps down at the end of 2018. Lasseter apologised last year to "anyone who has ever been on the receiving end of...(any) gesture they felt crossed the line."

headlines: It's a crock of sh*t: David, Victoria deny divorce rumours
text: The spokesperson of former footballer David Beckham and his wife, fashion designer Victoria Beckham, while denying reports that they are getting divorced, called the rumours "a crock of sh*t". "There's no statement due, no divorce, and a lot of Chinese whispers and fake social media news. This is all very bizarre and an embarrassing waste of time," the spokesperson added.

headlines: No problem with "bro" bit: Bhogle after Rashid calls him bro
text: After 19-year-old Afghan spinner Rashid Khan called 56-year-old commentator Harsha Bhogle "bro" on Twitter, the latter tweeted, "Hey @rashidkhan_19, no problem with the "bro" bit. Go for it! Looking forward to catching up in Bengaluru!" Rashid was trolled for calling Bhogle "bro" by Twitter users, with a user writing, "Uske real age ke hisaab se bro sahi hai."

headlines: Netherlands to build world's 1st habitable 3D-printed houses
text: The Dutch city of Eindhoven is set to be the first in the world to have habitable houses made by a 3D printer. The first house will be a single-floor house, to be occupied by mid-2019, while the other four will be multi-storey houses. The project would help reduce carbon footprint as less cement would be needed for their construction.

headlines: Congress is finished: Owaisi on ex-Prez Pranab's RSS visit
text: Slamming former President Pranab Mukherjee's visit to the RSS headquarters in Nagpur, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "The Congress is finished." Pointing out that Mukherjee attended the RSS event despite having been in the Congress for 50 years, Owaisi questioned, "Do you still have hopes from this party?" He suggested regional parties as an alternative, stating they should be strengthened.

headlines: 3 new astronauts reach ISS days after 3 returned to Earth
text: Three crew members arrived at the International Space Station on Friday as their Soyuz module successfully docked to the Earth-orbiting laboratory. The trio completed the station's six-member crew as three astronauts returned to Earth last Sunday after 168 days in space. The Expedition 56 crew includes NASA's Serena AuÃ±Ã³n-Chancellor, ESA's Alexander Gerst and Russian cosmonaut Sergey Prokopyev.

headlines: Gangster said I was on hit list: Umar Khalid on death threat
text: JNU student leader Umar Khalid has filed a police complaint alleging he received death threats from a man claiming to be gangster Ravi Pujari. Adding that he has asked for police protection, Khalid tweeted, "He said that I am on his HIT LIST!" Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani and Alt News Co-founder Pratik Sinha also alleged they received threats from Pujari.

headlines: Will call Jong-un to White House if summit goes well: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said that he would invite North Korean leader Kim Jong-un to the White House if next week's summit between the two leaders in Singapore is successful. He added, "I think he (Jong-un) would look at it very favourably." Trump had earlier said that the summit "is going to be much more than a photo-op".

headlines: New York launches anti-suicide program after celeb suicides
text: New York's Governor Andrew Cuomo has launched a suicide prevention programme in the wake of recent celebrity suicides of chef Anthony Bourdain and fashion designer Kate Spade. The Attempted Suicide Short Intervention Program "tailors treatments to the specific needs of individuals and...get people the support they need," Cuomo said on Friday.

headlines: US unveils world's most powerful supercomputer, beats China
text: The US has unveiled the world's most powerful supercomputer called 'Summit', beating the previous record-holder China's Sunway TaihuLight. With a peak performance of 200,000 trillion calculations per second, it is over twice as fast as Sunway TaihuLight, which is capable of 93,000 trillion calculations per second. Summit has 4,608 servers, which reportedly take up the size of two tennis courts.

headlines: Trump floats pardon of Muhammad Ali despite no conviction
text: US President Donald Trump on Friday said he was considering granting a posthumous pardon to late boxing legend Muhammad Ali, who was convicted for refusing military service during the Vietnam War. Responding to the proposal, Ali's attorney said, "We appreciate President Trump's sentiment, but a pardon is unnecessary." Muhammad Ali's conviction was overturned by the US Supreme Court in 1971.

headlines: Yahoo Messenger to shut down 20 years after launch
text: Yahoo has announced it is discontinuing its Messenger service after 20 years, from July 17, after which users won't be able to login. However, users can download their chat history from the company's website till six months. "If you're looking for a Messenger replacement, Yahoo recommends the product Squirrel, which is currently in beta and invite only," the company said.

headlines: Ex-HC judge Karnan launches flag for new political party
text: Retired High Court judge CS Karnan on Friday launched the flag for his new political party 'Anti-Corruption Dynamic Party', which is the fourth to be launched in Tamil Nadu after late CM Jayalalithaa's demise. The first and only HC judge to have retired while absconding, Karnan earlier announced his party will only field women candidates in 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: K'taka CM Kumaraswamy keeps 11 ministries including Finance
text: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy has allotted himself 11 ministries including Finance, Energy, and Infrastructure Development. Deputy CM and Congress leader G Parameshwara kept three portfolios including Home and Bengaluru City. With 77 elected MLAs, the Congress retained 22 ministries, while the JD(S), with 37 MLAs, got 12 ministries.

headlines: World's largest iceberg to melt near equator after 18 years
text: The world's largest iceberg has broken-up after drifting from Antarctica towards the equator, images from the space station have shown. After separating from Antarctica's largest ice shelf in 2000, pieces of the 11,000-sq-km iceberg have floated towards warmer waters in the tropics. NASA said it wouldn't be possible to track the melting iceberg further if the chunks get any smaller.

headlines: China hacked sensitive US Navy undersea warfare data: Report
text: China reportedly hacked the computers of a US Navy contractor and stole 614 gigabytes of highly sensitive data on undersea warfare, including plans for a supersonic anti-ship missile for use on submarines. The Chinese Embassy said it knows nothing about the reported hack, adding, China "staunchly upholds cyber security and combats all forms of cyber attacks in accordance with law".

headlines: Heroic act: Mahindra praises cop who stood in rain for 2 hrs
