text: Praising a Mumbai traffic police officer who kept performing his duty in rain for 2.5 hours, Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Heroic acts should not just be those grand ones...but everyday acts of duty & concern." He added, "We need to expand our definition of heroes." A video showed 47-year-old Nandkumar Ingle doing his duty without any waterproof gear in heavy downpour.

headlines: Thought I'd be a spinster but met George at 35: Amal Clooney
text: Human rights lawyer Amal Clooney, the wife of Hollywood actor-producer-director George Clooney, said, "I met George when I was 35 and starting to become quite resigned to the idea that I would be a spinster. Then we met." George and Amal got married in September 2014 and are parents to their twins Alexander and Ella, who were born last year.

headlines: Friendship can exist in showbiz: Swara on Sonam's birthday
text: Swara Bhasker took to social media to share a picture with Sonam Kapoor on the occasion of her 33rd birthday today. "Knowing you has meant knowing that friendship and solidarity can exist even in this glittering world of glamour and showbiz," wrote Swara. She has worked with Sonam in 'Raanjhana', 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo' and 'Veere Di Wedding'.

headlines: Ranveer shares first still from Rohit Shetty's film 'Simmba'
text: Ranveer Singh took to Instagram to share the first still from his upcoming film 'Simmba', directed by Rohit Shetty. The actor, who will play a cop in the film, wrote in the caption, "ROHIT SHETTY ka HERO. CAPS LOCK mein." Produced by Karan Johar, and also starring Sara Ali Khan, 'Simmba' is scheduled to release on December 28.

headlines: HBO confirms 'Game of Thrones' prequel series
text: Television network HBO has confirmed it will make a prequel to its series 'Game of Thrones'. HBO said in a statement that the prequel will take place "thousands of years before the events of 'Game of Thrones'". However, the show won't be aired until at least a year after the finale of 'Game of Thrones', which will air in 2019.

headlines: Jacqueline, Daisy's fight scene in Race 3 is sensuous: Salman
text: Talking about the fight sequence between Jacqueline Fernandez and Daisy Shah in 'Race 3', Salman Khan said, "It looks like two men fighting and it also has its humour and slight sensuousness." "The kicks they've given are lethal. They've really, really trained for it," he added. Also starring Bobby Deol and Anil Kapoor, 'Race 3' will release on June 15.

headlines: India thrash Pak to reach record 7th Women's Asia Cup final
text: The Indian women's cricket team qualified for the record seventh Women's Asia Cup final after thrashing Pakistan by seven wickets on Saturday. India managed to restrict Pakistan to a total of 72/7, with Ekta Bisht picking 3/14 in her four overs. Riding on Smriti Mandhana's 38 and skipper Harmanpreet Kaur's 34*, India won the match with 23 balls to spare.

headlines: Warriors sweep LeBron-led team to win 3rd NBA title in 4 yrs
text: Golden State Warriors lifted their third NBA title in four years and their second title in a row after completing a 4-0 clean sweep over LeBron James-led Cleveland Cavaliers in the sides' Game 4 on Saturday. Warriors, for whom Steph Curry scored 37 points, handed the Cavaliers a 108-85 loss, with Cavaliers' LeBron James ending the match with 23 points.

headlines: Harbhajan Singh arm wrestles with 'The Great Khali'
text: Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh posted a video on Twitter of his arm-wrestling session with WWE wrestler 'The Great Khali'. "Panja with great Khali #DalipSinghCWE #bigfella #Awesomeguy #bigman," the 37-year-old spinner wrote as his post's caption. Khali had visited Harbhajan's house in Jalandhar around two years back when Harbhajan had gifted him a signed bat.

headlines: WhatsApp now labels forwarded messages in beta
text: Facebook-owned messaging service WhatsApp has now started labeling forwarded messages in Android beta. Forwarded messages carry a tag above the message saying 'Forwarded', which helps inform the receiver of the message that the sender has forwarded it. Notably, WhatsApp does not give the users an option to disable the label.

headlines: Uber aims to patent an AI system to identify drunk riders
text: Uber has applied for a patent for an AI system that can predict if a user is drunk while booking a cab. According to the application, the system would track users' typing speed (including typos) on the app, walking speed, booking location, among others. A 'drunk' passenger might only be matched with trained drivers, and prevented from joining a carpool.

headlines: 15 cases of fire reported across Railways in five months
text: A letter sent by the Railway Board to zonal General Managers has revealed that 15 incidents of fire involving locomotives, coaching stock and freight stock have been reported in the past five months. The letter cites laxity in the maintenance of rolling stock, lack of supervision, and insufficient security as the reasons behind the accidents.

headlines: Mumbai building declared 'dangerous' catches massive fire
text: A massive fire broke out on Saturday morning in Kothari mansion, a ground-plus-five-storey building that had been declared 'dangerous' by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation. Located in a densely populated area in south Mumbai, the building had been vacant for five years. Two firefighters were injured after a portion of the building collapsed while they tried to douse the fire.

headlines: Kolkata girl dies while imitating suicide scene from TV show
text: A seven-year-old girl in Kolkata died while trying to imitate a suicide scene from a TV serial. She was alone at her house with her two-month-old brother during the incident. Her mother, who had gone to a post office, discovered her hanging from the roof on returning home and rushed her to a hospital where she was declared brought dead.

headlines: BJP MLA slaps cop at police station, threatens to kill him
text: BJP MLA Champalal Devda has been caught on the CCTV slapping a policeman and threatening to kill him inside a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Dewas district. The MLA also hurled abuses at the officer for questioning his nephew on entering a restricted area of the police station where two rape-accused were lodged. An FIR has been registered against him.

headlines: Include Constitution in academics: Trivandrum archbishop
text: Trivandrum archbishop Soosa Pakiam has urged all Christian schools to include Constitution literacy as part of their moral science curriculum. Stating that children should "love the Constitution", he added, "It is highly dangerous that hatred and fear are invoked among various groups as a shortcut to power." The Constitution defines and decides the basic character of a nation, he said.

headlines: Ex-Prez visiting RSS an important event in history: Advani
text: BJP veteran leader LK Advani said former President Pranab Mukherjee's decision to visit RSS headquarters and give a speech on nationalism was a significant event in India's contemporary history. He added that RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and Mukherjee have demonstrated how dialogue can transcend ideological differences. Advani further said that the two leaders show that India accepts "pluralism of faiths".

headlines: Set up committee to study temples' management: SC to Centre
text: The Supreme Court on Friday directed the Centre to set up a committee to study the management of culturally and architecturally important temples across the country. The committee has to specially focus on facilities provided to pilgrims and the utilisation of funds. The order came in response to a plea on malpractices in the management of Odisha's Shri Jagannath temple.

headlines: Trump-Kim themed dishes mark US-N Korea summit in Singapore
text: Trump-Kim themed dishes are being served in Singapore's food outlets ahead of the summit between the US and North Korean leaders next week. A Mexican restaurant is selling 'Rocket Man' and 'El Trumpo' tacos, while a bar is serving special summit drink called the 'Bromance'. Another restaurant is serving 'Trump-Kim Chi Nasi Lemak', a dish with American and Korean elements.

headlines: Sun Pharma adds â¹9,523 crore in market cap in one day
text: India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharmaceutical added â¹9,523 crore to market capitalisation on Friday after the US health regulator USFDA didn't recommend any action against the company's Halol plant in Gujarat. The company's shares surged about 8%, taking its total market valuation to â¹1.26 lakh crore. The drugmaker faced regulatory scrutiny over manufacturing standards violations at the plant.

headlines: Karnataka boy with 624/625 scores 625/625 after rechecking
text: Mohammad Kaif Mulla, who scored 624 marks out of 625 in the Karnataka board exams for Class 10, has now become the state topper after he sent his paper for re-evaluation and got 100%. Earlier a joint topper, Mulla had scored full marks in all subjects except Science. He was confident of his answers and sent it for re-evaluation.

headlines: Video of late celeb chef Anthony with Mammootty emerges online
text: A video of celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain with Malayalam film actor Mammootty has surfaced online after the chef's death on Friday. Anthony, who passed away at the age of 61, is heard saying "strange and fantastic" while watching the shooting of Mammootty's film in India. The old video was part of a TV show that Anthony hosted.

headlines: Gates gives free book to all US students graduating in 2018
text: Billionaire Bill Gates has invited students graduating from a US college in 2018 to download free e-book of late Hans Rosling's 'Factfulness'. The book lays out Rosling's argument that the world is actually in a much better state than we think. Gates said this blueprint for how to think "factfully" is especially relevant for graduates, but "everyone should read it."

headlines: Dravid won't coach India U-19 team which features Arjun
text: India Under-19 and India A coach Rahul Dravid will not be travelling to Sri Lanka with the U-19 team which features Arjun Tendulkar, who broke into the team for the first time. The 45-year-old will oversee India A team for their tour of England, which starts on June 17. WV Raman will coach U-19 team in the absence of Dravid.

headlines: Cong's reaction to news about threat to PM Modi wicked: BJP
text: After the Congress and the RJD claimed that the reports of alleged assassination plan of PM Narendra Modi are planted, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said, "What can be more outrageous, unsavoury, and wicked?" "Congress Party has destroyed all the norms of civility and polity. As long as we are among humans, let us be humane," he added.

headlines: 1st Indian-made artillery gun ready for induction: Army
text: India's first indigenous, long-range artillery gun 'Dhanush' has cleared its final test and is ready to be inducted into the Indian Army, a senior official said on Friday. Earlier this month, fifty rounds of shells each were fired from six Dhanush guns, which are reportedly called 'desi Bofors'. The gun also passed the tests in cold, humid, and hot conditions.

headlines: Man retracts complaint against Yogi's Secy after detention
text: The businessman who alleged that Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's Principal Secretary SP Goyal demanded a â¹25-lakh bribe for facilitating the setting up of a petrol pump has retracted his allegations. This comes after he was detained by police for over eight hours on Friday. In a video, he claimed that he made the allegations after "losing his mental balance".

headlines: 9-yr-old shot at after jawan's rifle falls at Kolkata Metro
text: A nine-year-old boy was accidentally shot by a Railway Police Force jawan after his rifle fired when he dropped it at Kolkata's Dum Dum Metro station, according to reports. The impact of the fall unlocked the rifle's safety catch and the bullet hit the boy's leg. The jawan has been detained and CCTV footage from the station is being investigated.

headlines: â¹16cr claimed from Army by doctor for treating his jawan son
text: The owner of an Ayurvedic hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind has reportedly claimed â¹16 crore from the Indian Army as expenses for treating the head injury of a jawan, who is also his son. The jawan was treated from 2014 to 2017, the district administration said. However, the hospital claimed it sent bills amounting to â¹1.6 lakh, not â¹16 crore.

headlines: Putin is my best friend: Chinese President Xi
text: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday called his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin his "best, most intimate friend" and awarded him China's first Friendship Medal. Xi hailed China-Russia bilateral relations, claiming the two countries overcame all "fluctuations" in global politics. The two countries further pledged to increase mutual support and coordination in international affairs.

headlines: We could get somewhere if Trump led Brexit: UK Foreign Secy
text: In a leaked audio recording, UK Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson was heard saying that if US President Donald Trump led the Brexit negotiations then the UK would "actually get somewhere". "I have become convinced that there is method in his madness...He'd go in bloody hard," Johnson added. Johnson has been critical of UK PM Theresa May's handling of Brexit negotiations.

headlines: Couple says stuffed lion is their lawyer, lose child custody
text: A couple from Canada lost custody of their daughter after they insisted that their stuffed lion, claimed to represent 'Lord Jesus', is their lawyer. The couple, who said that they were getting counsel straight from the Lord through this lion, was found to have a history of violent arguments and had "unstable working and living arrangements".

headlines: Walmart sues its former chief tax officer for joining Amazon
text: Walmart has sued its former chief tax officer Lisa Wadlin for violating her employment agreement by joining rival Amazon. Walmart said Wadlin informed in January she was considering resigning but the company didn't learn she was joining Amazon until separation papers were signed in May. The company seeks to to stop Wadlin from taking the Amazon position until May 2020.

headlines: Yami's sister asked to exit restaurant for not wearing pants
text: Actress Yami Gautam's younger sister Surilie J Singh was recently asked to leave a restaurant in Serbia, as she was not wearing pants. Yami shared a video in which Surilie is explaining why she was asked to leave the restaurant. Surilie is currently in Serbia with Yami, who is shooting for the upcoming film 'Uri'.

headlines: Want roles written for white males, not black males: Michael
text: Hollywood actor Michael B Jordan has said that he only wants to play roles which are written for white males and not the roles which are specifically written for black people. "I don't want any pre-bias on the character," added Jordan. He played the character Erik Killmonger in the film 'Black Panther'.

headlines: Release date of Rishi Kapoor's 'Rajma Chawal' announced
text: The release date of the upcoming Rishi Kapoor starrer 'Rajma Chawal' has been announced as August 31, 2018. "Experience the social journey of a father and son with Rajma Chawal," tweeted the film's director Leena Yadav. She added, "Funny, we live in the space age generation yet fail to communicate with people that matter the most?"

headlines: Anil Kapoor apologises to mother on Salman's show
text: Actor Anil Kapoor, who was recently a part of the season 3 of Salman Khan's reality game show 'Dus Ka Dum', apologised to his mother on the show for not remaining in touch with her always. "I apologised to my mom on national television because you can never show enough love to her," said Anil.

headlines: No matter what you do, you cannot be Sanju: Arshad on Ranbir
text: Talking about Ranbir Kapoor portraying Sanjay Dutt in the upcoming biopic 'Sanju', Arshad Warsi said, "No matter what you do, you cannot be Sanju! You can't be the original." He added, "The way Sanju walks and talks; an actor can only imitate". Earlier, Salman Khan had said that Sanjay should have portrayed his older self in the film.

headlines: 17-yr-old player concedes 119 runs, the most ever in an ODI
text: Playing in her first ODI, Ireland Women's 17-year-old leg-spinner Cara Murray on Friday conceded 119 runs in 10 overs against New Zealand Women, the most by any bowler in an ODI (Men's/Women's). Further, four Ireland Women bowlers gave away 90-plus runs in the innings. Former Australian men's team fast bowler Mick Lewis had conceded the previous most runs (113).

headlines: 10-time champion Nadal enters his 11th French Open final
text: World number one Rafael Nadal on Friday defeated world number six Juan Martin del Potro to enter his 11th French Open final and 24th Grand Slam final. The 10-time French Open winner will face maiden Grand Slam finalist Dominic Thiem of Austria in the summit clash on Sunday. Notably, Nadal has lost just two of his 87 Roland Garros matches.

headlines: Sehwag thought eating chicken would make him fat: Sachin
text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar recalled that to get 'shy' Virender Sehwag comfortable with him, he invited him for a dinner where Sehwag revealed that he thought eating chicken would make him fat. "Only thing I told him was if I looked fat! Ever since [then], he [Sehwag] has been eating chicken," Sachin said.

headlines: All top 9 T20I bowlers spinners, Bumrah only pacer in top 10
text: In the latest ICC T20I rankings for bowlers, each of the first nine positions are held by spinners, with six of first seven positions being occupied by leg-spinners. Further, Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah is the only pacer in top 10, occupying the 10th position. Third-placed Yuzvendra Chahal is the only other Indian in the top 10.

headlines: Threat to PM can't be taken lightly as Cong involved: Swamy
text: After the police said some CPI (Maoists) members were planning a Rajiv Gandhi-like assassination of PM Narendra Modi, BJP MP Subramanian Swamy said, "Since Congress party is also involved...this shouldn't be taken lightly." "I'll be writing a letter to National Security Advisor about this...There's no doubt that PM Modi has been our star campaigner... and influenced our performance," he added

headlines: Swimming, water sports on Goa beaches closed over monsoon
text: Swimming and water sports across beaches in Goa have been closed till the end of September as the state witnessed monsoon rains from Friday and the seas are expected to be rough. An advisory issued by a lifeguard service asked visitors to not walk into water above knee-level even on days with no rain as a precaution.

headlines: Pune Police releases images of Bhima-Koregaon riot suspects
text: The Pune Police has released the images of suspects who killed a youth during the Bhima-Koregaon violence which took place in January this year. The suspects had allegedly been involved in attacking the youth with sticks and stones, the police said. The violence had been triggered during a gathering by Dalits for the 200th-anniversary celebrations of the Bhima-Koregaon battle.

headlines: Farmers to end 10-day agitation with Bharat Bandh on June 10
text: Farmers' unions across the country will mark the end of their 10-day protests with a Bharat Bandh on Sunday, June 10. Farmers across many states are on strike, demanding minimum support price, farm loan waiver, and implementation of Swaminathan Commission recommendations. Organisations said despite the strike not being as successful as anticipated, the biggest achievement was that it was peaceful.

headlines: Landfill site in Vadodara converted into tree museum
text: A landfill site in Gujarat's Vadodara has been converted into a tree museum after the municipal corporation planted over 12,000 saplings of nearly 100 varieties in an area of 50,000 square metres. Gardening on the site, which is reportedly worth â¹250 crore, began in 2016 after locals complained of the bad smell emanating from the landfill.

headlines: Scientists in India discover a planet for the first time
text: Scientists at Ahmedabad's Physical Research Laboratory have discovered an exoplanet, propelling India into a select group of countries which have found planets outside the solar system. The 'super-Neptune' is about 27 times the mass of Earth and six times its radius. It is most likely 'uninhabitable' due to the proximity to its star, 600 light-years away from Earth, scientists found.

headlines: Pervez Musharraf no longer Pak citizen as passport cancelled
text: Pakistan has suspended the national identity card and passport of former President Pervez Musharraf, according to reports. Musharraf could face deportation from Dubai where he is residing currently, as his stay becomes illegal following the suspension of his passport. Musharraf is facing charges of treason for subverting the Constitution after he imposed an emergency in Pakistan in 2007.

headlines: Orangutan tries to fight off bulldozer destroying its home
text: A footage released by an animal welfare group International Animal Rescue shows an orangutan fighting a bulldozer in Indonesia which was uprooting trees it considered its home. The incident reportedly took place in 2013 but the group released the footage on June 5, the World Environment Day. The group said deforestation has led to a decline in the orangutan population.

headlines: TV channel apologises over 'Indian terrorist' scene in Quantico
text: Television network ABC has apologised over an episode in Priyanka Chopra starrer 'Quantico' which showed 'Indian terrorists' framing Pakistan for trying to blow up Manhattan in New York. "The episode has stirred a lot of emotion, much of which is unfairly aimed at Priyanka Chopra, who didn't create the show, nor does she write or direct it," the statement read.

headlines: H'yana CM stops order on players paying income post backlash
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has deferred a government notification which directed sportspersons employed with the state to pay 33% of their income to the sports council. It added that athletes will have to pay their entire income if they are considered to be on-duty by the government. The notification was put on hold after several sportspersons slammed it.

headlines: Sachin Tendulkar never played age-group cricket for India
text: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar, whose son Arjun broke into India's Under-19 team on Thursday, never played any age-group cricket for India. The 45-year-old, who made his Test debut at the age of 16, still holds the record for being India's youngest Test and ODI debutant. Aged 14, Sachin scored a record-breaking 664-run partnership with Vinod Kambli in school cricket.

headlines: Ishant scored more runs than Pujara in County Championship
text: Indian pacer Ishant Sharma scored more runs than India teammate Cheteshwar Pujara in the County Championship 2018. Representing Sussex, the 29-year-old fast bowler hit 102 runs in six innings at an average of 25.5, while the 30-year-old batsman, playing for Yorkshire, managed 100 runs in eight innings at 12.5. Pujara's highest score was 41 while Ishant's top score was 66.

headlines: Shakib quickest to 10,000 runs, 500 wickets in int'l cricket
text: Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan became the quickest to reach 10,000 runs and pick 500 wickets in international cricket against Afghanistan on Thursday. The 31-year-old has now joined former all-rounders Jacques Kallis and Shahid Afridi as only the third cricketer to achieve the 10,000 runs and 500 wickets double. Shakib also became the first Bangladeshi cricketer with 500 international wickets.

headlines: Flipkart lost â¹1.6 crore refunding customers who got stones
text: In a legal complaint, Flipkart alleged that it suffered over â¹1.6 crore loss in less than two years due to refunding customers who claimed they received stones and mud instead of their ordered items like smartphones and cameras. Police said Flipkart paid the customers without proper verification. Flipkart suspects several teams are using the method to cheat the e-commerce company.

headlines: Video: Locals harass lioness with chicken as bait in Gujarat
text: A video showing locals harassing a hungry lioness by baiting it with a chicken several times in Gujarat's Gir forest has surfaced online. In the video, a man can be heard asking another accused to make the lioness roar. Police found the video on the phones of seven people who were arrested last month for organising illegal lion shows.

headlines: Pakistan bans school textbooks for showing Kashmir in India
text: Pakistan has banned Social Studies textbooks in private schools in Punjab province for showing Kashmir as a part of India in maps. A criminal case was filed against the book's publishers and the administration of the private schools across the province. Pakistan further banned individuals from printing, publishing, selling or prescribing textbooks or supplementary material without prior approval.

headlines: Men in PM Modi masks shower money on man singing bhajans
text: A video has surfaced online wherein some men wearing PM Narendra Modi masks are seen showering money on a singer at a devotional programme in Gujarat. The singer was reciting devotional songs about Lord Ram when the men came to the stage with cash. The money showered by the people in the programme is estimated to be in lakhs.

headlines: Mumbai hospital dean shifted for keeping mobile switched off
text: Maharashtra's medical education department has transferred Dr SD Nanandkar from the post of dean at Mumbai's JJ Hospital to Kolhapur for keeping his mobile switched off and remaining unavailable at most times. Adding that the post is "very sensitive", officials said Nanandkar remained unreachable on all three phone numbers. However, Nanandkar claimed the dean's office lacked a mobile network.

headlines: ISIS retakes parts of Syrian town in major attack
text: The Islamic State on Friday recaptured major parts of the Syrian town of Albu Kamal, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said. ISIS carried out its biggest attack on the town since it lost control of it last year, using at least 10 suicide bombers in the attack. Albu Kamal lies near Syria's border with Iraq.

headlines: Can't wait to share cinema space with Shah Rukh again: Karan
text: Karan Johar has said that he can't wait to share "cinema space" with Shah Rukh Khan again. "I can't wait to collaborate with him in a full-fledged manner...whenever we do something together, it will be extraordinary and amazing," added Karan. He further said, "Shah Rukh has been one of my best experiences in cinema...and it's something...I can't wait to repeat."

headlines: Gamer reaches Fortnite's 'unreachable' spawn island on trolley
text: YouTuber OrangeGuy with the help of two of his friends used a trolley to reach the 'spawn island' in popular online game Fortnite, an area touted to be 'unreachable' after the game's start. The area, which is a neutral territory where players assemble before the start of the game, has now been reached by many gamers using OrangeGuy's technique.

headlines: 19-yr-old Rashid calls Bhogle 'bro', gets trolled on Twitter
text: Reacting to Afghanistan's 19-year-old spinner Rashid Khan calling Indian commentator Harsha Bhogle "bro" while replying to a tweet, a user tweeted, "When your bro is almost 3 times older than you". Other users reacted to it with tweets like, "Bro? So you ain't 20 i guess might be in your late 30s," and, "Bro? More like Sir."

headlines: 19-yr-old Rashid took 8 wickets in 11 overs vs Bangladesh
text: Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan picked up 8 wickets in 11 overs in the recently concluded T20I series against Bangladesh. The 19-year-old bowled 35 dot balls (5.5 overs) and did not concede a single six in the series. Rashid gave away 49 runs at an economy rate of 4.45 and registered a bowling average of 6.125 in the three-match series.

headlines: Indian govt sends notice to FB over sharing data with Apple
text: The Indian government has sent a notice to Facebook, demanding an explanation to reports that claimed the platform shared users' personal data with 60 companies including Apple and Samsung. "The Government of India is deeply concerned about reports of such lapses/violations," an official statement said. The company has been given time till June 20 to respond to the notice.

headlines: Protein which makes holes in brains made in lab for 1st time
text: US-based researchers have synthesised the first artificial human prion to combat a fatal form of neurodegenerative disease which is still incurable. Prions are infectious brain proteins that have folded incorrectly. They can bind to neighbouring normal proteins and trigger a domino effect that causes microscopic holes, resulting in progressive deterioration, dementia, and death, noted researchers.

headlines: Akali Dal thanks PM Modi as Centre revokes GST on langar
text: A Shiromani Akali Dal delegation led by party chief Sukhbir Singh Badal and Union Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal thanked PM Narendra Modi on Friday after the Centre decided to revoke GST on langar items. Central GST will be refunded for items purchased under the 'Seva Bhoj Yojna' scheme, which has a financial outlay of â¹325 crore for FY19 and FY20.

headlines: Man arrested after alleging UP CM Secy demanded â¹25L bribe
text: The Uttar Pradesh Police has arrested a local businessman who accused Principal Secretary to CM Yogi Adityanath, SP Goyal, of demanding a bribe of â¹25 lakh for facilitating the setting up of a petrol pump. The businessman was reportedly arrested after an FIR was registered against him. Following his accusations, UP Governor Ram Naik demanded an enquiry into the matter.

headlines: Varanasi airport to be 1st to get facial recognition system
text: Varanasi's Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport will become India's first airport to have an automated smart facial recognition system at its entry, security and boarding points. The initiative, which is part of the DigiYatra scheme, will ensure quicker entry into airports by facilitating automated check-ins. It will be functional within the next four months, as per Airport Director AK Rai.

headlines: 3-yr-old boy dies after falling into open drain in Mumbai
text: A three-year-old boy in Mumbai's Chembur died after falling into an open drain while playing near his house with his friends on Wednesday. The drain was reportedly left open by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) workers. Locals claimed that they tried to save the boy but failed as the water was too deep.

headlines: Nita Ambani offers son's engagement card at Siddhivinayak temple
text: Mukesh Ambani's wife Nita Ambani along with son Anant Ambani presented the invitation card of Akash Ambani and diamond heiress Shloka Mehta's engagement at the Shree Siddhivinayak Ganapati temple in Mumbai. Akash is set to get formally engaged to Shloka on June 30. The engagement ceremony will be held at the family's residence Antilia in Mumbai.

headlines: India's GDP growth may cross 8% in next 2 yrs: Suresh Prabhu
text: India's GDP growth is likely to cross 8% in the next two years, Commerce Minister Suresh Prabhu has said. The government is taking number of steps including formulation of a new industrial policy to double the economy's size to $5 trillion in 7-8 years, he added. India's GDP growth surged to 7.7% in fourth quarter of 2017-18, highest since demonetisation.

headlines: Petrol prices decline by â¹1 in last 10 days
text: The petrol prices in Delhi has come down by â¹1 in the past 10 days from its record high of â¹78.42 per litre on May 29, while diesel has seen a 72-paisa decline. Petrol prices fell by 21 paisa to â¹77.42 per litre in Delhi on Friday, while diesel also saw a 15-paisa decline to â¹68.58.

headlines: New Zealand Women slam highest-ever ODI total in cricket history
text: New Zealand Women recorded the highest-ever ODI total across men's and women's cricket by scoring 490/4 in 50 overs against Ireland Women on Friday. The previous highest ODI total of 455/5 was also registered by New Zealand Women against Pakistan Women on January 29, 1997. England hold the record for scoring the highest ODI total (444/3) in men's cricket.

headlines: Trump calls for Russia to be included in G7
text: US President Donald Trump on Friday called for Russia's reinstatement in the G8 and said that Russia should be attending the forum's upcoming meeting in Canada. Russia was expelled from the forum in 2014 over its invasion of Ukraine and the annexation of Crimea. The US, UK, France, Germany, Canada, Italy, and Japan currently comprise the G7.

headlines: Tughlaqi Farmaan: Dutt on Haryana govt seeking pay share
text: Indian Olympic medalist wrestler Yogeshwar Dutt termed Haryana government's notification asking sportspersons employed by the state to pay 33% of their earnings as a 'Tughlaqi Farmaan'. Dutt, who tweeted, "Aise afsar se Ram bachaye", said that the move will lead to sportspersons shifting outside of Haryana. The money will be used for sports development in the state.

headlines: Arjun Tendulkar hit 70 vs Sachin XI to get into Mumbai U-14
text: Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun, who broke into the India Under-19 team on Thursday, was picked in the Mumbai Under-14 squad after scoring 70 runs against Sachin Tendulkar XI in 2013. Arjun top-scored for Ravi Shastri XI and shared a 132-run opening partnership. However, Sachin Tendulkar XI went on to win the match on first innings lead.

headlines: Rahul tweets leaked video of Kohli getting beard 'insured'
text: Team India wicketkeeper-batsman KL Rahul took to Twitter to share a leaked video of Virat Kohli reportedly getting his beard insured. "Haha, I knew you were obsessed with your beard @imVkohli but this news of you getting your beard insured confirms my theory," Rahul wrote. In the video, Kohli can be seen getting his beard measured and signing papers afterwards.

headlines: Apple patents wearable device to monitor blood pressure
text: Apple has been granted the patent for a wearable 'cuff' that would measure users' blood pressure. The blood pressure measurement system comprises a pressure sensor and a collection of airbags, or 'cells' that will exert pressure on the wearer's arm to measure the same. It will also have an actuator to measure the pressure required to get the reading.

headlines: Respect WhatsApp but people need an alternative: Patanjali
text: Talking about messaging app 'Kimbho' which the firm claims will give "competition" to WhatsApp, Patanjali MD Acharya Balkrishna has said he respects WhatsApp but "people need an alternative". He added, "Why can't we build our own messenger...that people can trust and which keeps user's data within India?" He predicted 'Kimbho' would be used by "all types and levels of Indians".

headlines: Agra students build solar car to protect Taj from pollution
text: Students of ACE College of Engineering & Management in Agra have developed a four-seater solar car to help reduce air pollution which is damaging the Taj Mahal. Priced at â¹50,000, the car can attain a maximum speed of 30 kmph. The vehicle can be used at night and is also sturdy enough for rural areas, college officials said.

headlines: Frustrated forces' dirty trick: RSS on ex-Prez's morphed pic
text: After a morphed image of former President Pranab Mukherjee at an RSS event emerged, the RSS issued a statement saying, "These frustrated forces are doing all such dirty tricks to defame RSS." In a veiled dig at the Congress, the organisation added, "These forces initially tried to create an opposition to make Dr Mukherjee refrain from attending this function."

headlines: IIT-Delhi graduate visits college, commits suicide
text: A 31-year-old alumnus of IIT-Delhi on Friday visited the institute and allegedly committed suicide by jumping off the seventh floor of a building in the campus. No suicide note was recovered from the spot. Police, who are talking to his family and friends to ascertain the reason, suspect unemployment could be the reason behind the man's step.

headlines: Left no stone unturned: Govt on efforts to bring back Mallya
text: The government has left no stone unturned in convincing UK that fugitive Vijay Mallya must be extradited to India, External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Raveesh Kumar has said. In February 2017, India made a formal request to the UK for the extradition of Mallya, who faces charges of money laundering and defrauding banks of â¹9,000 crore.

headlines: 1 out of every 100 people in the world is a refugee: Study
text: One out of every 100 people in the world is a refugee, the Global Peace Index (GPI) has claimed. Terrorism and internal conflict were found to be the main reasons for migration. According to the UN, out of 65.6 million refugees in 2016, 55% were from Syria, Afghanistan and South Sudan.

headlines: US couple orders bicycle online, finds lizard in package
text: A California-based couple who ordered a bicycle online found a lizard inside the package. The couple then contacted animal services, who identified the creature as a bearded dragon, native to Australia. The couple was amused as dragon had survived despite no holes in the cardboard box while the bike was made in China, implying it was shipped from the country.

headlines: Viral 'dancing uncle' meets Salman along with his family
text: Sanjeev Shrivastava, who has been dubbed as 'dancing uncle' on social media after his video went viral, met Salman Khan on the sets of the reality show 'Dus Ka Dum'. Shrivastava, who shared pictures with Salman on Twitter, met him along with his wife and two sons. Commenting on the picture, a user wrote, "Dada tussi chha gaye."

headlines: I am sure Priyanka will be there in 'Krrish 4', says Rakesh
text: Director Rakesh Roshan has said he is sure that actress Priyanka Chopra will be in his upcoming film 'Krrish 4' but he is not sure about the length of her role in the franchise's fourth instalment. Adding that he really enjoyed working with Priyanka, Rakesh said, "Priyanka has tremendous talent, great discipline and a lot of luck."

headlines: All you need is family: Shilpa Shetty on her 43rd birthday
text: Actress Shilpa Shetty, who turned 43 on Friday took to Instagram to share her birthday celebration pictures with her family and captioned it, "All you need is family." The birthday pictures included a handmade birthday card from her six-year-old son Viaan Raj Kundra. She thanked her husband, son and fans on Instagram.

headlines: Sequel of Kareena Kapoor's 'Veere Di Wedding' being planned
text: The spokesperson of Kareena Kapoor Khan and Sonam Kapoor starrer 'Veere Di Wedding' said that a sequel of the film is being discussed as it has been performing well at the box-office. The original film, which also starred Swara Bhasker and Shikha Talsania, earned  â¹10.70 crore on its first day to become India's third highest opening day grosser of 2018.

headlines: Federer didn't thank me: ManÂ who beat Nadal at French Open
text: Former Swedish tennis player Robin SÃ¶derling, who had become the first man to defeat Rafael Nadal at French Open in 2009, jokingly said he is still waiting for Roger Federer to thank him. "When he saw I beat Rafa, I think he was a little bit happy, of course," SÃ¶derling added. Federer won his only French Open title in 2009.

headlines: Watch Ronaldo's 7-year-old son score with scissor kick
text: Real Madrid forward Cristiano Ronaldo watched his son score with a scissor kick after Portugal's World Cup warm-up match against Algeria. The crowd cheered after seeing Ronaldo Jr score from set-piece situations and from lay-up assists being provided by his father. The seven-year-old was also seen dribbling the ball and scoring in the top corner from beyond the penalty spot.

headlines: Does panel finding Odisha temple's key have magic: Minister
text: After Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik ordered a judicial probe into the disappearance of keys to Jagannath Temple's treasury, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "I want to ask CM Naveen Babu, does inquiry commission possess a magic wand?" He added that the commission was set up to "fool people". The inner treasury of the 12th-century temple was last opened in 1984.

headlines: Tension as Congress leaders upset with portfolios: K'taka CM
text: Speaking about Congress leaders being unhappy with the portfolios allocated to them, Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy said, "Yes, there is some tension there, but I am confident that the Congress leaders will take the right decision." Former state Energy Minister DK Shivakumar was reportedly upset over the energy portfolio being handed to the JD(S).

headlines: Shocked Pranab called RSS founder India's great son: Vijayan
text: After former President Pranab Mukherjee called RSS founder Keshav Baliram Hedgewar a "great son of Mother India", Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said he was shocked to hear him praise someone "who established communal discord". Calling Mukherjee's attendance at the RSS event in Nagpur a "political move", Vijayan said his stand had dented the image of the post of President.

headlines: CAG to audit Rafale procurement after payments completed
text: The Comptroller and Auditor General of India will audit the procurement of 36 Rafale fighter jets from France only after the "deal is fully executed and the payments are completed", an official has said. The â¹59,000-crore deal became contoversial after the Congress claimed that the current deal is more expensive than the one struck during the UPA government.

headlines: US man infected himself with HIV to give people AIDS
text: A 25-year-old man in the US state of Arkansas has been jailed for 50 years after he admitted to intentionally contracting HIV to infect others. Stephen Koch was detained for drug-related charges and his admission came during the course of the investigation. He also pleaded guilty to child pornography and drug charges.

headlines: Trump puts water bottle on the floor, US VP copies him
text: A video of US Vice President Mike Pence following President Donald Trump as he removed a bottle from the table has gone viral on social media. Trump and Pence were attending a meeting to discuss preparedness for the upcoming hurricane season. Reacting to it, a Twitter user wrote, "Is it some code? What does it all mean?"

headlines: Azim Premji's youngest son joins board of Wipro Enterprises
text: Tariq Premji, the youngest son of billionaire Azim Premji, has been appointed to the board of Wipro Enterprises as a non-executive director. Tariq is the third family member to join the board, after his father and elder brother Rishad Premji. Tariq began working in Azim Premji's family office PremjiInvest and has been on the board of Premji's two philanthropic arms.

headlines: New research makes us think how play makes work better
text: PUMA and Virat Kohli commissioned a study on the State Of Play In India which revealed that 57% of Indians haven't played a sport in the last year! This got us thinking about the pros of playing for today's corporate millennial. From boosting confidence to working with a team, work and play go together.

headlines: Celeb chef Anthony Bourdain hangs himself inside hotel room
text: Emmy-winning host Anthony Bourdain has died at the age of 61 after he reportedly committed suicide by hanging himself inside his hotel room in France on Friday. The celebrity chef and TV personality was working on an upcoming episode of his CNN series "Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown" in France. Bourdain had authored several best-selling food, fiction and non-fiction books.

headlines: India's richest man's pay is less than that of his deputies
text: India's richest man Mukesh Ambani's annual salary is less than two of his deputies for the second consecutive year. Ambani's cousins Nikhil and Hital Meswani, who are Reliance's executive directors, received a compensation of â¹19.99 crore each. Ambani kept his salary at â¹15 crore for the 10th straight year to "set a personal example for moderation in managerial compensation levels".

headlines: Modi will be killed, we'll disintegrate India: JuD militant
text: Addressing public in Pakistan, terror group Jamaat-ud-Dawa chief Hafiz Saeed's aide Bashir Ahmad said, "(PM) Modi will be killed. India and Israel will get disintegrated as more and more martyrs will be produced." Seeking donations during the month of Ramadan, Ahmad said, "I also urge women to donate their sons and cash for 'Mujahideen' who were waging 'Jihad' in Kashmir."

headlines: Maoists threaten Maha CM Fadnavis and his family: Reports
text: The Maharashtra Home Ministry has received two letters from a Maoist organisation threatening Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis and his family members, reports quoting ministry sources said. The letters also mentioned the Gadchiroli encounter in which 39 Naxalites, including top leaders, were killed by police commandos and CRPF personnel in April. The police is now investigating the matter.

headlines: Nursery rhyme teaches US kids how to survive school shooting
text: A school in the US city of Boston is using a nursery rhyme to teach kindergarten students how to survive school shootings. According to reports, the 'Lockdown' poem is supposed to be sung to the tune of the poem 'Twinkle Twinkle Little Star'. This comes as part of measures to tackle school shootings in the US.

headlines: TIME cover shows Trump as a king
text: The TIME magazine has depicted US President Donald Trump in its latest edition as a king having "absolute powers". Sharing the cover's image, TIME wrote, "Donald Trump's campaign to discredit the Russia investigation may be working. It's also damaging American democracy." Trump had recently stated that he had the absolute right to pardon himself.

headlines: Austria shuts down mosques in crackdown on 'political Islam'
text: The Austrian government has announced it will shut down seven mosques run by hardline Turkish nationalists and foreign-based Muslim groups in a crackdown on political Islam and radicalisation. The crackdown is based on an Austrian law that bans foreign fundings for religious groups. The government also plans to expel Imams employed by some foreign groups.

headlines: Most beautiful woman, needs no filters: Twinkle on mom's b'day
text: Twinkle Khanna took to social media to share a picture with her mother Dimple Kapadia on the occasion of her 61st birthday today. Twinkle wrote, "Birthday lunch with the most beautiful woman in the world. She needs no filters and luckily doesn't have one either." Dimple, who made her debut with 'Bobby', is known for films like 'Saagar' and 'Rudaali'.

headlines: Was expecting the shock: Swara on 'Veere...' masturbation scene
text: Swara Bhasker, while talking about the response received by her masturbation scene in 'Veere Di Wedding', said, "I was expecting the shock." Recalling the time she shot for the scene, Swara added, "I was nervous. I asked for a closed set." Swara further said, "The only thing I told [director] Shashanka Ghosh was, 'Let's make the scene funny, not vulgar."

headlines: 'Legally Blonde 3' to release 17 yrs after 2nd instalment
text: Reese Witherspoon confirmed the third instalment of the 'Legally Blonde' franchise which will release in 2020, 17 years after the release of 'Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde'. Announcing the film, she shared a video where she is seen wearing a pink bikini and floating in a swimming pool, which is similar to a scene from the original film.

headlines: 'Party Chale On' song from Salman starrer 'Race 3' released
text: A new song titled 'Party Chale On' from Salman Khan starrer 'Race 3' has been released. The song has been composed by music composer duo Vicky-Hardik with vocals by Mika Singh and Iulia Vantur and lyrics by Hardik Acharya. Directed by Remo D'Souza, 'Race 3' is scheduled to release on June 15.

headlines: Afghanistan troll B'desh with 'Naagin' dance post whitewash
text: Afghan cricketers including wicketkeeper Mohammad Shahzad trolled the Bangladesh cricket team by performing the 'Naagin' dance after completing a 3-0 whitewash over them on Thursday. Earlier during Afghanistan's batting, Bangladeshi bowler Nazmul Islam performed the same celebration after dismissing Shahzad for 26. Earlier in March, Bangladeshi team had done the celebration against Sri Lanka.

headlines: Kept staring at Sachin when I first saw him: Bhuvneshwar
text: Indian pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar has said he kept staring at Sachin Tendulkar when he first saw him at the hotel before the start of Mumbai-Uttar Pradesh Ranji final at Hyderabad in 2009. Bhuvneshwar added he felt like he was "possessed" and kept staring at Sachin even when he was batting. The 28-year-old dismissed Sachin for a duck in the match.

headlines: English woman cricketer congratulates 'mate' Arjun Tendulkar
text: English cricketer Danielle Wyatt, who had once proposed to Virat Kohli on Twitter, congratulated Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun who broke into India's Under-19 squad on Thursday. Wyatt also tagged Sachin in the congratulatory post. The 27-year-old English female cricketer had once tweeted about meeting 'little mate' Arjun while coming to the Lord's cricket ground for a match.

headlines: FB to send fewer 'You are now connected on Messenger' alerts
text: Facebook has said that it will send fewer notifications, about their friends joining messenger, to users who don't enjoy getting them. Facebook sends the alerts which read, 'You are now connected on Messenger', when a user becomes 'Friend' with another or a friend joins Messenger. Facebook will employ machine learning to analyse which users do not like the feature.

headlines: Samne aao chaliye: Mishra to Delhi CM on Assembly absence
text: Claiming that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has less than 10% attendance in the Assembly, rebel AAP leader Kapil Mishra has threatened him with legal action if he does not attend the House. He further posted a video in which he sings a song with the lyrics, "Zara Samne toh aao chaliye, ghar ke andar dubakne mein kya raaz hai..."

headlines: Cong gives RS seat to ex-ally, party MLAs call it suicidal
text: After the retirement of senior Congress leader KJ Kurien from Rajya Sabha, the party alloted the vacant seat to former ally Kerala Congress (M). However, the decision led to protests by Congress MLAs in Kerala, with some of them calling the move "suicidal". Meanwhile, senior leader Oommen Chandy said the seat was given to KC(M) as a "special case".

headlines: Plot to kill PM comes up when his popularity declines: Cong
text: After Pune Police claimed that members of banned CPI(Maoists) had plotted a "Rajiv Gandhi-type incident" to kill PM Narendra Modi, Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam on Friday said, "It has been PM Modi's old tactic... whenever his popularity declines, news of an assassination plot is planted." "So it should be probed how much truth is in it this time," he added.

headlines: Lava from Hawaii volcano creates new land, buries 400 homes
text: A region called Vacationland on Hawaii's Big Island had disappeared as lava poured into an ocean bay, turning it into new land. The molten rock entirely covered Vacationland and only a few buildings remained in the ocean subdivision, the US Geological Survey said. The total number of homes destroyed in the Kilauea volcano eruption has reached about 400, said officials.

headlines: 8 MP forest officials held for killing man, burning his body
text: Eight forest department personnel were arrested in Madhya Pradesh on Thursday for allegedly beating a villager to death and then burning his body to destroy evidence, a police official said. The villager had visited the forest to collect firewood, and the employees caught him on the suspicion that he was cutting teak trees. Following this, they allegedly thrashed him.

headlines: CRPF jawan posthumously given PM's medal for saving pilgrims
text: CRPF constable Harvinder Singh has been posthumously honoured with the PM's police medal for saving the lives of Vaishno Devi pilgrims in 2016. Singh had been helping pilgrims reach the shrine when he saw some women and children trapped under a landslide. While saving them, he was hit by a huge rock, later succumbing to his injuries.

headlines: G7 may become G6 if Trump remains isolated: France
text: French President Emmanuel Macron has said the G7 may become G6 if US President Donald Trump "doesn't care about being isolated". The six countries, namely, UK, Canada, Germany, Italy, Japan, and France "are a bigger market taken together than the US' market", he added. He further said, "We don't mind being G6 if need be."

headlines: Never sought incentive from UP govt for food park: Patanjali
text: Patanjali's MD Acharya Balkrishna has said the company never asked for incentives from Uttar Pradesh government to set up a mega food park. "Under the central government's scheme, the food park was sanctioned to us," Balkrishna added. UP CM Yogi Adityanath had directed officials to expedite process for setting up the food park after Patanjali announced to shift the park.

headlines: Will always be BJP's ally, we should come together: Badal
text: Amid reports of Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) and BJP parting ways, SAD President Sukhbir Singh Badal on Thursday said, "SAD is a permanent ally of BJP." He added, "I would like to appeal to all our allies that this is the time to fight, the battle is in six months. We should get together and cast away all our differences."

headlines: Rajiv Gandhi-type incident was plotted to kill PM Modi: Police
text: Members of the banned CPI(Maoists) were plotting to kill PM Narendra Modi in "another Rajiv Gandhi-type incident" by "targeting his road shows", according to a letter seized by Pune Police during investigation into Bhima-Koregaon violence. The CPI(Maoists) would be in trouble if PM Modi continues at the same pace with which he formed government in 15 states, the letter stated.

headlines: Woman found dead inside 5-star hotel's washroom in Delhi
text: A woman was found dead inside a five-star hotel's washroom in Delhi's Mayur Vihar on Thursday. The woman, who was staying with her boyfriend, was found unconscious by the staff after which she was rushed to a hospital, where she was declared dead. There were no visible injuries on her body and the police have not yet discovered anything suspicious.

headlines: 30-yr-old fan arrested for stalking Prem Ratan Dhan Payo singer
text: Mumbai police on Wednesday arrested a 30-year-old man named Rajesh Kumar Shukla for allegedly harassing and stalking 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo' singer Palak Muchhal over the phone and threatening her. The man reportedly called her and messaged her, requesting her to meet. However, the messages turned abusive and violent after she declined to meet him.

headlines: H'yana govt orders sportspersons to pay 33% income to state
text: The Haryana government has issued a notification directing sportspersons employed with the state to pay 33% of their income earned professionally and through commercial endorsements to the state sports council. They will have to submit their full income if they are considered to be on-duty by the concerned authority. The money will be used for development of sports in Haryana.

headlines: Google won't design AI for weapons, surveillance: CEO Pichai
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has clarified the company is not developing artificial intelligence (AI) for use in weapons, as it "could directly facilitate injury to people." Google will not design AI for surveillance technologies which violate internationally accepted norms, however, it will continue to work with governments in areas like cybersecurity, training and military recruitment, added Pichai.

headlines: GoAir cancels flight after bird damages engine, loses â¹5 cr
text: A GoAir flight bound to Port Blair had to return to Kolkata on Thursday after it suffered a bird hit that damaged the plane engine's six blades. The flight's pilot had experienced heavy vibrations during lift-off, following which the flight was called back and was cancelled after deboarding 160 passengers. The damage will approximately cost â¹5 crore to the airline.

headlines: Didn't expect this from Pranab da: Sonia's Secy on RSS event
text: After former President Pranab Mukherjee's daughter tweeted against his visit to an RSS event in Nagpur, UPA Chairperson Sonia Gandhi's Political Secretary Ahmed Patel replied, "I did not expect this from Pranab da!" Reports have claimed that Gandhi personally ordered Patel to post the tweet. Earlier, several Congress leaders had openly opposed Mukherjee's decision to attend the RSS event.

headlines: Amazon invests $1.5 million in its Indian food retail biz
text: Amazon has infused $1.5 million in Amazon Retail India, its food retail business in the country, according to filings. In February this year, Amazon became the first foreign e-commerce firm to start its own food retail venture in India, piloting its services in Pune. Earlier, reports said Amazon has planned to invest up to $500 million in the food segment.

headlines: Hope India and Pakistan can work together in SCO: China
text: China has expressed hope that India and Pakistan will work together for regional peace in the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) which provides a base for the two countries to strengthen cooperation. China said, "We believe all members will...deepen solidarity and mutual trust." This comes amid concerns that India and Pakistan could raise the Kashmir issue during the upcoming SCO summit.

headlines: Man's body found in servant quarters of Rashtrapati Bhavan
text: A staffer's body was found inside the servant quarters of the Rashtrapati Bhavan on Friday after people complained of foul smell coming from the place. Police said the man had been unwell for some time and rule out any foul play in his death. The police also suspect that the body had been lying in the room for 2-3 days.

headlines: Gauri Lankesh killed as she was anti-Hindu: Murder accused
text: Naveen Kumar, an accused in journalist Gauri Lankesh murder case, reportedly confessed that another accused Praveen asked him to arrange bullets in August 2017 to kill Lankesh as she was anti-Hindu. Naveen, who's associated with a Hindu outfit, said he couldn't arrange the bullets and failed to establish contact with Praveen. Naveen claimed he learned about the murder through television.

headlines: T'gana cops launch helpline after DGP lists 391 corrupt cops
text: Telangana Police have launched helpline numbers to lodge complaints against policemen demanding bribes after a survey ordered by DGP M Mahendar Reddy exposed 391 corrupt policemen. Calling the list of corrupt officials "indicative but not exhaustive", the DGP had emailed the list to all district police chiefs and directed them to put an end to the menace of bribe collection.

headlines: 5 patients die in 24hrs at UP hospital, families blame faulty ACs
text: At least 5 deaths were reported within 24 hours at a government hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, with the families of the deceased blaming faulty air conditioning system in the ICU for the deaths. "Windows and doors around the ICU wing were opened to provide relief to the patients," relatives said. However, the hospital authorities have denied the accusations.

headlines: CM Naidu declares Andhra Pradesh open-defecation free
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu has declared the state open-defecation free after achieving the goal of constructing 2.77 lakh individual toilets. "We've completed the task of constructing toilets but they have to be used by every individual. For that, the administration has to take up some awareness programmes," Naidu said. Notably, the state's urban areas were declared ODF in 2016.

headlines: Kim Jong-un lookalike detained at Singapore airport
text: A Hong Kong-based comedian who impersonates North Korean leader Kim Jong-un said he was detained for two hours at Singapore airport on Friday. This comes ahead of the summit between US President Donald Trump and Jong-un to be held in Singapore next week. The lookalike, who goes by the name Howard X, was told to steer clear of summit venues.

headlines: I was very normal about stardom, wish I had noticed it: Bobby
text: Speaking about his stardom in the 90's, Bobby Deol said, "I wish I knew I had reached the level up with two-three movies but I never realised that...I was...normal about it. I wish I had noticed it." "Maybe that would've made me focus on not losing it," he added. Bobby further said he never thought people were competing with him.

headlines: Came to India to work with Sanjay Leela Bhansali: Jacqueline
text: Jacqueline Fernandez has revealed she came to India to work with Sanjay Leela Bhansali after watching his films 'Devdas' and 'Black'. "When I first watched Devdas at the Cannes Film Festival, I returned home, called for a DVD and watched the film again. I found the film unbelievable," she added. Jacqueline further said, "My dream has not yet been fulfilled."

headlines: Was portrayed as lesbian on reality show: Aashka on Bigg Boss
text: Television actress Aashka Garodia, who was a participant on 'Bigg Boss' season 6, said she was portrayed as a lesbian through "editing tricks" on the show. "I was rubbing balm on a sick fellow inmate's body after she had broken into an allergic reaction," she added. Aashka further said it was "extremely embarrassing" for her and her parents.

headlines: Gerard Pique and Shakira's Barcelona house robbed
text: Barcelona defender Gerard Pique and his partner and singer Shakira's house in Barcelona has reportedly been robbed. The robbers reportedly entered the house undetected during a stormy night, while Pique's parents were asleep. Pique and Shakira were both in the German city of Cologne at the time, where the Colombian-Lebanese singer was performing in a concert.

headlines: Google removes egg from salad emoji to promote diversity
text: Google's emoji UX Manager, Jennifer Daniel has said the company has removed the egg from the salad emoji in Android P beta 2 to make it "a more inclusive vegan salad." However, she later explained the updated emoji corresponds more accurately with its original description; "A bowl of healthy salad, containing lettuce, tomato, and other salad items such as cucumber."

headlines: Won't launch messaging app until experts check it: Patanjali
text: Speaking about Patanjali's messaging app 'Kimbho', Managing Director Acharya Balkrishna recently said, "We pledge not to launch the app until a team of expert hackers...plug all the security and privacy loopholes". Earlier, Kimbho disappeared from Google Play Store a day after its launch last month. It was after a French security expert claimed he could access messages of all users.

headlines: Instagram now lets users share story if they're tagged in it
text: Instagram now allows users to share another user's story as their own story if they are mentioned in that story. When someone is mentioned in a user's story, they receive a notification in their message thread with that person, below which an option to add that to own story will appear. However, only public accounts can have their stories shared.

headlines: IAF's Jaguar jet crashes in Gujarat, 2nd incident in 72 hrs
text: A Jaguar fighter jet of the Indian Air Force crashed in Gujarat's Jamnagar on Friday morning during a routine training session. The pilot managed to eject safely after the aircraft developed snags before the landing. This is the second incident in the last 72 hours after another Jaguar jet crashed in Gujarat's Kutch on Tuesday, killing Air Commodore Sanjay Chauhan.

headlines: Kashmiri kickboxing champ hugs Rajnath Singh, takes selfie
text: A video of a nine-year-old Kashmiri kickboxing champion hugging Home Minister Rajnath Singh and then taking a selfie with him has gone viral. Tajamul Islam, who won the World Kickboxing Championship in 2016, was being felicitated, along with other sportspersons from J&K at a sports conclave.  Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah later tweeted, "Sweet kid. Here's wishing her more success."

headlines: I don't support the #MeToo movement: Russian Prez Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said he does not support the global #MeToo movement in which women have publicly denounced their sexual abusers. He questioned why women were coming forward decades after the alleged attacks took place. Putin added that legal process should be used for handling these cases rather than a media campaign.

headlines: Pornstar has no reputation, affair not credible: Trump lawyer
text: US President Donald Trump's lawyer Rudy Giuliani has said pornstar Stormy Daniels' claim that she had an affair with Trump in 2006 is not credible because she is a porn actress with "no reputation". "I don't respect a porn star the way I respect a career woman," he added. He further called the hush payment to Daniels "a nuisance thing".

headlines: Killer who ate own eyeball not free from death row: US court
text: A Texas death row inmate, who gouged out his eyeballs and ate one of them, is sane enough to be executed, the 5th US Circuit Court of Appeals ruled. The defendant being mentally ill does not exempt him from death penalty, the court added. Andre Thomas was sentenced to death in 2004 for murdering his estranged wife and children.

headlines: FB bug changed 1.4 cr usersâ privacy setting to âpublicâ
text: Facebook has said it recently found a bug that automatically suggested posting publicly when people were creating their posts, potentially causing them to post friends-only content to the public. The bug, which was active between May 18 and 27, affected 1.4 crore users. Apologising for the error, Facebook said itâs asking users to review posts they made during that time.

headlines: Key member of gang that plotted to kill Salman Khan arrested
text: The Haryana Police has arrested Sampat Nehra, sharpshooter of a gang led by Lawrence Bishnoi who had threatened to kill actor Salman Khan during his appearance at a Jodhpur court in April. Nehra is reported to have been running the gang in the absence of Bishnoi who is lodged at Jodhpur jail. Police tracked him through his social media activities.

headlines: Android Co-founder's startup unveils magnetic headphone jack
text: Android Co-founder Andy Rubin's startup Essential has unveiled its first attachment module, a magnetic 3.5-mm headphone jack dongle, since the launch of its phone almost a year ago. Essential pointed out that one could finally charge the phone while simultaneously listening to music. The Audio Adapter HD would likely be released this summer, although its cost was not revealed yet.

headlines: China's ZTE to pay $1 billion fine to US to lift sanctions
text: Chinese telecommunications equipment maker ZTE has agreed to a $1 billion fine to end US sanctions against it. The US blocked ZTE's access to US suppliers in April after an investigation found that ZTE had been shipping gear to Iran and North Korea illegally. Further, ZTE will have to install a new board of directors within the next 30 days.

headlines: Work only for Hindus, not Muslims: BJP MLA to Corporators
text: BJP MLA Basangouda Patil Yatnal in Karnataka told the Corporators, "Don't work for the welfare of Muslims. You must work for the welfare of Hindus only. Who voted us to power". "I had instructed my people that those with topi (skull cap) and burkha should not come and stand in my office or beside me," Yatnal added.

headlines: Ant Financial raises $14 bn, becomes largest fintech firm
text: Chinese e-commerce major Alibaba's financial affiliate Ant Financial has raised around $14 billion from investors including US-based private equity firm Warburg Pincus. Temasek Holdings and Singapore's sovereign wealth fund GIC also participated in the round. The funding makes Ant Financial, which is said to be valued at $150 billion, the world's largest fintech firm, according to Bloomberg.

headlines: Scientists discover bees understand the concept of zero
text: Researchers have discovered that honey bees can be trained to choose an image with the lowest number of elements in order to receive a reward of sugar solution, claiming they understand the concept of zero, like humans, monkeys and birds. Bee brains have fewer than one million neurons, compared with the 86,000 million neurons of a human brain, scientists noted.

headlines: Ex-Prez Mukherjee showed RSS mirror of truth: Congress
text: Referring to former President Pranab Mukherjee's speech at an RSS event in Nagpur, Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala on Thursday said, "Today Pranab Mukherjee has shown the mirror of truth to RSS at their headquarters." He added, "Shri Pranab Mukherjee has reminded the RSS of the history of India. He taught the RSS that India's beauty lies in its tolerance."

headlines: Kerala woman forced to live like a man for 20 years
text: A 30-year-old woman in Kerala has revealed that she lived as a man for the first 20 years of her life as the doctor said she had male chromosomes despite her having female organs. She was later given male hormones which caused her to grow a beard and a moustache. She is over six feet tall due to the hormones.

headlines: Morphed pic of ex-Prez doing RSS salute goes viral
text: A morphed image of former President Pranab Mukherjee has gone viral, wherein he could be seen doing an RSS-style salute after he attended the RSS event in Nagpur. Mukherjee's daughter Sharmistha has slammed BJP and RSS for the picture, calling it their "dirty tricks department's" work. Earlier, Sharmistha had warned her father of fake stories if he attended the event.

headlines: Adityanath's secy accused of â¹25L bribe, Guv demands action
text: In a letter to Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, Governor Ram Naik demanded appropriate action against his Principal Secretary SP Goel over allegations he sought â¹25 lakh to allot additional land to set up a petrol pump. Refuting the allegations, Goel claimed he received the complainant's application for additional land after Naik's letter and had not dealt with the case.

headlines: Honeypreet's bail plea in Panchkula riots case rejected
text: The Panchkula Sessions Court in Haryana on Thursday rejected the bail plea of Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim's adopted daughter Honeypreet Singh. Honeypreet was arrested for inciting the violence which erupted in Panchkula after Gurmeet Ram Rahim was convicted in two rape cases in August last year. Over 30 people had died in the Panchkula violence.

headlines: Centre conspiring to take over Tirumala temple: Andhra CM
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on Thursday claimed that the Centre is conspiring to take over Tirumala temple's functioning. Adding that he will not let the Centre's conspiracies to turn into reality, Naidu said, "I survived an extremist attack in 2003 only because of Lord Balaji's blessings. I won't let the sanctity of the temple of Lord Balaji tampered."

headlines: Pak SC allows Musharraf to file nomination papers for polls
text: Pakistan's Supreme Court has allowed ex-President Pervez Musharraf to conditionally file nomination papers for upcoming general elections. The decision came while hearing a review petition filed by Musharraf against a High Court ruling that disqualified him from contesting elections for life. The apex court said Musharraf's candidature will be accepted only if it overturned the High Court verdict.

headlines: Summit with Kim Jong-un will be more than photo-op: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Thursday said the June 12 summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un "is going to be much more than a photo-op". He added he is "very well prepared" for the meeting which is "about the attitude [and] willingness to get things done". The summit will take place in the Capella Hotel on Singapore's Sentosa Island.

headlines: Bayer closes $63 bn Monsanto deal, becomes largest seed firm
text: German conglomerate Bayer on Thursday completed its $63-billion takeover of US-based Monsanto to create the world's biggest agro-chemical and seed company. The deal, announced in September 2016, was closed after Bayer got all necessary regulatory approvals from various countries including the US and India. Bayer announced this week that the Monsanto name will be retired after the takeover.

headlines: It's 'cues' not 'ques': Big B corrects Alia's spelling
text: Amitabh Bachchan, while correcting Alia Bhatt for mistakenly writing 'cues' as 'ques' in a tweet where she talked about her experience of working with him, wrote, "Err...its 'cues' not 'ques'." "You are just too cute," he added. Alia and Bachchan will star together in the upcoming film 'BrahmÄstra', which will also star Ranbir Kapoor.

headlines: Tell me what's wrong with Alia, Ranbir: Sudhir on nepotism
text: Speaking about nepotism in Bollywood, filmmaker Sudhir Mishra said, "Tell me what's wrong with [star-kids] Alia Bhatt or Ranbir Kapoor. Both are terrific actors...they should be getting to do good films." "Whoever has talent and is ready to work hard must get [opportunities]," he added. Sudhir further said star-kids getting better launch films can't stop outsiders from creating their base.

headlines: Afghanistan's 1-run win completes 3-0 clean sweep over B'desh
text: Afghanistan's 19-year-old spinner Rashid Khan defended 8 runs in the final over to hand his side a one-run win over Bangladesh, thereby completing a 3-0 whitewash over them in the series. Rashid picked a wicket with his first ball of the final over, while Bangladesh lost a wicket to a run-out on the final delivery of the match.

headlines: Mumbai shoe firm files infringement case against Flipkart
text: Mumbai-based footwear company Metro Shoes has filed a trademark infringement case against Flipkart in Bombay High Court. Metro Shoes has alleged that Flipkart's private brand named Metronaut is similar to Metro's eponymous brand, adding that the e-commerce startup is also selling shoes under the brand name. In response, Flipkart said it has not been aware of any such legal proceeding.

headlines: We've requested Malaysia for Zakir Naik's extradition: MEA
text: Addressing a media briefing on Thursday, Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said India has made a request to Malaysia for the extradition of Islamic preacher Zakir Naik. A response from Malaysia's end is awaited, he added. Naik is wanted by NIA for allegedly influencing terrorists involved in Dhaka terror attack and for inspiring many Indians to join ISIS.

headlines: Over 1,000 ceasefire violations by Pak in 2018 so far: MEA
text: Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said, "In 2018, there have been more than 1,000 unprovoked ceasefire violations by Pakistan, it is used as a cover to infiltrate terrorists into our territory." "We have always taken it very strongly, this matter of unprovoked ceasefire violation with the Pakistani side as it involves loss of life and property," he added.

headlines: Centre orders to shoot down UFOs spotted near Delhi airport
text: According to new guidelines issued by the Home Ministry, the Central Industrial Security Force and National Security Guard can shoot down Unidentified Flying Objects spotted near Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport. The object must be identified as dangerous before being shot down. Earlier, the forces had to inform all concerned agencies and then decide how to bring down the object.

headlines: Another TN girl commits suicide after failing to clear NEET
text: A girl allegedly committed suicide at her home in Tamil Nadu on Wednesday as she was reportedly upset over her inability to clear the NEET examination. Her parents said they had tried cheering her up but she hanged herself while they were in the other room. Earlier, a 19-year-old Tamil Nadu girl ended her life after failing to clear NEET.

headlines: Kenyan woman offered lift, gangraped by 5 in Haryana
text: A 30-year-old Kenyan woman was allegedly gangraped after she was offered lift by three men on Wednesday night in Haryana's Gurugram. The woman had gone to a party and was waiting for her cab when the men offered her a lift, following which they raped her and were joined by two other accomplices. Three of the accused have been arrested.

headlines: India denies entry to Maldivian MP amid strained ties
text: Amid strained relationship between the two countries, India denied entry to Maldivian MP Ahmed Nihan when he arrived at the Chennai airport earlier this week. External Affairs spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said they are trying to figure out how this happened. This comes days after reports said Maldives will return two search-and-rescue helicopters it was gifted by India in 2016.

headlines: Canara Bank fined â¹8 cr in UK for money laundering breaches
text: The UK's Financial Conduct Authority has fined state-owned Canara Bank's UK division Â£896,100 (â¹8 crore) for breaching anti-money laundering laws. It has also prohibited the bank from accepting new deposits for nearly five months. The regulator said the control failures at the bank affected almost all levels of its business and governance structure, including senior management.

headlines: Railways drops excess baggage fee plan within 6 days of announcement
text: The Indian Railways has dropped its plan to penalise passengers for carrying excess baggage in trains within six days of its announcement. The 30-year-old rule was brought into action from June 1 this year. According to Railway Ministry's spokesperson, the drive was merely to make people aware of how carrying excess luggage causes inconvenience to other travellers.

headlines: Clothes hung from drones in Saudi fashion show as women not allowed
text: A fashion show in Saudi Arabia featured "ghost models" by hanging clothes from drones as women in the conservative kingdom are not allowed to model. Organisers of the fashion show, which reportedly took place on Wednesday, claimed that the event was "Ramadan appropriate". The show featured outfits from luxury brands, including Dolce & Gabbana.

headlines: Rajini's 'Kaala' 1st Indian film to release in Saudi Arabia
text: Rajinikanth starrer 'Kaala' became the first Indian film to release in Saudi Arabia, months after the kingdom opened a cinema for the first time in 35 years. The producers of the movie shared a poster with the caption, "only Thalaivar can do this". Notably, 'Black Panther' was the first movie to be screened in Saudi Arabia in 35 years.

headlines: Anand Mahindra procures Rajini's 'Kaala' car for his museum
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Thursday tweeted that he has procured the 'Mahindra Thar' used in Rajinikanth's movie Kaala for his company's auto museum. The billionaire said the movie's producer Dhanush agreed to provide the car. Mahindra had expressed his willingness to acquire the car in May last year, when it was featured in the movie poster.

headlines: ABD's only ODI golden duck came after 220Â matches, 12 years
text: Ex-South African cricketer AB de Villiers recorded his first and only ODI golden duck in his 221st match (212 innings) on June 7, 2017, over 12 years after his ODI debut. The then South African captain was caught by Pakistan's Mohammad Hafeez off Imad Wasim's bowling in a Champions Trophy match. The 34-year-old registered seven ODI ducks in his career.

headlines: We did receive Facebook data: Cambridge Analytica's ex-CEO
