text: Alexander Nix, the former CEO of Facebook's data scandal-linked firm Cambridge Analytica, has accepted that the company had received Facebook users' data. Reversing his earlier statement, Nix said he thought he was being asked if Cambridge Analytica still held the data from the researcher Aleksandr Kogan. "Of course, the answer to this question should have been 'yes'," he added.

headlines: Startup that makes self-driving delivery robots raises $25mn
text: US-based startup Starship Technologies, which develops self-driving delivery robots, has raised $25 million from investors including Airbnb Co-founder Nathan Blecharczyk and Skype's Jaan Tallinn. The round also saw participation from existing investors Matrix Partners and Morpheus Ventures. Founded in 2014, Starship claims its robots can deliver food in 15-30 minutes within a 3-km radius.

headlines: NASA rover finds 'building blocks of life' on Mars
text: NASA's Curiosity rover, which landed on Mars in 2012, has found organic molecules containing carbon and hydrogen besides traces of oxygen and sulphur in three-billion-year-old rocks. Commonly associated with life, organic molecules can also be created by non-biological processes and are not necessarily indicators of life, NASA remarked. NASA will send another rover in 2020 to dig deeper on Mars.

headlines: Attempt to define nationhood will dilute identity: Ex-Prez
text: Addressing an RSS event in Nagpur on Thursday, former President Pranab Mukherjee said, "Any attempt at defining our nationhood in terms of...religion, region, hatred and intolerance will only lead to dilution of our identity." "Our national identity has emerged after a long drawn process of confluence and assimilation, the multiple cultures and faiths make us special and tolerant," he added.

headlines: BR Ambedkar's grandson Prakash threatens journo on camera
text: Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh President and Dr BR Ambedkar's grandson Prakash Ambedkar on Thursday threatened to a senior journalist on camera. Ambedkar can be seen abusing the journalist and threatening him, saying, "The government will change in six months." "Tell him that let elections take place, then we shall meet him. Remind him who he is targeting," he added.

headlines: RSS not trying to establish itself as Hindu body: RSS chief
text: Addressing an RSS event on Thursday, chief Mohan Bhagwat said, "RSS is trying to bring everyone together in the country and not trying to establish itself as a Hindu outfit." "Every Indian worships the motherland in their own way. We celebrate diversity...No one is alien to us," he added. Former President Pranab Mukherjee was the Chief Guest at the event.

headlines: All electricity meters to be smart prepaid in 3 years: Govt
text: Power Minister RK Singh has said all electricity meters in India will become smart prepaid meters in the next three years. "So need of the hour is to scale up manufacturing of smart prepaid meters and to bring down their prices," he told manufacturers. The government said the meters will reduce power companies' losses and increase ease of bill payments.

headlines: Team fined â¹27 lakh after cat stopped Champions League match
text: UEFA has handed a â¹27-lakh fine to Turkish football club Besiktas after a cat invaded the pitch forcing the play to be briefly stopped during their Champions League match against Bayern Munich in March. Besiktas, charged with "insufficent organisation", have also been penalised for fans throwing objects and blocking stairways at the stadium.

headlines: Premji buys 6% stake in Big Bazaar's parent for â¹1,700 crore
text: Wipro Chairman Azim Premji's family office PremjiInvest has bought a 6% stake in Kishore Biyani-led Future Retail, which runs Big Bazaar and Easyday stores, for around â¹1,700 crore. The stake was sold by Bharti Group, which continues to hold 3% in Future Retail. Notably, PremjiInvest is already an investor in one of the Future Group entities, Future Lifestyle Fashions.

headlines: Ambani keeps salary capped at â¹15 crore for 10th straight yr
text: India's richest person Mukesh Ambani has kept his annual salary from Reliance Industries capped at â¹15 crore for the tenth consecutive year. Ambani's cousins Nikhil and Hital Meswani, who are executive directors at Reliance, saw their compensation rise by about 20% to â¹19.99 crore each. Ambani's wife, Nita Ambani, a non-executive director, earned â¹1.56 crore as sitting fee and commission.

headlines: You're 13 yrs late: Raveena to fan who asked her to marry him
text: Actress Raveena Tandon has responded to a Twitter user who asked her if she would marry him. "Sorry yaar, you are 13 years late in asking," wrote the 43-year-old actress while replying to the fan. Raveena got married to film distributor Anil Thadani in the year 2004 and also has two children with him.

headlines: Chhetri scores in his 5th straight match as India lose to NZ
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri scored in his fifth consecutive match in India's 1-2 defeat against New Zealand in the Intercontinental Cup at the Mumbai Football Arena on Thursday. Chhetri has now scored eight goals in his last five matches. Interestingly, this was India's first defeat with Chhetri in the playing XI since October 13, 2015.

headlines: Important milestone: Sachin after son breaks into India U-19
text: After Arjun broke into the India Under-19 team, cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar said it is "an important milestone" in his son's cricketing life. "Anjali and I will always support him in his choices and pray for his success," he added. Arjun has been picked in the squad that will play two four-day games against Sri Lanka.

headlines: Will be 3rd wheel always: Rahul on pic with Mayank and wife
text: Team India batsman KL Rahul on Thursday took to Twitter to share pictures of himself with newlywed couple Mayank Agarwal and Aashita Sood. "Bromance and Romance! You're damn lucky (Mayank)...I promise to be the third wheel always," he wrote alongside the pictures. Rahul and Agarwal played together for Kings XI Punjab in IPL 2018.

headlines: De Villiers surprises 14-yr-old fan, plays cricket with him
text: South African cricketer AB de Villiers, who retired from international cricket last month, surprised his 14-year-old fan Leo Sadler and played backyard cricket with him. De Villiers also gifted him a South Africa national team cap. The fan's mother had said that when she gave him the news of De Villiers' retirement, he "didn't believe it and burst into tears".

headlines: No Twitter after yoga: Rhodes on replying to fake Chhetri
text: After replying to a fake Sunil Chhetri Twitter account, former South African cricketer Jonty Rhodes tweeted, "I should never go through my twitter account directly after yoga - thanks everyone for setting me straight." The fake Twitter account had shared Chhetri's picture with Rhodes and asked the cricketer to teach him how to "break stumps on the dive".

headlines: Kohli's wax statue damaged by crowd after being inaugurated
text: Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli's wax statue was damaged by the crowd on the day of its unveiling at Madame Tussauds in Delhi. Fans flocked to take selfies with Kohli's statue, which led to the right ear of the statue being damaged. The statue was removed and sent to a workshop for repairs after the incident.

headlines: World number one Halep reaches her 3rd French Open final
text: World number one women's tennis player Simona Halep on Thursday defeated world number three GarbiÃ±e MuguruzÃ  to enter her third French Open final. The 26-year-old Romanian, who has never won a Grand Slam so far, had previously finished as runner-up at Roland Garros in 2014 and 2017. Halep will face world number 10 Sloane Stephens in the final on Saturday.

headlines: Facebook tests Musical.ly-like Lip Sync Live feature
text: Facebook has introduced a feature called Lip Sync Live in test mode, similar to lip-syncing app Musical.ly. The feature will allow users to pretend to sing a song on a broadcast which can be shared in real time on the platform. Users will also be able to see the artist of the song and tap to follow them on Facebook.

headlines: Shah meets Uddhav after Sena calls BJP 'political enemy'
text: BJP president Amit Shah met Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray for a two-hour meeting in Mumbai on Wednesday. The meeting, which comes days after a Sena MP called the BJP its biggest "political enemy," also included Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis. "The agenda of the meeting was to ensure better coordination and resolve grievances," a BJP leader said.

headlines: T'gana cops release song to stop fake messages on kidnappers
text: In a bid to clamp down on fake WhatsApp messages on child abductors, Telangana police officers have released an awareness song. Sung by Traffic Inspector Anjapally Nagamallu, its lyrics say, "Don't lynch and kill people... If you have a suspicion dial 100." Nagamallu said the police are already conducting workshops, but their reach would be wider with an "enjoyable song".

headlines: Jignesh Mevani may be summoned over Bhima-Koregaon violence
text: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani may be summoned in connection with the Bhima-Koregaon violence in January, the Pune Police has said. Mevani was present at the Elgaar Parishad event, which marked the 200th anniversary of the Bhima-Koregaon Battle wherein British forces defeated the Peshwa army, it added. The event had turned violent and a youth had died in clashes.

headlines: I came here to explain patriotism: Ex-Prez Pranab at RSS event
text: Addressing an event at RSS headquarters in Nagpur, former President Pranab Mukherjee on Thursday said, "I am here amongst you to share my understanding with you of the concepts of nation, nationalism and patriotism in the context of India." The former Congress leader had attended the event despite facing criticism from several Congress leaders, including his daughter.

headlines: Shah Rukh Khan's cousin to contest Pak general elections
text: Shah Rukh Khan's paternal cousin Noor Jahan has announced plans to contest the upcoming general elections in Pakistan from Peshawar. Claiming she wants to work for women's empowerment, Jahan said, "I hope people support me in the same way they support Shah Rukh." She has previously served as a councillor and will contest the elections as an independent candidate.

headlines: Arjun Tendulkar breaks into India U-19 team for first time
text: Former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar's 18-year-old son Arjun Tendulkar has been named in the India Under-19 squad for the upcoming tour of Sri Lanka. The left-arm fast bowler was among 25 under-19 cricketers who recently underwent a month-long National Cricket Academy camp in Dharamshala. Arjun had taken 18 wickets in nine Cooch Behar Under-19 Trophy matches last season.

headlines: 10-time champ Nadal reaches French Open semis for 11th time
text: World number one Rafael Nadal on Thursday defeated Diego Schwartzman in a rain-affected match to reach the French Open semi-finals for the 11th time. The 10-time French Open champion registered a four-set comeback win after having dropped his first set at Roland Garros since 2015. The 32-year-old has now won 84 of 86 French Open matches he has played.

headlines: Twitter crashes worldwide for users, says it's over capacity
text: Users on Thursday reported that micro-blogging site Twitter crashed worldwide, claiming it showed a message that the platform is over capacity. Some users also reported that they received a message saying 'something is wrong' and asked them to try again later. The issue affected the desktop version as well as the Android app, according to a report.

headlines: IIT, DTU students win $1 mn prize for women's safety device
text: Leaf Wearables, a Delhi-based startup by students of IIT Delhi and Delhi Technological University, has won a $1-million Anu and Naveen Jain Women's Safety XPrize for creating a women's safety device. The device can send alerts within seconds to summon help for women in danger. A total of 85 teams from 18 countries had entered the competition.

headlines: Bentley Bentayga V8 SUV launched in India at â¹3.78 crore
text: UK-based automobile manufacturer Bentley Motors has launched the Bentley Bentayga V8 SUV in India at a starting price of â¹3.78 crore (ex-showroom). Powered by a 4.0-litre twin-turbocharged V8 petrol engine, the SUV develops 542 bhp and 770 Nm of torque. Further, Bentayga V8 can go from 0-100 kmph in 4.5 seconds and offers a top speed of 290 kmph.

headlines: Uber rival Gett raises $80 million at $1.4 billion valuation
text: US-based Uber rival Gett has raised $80 million in a funding round led by Volkswagen with participation from previous investors. The latest round valued the startup at $1.4 billion, the startup's CEO and founder Dave Waiser said in an interview. Founded in 2010, Gett has raised $693 million till date from investors including Inventure Partners and Kreos Capital.

headlines: Tesla short sellers lose $1 bn in a day as stock surges 10%
text: Short sellers betting against Tesla lost $1.1 billion on Wednesday as the carmaker's shares surged 9.7%, according to S3 Partners. This came after CEO Elon Musk told shareholders Tesla may exceed goal to make 5,000 Model 3 sedans a week by June-end. In May, Musk tweeted that "short burn of the century" was coming soon for those betting against Tesla.

headlines: NASA spacecraft beyond Pluto wakes up to further mission
text: NASA's New Horizons spacecraft, which flew by Pluto in 2015, was awoken from hibernation for its next rendezvous with a space rock at the edge of the Solar System. During hibernation, the spacecraft runs on autopilot and works on commands uploaded to its memory before snoozing off. New Horizons has been in and out of hibernation mode twice since 2017.

headlines: Maternal mortality ratio in India down 22%
text: The Maternal Mortality Ratio (MMR) in India has declined 22% from 167 in 2011-13 to 130 in 2014-16, according to data released by the Registrar General of India. Maternal mortality is the death of a woman while she is pregnant or within 42 days of termination of the pregnancy, due to any pregnancy-related issue.

headlines: Kerala govt on alert as man tests positive for black fever
text: A 38-year-old Kerala man has tested positive for 'Kala-azar' or black fever, which is spread by sandflies and can be fatal if left untreated. Health officials have urged people not to panic as the disease is curable. Meanwhile, Health Minister KK Shailaja said, "A meeting of peoples' representatives and health workers was convened and preventive measures have been chalked out."

headlines: Man molests minor at a fair in West Bengal, video goes viral
text: A video of a man molesting a minor girl at a fair at Hooghly's Chinsurah in West Bengal has gone viral on social media. In the video, he can be seen harassing the girl from behind and stops only when the girl's mother pulls her aside. The police have seen the video and are trying to track the man.

headlines: Students unable to spell own names excel in Guj Board English exam
text: Around 96 cases of mass copying in Gujarat Board's Class 10 English paper have been confirmed at Panchmahal district wherein students who couldn't spell their own names excelled in the exam. An essay on "My Best Friend" was found to be identical in all the answer sheets. Some students even wrote same answers and made same mistakes in Sanskrit paper.

headlines: Iceland most peaceful country, Syria least peaceful: Study
text: The Global Peace Index 2018 ranked Iceland as the world's most peaceful country, while Syria, which has been facing a civil war since seven years, was found to the least peaceful. The Middle East and North Africa remained the least peaceful regions. All the four most peaceful regionsâEurope, North America, Asia-Pacific, and South America, registered a decline in peace level.

headlines: World less peaceful now than any time in past decade: Study
text: The world has become less peaceful today than at any time in the last decade, according to the Global Peace Index (GPI). Global peacefulness declined by 0.27% in 2017, with peacefulness declining in 92 out of 163 countries. GPI analysed safety and security in society, extent of ongoing domestic and international conflict among other factors to assess global peace.

headlines: Chinese firm's cleaners turn millionaires as stock surges 9,500%
text: Hundreds of employees including cleaners, factory workers and cafeteria chefs of Chinese lens maker Sunny Optical have turned millionaires as the company granted stock to early staff, regardless of their position. The company's shares have surged 9,500% since June 2008. Excluding 4 directors, the average holding per employee translates to about $17 million (â¹114 crore), according to Bloomberg.

headlines: New poster of Janhvi Kapoor's B'wood debut 'Dhadak' released
text: A new poster of Sridevi's daughter Janhvi Kapoor's debut film 'Dhadak' has been released. Janhvi will star opposite Shahid Kapoor's half-brother Ishaan Khatter in the Shashank Khaitan directorial. Co-produced by Karan Johar, 'Dhadak' is reportedly a remake of the 2016 Marathi film 'Sairat', and is scheduled to release on July 20.

headlines: My intention wasn't wrong: Jacqueline on forcefully hugging kid
text: Jacqueline Fernandez, who was criticised for hugging a child without his consent on a show, has said her intention wasn't wrong. "I've a nephew. He doesn't like to be hugged at times, but I...hug him as I'm his aunt," she added. Jacqueline further said, "I understand where people's concerns are coming from...[but] it's my right to believe...my intentions weren't wrong."

headlines: Player who scored 202 on debut suspended for doping by BCCI
text: Punjab wicketkeeper-batsman Abhishek Gupta, who scored 202 on his Ranji debut last season, has been handed a retrospective eight-month ban by BCCI for failing a dope test. The 27-year-old "had inadvertently ingested a prohibited substance, which can be commonly found in cough syrups" during a domestic T20 competition in January. Yusuf Pathan was also handed a doping ban in January.

headlines: Twitter to raise $1 billion in debt
text: Microblogging site Twitter has announced that it is selling $1 billion of bonds in its second-ever debt offering. This comes a day after the Dow Jones Indices said that Twitter would be added to the S&P 500 Index, which is a market capitalization weighted index of the 500 largest US publicly traded companies by market value.

headlines: Oldest footprints discovered in 540-mn-yr-old insect tracks
text: The oldest known footprints on Earth, left by ancestors of modern-day insects at least 541 million years ago, have been discovered in China. Scientists couldn't ascertain what the creature looked like, but said nothing this old with legs had been discovered to date. The fossils, few millimetres in width, were spotted by tilting rock slabs at different angles against sunlight.

headlines: NASA probe solves 39-yr-old mystery of lightning on Jupiter
text: NASA's Juno spacecraft has solved the mystery behind lightning on Jupiter, which was first spotted by NASA's Voyager 1 in 1979 but deemed different than lighting on Earth. Juno, which went closer to Jupiter, found it was similar to that of Earth, however, the gas giant experiences the phenomena only near its poles while Earth witnesses it around the equator.

headlines: You don't need to be like-minded but right-minded: Rajnath
text: During his visit to Jammu and Kashmir, Home Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday said, "We are open to talks with all, you don't need to be like-minded to talk but you do need to be right-minded." Speaking of separatists, he said, "They can play any kind of politics, but they should not play with future of children...they are an asset."

headlines: Guj MLA Jignesh seeks Y-category security over death threats
text: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani has sought Y-category security cover on Thursday after allegedly receiving his second telephonic death threat in two days. An associate of Mewani said he had received similar threats on Facebook and Twitter earlier. Individuals protected under Y-category security are assigned a security cover of 11 personnel including commandos and police.

headlines: 10 injured as honey bees attack YSR Cong leader, supporters
text: At least 10 people were injured after being stung by honey bees which attacked them during YSR Congress leader Jagan Mohan Reddy's 'padayatra' (foot march) in Andhra Pradesh's West Godavari on Thursday. Jagan was unhurt as his security and supporters used handkerchiefs, and party flags to protect him. The injured were shifted to a hospital and the padayatra resumed later.

headlines: Iraq orders manual recount of all 1 crore votes
text: The Iraqi Parliament has ordered a full manual recount of the country's recent parliamentary election where 1.1 crore votes were cast. This came in response to charges of electoral fraud. Elections were held in Iraq last month for the first time since the defeat of Islamic State in the country.

headlines: Fired employee shoots at company's HR Head in Gurugram
text: An employee who was sacked from a Japanese multinational company in Gurugram, today opened fire at the company's HR Head. The employee, who was fired over his alleged 'unprofessional behaviour' on Wednesday, shot at the HR Head with an accomplice on a bike after intercepting his car. The HR Head suffered two gunshot injuries, the police said.

headlines: Ex-Prez Pranab Mukherjee addresses RSS event amid Cong protests
text: Former President Pranab Mukherjee on Thursday addressed an event at RSS headquarters in Nagpur as the Chief Guest despite facing criticism from several Congress leaders, including his daughter. At the event honouring RSS founder KB Hedgewar, the former President wrote in the visitor's book, "I came here to pay my respect and homage to a great son of Mother India."

headlines: Facebook makes typo while introducing new journalism project
text: Facebook on Wednesday introduced a new journalism project to produce news shows specifically for the platform and made a typo while pledging its commitment for the same. "We care about about supporting high quality journalism," the Facebook Journalism Project's Overview section read. The social media platform later corrected the typo on the company's blog post introducing the project.

headlines: Google rolls out free WiFi to 400 Indian railway stations
text: Google announced today that the company has successfully rolled out free public WiFi at 400 Indian railway stations in collaboration with RailTel. Dibrugarh railway station in Assam has become the 400th station to go live, Google said in a statement. The initiative was first announced in 2015 by the company's CEO Sundar Pichai and Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

headlines: Pranab Mukherjee's daughter rubbishes reports of joining BJP
text: Former President Pranab Mukherjee's daughter and Congress leader Sharmistha Mukherjee has denied reports of her joining the BJP, saying she would rather quit politics than join the BJP. Delhi Congress Chief Ajay Maken also said she is a "devoted" Congress member. The reports of Sharmistha joining BJP emerged after former President Mukherjee accepted the invitation for an RSS event.

headlines: I have an issue with time: Musk on Model 3 production delays
text: On being asked about Tesla Model 3 production delays at the recent shareholder meeting, CEO Elon Musk said, "I think I do have like an issue with, uh, time." Musk explained that his brother used to lie to him about the school bus time so that he would arrive on time. "I have a condition, I dunno," he added.

headlines: You can't use your wife's ATM card, says SBI; Court agrees
text: The SBI has refused to refund a Karnataka woman of â¹25,000 after she gave her debit card to her husband to withdraw money from an ATM, saying 'PIN shared, case closed'. While the transaction was successful, the ATM failed to dispense cash. The court agreed with SBI saying she should have given a self-cheque or an authorisation letter for withdrawal.

headlines: Over 100 injured as bus comes in contact with live wire
text: More than 100 labourers were severely injured on Thursday when the bus they were travelling in came in contact with a high-tension live wire in Rajasthan's Bhusawar. The wires were dangling above the road when the bus passed the spot, causing the accident. Of the injured people, six were critical while 15 were badly burned.

headlines: Pune Police confirms Naxal link in Bhima-Koregaon violence
text: The Pune Police on Thursday confirmed that the five people arrested in connection with the Bhima-Koregaon violence have links with Naxals. The houses of some of the accused were raided and recovered pen drives, hard drives, and documents were sent to forensics. The violence had been triggered during a gathering by Dalits for the 200th-anniversary celebrations of the Bhima-Koregaon battle.

headlines: 15-year-old girl poisoned to death after gangrape in Haryana
text: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly poisoned to death after being gangraped by three men in a village in Haryana on Tuesday, the police said. Her father said she had gone missing, and was later dropped home by two men who claimed she was sick. Once they left, the girl told her parents that she was sexually assaulted and poisoned.

headlines: WWIII could lead to end of civilisation: Russia Prez Putin
text: Urging nations against taking "radical" actions that would lead to a global conflict, Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that World War III "could be an end of the modern civilisation". Putin further quoted renowned physicist Albert Einstein saying, "I do not know with what weapons WWIII will be fought, but WWIV will be fought with sticks and stones."

headlines: Homebuyers can now drag defaulting builders to insolvency
text: President Ram Nath Kovind has promulgated an ordinance empowering homebuyers to initiate insolvency proceedings against defaulting builders. The insolvency law now recognises homebuyers as financial creditors which would give them a share in the money earned through sale of a bankrupt developer's assets. Homebuyers will get due representation in the Committee of Creditors, the government said.

headlines: Indians account for over 75% of US green card waiting list
text: Indians account for over 75% of the highly-skilled professionals waiting to obtain legal permanent residence status in the US, popularly known as green card. Of the 395,025 foreign nationals waiting for green card, 306,601 were Indians, according to official data as of May. The only other country to have more than 10,000 people waiting for green card is China (67,031).

headlines: Happy b'day Laksshya's 'bua': Tusshar on sister Ekta's b'day
text: Actor Tusshar Kapoor took to Instagram to share a childhood picture with his sister Ekta Kapoor on the occasion of her birthday today and wrote, "Happy birthday 'Bua' of Laksshya!" "Ultimate family person ever, though you vow never to throw a surprise party for the wrong candidates," he added. Laksshya is Tusshar's two-year-old son who was born via surrogacy.

headlines: Rejected my 1st H'wood film because of nude scene: PenÃ©lope
text: PenÃ©lope Cruz has revealed she turned down her first Hollywood film because the producers added a nude scene to the script without telling her. "They said, 'You've to accept there are going to be some naked scenes that weren't in the script'," she added. However, PenÃ©lope further said she went through the screen test even though she rejected the film.

headlines: Poster of 'Sanju' featuring Dia as Dutt's wife Maanayata out
text: A new poster of Sanjay Dutt's biopic 'Sanju', featuring actress Dia Mirza as his wife Maanayata has been released. "And here comes Dia Mirza as Maanayata, someone who stood by Sanju through thick and thin," wrote the film's director Rajkumar Hirani while sharing the poster. Also starring Sonam Kapoor, Manisha Koirala and Anushka Sharma, 'Sanju' will release on June 29.

headlines: Mithali 1st Indian lady to hit 2000 T20I runs as Ind beat SL
text: Playing in her 74th T20I, Mithali Raj became the first-ever Indian woman cricketer to reach 2,000 runs in T20I cricket as India defeated Sri Lanka by seven wickets in the Women's Asia Cup on Thursday. India are currently on top of the points table with six points from four matches. India will next face Pakistan on June 9.

headlines: Steyn gives 80 runs in 10 overs in 1st match after 5 months
text: Playing in his first match after five months, South African pacer Dale Steyn conceded 80 runs in 10 overs in his team Hampshire's defeat against Somerset in the Royal London One-Day Cup on Wednesday. The 34-year-old had the worst economy rate among the six bowlers used by Hampshire. Steyn was sidelined with a heel injury in January this year.

headlines: I sledge my daughter while playing UNO: New Australia coach
text: Australian cricket coach Justin Langer has said that he "sledges" his daughter while playing UNO with her. "If I'm playing with my daughter, she wants to beat me big time, so we have a bit of banter, or what we call sledging," he added. Langer further said that "sledging is fun part of cricket" but "abuse is no good".

headlines: FB to train staff in local languages after Sri Lanka riots
text: Facebook is planning to train its employees in Sri Lanka's local languages like Sinhala to identify inappropriate content on the platform. The move comes months after anti-Muslim riots took place in the country resulting in the death of three people. Facebook was also banned in Sri Lanka for a week in March for displaying negative criticism which fuelled the riots.

headlines: WB Governor given additional charge of Tripura Governor
text: President Ram Nath Kovind on Thursday gave West Bengal Governor Keshari Nath Tripathi the additional charge of Tripura Governor till Tripura Governor Tathagata Roy is on leave. Notably, Tripathi had also been given the additional charge of Bihar governor in November 2014 after then Bihar Governor Ram Nath Kovind resigned when the BJP selected him as a presidential candidate.

headlines: Withdrew stone-pelting cases as kids make mistakes: Rajnath
text: Union Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday said the Centre withdrew cases against 6,000 youngsters booked for stone pelting in Kashmir last year as "children can make mistakes." "Children anywhere are the same. We understand that some youths were misled into stone pelting. I want to appeal to the youth that they should follow the path of development," he added.

headlines: Women in Bihar village build road as govt fails to in 10 yrs
text: About 130 women have built a two-kilometre road in a Bihar village after the government failed to build it for 10 years. Several pregnant women had died due to the road as they failed to reach health centres on time. Although the administration had tried acquiring land to build a road, they abandoned the idea due to protests by landowners.

headlines: UK, Germany, France seek exemption from US sanctions on Iran
text: The UK, France, Germany, and EU sent a joint request to the US to exempt European companies from the sanctions imposed on Iran. The countries said they expected the US to refrain from actions that would harm Europe's security interests. The US reimposed sanctions against individuals and entities conducting trade with Iran after it withdrew from the 2015 nuclear deal.

headlines: Air India hikes baggage fee to â¹500/kg for domestic travel
text: State-run Air India has hiked excess baggage charges by â¹100 per kg to â¹500 for domestic flights, starting June 11. The revised charges are applicable on all flights operated by Air India, excluding those of its regional arm, Alliance Air. Air India currently offers free baggage allowance of 25 kg and 35 kg in economy and business class, respectively.

headlines: Videocon admitted to bankruptcy proceedings of â¹20,000 crore
text: Venugopal Dhoot-led Videocon Industries has been admitted for insolvency proceedings by the National Company Law Tribunal after a plea by lenders led by SBI. The firm owes â¹20,000 crore to various banks including â¹3,900 crore to SBI alone. Videocon's total consolidated debt is around â¹44,000 crore, but the lenders have not taken its foreign arms to the bankruptcy court.

headlines: Swachh Bharat Mission creating healthy India, says PM Modi
text: Addressing the beneficiaries of various central healthcare schemes, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said, "The Swachh Bharat Mission is playing a central role in creating a healthy India." He further said the sanitation cover in India has increased by 38%, while around 3.5 lakh Indian villages have declared themselves to be 'Open Defecation Free'.

headlines: Abu Salem jailed for 7 yrs for demanding â¹5 cr from businessman
text: Delhi's Tis Hazari Court on Thursday sentenced gangster Abu Salem to 7 years in jail in a 2002 extortion case. Salem had demanded â¹5 crore as protection money from a Delhi-based businessman. The gangster is currently serving a life sentence for his role in the 1993 serial blasts in Mumbai, which had killed 257 people and left over 700 injured.

headlines: Wasim Akram used wife for sexual fantasies: Imran's ex-wife
text: Pakistani cricketer-turned-politician Imran Khan's ex-wife Reham Khan has alleged in her upcoming book that former cricketer Wasim Akram used his late wife Huma Mufti to fulfil his sexual fantasies. Reham claimed Akram hired a black man to have sex with Huma while he watched. Akram has sent her a legal notice, calling the claims defamatory, indecent and disrespectful.

headlines: 'Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom' hits the theatres
text: Chris Pratt starrer 'Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom', which released today, "is a new low for the...[Jurassic Park] series," wrote Hindustan Times (HT). "The film excels when it allows...the CGI dinosaurs to shine," said The Times of India (TOI). The New Indian Express called the film's action sequences "intense". It was rated 2/5 (HT) and 3.5/5 (TOI, The New Indian Express).

headlines: Kate suffered from depression for over 5 yrs: Husband on her suicide
text: Luxury fashion designer Kate Spade's husband Andy Spade, in a statement issued after her alleged suicide on Tuesday, revealed she suffered from depression and anxiety for over five years. "She was actively seeking help for depression and anxiety...seeing a doctor on a regular basis and taking medication," he added. Andy further said there was no substance or alcohol abuse involved.

headlines: Rock climbers scale 3,000-feet wall in 2 hours, set record
text: Two of the world's most accomplished rock climbers, Alex Honnold and Tommy Caldwell, broke their own speed-climbing record by scaling El Capitan's 3,000-foot granite wall in 1 hour, 58 minutes and 7 seconds. The duo was practising the 'Nose route' since May at US' Yosemite Valley. This comes days after two speed climbers fell to their deaths on El Capitan.

headlines: Kohli BCCI's best male int'l cricketer for last 2 seasons
text: Indian men's cricket team captain Virat Kohli has been named BCCI's best international cricketer (men) for the 2016-17 and 2017-18 seasons and will receive the Polly Umrigar Award on June 12. Further, Indian women's T20I team captain Harmanpreet Kaur and opener Smriti Mandhana will receive the award for best international cricketer (women) for the 2016-17 and 2017-18 seasons respectively.

headlines: Google Co-founder-backed firm shows single-seat flying car
text: Google Co-founder Larry Page-backed startup Kitty Hawk has unveiled its latest all-electric flying car called 'Flyer' which can seat one person in a central pod. The vehicle features 10 propellers and can fly up to 10 feet off the ground at speeds of up to 32.1 kmph. The flying car's battery life is said to be 12 to 20 minutes.

headlines: Ola's revenue rises 70% at â¹1,286 crore in FY17
text: Homegrown cab aggregator Ola has posted a 70% rise in revenue at â¹1,286 crore for the year ended March 31, 2017, according to filings. In comparison, the startup recorded a revenue of â¹758.23 crore for the same period during the previous year. Ola counts Japanese conglomerate SoftBank and US-based investment firm Tiger Global Management among its major investors.

headlines: Bihar students protest after nearly half fail in Board exams
text: After only 53% students managed to clear the Class 12 Board exams in Bihar, students staged a protest outside the Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) office alleging discrepancy in the results. Some students also claimed they were lathi-charged during the protest, but the police denied the allegations. Last year, only 35% students had cleared the state Board exams.

headlines: One dog per flat rule in B'luru put on hold after backlash
text: Following protests by pet owners in the city, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) rule allowing only one dog per flat and maximum three per independent house has been put on hold. Bengaluru Mayor Sampath Raj met with pet owners and acknowledged their concerns. The BBMP had also put out an 'approved' list of breeds, which didn't include the Indian strays.

headlines: Swaraj unveils two-faced Mahatma Gandhi bust in S Africa
text: Minister of External Affairs Sushma Swaraj on Thursday unveiled a two-faced Mahatma Gandhi bust at South Africa's Pietermaritzburg railway station. The bust depicts Gandhi ji's younger version on the front and older version on the back side. Notably, it is the same station where Mahatma Gandhi was thrown out of a 'whites-only' train compartment in 1893.

headlines: Mumbai airport handles 1k flights in 24hrs, breaks own record
text: The Chhatrapati Shivaji International Airport in Mumbai, which is the world's busiest single-runway airport, broke its own record by witnessing 1,003 flight operations in 24 hours on Tuesday. The airport's previous record was on May 19, when it handled 988 flights in a day. The increase in flight operations was due to a storm on Monday that led to delays.

headlines: Centre approves plan for 3 lakh solar street lights in India
text: The Union Cabinet has approved a â¹637-crore plan which includes installing 3 lakh solar street lights throughout the country, especially northeastern states and Maoist-affected districts. It also includes distributing 25 lakh solar study lamps to all the students in such areas. Further, the Centre is planning a second phase to build stand-alone solar power plants where grid supply is unreliable.

headlines: Woman drops newborn girl on the street in UP
text: A video of a woman dropping a newborn girl from a car on an empty street in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar has gone viral. The CCTV footage shows the woman, with face entirely covered, leaning from the car's window and leaving the newborn outside a house. The baby is currently being treated and is said to be in a critical condition.

headlines: Didn't Canada burn down White House: Trump asks Trudeau
text: In a phone call with Canadian PM Justin Trudeau, US President Donald Trump falsely claimed that Canada burned down the White House during the 1812 war. Trump had said this when Trudeau asked him how he could justify new tariffs on national security grounds. The White House was burned by British troops and Canada had been a British colony then.

headlines: Trump hosts his first Iftar dinner at White House
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday hosted his first Iftar dinner at the White House, which was attended by ambassadors from several Muslim-majority nations. The US President said Iftar marked "the coming together of families and friends to celebrate a timeless message of peace, clarity and love". Several Muslim groups boycotted the dinner, citing Trump's alleged anti-Muslim views.

headlines: Man bitten by head of severed snake that he killed
text: A man in the US state of Texas required 26 doses of anti-venom after he was bitten by the severed head of a rattlesnake that he had killed. The head bit him on the hand while he was disposing of the remains of the four-foot snake. Notably, a snake's bite reflex can be triggered even hours after the animal dies.

headlines: Video: US man drives SUV in reverse on busy highway
text: A video of a man driving a white SUV in reverse on a busy highway in the US state of Ohio has surfaced online. The Ohio Department of Transportation published a Facebook post following the incident and captioned it 'What not to do in traffic'. The department's video ended with the message that read, "Please, don't be that driver."

headlines: Karisma not marrying rumoured boyfriend Sandeep: Dad Randhir
text: Denying rumours that his daughter Karisma Kapoor will marry her rumoured boyfriend Sandeep Toshniwal, Randhir Kapoor said, "There's no truth to this." "She has clearly told me she doesn't want to start a family again," he added. Randhir further said he doesn't know Sandeep at all, while adding, "He's her friend and they do go out together, which is fine."

headlines: Sledging is a fun part of the game: Aus coach Justin Langer
text: Ahead of the England tour, Australia's new coach Justin Langer has said "in Australia sledging is actually a good word...a fun part of the game. But there's a difference between banter and abuse...abuse is not good." Captain Tim Paine explained that his team would sledge the opposition to make them "uncomfortable", but abuse is "no longer" part of Australia's methods.

headlines: Google may face $11bn fine for abusing dominance via Android
text: The European Commission may reportedly fine Google up to $11 billion for abusing its dominance through the Android mobile operating system. The EU began the case in 2016, accusing Google of imposing illegal terms on Android device makers to harm competition. Earlier, Google was fined $2.7 billion for abusing search dominance to give an advantage to its shopping comparison service.

headlines: Sharad Yadav can keep official house, can't draw salary: SC
text: The Supreme Court has ruled that rebel MP Sharad Yadav, disqualified as an MP in December last year, can retain his official bungalow but cannot draw salary or allowances. The top court modified a Delhi High Court order which had allowed him to draw the salary. The High Court had, however, refused to grant interim stay on his disqualification.

headlines: Centre will change fate and face of J&K: Rajnath Singh
text: Speaking at a Sports Conclave in Srinagar on Thursday, Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh said the Narendra Modi-led government at the Centre will change the face and the fate of Jammu and Kashmir. Further asserting that the government has a "lot of love" for Kashmir, he said the country can only progress if the youth of the region progress.

headlines: Expect extremely heavy rainfall in Mumbai over weekend: IMD
text: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that the maximum intensity of rainfall is expected over Mumbai during the coming weekend and possibility of extremely heavy rainfall in isolated areas cannot be ruled out. The weather bureau has issued an alert asking citizens to stay indoors as much as possible from June 9 to June 11.

headlines: Mumbai cop directs traffic without raincoat in heavy rain
text: Videos of a traffic policeman in Mumbai wherein he can be seen controlling traffic without an umbrella or a raincoat during heavy rainfall on Monday have surfaced online. The videos show traffic moving smoothly with the help of the policeman's directions. Meanwhile, several roads were flooded due to the rain, affecting traffic conditions in many parts of the city.

headlines: Japan mulls anti-sexual harassment training for officials
text: Japan reportedly plans to send its senior officials to attend sexual harassment awareness sessions as a precondition for promotion. This follows series of sex scandals, including one involving Vice Finance Minister Junichi Fukuda who resigned in April after being accused of sexually harassing a female reporter. The Cabinet Bureau of Personnel Affairs will check whether courses have been attended.

headlines: We won't allow Iran to develop nuclear weapons: US
text: US State Secretary Mike Pompeo on Wednesday said his country will not allow Iran to develop nuclear weapons and that the US is aware of reports that Iran plans to increase its uranium enrichment capacity. "Iran is aware of our resolve. It's another example of Iran foolishly squandering its resources," he added.

headlines: Govt approves â¹10,000 crore to ISRO for future missions
text: The Centre on Wednesday approved the continuation of the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle and Geosynchronous Satellite Launch Vehicle Mark-III programmes, costing over â¹10,000 crore. While â¹6,131 crore was allotted for launching light-weight satellites in 30 PSLV flights, â¹4,338 crore was given for heavy-weight satellites on 10 GSLV missions. The funds will cater to missions from late-2019 to 2024.

headlines: Govt seeks to use satellite to measure Yoga Day participation
text: The Union Ayush Ministry has approached the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), seeking to use satellite imagery to determine the number of people taking part in events on the International Yoga Day. Ayush Secretary Rajesh Kotecha said that while a formal response is awaited, the ISRO chief has given an in-principle approval to the request.

headlines: Imran Khan will hand over Pakistan to extremists: Ex-wife
text: Imran Khan's former wife Reham Khan has claimed in a book that the Pakistani cricketer-turned-politician will hand over the country to extremists if he wins the upcoming general elections. Describing Imran as Mr U-turn, Reham said everyone including his opponents and his backers should be wary of him. Reham's marriage with Imran lasted 10 months.

headlines: I live in rented house, need money to buy 1: Golmaal actor Sanjay
text: 'Golmaal' film franchise actor Sanjay Mishra has revealed he still lives in a rented accommodation and needs money to buy a house. "I think that's more to do with my attitude...I ask filmmakers to first show me their work," he added. Mishra further said sometimes he also takes emotional decisions if he has worked with a particular filmmaker before.

headlines: Bigg Boss contestant Shradha Sharma accuses CA of molestation
text: Former Bigg Boss contestant and actor Raja Chaudhary's ex-girlfriend Shradha Sharma has filed a molestation complaint against her Chartered Accountant Rajesh Saluja. "I wasn't on board with his decisions and his unprofessional attitude so I decided to cut off ties with him...but he ended up molesting me," she added. Shradha also claimed Saluja has been "exploiting a lot of girls".

headlines: Rajinikanth starrer 'Kaala' hits the theatres
text: Rajinikanth starrer 'Kaala', which released today, "works really well as a film and as a Rajinikanth vehicle," wrote Hindustan Times (HT). The film "gives a spin to the classic white-is-pure-and-black-is-evil logic," said The Times of India (TOI). The Indian Express wrote that 'Kaala' is a film about revolution. The film was rated 4/5 (HT) and 3.5/5 (TOI, The Indian Express).

headlines: Actor Arbaaz Khan becomes witness in IPL betting case
text: Bollywood actor Arbaaz Khan and producer Parag Sanghvi will be made witnesses to the IPL betting racket, Thane Police's Anti-Extortion Cell said on Wednesday. While Arbaaz had earlier admitted to links with Dawood Ibrahim's bookie Sonu Jalan, Sanghvi denied involvement in the betting racket. Arbaaz and Sanghvi will record their statement before the court under Section 164 of the CrPC.

headlines: Man arrested for live streaming Rajinikanth's Kaala on Facebook
text: A man named Praveen Thevar has been arrested for live streaming Rajinikanth and Huma Qureshi starrer 'Kaala' on Facebook during the film's preview show in Singapore on Wednesday. Following his arrest, the live stream was brought down. Reacting to this, producer G Dhananjayan posted on Twitter, "Shocking act of piracy. Disgusting."

headlines: Will hang myself if TDP allies with Congress: Andhra Dy CM
text: Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM KE Krishnamurthy on Wednesday said that TDP has ruled out any alliance with Congress for the 2019 General Elections, adding, "If it (alliance) happens, I am ready to hang myself." The rumours of their alliance surfaced after TDP chief and state CM Chandrababu Naidu shared stage with Congress leaders during Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy's swearing-in ceremony.

headlines: Will still contest alone: Shiv Sena MP after Amit Shah meet
text: Following a meeting between Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray and BJP President Amit Shah, Sena leader Sanjay Raut said there will be no change in the resolution to contest all upcoming elections alone. Shah met Thackeray at the Sena chief's residence on Wednesday as part of BJP's 'Sampark for Samarthan' outreach programme and the meeting lasted for over two hours.

headlines: Astronaut appointed science minister in new Spanish cabinet
text: New Spanish Prime Minister Pedro SÃ¡nchez on Wednesday appointed Pedro Duque, a 55-year-old veteran of two space missions, as his science minister. Duque, the first Spaniard to go into space, said he wished his mother was still alive to see it. He last went to space in 2003 as part of an International Space Station (ISS) mission.

headlines: Pune doctor visits beggars on streets for free check-ups
text: Dr Abhijit Sonawane in Pune visits temples, mosques and streets daily to treat elderly and physically challenged homeless people, who beg to survive. He also gives them free medicines during the check-ups. "While treating these people I build a rapport with them and then try to convince them to quit begging and do some kind of work," the doctor said.

headlines: IPS officer offers free coaching to UPSC aspirants in Jammu
text: IPS officer Sandeep Chaudhary from south Jammu is providing free coaching to 150 students for UPSC, J&K sub-inspector, banking, and Staff Selection Commission (SSC) exams. Adding that he never "spent a penny" on his education and studied through IGNOU, Chaudhary said, "My aim is not only to help aspirants crack the exams, but also to democratise the state of education."

headlines: Pregnant tribal woman carried to hospital over no ambulance
text: A pregnant tribal woman in Kerala's Palakkad was carried to the hospital on a makeshift stretcher made of logs and a bedsheet because of non-availability of an ambulance, reports said. She was carried till a motorable road, after which a private vehicle transported them. Meanwhile, authorities claimed the ambulance did not arrive because it was under repair.

headlines: Uttarakhand to ban use of polythene from July 31
text: On the occasion of World Environment Day on Tuesday, Uttarakhand CM Trivendra Singh Rawat announced a blanket ban on polythene starting July 31. Polythene wholesalers will be asked to finish their polythene stocks by the given date, he said. "A statewide campaign will be launched to sensitise the people to the environmental and ecological damages caused by polythene," he added.

headlines: Rajasthan govt to buy old phones, computers to curb e-waste
text: In a bid to check e-waste problem, Rajasthan government has launched a scheme wherein people can sell their old phones, computers, routers and any other electronic items to the government. The government will also give jute bags in exchange for plastic bags to people. Around 20 such collection points have been set up at Indian Oil petrol pumps in Jaipur.

headlines: People to get â¹5 on putting bottle in crusher at Guj station
text: Indian Railways has installed plastic bottle crushers at Vadodara railway station in Gujarat that will credit â¹5 in people's Paytm wallet upon disposing bottles. People will have to enter their mobile number on the machine after dropping bottles into it, following which the money will be credited to them. The move aims to reduce plastic waste at the station.

headlines: New militants join because of thrill seeking: J&K CID study
text: Most militants are between 15 and 25 years of age, went to government schools, join because of a "thrill seeker attitude", and have behaviour "as normal as a guy next door", according to a study by the J&K CID. The study added that only in 20% cases it emerged that the recruits had been previously allegedly harassed by security forces.

headlines: Chinese city opens 'mobile lane' for texting pedestrians
text: The Chinese city of Xi'an has introduced a special lane on one of its roads for pedestrians who use their mobiles while walking. The walkway has been painted red, green and blue, and is 80cm wide and several hundred metres long. "The lane gives us people looking at phones frequently a sense of safety," a local resident said.

headlines: Don't want live-in relationship, would marry for kids: Alia
text: Alia Bhatt has said she does not want to be in a live-in relationship while adding that she may get married before she turns 30. "I've always believed that I'd get married because of kids. So, if I'm like, 'This is the time I want to have children and am also ready to have babies', I'll get married," she added.

headlines: Two-time champion Sharapova crashes out of French Open
text: Two-time French Open winner Maria Sharapova has crashed out of the tournament after suffering a quarter-final defeat from world number three Garbine Muguruza. Spain's Muguruza, who won the French Open in 2016, defeated the Russian 6-2, 6-1 in a 70-minute match on Wednesday. The 24-year-old will play world number one Simona Halep in the last four.

headlines: NBA star LeBron throws self pass off backboard for slam dunk
text: NBA star LeBron James passed the ball to himself off the backboard for a slam dunk in the opening minutes of NBA Finals' Game 3 on Wednesday. James, who plays for Cleveland Cavaliers, ducked past a Golden State's defender, threw the ball to the backboard and caught it on the rebound before completing the dunk, referred as a "solo alley-oop".

headlines: Job is too consuming: NZ cricket coach resigns ahead of WC
text: With less than a year to the ICC Cricket World Cup, Mike Hesson has announced he will step down as New Zealand team coach in July. "This job requires 100% commitment and is all consuming...I know what's required over the next 12 months, but I don't feel I have the capacity to give what the job deserves," said the 43-year-old.

headlines: Mumbai's all-women parcel delivery startup raises â¹3.3 crore
text: Mumbai-based parcel delivery startup Hey Deedee has raised â¹3.3 crore in pre-seed funding from Metaform Venture. The amount will be used to expand its market from four to 10 cities, the startup said in a statement. Founded in 2016, the startup has an all-women parcel delivery fleet which it builds by skilling underprivileged women in two-wheeler driving to deliver parcels.

headlines: Mercedes-Benz parent unveils two electric trucks in US
text: Mercedes-Benz parent company Daimler's truck unit has unveiled two electric trucks called Freightliner eCascadia and Freightliner eM2 for the US market. While eCascadia is a heavy-duty truck and has a range of up to 400 kilometres, eM2 is a medium-duty truck with a range of around 370 kilometres. Daimler plans to begin production of the trucks in 2021.

headlines: TN man killed by lightning while trying to take its photo
text: A 43-year-old man was killed by lightning in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur while trying to take a picture of it on his mobile phone, police said. When the victim's friends tried to pick him up, they found injuries on his face and chest, police officials added. Following the incident, the police warned people against trying to take photographs of lightning.

headlines: Trump commutes drug offender's sentence after Kim's appeal
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday commuted the life sentence of a woman for a first-time drug offence after meeting reality TV star Kim Kardashian regarding prison reform. The 63-year-old woman has served over 20 years in prison on drug conspiracy and money laundering charges. "[We] believe those who've worked to better themselves...deserve a second chance," the White House said.

headlines: IIT Bombay displaces IIT Delhi as best-ranked Indian university
text: Rising 17 positions from last year to 162, IIT Bombay has displaced IIT Delhi (172) to become the top-ranked Indian institute in the QS World University Rankings, which featured IISc Bangalore at 170. Globally, Massachusetts Institute of Technology remained the top university for seventh straight year. The number of Indian universities in the top 1,000 increased from 20 to 24.

headlines: Indian football team's remaining matches also sold out
text: All the tickets for the Indian football team's remaining Intercontinental Cup matches at the Mumbai Football Arena have already been sold out. This comes after captain Sunil Chhetri shared a video on social media urging Indians to show up for their matches. India will face New Zealand on June 7 before featuring in the summit clash on June 10.

headlines: Cambridge Analytica discussed US polls with WikiLeaks: Report
text: A Cambridge Analytica Director had met WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to discuss the 2016 US Presidential elections retrospectively, according to The Guardian. Brittany Kaiser also reportedly made cryptocurrency payments and donations to Wikileaks, calling the organisation her "favourite charity". The firm had earlier approached Assange to help him with the Hillary Clinton email scandal.

headlines: Indian techies train drone to spot violent people in crowd
text: Researchers from India and the UK have demonstrated a real-time Drone Surveillance System that can detect violent people in public areas. The system first detects humans from aerial images and then analyses their poses to identify violent individuals. It compares the poses with postures the researchers have designated as 'violent' for the purpose.

headlines: China's Huawei says it hasn't collected Facebook user data
text: Chinese phone maker Huawei on Wednesday said it has never collected or stored Facebook user data after the social media giant acknowledged it shared such data with Huawei and other manufacturers. Interestingly, US intelligence officials had earlier flagged Huawei as a national security threat. Other Chinese manufacturers with whom Facebook has data-sharing partnerships are Lenovo, OPPO and TCL.

headlines: SoftBank CEO may meet PM Modi for $60-billion solar project
text: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's CEO Masayoshi Son may meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his visit to India next week, as per reports. Son will discuss his company's plan to invest $60 billion in the solar sector of the country. SoftBank is reportedly planning to infuse the money by 2020 with prospects of generating jobs for 2 lakh people.

headlines: All NRI marriages to be registered in 48 hours: WCD Minister
text: Women and Child Development Minister Maneka Gandhi has announced that all NRI marriages solemnised in India will have to be registered within 48 hours or the passport and visas would not be issued. Gandhi added that registrars would send the details of the NRI marriages to the WCD Ministry so that a central database can be maintained.

headlines: Stone-pelting incidents in J&K down by 80% during Ramadan
text: The stone-pelting incidents in Jammu and Kashmir during the first 16 days of Ramadan have decreased from 195 in 2017 to 39 this year, indicating a decline of 80%, according to government data. "We have confirmation of about only five boys from the Valley who joined the ranks of militants in this period of halt on operations," an official said.

headlines: Ex-Prez's daughter warns him against attending RSS event
text: Former President Pranab Mukherjee's daughter and Congress spokesperson Sharmistha on Wednesday warned her father against attending the RSS event, tweeting, "By going 2 Nagpur, u r giving BJP/RSS full handle 2 plant false stories." The warning came after there were rumours that Sharmistha was joining the BJP, to which she said, "Hope [Mukherjee] now realises...how BJP dirty tricks dept operates."

headlines: Prez decided against religious festivities last year: Secy
text: President Ram Nath Kovind, after taking charge last year, decided against holding religious celebrations in Rashtrapati Bhavan at public expense as it is a public building, the Press Secretary to President, Ashok Malik, announced. In accordance with this, the Rashtrapati Bhavan will not hold an Iftar celebration this year, after a gap of a decade.

headlines: Chhattisgarh Governor refuses pay hike of â¹2.4 lakh a month
text: Chhattisgarh Governor Balramji Das Tandon has declined the salary hike announced by the Centre recently, his office said on Wednesday. Tandon will continue to draw â¹1.1 lakh per month instead of the revised salary of â¹3.5 lakh per month. The Accountant General agreed to this after Governor Tandon wrote a letter expressing his willingness to continue with the old salary.

headlines: Uttarakhand cop carries sick pilgrim to hospital on his back
text: A police officer carried an ageing pilgrim nearly two kilometres uphill on his back after the pilgrim had a heart attack and collapsed near the Bhairo Mandir in Uttarakhand on Wednesday. The officer admitted him to the hospital to ensure he received medical attention. The pilgrim, who was discharged within four hours, later thanked him and visited the shrine.

headlines: Kim Jong-un begged for US-N Korea summit: Trump lawyer
text: Donald Trump's lawyer Rudy Giuliani on Wednesday said that North Korean leader Kim Jong-un "begged" the US President to reschedule their summit. Giuliani said that "Kim got back on his hands and knees" after Trump called off the June 12 talks in Singapore. Trump had cancelled the summit citing North Korea's "tremendous anger and open hostility".

headlines: Hong Kong parking space sells for over â¹5 crore
text: A parking space in Hong Kong which was bought for nearly â¹3 crore last year has been sold for over â¹5 crore. The parking spot at the luxury Ultima apartment complex is located in the country's Kowloon district. Earlier this year, a car space in the same apartment complex was rented out for a record HK$10,000 (over â¹85,000) a month.

headlines: Video: Crimean zookeeper uses slipper to tame lions
text: Videos of a zookeeper in Crimea using his slipper to keep lions in line have surfaced on social media. Oleg Zubkov, the director of the Taigan Safari Park, calls the footwear a "scary weapon" and also uses it to intervene in fights between lions. He has reportedly been using the technique to tame lions for several years.

headlines: Chinese man puts eggplant up his anus to treat constipation
text: A Chinese man put a 30-cm-long eggplant up his anus after suffering from constipation and abdominal pain for two days. When the 50-year-old visited a doctor, his X-ray report showed that the eggplant was pushed so hard that it reached up to his lungs. Doctors operated the man to remove the vegetable from his body.

headlines: Government makes PAN mandatory for sending money abroad
text: The government has made Permanent Account Number (PAN) mandatory for sending money abroad under the Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS). Earlier, PAN was not insisted upon for current account transactions of up to $25,000. The scheme allows all resident individuals to remit $250,000 overseas every financial year for the purposes of education, medical treatment, and purchase of shares among others.

headlines: Wrote BTech exams while students took selfies with me: Kartik
text: Kartik Aaryan has revealed he wrote his BTech exams while other students were taking selfies with him. He added that this happened while he was shooting for the sequel to his debut film 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'. "My mother wanted me to have that degree. You can say aaj main padha likha sirf unhi ki wajah se hu," Kartik further said.

headlines: Gavaskar once faced 174 balls to score 36 runs in WC ODI
text: Former Indian cricket team captain Sunil Gavaskar played 29 overs (174 balls) out of India's 60 overs to score just 36 runs against England on June 7, 1975, in the inaugural World Cup. Gavaskar, who opened the innings for India, hit just one four and remained unbeaten. Batting second, India managed to score 132/3, losing the match by 202 runs.

headlines: US couple who defrauded Amazon of $1.2 mn jailed for 6 years
text: A US-based couple has been sentenced to nearly six years in jail for defrauding online retailer Amazon of $1.2 million in consumer electronics. Along with the couple, a 29-year-old was also sentenced to two years in jail. The trio exploited Amazon by repeatedly falsely claiming the electronics they ordered were damaged, and then receiving replacements from Amazon at no charge.

headlines: CEO of FB data scandal firm accused of stealing $8mn: Report
text: Alexander Nix, the former CEO of Facebook data scandal-linked firm Cambridge Analytica, has been accused of stealing $8 million from Cambridge Analytica, according to reports. Nix took the money shortly after it was exposed that the company harvested millions of Facebook users' data. Nix was suspended in March after he was filmed offering bribes and using sex workers against politicians.

headlines: Now 44% of startups are in tier II, tier III cities: PM Modi
text: Highlighting that the government has tried to localise the startup culture, PM Narendra Modi said, "44% of the startups are found in tier II and tier III cities, today." Adding the startups are "growth engines", he urged people to keep innovating. He also said the government's â¹10,000-crore 'fund of funds' will ensure a funding of â¹1 lakh crore for startups.

headlines: Uber CEO encourages employees to 'have the D', reveals memo
text: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi encourages the company's employees to 'have the D', which for him reportedly stands for 'decision-making power', a memo has revealed. "You may hear me say in meetings '[insert name] has the D here'. This is about being clear on who is the decision maker; I'd encourage you to do the same," Khosrowshahi said in the memo.

headlines: Man kills wife over frequent fights, surrenders before cops
text: A man in Delhi allegedly killed his wife in a fit of rage as she used to frequently quarrel with him over trivial issues. He later surrendered before the police and confessed to the crime, saying that he was mentally upset over last few days and regretted killing his wife. The couple had a love marriage last year.

headlines: Air India worker among 3 held for smuggling foreign currency
text: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence officials have detained three people, including an Air India employee, involved in smuggling foreign currency and gold bars into India in separate incidents. While one of the accused was caught with foreign currency worth â¹27 lakh, another was found with 12 gold bars worth â¹44.60 lakh, which he was to hand over to an airline employee.

headlines: South Korean cafe serves lattes with Kim Jong-un images
text: A South Korean cafe has been serving lattes decorated with images of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un and President Moon Jae-in. Customers can also get their photo printed on the latte foam along with the two leaders. The North Korean leader's popularity has increased in South Korea following the summit between the two countries in April.

headlines: Air India delays salaries for third month in a row
text: National carrier Air India has reportedly delayed the payment of salaries to its employees for the third consecutive month. An Air India spokesperson has said the employees are expected to receive their salaries for May by next week. Air India employees reportedly get paid by the 30th or the 31st of every month.

headlines: How many days one has to work around the world to buy iPhone X?
text: A study by financial services company UBS has revealed a person working in Mumbai has to work 114.7 days to afford the iPhone X, while a Delhi person has to work 100.5 days for the same. A Cairo person has to work the most, for 133.2 days, while a person in Zurich can afford iPhone X in only 4.7 days.

headlines: WhatsApp founders gave up $1.3 bn after rift with Facebook
text: WhatsApp Co-founders Brian Acton and Jan Koum gave up Facebook stock worth $900 million and $400 million respectively when they quit the company after a rift, according to The Wall Street Journal. Both would've been eligible for it if they had stayed with Facebook until this November. They even had clashes with Facebook over chairs, bathroom designs and desk sizes.

headlines: Microsoft launches underwater data centre in Scotland
text: Microsoft has launched the prototype of an underwater data centre off the coast of Scotland's Orkney Islands. The 40-foot-long capsule, which contains 864 servers and 27.6 Petabytes of storage, has been placed 117 feet below the ocean's surface. It is part of Microsoft's Project Natick and is designed to hold data for up to five years without maintenance.

headlines: WhatsApp founders clashed with Facebook over chairs, bathroom
text: WhatsApp Co-founders Brian Acton and Jan Koum had clashes with Facebook over chairs, bathroom designs and desk sizes at their office, according to The Wall Street Journal. They even gave up Facebook stock worth $900 million and $400 million respectively to quit the company. Both would've been eligible for the stock if they had stayed at Facebook until this November.

headlines: India fastest growing economy in FY19 at 7.3%: World Bank
text: India will retain the tag as the world's fastest growing major economy advancing 7.3% this fiscal year and 7.5% in the next two, the World Bank has projected. India has overcome the temporary disruptions caused by the implementation of GST, it added. "India's economy is robust, resilient and has potential to deliver sustained growth," a World Bank official said.

headlines: Mithali got $250 as match award, Dhawan got $7,500 in 2016
text: Mithali Raj and Harmanpreet Kaur, who were named Player of the Match in India's first two matches of Women's Asia Cup 2018 respectively, received $250 each as prize money. During men's Asia Cup in 2016, the winners of the award in group stage received $5,000 each. Further, Shikhar Dhawan had received $7,500 for winning the award in the final.

headlines: Real Madrid to get â¹394cr without kicking a ball in next CL
text: Three-time defending champions Real Madrid will receive over â¬50 million (nearly â¹394 crore) for the Champions League next season as part of a new revenue distribution system. UEFA said that â¬2.04 billion would be distributed among teams competing in CL in 2018/19. Further, all 32 teams in the group stage will receive a â¬15.65-million starting fee.

headlines: Fitbit CFO quits to join autonomous vehicle tech startup
text: American wearable device maker Fitbit's Chief Financial Officer (CFO) William Zerella has quit the company to join an autonomous vehicle tech startup, the company said on Wednesday. Previously, Zerella served as the CFO of the telecommunications company Vocera Communications. Zerella, who joined Fitbit in 2014, will be replaced by the company's Chief Accounting Officer Ronald Kisling.

headlines: How much does he know: Jaitley in FB note on Rahul Gandhi
text: After Congress President Rahul Gandhi's speech in Madhya Pradesh, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on Wednesday wrote a Facebook note titled, "How much does he know?" Taking six points raised by Rahul in his speech and claiming them to be false, the minister wrote, "Is he being inadequately briefed or is he being a little too liberal with his facts?"

headlines: I was almost killed on a bike: Musk on why Tesla won't make bikes
text: On being asked about Tesla launching electric motorcycles during a shareholder meeting on Tuesday, CEO Elon Musk said the company was "not going to do motorcycles". Explaining his decision, Musk said that he "used to ride motorcycles" when he was a kid but was almost killed by a truck once while riding his bike.

headlines: Ex-Google executives' meal-ordering app Ritual raises $70 mn
text: Meal-ordering app Ritual, founded by former Google executives, has raised $70 million funding led by Georgian Partners. The round also saw participation from existing investors including Greylock Partners and Insight Venture Partners. Founded in 2014 by Larry Stinson, Ray Reddy, and Robert Kim, Ritual allows users to order meals and even pick up their co-workers' orders while picking their own.

headlines: Centre warns Kerala, Maha, Goa and Gujarat of flash floods
text: The Centre on Wednesday warned Kerala, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Goa and Gujarat that heavy rainfall this week may lead to flash floods. The Met department has forecasted that "heavy to very heavy rainfall" is likely at a few places and "extremely heavy fall" at isolated places over Konkan and Goa. Further, there is a forecast of very heavy rainfall in Mumbai.

headlines: Plea against CBSE for charging â¹1.2k for answer sheet copies
text: A contempt plea has been filed against the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) in the Supreme Court, challenging the notification prescribing a fee of â¹1,200 for getting photocopies of evaluated answer sheets. The petition claims that the notification violates a Supreme Court judgement, which stated that asking for evaluated answer booklets falls under the purview of the RTI Act.

headlines: 53% students pass Bihar Class 12 exams, up from 35% last year
text: Nearly 53% of the 11,92,053 candidates who appeared for the Bihar class 12 boards passed the examinations. The pass percentage increased from last year, when it was about 35%. The Science stream was topped by Kalpana Kumari, who scored 434 marks, while the Commerce stream was topped by Nidhi Sinha, who also scored 434 marks.

headlines: CM Yogi speaks to Patanjali, mega food park to remain in UP
text: After UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath spoke to Ramdev and Patanjali Ayurved MD Acharya Balkrishna, the company said its proposed mega food park will not be shifted out of the state. Adityanath has assured Patanjali that the formalities will be completed soon. Balkrishna on Tuesday announced shifting of the food park due to the "disappointing attitude" of the government.

headlines: Don't know if you're fashionably dressed for my reply: SRK to troll
text: Shah Rukh Khan has responded to a troll who questioned his silence on several issues in India and asked if his views are confined only to makeup and fashion. "I'd reply to you but I don't know if you're appropriately and fashionably dressed for my reply," the actor wrote. The troll had asked the question during a session of #AskSRK.

headlines: Ricky Ponting joins Australia coaching team for England tour
text: Ex-Australian captain Ricky Ponting will be a part of the national team's coaching staff for their upcoming tour of England. The 43-year-old will join former teammate Justin Langer, who was appointed head coach after Darren Lehmann resigned following the ball-tampering scandal. Ponting has served as assistant coach for Australia's T20I side twice before and was DD's head coach this year.

headlines: Will treat my woman like princess, not do any hiding: Rahul
text: Kings XI Punjab and Team India wicketkeeper-batsman KL Rahul has said that he would "treat his woman like a princess and not do any hiding". This comes after reports of Rahul being in a relationship with actress Nidhhi Agerwal surfaced online. "I assure you there is nothing happening. If I am seeing somebody, I'll make sure everybody knows," Rahul added.

headlines: Working out like a boss: Kohli shares gym video with Anushka
text: Team India captain Virat Kohli took to Instagram to share a video of himself working out at the gym with Anushka Sharma. In the video captioned "Training together makes it even better", Anushka can be seen doing cardio. "Working out like a boss...She has been going on and on...She can do more cardio than me," Kohli says in the video.

headlines: Baseball fan catches ball in cup full of beer, downs drink
text: A spectator watching a Major League Baseball match between San Diego Padres and Atlanta Braves caught a foul ball in a cup of beer. Gabby DiMarco received a round of applause from the crowd and went on to down the beer with the ball still in the cup. "This might be the greatest highlight ever," a user tweeted.

headlines: Dating app drops swipe for live video to show personality
text: UK-based dating platform Badoo has announced it will be replacing the 'swipe' option for live video streaming to help users show off their personalities on the platform. Users can access the live streams in the 'Badoo Live' tab and watch them being broadcasted during that moment. Users will also be able to send messages to streamers during the broadcast.

headlines: Samajwadi Party ready for one nation, one election: Akhilesh
text: Talking about Prime Minister Narendra Modi's suggestion of 'one nation, one election', Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said, "The idea is very good and Samajwadi Party is prepared to contest simultaneous elections in 2019." He further said that the voter IDs must also be linked with the Aadhaar. His comments come after the UP government supported simultaneous polls.

headlines: Which startups has $100-bn SoftBank Vision Fund invested in?
text: Masayoshi Son-led SoftBank's $100-billion Vision Fund has made highest investments in Uber, ARM Holdings, and NVIDIA at $9.3 billion, $8.2 billion and $5 billion respectively. SoftBank also invested $4.4 billion in WeWork and $2.5 billion in Bengaluru-based Flipkart. Further, the Japanese conglomerate invested $1.9 billion in Paytm and $0.3 billion in hotel aggregator Oyo.

headlines: NDA Principal booked over irregularities in appointing staff
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has booked Om Prakash Shukla, the Principal of the National Defence Academy (NDA), over allegations of irregularities in appointment of the teaching faculty of the academy. The agency has also booked a Political Science professor, assistant professors of Mathematics and Chemistry, and the Head of the Department of Chemistry among others in the case.

headlines: Thousands attend funeral of 2 suspected militants in Kashmir
text: Thousands of people in Kashmir attended the funeral of two suspected militants on Wednesday after their bodies were dug out from near LoC. The bodies were taken out after two families approached the police claiming that two of the five suspected militants killed on May 26 were their sons. The bodies were handed over to the families after legal proceedings.

headlines: Cops break into Chelsea Manning's home over 'suicidal' tweet
text: Armed police broke into US Army whistleblower Chelsea Manning's home as part of "wellness" check after she tweeted a photo which reportedly suggested she was considering suicide. The police said they went to Manning's home after receiving multiple calls from "concerned parties". Manning had posted an image that showed her standing on a building's edge with the caption, "I'm sorry."

headlines: â¹2,800 cr income tax demand not justified: Cognizant to HC
text: Cognizant Technology Solutions on Wednesday told the Madras High Court that the â¹2,800-crore tax demand by the Income Tax department was not justified. The department has alleged that the US-based IT firm had not paid Dividend Distribution Tax towards share buyback from overseas shareholders.
