The court had earlier asked Cognizant to deposit â¹420 crore or 15% of the amount demanded.

headlines: Colgate hosts free dental checkup camp for taxi drivers in Mumbai
text: Taxi drivers have a tiring lifestyle that requires them to stay awake and/or work long hours, which leads to some of them picking up the habit of chewing tobacco. To protect the smiles of the people who drive Mumbai, Colgate organised a free dental check-up camp at Mumbai International Airport (availed during their waiting time) to identify their problems.

headlines: Shabana mistakes Malaysians for Indian railway workers, apologises
text: Actress Shabana Azmi has apologised after mistaking workers of a Malaysian eatery for Indian Railways employees. Sharing a video on Twitter of the workers washing utensils in muddy water, Shabana tagged Railway Minister Piyush Goyal asking him to take note. The Twitter handle of Ministry of Railways clarified that the workers were Malaysians, following which Shabana apologised.

headlines: Virat Kohli's wax statue unveiled at Madame Tussauds Delhi
text: Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli's wax statue was unveiled at India's first and only Madame Tussauds wax museum in Delhi on Wednesday. Kohli became the third Indian cricketer after Sachin Tendulkar and Kapil Dev to have a statue at the museum. "Presenting #TussaudsDelhi's next big unveil! The run machine, the chase master," the museum's official Facebook page wrote.

headlines: Mexico hosts 30 prostitutes at pre-World Cup party: Reports
text: Members of Mexico's football team held a farewell party with around 30 prostitutes before leaving for Europe ahead of the World Cup, reports said. A magazine published images of players at the party with the headline "The true farewell of the Tri!". However, officials said the players involved won't be sanctioned as they attended the party in their free time.

headlines: 'World's smallest' 4G phone with fingerprint sensor made
text: China-based Unihertz has developed a 3.7-inch-long smartphone called Atom which the company claims is the 'world's smallest' 4G smartphone. Atom, which runs on Android 8.1 Oreo, features a front-mounted fingerprint sensor for unlocking and can also work underwater. It comes with a 2.45-inch display, 4 GB of RAM, a 16-megapixel rear-facing camera and an 8-megapixel front-facing camera.

headlines: Churches conspiring with Vatican to destabilise govt: VHP
text: After the Delhi and Goa Archbishops claimed the Indian Constitution was in danger, VHP accused churches in India of conspiring with the Vatican as "contract killers to destabilise elected governments" and prop up "puppet" ones. It further alleged, "the Constitution of India is in danger because of the political stand of the church and its agenda of religious conversions."

headlines: Ferrari sold for â¹469 cr becomes world's most expensive car
text: A 1963 Ferrari 250 GTO sold for $70 million (â¹469 crore) has become the most expensive car ever sold in a private sale. The car was reportedly bought by David MacNeil, the CEO of car floor mats making company WeatherTech. It won the 1964 famed Tour de France race and came in fourth at Le Mans.

headlines: â¹10,000 cr 'fund of funds' will ensure startup funding: PM
text: Addressing a group of young entrepreneurs on Wednesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the government's â¹10,000-crore 'fund of funds' will ensure that startups get fundings. He further said as of now the fund has provided an assistance of â¹7,000 crore to startups. In the long term, the fund is expected to provide a funding of â¹1 lakh crore for startups.

headlines: Man jailed in Singapore for spiking flatmate's drink to rape her
text: A 28-year-old Indian man was sentenced to nearly three years' imprisonment in Singapore on Wednesday for spiking his female flatmate's drink with a plan to rape her. The flatmate drank the drink and realised something was wrong, following which the police were called. Annadurai Prabakaran, who works as a private bus driver, had been working in Singapore for 7 years.

headlines: China Prez Xi only leader I celebrated my b'day with: Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping is the only world leader with whom he celebrated his birthday. Calling Xi  a "reliable partner and good friend", Putin added that the Chinese President is "a very accessible and a very sincere person". The Russian President is scheduled to visit China on an official visit later this week.

headlines: US to use facial recognition to scan people at Mexico border
text: The US will begin using facial recognition technology as part of a pilot programme at its border with Mexico to scan images of people travelling inside vehicles. The images captured will be matched with government documents, including passports and visas. This would help in verifying travellers before they get to the border checkpoint, according to reports.

headlines: We have not received notice to appear before CBI: AirAsia
text: Malaysia's AirAsia Group has said the company and its CEO Tony Fernandes have not received summons to appear before CBI over a corruption probe. The CBI has accused the airline and its employees of bribing government officials to obtain international flying licence for AirAsia India. Earlier, reports said that Fernandes had been asked to appear before CBI on June 6.

headlines: Video shows rats running on Burger King buns at US outlet
text: A video showing rats running inside bags filled with hamburger buns at a Burger King outlet in US' Wilmington has gone viral on social media. Authorities had temporarily shut down the location last week citing "imminent health hazard". The inspecting officers found rat droppings on the burger buns as well as on the floor near the storage and cooking areas.

headlines: Rajinikanth urges Kannadigas not to disturb 'Kaala' release
text: Seeking the cooperation of the people of Karnataka for the smooth release of his film 'Kaala', Tamil actor Rajinikanth said, "I haven't made any mistake. Please do not disturb those who want to watch the movie." Pro-Kannada outfits have threatened to stall the film's release after Rajinikanth said Karnataka should implement the Supreme Court order on Cauvery water sharing.

headlines: Ashwin told me I bowl better than him: 17-yr-old Mujeeb
text: Afghanistan's 17-year-old spinner Mujeeb Ur Rahman has revealed that Kings XI Punjab captain Ravichandran Ashwin would sometimes tell him that he bowls better than him. "That would make my day," he added. "I had been following Ashwin and Sunil Narine for a long time...Getting picked for a team led by Ashwin was like a dream come true," Mujeeb further said.

headlines: I got overage, Yuvraj continued to play U-19: Harbhajan
text: Indian off-spinner Harbhajan Singh, in his chat show with CSK all-rounder Shane Watson, revealed that he and all-rounder Yuvraj Singh had played in Under-14, Under-16 and Under-19 cricket together. "I got overage and Yuvraj continued to play Under-19 cricket...He's like Afridi," he joked. "(Was he) like 18 for three years," Watson added.

headlines: Make in India a failure, everything is made in China: Rahul
text: Addressing a rally in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur, Congress President Rahul Gandhi today said, "Make in India is a failure. Everything is made in China, China, China." Referring to a meeting between Chinese President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, he added, "Our PM is swinging on a swing with the Chinese leader in Gujarat."

headlines: World's biggest atom smasher detects 'God particle' again
text: The Large Hadron Collider, the world's most powerful particle accelerator has detected the Higgs boson again, which is often dubbed the "God particle". Higgs boson is known to interact only with massive particles, but was discovered in its decay to two massless photons, said researchers, adding "this is why the Higgs boson is seen as a portal to new physics".

headlines: Man threatens to kill Kerala CM, apologises later
text: The police have booked a man working in the Gulf for allegedly threatening to kill Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and attack his family in a video. The man had later posted another video in which he apologised to the CM and his family, saying the threat video had been shot when he was drunk.

headlines: Militants desperate to sabotage Ramadan ceasefire: J&K CM
text: Hours after militants attacked an Indian Army camp in Kashmir, Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti said militants were "desperately" trying to sabotage the Ramadan ceasefire. Urging separatists to solve their issues through talks with the Centre, she added, "Save Jammu and Kashmir, its honour and its economy by coming forward." She further called for a political solution.

headlines: Delhi lab wrongly diagnoses man with HIV, loses licence
text: The Delhi Medical Council has cancelled the licence of a lab in Defence Colony after it wrongly declared a man HIV-positive. "I was about to take up a new job at an MNC in Delhi. However...the lab declared me HIV-positive, following which the company denied me the job," the man said. Later his reports were contradicted by other lab.

headlines: Pakistan smugglers use drones to smuggle drugs to India
text: Pakistani drug smugglers are using drones to smuggle drugs across the border in India, reports quoting BSF officials said. As many as 37 drones were reportedly sighted by the BSF at the Punjab border last year. Scuba divers from across the border have also been reported to be delivering drugs using the gaps in the Sutlej and Ravi rivers.

headlines: Avoid releasing Rajinikanth's Kaala in Karnataka, says CM
text: Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy on Wednesday said makers of Rajinikanth-starrer 'Kaala' should avoid releasing it in the state "considering the situation." He said, "as a Kannadiga, in such situation where there is opposition, it is ideal if they will not release the movie." Pro-Kannada outfits have sought a ban on 'Kaala' opposing Rajinikanth's views on the Cauvery water dispute.

headlines: First physical evidence of chariots in Bronze Age unearthed
text: The Archaeological Survey of India has unearthed chariots, swords, and caskets dating back to 2200 BC-1800 BC in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat. This is reportedly the first-ever physical evidence of chariots dating back to the Bronze Age. Based on the remains excavated, the ASI said that it seems like the region belonged to the warrior class in the past.

headlines: IAF officer dies, cops say 'poisonous content' found in body
text: A 27-year-old IAF flight lieutenant named Himanshu Gupta died at a government hospital in Bhopal on Tuesday, the police said. The cause of death is under investigation as some poisonous content was found in his body, the police added. Gupta had reportedly complained of difficulty in breathing and stiffness in his chest before he passed away.

headlines: Switzerland may inspect Facebook profiles of asylum seekers
text: Switzerland may review Facebook, Twitter and other social media profiles of migrants before granting them asylum, according to reports. Information posted on the social media platforms could provide a better understanding of the applicants, including their family relationships, officials said. More than 18,000 migrants had sought asylum in Switzerland last year.

headlines: NEET topper Kalpana Kumari also tops Bihar Board Class 12 exam
text: Kalpana Kumari, who recently topped the CBSE NEET 2018 exam, also topped Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) Class 12 exam on Wednesday. The 18-year-old scored 434 marks out of 500 in the science stream. Kumari, who prepared for NEET in Delhi, secured 99.99 percentile in NEET 2018 with 691 marks out of 720.

headlines: 1st look video of Rao, Shraddha's horror comedy 'Stree' out
text: The announcement video of Rajkummar Rao and Shraddha Kapoor starrer 'Stree' has been released. The film, which is set in a town called Chanderi, has been written by the duo Raj Nidimoru and Krishna DK and will be directed by Amar Kaushik. The horror comedy film is scheduled to release on August 31.

headlines: Lara slammed record 501* in 8 hours, hit 308 in 4s and 6s
text: Former Windies captain Brian Lara became the first cricketer in history to score 500-plus runs in a first-class innings on June 6, 1994. Playing for Warwickshire against Durham, Lara slammed a record 308 runs in boundaries (62 fours, 10 sixes) in his world record innings of 501*(427). Lara spent almost eight hours on the crease during his knock.

headlines: No woman featured in world's highest-paid 100 athletes
text: Forbes list of the world's highest-paid athletes has featured no woman this year while tennis star Serena Williams was the lone female athlete in top 100 last year. Williams' prize money dropped from $8 million to $62,000 as she gave birth last September while Maria Sharapova, who was also featured earlier, faced a 15-month suspension for using a banned substance.

headlines: PM Modi, CM Yogi statues to be placed in BJP offices in UP
text: After Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath received miniature statues of himself and PM Narendra Modi on his 46th birthday, the party is planning to place replicas of the statues in BJP offices across the state. The statues were prepared by a party worker from Chitrakoot in Madhya Pradesh. BJP has over 60 party offices in the state.

headlines: Wonât tell my mann ki baat, but hear yours: Rahul to farmers
text: Addressing farmers in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "I will not tell you my 'mann ki baat' but I will listen to yours." Adding that Congress would waive farm loans within 10 days of forming the government, Gandhi said, "I will not say that I will give you â¹15 lakh. But I will do what I say."

headlines: Jeff Bezos pens open letter as Amazon India turns 5
text: World's richest man and Amazon's CEO Jeff Bezos penned an open letter to customers on the company's fifth anniversary in India. "We're five years into our journey, but... it's still Day 1, and I'm energized and humbled by the opportunities ahead," he wrote on Amazon India's website. Notably, Amazon was launched in India on June 5, 2013.

headlines: Enamel could be regenerated as scientists develop material
text: UK-based researchers have developed a new way to grow mineralised materials which they claim could regenerate dental enamel and bone. Enamel, located on the outer part of teeth, is the hardest tissue in the human body, however, it cannot regenerate like other tissues. The researchers grew enamel-like ordered mineralised structures from nano-crystals based on a specific protein.

headlines: Doctor performs Nipah victims' last rites as kin stay away
text: A doctor in Kerala said he took the responsibility of handling the last rites of 12 patients who died of the Nipah virus. The 41-year-old doctor said the relatives of several patients chose to stay away due to fear of contracting the virus. He said, "I did not have to think twice...It was my duty."

headlines: Video: US police chase soldier driving stolen armoured vehicle
text: A video of Virginia State Police chasing an armoured vehicle allegedly stolen by a US National Guard soldier has surfaced online. At least six cars and a helicopter from the Virginia State Police were involved in the chase, which lasted for around two hours. The soldier was reportedly shot with a taser before being arrested.

headlines: It was just a joke: Qatar Airways boss on women CEOs remark
text: Offering his "heartfelt apologies" for saying a woman could not do his job, Qatar Airways CEO Akbar Al Baker said it was "just a joke". He added the press took his statement out of context and "blew it out of proportion". Baker's earlier comments came after he was elected as the chairman of airlines group International Air Transport Association.

headlines: US tech firm gives free company stock to conference guests
text: US subscription management company Zuora gave a share of its stock to each of the guests who attended its annual conference on Tuesday. "We're doing something a little wonky. We want to show appreciation for the revolution that they've caused," Zuora CEO Tien Tzuo said. Almost 2,000 guests attended the conference, many of whom are Zuora's customers and partners.

headlines: Action should look genuine and not make people laugh: Salman
text: Salman Khan has said action in films should look genuine and believable and not make people laugh. "It's a lot of strain and hard work. If you don't look the part physically and end up doing unbelievable action, people laugh at you," he added. Salman further said it is "tricky" to get it right as action scenes can go "overboard".

headlines: You live in me: Dutt on father Sunil's birth anniversary
text: Actor Sanjay Dutt took to Instagram to share a picture from his childhood with his late father, actor Sunil Dutt on the occasion of his birth anniversary today. "He lives in me... Happy Birthday Dad!" he wrote in the caption. Sunil Dutt had passed away in May 2005 after suffering a heart attack.

headlines: India lose a Women's Asia Cup match for 1st time in 14 years
text: India's women's cricket team on Wednesday lost to Bangladesh by seven wickets, suffering their first-ever defeat in the Asia Cup since the inception of the tournament in 2004. Six-time defending champions India had won all the 34 matches they had played in Asia Cup (50-over and 20-over) before today. Despite the defeat, India are on top of the points table.

headlines: Pak coach loses bet to player, takes team out for dinner
text: Pakistan cricket team coach Mickey Arthur took the entire team for dinner after losing a bet to 19-year-old all-rounder Shadab Khan. Prior to the team's Ireland-England tour, Shadab told Arthur he would score three half-centuries in as many matches. The 19-year-old scored a fifty in each of the three Tests after being challenged by Arthur to improve his batting.

headlines: Only Bitcoin is pure digital gold: Apple Co-founder Wozniak
text: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak has said, "Only Bitcoin is pure digital gold", adding he buys into Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey's belief that it will become the single global currency. "Bitcoin is mathematically defined...and there's no human running...its just growing and growing...and surviving, that to me says something that is natural," he added. Wozniak earlier revealed he sold all his Bitcoins.

headlines: Global conspiracy to stop PM winning 2019 polls: BJP leader
text: Karnataka BJP leader CT Ravi has claimed that a conspiracy was being hatched on a global level to prevent PM Narendra Modi from being re-elected in the 2019 elections. Stating that Pakistan and China fear PM Modi, he added that India would be stronger if he retains power. "Modi fever" has forced Opposition to create a united front, he added.

headlines: PM Modi calls Nirav Modi, Mehul Choksi bhai: Rahul Gandhi
text: Addressing a rally in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur on Wednesday, Congress President Rahul Gandhi said, "Prime Minister Narendra Modi calls Mehul Choksi Mehul bhai and Nirav Modi, Nirav bhai." Asserting that the government's first duty should be to take care of farmers, Rahul said, "PM Modi and BJP aren't concerned about farmers. Helping their rich businessmen friends is their only priority."

headlines: Team tracks 12 clocks for 14 years to test Einstein's theory
text: Physicists at US' National Institute of Standards and Technology constantly monitored 12 high-precision atomic clocks spread around the world from 1999 to 2014. The experiment tested Einstein's thought experiment involving Earth as a free-falling elevator in Sun's gravity, where all objects would accelerate at the same rate. The clocks remained synchronised for over 14 years, proving the theory.

headlines: 11 bikes parked illegally, outside malls in Gurugram stolen
text: As many as 11 motorcycles which were parked in unauthorised parking spaces or outside malls were stolen in separate incidents in Gurugram on Saturday and Sunday. While a few thefts were reported from market areas, a man's bike was stolen from outside his house. "We have been asking commuters to park in designated spaces," a police official said.

headlines: Man held for marrying woman by posing as IAS officer on FB
text: Police detained a man in Odisha for allegedly impersonating as an IAS officer and marrying a woman in the state's Damodarpur village. The accused had created a fake account on Facebook, mentioning himself as an IAS officer and befriended the girl on the platform before seeking her parents' approval. He also duped people of money by promising them jobs.

headlines: Youth in India becoming job creators: PM Modi
text: In an interaction with young entrepreneurs, PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said the youth in India have now become job creators instead of job seekers. "There was a time when start-ups meant only digital and tech innovation. Things are changing now. We are seeing start-up entrepreneurs in different fields," he added.

headlines: Indian-American IS supporter jailed for lying to join US army
text: A 28-year-old Indian-American has been sentenced to five years in jail for making false statements in his application to join the US army. Shivam Patel was an ISIS supporter and had earlier left his teaching job in China to join the militant group in Jordan. He was also convicted of passport fraud and was ordered to pay $4,000 in fines.

headlines: Gurudwara, mosque set on fire in UK in suspected hate crimes
text: A gurudwara and a mosque in Leeds, England were set on fire on Tuesday at almost the same time in suspected hate crimes. The police said the attacks on the Guru Nanak Nishkam Sewak Jatha gurudwara and the Jamia Masjid Abu Huraira mosque may be connected. "We are carrying out...enquiries, including checks on CCTVs," the police added.

headlines: Video of Chinese man transporting car on 3-wheeler goes viral
text: A video of a man transporting a black sedan on the top of a three-wheeler in China's Zhejiang province has gone viral. The man, who bought the car for 800 yuan (over â¹8,000), said he had transported it on his three-wheeler to save money. He was fined 1,300 yuan (over â¹13,000) for violating traffic rules.

headlines: Economic pressure will kill Iran nuclear deal: Israel PM
text: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday said that "weight of economic forces" will kill Iran's nuclear deal with world powers. Adding that there was a need to tackle Iran's "regional aggression", Netanyahu said, "Iran is conquering one country after another." This comes after Israel's Intelligence Minister Yisrael Katz called for a "military coalition" against Iran.

headlines: RBI hikes repo rate for the first time in 4.5 years
text: The RBI has hiked the repo rate, the rate at which banks borrow from RBI, by 25 bps to 6.25% during its second bi-monthly policy review of 2018-19. This is the first hike since January 2014, when the rate was raised to 8%. The hike comes amid rising oil prices and high retail inflation, which accelerated to 4.58% in April.

headlines: Not your fault. Ask Dad: Kate Spade in suicide note to daughter
text: Luxury fashion designer Kate Spade who allegedly committed suicide on Tuesday, left a note for her daughter which reportedly read, "Bea - I have always loved you. This is not your fault. Ask Daddy!" Frances Beatrix is the only child of 55-year-old Spade, who was found hanging at her home. Kate's husband was at home when she took her life.

headlines: Mayweather named world's highest-paid athlete with $285 million
text: Undefeated boxing champion Floyd Mayweather has been named the world's highest-paid athlete by Forbes for the fourth time in seven years with $285 million in earnings. Cristiano Ronaldo, who stood first the last two years, slipped to third with Lionel Messi grabbing the second spot. UFC star Conor McGregor, who fought Mayweather last year, was ranked fourth with $99 million.

headlines: Tesla making 3,500 Model 3 cars a week: CEO Elon Musk
text: Tesla is producing 3,500 Model 3 cars a week on an average, CEO Elon Musk said during the company's annual shareholder meeting on Tuesday. He also said that Tesla is pushing to meet the 5,000-per-week goal by the end of June. Musk further added that full production of $35,000 Model 3 cars would begin in the first quarter of 2019.

headlines: 2 girls steal 38 mobiles in Mumbai locals for same boyfriend
text: Mumbai Police has arrested two college girls for allegedly stealing 38 mobile phones worth â¹3 lakh from the women's compartments of local trains in the past two months. The police claimed both the girls were dating the same man and spent most of the sale proceeds on him. A dealer who bought the phones from the girls was also arrested.

headlines: High alert in UP after LeT letter threatens bomb blasts
text: Uttar Pradesh Police has sounded a high alert in the state after receiving a letter in the name of Pakistan-based terror organisation Lashkar-e-Taiba, threatening bomb blasts at many sites. The letter stated explosions would take place at Krishna Janmabhoomi, Varanasi's Kashi Vishwanath Temple, and two railway stations between June 6 and 10. The letter's authenticity is yet to be ascertained.

headlines: Bengaluru policewoman breastfeeds abandoned newborn
text: After the Bengaluru Police rescued an abandoned newborn stuffed in a plastic bag, a policewoman who was taking care of the weak baby breastfed him. "I just couldn't bear it...I felt like my child was crying and I had to feed the baby," the policewoman said. The baby was named Kumaraswamy after Karnataka's new CM HD Kumaraswamy.

headlines: Singapore to restrict airspace during Trump-Kim summit
text: Singapore airspace will be temporarily restricted during the upcoming summit between the US and North Korea, according to a notice to airmen. It added that aircraft arriving into Singapore Changi Airport will have to slow down and face some restrictions on runway use due to national security reasons. Aircraft violating restrictions "may be intercepted", it further said.

headlines: UN General Assembly elects 1st Latin American woman President
text: Ecuador's Foreign Minister Maria Fernanda Espinosa Garces was on Tuesday elected the next President of the UN General Assembly, making her the first Latin American woman to head the UN body. Espinosa Garces became only the fourth woman President of the General Assembly in its 73-year history. She will assume her duties in September.

headlines: I see no need to hide: Putin on his shirtless pictures
text: Responding to questions about his "half-naked" photos circulating on social media, Russian President Vladimir Putin said that he sees "no need to hide...and there is nothing wrong with that". Putin added that he had seen pictures of him riding a bear and clarified that he had never done so, referring to his pictures being photoshopped and used as memes.

headlines: Calls with Trump are like sausages: French Prez Macron
text: Comparing his calls with US President Donald Trump to sausages, French President Emmanuel Macron said, "It's better not to explain what's inside." Quoting Prussian statesman Otto von Bismarck, Macron added, "If we explained to people how sausages were made, it's unlikely they'd eat them." Earlier, reports claimed that a phone call between Macron and Trump last week had been "terrible".

headlines: Biggest risk for an actor is not taking risks at all: Diana
text: Diana Penty has said the biggest risk for an actor is not taking risks at all. "I've always made a conscious attempt to try different genres, play different characters," she added. Diana further said, "The most sensible thing to do would be to strike a healthy balance between taking risks with unique content and playing it safe with formula content."

headlines: Sanjay should have portrayed his older self in Sanju: Salman
text: Salman Khan has said Sanjay Dutt should have portrayed his older self in his biopic 'Sanju'. "I thought why did somebody else play this bit? The last 8-10 years. No one can do justice to that," he added. However, Salman further said, "Rajkumar Hirani is a very sensible filmmaker, I am sure he has made a good film."

headlines: BJP President Amit Shah meets Madhuri Dixit in Mumbai
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Wednesday met with actress Madhuri Dixit in Mumbai as part of the party's 'Sampark for Samarthan' programme. Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis was also present during the meeting. Shah is also scheduled to meet with Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray, whose party has said it won't ally with BJP for the 2019 polls.

headlines: May the new generation educate me in qualities I lack: Big B
text: Talking about his experience of working with Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor and director Ayan Mukerji for 'BrahmÄstra', Amitabh Bachchan said, "May this fresh and new generation educate me in the qualities that I lack." Appreciating the "meticulous planning" of Ayan and the production team, Bachchan added, "Such efforts were never seen in our time."

headlines: Argentina-Israel match called off over threats to Messi
text: Argentina's upcoming World Cup warm-up with Israel to be held in Jerusalem has been cancelled, the Israeli embassy confirmed citing "threats and provocations" against Barcelona star Lionel Messi. This comes after Palestinian football head urged fans to burn shirts bearing Messi's name if the match took place. Palestine and Israel both claim Jerusalem as their capital.

headlines: Shahid Afridi has been 36 for about 7 years: Shane Watson
text: Shane Watson, in Harbhajan Singh's chat show, jokingly said Pakistan's Shahid Afridi has been "36 for about 7 years". Watson had asked Harbhajan his age in the 2001 Australia series to which Bhajji replied, "18". Watson asked if it was his birth age or cricket age, after which Harbhajan asked him if he "spent a lot of time with Afridi".

headlines: Apple mocks Android on stage at WWDC keynote event
text: Apple's VP of Software Engineering, Craig Federighi, mocked Google's Android operating system during the company's WWDC keynote event. He said that 81% of iOS users are currently running iOS 11 while 6% Android users are on the last Oreo version. "When you look at the competition, it's hard to say they really have a software update model," he added.

headlines: Many youth join politics through family: Nitish on Tejashwi
text: Taking a veiled dig at RJD leader and Lalu Yadav's son Tejashwi Yadav, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said many young leaders owe their positions to their families. He added that they go on tweeting about things they do not even understand. Reacting to the statement, Tejashwi asked the CM to sign an affidavit swearing his son will never enter politics.

headlines: Farmers protest a Congress conspiracy: MoS Giriraj Singh
text: Minister of State for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises Giriraj Singh on Wednesday said, "The ongoing protests by farmers in some parts of the country are a Congress conspiracy." Speaking at an event in Patna, he added that the protest was supported only by a few. The ten-day protest started on June 1 by farmers across several states.

headlines: Paytm Founder co-launches $150mn environment protection fund
text: Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma and venture capitalist Shailesh Vickram Singh have launched a $150-million environment protection fund, called the 'Massive Fund'. It will support 18-20 startups and tech leaders working on the agenda of pollution reduction. Commenting on the same, Sharma said, "Our efforts... will be to ensure that capital does not get in the way for innovative solutions."

headlines: MMRDA plans Japan-like skywalks from Metro stations to malls
text: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority has proposed to connect the upcoming Metro stations in the city with nearby malls and offices through skywalks, like those in Japan and Dubai. The skywalks will enable the commuters to directly access malls and offices without getting on roads. However, the cost of skywalks' construction would be borne by the connecting buildings.

headlines: 21 DU colleges told to get principals as Prez shows concern
text: After President Ram Nath Kovind's office expressed concern, 21 Delhi University colleges being run by acting heads have been asked to appoint regular principals by July 15. The directive came at a meeting chaired by Higher Education Secretary R Subrahmanyam and attended by several colleges' representatives. Representatives reportedly blamed conflict between DU and the AAP government for the delay.

headlines: Haryana govt will plant 2 lakh saplings: Forest Minister
text: The Haryana forest department will plant over two lakh saplings within the next few months in an attempt to increase the green cover in the state, Forest Minister Rao Narbir Singh said on Monday. Adding that trees are cut whenever development takes place, the minister added, "This monsoon...We will start quickly after it rains and ensure the saplings sustain."

headlines: UPSC aspirant, cabbie held for raping, trying to sell girl
text: A UPSC aspirant and a cab driver were arrested from Delhi's GB road for allegedly raping a 15-year-old girl and trying to sell her off at a brothel. The duo was caught after a police constable in the area grew suspicious of them, following which a policeman posed as a brothel owner and asked the accused to bring the girl.

headlines: Body of 4-year-old boy missing for 18 months found in box
text: The partially decomposed body of a four-year-old boy, who went missing 18 months ago, was found in a wooden box on his neighbour's rooftop in Ghaziabad. The box was spotted by his eight-year-old brother, who mistook it for a "scary doll". Police had earlier arrested two alleged kidnappers for calling the family 45 times to demand â¹8-lakh ransom.

headlines: Japan PM Shinzo Abe to seek Trump's assurances over N Korea
text: Japanese PM Shinzo Abe will urge US President Donald Trump not to forget his country's security concerns during the historic summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. Japan seeks complete and irreversible dismantlement of North Korea's nuclear weapons and ballistic missiles of all ranges. "We think the US, of course, understands [our] position," Japan's Foreign Ministry said.n

headlines: CBI wanted to arrest PM Modi in Ishrat Jahan case: Ex-DIG
text: Gujarat's former DIG DG Vanzara has told a special court that the CBI wanted to arrest then CM Narendra Modi and then state minister Amit Shah in the 2004 Ishrat Jahan fake shootout case. The case pertains to Vanzara's team killing 19-year-old student Jahan and three others in an alleged gun battle, which the SIT concluded was a 'fake' encounter.

headlines: Kohli only Indian among world's highest-paid athletes with â¹161cr
text: With earnings of â¹161 crore, Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli was ranked 83rd by Forbes while boxing champion Floyd Mayweather topped the highest-paid athletes' list for the fourth time in seven years by pocketing â¹1,911 crore. Argentine footballer Lionel Messi was placed second, ahead of Portuguese rival Cristiano Ronaldo while 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer stood seventh.

headlines: Trailer of Rajkummar, Nargis starrer '5 Weddings' released
text: The international trailer of Rajkummar Rao and Nargis Fakhri starrer '5 Weddings' has been released. The film had its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival in May. Directed by Namrata Singh Gujral and also starring Bo Derek and Candy Clark, '5 Weddings' is scheduled to release on September 21.

headlines: Chennai startup wins Apple Design award 2018
text: Chennai-based startup Calzy 3 has won the Apple Design award 2018, along with nine other startups from different countries. Calzy 3 is a customisable calculator that uses iOS technologies such as Drag & Drop to share results in other apps to help users perform day to day mathematical calculations. Other winners included Amsterdam-based date-focused note-taking app Agenda.

headlines: Facebook reveals it shared data with Chinese phone makers
text: Facebook has admitted it shared its users' data with four Chinese smartphone makers including Huawei. Facebook said it was careful about the partnerships, which were made to help smartphone makers build custom versions of its app. The company further emphasised that the information from partnerships with Huawei was stored on the devices and not on the Chinese smartphone maker's servers.

headlines: Musk to remain Tesla Chairman as proposal for removal rejected
text: Tesla shareholders on Tuesday voted against a proposal to remove Elon Musk as the company's Chairman. The proposal asserted, since Musk is also Tesla's CEO, it would be difficult for him to minimise conflicts that may arise from combined CEO and Chairman positions. After the vote, Musk said, "This is the most excruciating hellish several months I've ever had."

headlines: Man raises $8 mn for firm he started while he was at Tesla
text: Ex-Tesla employee Sisun Lee incorporated a startup called '82 Labs', which makes a hangover recovery drink, while he worked for the electric automaker in 2017. Lee later left Tesla and posted fake product pictures online to check if there was a demand for it in America. His startup raised $8 million in April and is now valued at $33 million.

headlines: MP announces outstanding power bill waiver for poor families
text: The Madhya Pradesh government has announced a waiver scheme for outstanding power bills for labourers and poor families. The scheme is expected to benefit around 77 lakh people in the state. The state government also approved a scheme to subsidise electricity for registered labourers of the unorganised sector and Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.

headlines: New coaches of premium trains go missing in Ranchi: Reports
text: The Ranchi division of Indian Railways has reportedly complained that new coaches of premium trains like Rajdhani Express and Sampark Kranti Express have gone missing. Even though the Ranchi division has no clue about the missing coaches, the authorities believe an organised gang must have stolen the coaches from the railway yard.

headlines: Bihar replaces central scheme with own state farmer scheme
text: Bihar has approved its own scheme to provide financial assistance to farmers for their crop damage, replacing the Centre's Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana. Claiming that the earlier scheme benefitted insurance companies more than farmers, government official Atul Prasad said that the farmers registered under the new scheme won't have to pay any premium.

headlines: Not paying for N Korean officials' stay in Singapore: US
text: The US State Department on Tuesday said that the country is not paying for North Korean officials' stay in Singapore during next week's summit between President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. Earlier, Nobel Prize-winning nuclear disarmament group ICAN offered to pay for the cost of the summit, calling it once in a generation opportunity.

headlines: US environment chief tried to buy used Trump hotel mattress
text: US Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt had asked his aide to search for a used mattress from the Trump International Hotel. Pruitt is currently facing a dozen investigations for misspending and the management decisions by him and his top aides. The EPA chief had earlier faced criticism for spending over â¹28 lakhs for a phone booth in his office.

headlines: Duterte says will quit if enough women protest his kiss
text: Defending his kiss on the lips of a married Filipino woman in South Korea, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has said he will resign if enough women are offended and sign a petition calling for him to step down. The 73-year-old, who called the act a "gimmick", said he used to kiss every woman on the lips during his mayoral campaign.

headlines: Trump's decision to meet Kim 'brave and mature': Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that US President Donald Trump's decision to set up a meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un was "brave and mature". Putin further said that he hopes that the meeting will have a "positive outcome". The Trump-Kim summit will take place on June 12 in Singapore.

headlines: SC refuses to stay release of Rajinikanth's 'Kaala'
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday refused to stay the release of Rajinikanth starrer 'Kaala'. "Everybody is anxiously waiting for the release of the movie. We don't want to interfere with its release," the court said. A petitioner had earlier approached the court claiming his copyright-protected work related to story scenes and songs were used by the film's producer without permission.

headlines: I've no comments for people who slut-shame: Swara on trolls
text: Actress Swara Bhasker, while commenting on social media users trolling her masturbation scene in 'Veere Di Wedding', said, "I have no comments for people who are petty, who are hypocritical or who slut-shame." "Currently, I'm ignoring these people and feeling very happy with the rest of the team of 'Veere Di Wedding' about the success of the film," she added.

headlines: Freida Pinto to star with Orlando Bloom in Hollywood film
text: Actress Freida Pinto is set to star with Hollywood actor Orlando Bloom in a film titled 'Needle in a Timestack'. The film is an adaptation of a short story by Robert Silverberg. The story of the film will reportedly revolve around a couple working to hold their marriage together in a world where time travel is possible.

headlines: Poster of Sanju featuring Manisha as Dutt's mom Nargis out
text: A new poster of Sanjay Dutt's biopic, titled 'Sanju', featuring actress Manisha Koirala as his late mother Nargis Dutt has been released. Sharing the poster, the film's director Rajkumar Hirani wrote, "She lovingly called him #Sanju, and now that's what we all do too!" 'Sanju', also starring Sonam Kapoor, Dia Mirza and Anushka Sharma, will release on June 29.

headlines: Cricket Australia CEO resigns after 17-year tenure
text: Cricket Australia CEO James Sutherland has resigned from the post after 17 years, giving a 12-month notice period. This comes two months after the ball-tampering scandal, which saw Darren Lehman depart as head coach with bans handed to Steve Smith, David Warner, and Cameron Bancroft. Notably, Sutherland was younger than then Test captain Steve Waugh at his appointment aged 35.

headlines: Goal net pieces from Brazil's 7-1 WC loss to be sold for â¬71
text: One of the goal nets from Brazil's worst World Cup defeat, which occurred in the 2014 semifinal against Germany, will be cut up and sold for charity. The net would be cut into 8,150 pieces and sold online for a minimum of â¬71 (nearly â¹5,600) a piece, echoing the 7-1 loss. Brazil's Mineirao stadium hopes to raise at least â¬500,000.

headlines: Instagram may let users post hour-long videos
text: Facebook's photo-sharing app Instagram may let users post videos that last up to an hour, as per reports. Currently, the time limit for videos is 60 seconds in Instagram Feed and 15 seconds in Stories. The new feature will focus on vertical video or video that is taller than it is wide, the reports added.

headlines: Antarctica also witnesses earthquakes, confirms study
text: Long thought to be silent because of ice cover, East Antarctica is actually seismically active, a US-based study confirmed. "Lack of seismicity wasn't due to a lack of events but a lack of instruments close enough to record it," said the lead researcher, as only nine events were recorded until 2009, while 27 were registered in the same year alone.

headlines: Only 1 dog to be allowed per flat: B'luru civic body order
text: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has ordered that only one approved dog can be kept in a flat and an independent house cannot have more than three. New rules also state that dog owners must get a licence consisting of a radio collar with an embedded chip, failing which they will have to pay a fine of â¹1,000.

headlines: Phone explodes in man's shirt pocket at Mumbai restaurant
text: A CCTV footage of a restaurant in Mumbai has surfaced, wherein a man could be seen jumping off his seat and throwing his phone out of his shirt's front pocket after it exploded. Fumes were coming out of the phone, which also created panic among other people at the restaurant. The man sustained minor injuries in the incident.

headlines: Lawyer, activists among 5 arrested over Bhima-Koregaon riots
text: Police have arrested five people, including prominent lawyer Surendra Gadling and a Delhi man Rana Jacob, in connection with the Bhima-Koregaon riots in Maharashtra in January. Police also searched the house of a Nagpur university's professor with alleged Maoist links. The violence had been triggered during a gathering by Dalits for the 200th anniversary celebrations of the Bhima-Koregaon battle.

headlines: Russian accidentally digs up bones of partner's murdered ex
text: A Russian man, while digging a vegetable patch in his partner's garden in Siberia, found human bones that turned out to be those of his partner's ex-boyfriend. The woman revealed she had murdered her ex during an argument by hitting him with an axe. Authorities said a murder probe is underway and the woman is under a travel ban.nn

headlines: German politician reports cloth robbery wearing boxers
text: The co-leader of German political party Alternative for Germany, Alexander Gauland, had to walk to a police station from the shores of a lake wearing only his boxers after his clothes were stolen while he was swimming. Police officials said the robbery appeared to be politically motivated as Gauland had recently called Hitler and the Nazis "bird shit".

headlines: Varanasi airport 1st to have national highway under runway
text: The Lal Bahadur Shastri International Airport near Varanasi is set to become the first Indian airport to have a national highway underneath its runway. A new underpass that will convert the highway into a four-lane road will be constructed, while the current runway will be expanded from 2,750 metres to 4,075 metres.

headlines: World's 1st feature film to star only one actor was from India
text: The 1964 film 'Yaadein', which was directed and produced by Sanjay Dutt's late father Sunil Dutt, was the world's first feature film to star only one actor. While the movie starred Sunil Dutt, his wife Nargis Dutt featured only as a silhouette in the climax. Guinness World Records also recognised it for having the 'fewest actors in a narrative film'.

headlines: Late-stage breast cancer cured for the first time ever
text: In a first, a woman with advanced breast cancer that had spread around her body has been successfully treated, American doctors have announced. The then 49-year-old, earlier given three years to live, was treated in 42 weeks with an immunotherapy that grows patient's immune cells in the lab and re-injects them in the body to find and destroy cancer cells.

headlines: Trump told Kim she and Kanye helped him with black voters
text: US President Donald Trump reportedly told reality TV star Kim Kardashian that she and her husband, rapper Kanye West, helped him in boosting his approval among black voters. Trump met Kardashian last week to discuss prison reforms in the US. The rapper had previously tweeted in support of Trump and said the two had "dragon energy."

headlines: Kundra not part of Bitcoin scam, only a witness: Spokesperson
text: The spokesperson of Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra has issued a statement saying that Kundra has no involvement or connection with the Bitcoin scam and was summoned by the Enforcement Directorate merely as a witness. "Raj is cooperating with the law enforcement agency as [scam-accused] Amit Bhardwaj is an acquaintance and protocol is being followed," the spokesperson added.

headlines: Prostitutes are better than govt officials: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Surendra Singh on Tuesday said, "Prostitutes have better character than governments. At least they (prostitutes) do their work and dance on stage when they take money from you." "But there is no guarantee that these officials will do your work after taking money," he added. Reportedly, he also urged people to thrash government officials who ask for bribes.

headlines: A day on Earth was only 18 hours long 1.4 billion years ago
text: About 1.4 billion years ago, a day on Earth lasted 18 hours 41 minutes, partly because the Moon was closer, according to a US-based study. "As the Moon moves away, the Earth is like a spinning figure skater who slows down as they stretch their arms out," said a geoscientist explaining Earth's rotational period is getting longer than 24 hours.

headlines: Answer sheets gutted in fire at Hyderabad's university
text: Several bundles of answer sheets of BSc (Botany) exam were gutted in a fire that broke out at Hyderabad's Osmania University's Valuation Centre on Tuesday. An electrical short circuit could be one of the main causes for the fire, fire officers said. Reportedly, the university has constituted a committee to inquire into the incident and assess the extent of damage.

headlines: UP varsity students riot over vacating hostel for summer
text: Violence was triggered near Allahabad University after the administration asked students to vacate hostels for the upcoming summer vacations. Protesting students pelted stones on vehicles and set fire to a police jeep. The university had earlier told students that it would seek police help by June 12 to ensure that the students vacate the hostel.

headlines: Have far more consensus with India than differences: China
text: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has said that China and India have far more consensus than differences. He added that China and India working together will benefit the entire world, and contribute to the progress of human civilisation. Yi made the remarks during his meeting with Indian counterpart Sushma Swaraj on the sidelines of the BRICS Ministerial Conference on Monday.

headlines: Singapore's Capella Hotel named Trump-Kim summit venue
text: The historic meeting between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un to be held on June 12 will take place in the Capella Hotel on Singapore's Sentosa Island. Area around the hotel has been marked as a special security zone. The summit will be the first ever between a sitting US President and a North Korean leader.

headlines: Israel trolls Iran with 'Mean Girls' GIF on Twitter
text: Israel on Monday trolled Iran with a GIF from the movie 'Mean Girls' after Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei called the country a "cancerous tumour" that needs to be "eradicated". Responding to Khamenei's tweet, the Israel embassy in the US responded with a GIF where one character asks another "Why are you so obsessed with me?"

headlines: Don't be like Ekta Kapoor: Swedish YouTuber PewDiePie
text: Swedish YouTuber PewDiePie has uploaded a video which ended with a disclaimer saying, "Don't be like Ekta Kapoor and go on a Twitter rant when it is completely unrelated to you." He titled the video, "She is angry because I made fun of her". PewDiePie spelled Ekta's name wrong in the beginning, saying, "Etika Kapoor here...I hate PewDiePie."

headlines: Kangana covers face with plastic bag on Environment Day
text: On the occasion of World Environment Day 2018 on Tuesday, actress Kangana Ranaut featured in a video in which she is seen covering her face with a plastic bag. Urging followers to stop using single-use plastic bags, Kangana said, "In 30 years, there will be more plastic in the ocean than fish." Notably, this year's theme is 'Beat Plastic Pollution'.

headlines: Shahid Kapoor to train as a boxer for his next film
text: Actor Shahid Kapoor will train as a boxer for his upcoming film with director Raja Krishna Menon. Shahid, who is currently working on 'Batti Gul Meter Chalu', will spend approximately three months training, with the film set to go on floors in December. Menon said Shahid is "nimble on his feet" which will come in handy for the film.

headlines: My defence of Swara is not for her remark on Pakistan: Sonam
text: Sonam Kapoor has tweeted that her defence of actress Swara Bhasker has nothing to do with the latter's comments on Pakistan, wherein she said Pakistan is a 'failing state'. Sonam added, "Get your fact right and stop trying to spread mischief and hate!" Earlier, she had said people like to troll Swara as she has an opinion of her own.

headlines: Arjun reacts to rumour of him dating actress NataÅ¡a StankoviÄ
text: Actor Arjun Rampal, while reacting to rumours of him dating Serbian actress NataÅ¡a StankoviÄ, wrote, "Some mornings start with freshly brewed coffee, others with freshly stirred link ups!" "Right now it's just my cuppa and me... #newstome," he added. Earlier, reports said Arjun and NataÅ¡a started dating after meeting on the sets of his film 'Daddy'.

headlines: Priyanka can dumb herself down and can also intimidate: Hrithik
text: Hrithik Roshan has said that Priyanka Chopra could just as easily dumb herself down as she could intimidate, depending on the person or situation. "Only in her case, the transformation is of the intellect and is driven by a generous heart to make people around her comfortable," he added. He further said that Priyanka fits any situation like a chameleon.

headlines: I can talk about anything with Karan Johar: Alia Bhatt
text: Actress Alia Bhatt has said she can talk to filmmaker Karan Johar about "anything under the sun". "Be it personal, professional, philosophical...something that gives me a good and fun perspective is Karan Johar. Talking to him refreshes me to another level," said Alia. Karan had launched Alia with his 2012 film 'Student of the Year' and recently co-produced 'Raazi'.

headlines: World no. 72 knocks 2016 champ Djokovic out of French Open
text: Twelve-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic, who had won the French Open in 2016, crashed out of this year's edition after suffering a four-set defeat against world number 72 Marco Cecchinato in the quarter-final on Tuesday. With the win, Cecchinato became the first Italian to reach French Open semi-final since 1978 and the lowest-ranked Roland Garros semi-finalist in 19 years.

headlines: Nabi, Rashid take 6/31 as Afghanistan win series vs B'desh
text: Spinners Mohammad Nabi and Rashid Khan registered combined figures of 8-0-31-6 as Afghanistan defeated Bangladesh in the second T20I in Dehradun on Tuesday to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the 3-match series. With this, Afghanistan sealed their first-ever T20I series win over Bangladesh. Rashid won his second successive Man of the Match award for his four-wicket haul.

headlines: Planet Nine could instead be group of large asteroids: Study
text: The hypothetical 'Planet Nine' may not be a planet and could be a group of large asteroids that disturb orbits of smaller comets in the solar system with their collective gravity, according to a US-based study. Researchers also hypothesised that the disturbance created by such interactions could have flung comets towards the Earth, which could explain the extinction of dinosaurs.

headlines: ED questions ex-FM Chidambaram in Aircel-Maxis case
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday questioned former Finance Minister P Chidambaram in the Aircel-Maxis money laundering case. He was allowed to go for lunch after being questioned for two hours in the â¹3,500-crore case, following which the questioning resumed. Further, a Delhi court has ruled that P Chidambaram cannot be arrested till July 10.

headlines: Governors' residences not parallel power centres: Vice Prez
text: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Tuesday said that Raj Bhavans, the official residences of state governors, are not parallel power centres. Adding that state government always needs a "wise counsel, a mentor, a friend, philosopher and guide to steer the ship of development", Vice President Naidu said, "This is especially true when narrow perspectives tend to distort the development process."

headlines: We probed Sunanda Pushkar case professionally: Delhi Police
text: The Delhi Police, which has accused Congress leader Shashi Tharoor of abetment to suicide in his wife Sunanda Pushkar's death case, said they investigated the case "professionally". "We will defend the case in the court and do a proper follow-up of the court proceedings," the police added. The chargesheet alleged that Tharoor's flirtatious nature had forced Pushkar to commit suicide.

headlines: US spy charged with selling state secrets to China for â¹5 cr
text: A 58-year-old former US intelligence officer has been charged with selling state secrets to China for at least $800,000 (over â¹5 crore). Ron Rockwell Hansen had sought information on the US military operations planned against China. Hansen is facing 15 charges, including an attempt to gather or deliver national defence information to aid a foreign government.

headlines: Pastor killed by crocodile during baptism ceremony at lake
text: An Ethiopian pastor was killed after being attacked by a crocodile while he was baptising worshippers at a lake in the south of the country last week. "All of a sudden, a crocodile jumped out of the lake and grabbed the pastor," an eyewitness said. The 45-year-old was reportedly bitten on his legs, back and hands.

headlines: Luxury fashion designer Kate Spade found dead in New York
text: Luxury fashion designer Kate Spade was found dead in her New York City apartment on Tuesday, with police confirming that she committed suicide. The 55-year-old designer was reportedly found hanging by her housekeeper, and is said to have left a note. Spade started her line of handbags in 1993, which now has over 315 shops globally.

headlines: I should be poster boy for #MeToo movement: Woody Allen
text: Showing his support for the #MeToo movement, writer-director Woody Allen has said that he should be the poster boy for the movement. "I've worked with hundreds of actresses...I've always had a wonderful record with them," he added. He further said, "Not a single (actress)...ever suggested any kind of impropriety at all," adding that everyone wants justice to be done.

headlines: After Arbaaz, Sajid Khan named in IPL betting racket
text: Dawood Ibrahim-linked bookie Sonu Jalan has reportedly named director Sajid Khan, known for films like 'Heyy Babyy' and 'Housefull', in the IPL betting racket. Jalan told the police that Sajid used to place bets on cricket matches with him seven years ago, as per reports. This comes after Arbaaz Khan confessed to placing bets on IPL matches with Jalan.

headlines: Instagram crashes worldwide for hours on Android devices
text: Facebook-owned photo and video sharing app Instagram crashed worldwide for several hours on Android devices on Tuesday. "Instagram hasn't been working since about 3 in the morning. I thought it was just my crap phone," a user wrote. Later, Instagram fixed the issue and apologised for the crash saying, "We're sorry, and things are resolved!"

headlines: Amazon becomes second US firm to cross $800 billion m-cap
text: E-commerce giant Amazon on Monday became the second US company after Apple to surpass $800 billion market capitalisation mark. Amazon's market value is $808 billion while the world's most valuable company Apple has a market capitalisation of $943 billion. Amazon's largest shareholder and CEO Jeff Bezos now has a net worth of $138 billion, according to Bloomberg.

headlines: Govt making soldiers buy their own clothes, shoes: Rahul
text: Citing a report suggesting the government has decided to cut down its supplies from ordnance factories, Congress President Rahul Gandhi has accused the government of making soldiers buy their own clothes and shoes. "MAKE (empty slogans and useless acronyms) IN INDIA....meanwhile, make our soldiers buy their own clothes & shoes," he tweeted.

headlines: PM Modi 'very angry' with Lt Governor Baijal, says Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal today claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was "very angry" with Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal as he was not creating sufficient obstacles for the AAP government. "Because despite all the obstacles by the LG, the Delhi government is doing phenomenal work for people. That is the reason Jung was also removed," he tweeted.

headlines: I'll call govt 'ek paise wali sarkar': Jyotiraditya Scindia
text: After the government cut the fuel price by 1 paisa last week, Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday said, "I'll call [the government] 'ek paise wali sarkar'." "Government's putting blot on people of this nation by lowering fuel prices by 1 paise...Most importantly MP charges highest VAT-28% on petrol and 22% on diesel," he added.

headlines: Goa minister suffers brain stroke in Mumbai, hospitalised
text: Goa Power Minister Pandurang Madkaikar underwent an operation at the Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital in Mumbai after suffering a brain stroke, Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane said today. Adding that he and a few other BJP leaders were going to visit him, Rane said, "I am sure he will be fine. He is in good hands."

headlines: India draws more groundwater than China, US combined: Study
text: India extracts more groundwater than China and the US combined, and accounts for a quarter of the groundwater extracted globally, a study by WaterAid has revealed. Further stating the northern and central India are among regions facing water crisis, the study said, around 163 million people in India don't have access to clean water close to home.

headlines: Human rights body blames WB govt for Ram Navami riots
text: After investigating the communal riots that happened during Ram Navami in West Bengal in March, the National Human Rights Commission has blamed the state administration. "The scale of loot, arson, murders which took place at Raniganj on March 26 and Asansol on March 27 clearly shows gross failure of the administration despite availability of intelligence inputs," an NHRC report said.

headlines: Dutch PM spills coffee in Parliament, cleans mess himself
text: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte accidentally spilled coffee in the Parliament and cleaned up the mess himself. A video showed Rutte use a mop to clean the floor and a piece of cloth to wipe away the stains. Reacting to it, a Twitter user wrote, "Imagine all politicians were this humble/good humoured".

headlines: UIDAI restricts e-wallets from accessing Aadhaar database
text: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has restricted mobile wallet companies from accessing the Aadhaar database, effective July 1. The Aadhaar issuing body has said that most payment companies do not have the necessary infrastructure to protect users' data. All payment firms must now depend on customers to provide virtual Aadhaar numbers for authentication as they cannot do eKYC.

headlines: Delhi HC restrains Indian firm from using H&M trademark
text: The Delhi High Court has restrained HM Megabrands from using the trade name 'HM' or variations similar to Hennes & Mauritz (H&M). The Swedish fashion retailer claimed the Indian firm is representing the alphabets 'H' and 'M' in a similar font style and colour combination. The Indian firm said the alphabets are taken from the proprietor's name Hashim Merchant.

headlines: Patanjali to shift food park out of UP, slams state govt
text: Patanjali's Managing Director Acharya Balkrishna has said the company will shift its planned mega food park out of Uttar Pradesh due to state government's "disappointing attitude." The Greater Noida food park would have brought prosperity to the land of Lord Rama and Krishna, he added. Former CM Akhilesh Yadav laid the foundation of the â¹1,666-crore food park in 2016.

headlines: Rashid takes 3 wickets in 5 balls, posts figures of 4-0-12-4
text: Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan took three wickets in five balls of his third over in the second T20I against Bangladesh at Dehradun on Tuesday. The 19-year-old, who went wicketless in his first two overs, went on to register bowling figures of 4-0-12-4 in the match. He has now taken 56 wickets in T20Is, second-most after 32 T20I matches.

headlines: Dhoni visits Deori temple after leading CSK to IPL title
text: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni visited the Deori temple in Ranchi to offer prayers after having led Chennai Super Kings to their third Indian Premier League title. "Dhoni visited the temple as the wish he made for IPL was fulfilled and he also prayed for the upcoming series," the temple's priest Manoj Panda said.

headlines: When is the funeral: Gayle tells fan copying his dance
text: After a fan shared a video of himself mimicking Kings XI Punjab and Windies opener Chris Gayle's dancing moves, the latter tweeted, "You killed it! When is the funeral?" "Not sure when the Funeral is but sincere thanks for retweeting it...However, each time you come out and bat I feel like I'm attending...Funeral of a 'LEATHER BALL'," the fan wrote.

headlines: Harbhajan pays over â¹2.5 lakh for treatment of U-16 teammate
text: Chennai Super Kings off-spinner Harbhajan Singh paid over â¹2.5 lakh for the entire medical procedure and surgery of his Under-16 teammate Harman Harry. Harry was battling for his life after developing fistula in his intestines and had spent his savings on treatment. "Harbhajan came as an angel and has pulled me out from the jaws of death," Harry said.

headlines: We have 11 Dhoni-like stories in our team: Afghan spinner
text: Afghanistan's 23-year-old spinner Sharafuddin Ashraf has said their team has 11 MS Dhoni-like stories. "A film can be made on each one of (our players). There would be no international cricketer from Afghanistan who hasn't faced immense struggles in his career," he added. "Our seniors were up against steeper challenges than we are," he further said.

headlines: PM Modiâ will be NDA's face in Bihar in 2019: Chirag Paswan
text: Lok Janshakti Party MP Chirag Paswan on Tuesday claimed PM Narendra Modi will be the face of the NDA in the 2019 Lok Sabha polls in Bihar. This comes after the JD(U) party said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar would be the face of the NDA. The Lok Janshakti Party was formed in 2000 after Ram Vilas Paswan split from JD(U).

headlines: Shah to meet Uddhav after Sena calls BJP 'political enemy'
text: BJP chief Amit Shah will meet Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday, after Sena MP Sanjay Raut described the BJP as its biggest "political enemy." Recently, the two allies had contested the Palghar bypolls separately. However, the BJP said the meeting is part of the party's 'Sampark for Samarthan' (contact for support) nationwide campaign.

headlines: Paytm parent puts â¹9cr in wealth management unit Paytm Money
text: One97 Communications, the parent company of digital payments startup Paytm, has infused â¹9 crore in its wealth management division Paytm Money, according to filings. Paytm Money's Senior Vice President Pravin Jadhav will now act as a whole time additional director at the company, the filings added. Paytm Money was introduced by the digital payments startup in January this year.

headlines: Maharashtra CM violated election code: Congress to EC
text: The Congress on Tuesday filed a complaint against Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis with the Election Commission, alleging that he violated the Model Code of Conduct in the recently-held Lok Sabha bypolls. It alleged that Fadnavis announced loan waiver and disbursal scheme for tribals ahead of the elections and urged BJP workers to use 'saam, dam, dand, bhed' to win polls.

headlines: 2 security personnel commit suicide in Jaisalmer in two days
text: Two security personnel have committed suicide in Jaisalmer within a span of two days. A BSF head constable allegedly shot himself with his official weapon on Tuesday as he was reportedly facing domestic issues. The incident occurred less than a day after 38-year-old Army jawan Jogendra Singh allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself inside a store.

headlines: Indian man missing for 5 years traced to Pakistani jail
text: Police have said a man from Rajasthan, who went missing five years ago, has been traced to a Pakistani jail. Stating that the 25-year-old was mentally unsound, his family said they do not know how he strayed into Pakistan. Earlier, the family of a missing 68-year-old man found that he had been lodged in a Pakistani jail for 36 years.

headlines: Israel calls for military coalition if Iran enriches uranium
text: Israel's Intelligence Minister Yisrael Katz has called for a "military coalition" against Iran if it restarts the enrichment of uranium in defiance of the 2015 nuclear deal. This comes after Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said that Iran should be prepared for uranium enrichment if the nuclear deal with the world powers collapses.

headlines: Armaan begging me to return: Girlfriend after assault case
text: Armaan Kohli's live-in girlfriend Neeru Randhawa, who has accused him of assault, says the actor is promising marriage and "begging" her to come back to him. Neeru has alleged Armaan has been sending her text messages post the assault incident, promising that he would change. She also claims the 46-year-old actor had assaulted her in February this year.

headlines: Swimsuits scrapped, Miss America not to be chosen on looks
text: The Miss America Organization has dropped the swimsuit round from the competition this year onwards, saying contestants will no longer be judged on looks. "It's what comes out of their mouths that we care about," Gretchen Carlson, a former Miss America and the Organization's chief said. Carlson added television ratings won't suffer since viewers were more interested in talent rounds.

headlines: What are Microsoft's biggest acquisitions?
text: In 2016, Microsoft acquired business-oriented social networking service LinkedIn in an all-cash transaction valued at $26.2 billion, in one of the biggest tech deals in the world. In 2011, Microsoft acquired Skype for $8.5 billion in cash. This week the company announced it will acquire the world's largest collaborative coding platform GitHub for $7.5 billion in an all-stock deal.

headlines: Railways to charge for excess baggage 30yrs after making rule
text: The Indian Railways had decided to enforce an over 30-year-old rule to charge passengers for carrying excess baggage in trains. Passengers travelling in sleeper class can carry 40 kg and are charged â¹109 for carrying another 40 kg in the luggage van for 500 km. Those violating the rule will face a penalty six times the excess baggage charge.

headlines: Indian football team showed they mean business: Kohli
text: Indian cricket team captain Virat Kohli on Tuesday took to Twitter to congratulate the Indian football team for their 3-0 victory over Kenya, saying the "team again showed that they mean business". He also praised football team captain Sunil Chhetri for scoring a brace in his 100th international match. The match was played in the fully sold-out Mumbai Football Arena.

headlines: Ex-SoftBank COO Nikesh Arora to get $128 mn pay at new company
text: After being named Palo Alto Networks' CEO, former Google and SoftBank executive Nikesh Arora has been awarded a $128-million pay package. Arora will receive restricted stock of $40 million, vesting over seven years, on top of annual salary and bonus of $1 million each. He is also entitled to receive stock options worth $66 million based on share price targets.

headlines: Two-wheeled e-car without steering wheel tested in China
text: Beijing Lingyun Intelligent Technology has designed a two-wheeled electric car prototype which does not have a steering wheel or an acceleration pedal. The car, which is being tested in China, can be controlled by using a computer mouse and 24-inch screen. It has a top speed of 100 kmph and offers 100 kilometre of travel on one charge.

headlines: Apple iOS 12 allows 2 users to unlock iPhone X with Face ID
text: Apple's latest operating system iOS 12 will allow two users to unlock a single iPhone X handset with Face ID. The update is available under the "Set Up an Alternative Appearance" tab in Face ID settings. However, if users choose to remove the alternate face, they will have to reset the entire saved Face ID data.

headlines: Apple did not request any personal data from Facebook: Cook
text: Responding to claims that Apple had access to Facebook's user data, CEO Tim Cook said the company did not request or receive any personal data from the social network. "We weren't in the data business. We've never been in the data business," he added. Earlier, reports claimed Facebook gave user data access to 60 firms including Apple, Samsung and Amazon.

headlines: Conversion to make someone agree with you wrong: Minister
text: After 120 Dalits from Haryana's Jind converted to Buddhism over alleged government apathy, state minister Anil Vij on Tuesday said, "Using conversion to make someone agree with you isn't right." "One must stand by his religion. If they had a problem, we could've looked for a solution. Some demands had been agreed to," he added.

headlines: Nuclear battery that can power spacecraft for 100 years made
text: Russian researchers have created a battery based on radioactive isotope nickel-63 that has a half-life of 100 years, which could help power deep space missions. The prototype packs about 3,300 milliwatt-hours of energy per gram, which is more than any other nuclear battery based on nickel-63 and 10 times more than commercial electrochemical cells, said researchers.

headlines: How much does government spend on social media advertising?
text: The Information and Broadcasting Ministry and MyGov portal, under Electronics and IT Ministry's Digital India, are responsible for advertising government schemes and programmes on social media. The I&B Ministry spent nearly â¹82 crore in six years between 2012-18, of which the NDA spent â¹67 crore in the last four years. Meanwhile, MyGov has spent â¹107 crore in 2016-17.

headlines: Shashi Tharoor calls for legalising cannabis in India
text: Asserting that cannabis is indigenous to India in the form of 'bhang', Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has said India should legalise and regulate the production, supply, and use of cannabis. Stating that alcohol and tobacco are far more harmful than cannabis, Tharoor claimed that regulation would allow the consumers to know about the strength of the drug.

headlines: Landlocked Ethiopia plans to build its navy
text: Landlocked nation Ethiopia is planning to build a Navy as part of military reforms, the state media reported. Ethiopia had disbanded its Navy in 1991 after its then-province Eritrea declared independence, leaving it landlocked. Ethiopia shares borders with Eritrea in the north, Djibouti and Somalia in the east, Sudan and South Sudan in the west and Kenya in the south.

headlines: Playing PM Narendra Modi will be hugely challenging: Paresh
text: Actor Paresh Rawal, who will be portraying Prime Minister Narendra Modi in an upcoming biopic, has said that it will be a "hugely challenging" role for him. "We are just locking the script and hopefully it will finish soon, and we will begin to shoot it in September or October," he added. The actor will reportedly also produce the biopic.

headlines: Jennifer Aniston to be Courteney's Maid of Honour: Report
text: As per reports, American actress Jennifer Aniston will be her 'Friends' co-star Courteney Cox's Maid of Honour. Courteney will reportedly get married to Snow Patrol singer Johnny McDaid in Ireland this year. "Courteney wouldn't want to walk down the aisle without Jennifer by her side. They have a very strong friendship," added reports.

headlines: I'll put money in my films if people stop putting: Sushant
text: Talking about his passion for acting, Sushant Singh Rajput said, "If one day people stop putting money in my movies, I will put in money...prod people to watch...films, that's how much I enjoy it." He added that time consumed in making films is time well used. "This (acting) is something I don't mind investing my time in," he further said.

headlines: Bill time par diya karo: Harbhajan trolls Yuvraj over tweet
text: Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh trolled Yuvraj Singh after the latter tweeted about a power outage in Mumbai. Yuvraj tweeted, "Lights Out in Bandra for over an hour now ... can we get it back please ?!?!" To Yuvraj's tweet, Harbhajan replied with, "Badshah bill time par diya karo." A user reacted to it with, "Bhajji - 1 Yuvi - 0".

headlines: Team India fan Sudhir brings litchi for Harbhajan and family
text: Team India fan Sudhir Gautam brought litchi for Indian spinner Harbhajan Singh and his family. Posting a picture with Sudhir on Twitter, Harbhajan wrote, "This man, Sudhir, never forgets to bring lichis every year..thanks a lot." "[M]ore than that thanks for being the most loyal team India supporter yet.. God bless," Harbhajan's tweet further read.

headlines: Apple iOS 12 to let users track time spent on apps, websites
text: Apple has introduced a 'Screen Time' feature for iOS 12 that will allow users to check how much time they spend on apps and websites. The feature will create Activity Reports showing the total time a person spends on each app. It will allow people to "take control of how much time they spend in a particular app," Apple said.

headlines: BJP must construct Ram temple to win in 2019: Ayodhya priest
text: Acharya S Das, the chief priest of the Ram Janmabhoomi temple, on Tuesday said if BJP wanted to come to power again in the 2019 general elections, it should start constructing the Ram temple. "BJP has, in a way, betrayed Lord Ram. It came to power in the name of Ram and then forgot the Lord," he added.

headlines: 3 minor sisters hacked to death in Bihar, cops suspect rape
text: Three minor sisters aged between 10 and 16 were hacked to death in Bihar, and the police suspect that they were raped. Locals have claimed the girls were asleep when perpetrators barged into their residence as their parents were away. The police have detained two people in connection with the incident and are awaiting the post-mortem report.

headlines: Terrorism and talks cannot go hand in hand, India warns Pak
text: Stating India "honours" the ceasefire but will retaliate if Pakistan makes unprovoked attacks, Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said, "Terror and talks cannot go hand in hand." She added, "When it is an unprovoked attack the Army was given the right to retaliate. We honour the ceasefire but...a margin was given to us when there is an unprovoked attack."

headlines: 18-yr-old jumps to death after failing to get good NEET rank
text: An 18-year-old girl jumped to death from the top of a 10-storey shopping complex in Hyderabad today after failing to get her expected rank in the NEET exam, according to the police. She committed suicide even as several people raised an alarm after noticing her on the top floor. She sustained head injuries and died on the spot.

headlines: I&B ministry releases â¹617 cr for salaries of DD, AIR staff
text: The Union Information and Broadcasting Ministry has released â¹617 crore for the payment of three months' salaries of Doordarshan and All India Radio employees. The amount has been released despite Prasar Bharati, the parent company of DD and AIR, not having signed an agreement to get grants-in-aid from the government. An official said the agreement will be signed "subsequently".

headlines: US woman kills husband for beating cat
