text: A woman in the US state of Texas has confessed to shooting her husband dead because he was beating the family cat, police said. Mary Harrison was arrested after she told the authorities that she shot her husband during an argument. The woman has been charged with murder and is being held on a bail of $100,000.

headlines: Ola fights congestion, gives 1 lakh free share rides
text: Ola Share has been creating awareness and fighting congestion ever since its inception. As a part of its ongoing #FarakPadtaHai campaign, this World Environment Day, Ola is giving 1 lakh free Share rides to users from the metro, bus and railway stations to promote shared mobility. Avail 1 lakh free Ola Share rides from 5th-8th June.

headlines: Ola driver forces woman passenger to strip for photos, gets arrested
text: An Ola driver was arrested after he allegedly abducted a woman passenger, molested her, and took her pictures after forcing her to strip in Bengaluru. The incident took place on June 1 when the 26-year-old woman booked the cab for airport. The accused even asked her to either stay quiet or he will call his friends to gangrape her.

headlines: Flipkart founders-backed startup launches e-scooters at â¹1.2L
text: Flipkart founders Sachin Bansal and Binny Bansal-backed startup Ather Energy has launched its first two electric scooters in Bengaluru, priced at â¹1.09 lakh and â¹1.2 lakh. The Ather 340 model has a range of 60 km and a top speed of 70 kmph. On the other hand, Ather 450 has a 75 km range and 80 kmph top speed.

headlines: No point in living further: UPSC aspirant in suicide note
text: Karnataka's 28-year-old UPSC aspirant Varun Subhash Chandran committed suicide on Sunday after he was denied entry at the exam centre for being four minutes late. "Rules are rules, but bending them for a good purpose should be legitimate...Just think I never existed," he wrote in his suicide note. Varun got late as he had mistakenly reached the wrong centre earlier.

headlines: Charges in Sunanda death case vindictive: Shashi Tharoor
text: After a Delhi court decided that Congress MP Shashi Tharoor must face a trial over his his wife Sunanda Pushkar's death, Tharoor issued a statement saying, "I find the charges preposterous...the product of malicious and vindictive campaign." "I will continue to vigorously contest these charges and maintain my steadfast conviction that ultimately the truth will prevail," he added.

headlines: 30-yr-old becomes 1st visually-challenged woman IAS officer
text: Thirty-year-old Pranjal Patil has become the first visually-challenged woman IAS officer in India as she joined her posting as Assistant Collector in Kerala's Ernakulam district last week. The Maharashtra resident had lost her eyesight when she was six-years-old and faced difficulty in her initial academic years. In 2016, she secured 773 rank in the UPSC exam in her first attempt.

headlines: Odisha artist creates sand turtle on world environment day
text: Padma Shri-awardee sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik has created a 50-foot-long sand turtle on Odisha's Puri beach with the message 'Beat Plastic Pollution' on the occasion of World Environment Day. Pattnaik used plastic bottles to create the turtle's shell. The turtle, which was created using 30 tonnes of sand, showcases the plight of sea turtles who choke on plastic.

headlines: Ex-ISI chief to be punished over book with ex-RAW head: Pak
text: Pakistan Army spokesperson Major General Asif Ghafoor has said ex-ISI chief Asad Durrani will be punished as per the law for co-authoring a book with former RAW chief AS Dulat. Durrani is accused of violating the military code of conduct. He has made several revelations in the book, including details of deals struck between India and Pakistan.

headlines: I don't owe a private apology to Monica: Ex-US Prez Clinton
text: Former US President Bill Clinton has said that he does not owe a private apology to Monica Lewinsky, the former White House intern he had an affair with. Talking about how he handled the affair, Clinton said he "did the right thing". Clinton had faced impeachment for lying to investigators about his relationship with Lewinsky but was acquitted later.

headlines: UN asks US to stop separating migrant children from parents
text: The UN has called on the US to "immediately halt" its policy of separating migrant children from their parents at the country's southern border. "Detention is never in the best interests of the child and always constitutes a child rights violation," it said. The UN added it was "deeply concerned" over the US administration's "zero tolerance" policy on illegal immigration.

headlines: Cryptocurrency Ponzi racket worth â¹500 crore busted in Thane
text: The Thane police on Monday busted a cryptocurrency Ponzi racket estimated to be worth as much as â¹500 crore. The alleged fraud was carried out by Flintstone Group, where its employees lured in people by promising them 10-20 times returns on investments in four to six months. Some were allegedly offered Caribbean citizenship as well as a Swiss bank account.

headlines: Uday Chopra takes a dig at Daisy Shah's 'Race 3' dialogue
text: Uday Chopra posted a tweet which read, "My mother is my mother, but only cause of my father. Just like my father is my father only cause of my mother." It's an apparent dig at Daisy Shah's dialogue 'Our business is our business, none of your business' from 'Race 3'. Reacting to Uday's tweet, a user commented, "Pearls of wisdom."

headlines: Actresses made 'Veere...' powerhouse of talent: Co-producer
text: Talking about Veere Di Wedding's lead actresses Kareena Kapoor Khan, Sonam Kapoor, Swara Bhasker and Shikha Talsania, co-producer Nikhil Dwivedi, said, "It (the film) is a powerhouse of talent." "Everyone was so...committed to their work and was so professional that it has been a great experience working with all of them," added Nikhil, who is the film's only male producer.

headlines: Sanjay Dutt to star in Akshay Kumar's 'Housefull 4': Reports
text: Actor Sanjay Dutt will reportedly be a part of Sajid Khan's 'Housefull 4' which will also star Akshay Kumar, Riteish Deshmukh, Bobby Deol, Kriti Sanon and Pooja Hegde. As per reports, Kriti Kharbanda, who made her Bollywood debut with the 2016 film 'Raaz Reboot', will also be a part of the film, which is being produced by Sajid Nadiadwala.

headlines: Arjun dating DJ Waley Babu actress NataÅ¡a StankoviÄ: Reports
text: Arjun Rampal, who recently announced his separation from Mehr Jesia, is reportedly dating Serbian actress NataÅ¡a StankoviÄ who appeared in the song 'DJ Waley Babu'. "Arjun and Natasa got acquainted while working on [Arjun's film] 'Daddy' and they've apparently kept in touch with each other," reports stated. NataÅ¡a featured in the song 'Zindagi Meri Dance Dance' in the film.

headlines: Youth football players lift overturned car to rescue couple
text: While driving back from a championship tournament in California, US, a youth football team from Idaho lifted an overturned vehicle and rescued the couple trapped inside. A video shows the players pulling a man out of the car before pushing on the side to lift the vehicle up enough for a player to rescue the woman.

headlines: Jadeja once called cheetahs, felt like punching him: Rohit
text: Indian cricketer Rohit Sharma has revealed that he once felt like punching Ravindra Jadeja as the latter started making weird noises and calling cheetahs during a jungle safari in South Africa. "The moment Jadeja started making noises, those cheetahs turned around to look at us," Rohit said. "Only I know what I was going through," he added.

headlines: Betting rates for SRH vs DD recovered from bookie's phone
text: Thane police have recovered alleged betting rates for an IPL 2018 match between SunRisers Hyderabad and Delhi Daredevils from Dawood Ibrahim-linked bookie Sonu Jalan. According to the screenshots recovered from Jalan's phone, rates for SRH were â¹1.68, while the rates for Daredevils were â¹2.46. Jalan said many clients had bet on the match, however, he refused to reveal any names.

headlines: Apple iOS 12 offers 'Shortcuts' app for custom Siri commands
text: Apple has introduced a 'Shortcut' app for Siri on iOS 12 which allows users to create their own commands for the digital assistant. Users can integrate those commands with third-party apps through an "add to Siri" button. For instance, if a user says "morning coffee", Siri will place an order for coffee from an app on their iPhone.

headlines: GM settles suit with biker hit by its self-driving car in US
text: General Motors (GM) has agreed to settle a lawsuit filed by a motorcyclist hit by the company's self-driving car last year in the US. The rider Oscar Nilsson had claimed the car swerved into his lane, knocking him off his motorcycle and injuring him. A GM spokesperson confirmed the settlement between the two sides but did not release any details.

headlines: Seat sharing will be discussed at appropriate time: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav today said there was no decision on seat sharing between his party and the Mayawati-led BSP for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, adding, "We will discuss at the appropriate time." "We 'samajwadis' have a big heart," he added. The statements came after reports claimed BSP is demanding 40 out of 80 seats in UP.

headlines: Political environment today similar to 1977: Sharad Pawar
text: Asserting that the current political environment is similar to that which existed in 1977, Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar said a united opposition would be able to defeat a single party. "In 1977, the downfall of one party started and...the government collapsed. A similar situation can be a possibility now if the opposition comes together," he said.

headlines: Walmart-Flipkart deal will endanger jobs: Trader unions
text: Over 100 trader unions have opposed the Walmart-Flipkart deal saying it would cause "irreversible damage" to small businesses and endanger jobs. "Walmart is well-known for its global supply chain, especially of cheap goods from China, which will hurt local manufacturers," an association said. Earlier, the Confederation of All India Traders filed a plea against the deal alleging unfair competition.

headlines: Saudi bans produce imports from Kerala after Nipah outbreak
text: Saudi Arabia has temporarily banned processed and frozen fruit and vegetable imports from Kerala from Sunday amid concerns over Nipah virus outbreak. On May 29, the United Arab Emirates also banned imports from Kerala and had earlier asked its citizens to avoid unnecessary travel to Kerala. The Nipah virus has claimed more than 15 lives in the state so far.

headlines: Rohtak man claims his wife was killed by her family
text: In an alleged case of honour killing, a 24-year-old man from Rohtak claimed his 19-year-old wife was murdered by her family members. Monu said he had married his wife, a second-year BCom student, without her parents' permission. He alleged that she left to meet her parents and when he tried to call her, her father said she had been killed.

headlines: France building its first village for dementia patients
text: France has begun building its first 'Alzheimer's village' where up to 120 patients would live freely without medication alongside carers, volunteers, and scientists. The $34-million project costs the same as a typical nursing home but will be less restrictive, said experts, hoping the village will allow residents to have more active and happier lives.

headlines: Daily fuel pricing mechanism to stay: Oil Minister
text: Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan has ruled out a review of daily price revision mechanism of petrol and diesel, which was introduced in mid-June last year. He added that the government is working on a "holistic" strategy to bring down fuel prices. Petrol in Delhi now costs â¹77.83 per litre after falling for the seventh day in a row on Tuesday.

headlines: 1st teaser of 'Transformers' spin-off 'Bumblebee' released
text: The first official teaser of 'Bumblebee', the spin-off to the 'Transformers' film series, has been released. The film, which is also a prequel to the 2007 film 'Transformers', stars Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Kenneth Choi among others. Directed by Travis Knight, 'Bumblebee' is scheduled to release on December 21.

headlines: Apple shares hit record on first day of developer conference
text: Shares of American technology giant Apple hit a new all-time high on Monday, the first day of the company's 5-day Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC). The stock rose 0.84%, pushing Apple's market capitalisation to $943 billion. Apple announced the latest version of its macOS named 'Mojave' and unveiled iOS 12 for iPhones and iPads at the WWDC event.

headlines: We showed big heart by offering JD(S) CM post: Cong leader
text: Discussing the Congress-JD(S) alliance in Karnataka, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said, "Congress leadership...showed a big heart by offering chief ministership to the JD(S) without any condition." Welcoming changes after Rahul Gandhi took over as Congress president, he added, "All this happened so fast that old Congress members like us did not even feel that it was the same Congress party."

headlines: Astronaut reveals puzzles he had to solve in selection test
text: British astronaut Tim Peake has shared "mental challenge" puzzles that he had to solve as a part of European Space Agency's selection process. Peake was selected from 8,000 applications to go to the International Space Station. The 46-year-old astronaut had finished his 186-day mission on the ISS in June 2016.

headlines: Container port dumping 20k kg plastic a day in sea in Mumbai
text: Maharashtra's environment department will issue a notice to Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust after an inquiry revealed it was dumping 20,000 kg of plastic every day into the sea, 12 km outside Mumbai. The department was alerted by local fishermen who had been fishing out large quantities of plastic, particularly from the area where the government-owned port dumps its waste.

headlines: Haryana bans single-use water bottles in govt offices
text: Ahead of the World Environment Day, the Haryana government has banned single-use water bottles in all government offices in the state and ordered the use of only multi-use water bottles. Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said that a five-point programme would be implemented for maintaining ecological balance in Haryana, including plantation of 20 lakh saplings and using LED bulbs.

headlines: Saudi Arabia issues its first driver's licences to women
text: Saudi Arabia began issuing its first driver's licences to women on Monday ahead of lifting the ban on women driving on June 24. The first batch of licences was issued to 10 women. Around 2,000 more licences are expected to be issued to women next week, the country's Ministry of Information said.

headlines: Of course top job has to be led by a man: Qatar Airways CEO
text: On being asked why Qatar Airways was led by a man, CEO Akbar Al Baker said, "Of course it has to be led by a man, because it is a very challenging position." He later defended the statement and said Qatar has over 33% female workforce. He also added that it would be his pleasure to have a female CEO.

headlines: Ambanis release video invite for Akash's June 30 engagement
text: India's richest person Mukesh Ambani's family has released a video invite for the guests who will be attending Akash Ambani's formal engagement with Shloka Mehta on June 30 this year. The engagement ceremony will be held at the family's residence Antilia in Mumbai. Akash proposed to his childhood friend and diamond heiress Shloka Mehta on March 24 earlier this year.

headlines: Vedanta enters steel, buys Electrosteel for â¹5,320 crore
text: Billionaire Anil Agarwal's Vedanta has acquired bankrupt Electrosteel Steels for â¹5,320 crore, marking its entry into the steel business. This is the second company in the first 'dirty dozen' list issued by the RBI to be sold to new owners under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC). Last month, Tata Steel completed its â¹35,200-crore acquisition of Bhushan Steel.

headlines: I take up roles that I feel I would fail in: Sushant
text: Speaking about the kind of roles he chooses, Sushant Singh Rajput said, "I take up roles I feel I'd fail in...then it becomes like a challenge for me to outdo myself." "My philosophy of success in life is to find different ways of failing," he added. Sushant further said, "Failure is just a way of pushing myself to do more."

headlines: As actors, we're only defending ourselves, used to it: Sonam
text: Actress Sonam Kapoor has said that as actors, they only have to keep defending themselves, in media as well as in public. "Whether you are working hard...Whether you are a feminist or not...Whether you are getting married or not...We keep defending ourselves," she added. Sonam further said that she is now used to defending herself.

headlines: Rani Mukerji's 'Hichki' to be screened at Shanghai Film Fest
text: Rani Mukerji starrer 'Hichki' is set to be screened at the Belt and Road Film Week of Shanghai International Film Festival in China. The film will be screened on the opening day of the film festival on June 16. Siddharth Malhotra, the director of 'Hichki', will also interact with members of the audience following the screening.

headlines: It has become tough being a celebrity today: Jacqueline
text: Speaking about social media trolls, Jacqueline Fernandez said it has become tough being a celebrity today. "Social media has opened up so many doors...but there are also a lot of people...who are depressed and angry, and they use the platform to vent their own frustrations," she added. Jacqueline further said, "I don't take trolls or people creating the memes seriously."

headlines: Brings me back to a good place: Buttler on 'F**k It' message
text: England's Jos Buttler has revealed he writes 'F**k It' on top of his bats as it reminds him of what his "best mindset" is. "It's just a good reminder when I'm in the middle...questioning myself...it brings me back to a good place," he said. "It puts cricket in perspective. When you nick off, does it really matter," he added.

headlines: Fan invades pitch to touch Chhetri's feet in his 100th match
text: A fan invaded the pitch to touch the feet of Indian football captain Sunil Chhetri after India's win against Kenya in the 2018 Intercontinental Cup on Monday. After the invader demanded Chhetri for a selfie, Chhetri asked him to come later, requesting security to escort him out. Chhetri, who scored a brace, was appearing in his 100th international match.

headlines: Apple tests mode which locks USB access after 1 hr on iOS 12
text: Apple has unveiled a 'Restricted' mode for iOS 12 beta version that restricts accessories from connecting via USB after the iPhone has been locked for an hour. Users will require to unlock the phone with their passcode while connecting it to a USB accessory. Earlier, the Restricted mode limited the Lightning port to only charging after 7 days.

headlines: Largest breast cancer study finds many don't need chemo
text: With over 10,000 breast cancer patients, the largest precision medicine trial ever done has found that chemotherapy may be avoided in about 70% of cases. Chemotherapy has side effects like nausea, vomiting, hair loss and fatigue in the short-term. Researchers were able to separate women more likely to have recurrent cancer through genetic testing to spare thousands from the treatment.

headlines: CBI names ex-ministers' sons in 108 ambulance fraud case
text: The sons of two former union ministers are among three named in a CBI chargesheet in the 108 ambulance fraud case. Investigation is pending against several others, including former Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot and Congress leader Sachin Pilot. The case came to light in 2014 over alleged irregularities in the way a tender for ambulance services in Rajasthan was awarded.

headlines: Thunderstorm, lightning expected in Gurugram for 3 days: IMD
text: Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) on Monday said that thunderstorm with squall and lightning is expected in Gurugram from Wednesday to Friday. The storm is likely to lower the city's temperature to 39â on Wednesday and 38â on Thursday from the average temperature of 42â. Several trees and electricity poles have been uprooted due to frequent thunderstorms in the city.

headlines: Man sends PM Modi cheque for 9 paise to protest fuel price
text: A man from Telangana has sent PM Narendra Modi a cheque for 9 paise as protest, mocking the recent drop in fuel price in the state by the same amount. He handed over the cheque to District Collector Krishna Bhaskar and requested the IAS officer to ensure that the cheque reached the Prime Minister's relief fund.

headlines: 75-year-old man jailed for leaving cattle out in the rain
text: A 75-year-old Mumbai resident has been sentenced to 10 days in jail for leaving his 28 cows out in the rain for five days during the 2013 monsoons. Gopal Phulsunge, who was also fined â¹3,000, was found guilty of confining the animals in a small space. The police had registered the case following a complaint by an animal activist.

headlines: PM Modi wishes UP CM Yogi Adityanath on 46th birthday
text: On the occasion of UP CM Yogi Adityanath's 46th birthday on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Warm birthday wishes to Uttar Pradesh's hardworking Chief Minister." Local traders in Gorakhpur prepared a 46-kg laddoo on the eve of his birthday. Several BJP leaders and Hindu Yuva Vahini General Secretary PK Mall attended the function organised by locals.

headlines: B'luru man held for posting wife's obscene photo online
text: Bengaluru Police have arrested a man for allegedly posting an edited obscene picture of his wife and her phone number on a dating website. The couple was living separately and fought frequently over trivial matters, police officials said. The husband was arrested after the woman lodged a police complaint when she began getting calls from unknown men.

headlines: Singapore launches medallion to mark Trump-Kim summit
text: Singapore on Tuesday unveiled a 'World Peace' medallion to commemorate the upcoming summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. The medallion costs over $1,000 for the gold version. The meeting between Donald Trump and Kim Jong-un will be the first ever between a sitting US President and a North Korean leader.

headlines: 148-year-old Hindu temple re-sanctified in Singapore
text: A 148-year-old Hindu temple in Singapore, Sri Krishnan Temple, was re-sanctified in a ceremony attended by around 10,000 devotees. The Maha Samprokshanam ceremony, which began on Sunday, marked the start of a 48-day-long sanctification process. Before the ceremony, the temple underwent renovation for over four years at a cost of nearly SGD 4 million (â¹20 crore).

headlines: Starbucks Chairman Howard Schultz quits, may run for US Prez
text: US coffee giant Starbucks on Monday announced that its Executive Chairman Howard Schultz will step down on June 26 amid speculation that he may run for President. Under his leadership, the Seattle-based company went from 11 cafes to over 28,000 in 77 countries. The billionaire joined Starbucks in 1982 and took over as Chairman from the CEO position last year.

headlines: Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra summoned over Bitcoin scam
text: Actress Shilpa Shetty's husband and businessman Raj Kundra has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate for questioning in connection with a Bitcoin scam. Reportedly, he has been summoned for his links with scam-accused Amit Bhardwaj, who allegedly duped 8,000 people of â¹2,000 crore. Kundra has previously been involved in an IPL betting scandal and was banned from cricket for life.

headlines: Shashi Tharoor to stand trial in wife Sunanda's death case
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has been summoned by a Delhi court on July 7 in connection with his wife Sunanda Pushkar's death in 2014. Delhi Police had charged Tharoor with abetment to suicide and cruelty after Pushkar was found dead under mysterious circumstances in a hotel room. The chargesheet alleged that Tharoor's flirtatious nature had forced Sunanda to commit suicide.

headlines: IISc develops 'LifeBox' to transport organs by drones
text: Researchers at IISc Bangalore have developed a 'LifeBox' that can extend the preservation time of organs, specifically the heart, and allows for increased travel time and distances. Researchers said that transport of organs using drones could cut down the transportation time by at least 50% compared to green corridors. The technology was used to transport a payload for 10 km.

headlines: Woman born without vagina gets one made with fish skin
text: A Brazilian woman born without a vagina has become the world's first patient to undergo reconstructive surgery using fish skin, declared successful after a year. The procedure involved creation of an orifice and inserting a genital-shaped mould lined with the skin of fish tilapia. The fish skin absorbed into her body and transformed into tissue that lines the vaginal tract.

headlines: Apple iOS 12 to let users create Animoji that look like them
text: Apple on Monday unveiled its latest software iOS 12 for iPhones, which will enable its users to create custom Animoji that look similar to them, called 'Memoji'. The users will be able to create Memoji within Messages by choosing from a set of characteristics to form a unique personality. Memoji will also feature winks and tongue detection to capture expressions.

headlines: Cong MLA pays for man's funeral, carries & cremates his body
text: Assam Congress MLA Rupjyoti Kurmi recently paid for a funeral of a poor man and carried his body till the cremation site. "As a human being and responsible for the people I represent, it's the least I could do," Kurmi said. Last year, Kurmi also carried 50 kg rice bag on his back and delivered it to flood relief camps.

headlines: Pak national held for living in Hyderabad with forged papers
text: A Pakistani national has been arrested in Hyderabad for overstaying in the city with forged documents. The man came to India via Nepal and has been staying in the city for over seven years. He was caught when his Indian wife approached the cybercrime police after he allegedly threatened to release nude videos of her and her daughter.

headlines: PM Modi leader in tackling climate change: UN body chief
text: United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) Executive Director Erik Solheim, in India for World Environment Day, has said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is a "global leader" in tackling climate change. The Indian government is really adamant to act and there are so many positives like banning of plastic in Maharashtra and universities being made plastic free in Hyderabad, Solheim added.

headlines: TN announces plastic ban from 2019 on World Environment Day
text: On the World Environment Day, Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami announced that the state would ban the use of plastic from 2019. However, milk and oil pouches, along with other basic need items will be exempted from the ban, he added. In 2017, the state government had banned the manufacture and use of plastic bags below 51 microns.

headlines: India hosts 2018 World Environment Day
text: India is the global host of 2018 World Environment Day, a UN Environment-led global event which is taking place today. The theme of this year's edition, 'Beat Plastic Pollution', urges people around the world to explore sustainable alternatives and urgently reduce production and excessive use of single-use plastic. PM Narendra Modi will address an event marking the World Environment Day.

headlines: Who was the 'Tank Man' of China's Tiananmen Square protests?
text: A man had halted the movement of tanks ordered to kill student protesters during the 1989 pro-democracy protests in China's Tiananmen Square on June 5. The 19-year-old, better known as the 'Tank Man', was identified by a British publication as Wang Weilin. He had halted the tanks by displaying his palm and climbed up the front of the lead tank.

headlines: Akash Ambani to formally get engaged to Shloka on June 30
text: India's richest person and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani's eldest son Akash is set to get formally engaged to diamond heiress Shloka Mehta on June 30. According to the official save the date invitation, the ceremony will take place in Mumbai. The couple, who studied together at Dhirubhai Ambani International School, will reportedly get married later this year.

headlines: I feel sorry for the things I said against Sunny Leone: Rakhi
text: Following her apology to Sunny Leone on a reality show over comments made against her, Rakhi Sawant said, "I feel sorry for...the things I said against her." "Now she's a mother, I shouldn't say anything bad about her," Rakhi added. She further said, "Earlier I was totally against her because she was a porn star. But...she has been working hard."

headlines: Arjun slams media house for article on sister Janhvi's dress
text: Arjun Kapoor has slammed a media house for publishing an article on his half-sister Janhvi Kapoor's outfit being trolled by social media users. "Ridiculous how trolls are given attention by the media...the lesser the stories the lesser the trolls win," he tweeted. Social media users, while trolling Janhvi's outfit, had written that she 'forgot' to wear jeans.

headlines: People like to troll Swara because she has an opinion: Sonam
text: Supporting Swara Bhasker who was trolled for calling Pakistan a 'failing state', Sonam Kapoor said, "I think people just like to troll her because she has an opinion." Swara had made the remark on being asked about her film 'Veere Di Wedding' being banned in Pakistan. Following her statement, she was also slammed by Pakistani actress Urwa Hocane.

headlines: Looks like soon football will be our religion, tweets user
text: Reacting to Indian football team defeating Kenya in jam-packed Mumbai Football Arena, a user tweeted, "What a cheerful atmosphere...looks like soon football will be our religion." Other tweets read, "Such is the impact of Chhetri video that even God has shown his presence in the form of rain," and "Fans today be like...Divided by: Messi and Ronaldo...United by: Sunil Chhetri."

headlines: Indian footballers, fans perform 'Viking Clap' celebration
text: Indian footballers along with fans in the Mumbai Football Arena performed the Viking Clap celebration after a 3-0 win against Kenya on Monday. Tickets to the match were sold out after captain Sunil Chhetri urged people to show up to their matches. Notably, the Viking Clap celebration was made popular by the Iceland football team during their Euro 2016 campaign.

headlines: Chhetri thanks fans for sold-out stands for India's match
text: Indian captain Sunil Chhetri, who posted a plea to Indian people to show up for matches, took to Twitter to thank the fans for the sold-out stands during India's 3-0 win over Kenya. In his plea, Chhetri had urged people to "please come and watch us in the stadiums... abuse us, criticise us... but please get involved".

headlines: TMC worker shot dead in W Bengal after death of 2 BJP men
text: A TMC worker was shot dead on Monday night by three unidentified assailants in West Bengal's Howrah, days after the death of two BJP workers. The ruling TMC has blamed the BJP for the murder of Mohsin Khan, whose wife won the recently-concluded panchayat elections in May. The rural elections were also marred with violence between the political parties.

headlines: BJP Prez Shah meets Ramdev to seek support for 2019 election
text: BJP President Amit Shah on Monday met yoga guru Ramdev to seek support for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, as part of his 'Sampark for Samarthan' campaign. The BJP chief and other leaders will meet at least 50 eminent personalities who supported the party during the last elections and inform them about the work done in the last four years.

headlines: Blood test to detect 10 cancers before symptoms being made
text: Researchers are developing a blood test called liquid biopsy, which can screen for 10 different cancer types before the symptoms appear in the patient. The test was most accurate for diagnosing pancreatic, ovarian and liver cancers, though number of detections was small. "This is potentially the holy grail of cancer research," said the study's author at world's largest oncology conference.

headlines: Woman gives birth hours after report says foetus is dead
text: A woman in West Bengal gave birth to a healthy baby hours after a lab report said she was carrying a dead foetus, according to her family. The woman had experienced labour pains and visited the laboratory, whose report had read "Intra-uterine fetal death at 32 weeks 5 days." The family has now lodged a police complaint against the laboratory.

headlines: SC allows govt to have quota in promotions for SC/ST staff
text: The Supreme Court has allowed the Centre to provide reservation in promotions for SC/ST employees in all government departments till the issue is disposed of by the bench. The Centre had filed a plea against a Delhi High Court order quashing the reservation. The High Court had asked for a preliminary exercise to get data regarding lack of representation.

headlines: India begins importing LNG from Russia in 20-yr deal
text: India on Monday began importing Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) from Russia as it received the first 3.4 trillion British thermal unit of cargo at Gujarat's Dahej terminal. India will be importing LNG worth an estimated $25 billion over 20 years from Russia. India is the world's fourth-largest buyer of LNG and imports the gas from Qatar, Australia and the US.

headlines: 16 people fined in Mumbai for not picking up pets' poop
text: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation last week imposed a fine on 16 people for not picking up their pets' poop, during a three-day drive they implemented in areas including Mahalaxmi and Girgaum Chowpatty. According to the Greater Mumbai Cleanliness and Sanitation Byelaws, owners can be fined â¹500 for not picking up their pets' poop.

headlines: 60th witness turns hostile in Sohrabuddin encounter case
text: A senior Rajasthan policeman has said in court that two CBI officers forced him to give false statement in the Sohrabuddin Sheikh encounter case, becoming the 60th prosecution witness to turn hostile. The policeman, then an Investigating Officer in a murder case in which Sheikh was an accused, now serves as a deputy superintendent of the state police.

headlines: Brazilian teen dies after shark bites off his penis
text: A Brazilian teen passed away on Monday after a shark bit off his penis while he was swimming at a beach in the city of Recife. The 18-year-old was swimming near the shore despite the area being marked by signs warning of shark attacks. Earlier, a man lost a hand and part of his leg on the same beach.

headlines: Was diagnosed with mental condition at 39: Rapper Kanye West
text: American rapper Kanye West has revealed that he was diagnosed with a "mental condition" at the age of 39. "But... it's not a disability, it's a superpower," he added. In his newly released album titled 'YE', the 40-year-old rapper has made references to bipolar disorder, a brain disorder that causes unusual shifts in mood and energy.

headlines: Football team shouldn't beg people to come watch them: Coach
text: After Indian football captain Sunil Chhetri's plea resulted in packed stands, coach Stephen Constantine said, "I don't feel we should be begging people to watch the national team." He claimed the manner in which the team has been playing should be enough to draw the crowds. "I expect the stands to be full in the next two matches", he added.

headlines: GitHub founders to own more Microsoft stock than CEO Nadella
text: The founders of GitHub, the coding platform acquired by Microsoft for $7.5 billion, will own about 10 times more shares than Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, according to Bloomberg. The all-stock deal is equivalent to 73.8 million shares, half of which would pass to GitHub's three founders. Among insiders, only Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates' holding would exceed that of GitHub founders.

headlines: No differences between Cong-JD(S) over Cabinet: K'taka CM
text: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Tuesday said, "There is no difference between our (JD(S) and Congress) MLAs. They have given total freedom to party's president to select the future cabinet." Congress has the charge of 22 state ministries, including Home, Agriculture and Health, while JD(S) has the charge of Finance and 11 other portfolios.

headlines: Man once rejected $100 mn for startup, it's now worth $500 mn
text: Singapore-based Quek Siu Rui once declined a $100-million offer for his startup Carousell, which is now said to be valued at $500 million. In a recent interview, Rui said the startup was "once-in-a-lifetime opportunity" and he wants to build an enduring company. Carousell, which was founded in 2012, is a mobile classifieds app for person-to-person buying and selling.

headlines: Prez clears naming Mughal Sarai station to Deen Dayal Upadhyaya
text: Uttar Pradesh's Mughal Sarai Junction has officially been renamed as Pandit Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Junction, after President Ram Nath Kovind gave his assent to the state government's proposal. The renaming was earlier approved by the Railways Ministry after the state cleared it in 2017. Notably, BJP idealogue Upadhyaya was found dead under mysterious circumstances near the railway station in 1968.

headlines: Pilot killed after IAF's fighter jet crashes in Gujarat
text: A Jaguar fighter jet of the Indian Air Force on Tuesday crashed in Mundra district in Gujarat's Kutch region during a routine training mission. Pilot Air Commodore Sanjay Chauhan has lost his life in the incident. This comes months after an IAF helicopter crashed in Assam during an emergency landing and killed two pilots.

headlines: Govt working to free housing sector from corruption: PM Modi
text: Talking about Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said, "We've been working to free the housing sector from middlemen, corruption and ensuring that the beneficiaries get their own home without hassles." Adding that the scheme is creating employment opportunities, PM Modi stated, "We're working on skill development to enable faster and better quality construction of the houses."

headlines: Most number of successful NEET candidates from Uttar Pradesh
text: As many as 7.14 lakh candidates have cleared the 2018 National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET), of which the highest number, 76,778, were from Uttar Pradesh. Over 72,000 and 70,000 aspirants cleared the entrance from Kerala and Maharashtra respectively. An estimated 13.36 lakh candidates had registered, however, only 12.69 lakh candidates appeared for the test.

headlines: Locals in PoK accuse Pakistani forces of land-grabbing
text: A video has surfaced online wherein locals of Kotli district in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) can be seen accusing Pakistan security forces of illegal encroachment. Locals, who were standing in a group, could be heard saying, "What is your right to do this? You first captured our estate and now you are capturing our plots. We will not leave."

headlines: 18-yr-old becomes UK's youngest convicted female ISIS terrorist
text: An 18-year-old woman, Safaa Boular, has become UK's youngest convicted female Islamic State terrorist after a court found her guilty of plotting a terror attack on the British Museum in London. She plotted the attack with UK's first all-woman terror cell. Boular was also found guilty of an earlier attempt to travel to Syria to join ISIS militants.

headlines: Death toll in Guatemala volcano eruption rises to 69
text: The death toll from the most violent eruption of Guatemala's Fuego volcano in over four decades rose to 69 on Monday. Authorities said they will have to use other anthropological methods and take DNA samples to identify those killed as "the dead have lost their features or their fingerprints". President Jimmy Morales travelled to survey the disaster area.

headlines: Russian TV channel photoshops smile onto Kim Jong-un's face
text: State-owned Russian television channel Russia-1 photoshopped a smile onto North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's face in a recent broadcast of his meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. However, the photograph released by Russia's Foreign Ministry shows Kim Jong-un unsmiling. Meanwhile, the broadcast's host said the image was not altered.

headlines: Nawazuddin responds to rumour of Taapsee rejecting film with him
text: Nawazuddin Siddiqui, while responding to reports that Taapsee Pannu rejected a thriller film over being cast with him, said he was never approached for the film. "I was never a part of any thriller film. So basically it's all baseless," he wrote. Earlier, Taapsee had also denied rumours that she rejected a film because she was paired with Nawazuddin.

headlines: Zim players stop practice, threaten boycott over unpaid fees
text: Zimbabwe cricketers have stopped attending practice sessions and have threatened to boycott the tri-series against Pakistan and Australia in July over pending salaries from Zimbabwe's cricket board. The board owes three months' salary and match fees from Zimbabwe's tour of Sri Lanka last year. India's former team manager Lalchand Rajput is set to join Zimbabwe as their coach next week.

headlines: Japan plans to launch driverless car system in Tokyo by 2020
text: Japan is planning to launch a self-driving car service in Tokyo by 2020, according to a government strategic review announced on Monday. The strategy also includes plans to allow the development of virtual power plants by the fiscal year ending March 2022. The government will then try to commercialise the system as early as 2022, as per the review.

headlines: Apple unveils latest desktop operating system macOS Mojave
text: Apple has introduced the latest version of its desktop operating system called 'macOS Mojave'. Some of its features include 'Dark Mode' that transforms the desktop to a darkened colour scheme, and 'Stacks', which organizes messy desktops by automatically stacking files into neat groups. Group FaceTime will allow users to video chat with multiple people at the same time.

headlines: Nipah virus result of tampering with nature: JP Nadda
text: Union Health Minister JP Nadda on Monday said that Nipah virus outbreak in Kerala was the result of "tampering with nature" but wasn't a man-made problem. "Every person suffering from the virus has been mapped and those in contact with such patients have been detected," the minister added. At least 16 people have died in Kerala due to the virus.

headlines: Man dies after 4 T'gana cops tie his hands, dump him on road
text: A 35-year old mentally challenged man died in Hyderabad after four policemen allegedly tied his hands and dumped him on a highway for being a nuisance. The accused had just rescued the victim from a violent mob which suspected him of being a child abductor, reports said. However, a shepherd witnessed the incident and alerted the local police.

headlines: Meghalaya to form panel for solution to Shillong violence
text: After five days of violence in Shillong, the Meghalaya government has decided to form a special committee to find a "permanent solution" for the relocation of the sweeper colony where the clashes had broken out. An altercation between a Punjabi woman and a Khasi youth had triggered the clashes, following which protestors clashed with the police as well.

headlines: Man killed over sharing family pics on WhatsApp group
text: A man was beaten to death in Haryana's Sonipat allegedly over sharing pictures he clicked with his family members on a WhatsApp group. The victim's brother said he had accidentally shared the pictures on the group, which angered one of the recipient. The accused invited the man and his family to his home and attacked them with rods and bricks.

headlines: Chidambaram gets protection from arrest in Aircel-Maxis case
text: A Delhi court has extended protection from arrest to senior Congress leader P Chidambaram till July 10 as the Enforcement Directorate sought more time to file a reply in the Aircel-Maxis case. The case relates to then Finance Minister Chidambaram approving Foreign Direct Investment of â¹3,500 crore in Aircel-Maxis deal while having the authority to approve up to â¹600 crore.

headlines: IRCTC to cut down quantity, improve quality of train meals
text: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has decided to cut down the quantity of the meals and focus on improving the quality, reports said. IRCTC will serve boneless chicken, discontinue soup, and will add a serving of dry vegetable. This comes after the Railway Board allowed the corporation to rationalise the menu instead of increasing the prices.

headlines: 31 killed on Mumbai-Pune expressway in 4 months
text: At least 31 people have been killed on the 94-km Mumbai-Pune expressway in the past four months. Most of the deaths resulted due to stationary vehicles being rammed into by other vehicles because of low visibility or high speed. As many as 55 accidents involving stationary vehicles on the expressway were reported in January and February this year.

headlines: Probe into nerve attack on ex-spy cost UK police â¹62 crore
text: The probe into the nerve agent attack on former Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia cost the UK's Wiltshire police alone more than Â£7 million (â¹62 crore).  Describing the investigation as a "national operation which must be paid for nationally", Wiltshire's crime commissioner Angus Macpherson said he has asked the central government to pay the bill.

headlines: Singapore's Gurkhas to guard Trump-Kim summit
text: Singapore police's Gurkha Contingent will guard the historic meeting between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un to be held on June 12 in the country, with khukris and assault rifles. Khukri, a heavy curved knife, is used as a traditional weapon by the Gurkhas, who have been recruited from Nepal.

headlines: Enemies will never be able to halt our nuke progress: Iran
text: Asserting that enemies of Iran will never be able to halt its nuclear progress, Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Monday said, "It is their bad dream and will not happen." He added that Iran should be prepared to increase its uranium enrichment capacity if the 2015 nuclear deal with world powers falls apart.

headlines: Thomas Cook presents USA holiday packages
text: Travel company, Thomas Cook India, has launched flight inclusive America holiday package for 10 nights starting at â¹2,62,450/- . Capture the breathtaking views of the Niagara Falls, visit Universal Studios or avail one of the exciting optional tours to Yellowstone National Park with this package including accommodation, breakfast, sightseeing and transfers as per itinerary.

headlines: Apple introduces iOS 12 for iPhones and iPads
text: Apple on Monday unveiled its latest software iOS 12 for iPhones and iPads at WWDC 2018. Some of the features include 'Do Not Disturb' that doesn't show app notifications during a pre-selected bedtime, while 'Group Notifications' allows easier clearing of notifications from the same app or topic. 'Memoji' will let users create personalised Animojis that look similar to them.

headlines: OnePlus 6 Silk White limited edition now available in India
text: The limited edition Silk White variant of OnePlus 6 is now available on Amazon.in and OnePlus.in. The glass back has been precisely polished to create a restrained elegance in both look and feel and the subtle shimmering effect is achieved using a sprinkling of pearl powder. Priced at  â¹39,999, the variant comes with 8GB RAM and 128GB internal storage.

headlines: Days on Earth getting longer as Moon is going farther: Study
text: A US-based study has found that the average day length on Earth is growing by 1/75,000 second per year, as the Moon is slowly drifting apart. Researchers also claimed Earth had a 18.7-hour rotational period 1.4 billion years ago. They further predicted the Moon would reach a stable distance when it will be visible only from one half of Earth.

headlines: Bigg Boss contestant Armaan booked for assaulting girlfriend
text: Actor and ex-Bigg Boss contestant Armaan Kohli has been booked for allegedly assaulting his live-in partner Neeru Randhawa following an argument over monetary issues. "He...banged my head against the floor...The wound was so deep that I had to undergo a surgery," said Neeru. Armaan is currently absconding and a team is searching for him, as per a senior police officer.

headlines: Govt announces â¹8,000-crore package for sugarcane farmers
text: The Centre has announced a comprehensive package of more than â¹8,000 crore to provide relief to sugarcane farmers and to clear their dues, which have crossed over â¹22,000 crore. The interventions include increase in custom duty on import of sugar, removal of custom duty on export of sugar, and the creation of buffer stock at the cost of â¹1,200 crore.

headlines: Kerala to pay medical bills of Nipah virus patients
text: The Kerala government will cover the medical expenses of the patients infected with Nipah virus in Kozhikode and Malappuram, CM Pinarayi Vijayan has said. Praising state health officials, he said that the state has been the quickest to contain the disease when compared to other countries. Kerala will provide free ration to around 2,500 people under observation, he added.

headlines: We are nuclear powers, no space for war with India: Pak Army
text: Accusing India of carrying out over 1,000 ceasefire violations since the beginning of the year, Pakistan Army spokesperson Major General Asif Ghafoor on Monday said, "We are two nuclear powers, and there is no space for war." Stating that Pakistan wished to respect the truce agreement, he added, "Our defence, our desire for peace, should not be mistaken for weakness."

headlines: Tight security in Amritsar before 'Op Blue Star' anniversary
text: Paramilitary forces and intelligence personnel have been stationed across Amritsar ahead of the 34th anniversary of Operation Blue Star. Meanwhile, a radical group has threatened to organise a shutdown in the city on June 6. The Indian Army had stormed the Golden Temple in the first week of June 1984 to kill extremist Sikh leader Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale.

headlines: I have absolute right to pardon myself: US Prez Donald Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Monday tweeted, "I have the absolute right to PARDON myself, but why would I do that when I have done nothing wrong?" This comes while he is being investigated for Russian links to his presidential election campaign. Earlier, Trump's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani had argued that the constitution "doesn't say he can't" pardon himself.

headlines: UK school bans boys from wearing shorts, allows skirts
text: A school in the UK's Oxfordshire has banned boys from wearing shorts during summers and has instead asked them to wear skirts if they find trousers uncomfortable. The school said its gender-neutral uniform policy allows only trousers or skirts as legwear. Notably, several schools in the UK have adopted gender-neutral uniform policy to protect transgender students from discrimination.

headlines: Priyanka this is anti-national, Twitter user slams Quantico
text: Slamming Priyanka Chopra's American TV show 'Quantico', a Twitter user wrote, "This is real anti national." The tweet referred to the latest episode where 'Indian nationalists' were reportedly shown framing Pakistan for trying to blow up Manhattan in New York. "Couldn't Priyanka ask the 'Quantico' team to change the narrative," asked another user while adding, "I'm truly ashamed of Priyanka."

headlines: Reference to Madhuri deleted from 'Sanju' on request: Report
text: A scene in the upcoming film 'Sanju', where actress Madhuri Dixit has been referred to, was removed on the actress' insistence, as per reports. Director Rajkumar Hirani reportedly shot a scene where Ranbir Kapoor as Sanjay Dutt makes a call to her after his arrest. Sanjay and Madhuri were rumoured to be in a relationship in the early '90s.

headlines: Heard stories of sexual harassment in B'wood, says Taapsee
text: Taapsee Pannu has said that she has heard stories of sexual harassment in Bollywood but she herself has not faced any sexual harassment, otherwise she would've probably helped voicing it. "It is not that it does not happen, it does...People probably aren't ready to openly talk about it because there are a lot of taboos attached to it," she added.

headlines: Moon of my life Emilia: GOT's Khal Drogo actor on co-star
text: 'Game of Thrones' actor Jason Momoa, who played the role of Khal Drogo in the show, shared a short clip on Instagram with his co-star Emilia Clarke who plays his wife Daenerys Targaryen, captioning it, "Moon of my life." Emilia too posted a picture of both of them where Jason can be seen carrying her.

headlines: Haven't gone home in a year, miss family a lot: Rashid Khan
text: Afghanistan's 19-year-old leg-spinner Rashid Khan, who is currently in Dehradun for the T20I series against Bangladesh, said he has "not gone home in a year" and that he misses his "family a lot". "I try to (be in) the best possible frame of mind to give good performance...so that troubled people back home get something to cheer about," he added.

headlines: Chhetri scores chip-goal over the keeper in India's 3-0 win
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri scored with a chip from outside the goalkeeping area in the 92nd minute in India's 3-0 win over Kenya in Mumbai on Monday. Chhetri, who scored a brace in the match, made a run after a through ball from Balwant Singh and took a single touch before chipping it over the goalkeeper.

headlines: Gopichand training Saina, Sindhu at separate venues post CWG
text: Coach Pullela Gopichand is training PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal at different centres of his academy since the two players are reportedly not comfortable with each other following their gold medal match in the Commonwealth Games 2018. "In the interest of the players, our coaching team has taken this decision," Gopichand said on being asked about the different training venues.

headlines: England fined â¹14 lakh as player sips non-sponsored drink
text: FIFA has handed a â¹14-lakh fine to England's Football Association after an England player drank a non-sponsored drink during a match. An England player was seen sipping the non-sponsored drink during England's Under-20 World Cup campaign last year. FA will register an official complaint as FIFA earlier fined Russia just â¹20 lakh over 'monkey chants' directed at French players.

headlines: BJP seeks action against channel for slandering Mizoram Guv
text: BJP has written to Mizoram Chief Secretary Arvind Ray seeking action against Manorama News for allegedly slandering newly-appointed Governor Kummanam Rajasekharan on the day of his swearing-in ceremony. BJP alleged that the news channel played an audio clip synchronised with visuals of BJP President Amit Shah, which implied that Shah was insulting Kummanam by saying "every dog has his day".

headlines: Unknown dinosaur skeleton sold for â¹15 crore in Paris
text: A 70% complete skeleton of an unidentified dinosaur was sold for â¬2 million (â¹15.7 crore) at the Eiffel Tower in Paris on Monday. The bones of what scientists believe to be "probably a new species" of the carnivorous allosaurus were discovered at Wyoming, US, in 2013. The 9-metre-long, 2.6-metre-high dinosaur lived during the late Jurassic period 150 million years ago.

headlines: TN girl commits suicide after failing NEET on 2nd attempt
text: A 17-year-old girl was found dead in Tamil Nadu hours after she failed her second attempt at NEET, the results of which were declared on Monday. Police suspect that she may have committed suicide by consuming rat poison. Last year, 17-year-old S Anitha had committed suicide after failing to clear NEET, leading to widespread protests in Tamil Nadu.

headlines: Minorities now fear for their safety: Goa-Daman Archbishop
text: In a letter addressed to Christians, Archbishop of Goa and Daman Father Filipe Neri Ferrao wrote, "Human rights are under attack and democracy appears to be in peril...various minorities fear for their safety." "Our Constitution is in danger...as the general elections are fast approaching, we must strive to know our constitution better and work harder to protect it," he added.

headlines: Delhi records 52.8% rise in drunk driving cases this year
text: Delhi has recorded a 52.8% increase in drunk driving cases in 2018 as compared to last year, according to police records. Between January and May this year, as many as 15,450 motorists  were prosecuted for drunk driving and over 7,000 vehicles impounded or seized. Over 80% accidents due to drunken driving occur between 1 am and 4 am, officials said.

headlines: Jet Airways crew help man suffering heart attack onboard
text: Jet Airways crew helped in saving a man's life who collapsed after suffering a heart attack onboard a Mumbai-Kolkata flight recently. The man had suffered the attack an hour after the departure, following which the crew rushed to his aid and the flight was taken back to Mumbai for proper medical treatment. The crew was lauded for their quick decision-making.

headlines: Chhetri scores twice in his 100th match as India beat Kenya
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri marked his 100th international appearance with two goals in India's 3-0 victory over Kenya in the Intercontinental Cup on Monday. Chhetri, who is the third best active international goal-scorer after Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi, has now scored 61 international goals. Notably, all the tickets for the match were sold out following Chhetri's plea.

headlines: Who is Kalpana Kumari, the 18-year-old topper of NEET 2018?
text: Bihar's 18-year-old Kalpana Kumari, who attended coaching classes in Delhi, got 691 out of 720 marks or 99.99 percentile to top CBSE's NEET 2018. She appeared for Class 12 board examination conducted by Bihar board this year. "She wishes to get into AIIMS, Delhi. Her second preference is Maulana Azad Medical College, Delhi," her sister said.

headlines: FBI agent drops gun during backflip, accidentally shoots man
text: An off-duty FBI agent dropped his gun while performing a backflip on the dance floor at a bar in US' Denver and accidentally shot a man. The bullet hit the leg of a man who was rushed to a hospital and is reportedly stable. A 32-second video of the incident was widely shared on social media.

headlines: First legal bare-knuckle fighting c'ship held after 130 yrs
text: The first-ever sanctioned and legal bare-knuckle boxing championship was held in USA's Wyoming on Saturday after a gap of nearly 130 years. The matches, which featured former MMA and underground bare-knuckle fighters, saw several bloodied faces and an 18-second knockout. Out of all the matches held at the event, only one match featured women fighters.

headlines: Rahul accuses PM of giving scripted interview in Singapore
text: Congress President Rahul Gandhi on Monday claimed that the interviews given by PM Narendra Modi on public platforms were pre-scripted. He also tweeted a video of PM Modi's interview in Singapore, wherein the person translating PM Modi's answers read out information which was not included in the Prime Minister's speech. Rahul claimed PM Modi's spontaneous response would be an "embarrassment".

headlines: Maharashtra police stop 2 Cong MLAs from burning themselves
text: Maharashtra Police on Monday stopped Congress MLAs Virendra Jagtap and Yashmomati Thaku from setting fire to themselves. They were leading a "silent mocha" against the district administration after it failed to reply to the party's demand of urging the government to procure pulses from farmers. Police officials dressed in civilian clothes stopped the MLAs before they poured kerosene on themselves.

headlines: 1,000 jawans to be deployed in Shillong amid violence
text: The Centre has agreed to deploy around 1,000 security personnel of paramilitary forces in Meghalaya's Shillong amid violence and communal tension in the capital. Police were forced to use tear gas against protestors after they toppled police vehicles and assaulted a cop on Sunday. The clashes were triggered after a Khasi bus conductor was assaulted last week.

headlines: TN to release 67 life-term convicts who have served 10 years
text: The Tamil Nadu government on Monday announced its decision to release 67 life-term prisoners, who have served at least 10 years in jail. The move is aimed to commemorate the 100th birth anniversary of late Chief Minister MG Ramachandran. Governor Banwarilal Purohit will approve the proposed releases after reviewing each case based on the convict's criminal and health records.

headlines: Eatery owner shot dead in row over bill of â¹190
text: The 40-year-old owner of an eatery near Kolkata was shot dead on Sunday after asking a customer named Mohammad Firoz to pay earlier dues of â¹190. Firoz and three others asked the eatery owner for biriyani but refused to pay, claiming he was overcharging. Following this, he asked them to clear their earlier dues and this led to an altercation.

headlines: Complaint against Minister for calling farmer protest stunt
text: Social activist Tamanna Hashmi has filed a complaint against Union Agriculture Minister Radha Mohan Singh for calling the ongoing farmers' protest a means to grab media attention. Hashmi said that the comments made by the minister were an insult to the farmers. Farmers across seven states are on strike, demanding minimum support price and implementation of Swaminathan Commission recommendations.

headlines: 13 people killed during first monsoon weekend in Maharashtra
text: As many as 13 people died in separate incidents, ten of which were cases of drowning, during the first monsoon weekend in Maharashtra. Five people, including a family of four, drowned at a beach in Ratnagiri, while two cousins from Thane drowned when they accidentally walked into a ditch of water. Three others were electrocuted in separate incidents on Saturday.

headlines: Highly dangerous phase of Nipah outbreak over: Kerala govt
text: The Kerala Health Department has said the highly dangerous phase of Nipah virus outbreak is over. Reportedly, no one has been infected with the virus since May 17 and the second phase, which was likely to take place after May 20, has not occurred. Health Minister KK Shyalaja said vigilance against the disease will continue till June 30.

headlines: Bombing at Afghan clerics meet that banned suicide bombing
text: At least 14 people have been killed in a suicide bomb explosion targeting a gathering of the Afghan Ulema Council, shortly after the country's top religious body issued a fatwa declaring suicide attacks "haram". The council had called on the Afghan government forces and the Taliban to halt the ongoing conflict and agree on a ceasefire.

headlines: Relationship becomes tough when member sues us: COAI on Jio
text: Telecom industry body COAI has said that issues with Jio could have been resolved through dialogue as a lawsuit against the association makes a good relationship difficult with the member. Jio sued COAI and its Director General Rajan Mathews for defamation. COAI in a press statement in September 2016 said that Jio entered the sector as a "back door operator".

headlines: Kareena's wedding dress in Veere Di Wedding made 25 yrs ago
text: Kareena Kapoor Khan's wedding dress in 'Veere Di Wedding', which was designed by designer duo Abu Jani and Sandeep Khosla, was made 25 years ago. "It was lying in our coffers...(producer) Rhea Kapoor came to the factory and we started...taking out old pieces," said Sandeep. While the skirt and blouse remained the same, the dupatta was created and modernised slightly.

headlines: Suniel to plan something for me: Viral video's 'dancing uncle'
text: Sanjeev Shrivastava, who has been dubbed as 'dancing uncle' on social media after his video went viral, said that he met actor Suniel Shetty while adding, "He told me he will plan something for me soon." Sanjeev, who also met actress Neelam, added, "She congratulated me for having brought the song alive after so long."

headlines: Planning to bring back Bobby as Greek God in film: Salman
text: Talking about finalising the right film for Bobby Deol, Salman Khan said, "I am personally looking into the story...locking the director for the film. The script will bring Bobby back as a Greek God." Salman further said, "If Bobby thought he worked hard for 'Race 3', he does not know what is coming."

headlines: Goalie 'fakes' injury to let teammates break Ramadan fast
text: Tunisia's goalkeeper Mouez Hassen allegedly faked an injury to let his teammates break their Ramadan fast during their side's pre-World Cup friendly match against Turkey. During the break in play, the players were seen eating dates, drinking water and energy drinks before continuing play. Reports claim that players have an understanding between them about the fake injury.

headlines: Goats with the GOAT, tweets user on Messi's pics with goats
text: Reacting to five-time Ballon d'Or-winner Lionel Messi's magazine photo shoot with goats, a user tweeted, "Goats with the GOAT (Greatest of All Time)." "Why's Messi holding Ronaldo?" another user wrote. Other tweets read, "Imagine taking pictures with goats to prove you're the GOAT," and "When will you make Ronaldo do a photo shoot with dolphin?"

headlines: Nadal wins 900th match to enter 12th French Open quarters
text: World number one Rafael Nadal on Monday defeated Germany's Maximilian Marterer in straight sets to register his 900th career win and enter the French Open quarter-finals for the 12th time. Nadal is only the second active and fifth male player overall to register 900 wins in the Open Era. Nadal will face world number 12 Diego Schwartzman in the quarter-finals.

headlines: KXIP's Mayank Agarwal ties the knot with girlfriend Aashita
text: Kings XI Punjab and Karnataka batsman Mayank Agarwal has tied the knot with his long-time girlfriend Aashita Sood. The 27-year-old, who scored over 2,000-plus runs in the last domestic season, had proposed to Aashita in December 2017 at the London Eye. Kings XI Punjab opener KL Rahul was among the attendees at the wedding.

headlines: Brendon McCullum returns to rugby after a gap of 18 years
text: Former New Zealand cricket captain Brendon McCullum returned to play rugby after a gap of 18 years. McCullum, who was considered to be a sportsman in multiple disciplines in school, played for the United Matamata B team in the local derby. The 36-year-old also suffered a groin injury during the match.

headlines: Chandigarh rape survivor attacked on her way to court
text: A 25-year-old rape survivor was hospitalised today after two motorcycle-borne assailants threw an acid-like substance on her while she was on her way to a Chandigarh court. The police said she did not receive severe injuries but was being treated for burning in the eyes. She had accused a Jammu youth of raping her at a hotel last year.

headlines: Man posts pro-Pak comments from neighbour's FB account, held
text: A trader was arrested by Assam Police on Monday for allegedly posting communally sensitive and pro-Pakistan comments from the Facebook account of his neighbour to spite him. After the comments were shared on Ahedul Ali's page, his shop was burned down and he was briefly detained. The police later tracked down the IP address and arrested shop owner Jyotish Nath.

headlines: Man shot dead for opposing eve-teasing of his daughter
text: A 65-year-old man was shot dead by two youths for opposing their attempts to sexually harass his daughter, the Uttar Pradesh Police said on Monday. The deceased and the youth are residents of the same locality, and a search has been launched to nab the accused. The incident occurred in the Rampuri area in Muzaffarnagar.

headlines: US air strikes in Syria kill 12 members of same family
text: US-led coalition air strikes on the Islamic State militant group killed 12 members of the same family last week, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights has said. The coalition had admitted that its air strikes have "unintentionally" killed nearly 900 civilians in Syria and Iraq. Around 3.5 lakh people have been killed in Syrian war since it started in 2011.

headlines: Indian football team's match sold out after Chhetri's plea
text: All the tickets for India's football match against Kenya today in Mumbai have been sold out, two days after Indian skipper Sunil Chhetri posted a video urging people to show up for matches in stadiums. The stadium, which has a capacity of around 18,000, also hosted India's last match which had only 2,500 spectators, following which Chhetri posted the video.

headlines: Microsoft buys world's largest coding platform GitHub for $7.5 bn
text: Technology major Microsoft today announced the acquisition of the world's largest collaborative coding platform GitHub for $7.5 billion in an all-stock deal. Founded in 2008, GitHub has never turned profitable till date and was trying for nine months to find a new CEO.  Microsoft's Corporate VP Nat Friedman will become GitHubâs new CEO after the acquisition closes later this year.

headlines: UPSC aspirant denied entry to exam hall, commits suicide
text: A 28-year-old UPSC aspirant allegedly committed suicide in Delhi's Rajendra Nagar on Sunday after he was denied entry into the examination hall for arriving late. Police reportedly found a suicide note at his residence which read, "The rules are fine but there should be some leniency." An investigation into the incident is underway.

headlines: Google translates 'I am flat-earther' to 'I am crazy person'
text: Google Translate converts 'I am a flat-earther' to 'Je suis un fou' in French which translates to 'I am a crazy person' in English. A Google spokesperson explained that it was an 'error' and the company was working on a fix. 'Flat-earther' is used for people who believe the Earth is not spherical but shaped like a plane or disk.

headlines: 'Veere Di...' becomes 2018's 5th highest 1st weekend grosser
text: Kareena Kapoor Khan and Sonam Kapoor starrer 'Veere Di Wedding' has replaced Alia Bhatt starrer 'Raazi' to become this year's fifth highest opening weekend grosser with a collection of â¹36.52 crore. 'Raazi' had earned â¹30.83 crore as its first weekend collection. Meanwhile, Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh starrer 'Padmaavat' continues to be the top opening weekend grosser of 2018.

headlines: Serena pulls out of French Open ahead of Sharapova match
text: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has pulled out of the French Open with pectoral injury, an hour before she was set to play five-time Grand Slam champion Maria Sharapova in the Round of 16 on Monday. "I love playing (against) Maria...It's extremely disappointing," Serena said. The 36-year-old American had beaten Sharapova in each of their previous 18 matches.

headlines: Heli-taxis launched to cut Shimla-Chandigarh travel time to 20 min
text: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Monday flagged off a helicopter taxi service that will reduce the travel time between Shimla and Chandigarh to 20 minutes, against the nearly 3.5 hours by road. The service, operated by Pawan Hans, can accommodate 19 persons on each sortie and will charge â¹2,999 per person.

headlines: Over 2,600 people committed suicide in 2015 due to exams
text: As many as 2,646 people committed suicide in 2015 due to "failure in examination," according to data released by the National Crime Records Bureau. The deceased accounted for 2% of all suicides in 2015. The number was slightly lower in 2014, with 2,403 people killing themselves after failing their exams.

headlines: Delighted to be back home: Jaitley after kidney transplant
text: After undergoing a kidney transplant, Union Minister Arun Jaitley on Monday tweeted, "Delighted to be back at Home." Expressing gratitude towards doctors and medical staff for looking after him for over three weeks, he thanked his friends and colleagues for wishing for his recovery. Railways Minister Piyush Goyal had been given additional charge of Finance Ministry till Jaitley recovers.

headlines: Test confirms jawan from Kerala did not die of Nipah virus
text: Test result from the National Institute of Virology in Pune has confirmed that the 27-year-old jawan from Kerala, who recently passed away in Kolkata, did not die due to Nipah virus infection. The soldier's health had begun failing after he had gone to Kerala on a one-month leave. This prompted suspicion that his death was caused by the virus.

headlines: Cop injured as cow smugglers open fire at Rajasthan Police
text: A police officer has sustained injuries after cow smugglers opened fire at the police in Rajasthan's Bharatpur district on Sunday. The incident occurred when police stopped the truck which was being used to smuggle over 20 cows. Both accused have been arrested and police said one of the men was accused of murder earlier.

headlines: WCD Ministry reveals Air India sexual harassment victim's name
text: In violation of norms, the Women and Child Development Ministry revealed a sexual harassment victim's name in its press note after she met Union Minister Maneka Gandhi. The victim, an air hostess working for Air India, alleged she was sexually harassed by a senior executive for six years. The note was later replaced with a version without the name.

headlines: Jharkhand woman starves to death after no food for 3 days
text: A 59-year-old woman from Jharkhand's Dumri allegedly starved to death on Sunday after she didn't get food for at least three days. District officials said that the woman died due to the negligence of authorities, who failed to provide her with a ration card. Dumri MLA Jagarnath Mahto said he will raise the matter in the Assembly.

headlines: Video: 98-year-old China house moved 54m, rotated 90 degrees
text: A 98-year-old house was moved nearly 54 metres and rotated 90 degree to make room for a commercial building in China's Shanghai. The displacement process began in April and parts of the building were reinforced to ensure it survived the relocation. The contractor revealed that the building was moved by computer-controlled hydraulic machines along a guide rail.

headlines: IDBI Bank CEO Mahesh Jain appointed RBI Deputy Governor
text: The government has appointed IDBI Bank's Managing Director and CEO Mahesh Kumar Jain as a Deputy Governor at the RBI. Jain, who has more than 30 years of experience in banking, has previously served as the CEO of state-run Indian Bank. The post of RBI Deputy Governor fell vacant after SS Mundra retired at the end of July 2017.

headlines: I'm working harder because the newcomers are so good: Salman
text: Actor Salman Khan has said that he is working harder because the newcomers are quite good at what they do. He added, "Today, I think keeping up with the juniors and their fan-following is ten times harder." Salman further said, "We are going to give the younger ones a hard time, but it is not easy."

headlines: My kids Nysa, Yug have been amazing teachers to me: Kajol
text: Kajol has said that both her children Nysa and Yug have been amazing teachers to her. She added, "I learn a lot from my kids... My daughter gives me super one-liners...and it makes so much sense." She further said Nysa and Yug have the ability to give her a new perspective on conversations.

headlines: Younis apologises for cutting Akram's b'day cake in Ramadan
text: Former Pakistani captain Waqar Younis on Monday took to Twitter to apologise for cutting cake on ex-captain Wasim Akram's birthday during Ramadan on Sunday. "We should've respected Ramadan and the people who were fasting...It was a poor act on our behalf," Younis wrote. Pakistani sports anchor Zainab Abbas had shared pictures of Akram's birthday celebrations on Twitter.

headlines: Man books entire stand after Chhetri's plea for support
text: Mumbai-based YouTuber Nikunj Lotia has booked an entire stand at the Mumbai Football Arena for Indian football team's match against Kenya on Monday. Nikunj requested fans to contact him for tickets and said he would give away 150 free tickets for the match. This comes after captain Sunil Chhetri urged Indians to watch their matches from the stadiums.

headlines: What is the longest Kohli has run, heaviest he has lifted?
text: Indian captain Virat Kohli has revealed that the longest he has run is for 20 minutes at 14 kmph, while the heaviest weight he has ever lifted is 145 kg deadlift. The 29-year-old said he feels like he is currently the fittest he has ever been and added that he does not look up to anyone for fitness.

headlines: PM ne desh ko topi pehna di: Cong on PM Modi's mosque visit
text: After PM Narendra Modi visited a mosque in Singapore, Congress leader Kamal Nath said, "Jis aadmi ne pure desh ko topi pehna di, woh khud topi pehne ya na pehne kya matlab." Nath's remarks came in response to a reporter's query about PM Modi not wearing skull caps in India but doing so when he is abroad.

headlines: Both K'taka, TN farmers important: K'taka CM on Cauvery row
text: After meeting actor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan over the Cauvery Water Management Board, Karnataka CM Kumaraswamy said, "Both Karnataka and Tamil Nadu farmers are important." Meanwhile, Haasan said several lawyers advised him that the dispute between the two states should be settled outside court. The Supreme Court in February reduced Tamil Nadu's share of Cauvery water.

headlines: 6-year-old girl's body found in pit, police suspect rape
text: A six-year-old daughter of a migrant labourer was found with her throat slit and blood on her private parts at a Haryana farmhouse on Sunday. "In the preliminary investigations, it seems a case of murder after rape," the police said. An investigation is ongoing, and the police suspect the perpetrator could be one of the labourers living inside the farmhouse.

headlines: Hyd man gets duped of â¹30 lakh on false promise of job in US
text: A man in Hyderabad was allegedly duped of â¹30 lakh on the pretext of a job at a five-star hotel in the US. He received the offer on a job portal and was asked to pay the money as fees for his application. He deposited the money in bank accounts that police believe are operated by a Nigerian national.

headlines: Jagannath temple treasury keys disappear, govt orders probe
text: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Monday ordered a judicial probe into the disappearance of the keys of the inner chambers of the Jagannath Temple's treasury. It had earlier emerged that keys of the chambers which were last opened in 1984 were missing. Meanwhile, the BJP and Congress slammed the government for alleged negligence towards the development of the 12th-century temple.

headlines: Cousin raped, blackmailed me for Canada residency: NRI girl
text: An 18-year-old NRI woman has claimed she was raped by her Punjab-based cousin and blackmailed into marriage because he wanted to get permanent residency in Canada.
