She claimed the accused and his family sedated her before the rape following which they used a video of the incident to blackmail her. Police booked the accused, who now resides in Australia.

headlines: Syria Prez to become 1st int'l leader to meet Kim in N Korea
text: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad plans to visit North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, North Korean state media said on Sunday. He will become the first head of state to meet Jong-un in North Korea since he came to power in 2011. Praising the North Korean leader, Assad said recent developments on the Korean peninsula were a result of Jong-un's "wise leadership".

headlines: Bihar's Kalpana Kumari tops NEET 2018 with 99.99 percentile
text: Bihar's Kalpana Kumari has topped the medical entrance exam NEET 2018 with a percentile of 99.99. She scored 171 out of 180 in Physics, 160 out of 180 in Chemistry and 360 out of 360 in Biology (Biology and Zoology). Over 13 lakh candidates had registered for the exam, out of which 6.34 lakh candidates were able to pass it.

headlines: Asteroid spotted hours before impact, burns up over Africa
text: A boulder-sized asteroid designated '2018 LA' was spotted hours before impact on Saturday by NASA-funded Catalina Sky Survey in Arizona. The asteroid entered Earth's atmosphere at a speed of 17 kilometres per second and burned up several miles above South Africa, creating a bright fireball in the sky. The asteroid was estimated to be about 2 metres across.

headlines: 'Makdee' actress Shweta confirms she's engaged to boyfriend
text: 'Makdee' actress Shweta Basu Prasad has confirmed that she is engaged to her longtime boyfriend, director Rohit Mittal. Shweta and Rohit have been in a relationship for around four years and she proposed to him in Goa, as per reports. They have worked together in some short films and were reportedly introduced to each other by director Anurag Kashyap.

headlines: Jolie made film debut at 7 as onscreen daughter of her father
text: Actress-filmmaker Angelina Jolie made her onscreen debut when she was 7 in a brief role in the 1982 film 'Lookin' to Get Out', where she played the onscreen daughter of her real-life father Jon Voight. He also played her onscreen father in 'Lara Croft: Tomb Raider'. Jolie has won an Oscar and three Golden Globe Awards in her film career.

headlines: SpaceX launches communications satellite on Falcon 9 rocket
text: Elon Musk-led space exploration startup SpaceX on Monday launched its pre-flown Falcon 9 rocket, carrying the SES-12 satellite to a Geostationary Transfer Orbit (GTO). The satellite, which was deployed about 32 minutes after liftoff, will provide data and video services throughout the Asia-Pacific region. However, SpaceX did not attempt to recover Falcon 9's first stage after launch.

headlines: Nitish Kumar to be NDA's face in Bihar for 2019 polls: JD(U)
text: JD(U) National General Secretary Pavan Varma has said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will be the face of the NDA for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections in Bihar, adding, "JD(U) is the largest constituent of the coalition." He further said, "Kumar is the tallest leader and BJP, LJP and RLSP will have to approach the Lok Sabha polls under his leadership."

headlines: Kolkata man crashes Ferrari on flyover at 150kmph, dies on spot
text: A Kolkata-based businessman died and a girl was injured after a â¹3-crore Ferrari they were driving crashed into a wall reportedly while trying to avoid a slowing truck on a flyover in Howrah. Reports said he had been driving the supercar at 150 kmph. The man died on the spot after waiting for an hour to be rescued.

headlines: CBSE declares results of medical entrance exam NEET 2018
text: The CBSE on Monday declared the results of the medical entrance exam National Eligibility Entrance Test (NEET) 2018. More than 13.2 lakh candidates had registered for exam, which was conducted on May 6 across 2,255 examination centres in the country. Earlier, the Supreme Court had refused to put a stay on the declaration of the results.

headlines: 1400 people under house quarantine in Kerala over Nipah virus
text: Over 1,400 people have been put under quarantine in their own homes amid the Nipah virus outbreak in Kerala, an official said. They have been asked to report any symptoms of the virus to health officials. At least 18 people in the state have died due to the virus, including a nurse who treated Nipah virus patients.

headlines: Kerala MLA wears mask, gloves to Assembly over Nipah outbreak
text: Indian Union Muslim League MLA Parakkal Abdulla attended the Kerala Assembly on Monday wearing a mask and gloves to highlight the impact of the Nipah virus. Abdulla said this was a symbolic gesture as everyone in Kozhikode was wearing masks. He was slammed by CM Pinarayi Vijayan for "trivialising" the issue, while Health Minister KK Shailaja called the act "ridiculous."

headlines: Good times over, pack your bags: Italy to illegal migrants
text: Warning that the good times for illegal migrants are over, Italian Interior Minister Matteo Salvini on Sunday said that they should pack their bags. Adding that Italy cannot be Europe's refugee camp, Salvini said, "It's too costly to keep them in Italy...I think it's better to spend money in the countries of origin."

headlines: Insulting that US considers Canada security threat: Trudeau
text: Slamming tariffs imposed by the US on metal imports from the country, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has said that it is "insulting" that the US considers Canada a national security threat. Trudeau added that Canada would impose direct reciprocal tariffs on the US in retaliation. Meanwhile, the White House said the Canadian Prime Minister was "overreacting".

headlines: Nuclear disarmament group offers to pay for Trump-Kim summit
text: Nobel Prize-winning nuclear disarmament group ICAN has offered to pay for the cost of the summit between US President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. "This is a historic meeting, and once in a generation opportunity," ICAN said. This comes amid reports that cash-strapped North Korea may have trouble bearing the cost of the summit.

headlines: 94% of IT graduates not fit for hiring: Tech Mahindra CEO
text: Highlighting the widening skill gap in the IT industry, Tech Mahindra CEO CP Gurnani has said 94% of engineering graduates were not fit for hiring. He added that the responsibility for skill development and training graduates to be ready for the market is shifting onto the industry. Gurnani also said that the current infrastructure is creating more people for unemployment.

headlines: Reliance Jio begins hiring AI team under Akash Ambani
text: Reliance Jio has started hiring a team of professionals under Akash Ambani to work on Artificial Intelligence (AI), according to reports. Apart from AI, the telecom firm is reportedly looking for people who can work on blockchain and machine learning. In May, the Mukesh Ambani-led company launched 'JioInteract', an AI-based brand engagement video platform.

headlines: Afghanistan pacer breaks stump into two against Bangladesh
text: Afghanistan pacer Shapoor Zadran's delivery to Bangladesh's Rubel Hossain broke the leg stump into two during the first T20I between the two sides on Sunday. Hossain, who was facing his first delivery, tried to stay back and took a swing at the delivery but missed. This was Zadran's second bowled dismissal in the same over.

headlines: Rohit's 'first pitch' goes wrong, throws ball over catcher
text: Rohit Sharma on Sunday became the first Indian cricketer to throw the ceremonial 'first pitch' in a Major League Baseball match, achieving the feat ahead of the match between Seattle Mariners and Tampa BayÂ Rays. However, Rohit couldn't throw the ball with accuracy as it went over the catcher. Rohit was seen holding his head in disappointment after the throw.

headlines: Table Tennis player switches hands during rally, wins point
text: German table tennis player Timo Boll switched hands during a rally and still managed to win the point during the 2018 ITTF World Tour China Open. Boll, who is a left-handed player, switched to his right hand for one shot, keeping the ball in play and eventually winning the point two shots later. Boll is currently world number three.

headlines: I cried for four days after ball-tampering scandal: Smith
text: Former Australian captain Steve Smith has revealed that he "spent four days in tears" after the ball-tampering scandal in the Cape Town Test, that led to him being banned for a year. "I was really struggling mentally. It certainly was the toughest thing that I've had to do," he added. Smith will feature in Global T20 Canada later this month.

headlines: India restrict Thailand to 66/8, win by 66 runs in Asia Cup
text: India restricted Thailand to 66/8 in 20 overs to win the match by 66 runs in the Women's T20 Asia Cup at Kuala Lumpur on Monday. The victory was India's second successive in the tournament, after having defeated Malaysia by 142 runs in their opening match. Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur was named Player of the Match for her all-round show.

headlines: Amazon delivery firms face legal action over workers' rights
text: Two delivery drivers are taking legal action against Amazon's three delivery firms, claiming they were dismissed for complaining about working practices. The GMB union, representing the drivers, claimed they work overtime, wait long periods to load their vans, and were not being paid as entitled. Further, Amazon has been accused of classifying them as self-employed despite having proper shifts.

headlines: BJP door open for rebel AAP leader Kapil Mishra: Minister
text: Union Minister Vijay Goel on Sunday said that BJP's doors are open for suspended AAP leader Kapil Mishra. Adding that he has known Mishra since before he was an AAP leader and saw that he was a good man who is not afraid to fight for what's right, Goel said, "We need friends like Kapil Mishra."

headlines: People have understood BJP does not mean business: Akhilesh
text: Claiming BJP makes empty promises, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said, "With empty stomach, people have now understood that the BJP does not mean business." Akhilesh slammed BJP for accusing the party of practising minority appeasement while adding, "Modi has just visited Indonesia and Malaysia during the month of Ramzan. Is it an attempt towards 'international appeasement' of the Muslims?"

headlines: Punjab asks Centre for â¹2,100cr for Guru Nanak's 550th anniv
text: In a letter to PM Narendra Modi, Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has sought â¹2,145 crore for infrastructure projects and special programmes to commemorate Guru Nanak's 550th birth anniversary in 2019. This includes â¹875 crore to develop infrastructure in four historic towns, â¹350 crore for an educational institute and â¹500 crore for a hospital in the name of Guru Nanak.

headlines: Delhi govt proposes vocational training course for beggars
text: Delhi's Social Welfare Department is planning to introduce a vocational skill development programme for people staying at government beggar homes. Under the programme, beggars will be trained in tailoring, handicrafts, and other skills and provided with â¹250 per day to ensure their sustenance. Further, those who successfully complete the course will get relevant kits, such as sewing machines.

headlines: Won't sign any US trade deal if it's not in our interest: UK
text: UK Secretary of State for International Trade Liam Fox has said the country won't sign any trade deal with the US following Brexit if it is not in its own interest. This follows the US decision to impose tariffs on metal imports from the EU, Mexico and Canada. Fox had asked the US to reconsider its decision, calling it unlawful.

headlines: Rashid Khan sets world record with his 1st ball of the match
text: Afghanistan's 19-year-old spinner Rashid Khan became the world's fastest cricketer to reach 50 wickets in T20I cricket after reaching the milestone with a wicket on his first ball of the match against Bangladesh on Sunday. Rashid, who bettered Pakistani spinner Saeed Ajmal's record, also picked a wicket with his second ball and ended the match with 3/13 in 3 overs.

headlines: Three astronauts return to Earth after 168 days in space
text: After spending 168 days aboard the International Space Station, NASA astronaut Scott Tingle, Japan's Norishige Kanai and Russian cosmonaut Anton Shkaplerov landed in Kazakhstan on Sunday. While Tingle and Kanai conducted separate spacewalks, Shkaplerov did a record-setting 8-hour-long spacewalk. It was Tingle and Kanai's first mission, while Shkaplerov has logged 532 days on three flights.

headlines: Scientific study to be done on Taj Mahal to determine colour
text: Union Culture and Environment Minister Mahesh Sharma has announced that a scientific study called colour stereography will be done on the Taj Mahal to determine its exact colour. "We have original photographs of the monument that are 100 years old and the same will be compared to pictures taken after cleaning the monument to measure the changes," Sharma said.

headlines: 7 arrested for spreading fake news on Nipah virus in Kerala
text: Police have arrested seven people in Kerala's Kozhikode for forwarding fake news about the spread of Nipah virus through WhatsApp. A Junior Health Inspector also lodged a complaint about rumours that his staff had contracted the virus. Further, a fake message being spread in the Health Department's name stating that the virus has been found in chickens is being investigated.

headlines: World must stand up to US 'bullying': Iran Foreign Minister
text: Amid efforts to save the 2015 nuclear deal after US exit, Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif on Sunday said that the world should stand up to US' bullying behaviour. Zarif called on the remaining signatories of the nuclear deal and other trade partners to make up for Iran's losses caused by the US exit.

headlines: Trump probably has power to pardon himself: US Prez lawyer
text: US President Donald Trump's lawyer Rudy Giuliani on Sunday said that the President probably has the power to pardon himself in the Russia probe. However, he further said that Trump has no intention of pardoning himself, adding that such a course of action would lead to impeachment. Earlier, Giuliani had said that a sitting President cannot be indicted.

headlines: Mumbai woman shares OTP 28 times, loses â¹7 lakh
text: A 40-year-old woman from Navi Mumbai lost nearly â¹7 lakh after sharing her one-time password (OTP) 28 times with a fraudster. The incident occurred between May 17 and 23 when she received a call from the fraudster who claimed to be an SBI manager. She learnt that nobody from the bank called her when she went to update her passbook.

headlines: Govt firms to conduct board meetings at tourist places
text: In a bid to promote tourism, state-owned companies will soon conduct board meetings, conferences and strategic meetings at tourist spots, according to an official statement. The Tourism Ministry has suggested five places namely Ajanta-Ellora, Hampi, Bodh Gaya, Mahabalipuram and Khajuraho. The move comes following a suggestion by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

headlines: Govt may merge 4 banks to create India's second-largest bank
text: The government is reportedly planning to merge at least four state-run banks including IDBI Bank, Bank of Baroda, Central Bank of India, and Oriental Bank of Commerce. The merged entity would become India's second-largest bank after SBI, with combined assets of â¹16.58 trillion. The government is also planning to sell 51% stake in IDBI Bank for â¹9,000-10,000 crore, reports said.

headlines: Indian economy like a car with 3 flat tyres: P Chidambaram
text: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram has said the Indian economy has become like a car whose three tyres are punctured. He called private investment, private consumption, exports, and government expenditure as the four engines of an economy with three of them being "punctured" in India's case. Government expenditure is on only in healthcare and some other amenities, he added.

headlines: 'A Band Of Boys' to make a comeback with new album
text: 'A Band Of Boys', a popular Indian band, is set to make a comeback with a new album. They will unveil the first song during a live performance on June 11 in Mumbai. The yet-to-be-revealed track is a recreation of one of their original songs. However, band members Sudhanshu Pandey and Siddharth Haldipur won't be part of the comeback.

headlines: Symonds is misunderstood, not arrogant at all: Chahal
text: Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has revealed that he shares a "great bond" with former Australian all-rounder Andrew Symonds who he considers is "misunderstood". Chahal, who met Symonds in IPL 2011, said, "You get to know the real Andrew Symonds when you spend some time with him. He... even danced with me on a Haryanvi folk song 'Ragini'".

headlines: Spinners pick 6 wkts as Afghanistan get 1st T20I win vs B'desh
text: Afghanistan's spin trio of Rashid Khan, Mujeeb Ur Rahman and Mohammad Nabi registered combined figures of 6/54 in 11 overs to help their side beat Bangladesh for the first time in a T20I match on Sunday. Rashid, who won the Man of the Match award, later said that performing well at the "biggest stage" in IPL gave him the confidence.

headlines: Shooter opens fire near marathon in California
text: A woman opened fire in San Diego, California, where thousands of people were participating in a city marathon, police have said. The shooter, who fired four or five shots near a parking structure near the finish line of the race, was later taken into custody. The race resumed after a brief halt with streets being closed temporarily following the shooting.

headlines: FB shared user data with 60 firms including Microsoft, Apple
text: Facebook shared its user data with at least 60 companies including Microsoft, Apple, Amazon and Samsung, according to a report by The New York Times. The firms were also given access to users' friends' data without consent, the report claimed. The deal allowed Facebook to expand its reach and let the firms offer social network's features on their devices.

headlines: BJP minister calls Opposition leaders 'Osamawadi'
text: Slamming the Opposition, BJP leader and union minister Giriraj Singh on Sunday tweeted that Maoists, casteist, communists and supporters of 9/11 attacks mastermind Osama bin Laden had united against the NDA. He added that the Opposition's efforts towards a united front will not have any impact since the NDA will successfully win the 2019 elections on its development agenda.

headlines: Ex-Amazon employees' logistics tracking startup raises $4mn
text: Bengaluru logistics tracking startup Locus, founded by former Amazon engineers Nishith Rastogi and Geet Garg, has raised $4 million in funding. It was raised from Rocketship.vc, Recruit Strategic Partners, pi Ventures, and Hemendra Kothari, along with investors including Blume Ventures and BeeNext. Incorporated in 2015, Locus offers route planning, vehicle allocation, and 3D packing solutions.

headlines: BigBasket to sell meat, beauty products via private labels
text: Online grocer BigBasket is planning to expand its portfolio by selling beauty products and meat via private labels. "We will not just have a private label (for beauty), but also normal labels, imported stuff, etc... Basically a new set of categories," CEO Hari Menon said. The move aims to generate 45% of BigBasket's overall sales from label business by 2019.

headlines: Punjab sends 4-member team amid threat to Sikhs in Shillong
text: The Punjab government has sent a four-member team to Shillong amid reports of unrest between the native Khasi and Dalit Sikh communities. The team is expected to make a ground assessment of the situation and extend all possible help to the Sikh community. Clashes between the two communities started after an altercation between a Punjabi woman and Khasi youth.

headlines: Reduce CBSE board exam duration from 7 to 4 weeks: Govt body
text: A committee formed by the Human Resource Development Ministry may recommend that the duration for CBSE Class 10 and 12 exams be reduced from seven to four weeks in an attempt to prevent paper leaks, reports said. The committee was formed after the leak of Class 12 Economics and Class 10 Maths paper in April this year.

headlines: Armed men rob SP's house in Indore by locking him in room
text: Four armed men broke into the government house of Superintendent of Police (SP) in Indore and robbed it by locking him inside his room, reports said. The SP alerted police officials, who arrived and arrested one of the accused. The accused had managed to get into the house by cutting the wire mesh on a window.

headlines: Family of Delhi man killed by Muslim lover's kin hosts iftar
text: The family of Ankit Saxena, the 23-year-old photographer who was allegedly killed by his Muslim girlfriend's family in February, on Sunday organised an iftar party in Delhi's Raghubir Nagar. Hoping that the party would "spread the message of peace and harmony", Saxena's father said he wanted the accused to be hanged but did not hate the entire community.

headlines: If anti-Sterlite protestors are anti-social, so am I: Haasan
text: Talking about actor-turned-politician Rajnikanth's remark that violence during the anti-Sterlite protest was caused by anti-social elements, MNM chief Kamal Haasan said, "If protesters are anti-social, so am I." He added, "Protests are not about fighting with guns and knives but even if guns are brought out, people should have the character to face them with an open heart."

headlines: Philippine Prez Duterte kisses woman in exchange for book
text: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte kissed a woman during a meeting with the Filipino community in South Korea on Sunday. Duterte told women in the audience that he would give a book titled 'Altar of Secrets: Sex, Politics, and Money in the Philippine Catholic Church' in exchange for a kiss. He later asked the audience to not take the kiss seriously.

headlines: German Prez apologises to LGBTâcommunity over Nazi injustice
text: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier on Sunday apologised to the LGBT community over the "suffering and injustice" caused under Nazi rule and in the decades after. Steinmeier said he wants to reassure "all gays, lesbians and bisexuals, all queers, transsexuals and intersexuals" that they are protected in today's Germany. The country legalised same sex marriages last year.

headlines: No GST on free services provided by banks, govt clarifies
text: GST will not be applicable to free banking services such as cheque book issuance and ATM withdrawals, the government clarified on Sunday. However, interest charged on outstanding credit card bills, and exit fee paid by investors of mutual funds will be taxable under GST. Further, additional interest charged in case of default of loan payment will attract GST.

headlines: Nirav Modi records safe, shifted before fire: I-T Department
text: The Income Tax Department on Sunday said the records relating to the ongoing investigation of Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi were transferred before a fire broke out in the Income Tax Office in Mumbai. The clarification came after media reports claimed the records were destroyed in the fire. The department is investigating the â¹14,000-crore PNB scam.

headlines: Serena Williams has beaten Sharapova 18 times in a row
text: American tennis star and former world number one Serena Williams, who is playing her first Grand Slam after giving birth, has beaten her rival Maria Sharapova 18 times in a row. The two will go head-to-head for the 22nd time today at the French Open Round of 16, with the 36-year-old American holding a 19-2 advantage over the 31-year-old Russian.

headlines: I ran towards Pak fans to celebrate goal in 1st match: Chhetri
text: Ahead of his 100th international match, Indian football captain Sunil Chhetri recalled his debut match where he scored a goal and "all in euphoria... ran to the Pakistani fans and started to celebrate". Chhetri, who will become only the second Indian footballer to appear in 100 matches, said, "I had a dream but never dreamed of playing 100 international matches."

headlines: Rajeev Misra may succeed Masayoshi Son as SoftBank CEO
text: SoftBank Vision Fund's CEO Rajeev Misra, who has been elevated to Executive Vice President of SoftBank's board, is likely to be considered as SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son's successor. Reports claim Misra is among at least three senior executives who could succeed Son when he steps down. Misra took over as CEO of the $100-billion Vision Fund earlier in 2016.

headlines: Delhi man out on bail rapes woman at her home for 6 hours
text: A 38-year-old man who was out on bail has been arrested for allegedly breaking into a woman's house in Delhi, raping her for six hours, and trying to strangulate her. The accused had tied up the woman's arms and legs and made her drink forcefully. He has around a dozen cases levied against him, according to police records.

headlines: 12 die after doctors at Jharkhand hospital go on strike
text: At least 12 people died due to alleged medical negligence after junior doctors and nurses at Jharkhand's Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences went on a strike on Saturday. The hospital staff demanded action against a patient's family for assaulting nurses after their relative was declared dead. The hospital administration said it has made alternate arrangements to operate the hospital.

headlines: IPS officerâs brother joins terror group in J&K
text: The brother of an IPS officer is allegedly among 80 youths who have joined militant groups like ISIS-Kashmir and Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind in Jammu and Kashmir this year, according to reports. The brother, an Unani doctor, was reported missing from Shopian. The list also includes an MBA degree holder from Kashmir University and a 26-year-old PhD scholar from Kupwara.

headlines: 'Cramped' NCERT syllabus to be reduced to half: HRD Minister
text: Human Resource Development Minister Prakash Javadekar has said NCERT syllabus will be reduced to half as it is presently "cramped". The government is considering 37,000 suggestions to ensure that students get time to focus on activities other than learning information, he added. The government will provide funds to schools for procuring sports equipment and library books, he further said.

headlines: Kolkata student stripped naked for asking about college fund
text: A student at Kolkata's St Paul's Cathedral Mission College was allegedly stripped naked and filmed by his seniors after he questioned them about the funds used for a college fest. He filed a police complaint after a video of the incident was circulated in college. West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee said strict action will be taken against the accused.

headlines: Cops use 14-yr-old form to claim Kathua juvenile is an adult
text: Jammu and Kashmir Police has retrieved a 14-year-old application submitted by the father of the accused in the Kathua rape case to contest that he is not a juvenile. Stating that the application claimed that his siblings were born within a gap of around three months, police said the accused's father has a casual approach towards providing information on birthdates.

headlines: Will revoke Ramadan ceasefire if Pak doesn't mend ways: Govt
text: Union Minister Hansraj Ahir on Sunday said the government will be "constrained" to revoke the Ramadan ceasefire as there was "no respite in cross-border terrorism and ceasefire violations on the part of Pakistan." Last month, the government had directed security forces in Jammu and Kashmir not to launch any operations, but allowed them to retaliate if they were attacked.

headlines: Explain govt efforts to bring back Kohinoor: CIC to PMO
text: The Central Information Commission has asked the Prime Minister's Office and External Affairs Ministry to detail steps taken to bring back antiquities like the Kohinoor diamond and Maharaja Ranjit Singh's golden throne. It also directed them to explain why an RTI seeking the information was sent to Archaeological Survey of India, which has no power over the subject.

headlines: Court gives 5 youths life term within 30 days of raping minor
text: Five youths were sentenced to life imprisonment on Saturday for raping a 16-year-old girl within 30 days of the incident in Odisha's Sambalpur district. They were sentenced by a special POCSO judge after a marathon trial of 14 hours. A juvenile accused in the case, who was witness to the crime, is being separately tried in a juvenile justice court.

headlines: 25 killed, 300 injured as volcano erupts in Guatemala
text: At least 25 people were killed and around 300 others were injured on Sunday in the most violent eruption of Guatemala's Fuego volcano in over four decades. The volcano spewed smoke and rocks 8 km into the air forcing mass evacuation from nearby villages. Guatemalan President Jimmy Morales said he was considering declaring a state of emergency.

headlines: 73,000 deregistered firms deposited â¹24,000 cr post note ban
text: As many as 73,000 companies which have been deregistered by the government deposited â¹24,000 crore in bank accounts after demonetisation, as per government data. The government had struck off the names of around 2.26 lakh companies for being inactive for long and various non-compliances. Many of these are suspected to have been used for illegal fund flows.

headlines: Gangster Dilpreet booked over extortion call to Punjabi actor
text: Gangster Dilpreet Dhahan has been booked for allegedly making an extortion call to Punjabi actor and singer Gippy Grewal. Gippy had informed the police that he received a call on WhatsApp from Dilpreet asking him to pay extortion money. Earlier, Dilpreet had claimed responsibility for firing multiple shots at Punjabi singer Parmish Verma.

headlines: Indo-Pak peace on horizon: Swara on trolls from Pak, India
text: Slamming trolls from Pakistan and India, Swara Bhasker tweeted, "Looks like Indo-Pak peace is on the horizon! #DushmanKaDushmanDost." An Indian user had commented on a post by a Pakistani Instagram account. He had written, "To every Pakistani on this post, this is coming from an Indian. Bhaiyo hamey bhi nahi pasand hai yeh (Brothers, we too do not like her)."

headlines: Ranveer Singh dances on 'Laila O Laila' at a wedding party
text: A video shows actor Ranveer Singh dancing on the song 'Laila O Laila' at stylist Nitasha Gaurav's wedding party. 'Laila O Laila' is a song from the 1980 film 'Qurbani' that featured Zeenat Aman. Sharing another video of the actor dancing, Nitasha wrote, "Thank you for coming and taking our wedding shingding to another level Ranveer,"

headlines: Legend, can I have tickets? Mirza reacts to Chhetri's video
text: Reacting to Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri's video, wherein he urged Indians to watch their matches from the stadiums, Indian tennis player Sania Mirza tweeted, "Legend, can I have tickets pls?" Responding to Mirza, the 33-year-old footballer wrote, "Only if you promise to sort me out with some when you're playing next!"

headlines: England win 1st Test since Sept 2017 to tie series with Pak
text: England defeated Pakistan by an innings and 55 runs in the second Test on Sunday to end their 8-Test winless streak and level the two-match series 1-1. Before this match, England had last won a Test against Windies in September last year. England's Jos Buttler, who slammed an unbeaten 80 off 101 balls, was named Man of the Match.

headlines: Let's fill stadiums: Sachin asks fans to support athletes
text: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar has shared a video of himself urging the fans to "fill in the stadiums and support Indian teams wherever and whenever they are playing". "Getting support from all the well wishers is the best tonic any athlete can have," he said. This comes after Sunil Chhetri urged fans to watch Indian football team's matches from stadiums.

headlines: Shimla Mayorâs vehicle crashes into govt quarters
text: The official vehicle of the Shimla municipal corporation mayor crashed into a government cottage after it hit a tree as it skidded off a road on Saturday. While the driver sustained minor injuries, the two others in the car escaped unhurt. The accident took place when the driver had been returning after dropping Mayor Kusum Sadrate at her residence.

headlines: 1,000-yr-old missing statues returned to TN temple from Guj
text: Two 1,000-year-old bronze idols of Emperor Raja Raja Chola and queen Lokmadevi, which went missing from Tamil Nadu's Brihadisvara Temple fifty years ago, have been recovered from a private museum in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. Police said the artefacts, which are the only known statues of the emperor and his consort, will be placed inside the temple within the next two days.

headlines: 32 pilgrims stuck in Iraq after being duped by travel agency
text: Around 32 pilgrims from Hyderabad are stranded in Iraq after the travel agency which organised their trip shut down following a police investigation against it. The tour operators hadn't paid their hotel bills following which the hotel confiscated their passports and barred them from leaving its premises. Local leaders have requested External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj to help the pilgrims.

headlines: Gujarat Dalits start online protest by adding 'Sinh' to name
text: Dalit youth in Gujarat have started a social media campaign by adding 'Sinh' to their names on online platforms. The word 'Sinh' means 'lion' in Gujarati and is associated with upper castes. This comes after members of an upper caste objected to a 22-year-old Dalit youth adding 'Sinh' to his name, leading to clashes and cross-complaints between the communities.

headlines: Cops with TMC: BJP on report that party worker killed self
text: After police said a BJP worker found hanging in West Bengal's Purlia had committed suicide, the party alleged police are trying to shield the murderers associated with Trinamool Congress. Calling the state government's order for a CID enquiry a "farce", state BJP leader Sayantan Basu said the party has decided to demand a CBI enquiry.

headlines: US teacher charged for feeding puppy to turtle in class
text: A school teacher in the US state of Idaho has been charged with animal cruelty after he fed a sick puppy to a turtle while demonstrating the circle of life to his students. Officials said that the March incident happened after school hours. If convicted, the teacher could be jailed for up to six months and fined up to $5,000.

headlines: Journo seeks â¹100 cr in defamation case against Rajini's Kaala
text: Claiming that Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Kaala' is based on his father who was nicknamed 'Kaala Seth', Mumbai-based journalist Jawahar Nadar has sought â¹100 crore in a defamation case against Rajinikanth and director Pa Ranjith. However, he admitted that he has not seen the movie yet, but said that he wants to ensure that his fatherâs reputation is unharmed.

headlines: Nice to see him copying me: Govinda on 'dancing uncle' video
text: After watching the viral video of Sanjeev Shrivastava, a professor dancing to his song 'Aap Ke Aa Jane Se' at a wedding, Govinda said, "It's so nice to see somebody copying you." Govinda added that he even showed the video to his wife Sunita. Shrivastava was dubbed as "dancing uncle" on social media after his video went viral.

headlines: No vacancy for PM's post in 2019: MinoritiesâMinister
text: Union Minorities Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Sunday said there is no vacancy for the post of Prime Minister in the 2019 elections. The "anti-Modi front" has over two dozen aspirants for the post but they will fight amongst themselves, he claimed. He said the BJP will contest the elections under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi.

headlines: The trip to end all trips: Canada PM jokes about India trip
text: Talking about his 8-day trip to India, Canadian PM Justin Trudeau jokingly described it as "the trip to end all trips". "Despite the blaring wall-to-wall international ridicule, it was a pretty good trip," he said at the annual Parliamentary Press Gallery Dinner. PM Trudeau and his family had faced criticism over "choreographed cuteness" for wearing Indian outfits during the trip.

headlines: 22-yr-old Indian-origin techie youngest to run for California Guv
text: A 22-year-old Indian-origin IT professional has become the youngest candidate to run for Governor in the US state of California. Shubham Goel, who is from Uttar Pradesh, currently works as a Virtual Reality Manager. Goel said he wants to run for Governor "to show people that the everyday person can make a difference".

headlines: Nearly half of Afghan children out of school: UNICEF
text: Nearly half of the Afghan children are missing out on school due to on-going conflict, poverty, and discrimination against girls, according to a report by UNICEF. The report further stated that girls account for 60% of those being denied education. "When children are not in school, they are at an increased danger of abuse and exploitation," UNICEF said.

headlines: Fans speculate Johnny Depp is sick after pics emerge online
text: Fans of Hollywood actor Johnny Depp have been speculating that the actor is "sick" after his new pictures emerged online. "I think my hero looks ill," one of the fans commented on his photo on Facebook. Another fan commented, "He looks thin." The photo also received comments such as "weak" and "skinny" to describe the actor's appearance.n

headlines: Even during my struggle period I knew I wanted to act: Vicky
text: Actor Vicky Kaushal has said that even during his struggle period, he knew acting was what he wanted to do. "The struggles were there but never bogged me down," he added. Vicky further said, "Whatever be the struggles, I was enjoying it... I felt I was living my life. It was a beautiful phase."

headlines: Bigg Boss 12 to have same-sex couple as contestants: Report
text: As per reports, the reality TV show 'Bigg Boss 12' will feature same-sex couple as contestants in the house. The show has reportedly planned to play a role in getting the society to accept homosexuality. Reports added that the makers are also looking for a controversial duo that is into the business of exotic dancing and adult services.

headlines: No hidden agenda in video requesting fans for support: Chhetri
text: Talking about his video urging countrymen to watch Indian football team's matches from stadiums, captain Sunil Chhetri said "there's no hidden agenda or propaganda" behind the video. "Whatever I said...was straight from my heart. I hope people won't take it in wrong sense," he added. "Please get involved...this is an important time...in Indian football," he had said in the video.

headlines: England's Buttler has 'F**k It' written on top of his bat
text: During the second England-Pakistan Test, cameras showed the top of the handle of batsman Jos Buttler's bat which had "F**k It" written on it. Reacting to it, a user tweeted, "Big fan of Buttler's own mental mantra...to refocus after each delivery." "Jos Buttler: I should bat sensibly with England 8 wickets down...*looks down at bat handle*," another user wrote.

headlines: Rabada poses with 'Women's Cricketer of the Year' trophy
text: Kagiso Rabada, who bagged six awards at Cricket South Africa's annual awards ceremony, mistakenly posed with 'Women's Cricketer of the Year' trophy. Reacting to it, a user tweeted, "He's so good he even won...Women's Cricketer of the Year". "This guy was on fire...he even changed his name to Dane Van Niekerk to go at it again next season," wrote another.

headlines: Surprised that Sharapova's book was a lot about me: Serena
text: After reading her upcoming French Open opponent and long-time rival Maria Sharapova's book, American tennis star Serena Williams said, "I didn't expect to be reading a book about me that wasn't necessarily true." Sharapova's book claims that Serena's dominance over her is because she defeated the American in Wimbledon 2004's final, which resulted in Serena crying in the locker room.

headlines: When are Indian football team's upcoming matches?
text: Indian football team is currently participating in the four-team Intercontinental Cup, which is being held at the Mumbai Football Arena in Mumbai. India will face Kenya on June 4 and New Zealand on June 7. India had defeated Chinese Taipei 5-0 in the first group match of the tournament on June 1, which witnessed a hat-trick by captain Sunil Chhetri.

headlines: UFC fighter ends opponent's 20-match win streak in 33 secs
text: UFC fighter Jimmie Rivera's 20-match winning streak ended 33 seconds into the first round by opponent Marlon Moraes' high kick. Moraes' kick landed on Rivera's head which floored him following which Moraes attacked him with a slew of punches. After the win, the fifth-ranked Moraes' win-loss record reads 21-5, while the fourth-ranked Rivera now has a win-loss record of 21-2.

headlines: Akram once smashed 257* while batting at number 8 in a Test
text: Former Pakistani fast bowler Wasim Akram holds the record for smashing the highest score while batting at number eight in a Test match. Akram, who is celebrating his 52nd birthday today, smashed an unbeaten 257 off 363 balls including 12 sixes and 22 fours against Zimbabwe in 1996 to achieve the feat. Akram scored three tons in his Test career.

headlines: TMC men killed son: Dad of BJP worker found hanging in WB
text: After post-mortem reports claimed that a BJP worker who was found hanging from an electricity pole in West Bengal had committed suicide, his father said that Trinamool Congress workers were responsible for his death. Dulal Kumar's father asked, "How can it be suicide when there was no problem in his life?" The BJP has called his death a "political murder".

headlines: Wilfully giving wrong replies to RTI invites penalty: Ex-CIC
text: Former Central Information Commissioner (CIC) Shailesh Gandhi has said that any Information Officer who wilfully provides wrong information to an RTI application can be penalised and disciplinary action could be taken against him. Gandhi added that in cases where the mistake is genuine, the concerned department must give an explanation for the lapse as well as the correct information.

headlines: Army jawan booked for raping, impregnating minor in Andhra
text: A 23-year-old Army jawan was booked after he allegedly raped and impregnated a minor girl in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam after promising to marry her. The jawan's family reportedly refused to accept the victim's proposal for marriage and offered her money to terminate the pregnancy. The accused jawan, who hailed from Visakhapatnam and was posted in Kolkata, is currently absconding.

headlines: Trivandrum duty-free shop's CEO held for â¹6-cr tax evasion
text: Customs officials on Saturday arrested the CEO of Plus Max, which operates a duty-free shop at the Trivandrum airport, for alleged tax evasion to the tune of â¹6 crore. R Sundaravasan allegedly used passport details of thousands of passengers to illegally divert foreign liquor to black market. Sale details and returns were allegedly fabricated to cover up the illegal sales.

headlines: Indian man wins over â¹18 crore in Abu Dhabi lottery
text: An Indian man named Dickson Kattithara Abraham has won 10 million dirham (over â¹18 crore) in a lottery in Abu Dhabi. Abraham, who is based in Nigeria, had purchased the ticket when he was travelling through Abu Dhabi. Five other Indian participants also won smaller prizes that ranged from 30,000 dirham to 100,000 dirham. n

headlines: K'taka CM bans officials from carrying mobiles to meetings
text: Newly-appointed Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy has banned government officials from carrying mobile phones to their meetings with him, in order to enforce discipline. State Chief Secretary K Ratna Prabha said the move will ensure that officials effectively contribute to the discussions. Earlier, the state prohibited teachers from using their phones during school hours.

headlines: Senior scientist held for sexually harassing Dalit student
text: A senior scientist at the National Institute of Nutrition in Hyderabad was arrested on Saturday for allegedly sexually harassing a Dalit student. Fifty-eight-year-old K Bhaskarachary, who was supposed to guide the student on her dissertation, allegedly harassed her with obscene messages and threatened her. Bhaskarachary had already been suspended by the institution last month.

headlines: 2 BSF personnel martyred in ceasefire violation by Pakistan
text: Two Border Security Force (BFS) personnel were martyred in sniper fire by Pakistani forces late on Saturday, according to the BSF. At least 12 villagers were injured in the heavy shelling, it added. This comes four days after Pakistani Director General of Military Operations called up his Indian counterpart to restore the ceasefire agreement.

headlines: Govt can't give everyone security: BJP leader on beach rape
text: Days after a 20-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped at a Goan beach, BJP leader Sulakshana Sawant said the government cannot provide security to every individual. Sawant said, "We need to change the mentality of the people." There is an increase in the number of rape cases being reported to the police as more women were reporting such crimes, she added..

headlines: No sanctions relief for N Korea until denuclearisation: US
text: US Defence Secretary James Mattis has said North Korea will get relief from sanctions only after it takes clear and irreversible steps to end its nuclear programme. He added that it will be a "bumpy road" to the nuclear negotiations with North Korea on June 12. His remarks follow President Donald Trump's meeting with senior North Korean official Kim Yong-chol.

headlines: Alliance won't defend Israel if Iran attacks: NATO chief
text: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg has said that the alliance would not come to Israel's defence in case of an attack by Iran. "Israel is our partner, but not a member of NATO. The security guarantee does not apply to Israel," he added. Stoltenberg's statement comes amid heightened tensions between Israel and Iran.

headlines: Endorsing harmful product or service is incorrect: Akshay
text: Actor Akshay Kumar has said that endorsing a harmful product or service is incorrect. "I think audience also must understand whom to follow and whom not to follow," he added. He further urged celebrities not to endorse harmful services or products like alcohol and tobacco because people look up to them and imitate them.

headlines: Aerial robot which can change its shape mid-flight developed
text: Researchers from CNRS in France have designed a flying robot 'Quad-Morphing' which can change its shape during flight. The robot, which has two rotating arms equipped with propellers, can reduce its wingspan in flight to navigate through tight spaces. Quad-Morphing, which can fly at a speed of 9 kmph, also features an autopilot system which activates arm reorientation.

headlines: Found 1 voter registered in 26 MP voter lists: Cong to EC
text: Madhya Pradesh Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia on Sunday claimed the party had found one voter registered in 26 lists after examining voter lists of all constituencies. He also questioned how the population increased by 24% in 10 years but voters increased by 40%. Further, party leader Kamal Nath said Election Commission has been given evidence of 60 lakh fake voters.

headlines: BJP worker found hanging in WB committed suicide: Police
text: West Bengal Police on Sunday said a 30-year-old BJP worker who was found hanging from a power transmission tower in Purulia the previous day had committed suicide. Another BJP worker was earlier found hanging from a tree, with a note on his shirt claiming that he was killed because of his political affiliation. BJP has termed the deaths "political murders".

headlines: Crater as big as 90 football fields formed on Hawaii volcano
text: A drone footage of the mouth of Hawaii's Kilauea volcano has revealed a crater measuring around 120 acres or roughly about the size of 90 American football fields. According to experts, explosions expanded the crater by 10 times its original size in the last month. The volcano has destroyed more than 80 homes since it first erupted four weeks ago.

headlines: How much are Governors paid as allowances?
text: The West Bengal Governor will be paid the highest allowance at â¹1.81 crore, while the Tamil Nadu Governor will get â¹1.66 crore and the Bihar Governor will be paid â¹1.62 crore, according to new government guidelines. These cover tours, maintenance of offices, hospitality and other expenses.  The allowances are paid by the state governments and were revised after four years.

headlines: Sushma Swaraj's plane goes out of contact for 14 minutes
text: The VVIP aircraft carrying External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj from Trivandrum to Mauritius went out of contact for 12-14 minutes on Saturday, a senior official has said. The incident reportedly prompted a security scare as air traffic controllers could not establish contact with the aircraft after it entered Mauritian airspace. However, the MEA denied having any knowledge of the scare.

headlines: Even S, N Korea became friends, says J&K CM on Indo-Pak ties
text: Citing the example of North and South Korea becoming "friends" after 70 years, Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti has sought an improvement in India-Pakistan relations. She said, "Shelling is still going on on our borders. People on that side are dying and people on this side are also dying." She called for an end to the shelling and bloodshed.

headlines: Can't resolve disputes on streets: Meghalaya CM on violence
text: Amid a night curfew imposed in Meghalaya's capital Shillong, CM Conrad Sangma said the issues which prompted violence can be resolved on a table and not on the streets. He added that reports about people being displaced and assaulted are untrue. However, defence officials said 500 people were placed in Army shelters after clashes erupted between Punjabi and Khasi communities.

headlines: Army rescues 500 people in Shillong amid communal clashes
text: The Army has rescued 500 people from disturbed areas in Meghalaya's Shillong after incidents of violence and arson were reported amid communal clashes in the capital. Violence was triggered after an altercation between a Punjabi woman and a Khasi youth, following which a mob clashed with the police. Protestors torched shops, pelted stones and hurled petrol bombs at security personnel.

headlines: China clears 8,500 kg of garbage from Mount Everest
text: A team of 30 people from China has cleared 8,500 kg of garbage from Mount Everest since April amid growing numbers of visitors. The garbage includes about 5,200 kg of household waste, 2,300 kg of human faeces, and 1,000 kg of mountaineering trash. China also plans to build environment friendly toilets and waste collection sites at Mount Everest.

headlines: Film isn't just about art form but how it fares: Tamannaah
text: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia has said that a film is not just about the art form but also how it fares at the box office. "It's part of the business...When it comes to a character, I make sure that it adds to the plot," she added. She further said she has accepted small roles in good, content-driven films.

headlines: Rao, Bhumi in Kareena, Akshay's next film with Johar: Report
text: Rajkummar Rao and Bhumi Pednekar will star opposite each other in Karan Johar's next production where Kareena Kapoor Khan and Akshay Kumar will be playing the lead roles, as per reports. The film is said to revolve around two couples in modern relationships. Kareena and Akshay will reportedly be playing the older couple trying to have a child.

headlines: Nadal once portrayed Shakira's love interest in music video
text: World number one tennis player Rafael Nadal portrayed Colombian singer Shakira's love interest in the official video of her 2009 song 'Gypsy'. "Shakira, as always, was spectacular. Working with a woman as charming as her, well, it makes it a lot easier," Nadal had said. The 16-time Grand Slam champion is celebrating his 32nd birthday today.

headlines: Maybe people get money writing about link-up with Disha: Tiger
text: Talking about rumours about him dating Disha Patani, actor Tiger Shroff said, "People like to write things about us, it's fine, maybe they get something out of it- money or some sort of pleasure." He added that he doesn't want to shut up anyone or clarify anything because he does not want to take someone's bread-and-butter away.

headlines: Time to wish Jaya for 45 years together: Big B on anniversary
text: Amitabh Bachchan, who completed 45 years of his marriage with wife Jaya Bachchan on Sunday, wrote in a blog post at midnight, "Time to call the wife who travels and to wish her for the years together." Sharing an old picture with Jaya on Twitter, he thanked fans who sent him greetings and flowers on the occasion of their anniversary.

headlines: ABD almost fell flat on his face before fastest ODI ton: Steyn
text: South Africa's Dale Steyn has revealed AB de Villiers "almost fell flat on his face" while going out to bat before scoring the fastest ODI ton at the Wanderers in 2015. Steyn added ABD rushed out of the change room as he was reluctant. "As he ran out, he almost saw his arse on the (stairs') first step," Steyn added.

headlines: Raina shares Chhetri's video, urges fans to support them
text: Cricketer Suresh Raina on Sunday took to Twitter to urge fans to support Sunil Chhetri and Indian football team for their "amazing efforts and progress". Raina also shared the video of Chhetri, wherein the football team captain urged countrymen to support them by watching their matches from stadiums. Earlier, Virat Kohli had urged Indians to take notice of Chhetri.

headlines: Minorities are safer in India, says Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi
text: Union Minister for Minority Affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Sunday said minorities are safer in India than in any other democratic country. He added, "Unfortunately some forces, especially political, are trying to create an atmosphere of fear to disturb the development, peace and prosperity." He further said that people who try to create an atmosphere of fear would not succeed.

headlines: PM Modi wishes DMK chief Karunanidhi on 95th birthday
text: Wishing DMK chief M Karunanidhi on his 95th birthday, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "A prolific writer, poet, thinker and orator, Karunanidhi Ji is one of India's senior most political leaders." Congress President Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "I pray for his good health and happiness, always." The ex-Tamil Nadu CM joined the state Assembly in 1957 and has never lost an election.

headlines: Train delays to cost officials their promotions
text: Railway Minister Piyush Goyal has warned heads of zonal railways that delays in train services will defer their appraisal proportionately, a senior official has said. Goyal gave the zonal general managers a month to improve punctuality and told them they couldn't blame maintenance work for the delays. Notably, as many as 30% trains were running late in the 2017-18 fiscal.

headlines: Parties which can't handle defeat blame EVMs: EC
text: Slamming political parties for opposing Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs), Chief Election Commissioner Om Prakash Rawat has said, "Political parties that cannot take defeat need to blame someone." Stating that EVMs and Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) machines allow the EC to announce poll results within hours, he added that the machines enhance the transparency in the voting process.

headlines: UN experts condemn Tuticorin police firing that killed 13
text: The UN Human Rights Commission experts have condemned the police firing that took place in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin during the anti-Sterlite protests in which at least 13 people were killed. The experts also called upon the Indian authorities to ensure an "independent and a transparent" investigation into the incident. Meanwhile, the state government has permanently shut down the Sterlite plant.

headlines: AI should be used for governance, improvement: IT Minister
text: Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad has said, "Artificial Intelligence should be used for governance...for improvement." Dismissing concerns that technology may displace jobs, he added, "If a person is not up to date in new technology, then he may have a problem. You have to be tuned to the new technology."

headlines: Delhi govt calls for arranging water for birds, animals
text: Delhi Environment Minister Imran Hussain has called for requesting agencies like the forest department and municipal corporations for arranging water for birds and animals during the summer months. Adding that various species of birds and animals enrich the biodiversity, Hussain said, "There have been cases in the past where birds have died due to thirst, scarcity of water."

headlines: Maldives govt slaps $20.5-million income tax notice on GMR
text: The Maldives government has issued a notice seeking $20.5 million towards income tax and penalties from GMR Male International Airport, a GMR Group company. The company had won $271 million arbitration against the wrongful termination of Male International Airport contract. A GMR spokesperson has refuted the tax claim as the group company has no business operations in the island nation.

headlines: ONGC incurs â¹4,000cr loss on gas production due to price cap
text: State-owned ONGC has incurred a â¹4,000-crore loss on natural gas output in FY18 as the government mandated price for the fuel was less than the cost of production. "We need at least $4 per million British thermal unit (mmBtu) to break-even compared to current price of $3.06," an official said. Notably, ONGC produces around 75% of India's natural gas output.

headlines: Tamil actress Sangeetha arrested for running prostitution racket
text: Tamil actress Sangeetha Balan, who is known for her role TV serials including 'Vani Rani', has been arrested for allegedly running a prostitution racket in a private resort in Chennai. Many young actresses were reportedly involved in prostitution. Women from various states, especially from North India, were rescued and sent to a rehabilitation center.

headlines: 'Main Badhiya Tu Bhi Badhiya' song from 'Sanju' released
text: 'Main Badhiya Tu Bhi Badhiya', the first song from Ranbir Kapoor and Sonam Kapoor starrer 'Sanju' has been released.  Sonu Nigam and Sunidhi Chauhan have sung it while it has been composed by music director duo Rohan-Rohan with lyrics by Puneet Sharma. Directed by Rajkumar Hirani, the film also stars Paresh Rawal, Manisha Koirala, Vicky Kaushal and Dia Mirza.

headlines: Watch Muhammad Ali dodge 21 punches in 10 seconds
text: Boxing legend Muhammad Ali, who passed away on June 3, 2016, once dodged 21 punches in 10 seconds as a 35-year-old fighting against then 19-year-old Michael Dokes. Ali, who was cornered in the ring, did a mock dance after Dokes missed the punches. Two years earlier, Dokes had claimed his hands are "so fast they can't catch them on film".

headlines: Researchers working on robots fitted with live muscle tissue
text: University of Tokyo researchers have demonstrated a way to maintain living tissue on a robotic joint to make life-like robots. They constructed a metal and plastic robot skeleton with muscle precursor cells, which were fitted with electrodes to allow the skeleton to move. The muscle-robot which was tested resembled a human finger and successfully picked up and moved a ring.

headlines: Maserati confirms electric car that can do 0-100 kmph in 2s
text: Italian luxury vehicle manufacturer Maserati has announced plans to launch the Alfieri electric sports car which can go from 0-100 kmph in under 2 seconds. The car, which will offer 300 kmph top speed, will feature a transmission supplied by Ferrari and a coupe or open-top version. The Alfieri was first unveiled four years ago as a concept car.

headlines: Father's maintenance for child not for only 2 meals a day: Court
text: A Delhi court has held that a father's maintenance payments towards his child cannot be limited to two meals a day and should be determined by what the child would have enjoyed if they lived together. This came as the court rejected a man's plea against a lower court order directing him to pay â¹12,000 per month as child maintenance.

headlines: Driving licences issued to 2 dead people in Mathura
text: The government transport office in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura has issued driving licences to two people who had passed away in separate road accidents in 2017. The Assistant Regional Transport Officer Babita Verma has said a show cause notice for the error was served to the concerned clerk, who has avoided it by taking leaves.

headlines: Nipah virus no longer a threat in Kerala: Medical body
text: Indian Medical Association President Ravi Wankhedkar on Saturday said Nipah virus is no longer a threat in Kerala, adding that 300 doctors from across the nation have arrived in the state. The virus has claimed 18 lives in Kerala. However, state Health Minister KK Shailaja said people need to be careful as around 2,000 people were exposed to the virus.

headlines: Nuclear-capable Agni 5 missile successfully test-fired
text: India successfully test-fired the indigenously developed and nuclear-capable Long Range Ballistic Missile Agni 5 on Sunday. This was the sixth trial of the surface-to-surface missile, which has a strike range of 5,000 km. Agni 5 is the most advanced missile with new technologies in terms of navigation and guidance, warhead, and engine, Defence Research and Development Organisation officials said.

headlines: Valet crushes Porsche while attempting to park in Australia
text: A Hyatt Regency Hotel valet in Sydney, Australia, managed to crash a Porsche Carrera while parking the car, resulting in wedging the sports car underneath another vehicle. The valet had to be rescued through the car's shorn roof and was not injured in the incident. A witness claimed the valet must have "panicked" and accelerated the Porsche under the car.

headlines: Int'l flyers need not pay GST at airport duty-free shops
text: International passengers buying goods at airport duty-free shops will not be subjected to GST, according to officials. The duty-free shops will have to only collect a copy of the passport from the passenger and later seek GST refund from the government. The revenue department will issue a clarification stating that duty-free shops would not levy GST, the official added.

headlines: 23-yr-old Rabada bags 6 trophies at annual awards ceremony
text: World number one Test bowler Kagiso Rabada bagged six trophies of the eight he was eligible for at the annual Cricket South Africa awards on Saturday, becoming the first cricketer to achieve the feat twice. The 23-year-old joined Jacques Kallis, Makhaya Ntini, Hashim Amla and AB de Villiers as two-time winner of the top SA Cricketer of the Year award.

headlines: There is an asteroid named after tennis star Rafael Nadal
text: Spain's world number one tennis player Rafael Nadal, who turned 32 today, has an asteroid named after him. The asteroid, discovered by an astronomical observatory on Nadal's home island of Majorca, was named after him when he beat Roger Federer in the Wimbledon 2008 final. Nadal's birthday coincides with French Open, a tournament he has won a record 10 times.

headlines: Muhammad Ali's youngest daughter retired as unbeaten boxer
text: Muhammad Ali's youngest daughter Laila Ali retired as an unbeaten boxer after having held the WBC, WIBA, IWBF, IBA super-middleweight titles alongside the IWBF light-heavyweight title. Laila, who had a 24-0 win-loss record with 21 knock-outs, once fought Joe Frazier's daughter Jackie Frazier-Lyde in the 'Ali/Frazier IV' match, a reference to the three historic boxing bouts between their fathers.

headlines: Nigeria's WC kit sold out in 15 min after 30 lakh pre-orders
text: The Nigerian football team's over 30 lakh World Cup replica shirts were sold out within 15 minutes after being made available for pre-order online on Friday. Long queues were seen outside a store in London. The Nigerian football team is ranked 47th in the world and is in the same group as Argentina, Croatia, and Iceland for the upcoming edition.

headlines: 'Jatt Gabru' catch celebration inspired by kabaddi: Dhawan
text: Indian batsman Shikhar Dhawan has revealed that his 'Jatt Gabru' celebration that he does after taking a catch in the field has been inspired from the sport of kabaddi. Dhawan said when he was in Australia, he took Shane Watson's catch and since he likes to watch kabaddi he adopted the celebration. "It's [kabaddi] a manly sport," Dhawan said.

headlines: Alibaba introduces delivery robot which can travel at 16kmph
text: Alibaba has introduced a self-driving robot called 'G Plus' that uses LiDAR technology to navigate at a speed of about 16 kmph. It also uses facial recognition to ensure the right recipient before opening the package locker. G Plus which is being developed along with Chinese company RoboSense is expected to begin commercial production by the end of this year.

headlines: Cigarette stub flares up in dustbin on flight, prompts scare
text: A passenger onboard a Dubai-Mumbai Air India flight prompted a scare after he dropped a burning cigarette stub in the bathroom's dustbin which caught fire. The cabin crew managed to douse the fire as soon as they detected the smoke coming from the bathroom. The passenger who had lit the cigarette was handed over to the police.

headlines: Whatever I've to say, will say at RSS event: Ex-Prez Pranab
text: After several Congress leaders expressed dissatisfaction at his going to an RSS event, former President Pranab Mukherjee was quoted by a Bengali daily as saying, "Whatever I have to say, I will say in Nagpur." "I have received several letters, requests and phone calls, but I have not responded to anyone yet," he added.

headlines: Downfall of empire begins: BJP as K'taka Cong leader resigns
text: After senior Congress leader SR Patil resigned from his post of North Karnataka Congress Working President, the BJP tweeted, "The downfall of the empire that was built after mocking people's mandate has begun." Patil tendered his resignation from the post to Congress President Rahul Gandhi taking moral responsibility for the party's performance in the recently-concluded Assembly elections.

headlines: Opp'n parties joining hands a compliment to PM Modi: Irani
text: Textiles Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday said that the coming together of several parties against the BJP is a backhanded compliment to PM Narendra Modi as it shows they can't win on their own. Further accusing Trinamool Congress of indulging in targeted killings of BJP workers in West Bengal, she said, "Government there has failed to maintain law and order."

headlines: Daimler faces $4.4 bn fine over diesel emissions: Report
text: German automotive giant Daimler is reportedly facing a $4.4-billion fine from the country's transport ministry over a diesel emissions scandal. Reports further claimed that a total of 750,000 Mercedes vehicles could be affected. The carmaker and the transport ministry has agreed to clear the technical issues related to diesel emissions, a spokesperson for the ministry said in an email.

headlines: Tripura will get 56-inch chest if youth becomes fit: CM Deb
text: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Deb on Sunday said that if the youth took up Union Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Rathore's fitness challenge then the state would develop a 56-inch chest. Adding that he himself had accepted the challenge and done 20 push-ups, the CM said, "If all youths do push-ups, they will become healthy and Tripura will become healthy too."

headlines: Vizag cops rescue Indian workers in UAE who tweeted for help
text: Visakhapatnam Police has rescued 22 Indians stranded in UAE's Abu Dhabi after they reached out to the police on Twitter. The unemployed youth were allegedly duped by an agency which promised them employment and sought â¹65,000 to â¹80,000 from each of them. The youth claimed they were treated inhumanely and were not allowed to go back to India.

headlines: Tata Sons rejects US site's claims on $50 mn gift to Harvard
text: Tata Sons has rejected impropriety allegations by a US news website over Tata Trusts' $50-million gift to Harvard Business School in 2010. Referring to the gift, the article said public money was misdirected to the "most privileged and wealthy in the world". Tata Sons also rejected claims the gift agreement was brokered between HBS Dean Nitin Nohria and Ratan Tata.

headlines: South Korea asks India to relax gold and silver import rules
text: South Korea has asked India to remove restrictions on gold and silver imports, which were imposed in August 2017 to check abuse of Free Trade Agreement. Importers are required to obtain a licence from government for importing gold and silver from South Korea. Gold imports from South Korea had attracted only 3% GST, leading to a surge in such imports.

headlines: Jet fuel prices hiked for 11th straight month
text: The country's largest fuel retailer Indian Oil Corporation has increased the prices of aviation turbine fuel for the 11th straight month, adding to the costs of airlines. The state-owned company raised prices by 7% over the previous month, the biggest hike in 17 months. Jet fuel will now cost â¹71,245 per kilolitre on an average across India.

headlines: Please take notice of my friend Chhetri, make effort: Kohli
text: After Indian football captain Sunil Chhetri posted a video urging Indians to support Indian football, Indian cricket captain Virat Kohli posted a video, asking Indians to take notice of his 'good friend' and make an effort. Kohli, who retweeted Chhetri's video, further said, "They are a team of talented players and I have seen them evolve and learn."

headlines: Indian women dismiss Malaysia for 27, win T20 by 142 runs
text: The Indian women's cricket team dismissed their Malaysian counterparts for 27 runs in 13.4 overs to register a 142-run win in their opening match of the Asia Cup, a tournament they have won six times. Not a single Malaysian player scored in double-digits. India's Mithali Raj scored a 69-ball 97*, while Poonam Yadav picked two wickets in two maiden overs.

headlines: 4-yr-old raped, stabbed in Haryana; body found in container
text: A four-year-old girl in Haryana's Faridabad was allegedly raped and stabbed before her body was stuffed inside a huge container. The accused, who worked at the victim's father's shop, had left the shop with the victim, promising to drop her home. When the girl didn't reach home, locals went to the accused's house and found her body in the container.

headlines: Suresh Prabhu asks Airbus to make planes in India
text: Civil Aviation Minister Suresh Prabhu has asked French aircraft manufacturer Airbus to build planes in India under the 'Make in India' initiative. He said the growing Indian aviation sector and stress on regional connectivity provides an opportunity for global aircraft manufacturers. Prabhu visited the Airbus facility in France's Toulouse on Friday during his ongoing visit to the country.

headlines: CBI questions alleged lobbyist on â¹12cr payment from AirAsia
text: The CBI on Friday questioned alleged lobbyist Rajender Dubey in connection with alleged malpractices by AirAsia India in securing international flying permit. Dubey, a promoter of Singapore-based HNR Trading, was questioned about the payment of â¹12.28 crore from AirAsia India on the basis of a "sham contract". CBI alleged the money was utilised for paying bribe to unknown government officials.

headlines: Govt may offer Air India's real estate as sale gets no bid
text: After Air India's sale bid closed without a single offer, the Finance Ministry is reportedly planning to include the carrier's prime real estate to make it more lucrative for the buyer. The properties were earlier excluded from the deal. According to the bid proposal, Air India's buyer was also required to take over a debt of â¹33,392 crore.

headlines: Bank losses wiped out govt's $13 bn capital infusions: Fitch
text: Losses by public sector banks in FY18 have almost entirely wiped out government's capital injections of $13 billion, ratings agency Fitch has said. It added that the situation is unlikely to improve in the current fiscal year. Fitch further said the poor results are due to revision in bad loan recognition norms, that should be beneficial over the long term.

headlines: Employees in Mumbai work longest hours in the world: Study
text: An average employee in Mumbai works 3,315 hours a year, the most among 77 major cities of the world, according to a study by Swiss investment bank UBS. Mumbaikars work more than twice as much as major European cities like Rome (1,581 hours) or Paris (1,662 hours). Mumbai was followed by Hanoi, Mexico City, New Delhi and Bogota.

headlines: I want to do a funny film and show it to my son: Shilpa
text: Actress Shilpa Shetty has said that she wants to do a funny film that is entertaining and if possible show it to her son Viaan Raj Kundra. She added, "I am not interested in doing drama." She further said that she does get film scripts but after a few pages she feels she has done such films before.

headlines: Adding cheap words to remix original songs hurts me: Lata
text: In an open letter on remix versions of songs, Lata Mangeshkar wrote that she feels hurt when the original tune is  distorted and new and cheap words are added. She further wrote, "Totally distorting the song is absolutely wrong." She added, "I request (recording) companies...to look at songs...as something that reflects our culture."

headlines: Pak int'l batsman breaks window on being given 'timed out'
text: Pakistani international batsman Fawad Alam broke a window pane after he was given 'timed out' while playing for the Clitheroe Cricket Club in England's Lancashire League. As per the law 40 of the Laws of Cricket, an incoming batsman must take the position to bat within three minutes of the dismissal of his or her teammate.

headlines: B'desh players sing, dance to Bengali song in dressing room
text: Bangladesh players including captain Shakib Al Hasan sung and performed to a Bengali song named 'Oporadhi' in the dressing room. The video, shared on Facebook by Shakib, shows the players singing and dancing, banging the bench while some holding the bats like guitars. Bangladesh are in India to face Afghanistan in a series, whose matches are being hosted in Dehradun.

headlines: MIT researchers develop world's first 'psychopathic' AI
text: Researchers at MIT have developed an artificial intelligence (AI) tool called Norman which they claim is the world's first 'psychopathic' AI. They claim that Norman was trained on image captions from a subreddit dedicated to documenting death. As a result, where "normal" AI sees a couple of people standing in an image, Norman sees a man jumping from a window.

headlines: Online sellers accuse Amazon of favouring certain merchants
text: A section of sellers has accused Amazon of favouring a particular merchant Cloudtail India over others and plan to take up the issue with the Competition Commission of India (CCI). This comes after Cloudtail posted a net profit (before tax) of â¹1.59 crore in FY17. Interestingly, Cloudtail is a joint venture between Amazon and Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy's Catamaran Ventures.

headlines: Cong leader urges ex-Prez Mukherjee to not attend RSS event
text: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has written a letter to former President Pranab Mukherjee asking him to not attend an RSS event on June 7 in Nagpur. Earlier, P Chidambaram had asked Mukherjee to use the opportunity to tell the RSS what is wrong with their ideology, adding that there was no point in debating why he accepted the invitation.

headlines: K'taka students can now report if teacher uses mobile in class
text: The Karnataka government recently issued a circular banning teachers at private and government schools from using mobiles and allowing the students to report if the ban is not adhered to. Officials said this is aimed at creating the "ideal environment" for teaching, adding that using mobiles was "extremely distracting". School headmaster/mistress will be held responsible if the ban isn't observed.

headlines: Will protect identity of those exposing poll malpractice: EC
text: Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) OP Rawat onâSaturday said that the identities of those using the commission's mobile app to expose electoral malpractices will not be disclosed. "The mobile app empowers the common man to send complaints with evidences," Rawat added. The app, used on a pilot basis in the Karnataka polls, received 780 video complaints of electoral malpractices.

headlines: Will disrupt H'yana CM events if quota demand not met: Jats
text: The All India Jat Aarakshan Sangharsh Samiti has threatened to disrupt Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar's events and rallies if the government did not act to vacate the court stay on their reservation. The association added that it will not allow any BJP minister to hold any function in the state if their demands are not met by August 16.

headlines: 100 buildings in Mumbai declared dangerous by Maha govt
text: The Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority has declared 7 buildings in Mumbai as 'extremely dangerous', while 93 buildings have been declared 'dangerous'. Officials have managed to vacate 286 families from the 'extremely dangerous' buildings and sent notices to the remaining 117 families to vacate. These seven buildings are believed to be more than 50 years old.

headlines: Gauri Lankesh murder accused left us in 2008: Hindu body
text: The Hindu Janajagruti Samiti on Saturday claimed that the man arrested recently for allegedly murdering journalist Gauri Lankesh has not been part of the organisation since 2008. The organisation added that he left for personal reasons and is not in touch with them. Lankesh was shot dead outside her home in Bengaluru in September last year.

headlines: Congress Councillor shot dead at wrestling arena in Amritsar
text: Congress Councillor Gurdeep Singh was shot dead by unidentified assailants at a wrestling arena in a stadium in Amritsar's Gol Bagh on Saturday. Singh was taking a shower after his practice when three masked assailants barged into the bathroom and shot him dead. Before fleeing the arena, the accused fired 17 shots in the air.

headlines: BJP leader threatens govt employee who asked him to pay bill
text: BJP leader Jagannath Singh Raghuvanshi on Saturday allegedly threatened a government employee for asking him to clear his â¹4-lakh electricity bill in Madhya Pradesh's Isagarh. A video of the incident has surfaced online and shows Raghuvanshi telling the employee, "You are living at my mercy here, or else I would have blackened your face and beaten you with shoes."

headlines: Navy sends ship to rescue 38 Indians stranded in Yemen
text: The Indian Navy on Sunday deployed a ship to rescue 38 Indians stranded in and around Yemen's Socotra island after cyclone Mekunu hit the area. The Navy sent its ship INS Sunayna as part of 'Operation Nistar' to evacuate the Indians. INS Sunayna had been deployed in the Western Arabian Sea and was diverted to reach Socotra on Monday.
