headlines: Few days left to avoid trade war between US and EU: France
text: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire has warned that the US has a few days to take urgent measures if it wants to avoid a trade war with the European Union. "It is up to the US to take the right decisions to smooth the situation," he added. This comes after US imposed tariffs on metal imports from the EU.

headlines: Trump calls Kim Jong-un's unread letter 'very interesting'
text: Following his meeting with senior North Korean official Kim Yong-chol, US President Donald Trump said he had received a letter sent by North Korean leader Kim Jong-un and that it was "very nice and very interesting". However, when reporters asked what was written in the letter, Trump admitted that he was yet to open it.

headlines: US has been ripped off by other countries on trade: Trump
text: Following his decision to impose tariffs on metal imports from the EU, Canada, and Mexico, US President Donald Trump on Saturday said, "The US has been ripped off by other countries for years on trade." Adding that the country was having a trade deficit of almost $800 billion, Trump said, "The US must be treated fairly on trade."

headlines: Trump's policies likely to make child poverty much worse: UN
text: The policies being pursued by US President Donald Trump are likely to worsen the problem of child poverty in the country, the UN Special Rapporteur on extreme poverty and human rights has said. Adding that the Trump administration must pay urgent attention, Philip Alston said, "Children who grow up in poverty have very little prospect of escaping from it."

headlines: Whale dies after swallowing 80 plastic bags weighing 8 kgs
text: Officials in Thailand said that a whale has died in the southern part of the nation after swallowing more than 80 plastic bags weighing around 8 kgs. A veterinary team tried stabilising its illness but failed. The nation is one of the world's largest consumers of plastic bags, which results in deaths of hundreds of marine creatures each year.

headlines: Abuse us but please come watch us play: Chhetri urges Indians
text: Indian football team captain Sunil Chhetri on Saturday posted a video on Twitter, urging the countrymen to watch their matches from the stadiums. "To all of you...who donât have any hope in Indian football...Come to the stadium...scream at us...abuse us...who knows one day we might change you," he said. "Please get involved...this is an important time...in Indian football," he added.

headlines: How did Carlos score 'goal that defied Physics' 21 yrs ago?
text: Former Brazilian footballer Roberto Carlos scored a 35-metre banana free kick, called the 'goal which defied Physics', with no direct line to the goal against France on June 3, 1997. The rotations of the ball about its axis created a pressure difference on its sides, making it curve towards the goal. This phenomenon is known as the Magnus Effect.

headlines: Which 3 flowers have been named after PM Narendra Modi?
text: Besides an orchid at National Orchid Garden in Singapore which was named 'Dendrobium Narendra Modi' on Saturday, PM Modi has two more flowers named after him. Last year, a fast-growing Israeli Crysanthumun was named 'MODI' during the PM Modi's visit to the nation. An orchid grown in Sikkim was named 'Cymbidium Namo' in 2016 by the state CM Pawan Chamling.

headlines: Couple abandons newborn fearing shaming for having 4th child
text: A couple from Kerala's Kochi abandoned their two-day-old baby outside a church, fearing being shamed by the society for having a fourth child, police said. CCTV footage shows the 32-year-old father kissing the baby's forehead before abandoning the child. The couple's friends and family mocked them after getting to know about the woman's pregnancy.

headlines: Book claims Sharif was unaware of Pak's Kargil infiltration
text: 'From Kargil To The Coup', written by Nasim Zehra, has claimed that former Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif was unaware of the Army's operation to infiltrate key positions in the Kargil sector which began in January 1999. The Pakistan Army, then headed by Pervez Musharraf, informed about the operation in May, only when he was confronted by Sharif.

headlines: Govt schools to be shut for 5 days over Shimla water crisis
text: The Himachal Pradesh Department of Education on Saturday decided to close all government schools in Shimla from June 4 to June 8 due to the water crisis in the region. Instead, the schools will operate during the annual monsoon break scheduled in July, a circular by the department read. Shimla has been facing acute water scarcity for over 10 days.

headlines: IKEA to enter India with first physical store in Hyderabad
text: Swedish furniture giant IKEA will open its first store in India in Hyderabad this July, Ikea India's Maharashtra market manager Per Hornell has said. "There will be 1,000 products at prices below â¹200 when we open our store," he added. In February, Ikea had opened a â¹100-crore distribution centre spread over 2.3 lakh square feet in Pune.

headlines: Clearly future is female: Sonam on success of 'Veere Di...'
text: Tweeting about the box office success of her latest film 'Veere Di Wedding', Sonam Kapoor wrote, "Clearly the future is female!" "Third highest opener this year for a film without a hero and an adult rating," she added while talking about the film's first day collection. The film earned â¹10.70 crore on its opening day.

headlines: Indian women should know how to drape a sari: Kangana Ranaut
text: Kangana Ranaut has said that Indian women should know how to drape a sari. "I know people who find it 'uncool' to admit that they speak and understand Hindi or that they like Indian food," she added. Earlier, designer Sabyasachi Mukherjee had said, "If...you don't know how to wear sari, I'd say shame on you. It's part of your culture."

headlines: Paid trolls: Swara on exact same tweets slamming 'Veere...'
text: Slamming the exact same tweets from different accounts which criticised 'Veere Di Wedding', Swara Bhasker tweeted, "I wish paid trolls would at the very least re-arrange the sentences and run a spell check." Swara had pointed out how masturbation was spelled incorrectly in the portion of the tweet that read, "We got embarrassed when that masturabation scene came on screen."

headlines: Djokovic angrily breaks racquet, gifts it to fan after win
text: Twelve-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic broke his racquet during his French Open Round of 32 match against Spain's Roberto Bautista Agut. The 31-year-old angrily whacked his racquet into the clay after losing a point during the second set tiebreaker of his 6-4, 6-7(6-8), 7-6 (7-4), 6-2 win. Later, he gifted the racquet to a young fan.

headlines: Ben Stokes pops behind sightscreen, distracts batsman
text: England all-rounder Ben Stokes unintentionally distracted Alastair Cook, who was on strike, by appearing behind a sightscreen during the Headingley Test against Pakistan on Friday. Stokes, who's not playing due to a hamstring injury, briefly halted play due to being in Cook's line of vision during England's first innings. Stokes was seen giggling while trying to hide behind the screen.

headlines: Rohit to throw 'First Pitch' in a Major League Baseball game
text: Rohit Sharma will become the first Indian cricketer to throw the ceremonial 'First Pitch' in a Major League Baseball match. Rohit, who's currently visiting the US, will throw it for Seattle Mariners at their home ground (Safeco Field) in Seattle, Washington on Sunday. MLB teams invite a guest of honour to throw the ceremonial 'First Pitch' to start the game.

headlines: Apple to introduce phone-to-phone augmented reality: Report
text: Apple is reportedly planning to introduce an augmented reality (AR) tool which would allow iPhone users to share AR while limiting the personal data sent to its servers. However, reports did not detail how many players the tool would support at a given time. The tool is expected to be an upgrade to Apple's AR framework for iOS called ARKit.

headlines: US eatery apologises for 'awful' tweets, says account hacked
text: US restaurant chain Buffalo Wild Wings has apologised for "awful" posts that appeared on its Twitter account after it was hacked. "It wasn't funny...the awful posts...obviously did not come from us," the company said. The posts on the account's timeline included a comment about a "secret recipe" ingredient at the restaurant and certain racist and explicit tweets.

headlines: No child labour in India's granite mines: Child rights body
text: After a Netherlands-based body's report claimed granite quarries in India witness slavery and child labour, a National Commission for Protection of Child Rights study has found the claims to be untrue. The report was published in August 2017, after which the NCPCR formed a fact-finding mission. The team observed the granite industry was mechanised, eliminating chances of child labour.

headlines: Sweeper held for creating Punjab Governor's fake FB profile
text: The police have arrested a 22-year-old sweeper in Amritsar after receiving complaints from Governor VP Singh Badnore's office about false information being spread about him on Facebook. Upon investigation, the police traced the sweeper who revealed he had created Badnore's fake profile to earn fame and money. Police also found contacts of several politicians and influential people on his phone.

headlines: Inmates of de-addiction centres sexually assaulted: Report
text: Many inmates of de-addiction centres in Delhi were physically and sexually assaulted, a report submitted by the Delhi State Legal Services Authority to the Delhi High Court has revealed. Over 750 people were kept in these centres against their will, it added. The HC had last month ordered a survey to ascertain if people were involuntarily kept in these centres.

headlines: 92-year-old man gets 10 years in jail for raping minor girl
text: A 92-year-old man in Rajasthan's Bhilwara was on Saturday sentenced to 10 years in prison for raping a mentally-challenged minor girl in 2009. The court also imposed a fine of â¹50,000 on him. The man had raped the girl when her parents were not home and the parents had filed a case against him when they saw her condition.

headlines: News mei aane ke liye anokhe kaam: Minister on farmer strike
text: After several farmer outfits began a 10-day strike across India, Union Agriculture Minister Radha Mohan Singh said, "Media mein aane ke liye anokha kaam karna hi padta hai" (People do unique things to get media coverage). Earlier, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said that protesting farmers are focusing on "unnecessary things" and do not have real issues.

headlines: Woman dies after being hit by water tanker in Shimla
text: A woman in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla died on Saturday after she was allegedly hit by a water tanker. The police registered a case against the driver of the water tanker and arrested him. The incident took place when the woman was walking on the Mall Road with her daughter-in-law and grandchildren, and the driver was driving the water tanker rashly.

headlines: Did not like meeting between North Korea and Russia: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump on Friday said that he "did not like" the recent meeting between North Korean leader Kim Jong-un and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. Trump later said that he could "love it" if it is "a positive meeting". Lavrov and Kim Jong-un had met to discuss bilateral relations and the de-escalation of tensions on the Korean Peninsula.

headlines: CBI books 13 ONGC officials in â¹80 crore scam case
text: The CBI has booked 13 serving and retired officials of ONGC in connection with a â¹80 crore scam. The officials were accused of misusing their positions in giving a contract worth â¹312 crore to Deep Industries for supplying gas dehydration units, causing a loss of â¹80 crore to ONGC. The fraud was allegedly committed by ONGC, Rajahmundry officials during 2014-2015.

headlines: EPFO official arrested by CBI in bribery case
text: The CBI has arrested an official of the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) while allegedly accepting a bribe of â¹20,000. Avinash Patra was arrested at his office while accepting the bribe from a contractor. The contractor, responsible for maintaining gardens on the premises of EPFO offices, had complained Patra demanded a bribe, threatening to create trouble for him otherwise.

headlines: Whirlpool India to acquire 49% stake in Elica PB
text: Whirlpool India has said its board has approved a proposal to enter into a strategic joint venture with Elica and acquire 49% stake in Elica PB India. As part of the joint venture, Elica PB India will manufacture and distribute cooking and built-in appliances under Whirlpool India. Whirlpool India said the deal is expected to close at approximately â¹162 crore.

headlines: Viral 'dancing uncle' made govt body's brand ambassador
text: After a video of him dancing to a Govinda song went viral on social media, engineering professor Sanjeev Shrivastava was on Saturday appointed as the brand ambassador of Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha Municipal Corporation. Earlier, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan praised Shrivastava for his enthusiasm and said, "Believe it or not, there's something special in Madhya Pradesh's water."

headlines: Which celebrities have been involved in betting in IPL?
text: Ex-RR co-owner and Shilpa Shetty's husband, Raj Kundra, confessed to betting on IPL matches in 2013 and was subsequently banned from cricket for life. Late actor Dara Singh's son Vindu was arrested in 2013 for betting in IPL and had called for legalisation of betting. Actor Arbaaz Khan on Saturday confessed he had been placing bets for six years.

headlines: Cat to predict FIFA World Cup match winners by eating mice
text: A cat named Achilles will predict the winners of 2018 FIFA World Cup matches by choosing between two mice, who will be kept in bowls marked with team flags. The cat, who is deaf, had previously predicted outcomes during the 2017 Confederations Cup. In 2010, Paul the octopus had correctly forecasted the outcome of Germany's matches.

headlines: China's Tencent sues rival firm for â¹10 over defamation
text: China's Tencent has sued two firms under its domestic rival Toutiao for defamation, demanding about â¹10 and public apologies as compensation. Tencent claimed that Toutiao intentionally tweaked a state media report's headline to highlight the company's name in a negative story while the essay also criticised other companies. Tencent said it is also suspending collaboration with the two companies.

headlines: Mulayam Singh vacates govt bungalow after 27 yrs on SC order
text: Samajwadi Party patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav has vacated his government bungalow on 5 Vikramaditya Marg reportedly after 27 years, in compliance with the Supreme Court orders. His son, Akhilesh, also vacated his government accommodation and the two will now be shifting to bungalows at Sultanpur Road. Earlier, Mulayam had asked for two years to vacate his government bungalow.

headlines: Air hostess names AI pilot who sexually harassed her for yrs
text: In a letter to Union Ministers Suresh Prabhu and Maneka Gandhi, an air hostess, who claimed an Air India executive sexually harassed her for 6 years, has named him as Captain Darryl Pais. Saying no action has been taken, the air hostess added that when she approached the Internal Complaints Committee Chairperson, she was told, "He flirts with me too."

headlines: Boarding private car big mistake: Abducted man after rescue
text: A 35-year-old HCL engineer, who was rescued after being abducted for eight days, said his biggest mistake was boarding a private car in Ghaziabad. The abductors administered Rajiv Kumar with sedatives after promising to drop him to Haridwar for â¹250. The abductors, who sought â¹15-lakh ransom from his wife, pricked Kumar with pins and exposed him to an air cooler.

headlines: Western Railway to launch awareness drive on excess luggage
text: The Western Railway's Rajkot division is planning to launch a 15-day awareness drive to educate passengers about carrying excess luggage in the trains and the penalty charged on it. While AC first-class passengers can carry 150 kg of luggage, of which 70 kg is free-of-cost, passengers travelling in second-class can carry 70 kg baggage with 35 kg free-of-cost.

headlines: Mayawati vacates govt house which was turned into memorial
text: BSP Supremo Mayawati on Saturday vacated her 10-bedroom government bungalow, which has been converted into a memorial for her mentor Kanshi Ram. Five of six ex-Uttar Pradesh CMs have vacated their government accommodations a day ahead of the Supreme Court deadline. Congress leader ND Tiwari has sought time to vacate his residence on health grounds.

headlines: Govt to refund GST on items purchased for 'langar'
text: The Centre has announced a scheme to reimburse its share of GST on raw material used to prepare langar in community kitchens. The 'Seva Bhoj Yojna' scheme has an outlay of â¹325 crore for FY19 and FY20. The authorities at Golden Temple claimed they paid â¹2 crore as GST for purchasing items for langar between July 2017 to January 2018.

headlines: Willing to take back all 7 lakh Rohingya refugees: Myanmar
text: Myanmar has said it is willing to take back all 7 lakh Rohingya refugees if they volunteer to return. The refugees had fled Myanmar to neighbouring Bangladesh following the Army's crackdown on Rohinyga militants in the Rakhine State last year. Myanmar signed an agreement with UN earlier this week under which the organisation would help in the repatriation of refugees.

headlines: Horror film based on rape-accused producer Weinstein to be made
text: Hollywood director Brian De Palma has said he is writing a horror film based on rape-accused producer Harvey Weinstein. He added, "My character won't be named Harvey Weinstein, but it will be a horror film, with a sexual aggressor, and it will take place in the film industry." De Palma is known for directing films like 'Scarface' and 'The Untouchables'.

headlines: Kriti to feature in a song in Varun, Alia starrer 'Kalank'
text: Kriti Sanon will feature in a song in the film 'Kalank', starring Varun Dhawan and Alia Bhatt. "Excited for this one! Happy to join team 'Kalank' for a super special song and my first with Dharma movies, Karan Johar!" she wrote while sharing a video of a rehearsal session. 'Kalank' will also star Madhuri Dixit and Sanjay Dutt among others.

headlines: Mohanlal pays condolence to fan who died due to Nipah virus
text: Malayalam actor Mohanlal took to Facebook to pay condolence to his fan Rasil Bhaskar who passed away due to Nipah virus infection. "Tribute to my brother Rasil Bhaskar, who had died due to Nipah infection," read Mohanlal's post. Rasil was part of Mohanlal's Balussery fan club in Kozikode, which had celebrated the actor's birthday recently at an old age home.

headlines: No catfights on Ocean's 8 sets, we're friends: Anne Hathaway
text: Denying rumours of catfights on the sets of the Hollywood film 'Ocean's 8', actress Anne Hathaway said, "We're friends. We genuinely love each other and we're so there for each other." "It's a beautiful thing. And I think that's what female friendship is," she added. Talking about herself and the other seven lead actresses, Anne said, "Media...wanted us to fight."

headlines: What was the word that won Indian-origin teen Spelling Bee?
text: Texas' 14-year-old Indian-American Karthik Nemmani won the 91st Scripps National Spelling Bee on Thursday by successfully spelling out the word 'koinonia'. Koinonia is a Greek-origin word that means a 'spiritual community' used to refer to Christian fellowships or communions. Nemmani competed in the championship as a wild-card contestant, beating fellow Texan Naysa Modi to win the title.

headlines: Grandmaster Anand turns chef, cooks fish dish in Norway
text: Indian Grandmaster Viswanathan Anand and China's Ding Liren prepared a fish dish while on a break during the Norway Chess Open while his wife Aruna watched on. "Sometimes I'm moving pieces, sometimes I'm cooking," Anand later tweeted. "My partner cut the vegetables & fish with the same precision with which he does in rook endings," Anand said about Ding.

headlines: Rashid 19 but has mind of a 30-year-old: Afghanistan coach
text: Afghanistan cricket team coach Phil Simmons has said that leg-spinner Rashid Khan is 19 years old but he has "got the mind of a 30-year-old". "He knows exactly what is expected of him," added Simmons about the spinner, who will make his Test debut in Afghanistan's maiden Test against India. Rashid has played just four first-class matches, taking 35 wickets.

headlines: I take out 'kooda' from home every Thursday in Aus: Dhawan
text: Team India opener Shikhar Dhawan, in a recent interview, revealed he takes out "kooda" (trash) from home every Thursday whenever he visits his wife Aesha in Melbourne, Australia. Aesha revealed once Dhawan cooked fish for their daughters when she was not at home and when she returned, the whole house "stunk like fish". Dhawan got married to Aesha in 2012.

headlines: Japan's passport named world's most powerful, India 76th
text: The Japanese passport has been named the most powerful passport in the world, granting visa-free access to 189 countries. The Indian passport secured the 76th rank in the index with its holders getting visa-free access to 59 countries. The Henley and Partners, a citizenship and planning firm, analyses 199 different passports across 227 destinations to list the rankings annually.

headlines: Cong called Rahul to OBC leader's death anniv for votes: BJP
text: BJP spokesperson Rajnish Agrawal has claimed that Madhya Pradesh Congress chief Kamal Nath invited Congress President Rahul Gandhi to the death anniversary of late OBC leader Subhash Yadav to gather votes from the OBC community. "Madhya Pradesh has a huge OBC population...Being in campaign mode, this will be an important programme," the invitation letter accessed by BJP purportedly read.

headlines: Andhra CM terms formation day of Telangana as 'black day'
text: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu termed the formation day of Telangana as a "black day", stating that Congress and BJP "unscientifically bifurcated" Andhra Pradesh to create Telangana on June 2, 2014. Andhra Pradesh is suffering from the split as it has been denied special status, he added. Meanwhile, Telangana CM Chandrashekar Rao said Telangana has become India's "most prosperous state".

headlines: Tourist season, population led to Shimla water crisis: CM
text: Speaking on the ongoing water crisis in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla, CM Jai Ram Thakur on Saturday said the tourist season and the increasing population led to water scarcity. Water available in traditional sources has gone down this year, he added. Shimla is facing acute water shortage for over 10 days, prompting residents to request tourists to not visit the city.

headlines: Move to alternative fuel to solve petrol price hike: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has said India should move to "alternative" fuels to find long-term solution of soaring prices of petrol and diesel. He added people could save up to â¹4,000/month by shifting to alternative fuels. He further said, "India is importing petrol and diesel worth â¹8 trillion and long-term efforts are being taken to bring the expenditure down."

headlines: Man booked for slitting wifeâs throat after argument
text: A case of murder has been registered against a 45-year-old man for allegedly slitting his wife's throat after an argument on Thursday in Mumbai. The man also tried to commit suicide by stabbing himself. The incident took place days after the man's wife told him to stop abusing her during a family gathering, the police said.

headlines: Saudi Arabia establishes Ministry of Culture
text: Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdulaziz issued a royal order establishing a Ministry of Culture, separating it from the Information Ministry. King Salman also reshuffled key ministerial posts, including the Ministry of Labour and Social Development and appointed deputies in the ministries of interior, telecommunications among others. This comes amid attempts to modernise the conservative kingdom.

headlines: Puerto Rico agency sues govt for actual hurricane death toll
text: Puerto Rico's Institute of Statistics has sued the Health Department and Demographic Registry to obtain data on the death toll in Hurricane Maria. This comes after a Harvard University study claimed the actual death toll was 70 times more than the official toll of 64. The institute said the data could help prevent deaths in the event of another storm.

headlines: Have been placing bets for 6 years, lost millions: Arbaaz
text: Actor-producer Arbaaz Khan, who was called in for questioning by Thane Police in connection with a betting racket involving Dawood Ibrahim-linked bookie Sonu Jalan, admitted that he has been placing bets for last six years. During interrogation, Arbaaz revealed he lost â¹2.8 crore in betting during IPL 2017. He also reportedly claimed that several other Bollywood celebrities were also involved.

headlines: Bookie linked to Arbaaz claimed fixing 21-wkt day SL-Aus Test
text: Jailed bookie Sonu Jalan, who is linked with actor Arbaaz Khan, had earlier claimed that he fixed the 2016 Sri Lanka-Australia Test in Galle. The match had witnessed 21 wickets falling on the second day of the Test. Jalan had allegedly fixed the match by luring the pitch curator, along with partners Prem Taneja and Junior Kolkata.

headlines: My soulmate: Boney shares video of Sridevi on their anniversary
text: Boney Kapoor shared a video of his late wife Sridevi while tweeting, "Today would have been our 22nd wedding anniversary. Jaan...My wife, my soulmate, the epitome of love, grace, warmth and laughter lives within me forever." The video ends with a message that says, "You were more than a legend... your vacuum will always be felt."

headlines: Benedict jumps out of taxi, fights off gang to save cyclist
text: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch, known for portraying Sherlock Holmes in the TV series 'Sherlock', jumped out of a taxi to fight off a gang of robbers and save a cyclist in London. "They tried to hit him but he defended himself and pushed them away...Then I think they also recognised it was Benedict and ran away," said the taxi driver.

headlines: BCCI has nothing to do with Arbaaz's betting: IPL Chairman
text: IPL Chairman Rajeev Shukla has said that neither the BCCI nor the IPL has got "anything to do" with the Arbaaz Khan betting case. "The matter is with the police...Both BCCI & ICC have anti-corruption units, police can coordinate with them," Shukla added. Arbaaz on Saturday confessed to betting in IPL and claimed he lost â¹2.75 crore in IPL 2017.

headlines: Indiaâs 1st national sports university to be made in Manipur
text: President Ram Nath Kovind gave his approval for setting up India's first-ever national sports university, in Manipur's capital Imphal. The Manipur government has made available around 326 acres of land for the university. The university will teach sports sciences, sports management, sports technology, and sports coaching, besides acting as a national training centre for several sports.

headlines: CID to probe deaths of BJP workers found hanging in WB
text: The Criminal Investigation Department will investigate the death of two BJP workers who were found hanging in West Bengal's Balrampur, police said. On Saturday, a BJP worker was found hanging from a pole, while another BJP worker's body was discovered hanging from a tree on Wednesday. BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya said that both the deaths were similar.

headlines: Kerala schools to stay shut as Nipah death toll rises to 18
text: After the Nipah virus outbreak in Kerala claimed at least 18 lives, the state government announced that schools and colleges in Kozhikode will remain shut till June 12. The vacations had been extended till June 5 earlier. Meanwhile, Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja Teacher said a second wave of Nipah outbreak is possible in accordance with its global pattern.

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices cut for 4th straight day
text: State-run oil marketing companies lowered prices of petrol and diesel for the fourth consecutive day on Saturday. Prices of petrol and diesel in Delhi were reduced by 9 paise each to â¹78.20 per litre and â¹69.11 per litre respectively. Petrol prices were reduced by 1 paisa on Wednesday following 16-days of increase post the Karnataka polls.

headlines: 2G case special judge delivered directionless verdict: CBI
text: In its appeal against special CBI judge OP Saini's verdict acquitting former Telecom Minister A Raja and others in the 2G Spectrum case, the CBI has said the verdict was directionless and diffident. Adding that Judge Saini "had not applied his mind" while delivering the verdict, it said he made the mistake of taking statements of accused as "gospel truth".

headlines: US vetoes UN resolution giving 'protection' to Palestinians
text: The US on Friday vetoed a Kuwait-drafted UN Security Council resolution that called for an international protection mission for Palestinian civilians. Calling the vote "grossly one-sided", the US ambassador to the UN, Nikki Haley said it didn't blame the Hamas for the violence along the Israel-Gaza border. More than 120 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli forces during months-long protests.

headlines: Chanda Kochhar helped Essar roundtrip â¹453 cr: Whistleblower
text: Shareholder activist Arvind Gupta has alleged ICICI CEO Chanda Kochhar's husband Deepak's firm received round-tripped funds of â¹453 crore from Essar Group, after Essar promoter Ravi Ruia got undue favours from ICICI. The funds were round-tripped into Deepak's NuPower Renewables via a Mauritius-based firm owned by the son-in-law of Ruia. However, both ICICI and Essar have denied the allegations.

headlines: Play dirty to get int'l permit: AirAsia CEO in leaked clip
text: In a purported audio-clip of AirAsia CEO Tony Fernandes, he has been heard telling former CEO of AirAsia India Mittu Chandilya he was ready to get international flying licence for its Indian arm through "dirty way". He said it would take a long time if done in "cleanly". "If you go international, I'll give more planes," Fernandes allegedly told Chandilya.

headlines: Remembering you: Rishi on dad Raj Kapoor's death anniversary
text: Sharing a portrait of his father and late actor Raj Kapoor on his death anniversary, Rishi Kapoor tweeted, "Remembering you." Raj Kapoor passed away due to complications related to asthma at the age of 63. Rishi made his acting debut as a child artist playing the younger version of his father's character in 'Mera Naam Joker'.

headlines: Keep the moves flowing: Arjun to man dancing in viral video
text: Sharing the viral video which shows a man dancing at a wedding, Arjun Kapoor wrote, "The ability to make others want to dance just by looking at you is a...skill...Keep the moves flowing sir." "I can see pure happiness on his face...this...joy is what we actors and performers crave when we let loose in front of the camera," he added.

headlines: Pay scale should be according to box-office success: Kajol
text: Actress Kajol, while speaking about pay parity in Bollywood, said, "The pay should be according to genre, how the box office is and box office success." "Pay equality is coming up to par. To call it a 'trend' would be strange (as it is) something that should be a natural fact of life," she added.

headlines: Madrid captain changes phone no. after injuring player in CL
text: Real Madrid captain Sergio Ramos has reportedly changed his phone number after he allegedly injured Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah in the Champions League final last week. Ramos and his family have received death threats, while Spanish police are investigating the complaints. Salah, who scored 44 goals this season, was injured within 30 minutes in Liverpool's first CL final in 11 years.

headlines: Al-Qaeda warns Saudi Crown Prince over hosting WWE event
text: The Yemen-based branch of terrorist outfit al-Qaeda sent a warning to the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Mohammad bin Salman for hosting the WWE Greatest Royal Rumble in April. "Disbelieving wrestlers exposed their privates and on most of them was the sign of the cross, in front of a mixed gathering of young Muslim men and women," the warning said.

headlines: England football team plays kabaddi for World Cup practice
text: Members of the England national football team played kabaddi as part of their practice session while preparing for the upcoming FIFA World Cup 2018. A video from the session shows striker Jamie Vardy, winger Jesse Lingard, and defender Phil Jones acting as raiders, while Raheem Sterling, Danny Rose, and Ashley Young can be seen playing as defenders.

headlines: US state paying people â¹6.7 lakh to relocate, work remotely
text: The American state of Vermont is paying people $10,000 (approximately â¹6.7 lakh) to relocate to the state and work remotely while residing in the state. The New Remote Worker Grant Program will fund 100 remote workers in 2019, on the condition that they must be employed full-time by an out-of-state business and must work from co-working spaces or home offices.

headlines: TMC is Taliban Congress Party: BJP after workers' death
text: After two BJP workers were found hanging in West Bengal's Balrampur district this week, BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain termed the ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) party as the "Taliban Congress party". Stating that the party should fight the BJP through ideology, Hussain accused the police of colluding with the TMC. Mamata Banerjee should resign as the Chief Minister, he added.

headlines: No objections to bringing investors for Flipkart: Walmart
text: Walmart COO Judith McKenna has said the company has "no objections" to bringing investors for Flipkart if it makes sense for them and the company. "Walmart sees bringing financial investors on board as a way of increasing the funding available to the business," McKenna added. Walmart is set to invest $16 billion in Flipkart in the world's largest e-commerce deal.

headlines: World's first artificial iris approved in the US
text: US Food and Drug Administration has approved the first prosthetic iris that can be implanted to treat patients with missing or damaged iris (coloured part of the eye). Over 70% of the 389 patients in clinical trials had reported decreased light sensitivity and glare while side effects included dislocation and the need for additional surgery for device repositioning or replacement.

headlines: Complaint against UP Dy CM for calling Sita test tube baby
text: A lawyer from Sitamarhi, Bihar, has filed a complaint against UP Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma for comparing Sita's birth from an earthen pot to that of test tube babies. The lawyer said Sharma hurt religious sentiments of the Hindu community. The complaint has been filed under deliberate and malicious acts and punishment of criminal conspiracy sections.

headlines: US, Cuba to permanently restore postal services
text: US and Cuba will permanently restore postal services after running a pilot program for two years, the Cuban Post Office said. The restoration would allow delivering posts through direct flights between Cuba and the US. Direct mail service between the former Cold War adversaries was suspended in 1963 following which mails flowed between them through countries including Canada and Mexico.

headlines: Spain's direct rule on Catalonia ends as new govt sworn in
text: Spain's Catalonia region sworn in a new government on Saturday, ending a seven-month direct rule by the central government. This came on the day Pedro Sanchez was sworn in as the new Spanish PM after Mariano Rajoy lost a confidence vote in the Parliament. Rajoy had imposed direct rule over Catalonia last year after the region held an independence referendum.

headlines: Lunch with billionaire Warren Buffett auctioned for â¹22 cr
text: An anonymous bidder has paid $3,300,100 (â¹22.1 crore) for a lunch with Berkshire Hathaway Chairman and world's third richest person, Warren Buffett. The price was short of the record $3.46-million paid for the lunch in 2012 and 2016. Buffett has participated in the auction for almost two decades and raised over $26 million to benefit Glide, a San Francisco-based charity.

headlines: After Arbaaz, 'Partner' producer summoned for IPL betting
text: Parag Sanghvi, known for producing films like 'Partner' and 'The Attacks of 26/11', has been summoned by Thane Police in connection with the IPL betting case. This comes after actor-producer Arbaaz Khan confessed to betting in IPL, days after the arrest of Dawood Ibrahim-linked bookie Sonu Jalan. Arbaaz had admitted that he had been placing bets.

headlines: Who is Sonu, Dawood's bookie who placed bets for Arbaaz?
text: Mumbai-based bookie Sonu Jalan, who placed bets for actor-producer Arbaaz Khan for IPL matches, allegedly has links with underworld don Dawood Ibrahim. Jalan paid â¹10 crore to a Lankan cricketer to fix a match in 2012 and supplied girls to an IPS officer. He was first arrested in 2008 for IPL betting and claimed fixing the 2016 Australia-SL Galle Test.

headlines: Haven't taken even a 15-minute vacation since 2001: PM Modi
text: Addressing students in Singapore, PM Narendra Modi said he has not taken a vacation for even 15 minutes since 2001. He said he feels that he does not have the right to sleep peacefully, as soldiers bear extreme weather conditions to protect India and several mothers work as labourers to bring up children. He added the "common man" inspires him.

headlines: UK gets its first airport therapy dog to calm passengers
text: The United Kingdom has got its first-ever airport therapy dog to calm passengers traveling to and from the Aberdeen International Airport in Scotland. The airport has kept an Alaskan malamute named Harley, who is seen walking in the airport alongside owner Niel Chisholm. Harley, who was first introduced in March on trial, will be returning to the airport in July.

headlines: MP ke pani mein kuch toh khas hai: CM on dancing professor
text: After a video of a professor from Madhya Pradesh dancing went viral, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan tweeted, "Mano ya na mano MP ke pani mein kuch toh khaas baat hai (Believe it or not, there's something special in MP's water)." Chouhan added that the professor's "enthusiasm has rocked the internet all over India".

headlines: 600 militants killed due to govt's decisive action: Minister
text: Stating that the terrorism in Jammu and Kashmir is at its "last stage", Union Minister Jitendra Singh said, "The decisive actions that the government has taken...600 terrorists have been killed during the period (tenure)." "This is much higher than the number of militants killed during the UPA-I and UPA-II (governments)," the minister added.

headlines: Indian sellers to sell on Walmart post Flipkart deal: Binny
text: While talking about the immediate synergies between Walmart and Flipkart, Indian e-commerce firm's Co-founder Binny Bansal said, "We'll be looking at Indian sellers selling on different Walmart properties across the globe." Bansal added the US retail giant wants Flipkart to expand, as e-commerce makes only 2.5% of the whole retail market. Walmart will acquire 77% Flipkart stake for $16 billion.

headlines: MP farmers make 'kheer' out of milk after stopping supply
text: Farmers in Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur, during the 10-day nationwide strike, prepared kheer out of milk and distributed it among villagers after suspending milk supplies to the cities. On the other hand, farmers in Punjab and Maharashtra were seen spilling milk and dumping vegetables on roads. The farmers are demanding minimum income guarantee scheme and loan waiver among other things.

headlines: Waiter finds â¹25 lakh left by customer, gives it to cops
text: A waiter in a Chennai restaurant on Friday found a bag containing â¹25 lakh, which was left by a customer, and immediately gave the bag to his manager. When no one turned up to claim the bag, the restaurant staff handed over the cash to the police. The waiter later received a gold ring from his employer for his honesty.

headlines: Thailand to send 'world's smelliest fruit' into space
text: Thailand's space agency is planning to send durian, regarded as the world's smelliest fruit, into space. The fruit would be dried and vacuum sealed for the five-minute spaceflight in July. "In the future we want astronauts to be able to eat Thai food...we want to see whether there are any physical changes after it returns to Earth," the agency said.

headlines: Arbaaz is trending for 1st time, tweets user on IPL betting row
text: Reacting to Salman Khan's brother Arbaaz Khan's involvement in the IPL betting scam, a Twitter user wrote, "I guess Arbaaz is trending on Twitter...for the first time." Another user wrote, "Why should Bhai have all the fun?" "Now only Sohail Khan [is] left," commented a user while another comment read, "Shame on everybody who said Arbaaz doesn't have a job!!"

headlines: Kareena, Akshay to star in Johar's production: Reports
text: Kareena Kapoor and Akshay Kumar will be paired together in an upcoming film, which will be produced by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions. They will reportedly be playing a married couple trying to have a child in the Raj Mehta directorial. Reports added that a younger couple will also star in the film.

headlines: Our Dharamji is our Dharamji: Salman in take on Race 3 dialogue
text: Salman Khan shared a picture with Bobby Deol and Dharmendra and wrote, "Our Dharamji is our Dharamji! Chalo in this special case your Dharamji too." The caption is a take on the dialogue 'Our business is our business, none of your business' delivered by Daisy Shah in 'Race 3'. Many social media users had earlier mocked Daisy over the dialogue.

headlines: Saha ruled out of Afghanistan Test, Karthik to replace
text: Indian wicketkeeper-batsman Wriddhiman Saha has been ruled out of the upcoming one-off Test match against Test debutants Afghanistan. The Indian selection committee has named Dinesh Karthik as Saha's replacement for the Test. Karthik, who last played a Test match for India in 2010 against Bangladesh, has scored 1,000 runs in 23 Tests so far in his career.

headlines: Afridi mocks Rashid for catch drop in his final int'l game
text: Pakistani cricketer Shahid Afridi mocked 19-year-old Afghan spinner Rashid Khan for dropping a catch in the former Pakistani captain's last international match when both players were representing the World XI against Windies on Thursday. Rashid pointed towards the lights, signalling that it affected his vision after which Afridi pointed in the same direction, gesturing what went wrong.

headlines: Snapchat partners with Gurugram firm for sales in India
text: In its first attempt to draw revenues from over nine million users in India, Snapchat has partnered with Gurugram based ad-tech firm Tyroo. Tyroo is part of Smile Group which has worked with Airbnb, LinkedIn, and Facebook, among others. Online advertising business in India is estimated between $1.2 billion and $1.5 billion, with over 95% going to Google and Facebook.

headlines: We don't expect hurdles in Flipkart deal: Walmart India head
text: Talking about growing political opposition to the Walmart-Flipkart deal, Walmart India head Krish Iyer said, "We believe that we've met all the legal requirements fully so we do not expect any hurdles." Iyer emphasised that the deal only requires approval by the Competition Commission of India. In May, Walmart agreed to buy 77% stake in Flipkart for $16 billion.

headlines: Artificial nerve system may lend prosthetics sense of touch
text: Stanford University scientists have developed an artificial sensory nerve system that could lend a sense of touch in prosthetic limbs and give future robots reflex capability. The researchers were able to activate a twitch reflex in a cockroach leg by varying pressure on their touch sensor. Further, the artificial nerve was able to differentiate Braille letters in another experiment.

headlines: Plea filed for declaring Ayodhya site as national heritage
text: A plea has been filed in the Delhi High Court seeking directions to the Centre to declare the disputed Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid site in Ayodhya as "national heritage". The petition argued that the site was of archaeological importance and had ancient monuments and antique artefacts. The court directed the petitioner to file a representation before the Ministry of Culture.

headlines: 15 killed due to thunderstorm in Uttar Pradesh
text: As many as 15 people were killed and nine were injured in the thunderstorm that had hit several parts of Uttar Pradesh on Friday. Several trees, electric polls and hoardings also fell down because of the storms. This follows thunderstorm and lighting on Sunday that claimed around 35 lives in Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and Jharkhand.

headlines: Gurugram to get 1,000 cops only for patrolling at night
text: Around 1,000 constables will be deployed only for patrolling purposes at night in Gurugram, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has said. The deployment will be more on the eastern part of Gurugram, particularly Golf Course Road, Sector 29, MG Road and Cyber City, since it witnesses the maximum vehicular movement, Gurugram Police Commissioner Sandeep Khirwar said.

headlines: FIR against CRPF driver after jeep runs over Kashmiri youth
text: The J&K Police has booked a CRPF personnel for rash driving after he ran over three stone-pelting youth, of which one succumbed to injuries on Saturday. The police also filed a case of attempt to murder and rioting against unidentified persons. The CRPF said the driver was trying to escape a violent mob that wanted to lynch them.

headlines: Former J&K CM slams govt as youth hit by CRPF jeep dies
text: Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Friday took to Twitter to slam the government as a 21-year-old youth died after being hit by a CRPF vehicle. Recalling the 2017 incident wherein a Kashmiri man was tied to an Army jeep and used as a 'human shield' against stone-pelters, Abdullah wrote, "Ceasefire means no guns so use jeeps?"

headlines: Indrani hospitalised after chest pain, 2nd time in 2 months
text: Sheena Bora-murder accused Indrani Mukerjea has been admitted to Mumbai's JJ Hospital after complaints of chest pain on Friday night. Mukerjea was earlier admitted in April when she fell unconscious in her prison cell after a drug overdose. Mukerjea, who has been lodged at the Byculla jail since August 2015, has claimed her life is under threat.

headlines: Dust, thunderstorms likely in Delhi-NCR region: Met Dept
text: The India Meteorological Department has said that dust and thunderstorms are likely to occur in the Delhi-NCR region on Saturday afternoon and evening. A dust storm with a wind speed of 40 km/hr had hit the capital on Friday night and significantly brought down the temperature. However, the storm had also led to diversion of at least three flights.

headlines: Concerned over China building dams on Brahmaputra: B'desh
text: Bangladesh has expressed its concerns over reports that China is planning to construct dams on the Brahmaputra river. Bangladesh's High Commissioner to India, Syed Muazzem Ali said that his country was "very concerned about the diversion of water...and is prepared to participate in a joint water basin management," both in the Ganges and the Brahmaputra.

headlines: Ex-Taliban hostage arrested over sexual assault granted bail
text: A Canadian former Taliban hostage, who was arrested on charges of sexual assault after returning home from years in captivity in Afghanistan, will be released from a Canadian jail with strict bail conditions. Joshua Boyle has been ordered to live with his parents and will be under electronic monitoring. Boyle and his wife were kidnapped by the Taliban in 2012.

headlines: Actor-producer Arbaaz Khan confesses to betting in IPL
text: Actor-producer Arbaaz Khan has confessed to involvement in betting in IPL, as per Thane's anti-extortion cell. Arbaaz was questioned this morning and was made to sit face-to-face with alleged bookie Sonu Jalan, who was arrested earlier in the case. Arbaaz reportedly lost nearly â¹3 crore, with Jalan threatening the former that his name will be exposed if he doesn't pay.

headlines: Stop using 'Bollywood' for Hindi film industry: BJP leader
text: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya has decided to write to I&B Minister Rajyavardhan Rathore, requesting him to stop the usage of the term 'Bollywood' for the Hindi film industry. Urging people to stop the term's usage, Vijayvargiya said the term was coined by British broadcaster BBC to "ridicule our industry" by implying that Hindi movies were just copies of Hollywood ones.

headlines: 'Veere...' beats PadMan, becomes 3rd highest opener of 2018
text: With first-day earnings of â¹10.70 crore, Sonam Kapoor and Kareena Kapoor starrer 'Veere Di Wedding' beat Akshay Kumar's 'PadMan' to become the third highest opener of 2018 in India. It is reportedly the first film led by a female star cast to have a double-digit opening in the country. 'Baaghi 2' remains the highest opener of 2018, followed by 'Padmaavat'.

headlines: Quora now available in Hindi, to launch regional languages
text: Question-and-answer platform Quora was launched in Hindi on Thursday while the company's India head Gautam Shewakramani said other Indian languages would be available within a few months. Founded in 2009 by Facebook's former CTO Adam D'Angelo, Quora has 200 million monthly unique visitors. The platform has users including former US President Barack Obama and Flipkart Co-Founder Sachin Bansal.

headlines: Microsoft may acquire web host GitHub for $5 billion: Report
text: Technology giant Microsoft is in talks to acquire web-hosting service GitHub for around $5 billion, according to reports. GitHub, which raised $250 million in funding led by Sequoia Capital in 2015, was reportedly valued at $2 billion following the round. The two companies were earlier reportedly considering a joint marketing partnership valued at around $35 million.

headlines: Google to not renew military drone AI project after backlash
text: Google has said it will not renew its artificial intelligence (AI) drone program for the US military, admitting it faced backlash which was bad for the company. This comes after reports claimed around a dozen Google employees resigned because of the project. Earlier, over 3,100 Google employees signed a petition urging the company's CEO Sundar Pichai to abandon the project.

headlines: Another BJP worker found hanging in WB, 2nd case in 4 days
text: The body of another BJP worker was found hanging by an electric pole in West Bengal's Purulia on Saturday. This is the second such incident after a 20-year-old BJP worker was found hanging from a tree with a hand-written note pinned to his t-shirt on Wednesday. Meanwhile, BJP has alleged that the state's ruling party TMC is behind the killings.

headlines: Japanese woman raped by taxi driver in Himachal's Kullu
text: Police have arrested a taxi driver for allegedly raping a Japanese national in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu on Friday. Reportedly, the accused had offered to take the woman to Kullu to catch a bus and the duo drank beer together, following which he took her to a secluded place and raped her. The victim has been sent for a medical test.

headlines: PM Modi unveils Mahatma Gandhi's plaque in Singapore
text: PM Narendra Modi, along with Singapore's former premier Goh Chok Tong, unveiled a plaque dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi at Clifford Pier in the city-state, where his ashes were immersed. A rendition of Gandhi ji's favourite bhajan 'Vaishnav Jan To Tene Kahiye' was also sung on the occasion. "Bapu's message reverberates globally," PM Modi tweeted after unveiling the plaque.

headlines: Lt Gen who declared surgical strike to head Northern Command
text: Lieutenant General Ranbir Singh who announced the surgical strikes against Pakistan, has been appointed as the new Northern Army Commander. The 58-year-old served as Director General of Military Operations during the strikes against Pakistan in 2016 and against insurgents in Myanmar in 2015. He replaced Lieutenant General Devraj Anbu who was appointed as the Vice Chief of Army Staff.

headlines: Dowry calculator site's creator refuses to take down portal
text: The 29-year-old freelance writer, who created a dowry calculator website, has refused to take down the online portal despite Women and Child Development Minister Maneka Gandhi's opposition to the site. Refusing to put a disclaimer about the site being a satire, Tanul Thakur said, "There is dumbing-down of entertainment in the country...I am not going to do that."

headlines: J&K youth dies after being hit by CRPF vehicle escaping mob
text: A 21-year-old youth in Kashmir on Saturday succumbed to injuries sustained when he and two others were hit by a CRPF vehicle on Friday. Videos and pictures of the incident showing an angry mob attacking the vehicle have circulated online. The CRPF has said the mob wanted to lynch its personnel and the driver was attempting to escape the situation.

headlines: Dendrobium Narendra Modi, orchid named after PM in S'pore
text: An orchid has been named as 'Dendrobium Narendra Modi' as a special gesture for PM Modi during his visit to Singapore on Saturday. The strong and robust tropical orchid can produce upright inflorescence up to 38 cm long with 14-20 well-arranged flowers, the government officials tweeted. PM Modi visited Singapore as part of his three-nation tour.

headlines: Russian pilot found alive 30 years after being shot down
text: A Russian pilot, who was missing presumed dead after his plane was shot down three decades ago during the Soviet intervention in Afghanistan, has been found alive, military veterans have said. A veteran suggested the pilot could be in Pakistan and wanted to return to Russia. Out of around 300 missing soldiers from the war, 30 have been found.

headlines: Will 'compete vigorously' with China in South China Sea: US
text: US Defence Secretary James Mattis on Saturday said the US will compete vigorously with China over its actions in the South China Sea if needed. However, the US is willing to work with China towards a constructive, results-oriented relationship, Mattis added. This comes amid an increased tension between the two nations over China's militarisation of the South China Sea.

headlines: Canada files WTO challenge against US' metal tariffs
text: Canada has filed a World Trade Organisation (WTO) challenge against the US' tariffs on steel and aluminium imports, vowing to work with the European Union which also filed a WTO challenge. Canada earlier announced "retaliatory" tariffs on US imports. The US imposed a 25% and 10% tariff on steel and aluminium imports respectively against the EU, Mexico and Canada.

headlines: Taapsee denies rejecting film over pairing with Nawazuddin
text: Taapsee Pannu has denied rumours of rejecting a film because she was paired with Nawazuddin Siddiqui. "Reasons for saying no vary...but for me, it has never been on the pretext of not wanting to work with a particular actor ever!" she said. Taapsee added, "With the respect I have for a talent like Nawaz, I...wish we work together in future."

headlines: I'm not afraid of losing out on fame and popularity: Shahid
text: Shahid Kapoor has said he isn't afraid of losing out on fame and popularity. "Fame and popularity are by-products. The idea is to worry about what you do as opposed to what happens because of what you do," he added. Shahid further said, "I'm afraid of losing out on opportunities to work with the best filmmakers...or get the best opportunities."

headlines: Apple may let users check time spent on devices with iOS 12
text: Apple has reportedly been working on an initiative called 'Digital Health', as a part of which it will introduce tools to let users monitor the time they spend on their devices. The tools will be available in a new menu inside Settings in the iOS 12 version of the operating system, which will likely be released in September, reports said.

headlines: IT Ministry asks where WhatsApp stores payments data
text: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has asked the National Payment Corporation of India (NPCI) for details about WhatsApp's payments service, including where it stores transaction data. It also asked the NPCI to check if WhatsApp shares data with parent firm Facebook. WhatsApp has been testing the service, which is due to be formally launched in India this month.

headlines: Green tea molecule could reduce heart attack risk: Study
text: Green tea could help prevent deaths from heart attacks caused by fat and cholesterol build-up, according to a UK-based study. Scientists discovered that a compound in green tea dissolves potentially dangerous protein plaques found in blood vessels. The team is working to introduce the compound into the bloodstream without it being necessary to drink large, harmful quantities of green tea.

headlines: Blue whale sighted in Red Sea for 1st time off Egypt's coast
text: A blue whale, the largest animal on Earth, was sighted in the Red Sea for the first time although no one was able to capture its photos, Egypt's environment ministry has said. The "endangered" mammal, which can grow up to 30 metres in length, was brought "to the brink of extinction" in the 1960s by intensive hunting, according to IUCN.

headlines: Neutron star merger likely created smallest known black hole
text: The merger of two fuel-exhausted neutron stars that generated gravitational waves detected last August likely gave birth to the lowest mass black hole ever found, a US-based study suggests. Data showed X-ray radiation levels were far lower than expected for a merged neutron star, implying a black hole formed instead having mass 2.7 times that of the Sun, said researchers.

headlines: Power demand in Delhi rises to record 6,651 megawatt
text: The power demand in Delhi broke its previous record of 6,526 megawatt by rising up to 6,651 megawatt on Friday. The BSES Yamuna Power Limited and BSES Rajdhani Power Limited have long-term power purchase agreements and banking arrangements with other states to meet the growing power demand of over 40 lakh consumers in the National Capital.

headlines: No forensic analysis in 13,000 rape cases every year: Maneka
text: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Maneka Gandhi on Friday said there was no forensic analysis in 13,000 out of 16,000 rape cases every year due to lack of capacity in Indian laboratories. Adding that the weakest part of crime detection was forensic, she said, "The premier forensic laboratory carries out analysis of less than 160 cases a year."

headlines: Don't shout slogans on Op Blue Star anniversary: Akal Takht
text: Ahead of the 34th anniversary of Operation Blue Star, Akal Takht jathedar Giani Gurbachan Singh on Friday appealed to Sikh bodies to observe the day peacefully and to avoid sloganeering inside Amritsar's Golden Temple. For the past few years, the anniversary has been marred with violence and sloganeering inside the temple in support of the Khalistan movement.

headlines: Farmers' protest has no issues, is unnecessary: Haryana CM
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Saturday said the 10-day protest launched by farmers across India does not have any issues and is unnecessary. He added that the farmers are hurting themselves by refusing to sell their produce. The protesting farmers have been demanding a loan waiver, minimum support price for their produce and implementation of the Swaminathan Commission recommendations.

headlines: Summit with N Korea's Kim Jong-un back on for June 12: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump, after meeting with a senior envoy from North Korea, has said a planned summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is back on for June 12 in Singapore. "I think it is probably going to be a very successful...process," Trump added. Earlier, Trump had cancelled the summit, citing North Korea's "anger and hostility".

headlines: Chhetri 3rd best active int'l scorer behind Ronaldo, Messi
text: Indian football captain Sunil Chhetri jumped to the joint-third spot on the list of active international goal-scorers, behind Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi, after hitting his first international hat-trick in eight years on Friday. Chhetri, who now has 59 international goals, helped India thrash Chinese Taipei 5-0 in the opening round match of the Intercontinental Cup.

headlines: MSD told me to call him anything but 'Sir': Yuzvendra Chahal
text: Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has revealed that during India's Zimbabwe tour MS Dhoni, who handed him his ODI cap, came to him and asked to call him anything but 'Mahi Sir'. Chahal said that after bowling two overs, Dhoni came to him and said, "Mahi, Dhoni, Mahendra Singh Dhoni or Bhai. Call me whatever you want".

headlines: Ex-Google, SoftBank exec Nikesh Arora joins US firm as CEO
text: US-based cybersecurity company Palo Alto Networks has appointed Nikesh Arora as its new Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board of Directors. Arora has served Japanese conglomerate SoftBank as President and technology giant Google as its Chief Business Officer in the past. Commenting on the development, Arora said he is "thrilled" to join the company and appreciates its culture.

headlines: Facebook scraps Trending section, to launch 'Breaking News'
text: Facebook has announced that it will remove the 'Trending' section from its platform next week, which was introduced in 2014 to help people discover news topics popular on Facebook. "From research we found that over time people found the product to be less and less useful," Facebook said. The company will instead introduce 'Breaking News' label and 'Today In' section.

headlines: US halts one of the first human gene-editing trials
text: A first-of-its-kind trial planning to use gene-editing on sickle-cell patients has been put on hold by the US drug regulator over unspecified questions. The therapy involves extracting stem cells from a patient's bone marrow and editing them with CRISPR, before injecting them back. Meanwhile, the US' first CRISPR trial, conducted by the University of Pennsylvania, is currently enrolling patients.

headlines: Adivasis declare 'self-rule' in tribal parts of Telangana
text: Around 2,000 hamlets of Adivasi community across Telangana have put up banners declaring self-rule in Adivasi villages to protest against the government's indifference in addressing the conflict between Banjara Lambada community and Adivasis. Using the slogan "Maava Naate Maava Raaj" (our village, our rule), the community has raised black flags in their hamlets as a part of the protest.

headlines: Chinese Army delegation to visit India 1st time after Doklam
text: China has announced that a delegation of troops from the People's Liberation Army will be visiting India this year for the first time since the 73-day standoff at Doklam. The two countries had suspended military exercises after the standoff and recently agreed to resume military relations when PM Narendra Modi visited Wuhan for an informal summit with President Xi Jinping.

headlines: Govt to give rewards up to â¹5 crore for info on tax evasion
text: The Income Tax Department has announced three reward schemes under which people can get rewards amounting up to â¹5 crore if they provide information on tax evasion. While a person can get up to â¹1 crore for giving "specific" information about any benami transaction or property, â¹5 crore can be earned by sharing information on undisclosed black money stored abroad.

headlines: What proposals of Swaminathan report are farmers demanding?
text: Over 100 farmer groups across India have started a ten-day strike demanding complete loan waiver along with the implementation of recommendations of the Swaminathan commission report, which were tabled between 2004 and 2006. The reports proposed distribution of waste land to farmers, increased investment in agriculture infrastructure and strengthening of formal credit system, among other measures.

headlines: India does not see Indo-Pacific as limited members club: PM
text: Delivering the keynote address at Shangri-La Dialogue in Singapore, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India does not see the Indo-Pacific region as a club of limited members, adding that it should be "free, open and inclusive". He said that India's role in the region is not part of a strategy of containment and is not aimed against any country.

headlines: Pak Foreign Minister's disqualification overturned by SC
text: Pakistan's Supreme Court on Friday overturned an Islamabad High Court verdict that disqualified former Pakistan Foreign Minister Khawaja Asif over his non-disclosure of holding a UAE work permit. Asif will be able to contest the upcoming general elections in the country in July. He was disqualified after a petition filed by an opposition leader Usman Dar.

headlines: Gender pay gap costs world economy $160 trillion: World Bank
text: Gender inequality in the workplace is costing the world economy $160 trillion, a World Bank study has claimed. Researchers estimated the losses by analysing the earning potential of the current labour force in 141 countries. Women account for only 38% of their country's human capital wealth and North America and Europe are among regions accounting for the largest losses.

headlines: Sanjay starts 'Prasthaanam' shoot on mom's birth anniversary
text: Actor-producer Sanjay Dutt started shooting for his upcoming production 'Prasthaanam' on June 1, which marks the birth anniversary of his mother and late actress Nargis Dutt. The film is the remake of a 2010 Telugu film and stars Ali Fazal and Manisha Koirala. Sanjay tweeted, "Even now, I feel excited about such new beginnings."

headlines: Would love to be part of 'Avengers: Infinity War': Bipasha
text: Actress Bipasha Basu has said that among the recent films that have released, she would have loved to be a part of 'Avengers: Infinity War' while adding, "I would love to play a superhero." Talking about her future projects, she added, "Unfortunately, a lot of things did not work out for me... but something is coming up very soon."

headlines: Actor Raja Chaudhary booked for drunken brawl
text: Television actor Raja Chaudhary has been booked for allegedly getting into a brawl with a group of people under the influence of alcohol in Kanpur on Friday. "We've registered a case against him and have sent him for the medical tests. Further investigation is underway," said Sanjeev Suman, SP Kanpur West. Raja is known for appearing on 'Bigg Boss 2'.

headlines: Big B shares pic with Ranbir, refers to him as Ranveer
text: Amitabh Bachchan took to social media to share a picture with Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt and director Ayan Mukerji and mistakenly referred to Ranbir as Ranveer Singh in the caption. "We prep for 'BrahmÄstra'... Ranveer, Alia, Ayan... everyone except me... I prep to brush my teeth," he wrote. Posting another picture with them, Bachchan clarified, "Typo... that's Ranbir not Ranveer."

headlines: Menu of first Indian restaurant in UK auctioned for â¹7.6L
text: The handwritten menu of the first Indian restaurant opened in the UK has been auctioned for nearly â¹7.6 lakh. The restaurant, Hindoostane Coffee House, was set up by Patna-born Sake Dean Mahomed at London's George Street in 1810. The menu comprised over 25 dishes, including pineapple pulao, lobster and chicken curries, assortment of breads, and chutneys.

headlines: Fans turn NBA star's reaction at player's mistake into memes
text: After Cleveland Cavaliers' LeBron James reacted frustratingly to a teammate's mistake in the Game 1 of the NBA Finals on Thursday, a user wrote, "When you leave all the doors open but your dog poops in the house anyway." "This is how I look when I'm trying to get my wife to understand what I'm saying," wrote another user.

headlines: Apple allows app updates a day after Telegram CEO's remarks
text: Apple has approved an updated version of the Telegram iOS app, after the messaging company's CEO complained on Thursday that the iPhone maker was blocking updates worldwide since April due to a ban in Russia. Telegram had refused to share its decryption keys with Russian security agencies following which the country banned the messaging app, as per CEO Pavel Durov.

headlines: I know how to do, what to do and when to do: Andhra CM
text: Asserting that he's not interested in becoming a Prime Minister, Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu said, "I know how to do, what to do and when to do." "What I want is good governance...I will work as a soldier," Naidu added. He also slammed PM Narendra Modi and BJP, accusing them of opting "illegal means" to win Karnataka Assembly polls.

headlines: BJP doesn't fear united Opposition: UP CM Adityanath
text: After the BJP's poor performance in two bypolls in Uttar Pradesh, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has said BJP doesn't fear a united Opposition and only focuses on its development agenda. "To stop Modi juggernaut across the country, many Opposition parties are coming together. These parties supported Naxalites and were involved in mass corruption during their regimes," he added.

headlines: IRCTC to get Alphonso mangoes delivered to passengers' seats
text: The IRCTC has tied up with a startup and a self-help group, which is known for supplying good quality mangoes, to deliver Alphonso mangoes to the passengers' seats. The move is aimed at promoting IRCTC's e-catering services 'Food-on-track'. The mangoes will be sold at a discounted price of â¹470 per dozen.

headlines: Night curfew in Shillong post clash between police and mob
text: A night curfew was imposed in Meghalaya's Shillong from 10 pm-5 am after a clash broke out between police and a mob. The clash erupted after a bus conductor was allegedly thrashed by people in the city's Them Aew Mawlong, which led to the mob marching towards the area and pelting stones at the police when they tried stopping them.

headlines: Tirupati temple receives â¹86 crore as offerings in May
text: Lord Venkateswara's hill shrine in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati received over â¹86 crore as offerings, excluding the worth of gold and other items dropped in the collection box, temple officials said. This is 10% more than the amount collected in May 2017. Over 25 lakh devotees visited the temple, while over 13 lakh devotees tonsured their heads as part of ritual.

headlines: 123 Karnataka MLAs won with vote share below 50%: Report
text: As many as 123 out of 222 MLAs in Karnataka won from their seats with a vote share less than 50%, a report released by the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) has revealed. Of the 123 MLAs, 53 belong to BJP, while 48 are from Congress. Five candidates won with a margin of less than 1,000 votes, the report added.

headlines: Asia future better when India, China work together: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Friday said Asia will have a better future if India and China work together in trust and confidence. Addressing an event in Singapore, PM Modi said no other relation of India had as many layers as its ties with China. He hailed the informal summit with Chinese President Xi Jinping as it helped cement Indo-China ties.

headlines: Arbaaz Khan lost around â¹3 crore in IPL betting: Reports
text: Actor-producer Arbaaz Khan lost nearly â¹3 crore by making bets on Indian Premier League matches, according to reports. The revelation comes after Arbaaz was summoned by Thane Police for involvement in an IPL betting case related to bookie Sonu Jalan, who was recently arrested. Jalan had reportedly threatened Arbaaz that if he doesn't pay him, his name will be exposed.

headlines: Cook has not missed a single Test in 12 yrs; sets world record
text: Former England captain Alastair Cook has set the world record for featuring in the most consecutive Test matches, after taking the field in his 154th straight Test against Pakistan on Friday. The 33-year-old batsman's streak had started on May 11, 2006 against Sri Lanka at Lord's. Cook surpassed former Australia captain Allan Border's record of 153 straight Tests.

headlines: Who is the man dancing at a wedding in viral video?
text: Sanjeev Shrivastava has been dubbed as "dancing uncle" on social media after a video of him dancing to Govinda's song "Aap Ke Aa Jane Se" went viral. The 46-year-old engineering professor said he once aspired to become a dancer, adding that he has danced at hundreds of events free of cost. "Dance is a god-gifted talent in me," added Shrivastava.

headlines: World's largest freshwater pearl auctioned for â¹2.5 crore
text: The world's largest known freshwater pearl was auctioned for over â¹2.5 crore on Thursday in the Netherlands. The pearl is known as the 'Sleeping Lion' due to its distinctive shape and once belonged to the Russian Empress Catherine the Great. The auctioneers said that the jewel weighs around 120 grams and is about 2.7 inches long.

headlines: Kerala Public Service Commission defers exams over Nipah
text: The Kerala Public Service Commission has postponed all OMR and online examinations scheduled till June 16 over Nipah virus outbreak in the state. The new dates for the exams will be announced later, an official statement said. This comes after at least 16 people, including a soldier, died and 1400 residents were put under house quarantine due to the outbreak.

headlines: Ex-Finance Minister Chidambaram summoned in INX Media case
text: CBI on Friday summoned former Finance Minister P Chidambaram for questioning in the INX Media case on June 6. This comes after the Delhi High Court directed the CBI to not arrest him till July 3. Earlier, P Chidambaram's son Karti was arrested for allegedly receiving â¹10 lakh as bribe for getting foreign investment clearance for INX Media.

headlines: Kerala Health Minister warns of another Nipah virus outbreak
text: After the death toll from Nipah virus reached 17, Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja Teacher on Friday warned of a second possible outbreak of the virus. "Those who came into contact with the infected would be particularly vulnerable. All such people have to be closely watched," she said. She further asked all such people to contact a special cell.

headlines: EU challenges US' metal tariffs at WTO
text: The European Union has opened a case against the US' imposition of tariffs on steel and aluminium imports at the World Trade Organisation. Calling the US' move "pure protectionism", the EU said it will impose retaliatory tariffs against the country. The US imposed a 25% and 10% tariff on steel and aluminium imports respectively against the EU, Mexico and Canada.

headlines: Idea Cellular proposes to become 'Vodafone Idea' post merger
text: Idea Cellular has called an Extraordinary General Meeting on June 26 to decide on changing its name to "Vodafone Idea" post merger with Vodafone India. The merger, expected to be completed by June, will create India's biggest telecom company. The Kumar Mangalam Birlaâ-led firm will also consider raising funds through non-convertible debentures not exceeding â¹15,000 crore.

headlines: SEBI imposes 3-yr ban on Mallya for illegal fund diversions
text: Markets regulator SEBI has banned liquor baron Vijay Mallya from accessing securities market for three years for illegal fund diversions at United Spirits. The regulator has also barred the firm's two former officials for 1 year. Mallya has also been barred from "holding position as director or key managerial person of a listed company for a period of five years."

headlines: Hema Malini unveils Esha Deol's first look from 'Cakewalk'
text: Hema Malini unveiled the poster of her daughter and actress Esha Deol's upcoming short film 'Cakewalk' and wrote, "Sharing the first look of my darling daughter." The film has been directed by Ram Kamal Mukherjee, who had also written Hema Malini's biography. This will be Esha's first onscreen appearance after the birth of her daughter Radhya Takhtani.

headlines: Zayn Malik to perform in India for first time in August
text: Singer Zayn Malik will perform in India for the first time in August by holding concerts in Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata and Hyderabad. "We are planning to organise his concert in Nepal too," said the COO of JPR Events Vishal Pandey. Zayn, who was earlier part of the band One Direction, is known for songs like 'Pillowtalk' and 'Let Me'.

headlines: Ali wishes Madhavan on b'day with pic from sets of 3 Idiots
text: Ali Fazal wished R Madhavan on his 48th birthday by sharing a picture of the two of them from the sets of the 2009 film '3 Idiots'. "I found this after years yesterday and what a day to come across this one being your Birthday today," tweeted Ali. '3 Idiots' was Ali's Bollywood debut film, where he portrayed Joy Lobo.

headlines: I don't want five bodyguards around Taimur: Kareena Kapoor
text: Kareena Kapoor Khan has said that she does not want five bodyguards around her son Taimur Ali Khan. She added, "That's not how Saif (Ali Khan) and I were brought up and we both came from affluent families." She further said that she wants Taimur to have as normal an upbringing as any other child has.

headlines: Faced innumerable rejections so I resorted to surgery: Rakhi
text: Revealing the reason behind her surgery, Rakhi Sawant said, "I faced innumerable rejections and resorted to surgery to improve my looks and appearance." Rakhi, who was originally named Neeru Bheda, added, "I went into the surgery room as my former self Neeru Bheda but came out as a new and improved version of my own self- Rakhi Sawant."

headlines: Thought he was horrible at 1st: Patralekhaa on boyfriend Rao
text: Talking about her relationship with boyfriend Rajkummar Rao, actress Patralekhaa said, "I didn't like him at all at first. I...thought he was a horrible man because of the character he played in 'Love Sex Aur Dhokha'." Talking about how her views changed after interacting with him, Patralekhaa added, "I couldn't believe this was the same man, he is so sweet."

headlines: Dhoni gives a lot of heart attacks to the opposition: Rahul
text: Team India batsman KL Rahul has said that former captain MS Dhoni gives "a lot of heart attacks" to the opposition. "It was great to see him back as captain (for CSK) and he won the IPL again...Absolutely enjoyed watching him hit those sixes," Rahul added. "This was a big year for me," Rahul said about his performance in IPL.

headlines: English fan jailed for attacking player while holding child
text: Michael Fitzpatrick, the Everton fan who had hit French club Lyon's goalkeeper Anthony Lopes twice in the face while carrying a toddler during a Europa League match in October last year, has been jailed for eight weeks. The incident had happened when players got into a mass brawl after Everton captain Ashley Williams pushed Lopes into the hoardings.

headlines: Dhoni invites Sachin fan Sudhir to his farmhouse for lunch
text: Former captain MS Dhoni invited Team India and Sachin Tendulkar fan Sudhir Gautam to his Ranchi farmhouse for lunch. Sudhir took to Twitter to share pictures from the visit, writing, "Special day with captain cool Dhoni, super lunch with super family at farmhouse. Words can't describe the moments spent."
