The pictures shared by Gautam feature Dhoni's father, wife among others.

headlines: Virat Kohli gifts signed bat to Sonu Nigam's cricketer son
text: Indian cricket captain Virat Kohli signed and gifted one of his bats to Sonu Nigam's son Neevan, who is a self-admitted fan of the cricketer. Neevan took to social media to thank Kohli for the 'best surprise' of his life. Neevan, who is currently training under former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli, posted a picture with the bat alongside Kohli.

headlines: Andhra declares new state symbols after T'gana bifurcation
text: Andhra Pradesh has declared separate state symbols after it was bifurcated to create Telangana in 2014. It declared Blackbuck as state animal, adding that it was symbolic of the state's ability to "take charge in uncertain situations and rise victorious". While Neem was chosen as state tree, Jasmine was selected as state flower. Rose-ringed parrot was declared state bird.

headlines: Muslims offering namaz thrashed inside Haryana mosque
text: A group of Muslims who were offering namaz in a mosque in Haryana's Karnal were allegedly thrashed by a group of around 20 men on Thursday night. The victims also claimed that the attackers vandalised the mosque and broke the speakers. "Those people told us that if we offer namaz again, we will be killed," one of the victims said.

headlines: Chinese man buried inside car as part of death wish
text: A man in the Chinese province of Hebei was buried in his car as part of his death wish, according to reports. The man had reportedly written in his will that he wished to be buried in his own car as opposed to the traditional coffin. A video posted online showed a silver car getting buried purportedly carrying his body.

headlines: CBI summons AirAsia CEO Tony Fernandes on June 6
text: The CBI has summoned AirAsia Group CEO Tony Fernandes for questioning in the AirAsia corruption row on June 6. Fernandes was accused of lobbying government officials to get international licence for AirAsia India. However, AirAsia India rejected any allegations of wrongdoing and said it was co-operating with all regulators and agencies "to present the correct facts".

headlines: Mistry slams Venkataramanan on using his name in AirAsia row
text: Ousted Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry has slammed AirAsia India director R Venkataramanan for using his name in the AirAsia corruption probe. Venkataraman alleged his name in CBI FIR was due to "baseless allegations made by Cyrus Mistry against Tata Trusts Trustees and Tata Sons in his 'revenge' legal actions." Venkataramanan is the Managing Trustee of Tata Trusts.

headlines: Samsonite CEO quits after being accused of lying in his CV
text: World's largest luggage-maker Samsonite has said its CEO Ramesh Tainwala has resigned citing personal reasons, days after he was accused of lying in his CV. This comes after short-seller Blue Orca said that Tainwala falsely claimed he earned a doctorate in business administration from Union Institute and University, US. Samsonite said Tainwala's resignation was in "best interests of the firm".

headlines: India is the world's largest producer of milk
text: India is the world's largest producer of milk, contributing about 19% of the world's total milk production with over 150 million tonnes of milk production every year. India, whose milk output surpasses that of all the European Union countries combined, is followed by the US, China, Pakistan and Brazil. World Milk Day is being observed on June 1.

headlines: Pictures of Arbaaz Khan with alleged bookies surface online
text: Pictures of Bollywood actor and producer Arbaaz Khan sitting with alleged bookies including Sonu Jalan have surfaced on the internet. Earlier in the day, Arbaaz had been summoned by Thane Police as a part of an investigation into the IPL betting scam case. Sonu had allegedly fixed matches in 2015 as well as during the Sri Lanka-Australia series in 2016.

headlines: 'Allah Duhai Hai' song from 'Race 3' released
text: Race 3's new song 'Allah Duhai Hai', the theme track of the 'Race' franchise, has been released. It has been composed by Tushar Joshi with vocals by Amit Mishra, Jonita Gandhi and Sreerama Chandra while Raja Kumari rapped for the song. The film stars Salman Khan, Jacqueline Fernandez, Anil Kapoor and Bobby Deol among others.

headlines: No more comebacks: Afridi on 6th retirement from cricket
text: Talking about his sixth retirement from cricket, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said, "No more comebacks." Afridi played his supposed final international match leading World XI against the Windies at Lord's in a one-off T20I on Thursday. Afridi first announced retirement from Tests in 2006, retiring from all formats in 2011, only to make a u-turn in five months.

headlines: Congress, JD(S) to jointly fight 2019 Lok Sabha polls
text: The Congress and JD(S) will form a pre-poll alliance to contest the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, Congress MP KC Venugopal said on Friday. The two parties formed a post-poll alliance in Karnataka to form the government despite the BJP emerging as the single largest party. Venugopal was accompanied by JD(S) leader and CM HD Kumaraswamy as he made the announcement.

headlines: Don't disturb kin of accused in Tuticorin firing: HC to cops
text: The Madras High Court has asked Tamil Nadu Police to not disturb the families of the missing accused in the Tuticorin police firing case on the pretext of enquiry. It also asked the government to file a response on the circumstances which led to the police firing. Thirteen people protesting against Vedanta's Sterlite plant were killed in the firing.

headlines: Air India sale now matter of national pride: Anand Mahindra
text: After the government got zero bids for Air India, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted that the national carrier's stake sale was now a matter of "national pride". He said, "Zero interest in the sale has demonstrated to the people that tough action towards a turnaround is needed." He added it was time to "turn the crisis into an opportunity."

headlines: Govt to reward up to â¹1 cr for reporting Benami transactions
text: The Income Tax Department has announced a reward of up to â¹1 crore for people reporting specific information about Benami transactions and properties. The government also assured that identity of the people giving information will not be disclosed and strict confidentiality shall be maintained. All persons involved in such Benami transactions could face imprisonment of up to seven years.

headlines: Kerala hospital staff on leave after Nipah virus kills 16
text: A hospital in Kerala's Balussery has asked its staff, including nurses and four doctors, to go on leave from Friday after two people being treated in the hospital for Nipah virus died. The week-long leave is a precautionary measure against the virus that has killed 16 people. Alternative arrangements have been made for the functioning of the hospital, officials said.

headlines: Pak province demands â¹58 cr to run Hafiz Saeed's properties
text: Pakistan's Punjab Province has asked for nearly â¹58 crore from the Finance Ministry to maintain the properties of the Mumbai terror attack mastermind Hafiz Saeed. The government had seized over 200 properties belonging to Saeed's Jamaat-ud-Dawah and Falah-i-Insaniat Foundation amid a crackdown on his organisations and charities. The government has barred all donations to Saeed's organisations.

headlines: Tata Trusts office raided 1st time in 100yr history: Reports
text: For the first time in the over 100-year history of Tata Trusts, the CBI raided the trust's office after its Managing Trustee R Venkataramanan was booked by CBI in AirAsia corruption probe, according to reports. CBI reportedly seized Venkataramanan's SIM card, laptop and computer hard drives. Venkataramanan is a director at AirAsia India, a Tata Group and AirAsia joint venture.

headlines: Varun Dhawan gets injured on the sets of 'Kalank': Reports
text: Varun Dhawan injured himself while shooting action sequences for 'Kalank', as per reports. "The scene was an intense brawl sequence where Varun had to lift and throw a door at a co-actor. The lift was ill-timed, and he ended up injuring his arm badly," reports stated. Despite the injury, the actor will reportedly not take a break from the shoot.

headlines: Preparing with the legend for BrahmÄstra: Alia on Big B
text: Sharing a picture with Amitabh Bachchan while preparing for 'BrahmÄstra', Alia Bhatt wrote, "Prep with the legend." The picture also features Ranbir Kapoor, whom Alia is dating currently, and the film's director Ayan Mukerji. While Ranbir and Alia shot for the film's first schedule in Bulgaria in the beginning of 2018, Bachchan is yet to commence shooting for 'BrahmÄstra'.

headlines: I was destined to portray Sunil Dutt: Paresh Rawal
text: Paresh Rawal, who portrays Sunil Dutt in 'Sanju', said he was destined to play the role. Talking about the special connection he has with Dutt, Paresh revealed that in 2005, Dutt wrote a letter to him. Paresh added that while preparing for 'Sanju' in 2017, he received a call from his wife asking him what to do with the letter.

headlines: 'Toilet: Ek Prem Katha' to release in China as 'Toilet Hero'
text: Akshay Kumar's 'Toilet: Ek Prem Katha' will release in China as 'Toilet Hero' on June 8. 'Toilet: Ek Prem Katha' will be the fifth film that will be released in China in 2018 after 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan', 'Hindi Medium', 'Baahubali 2' and 'Secret Superstar'. Akshay's film is based on 'Swachh Bharat Abhiyan', the cleanliness drive launched by PM Narendra Modi.

headlines: Was 23, married to Tom Cruise when I had 1st miscarriage: Nicole
text: Hollywood actress Nicole Kidman, while opening up about her first miscarriage in the 1990s at the age of 23 when she was married to actor Tom Cruise, said, "It's a huge, aching yearning." "The loss of a miscarriage is not talked about enough," she added. The actress suffered another miscarriage in 2001, around the time Kidman and Cruise were separating.

headlines: Upgrading wife like phone: Sehwag mocks Nigerian footballer
text: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to troll Nigerian footballer Emmanuel Emenike over his marriage to Iheoma Nnadi Amanda, who was crowned Most Beautiful Girl in Nigeria in 2014. "Upgrading wife like phone. Emmanuel please don't be annual," Sehwag wrote alongside a picture which claimed that Emenike had divorced Miss Nigeria 2013 to get married to Iheoma.

headlines: FB 4th most popular online platform among US teens: Report
text: According to Pew Research Center survey, Facebook isn't the most popular online platform among teens in the US anymore and stands fourth. While the most popular online platform among US teens is YouTube, used by 85% of the youth, followed by Instagram and Snapchat, Facebook is used by 51%. In 2015, 71% US teens had said they used Facebook.

headlines: Lost bypolls as voters went for holidays: BJP minister
text: Uttar Pradesh BJP minister Laxmi Narayan Chaudhary on Friday said that BJP lost the bypolls in two constituencies as the party's supporters had left the state with their children for summer vacation. He added that more people vote in general elections. Opposition parties won 11 out of the 14 Lok Sabha and Assembly seats in the recently-concluded bypolls.

headlines: Complaint filed against Flipkart over FDI norms violation
text: Traders' body CAIT has filed a complaint against Flipkart with the Enforcement Directorate for allegedly violating the government's foreign direct investment (FDI) policy. CAIT said under the guise of operating under a marketplace model, Flipkart is engaged in the inventory-based model of e-commerce. "Flipkart is engaging in buying of goods which are ultimately sold on their platform," CAIT said.

headlines: Model explains outcome of black hole consuming a star
text: According to UC Santa Cruz astronomers, a star close to a supermassive black hole in its galaxy's centre "would be torn apart by the black hole's gravity in a violent cataclysm called a tidal disruption event". The stellar material would form a heated accretion disk, which emits vast amounts of light and radiation that can be seen from the Earth.

headlines: PM Modi gives Padma Shri award to ex-Singaporean diplomat
text: During his visit to Singapore, PM Narendra Modi on Friday felicitated former Singaporean diplomat Tommy Koh with a Padma Shri award, India's fourth highest civilian award. Koh has served as Singapore's ambassador to US and UN. He is one of the 10 ASEAN members whom the government decided to felicitate this year on the silver jubilee of India-ASEAN partnership.

headlines: Most rape is just bad sex: Australian author
text: Australian author Germaine Greer has been slammed for saying that most rape is "bad sex" and "doesn't involve any injury whatsoever". Greer, who was herself raped at the age of 18, suggested that the punishment for rape be reduced. Greer further said some rape cases should be considered as "non-consensual...sex" rather than a "spectacularly violent crime".

headlines: Orient Cement drops â¹2000cr deal to acquire Jaypee's 2 firms
text: CK Birla Group firm Orient Cement has terminated its â¹1,946-crore deal to acquire Jaypee Associates' two firms, Bhilai Jaypee Cement and Nigrie Cement Grinding Unit. The deal was terminated as both companies failed to complete the transactions within the stipulated 12 months' time. Jaypee Group has been selling its assets to reduce debt from peak level of around â¹75,000 crore.

headlines: India's GST collection falls to â¹94,016 crore in May
text: The government on Friday said the GST collection in May fell to â¹94,016 crore, down from a record â¹1.03 trillion collected in April. However, the collection is higher in comparison to an average monthly collection of â¹89,885 crore of 2017-18. The GST collection in May reflects better compliance after the introduction of e-way bills, Finance Secretary Hasmukh Adhia tweeted.

headlines: ICC induct Nepal, Scotland, Netherlands, UAE in ODI rankings
text: The ICC has inducted the nations of Nepal, Scotland, Netherlands and UAE in the ODI team rankings. Netherlands gained ODI status by winning the ICC World Cricket League Championship last year, while the rest of the three national sides finished as the top associate teams in the ICC Cricket World Cup Qualifier tournament.

headlines: Actor Arbaaz Khan summoned by police in IPL betting case
text: Actor-producer Arbaaz Khan has been summoned by Thane Police for probe in connection with an Indian Premier League (IPL) betting scam. This comes after the police arrested 42-year-old bookie Sonu Jalan, who had evolved an online betting system for IPL 2018. Jalan is allegedly linked with underworld don Dawood Ibrahim and is associated with many Bollywood celebrities.

headlines: Video of 46-year-old professor dancing at wedding goes viral
text: A video showing a 46-year-old professor dancing to Govinda's song 'Aap Ke Aa Jane Se' at a wedding function has gone viral. Sharing the video, a user tweeted, "Best wedding performance selected by UNESCO," while another comment read, "We all may laugh and this is great entertainment, but look at the brilliant moves... Takes courage to perform impromptu."

headlines: TIME flies 958 drones to make 100-metre-tall cover
text: TIME has used 958 illuminated drones to recreate the magazine's red border and logo for the cover of its latest issue. The swarm of Intel drones was 100 metres tall, which hovered over Folsom, California for a few minutes before returning to earth. The cover photo was also shot by a drone, a first in the publication's 95-year history.

headlines: Don't peddle drugs, instead smuggle gold: BJP MLA in video
text: A video has surfaced, wherein BJP MLA Arjun Lal Garg in Rajasthan purportedly advised the Dewasi community to stop peddling drugs and smuggle gold instead as it's a bailable offence. "If you wanted to do some no. 2 business, do gold. Prices of both are same but it was safer to do gold business than drug", Garg purportedly said.

headlines: 121 planets that may have habitable moons discovered
text: Using data from NASA's Kepler Space Telescope, astronomers have identified 121 exoplanets that potentially host moons capable of supporting life. "There are 175 known moons orbiting the eight planets in our solar system. While most of these orbit Saturn and Jupiter, which are outside the Sun's habitable zone, that may not be the case in other solar systems," said researchers.

headlines: Kerala HC allows teenaged Muslim couple to live-in together
text: The Kerala High Court on Friday allowed a 19-year-old Muslim girl and an 18-year-old Muslim boy to live together, stating it cannot shut eyes to the reality of live-in relationships. It dismissed a petition by the girl's father that she was being detained by the boy. Recently, the Supreme Court had held that adult couples can live together without marriage.

headlines: Magazine slammed for showing Saudi Princess in driver's seat
text: A Vogue magazine cover featuring Saudi Princess Hayfa bint Abdullah al-Saud in the driver's seat has been slammed by campaigners amid the arrests of women activists in the kingdom. Most of the detainees have demanded the right to drive in Saudi Arabia. The magazine issue, which hailed the new Saudi reforms, was criticised for ignoring the restrictions imposed on women.

headlines: Pak govt becomes only the 2nd in its history to last 5 years
text: The Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz party-led government became the second civilian government to complete a full term in Pakistan since its formation in 1947. Pakistan's 2008-2013 government, led by Pakistan Peoples Party, was the first to complete the full five-year tenure. A caretaker government headed by Nasirul Mulk assumed power to oversee the upcoming general elections in the country in July.

headlines: Rajoy's govt 1st to lose confidence vote in Spain's history
text: Spanish PM Mariano Rajoy lost a confidence vote in the Parliament on Friday, making his government the first in Spanish history to be ousted this way. Rajoy's Popular Party was involved in a corruption scandal after being found guilty of illegally funding election campaigns. The Opposition Spanish Socialist Workers' Party leader Pedro Sanchez will replace Rajoy as the newÂ PM.

headlines: ICICI denies reports of asking Chanda Kochhar to go on leave
text: ICICI Bank has denied reports that the bank asked its CEO Chanda Kochhar to "go on leave" until an internal probe against her in Videocon loan row is completed. "She is on her annual leave which was planned in advance," the bank said. Further, the bank also denied that it has "appointed any search committee to find her successor".

headlines: Sanjay, Ranbir to feature in special song for Sanju: Reports
text: As per reports, Sanjay Dutt will feature in a special song with Ranbir Kapoor for promoting 'Sanju'. The song will reportedly be launched a few days before the film's release but will not be part of the film. Sanjay, in six looks from his 20s to 50s, will narrate his story to Ranbir in the song, reports added.

headlines: Ranbir told ex-girlfriend Deepika he is dating Alia: Reports
text: Ranbir Kapoor told his ex-girlfriend Deepika Padukone that he's dating Alia Bhatt before confirming his relationship in an interview, as per reports. "Ranbir and Deepika continue to be close friends and keep each other's secrets...It's rare to find such friendship between exes," reports stated. They had dated each other from 2008-2009 after meeting on the sets of 'Bachna Ae Haseeno'.

headlines: Salah's injury God's punishment for breaking fast: Preacher
text: A Kuwaiti preacher has claimed that Liverpool forward and Premier League's top-scorer Mohamed Salah's injury in the Champions League final is "God's punishment" for breaking his nRamadan fast. The preacher further said that the injury suffered by Salah is "perhaps good" for him. Salah left the field in tears during the final and is currently doubtful for the World Cup.

headlines: Russian cosmonauts play football with 2018 WC ball in space
text: Russian cosmonauts Oleg Artemyev and Anton Shkaplerov played football with the official 2018 FIFA World Cup ball on board the International Space Station. A video released by the Russian state space agency shows the duo, dressed in T-shirts with the logos of the World Cup, shooting the ball and exchanging passes in front of the Russian flag.

headlines: Seen everything now, tweets user on commentator near pitch
text: Reacting to former England captain Nasser Hussain commentating from the field during the World XI-Windies T20I on Friday, a user tweeted, "Hussain is standing at slips and doing commentary...Wow seen everything in cricket now!" Other tweets read, "Nasser Hussain has reached stratospheric levels of annoying now," and, "Please tell me that's a hologram of Hussain...and not the real thing."

headlines: Bypoll results wake-up call for BJP: Subramanian Swamy
text: Talking about BJP's poor performance in four Lok Sabha and ten Assembly seat bypolls, party MP Subramanian Swamy said the results of the polls are a wake-up call for the ruling party. "Party workers should not feel disappointed. It's important to bring popular leaders and the party workers in front...The party shouldn't be run like a corporate office," he added.

headlines: Study shows how Earth slows solar wind to a 'gentle breeze'
text: A US-based study has described the process of high-speed solar wind crashing into Earth's magnetic field and slowing down to a "gentle, warm breeze". As the Earth orbits amid the solar wind in a supersonic speed, it creates a bow-shock wave, which accelerates electrons to a high speed. This causes electrons to breakdown and converts their kinetic energy to heat.

headlines: Cong govt regularised 20k contractual staff for election: HC
text: The Punjab and Haryana High Court on Thursday set aside former Congress Haryana government's decision to regularise 20,000 contractual employees, stating the decision was made to appease voters ahead of state elections. Pointing out that the policy under which the regularisation was made had already been withdrawn, the HC remarked that the government's decision was based on personal benefits.

headlines: Sita's birth showed test tube babies existed: UP Dy CM
text: Referring to popular belief that Sita was born in an earthen pot, Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma said it shows that a concept similar to test tube babies existed during Ramayana. Supporting Tripura CM Biplab Deb's remark that satellites existed during Mahabharata, Sharma said Sanjay presented "live telecast" of Kurukshetra war to blind King Dhritarashtra while sitting in Hastinapur.

headlines: Explain what led to firing amid Sterlite protest: HC asks TN
text: The Madras High Court has sought a response from the Tamil Nadu government on what led to the police firing during anti-Sterlite protests in Tuticorin, in which 13 were killed and nearly 100 injured. It had earlier issued a notice to the CBI over a PIL seeking probe into the firing. The state government has permanently shut the Sterlite plant.

headlines: Man abducts and kills minor cousin for â¹1-crore ransom
text: A 25-year-old man kidnapped and killed his 17-year-old cousin for a ranson of â¹1 crore. The accused had lured his cousin by promising to buy him a computer game and later also tried convincing the boy's father to not inform the police. However, the father called the police, following which the man ordered his aides to kill the boy.

headlines: 312 MP medical colleges allow use of 'Hinglish' in exams
text: Around 312 colleges affiliated with the Madhya Pradesh Medical Science University have allowed students to use 'Hinglish', a mixture of Hindi and English, for answering questions in oral and written examinations. Vice-Chancellor Dr RS Sharma said the decision was taken to help students from rural areas, who weren't able to answer questions due to lack of fluency in English.

headlines: Haryana to supply water to Delhi if it withdraws cases
text: The Haryana government has proposed to supply water to Delhi till the advent of monsoon if the Delhi government withdraws the cases it filed at the National Green Tribunal and Delhi High Court related to their water dispute. Confirming the proposal, Delhi Jal Board Vice Chairman Dinesh Mohaniya said a decision will be taken soon.

headlines: Delhi Metro services halted after staff fight over parking
text: Delhi Metro services between Dwarka Sector-21 and Janakpuri West were halted for over half an hour on Thursday after a CISF sub-inspector allegedly beat a station manager over a parking issue. The manager had objected to the sub-inspector parking his vehicle in the wrong area and ordered deflating his vehicle's tyres. An argument ensued following which the manager was assaulted.

headlines: Family of US man killed by cop gets â¹2.7 in damages
text: The family of a man who was shot dead by a police officer in the US has been awarded 4 US cents (nearly â¹2.7) in damages. The family was initially awarded $4 in compensation, but after the court ruled that the officer was only 1% responsible for the death, the family will get 4 cents.

headlines: US 'losing its cards' in Syria: President Assad
text: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad has said that the US is "losing its cards" in Syria, namely the al-Nusra militant group and the Syrian Democratic Forces. The US has been supporting the two rebel groups to oust the Assad-led Syrian government. Assad further accused the US of bringing "more terrorism, more terrorists to Syria" with each Syrian military victory.

headlines: Sterling Biotech's luxury cars, land worth â¹4,701cr attached
text: The Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth â¹4,701 crore of Gujarat-based firm Sterling Biotech over a â¹5,000-crore fraud. The attached assets include immovable properties of about 4,000 acres, about 200 bank accounts of various linked companies and several high-end luxury cars. The firm took loans of over â¹5,000 crore from an Andhra Bank-led consortium, which turned into bad loans.

headlines: My mom wanted to abort me due to financial condition: Bharti
text: Comedian Bharti Singh has revealed her mother wanted to abort her due to financial conditions. "But eventually she didn't and today she's very proud of me," she added. Bharti further said, "I remember, once, just before my performance, she was admitted to the ICU and I wasn't keen to perform. She motivated me and made sure I gave my best."

headlines: Rishi abuses man on Twitter for criticising 'Sanju' trailer
text: A Twitter user has claimed that Rishi Kapoor sent him an abusive message for criticising the trailer of his son Ranbir Kapoor's film 'Sanju'. Part of Rishi's message read, "What do you know of cinema?" Slamming Rishi, comedian Aditi Mittal wrote, "Rishi...keeps abusing people online, and every news...portal keeps covering his movies... as if this kind of behaviour is NORMAL."

headlines: Teaser of 'Laila Majnu' presented by Imtiaz Ali released
text: The teaser of the upcoming film 'Laila Majnu', presented by Imtiaz Ali and produced by Ekta Kapoor, has been released. The film is said to be a "modern retelling" of the love story of Laila-Majnu. The film's cast is yet to be unveiled. Directed by Imtiaz's younger brother Sajid Ali, 'Laila Majnu' is scheduled to release on August 24.

headlines: Indian couple aged 75+ to attend their 10th FIFA World Cup
text: Kolkata-based Pannalal (85) and Chaitali Chatterjee (76), who have watched every FIFA World Cup since 1982 from the stadium, will travel to Russia for their 10th World Cup. "I'll be nearing 90 in 2022...there's little hope that we'd make it to Qatar for 2022 edition," Pannalal said. Last year, the couple was felicitated by FIFA during the Under-17 World Cup.

headlines: Can read texts of all users on Patanjali app: French expert
text: Calling Patanjali's newly launched messaging app 'Kimbho' a "security disaster", French security expert who goes by the alias Elliot Alderson has claimed that he could access the messages of all its users. Alderson also alleged that Kimbho is a copy of another application. The app was launched by Patanjali on Wednesday, claiming that it will give "competition" to WhatsApp.

headlines: Corruption is on a rise as compared to last govt: BJP MLA
text: Listing the reasons of BJP's loss in Kairana and Noorpur in recent bypolls in Uttar Pradesh, party MLA Shyam Prakash said, "Farmers aren't happy with government...Corruption, as compared to the last government, is on a rise." Prakash also slammed the state government on Facebook, saying that it came to power by using PM Narendra Modi's name.

headlines: Congress leader demands ban on Flipkart over selling weapons
text: Congress' Maharashtra leader Radhakrishna Vikhe-Patil has demanded a ban on Flipkart as it was allegedly found to be the source of purchase for arms seized in Aurangabad. This comes after the Aurangabad police seized weapons including swords and arrested seven people for the same. It was found that the arms were booked through Flipkart and delivered through a courier company.

headlines: Hawaii volcano making its own weather, says US govt
text: Hawaii's Kilauea volcano, which has been erupting for the past several weeks, is creating its own weather, the US Geological Survey has said. The heat released has led to the formation of "fire clouds" over the volcano, which can also form thunderstorms. The sulphur dioxide emissions in the volcanic smog or "vog" could also lead to acid rains, USGS warned.

headlines: PM Modi launches BHIM, RuPay and SBI apps in Singapore
text: PM Narendra Modi launched BHIM, RuPay and SBI mobile payment applications in Singapore at a business event focussed on digital platforms. RuPay was linked up with Singapore's 33-year old Network for Electronic Transfers (NETS), which will allow Singapore's NETS users to make online purchases on e-commerce merchant website in India using RuPay's point of sale terminals.

headlines: 7 dead, 26 injured after bus rolls down a hill in Shimla
text: At least seven people were killed and 26 injured after a Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) bus rolled down a hill near Theog in Shimla. The injured have been shifted to nearby hospitals. While the reason behind the accident is yet to be ascertained, the officials said the death toll is likely to go up.

headlines: All 5 convicted in Bodhgaya blasts sentenced to life term
text: A special National Investigation Agency court in Patna on Friday sentenced to life imprisonment all five people convicted for carrying out the 2013 bomb blasts in Bodhgaya. The blasts relate to a series of around ten bombs that had exploded inside and outside the premises of Mahabodhi Temple. Several people had been injured in the blasts, including two monks.

headlines: EC dispatches teams to study high cases of VVPAT failure
text: The Election Commission on Thursday dispatched two teams to Uttar Pradesh's Kairana and Maharashtra's Bhandara-Gondia to study the reasons behind the "abnormally high" cases of failures and defects in VVPAT machines during bypolls. The teams are expected to analyse factors behind the failure of the machines and cite the general conditions under which VVPATs were operated in the polling booths.

headlines: Farmers dump vegetables, spill milk on roads during protest
text: During their 10-day strike that began on Friday, farmers from various parts of the country were seen spilling milk and dumping vegetables and fruits on roads. The farmers, who are demanding loan waivers and minimum income guarantee schemes, have also suspended vegetables and dairy supplies to the cities. Rashtriya Kisan Mahasangh chief has assured it'll be a peaceful strike.

headlines: Pervez Musharraf's passport, ID card to be blocked: Reports
text: Pakistan on Thursday directed the Interior Ministry to block the national identity card and passport of former President Pervez Musharraf, according to reports. After the suspension, Musharraf's bank accounts would be frozen and his international travelling restricted. He will also be barred from sale and purchase of his properties in Pakistan and abroad, the report added.

headlines: Kim Jong-un complaints to Russia over 'US hegemonism'
text: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un complained of "US hegemonism" to Russia's visiting Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov on Thursday. "As we move to adjust to the political situation in the face of US hegemonism, I am willing to exchange detailed opinions with your leadership," Kim told Lavrov. This comes amid uncertainty over the summit between the US and North Korean leaders.

headlines: Karthik out on 0 as Afridi-led World XI lose to WI at Lord's
text: The former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi-led World XI side lost to the Windies by 72 runs in the ICC Hurricane Relief T20 Challenge on Thursday. Dinesh Karthik, the sole Indian player in the playing XI, failed to score a single run. Afridi, playing his final international match, extended his world-best T20I tally to 98 wickets in 99 matches.

headlines: CWG discus gold-winner retires 2 months before Asian Games
text: India's CWG 2014 and Asian Championships 2013 and 2015 gold medal-winner in discus throw, Vikas Gowda, has announced his retirement from the sport two months prior to the Asian Games 2018. "I was planning to retire after the Asian Games but last week I realised that my body is not responding to training," Gowda said.

headlines: Tabassum Hasan 1st Muslim from UP in Lok Sabha since 2014
text: Tabassum Hasan on Thursday won the Kairana bypolls to become the first Muslim from Uttar Pradesh to enter the Lok Sabha since 2014. She contested as a Rashtriya Lok Dal candidate with support from BSP, SP and Congress to defeat BJP's Mriganka Singh with over 40,000-vote margin. Kairana has 16 lakh voters, of which around 5 lakh are Muslims.

headlines: Tesla car on Autopilot mode crashes into parked police car
text: A Tesla Model S car crashed into an unoccupied parked police vehicle while it was reportedly driving on Autopilot mode in the US. The driver of the car suffered minor injuries in the accident. Commenting on the incident, Tesla said it has "always been clear that Autopilot doesn't make the car impervious to all accidents."

headlines: Gurugram online lending startup raises $10 million
text: Gurugram-based online lending startup CoinTribe has raised $10 million in a Series B funding round led by Sabre Partners. Existing investor Puneet Dalmia also invested in the startup's funding round. Founded in 2015, CoinTribe enables Micro & Small Enterprises and individual borrowers to apply for a loan and also connects them to potential lenders.

headlines: Dark matter may have an electrical charge, study suggests
text: Dark matter, believed to make up over 80% of matter in the Universe, may be electrically charged, Harvard University astronomers have proposed. A project on first-generation stars, made from Big Bang, had found possible evidence for dark matter-normal matter interaction. Researchers said it could only be explained by dark matter having charge equal to one millionth that of an electron.

headlines: Reptile-mammal fossil changes timeline of continental split
text: US researchers have discovered a 130-million-year-old fossilised skull belonging to a reptile-like mammal that weighed around 1 kg. The fossil is evidence that the break-up of Pangaea super-continent continued for about 15 million years more than previously thought, during which the reptile and mammal transition experienced a "burst of evolution" across several continents, said researchers.

headlines: Rape accused abducts, kills survivor's uncle to take revenge
text: A 22-year-old rape accused and his two friends were arrested in Delhi for allegedly abducting and killing the rape survivor's uncle to take revenge. The police said the girl's uncle, who was monitoring legal developments in the rape case on her behalf, was kidnapped by the accused on gunpoint and was shot dead near Palwal in Haryana.

headlines: Australian tourist robbed at Marina Beach in Chennai
text: A 24-year-old Australian woman tourist was allegedly robbed at the Marina Beach on Wednesday. An unidentified man had stolen her bag, which also contained her travel documents. After the woman approached the police, they helped in arranging a temporary visa and lodging a complaint with the Australian embassy. Police have taken CCTV footage of the area to trace the suspect.

headlines: LPG rates hiked 1st time in 2018 amid protests on fuel hike
text: The government has hiked the rates for liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) for the first time this year, amid criticism for not curbing rising fuel prices for at least 16 consecutive days. The prices for LPG have been hiked by â¹2.34 and â¹48 for subsidised and non-subsidised cylinders respectively in Delhi. The rates are revised at the beginning of every month.

headlines: Trump pardons Indian-American author Dinesh D'Souza
text: US President Donald Trump pardoned conservative Indian-American writer Dinesh D'Souza on Thursday, who was convicted in 2014 of violating campaign finance laws and sentenced to five years of probation after admitting the crime. D'Souza, a critic of Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton, had earlier released a film titled '2016: Obama's America' based on his book 'The Roots of Obama's Rage'.

headlines: fbb launches "Chill In Linen Weekend" from June 2
text: Future Group's fbb, is inviting everyone to #ChillInLinen this weekend from 2nd and 3rd June 2018. You can register yourself and shop from the largest collection of linen shirts starting at â¹999 from your nearest fbb/Big Bazaar store or on www.fbbonline.in. Three lucky shoppers will win a year of free shopping.

headlines: I have been a nicotine addict since the age of 15: Ranbir
text: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has revealed that he has been a nicotine addict since the age of 15. "It's taken me trips to Austria, to this doctor who gave me injections in my ears, to help me quit smoking the first time," he said. Ranbir added, "I don't think I have the willpower to give it up on my own."

headlines: Sonam, Kareena starrer 'Veere Di Wedding' hits theatres
text: Sonam Kapoor and Kareena Kapoor starrer 'Veere Di Wedding', which released today, "has a bold theme that defies stereotypes," wrote Bollywood Hungama. The Times of India (TOI) said the film is a "brave effort". Koimoi wrote that it might find a connect but with a very limited range of audience. It was rated 3.5/5 (Bollywood Hungama, TOI) and 2.5/5 (Koimoi).

headlines: World XI-Windies int'l match features on-field commentator
text: International cricket witnessed on-field commentary in the Hurricane Relief T20 Challenge match between the ICC World XI side and the Windies at Lord's on Thursday. Commentator Nasser Hussain stood at the slip position, among others, to witness and talk about the cricketing action, while also chatting up with players at various points. Hussain also talked to fans while on-field.

headlines: Afridi donates â¹13 lakh in charity; given guard of honour
text: ICC World XI team captain Shahid Afridi donated $20,000 (approximately â¹13.5 lakh) in charity following the conclusion of the World XI vs Windies in Hurricane Relief T20 Challenge at Lord's on Thursday. Afridi, who was playing his last international match, was given a guard of honour by his World XI teammates. "No more comebacks," Afridi said later.

headlines: Copy Washington, not Putin: Shareholder to Facebook CEO
text: At Facebook's annual meeting, shareholder James McRitchie asked the company's CEO Mark Zuckerberg to "emulate George Washington, not Vladimir Putin." At the meeting where shareholders proposed to limit Zuckerberg's control, McRitchie called Facebook's current structure, a "corporate dictatorship". Currently, Zuckerberg's shares have 10 times the voting power of that available to regular investors.

headlines: SoftBank to invest $2.25 billion in GM's self-driving unit
text: SoftBank Vision Fund will invest $2.25 billion in Cruise, the self-driving unit of General Motors, the automaker has announced. When the transaction closes, the Vision Fund will invest $900 million, and when Cruise is ready for commercial deployment, the fund will provide the remaining $1.35 billion. GM will also invest $1.1 billion in Cruise, the company added.

headlines: Malala reacts to news of Tesla car falling on her from space
text: Nobel Prize laureate Malala Yousafzai has responded to a fake news article which claimed the Tesla car which was launched in space fell back down to Earth and crushed her. Sharing the article on Twitter, Yousafzai tagged Tesla Co-founder Elon Musk and said, "Hello from the other side." When Musk replied to her, Yousafzai joked she is keeping the car.

headlines: Broccoli seeds sent to space station to study plant growth
text: Six broccoli seeds were sent to the International Space Station as part of the cargo resupply mission launched this week. While three of the seeds were sent as is, three were coated with bacteria that can live inside crops and improve plant growth. The research would help ascertain if astronauts can grow their own vegetables on the Moon or Mars.

headlines: Andhra to give â¹1,000 monthly allowance to unemployed youth
text: Andhra Pradesh government has announced a monthly allowance of â¹1,000 each to unemployed graduate youths in the state with an upper age limit of 35. Claiming the scheme to be first of its kind, state minister Nara Lokesh said, "It will cover close to 10 lakh unemployed youth...There is no restriction on the number per family."

headlines: Dawood Ibrahim aide accused in 1993 Mumbai blasts arrested
text: Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad on Thursday arrested Ahmed Mohammed Lambu, a close aide of gangster Dawood Ibrahim, for his involvement in the 1993 Mumbai bomb blasts that killed 257 people and injured over 700 people. Earlier in March, another suspected Dawood aide, Mohammed Farooq was extradited from the United Arab Emirates for his involvement in the blasts.

headlines: Karnataka CM urges US to open consulate in Bengaluru
text: Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy told US Ambassador to India Kenneth Juster, "US should open its consulate in Bengaluru at the earliest to facilitate, among other things, granting of its visas to the citizens of our state." Kumaraswamy also assured infrastructure, including land, building and support system to set up the consulate, the CM's office said in a statement.

headlines: Delhi on high alert after 12 terrorists infiltrate into J&K
text: The security forces in Delhi and Kashmir have been put on high alert after at least 12 terrorists infiltrated into Kashmir through the Pir Panjal mountains on Friday. The officials reportedly suspect that the terrorists are planning an attack on June 2, the 17th day of Ramadan. The terrorists are reported to be members of Masood Azhar-led terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed.

headlines: Farmers across the country begin 10-day strike
text: Farmers under the banner of Rashtriya Kisan Mahasangh went on a 10-day nationwide strike on Friday, demanding minimum income guarantee scheme and loan waiver among other things. Adding that the protests will be peaceful, RKM's chief Abhimanyu Kohar said farmers will suspend supply to cities and people will have to drive to the villages to buy vegetables or dairy products.

headlines: India to buy missile system from Russia despite US warning
text: India will go ahead with acquiring the S-400 anti-aircraft missile system from Russia despite the US warning against the procurement, reports said. India and Russia are reportedly working to find a solution to avoid US sanctions on defence trade with Russia. The â¹40,000-crore deal may be announced during a summit between PM Narendra Modi and President Vladimir Putin in October.

headlines: Govt approves construction of 1.5 lakh houses for urban poor
text: The Centre has approved the construction of 1.5 lakh houses for urban poor under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana, which aims to build 1.2 crore such houses till 2022. Over 56,500 houses will be built in Andhra Pradesh, 23,060 in Uttar Pradesh, 13,506 in Maharashtra, among other states. Around 47.5 lakh houses has been approved under the scheme till now.

headlines: Indian-American teen wins US' Scripps National Spelling Bee
text: 14-year-old Indian-American boy, Karthik Nemmani, has won the 91st Scripps National Spelling Bee contest held annually in the US, becoming the 14th consecutive Indian-American champion in 11 consecutive years. The eighth-grader from Texas has been awarded a $40,000 cash prize and a trophy after correctly spelling the word 'koinonia' in the final round.

headlines: Canada announces tariffs on US imports in tit-for-tat move
text: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Thursday announced that the country would impose "retaliatory" tariffs on US imports following the US' imposition of steel and aluminium tariffs on imports from Canada. He added that the tariffs will come into effect from July 1. He further said, "We have to believe that at some point their (Americans') common sense will prevail."

headlines: Having a baby doesn't mean I can't wear short dress: Kareena
text: Responding to social media users trolling her outfits and saying she should dress 'like a mother', Kareena Kapoor said, "Just because I have had a baby doesn't mean I can't wear a short dress." "I don't know what's motherly dressing," she added. Kareena further said she comes from a world where women wear what they want to.

headlines: Apple blocked app updates globally post Russia ban: Telegram
text: Apple has been preventing Telegram's secure messaging app from updating globally since Russia banned the service and ordered Apple to remove it from its online store, Telegram CEO Pavel Durov has claimed. Russia banned Telegram in April as "we refused to provide decryption keys to Russia's security agencies" in order to protect user privacy in a "troubled country", Durov said.

headlines: Nokia sells digital health unit within 2 yrs of acquisition
text: Nokia has sold its digital health business along with 200 employees to France's Withings after the Finnish giant acquired it in 2016 for about $200 million. Former Samsung executive Gregory Lee, who pulled Nokia away from the loss-making business to focus on patents would be leaving the company after less than a year in the job, CEO Rajeev Suri said.

headlines: Bypoll results show Modi era to end in 2019: Andhra Minister
text: After BJP won just two out of 14 Assembly and Lok Sabha seats in the recent bypolls, Andhra Pradesh Minister Yanamala Ramakrishnudu said, "The era of Modi will come to an end in 2019 as BJP is going to lose the general elections." "At least now, the saffron party leaders should open their eyes and change their attitude," he added.

headlines: NCP MP slams Maha govt over Chacha Chaudhary-PM Modi comics
text: NCP MP Supriya Sule has slammed the Maharashtra government for providing comic books featuring Chacha Chaudhary alongside PM Narendra Modi as supplementary reading material for school students. Accusing the BJP-led government of using education as a means to promote itself, she said, "Education shouldn't be used for political gains but the government is doing it by bringing marketing into it."

headlines: FreeCharge Co-founder raises $30 mn for new startup: Reports
text: FreeCharge Co-founder Kunal Shah has raised $30 million from a clutch of investors led by venture capital firm Sequoia Capital to start his new venture, according to reports. Shah is planning to start an incubator in sectors like consumer finance, healthcare, and education. In January, Shah took to Twitter to announce that he is "excited to startup again in 2018."

headlines: Waymo's fleet of self-driving minivans to go up 100 times
text: Google spinoff Waymo would be buying an additional 62,000 minivans from Fiat Chrysler Automobiles to be deployed as robot taxis. The deal, reportedly worth over $1 billion, would boost Waymo's 600-minivan fleet by over 100 times. This comes two months after Waymo ordered 20,000 fully electric SUVs from Jaguar, and announced expansion plans for a commercial ride-hailing service by 2020.

headlines: Google lists US party as 'Nazi', blames Wikipedia 'vandals'
text: A Google search for 'California Republican Party' listed 'Nazism' as one of the party's political ideologies until Thursday. Google defended itself claiming that its algorithms are totally unbiased and rely on public information sources such as Wikipedia which faces 'vandalism'. Google has been criticised for undercutting conservative voices and viewpoints.n

headlines: Big Bazaar #Smart Search for exclusive offers
text: India's largest retailer, Big Bazaar brings Smart Search on first Friday of every month for its customers to avail exclusive offers over and above the existing store offers. Customers just need to Add "Big Bazaar" to their search to get these exclusive one-day offers. It will provide exclusive offers on dinner sets, bedsheets, LED TVs, grocery, fashion & more.

headlines: Prince Harry, Meghan to return wedding gifts worth â¹63 crore
text: The newly-wed UK Royal, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, are returning wedding gifts that are reportedly worth nearly â¹63 crore. This comes as UK's Royals are not allowed to accept gifts from private individuals not personally known to them. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex had earlier urged people to donate to charity instead of sending them wedding gifts.

headlines: Harshvardhan starrer 'Bhavesh Joshi Superhero' hits theatres
text: Harshvardhan Kapoor starrer 'Bhavesh Joshi Superhero', which released today, "has an indigenous tone," wrote Hindustan Times (HT). "[Director] Vikramaditya Motwane's take on the superhero genre is worth a look," said The Times of India (TOI). NDTV wrote, "Despite its epic ambitions and technical strengths, the film is anything but super. It was rated 3/5 (HT), 3.5/5 (TOI) and 2/5 (NDTV).

headlines: Ex-VHP head's aide offers â¹2L reward for thrashing Salman
text: Former Vishva Hindu Parishad chief Pravin Togadia's associate Govind Parashar on Thursday announced a reward of â¹2 lakh for anyone who thrashes actor Salman Khan publicly. He accused Salman of hurting Hindu sentiments by naming his production's movie 'Loveratri' and "deliberately" scheduling its release during Navratri. Parashar is the Agra unit chief of Togadia's new organisation Hindu Hi Aage.

headlines: â¹121 crore fine on BCCI, Lalit Modi over 2009 IPL in SA
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday slapped a fine of over â¹121 crore on the BCCI, its former head N Srinivasan, ex-IPL commissioner Lalit Modi and others for violating the Foreign Exchange Management Act. It was investigating the case for the alleged contravention of FEMA in transferring over â¹243 crore out of India to host the 2009 IPL in South Africa.

headlines: Indian umpires to earn more match fees than domestic players
text: India's top 20 domestic umpires will get higher match fees compared to domestic cricketers, as per the revised pay structure approved by the CoA. The umpires' per-day match fees will be increased from â¹20,000 to â¹40,000 for all matches except T20s, while a domestic cricketer is paid â¹35,000. However, the players also get a share of BCCI's profits unlike umpires.

headlines: AI predicts when protest will turn violent based on tweets
text: Researchers at University of Southern California have developed an algorithm that analyses Twitter posts to predict when will protests turn violent. They first analysed 18 million tweets posted during the Black Lives Matter protests in 2015 and found that volume of tweets increased on days with violent protests. They then performed controlled behavioural experiments and found similar correlation.

headlines: Uganda imposes social media tax to stop 'gossip'
text: Uganda's Parliament passed a bill for "social media tax" imposing a daily fee of about 200 shillings (â¹3.57) for using platforms like WhatsApp, Facebook, and Twitter. President Yoweri Museveni argued that social media encouraged "gossip", costing Uganda time and income. The law would come into effect on July 1, however, people have cast doubts about how it will be implemented.

headlines: Who is Aditi Kamal, techie behind Patanjaliâs messaging app?
text: US-based software engineer Aditi Kamal is the woman who designed Patanjali's messaging app 'Kimbho'. Kamal, who has formerly worked at Google, Yahoo, and Oracle, is an alumna of the University of Southern California. Commenting on the development, Kamal said, "After working in the US for over a decade, I wanted to design an application for my country."

headlines: RJD has shut doors on Nitish, no alliance with him: Tejashwi
text: After Bihar CM Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) was defeated in the Jokihat bypolls on Thursday, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said his party has shut the doors on Nitish and won't ally with him anymore. Further asserting that the bypoll results showed that NDA government in Bihar has been rejected, he said, "Opposition unity has started showing its results across the country."

headlines: Kin of 3 Sterlite protest victims refuse to accept bodies
text: Demanding the legal closure of the Sterlite copper plant, the families of three people who were killed in police firing during protests against the plant have refused to accept the bodies of the deceased. They also demanded a memorial for the 13 victims of police firing. The three deceased were among seven victims whose postmortems were conducted again.

headlines: Sita was abducted by Ram: Guj Board's Class 12 Sanskrit book
text: Gujarat Board's Class 12 Sanskrit textbook 'Introduction to Sanskrit Language' claims that in Hindu mythology epic Ramayana, Sita was abducted by Ram instead of Ravana. "There is a very heart-touching description of the message conveyed by Laxman to Ram when Sita was abducted by Rama," a line in the book read. However, an official said, "It's a translation error".

headlines: 60 booked, 2 detained in protest against Shimla water crisis
text: Shimla Police on Thursday detained two people and booked 60 others as residents protested against the ongoing water crisis in the city. While the police released the two detainees later, they booked 60 people on charges of unlawful assembly. Shimla is facing acute water shortage for the past 10 days, prompting residents to request tourists to not visit the city.

headlines: Botswana Opposition opposes using India-made EVMs in polls
text: The Opposition in the African nation of Botswana has opposed using Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) supplied by India for the general elections in the country in 2019. The Botswana Congress Party claimed that the government aims to "rig the elections next year" through EVM manipulation. This comes amid allegations of EVM tampering in India following reports of technical glitches.

headlines: Odisha man 'gambles' away wife, watches her being raped
text: A man in Odisha's Balasore allegedly gambled his wife in a game and then watched her being raped after he lost. The incident took place when the woman's husband asked her to accompany him to a village pond, where their neighbour was waiting. The neighbour then raped her in front of her husband, who threatened her against disclosing the incident.

headlines: HDFC Bank adds â¹23,577 crore to market cap in one day
text: Private sector lender HDFC Bank added â¹23,577 crore to its market capitalisation on Thursday. This comes after Macquarie Capital Securities (India) said foreign investors are likely to buy more than $1 billion of the company's stock when trading window for them opens for a day on Friday. The bank's shares surged over 4%, taking its total valuation to â¹5.54 trillion.

headlines: Govt meets fiscal deficit target of 3.5% for 2017-18
text: The government has met its revised fiscal deficit target for 2017-18 at 3.53% of the Gross Domestic Product, government data showed. The government had originally set a fiscal deficit target of 3.2% of GDP but revised it to 3.5% at the time of Budget 2018. The revenue deficit during fiscal 2017-18 was â¹4.43 trillion or 101% of the Budget estimate.

headlines: Ready to compete with Ranveer Singh: Big B on his look
text: Actor Amitabh Bachchan took to social media to share a picture of himself in a blue framed spectacles, purple shirt and floral print jacket. Taking a light-hearted dig at Ranveer Singh's sense of style, Bachchan wrote, "This is the ultimate limit of excess... ready to compete with Ranveer Singh." Replying to this, Ranveer commented, "Hahahaaa it's a no-contest! I concede!"

headlines: Langer wants players to be good enough for his girls: Gilchrist
text: Ex-wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist has revealed Australian coach Justin Langer wants his players to be "good enough blokes" that he would consider allowing them to marry his daughters. "He's got four daughters...so that's the selection process going on," Gilchrist joked. "Doesn't matter how many runs you score. If you aren't a good bloke, that's what people remember," Langer had earlier said.

headlines: Symonds' wife made butter chicken for me in Aus: Chahal
text: RCB leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, in a recent interview, revealed ex-Australian cricketer Andrew Symonds' wife once cooked his favourite dish butter chicken for him in Australia. Chahal added he is very close to Symonds and loves to go fishing with him whenever he is in Australia. The 27-year-old further said Symonds and his wife call him 'Apples' due to his biceps.

headlines: Player misses Accounting exam to play Test for England
text: England cricketer Keaton Jennings, who has been pursuing a degree in accountancy for eight years, missed an exam on Wednesday after being called up to the national team for a Test against Pakistan. Adding that it's taking himÂ "forever" to complete the degree, the 25-year-old said, "The exam can be rewritten. If I fail it, so be it."

headlines: What is the 'rebel World Cup' taking place in London?
text: As many as 16 teams from unrecognised nations, independence-seeking regions and minority communities are participating in the 'rebel World Cup' taking place in London. The World Football Cup matches are taking place at non-league grounds across the UK's capital. The teams include Tibet, United Koreans of Japan, Tuvalu and Panjab (a UK-based team of Punjabi descent) among others.

headlines: 17-yr-old Nepalese 1st to make int'l debut for combined team
text: Nepal's 17-year-old spinner Sandeep Lamichhane on Thursday became the first-ever cricketer to make his international debut for a combined team (World XI/Asia XI/Africa XI). Lamichhane, who had made his IPL debut for Delhi Daredevils earlier in May, achieved the feat while representing World XI against Windies in a T20I at Lord's in London. The spinner registered figures of 1-0-12-0.

headlines: Corruption in SL cricket goes right to the top: Ex-captain
text: Sri Lanka's World Cup-winning captain Arjuna Ranatunga has alleged corruption in Sri Lankan cricket "goes right up to the top". This comes after a sting operation claimed some recent Tests in Sri Lanka were played on doctored pitches. "What they will catch is the small fish...the bigger fish will get away. I'm so disappointed with ICC's anti-corruption unit," Ranatunga added.

headlines: People missing educated PM like Manmohan Singh: Kejriwal
text: Slamming PM Narendra Modi, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday tweeted that people were "missing an educated PM like Dr Manmohan Singh", alongside a report on the falling value of rupee. Kejriwal has repeatedly questioned the authenticity of PM Modi's educational qualification. Notably, Singh had completed his PhD from Oxford University and was a professor at Delhi School of Economics.

headlines: Man with axe attacks CRPF jawan in attempt to steal rifle
text: A man with an axe allegedly attacked a CRPF personnel in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam on Wednesday in an attempt to steal his rifle but failed. The incident took place when the jawan was deployed outside the Deputy Commissioner's office. The assailant attacked the jawan on his back and tried to snatch the rifle, but fled when the jawan resisted.

headlines: Deputy ranger dies trying to douse forest fire in Himachal
text: A deputy ranger of the forest department died while trying to douse the flames of a forest fire in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba. He was leading a seven-member team in dousing the fire when he slipped on a slope and fell into a gorge, dying on the spot. His body was handed over to his family members after a postmortem.

headlines: India's CWG 2018 gold medalist Sanjita Chanu fails dope test
text: Commonwealth Games 2018 gold medal-winning weightlifter Sanjita Chanu has been provisionally suspended by the International Weightlifting Federation for testing positive for a banned anabolic steroid. ChanuÂ had won gold after lifting a total of 192 kg in the women's 53 kg category at the Gold Coast Games in April. If confirmed, the 24-year-old might lose her Commonwealth Games gold medal.

headlines: Air India finds no buyers as deadline expires today
text: The government has not received any bids for Air India as the deadline for submitting initial bids for the national carrier ended on Thursday. The government had announced that it will sell 76% stake in state-run Air India. The government had set the minimum net worth criteria for companies or consortiums bidding for Air India at â¹5,000 crore.

headlines: Locals crowdfund college Big B failed to build in 10 yrs
text: After actor Amitabh Bachchan's promise to build a college in the Daulatpur village in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki remained unfulfilled even after 10 years, locals resorted to crowdfunding and built a college themselves. Amitabh Bachchan had laid the foundation stone of the degree college named after his daughter-in-law Aishwarya Rai Bachchan in 2008, but the college is still unfinished.

headlines: Teams touring India to play practice matches vs Afghanistan
text: Ahead of Afghanistan's debut Test, against India starting June 14, BCCI has announced that all international teams touring India for bilateral series will play at least one practice match against Afghanistan. The practice matches will serve as international matches for the Afghanistan cricket team. The move is aimed at helping increase the morale of Afghan players and upgrade their skills.

headlines: First J&K club Real Kashmir qualifies for India's top league
text: Real Kashmir FC became the first football club from Jammu & Kashmir to qualify for the top division of India's I-League after claiming the 2nd Division title. They defeated Delhi-based Hindustan FC 3-2 on Wednesday to achieve the feat. With the victory, Real Kashmir took their tally to seven points from three games in the season's final round.

headlines: Harbhajan says Wankhede stadium is 'lucky' for him and Dhoni
text: Spinner Harbhajan Singh tweeted a picture of himself and MS Dhoni with the IPL trophy, calling Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium a "lucky" venue for both of them. "Same ground where we won the World Cup 2011 together...never imagined we would be playing together in IPL for the same team and winning it after 10 years playing against each other's," Harbhajan wrote.

headlines: It was a trial version: Patanjali on withdrawing Kimbho app
text: Yoga guru Ramdev's Patanjali has said 'Kimbho' app was removed from Google Play Store as it was launched on a trial basis for one day. Patanjali spokesperson SK Tijarawala said that this wasn't an official launch of the app and technical work is still in progress. The app garnered over 1,50,000 downloads within three hours of launch, he added.

headlines: UIDAI extends deadline to deploy Virtual ID system to July 1
text: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has extended the deadline for service providers to implement the Virtual ID (VID) system to July 1. The VID aims to give users the option of not sharing their Aadhaar number with service providers and give them a 16-digit temporarily generated VID instead. Agencies which undertake Aadhaar authentication have to mandatorily accept VIDs.

headlines: Ex-UP CMs Mulayam, Akhilesh vacate government bungalows
text: Former Uttar Pradesh CMs Mulayam Singh Yadav and Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday vacated their official residences in Lucknow in compliance with the Supreme Court order. This comes after the father-son duo moved the apex court seeking appropriate time to vacate the residential accommodation. The SC earlier this month said former CMs cannot live in government accommodations after stepping down.

headlines: US imposes steel, aluminium tariffs on EU, Canada and Mexico
text: The US on Thursday imposed tariffs on steel and aluminium imports from Canada, Mexico and the European Union (EU). While a 25% tariff will be imposed on steel imports, a tariff of 10% will be imposed on aluminium imports. The EU, Canada and Mexico were temporarily exempted from the tariffs when they were announced by the US two months ago.

headlines: Romania, Lithuania hosted secret CIA jails: EU Court
text: Romania and Lithuania hosted secret jails operated by the US intelligence agency CIA, the European Court of Human Rights said on Thursday. It ruled both the countries violated the rights of two al-Qaeda terror suspects who were tortured in detention. The ruling came in cases filed on behalf of the detainees, who are currently held in Cuba's Guantanamo Bay prison.

headlines: US allows terminally ill patients to try unapproved drugs
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday signed the 'Right to Try' bill that gives terminally ill patients the right to seek experimental treatments not approved by the government. Patients seeking access to the experimental drugs will no longer need the permission of the Food and Drug Administration. They will only require the approval of their physician and the drug manufacturer.

headlines: RCom's fourth quarter loss widens to â¹19,728 crore
text: Billionaire Anil Ambani-led Reliance Communications on Wednesday posted a net loss of â¹19,728 crore compared to a loss of â¹1,130 crore during the same period previous year. The loss widened because of a one-time charge the telco had to factor in due to the closure of its wireless assets. The company's revenue saw a nearly 40% drop to â¹949 crore.

headlines: Bad loans of 38 banks collectively crossed â¹10 lakh cr in Q4
text: Thirty-eight listed Indian banks accounted for gross bad loans totalling over â¹10.17 lakh crore for the quarter ended March. The gross bad loans of all the banks in the country had amounted to â¹8.40 lakh crore in the quarter ended December 31, 2017. India's largest lender SBI reported gross bad loans of â¹2.23 lakh crore in the March quarter.

headlines: SEBI imposes â¹10 lakh fine on DLF over wrong disclosure
text: Markets regulator SEBI has imposed a fine of â¹10 lakh on real-estate firm DLF for making "wrong disclosures" on utilisation of funds raised through Initial Public Offering. SEBI said it found the company made wrong disclosures regarding fund utilisation over prepayment of loans pertaining to the September 2007 quarter. SEBI conducted investigation in the stock of DLF for June-December, 2007.

headlines: Indian-American ex-CEO of IT firm pleads guilty to bribery
text: An Indian-American former CEO of an IT company has pleaded guilty for his role in bribing an official from the US city of Detroit. Parimal Mehta admitted to hand-delivering over $6,500 (â¹4.38 lakh) to a former Director of the city's Office of Departmental Technology Services between 2009 and 2016. Mehta sought preferential treatment for his company in various city projects.

headlines: Baahubali broke barriers of what regional cinema can do: Rana
text: Rana Daggubati has said the 'Baahubali' film franchise broke most barriers of what regional cinema can do nationally. "I hope that more films like these are made, and can make the impact that 'Baahubali' was able to," he added. Rana further said he falls under a category of neutral actors as he's constantly involved in content with no regional barriers.

headlines: Mallya quits as Force India Director, son to replace him
text: Vijay Mallya has quit as Force India's Director butÂ will remain a shareholder and Team Principal of the Formula 1 side. Vijay said that he took the decision so that his son Siddarth could replace him as the Director. The Indian businessman was part of a consortium that bought the Spyker team in 2007 and renamed it Force India.

headlines: Taking 2 steps back for giant leap: Rajnath on bypoll result
text: After BJP won only one out of four Lok Sabha seats in bypolls held across different states, Home Minister Rajnath Singh said, "To take a giant leap, you'll have to take two steps back. We (BJP) will take a giant leap in future." While BJP won Lok Sabha seat from Maharashtra's Palghar, it lost UP's Kairana seat to RLD.

headlines: Not getting death threats: Cop who saved Muslim boy from mob
text: The Sikh policeman who saved a Muslim boy from a mob in Uttarakhand's Ramnagar has denied reports claiming that he has been receiving death threats. "There's no such thing. In fact, I got to know about this from other people. I have been enjoying my holiday. There is no question of me receiving death threats," he said.

headlines: I invite you all to attend Kumbh next year: PM in Indonesia
text: Addressing a gathering in Indonesia on Wednesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Many of you may never have been to India. I invite you all to come to India for the Kumbh...next year." Further talking about the ties between the two nations, he said, "India and Indonesia are tied in a cultural relationship. We have a very old bond."

headlines: 22-year-old stabs, kills man for money to buy beer in Delhi
text: A 22-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stabbing a man 14 times and robbing him in Delhi to get money for buying beer, the police said on Wednesday. The accused, who was drunk at the time, had stolen the knife from a nearby meat shop to rob someone. He stabbed the victim when he resisted.

headlines: Chhattisgarh villagers forced to drink dirty water amid crisis
text: Residents of Chhattisgarh's Jheeram village reportedly have been forced to consume dirty water due to a water crisis. Emphasising that the village lacks facilities like education, water, and electricity, locals said that the toilets made by the government can't be used due to lack of water. Residents also said that they have to walk long distances to get drinking water.

headlines: Russia gifts North Korea's Kim Jong-un a 'box for secrets'
text: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Thursday gifted North Korean leader Kim Jong-un a box, saying he could lock "secret things" in it. Lavrov met Kim Jong-un during his visit to Pyongyang where the two leaders discussed inter-Korean relations and de-escalation of tensions on the Korean Peninsula. This comes ahead of Kim Jong-un's meeting with US President Donald Trump.

headlines: Israel, Myanmar to 'correct' each other's History textbooks
text: Israel and Myanmar have signed an agreement in the field of education that would allow both the nations to correct details in each other's History textbooks. The agreement calls for developing an educational programme in Myanmar to teach about the "Holocaust and its negative consequences". The pact also encourages teacher and student educational exchanges between the two countries.

headlines: Kims got mixed up, tweets user on Trump-Kim Kardashian meet
text: Reacting to a meeting between US President Donald Trump and reality television personality Kim Kardashian, a Twitter user wrote, "Trump is meeting with Kim Kardashian...because he couldn't pull off a meeting with Kim Jong-un." While one user tweeted, "Trump tried to invite Kim Jong-un but clicked on wrong Kim", another wrote, "When Reality Stars run our country.. idiocracy is real."

headlines: Korean Air HQ raided over embezzlement by founding family
text: South Korean prosecutors have raided Korean Air headquarters over suspected tax evasion, embezzlement and breach of trust by family of Chairman Cho Yang-ho. The investigation is the latest involving the family-controlled conglomerate. The chairman's older daughter was jailed after she threw a tantrum on a flight in 2014 while her younger daughter is under investigation for assaulting a colleague.

headlines: Mayawati sends bungalow key via post after govt refuses it
text: Former Uttar Pradesh CM Mayawati sent the keys of a government-allotted bungalow in Lucknow to the state authorities through Speed Post after a government estates officer refused to accept them. The officer insisted Mayawati has another 10-bedroom bungalow that she has to vacate, but refused to do so. Mayawati reasoned the bungalow has been converted into the Kanshi Ram Memorial.

headlines: India's GDP growth up at 7.7% in Q4, highest since note ban
text: India's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth surged to 7.7% in the fourth quarter of 2017-18, the highest since demonetisation. India retained the position of world's fastest-growing major economy in the January-March quarter, surpassing China's growth of 6.8%. The economy grew at 7.6% in Gross Value Added (GVA) terms, according to the government data.

headlines: Real Madrid boss quits 5 days after record 3rd CL title win
text: Zinedine Zidane has stepped down as Real Madrid manager, five days after leading them to a record third straight Champions League title victory. The 45-year-old was appointed as head coach in January 2016, guiding the club to one La Liga title, one Spanish Super Cup and three CL titles. "Big players need a change," Zidane said while announcing his decision.

headlines: Teen revealed plans in video before killing 17 at US school
text: A video of the 19-year-old Florida school shooter, who killed 17 people, detailing his plans before carrying out the massacre has been released. "When you see me on news, you'll all know who I am...You're all going to die," Nikolas Cruz can be heard saying. If convicted, Cruz could face death penalty for the shooting that took place in February.

headlines: JD(S) to get Finance, Congress to get Home Dept in K'taka
text: The Finance portfolio in the newly elected Karnataka government will go to the JD(S), while the Home Department will go to the Congress, reports said. This comes after five rounds of talks between the two parties, which are in an alliance in the state. Congress President Rahul Gandhi is on board and spoke to leaders from the US, reports added.

headlines: WhatsApp to 'predict' photos users will share on app: Report
text: WhatsApp is reportedly rolling out a feature called 'Predicted Upload' which can 'predict' the photos a user will share with other contacts. The feature redirects users in the 'Edit Photo' section while sending the image to the server in the background. Earlier, WhatsApp released a feature which allowed users to download deleted media, including images, videos, and voice messages.

headlines: Naxals burn construction vehicles, abduct labourers in Bihar
text: Naxals on Thursday set four road construction vehicles and three other vehicles on fire in Bihar's Munger. Confirming the incident, the police said the Naxals had also abducted eight labourers but freed four of them later. A search operation has been launched to nab the Naxals and rescue the remaining labourers.

headlines: ASI removes over 22 lakh kg of dirt from Red Fort terrace
text: The Archaeological Survey of India has removed 22 lakh kg of dirt from the Red Fort's terrace, preventing the structure's collapse, ASI's Joint Director General Janhwij Sharma said. Claiming that the cleaning process has been undertaken for the first time in about 100 years, Sharma added, "The idea was to restore the terrace of the Lahori Gate (main entrance)."

headlines: Maharashtra Agriculture Minister dies of cardiac arrest
text: Maharashtra Agriculture Minister Pandurang Pundalik Fundkar died aged 67 on Thursday after suffering a cardiac arrest while he was in Mumbai's KJ Somaiya Hospital. He had been hospitalised since two days. "[Pandurang] made an invaluable contribution towards building the BJP in Maharashtra. He was also at the forefront of serving the farmers of the state," PM Narendra Modi tweeted.

headlines: Mumbai civic body identifies 299 spots prone to landslides
text: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has identified 299 spots across the city that are prone to landslides in preparation for the monsoon. The highest number of such spots have been identified in the hilly parts of Bhandup, followed by Ghatkopar. "We have built retaining walls at half the locations in Ghatkopar (west), and put up caution notices everywhere," officials said.

headlines: Ex-BSF official among 5 held guilty in 2006 J&K sex scandal
text: A CBI court on Wednesday held five people, including a former BSF deputy inspector general and former deputy superintendent of police, guilty of rape in a 2006 J&K sex scandal case. The scandal had surfaced after a pornographic CD involving a 15-year-old was handed over to the police. Police had subsequently booked the racket's kingpin, who was running a brothel.

headlines: Malaysia sets up crowdfunding to pay off national debt
text: Malaysia has set up a trust fund for the public to donate money to help the government repay the country's debt. Malaysia's Finance Ministry said the fund would be called Malaysia Hope Fund and the contributions must be made in cash. Malaysia's national debt amounts to $250.8 billion which is 80% of its GDP.

headlines: Trump's net worth slides to $2.8bn, lowest since campaign
text: US President Donald Trump's net worth has plunged to $2.8 billion, the lowest since his presidential campaign, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. The Trump campaign had said that he was worth $8.7 billion when he announced the presidential run in 2015. The debt load of Trump's companies is now at least $520 million.

headlines: Kuwait proposes 'international protection' for Palestinians
text: Kuwait has proposed setting up an international protection mission for Palestinians. A draft UN Security Council (UNSC) resolution presented by Kuwait calls for measures to guarantee the safety and protection of Palestinian civilians "in the occupied Palestinian territories and Gaza Strip". More than 100 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli firing in the last two months.

headlines: Papua New Guinea prisoners freed to find food amid shortage
text: A Papua New Guinea prison freed 35 inmates to search for food amid shortages that occurred because the government delayed funds required for monthly rations. "Pressure is mounting. They (prisoners) were hungry," prison officials said. All except one of the 35 inmates returned to the prison after gathering food, officials added.

headlines: Denmark imposes ban on burqa in public
text: The Danish parliament on Thursday voted in favour of a ban on full-face veils in public, including Islamic veils such as the niqab or burqa. The government said the ban, which will come into force on August 1, is not aimed at any religion. Violations of the anti-veil law will result in a 1,000 kroner (over â¹10,500) fine.

headlines: China cops' advice on how to survive knife attack goes viral
text: A video by Chinese police giving advice on how to deal with a knife attack has gone viral.
