While suggesting what to do in the event of an attack, an officer responds by running away and screaming, "Help! Police officer!" It reportedly was aimed at telling citizens they should seek the help of authorities when confronted by an attacker.

headlines: Sensex surges 416 points ahead of GDP data for March quarter
text: Benchmark index BSE Sensex surged 416 points to close at 35,322.38 on Thursday ahead announcement of India's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) data for the March quarter. HDFC Bank, ONGC, and Hindustan Unilever were top gainers, whereas Tata Motors and Sun Pharmaceuticals were among the major losers. The Nifty 50 index closed higher by 121.80 points at 10,736.15.

headlines: We've known each other for long: Nidhhi on rumour of dating Rahul
text: 'Munna Michael' actress Nidhhi Agerwal, while denying rumours of dating cricketer KL Rahul, said they have known each other for long. "We have known each other since our teenage years before Rahul became a cricketer and I became an actress," she added. Rumours of Nidhi dating him began after they were spotted going out for dinner together.

headlines: Release date of 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar' postponed
text: The release date of Arjun Kapoor and Parineeti Chopra starrer 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar' has been postponed from August 3, 2018 to March 1, 2019. While Arjun will play a Haryanvi policeman, Parineeti will be playing a corporate worker in the film. 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar' will be directed by Dibakar Banerjee, who earlier directed 'LSD: Love Sex Aur Dhokha'.

headlines: Pratyusha's ex Rahul to marry girlfriend Saloni Sharma
text: Late actress Pratyusha Banerjee's ex-boyfriend Rahul Raj Singh is set to marry his girlfriend Saloni Sharma. Sharing a post on the occasion of his birthday, Rahul had written, "A special thanks to my dear Saloni Sharma...my soon to be wife and partner for life." Rahul, who was booked for abetting Pratyusha's suicide in 2016, is currently out on bail.

headlines: It was a mistake: Arshi on tweet claiming she had sex with Afridi
text: Bigg Boss 11 contestant Arshi Khan, while talking about an old tweet in which she claimed that she had sex with Pakistani cricketer Shahid Afridi, said, "That tweet was a mistake." "I should not have addressed him openly about such sensitive issues. Afridi Sahaab ke bahut ehsaan hai mujh par," she added. Arshi further said she respects Afridi a lot.

headlines: Man teaches Google Assistant to fire a gun
text: Artist and roboticist Alexander Reben has posted a video showing him commanding Google Assistant to fire a gun. The video shows him saying "OK Google, activate gun," after which a buzzer goes off and the gun fires. Talking about the setup, he said, "Part of the message for me includes the unintended consequences of technology."

headlines: Sharks have 'sixth sense' that is tuned to attack: Study
text: Sharks are equipped with an electro-sensing organ that allows them to detect the slightest disturbances from nearby prey amid background noises, according to a US-based study. Scientists compared their "sixth sense" to a superhuman who would perceive whispers as blaring horns. Their electro-sensory system is tuned to react suddenly, which triggers them to attack on any changes, said researchers.

headlines: World's oldest lizard lived when Earth had only 1 continent
text: Scientists have identified the oldest known lizard, a reptile that lived about 240 million years ago when Earth had a single continent geographically and dinosaurs had just emerged. Discovered 20 years ago in Italy, "mother of all lizards" Megachirella was initially misclassified as a lizard relative. The discovery pushed back the origins of lizards by 75 million years, said researchers.

headlines: Journalism started during Mahabharata: UP Deputy CM
text: Speaking at an event in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura to mark 'Hindi Journalism Day', state Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma said that journalism started during the Mahabharata. Claiming that the character Sanjaya, sitting at Hastinapur, narrated a bird's-eye view of the war of Mahabharata to Dhritarashtra, Sharma said, "If this is not live telecast, then what is it?"

headlines: Pizza chains in India remove pork pepperoni pizza from menu
text: Pizza chains in India including Domino's have temporarily removed pork pepperoni pizzas from its menu, citing unavailability of good quality meat and lack of demand from consumers. Pizza Hut has reportedly reduced sale of pork pepperoni pizzas to a few states only. However, Pizza Express culinary director Vicky Ratnani said, "We havenât faced any problems with supply of pork pepperoni."

headlines: Ranbir Kapoor confirms he is dating Alia Bhatt
text: Ranbir Kapoor, while confirming that he's dating actress Alia Bhatt, said, "It's new for us, so let it cook a bit." "It's really new right now, and I don't want to over speak. It needs time to breathe," he added. Ranbir further said the best thing about being newly in love is it always comes with a "lot of excitement".

headlines: Weinstein indicted for rape, may face up to 25 yrs in prison
text: Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein was indicted on Wednesday on charges of rape and a criminal sexual act. If convicted, Weinstein could face between five and 25 years in prison. "This indictment brings the defendant another step closer to accountability for the crimes of violence with which he is now charged," Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance, Jr said in a statement.

headlines: Aware criminal groups are trying to get into cricket: ICC
text: ICC Chief Dave Richardson has admitted "criminal groups are trying to get into cricket" and Test cricket remains at "high risk of being targeted for corruption". This comes after an Al Jazeera documentary claimed three Tests featuring India in last two years were fixed by Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company. "It was reminder...these guys are at work...they aren't going away," Richardson said.

headlines: Chandigarh airport to reopen on June 1 after 20-day closure
text: The Chandigarh International Airport will reopen on June 1 after a 20-day closure for expansion and repair work. The runway expansion and upgradation at the airport are being carried out at a cost of â¹450 crore. It'll operate 37 flights daily, including three international flights, and will soon have new flights connecting the city to Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Srinagar and Indore.

headlines: How do animals perceive images that look sharp to humans?
text: Comparing sharpness in vision for 600 animal species, researchers have revealed that human eyesight is roughly seven times sharper than cats and dogs, 40-60 times than rats and goldfish, and hundreds of times than insects. The study measured visual acuity by the number of pairs of black and white parallel lines a species can discern per degree field of vision.

headlines: 2000-yr-old remains of man crushed while fleeing volcano found
text: The headless skeleton of a man has been uncovered in Pompeii, Italy, who according to archaeologists likely escaped the first blast of Mount Vesuvius only to be crushed by a 300-kg rock flung by the volcanic eruption in 79 AD. The skeleton showed the man had an infection in his leg, which suggests he had difficulty in moving, said researchers.

headlines: Doctors offered free stay if they treat patients in Karjat
text: District Collector of Maharashtra's Raigad, Dr Vijay Suryawanshi, has offered free stay in Karjat to doctors if they volunteer and conduct camps in the town on weekends. Suryawanshi came up with the idea after a girl died due to malnutrition in the town. Reportedly, a sub-district hospital in Karjat has only two doctors to take care of around 200 patients.

headlines: High security at Pathankot court ahead of Kathua case trial
text: After the Supreme Court transferred the Kathua rape and murder case from J&K to Punjab's Pathankot court, high security has been deployed at the court complex ahead of the trial on Thursday. All eight accused in the case will be presented in the court, where all the proceedings will take place under CCTV camera surveillance.

headlines: Maneka Gandhi asks IT Minister to block dowry calculator site
text: Women and Child Development Minister Maneka Gandhi has asked IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad to block a 'dowry calculator' website and take action against the developers. Gandhi said the site was not only shameful but also illegal as it promoted dowry. The site claims to calculate dowry for grooms based on options such as salary, skin colour, and height.

headlines: Chidambaram gets protection from arrest in corruption cases
text: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram has been granted interim protection from arrest in the INX Media case till July 3 and till June 5 in the Aircel-Maxis case. Chidambaram's role came under the scanner over alleged irregularities in the â¹3,500-crore Aircel-Maxis deal and INX Media case involving â¹305 crore. The deals were cleared during Chidambaram's tenure as Finance Minister.

headlines: Direct US-Russia clash in Syria was narrowly avoided: Assad
text: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad has revealed during an interview that a direct clash between the US and Russia in Syria was narrowly avoided "by the wisdom of the Russian leadership". Adding that Syria needs Russian support, Assad said, "At the same time we need to avoid the American foolishness in order to be able to stabilise our country."

headlines: What you say is what you are: Assad on Trump's animal remark
text: Commenting on US President Donald Trump calling him an "animal", Syrian President Bashar al-Assad said, "What you say is what you are. So, he wanted to represent what he is." On being asked if he had a nickname for Trump, Assad said, "I cannot use similar language." Trump had called Assad an animal over a suspected chemical attack in Syria.

headlines: PUBG sues rival Fortnite for 'copying' its game
text: PUBG Corp, creator of PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds, has filed a lawsuit against rival Fortnite's maker Epic Games alleging copyright infringement. The company is accused of copying PUBG's user interface and in-game items. The two of the world's most popular games are based on the battle royale format in which 100 players engage in a shootout to be the last man standing.

headlines: Hindustan Unilever CEO Sanjiv Mehta's pay grew 36% to â¹19 cr
text: Hindustan Unilever's Managing Director and CEO Sanjiv Mehta took home a total remuneration of around â¹19.37 crore for 2017-18, a 36% jump over the previous year's â¹14 crore. Mehta's bonus increased nearly 150% to â¹5.58 crore in FY17. Notably, Mehta will take over additional responsibility of chairmanship from next month following the retirement of Harish Manwani.

headlines: Indian Oil most profitable PSU for second straight year
text: Indian Oil Corporation has emerged as India's most profitable state-owned company for the second consecutive year. Indian Oil posted a record profit of â¹21,346 crore in 2017-18, followed by ONGC, whose profit stood at â¹19,945 crore. Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries is the most profitable company for the third straight year, posting highest ever profit of â¹36,075 crore.

headlines: Loved Ranbir as Sanjay bhaiyya: Dutt's sister Priya
text: Reacting to the trailer of Sanjay Dutt's biopic 'Sanju', Sanjay Dutt's sister Priya Dutt said, "You can't have anybody aping bhaiyya 100 per cent. But I loved the way Ranbir [Kapoor] has portrayed him." "Bhaiyya's life has had so much comedy. The situation may have seemed crazy then, but now, when we look back, we laugh about them," she added.

headlines: Cong wins K'taka seat where nearly 10k fake IDs were found
text: Congress candidate Munirathna has won from Karnataka's RR Nagar in the Assembly elections by 41,162 votes. The polls in the constituency were postponed due to reports of nearly 10,000 fake voter IDs found in an apartment in Bengaluru. The winning candidate Munirathna was earlier accused of being involved in the voter ID scam.

headlines: Discussing working with Waymo on self-driving: Uber CEO
text: After settling a trade secrets lawsuit with Waymo, Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi has said the cab-hailing startup is "having discussions" with the Google spinoff to work together on self-driving. Adding it'll be "great" if something happens, Khosrowshahi said, "It's up to them whether they want to do it or not." Waymo had sued Uber for stealing its self-driving car technology.

headlines: Govt 'open, flexible' to iPhone plant in India: IT Minister
text: Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said the government is "open and flexible" on negotiating terms with Apple to manufacture iPhones in India. Adding that they are in "serious engagement" with the company, he also said, "I can only tell you, Apple will not be a loser in India... but let us wait for the formal proposal."

headlines: Ex-Meghalaya CM's daughter from Cong wins Assembly bypoll
text: Congress candidate and former Meghalaya CM Mukul Sangma's daughter Miani D Shira has won the Ampati Assembly seat in the bypolls. Sangma had won from Ampati for the sixth consecutive time but decided to vacate the seat to make way for his daughter. He had tendered his resignation in March after he also won from Songsak.

headlines: World's most valued AI startup SenseTime raises $620 million
text: China's SenseTime, which is the world's highest-valued artificial intelligence (AI) startup at $4.5 billion, has raised $620 million as part of its Series C+ funding round. The latest round was led by Fidelity International, Hopu Capital, Silver Lake and Tiger Global. The announcement comes just months after SenseTime said it raised $600 million from Alibaba, Suning.com and Singapore's Temasek.

headlines: We want to be the Amazon for transportation: Uber CEO
text: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi has said that the cab-hailing startup wants to be the "Amazon for transportation." Just like how Amazon sells third-party goods, Uber is going to offer third-party transportation services, Khosrowshahi added. Speaking at a recent interview, Khosrowshahi also revealed that Uber will hold an IPO (Initial Public Offering) in the second half of 2019.

headlines: Infibeam posts 90% rise in revenue to â¹839.3 crore in FY18
text: India's first listed e-commerce platform Infibeam has posted a 90% rise in revenue at â¹839.3 crore for the financial year 2018. The company's net profit rose 102% at â¹88.1 crore for the same period, the highest ever growth observed in the company. The high revenue and net profit was attributed to high-transaction volumes which stood at â¹21,550 crore for 2017-18.

headlines: US airline asks woman to prove relation to her biracial son
text: A Southwest Airlines employee asked a woman to prove that her biracial son was hers despite showing the one-year-old's passport. The employee asked the woman to show the kid's birth certificate or a Facebook post as an evidence as her surname and her son's surname was different. The airline later apologised for the incident.

headlines: AirAsia case won't have impact on Air India stake sale: Govt
text: The CBI case against AirAsia and its officials would not have any impact on Air India's disinvestment process, Civil Aviation Secretary RN Choubey has said. The agency named AirAsia Group CEO Tony Fernandes and others for allegedly violating foreign investment norms. "The decision as important as buying Air India is not taken on individual events of this kind," he added.

headlines: Tata CLiQ  announces 'CLiQ CLiQ' sale to celebrate 2nd anniversary
text: Phygital e-commerce brand Tata CLiQ has announced the 'CLiQ CLiQ Sale' for its customers to celebrate its 2nd anniversary which falls on May 27th. The sale goes live on June 1 and offers up to 70% discount across categories like electronics, fashion, jewellery, and luxury. It is also offering an additional instant 10% off on SBI Credit and Debit Cards.

headlines: Patanjali's messaging app disappears from Google Play Store
text: Patanjali's messaging app 'Kimbho' has disappeared from Google Play Store a day after it was launched by yoga guru Ramdev. This comes after a French security expert who goes by the alias Elliot Alderson called Kimbho "a security disaster", claiming he could access the messages of all the users. Ramdev had said the app would give competition to WhatsApp.

headlines: Jaipur boy who wrote Class 10 exams standing scores 93.4%
text: Ashmeet Bhatnagar, a 16-year-old from Jaipur who wrote his Class 10 CBSE exams standing due to a condition called myositis ossificans that makes it difficult for him to sit, has scored 93.4% marks. "Ashmeet may have a physical problem, but he's strong mentally," his father said. Ashmeet opted for Commerce in Class 11 and aims to become a government officer.

headlines: Rehab clinic for cryptocurrency addicts opens up in Scotland
text: A rehab clinic in Edinburgh, Scotland has started offering treatment to people who are addicted to trading or hoarding cryptocurrencies. Prices at Castle Craig Hospital start from approximately â¹1,22,000 per week for an extended treatment programme, while an "executive programme" starts at approximately â¹8,30,000 per week. A minimum commitment of two weeks' treatment is required of all patients.

headlines: Have to catch floating poop on space station: Astronaut
text: Describing space station toilets, most experienced woman astronaut Peggy Whitson has revealed that astronauts poop into a plate-sized hole, and use the vacuum to suck it into a bag. In case of malfunctions, astronauts have to catch the floating poop using rubber gloves, said Whitson. "The space station is not really a hotel...would call it a camping trip," Whitson added.

headlines: Buffett wanted to put $3 billion in Uber but talks failed
text: Berkshire Hathaway Chairman Warren Buffett proposed investing a reported sum of $3 billion in Uber earlier this year but the talks failed following disagreements. Berkshire wanted to provide a convertible loan to Uber to protect its investment in the company. Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi reportedly proposed decreasing the amount to $2 billion, giving Buffett a smaller share of the company.

headlines: Passed dead bodies on our way: Students who scaled Everest
text: One of the five students from Maharashtra who scaled Mount Everest recently said, "We had to pass many dead bodies of other climbers on our way. The first body scared me, but then we got used to it." Meanwhile, another student claimed, "It wasn't a big deal. We trained for it and climbed it. I was not scared at all."

headlines: Andhra women panel chief proposes similar panel for men
text: Andhra Pradesh Women Commission Chairperson Nannapaneni Rajakumari on Wednesday urged the state government to set up a similar commission for men. Blaming TV shows for "inducing" cruelty into some women, she said, "I have similar sympathy for men who are being targeted by women in illicit relationships with other men. I will stand by them and seek justice for them."

headlines: Nipah virus kills two more in Kerala, death toll rises to 16
text: After the Nipah virus claimed two more lives in Kerala's Kozhikode on Wednesday, the death toll rose to 16. One of the victims contracted the virus at Kozhikode Medical College Hospital. Meanwhile, over 1,000 people who were in touch with the affected earlier are under observation and the total number of suspected cases stands at nine.

headlines: Only senior doctors should give news of patient's death: BMC
text: To avoid violence against doctors in government-run hospitals, BMC said only those holding the post of lecturers or higher ranks should break news about a patient's death to relatives. Stating that there has to be division of responsibilities, a BMC official said, "We can't expect a resident doctor to break this news to relatives."

headlines: Star Wars-style ultimatums can't solve global issues: Russia
text: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov has said that ultimatums in the style of 'Star Wars' cannot solve global issues such as the denuclearisation of the Korean Peninsula or the Iran nuclear deal. Claiming that ultimatums and pressure on countries are bound to be "doomed", Lavrov added that the issues could only be solved by adopting multilateral approaches and international laws.

headlines: Pak mustn't be admitted to Nuclear Suppliers Group: Watchdog
text: US-based nuclear proliferation watchdog Institute for Science and International Security has said that Pakistan's application to the Nuclear Suppliers Group should not be granted because of its ongoing illicit nuclear procurements abroad. It added that Pakistan has greatly expanded its nuclear complex dedicated to producing nuclear weapons and it may be building uranium enrichment plants.

headlines: DGCA gave us clean chit in February '17: AirAsia on CBI case
text: AirAsia India has said that allegations regarding indirect foreign control in violation of norms were investigated by aviation regulator DGCA and a clean chit was given in February 2017. The CBI had named AirAsia Group CEO Tony Fernandes and others for allegedly violating foreign investment norms in giving effective management control to a foreign entity through government clearance in 2013.

headlines: Salman Khan to launch newcomer Zaheer Iqbal in Bollywood
text: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram to reveal that he will be launching a newcomer named Zaheer Iqbal in a film, which is said to be a love story set in Kashmir. Zaheer's father is reportedly Salman's close family friend. Reports added that Salman decided to launch Zaheer in Bollywood after watching him perform at his sister Arpita Khan's wedding.

headlines: 'Veere Di Wedding' banned in Pakistan over 'vulgar language'
text: Sonam Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor, Swara Bhasker, and Shikha Talsania starrer 'Veere Di Wedding' has been banned by Pakistan's Central Board of Film Censors (CBFC), reportedly due to "vulgar dialogues and obscene scenes". "This film is not acceptable in our society due to its vulgarity and sexual dialogues spoken by the four girls," a senior CBFC official said.

headlines: Would love to see you onscreen again: Anil to Rao, Patralekhaa
text: Anil Kapoor, while replying to Rajkummar Rao's tweet on his film 'CityLights' completing four years, wrote, "Would love to see both of you onscreen again." Rajkummar and Patralekhaa reportedly started dating after meeting on the sets of the film. In his tweet, Rao had written, "#4YearsofCityLights. One of the most special films and special performances of my career."

headlines: Most expensive player sold for â¹1.5cr at Pro-Kabaddi auction
text: Raider Monu Goyat became the costliest player in Pro Kabaddi League history as Haryana Steelers acquired his services for â¹1.51 crore on Day 1 of PKL 2018 auction. Rahul Chaudhari went to Telugu Titans for â¹1.29 crore, becoming the second costliest athlete. Iran's Fazel Atrachali, bought by U Mumba, was the first to cross the â¹1-crore mark earlier on Wednesday.

headlines: China's Tencent trains AI to de-blur, face-edit photos
text: China's Tencent has unveiled an artificial intelligence (AI)-based tool to remove blurriness of images using large-scale de-blurring datasets. It has also trained an AI called "face editor" which adds, removes, or modifies the facial features of a person in an image. The face-editor uses an encoder and decoder system that could allow it to function in cameras or apps.

headlines: Still don't know what data Cambridge Analytica had: FB COO
text: Talking about the data scandal at Facebook, COO Sheryl Sandberg has said, "To this day, we still don't actually know what data Cambridge Analytica had." Analytica was accused of illegally obtaining data of 87 million Facebook users and using it to influence the US elections. Earlier, Sandberg admitted Facebook could've addressed the data leak "two and a half years ago".

headlines: Facebook to train 60,000 Indian women on safe internet use
text: The National Commission for Women has partnered with Facebook to launch a digital literacy programme to train 60,000 women in universities across India on safe use of the internet. It has been launched in collaboration with the Cyber Peace Foundation and will enable trainees to differentiate between credible and questionable information. The training will be conducted in local languages.

headlines: Google Chrome lets users sign-in on sites without passwords
text: Google has released a version of its browser called 'Chrome 67' which allows users to sign-in on websites without requiring a password. It will support Web Authentication (WebAuthn) standard which allows users to sign-in using biometrics like fingerprints or facial images. Chrome 67 will also increase the site isolation to prevent a page from collecting data from other browser tabs.

headlines: Digital payments startup Pine Labs raises $125 million
text: Noida-based digital payments startup Pine Labs has raised $125 million from Singapore-based investment firm Temasek and American payments giant PayPal. The funding comes around two months after Pine Labs raised $82 million in a funding round led by Actis Capital. Founded in 1998, Pine Labs is a provider of retail POS (Point of sale) solutions that simplify payment acceptance.

headlines: Alibaba's Ele.me gets nod to deliver food by drones in China
text: Alibaba-owned food delivery startup Ele.me has received approval by authorities in China to operate in the country's initial delivery routes for drones. The company claims the users would receive their orders within 20 minutes of order confirmations. The company further said its E7 drone can carry a 6-kg payload at up to 65 kmph for 20 kilometres.

headlines: Insect-eating birds spread them by pooping their eggs: Study
text: Japanese researchers have found that birds may be contributing in expanding habitats of insects which cannot travel far by themselves. The team hypothesised that the eggs within insect bodies could pass through birds undigested and hatch. They tested this hypothesis with stick insects, known for their hard eggs, and found that some eggs excreted unharmed and successfully hatched.

headlines: People lock water drums in Raj village over water robberies
text: In an attempt to avoid robbery of water due to scarcity, people in Rajasthan's Parasrampura village have started locking their water drums. The village residents get drinking water once a week that has led to an increase in the number of such robberies. "Looking at circumstances, it (water) has become more precious to us than gold," a local said.

headlines: Villagers lock school after all students fail Class 10 exam
text: Villagers locked a school in Haryana's Palwal as protest after all 51 students who gave CBSE Class 10 exam failed. The principal was shifted temporarily after villagers agreed to unlock it only if he is changed. "We had already raised the issue of poor education system in our school with the state government, but nothing happened," the village head said.

headlines: Accept open, distance degrees for recruitment: Govt to PSUs
text: The government has directed public sector undertakings to recognise diplomas and degrees acquired through open and distance learning from UGC-recognised universities for employment purposes. This comes after the HRD Ministry had written to the Department of Public Enterprises saying it has been receiving complaints about PSUs not recognising such degrees/diplomas for recruitment purposes.

headlines: Exciting âRail Journeyâ themed holidays introduced by SOTC
text: Renowned travel and tourism company SOTC has launched a unique holiday package that will take travellers on train adventures to different locations across the world - 'The Great Rail Journeys'. From elegant Europe to scintillating China, travel across snowy landscapes, majestic mountains and lush green valleys at prices starting at â¹1,18,000. Limited seats available on a first come, first-served basis.

headlines: BJP worker found hanging from tree with killer's note on shirt
text: An 18-year-old BJP worker was found hanging from a tree in West Bengal's Purulia on Wednesday. "This is for doing BJP politics from age 18. Been trying to kill you since the election but failed. Today you are dead," the killer wrote on Trilochan Mahato's shirt. A note with similar warning was found at his feet.

headlines: Kim Yong-chol 1st N Korean official to visit US in 18 years
text: Former North Korean spy chief Kim Yong-chol on Wednesday arrived in New York, becoming the most senior North Korean official to visit the US since 2000. An adviser to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, Yong-chol met US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo amid uncertainty over the June 12 summit between the leaders of the two countries.

headlines: 'Punyatma' Rahul Gandhi's trust gives me power: Karnataka CM
text: At a meeting regarding farm loan waivers, Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said, "Even though I don't have the blessings of the people, 'punyatma' (good soul) Rahul Gandhi placing trust in me has given me power." He told farmers, "Taking him into confidence, I will have to come to a decision... All your wishes will be fulfilled, but give us time."

headlines: BJP got â¹532 crore in donations above â¹20,000: ADR Report
text: The BJP got â¹532.27 crore in donations exceeding â¹20,000 in 2016-17, an Association for Democratic Reforms report has revealed. This amount is over 12 times the donations received by the Congress in excess of â¹20,000, the report added. Further, the BJP reported a total income of â¹1,034.27 crore in the year, which was 4.6 times the income of Congress.

headlines: Ex-Prez should tell RSS what's wrong with them: Chidambaram
text: After former President Pranab Mukherjee accepted RSS' invitation to attend their event, Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "Sir you have accepted invitation, please go there and tell them (RSS) what's wrong with their ideology." Earlier, some Congress leaders wrote to the former President, requesting him to "reconsider and avoid" visiting the RSS event.

headlines: K'taka CM Kumaraswamy promises farm loan waiver in 15 days
text: Asserting that saving farmers is his government's priority, Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy promised to waive farm loans within 15 days and insisted that there was "no going back" on it. "I'm getting it (the loan amount) calculated, whatever thousand crore rupees it is... Saving you is our government's responsibility," he told a gathering of farmers.

headlines: 1p drop in petrol price mistake by our staffer: Oil Minister
text: Pointing out that the price of petrol and diesel has changed by 1 paisa before, Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "However, today (Wednesday) one of our employees made a mistake." "Since we moved to...mechanism of daily price change, prices have gone up and down by 1 paisa, 12 paise, 27 paise," he added.
